description: OSLO, Norway  The Nor wegian Government, feeling these days rather like the cat that's got the cream, is plan ning greater participation in exploring and exploiting an ap parently enormous supply of offshore oil.

title: $72,607 Reward for $2 Bet
description: DETROIT, July 2 (AP)Two dollars won an unidentified bet tor $72,607 yesterday for a rec ord payoff at the Livonia track. He correctly picked Greek Madie and Far Far Away to finish in that order in the fifth race and exchanged his ticket for Gerowa and Corky of Clinton, the onetwo fini shers in the sixth.

title: W. S. JAMES
description: ABILENE, Tex., July 2 (AP) W. S. James, father of W. H. James, president of the Daily News in New York, died today. He was 86 years old.

title: Earth Resources Contract
description: The Earth Resources Com pany reported yesterday in Dallas that it had contracted to sell copper concentrates from its Nacimento, N. M., project to the American Smelt ing and Refining Company. The fiveyear contract will cover deliveries beginning in June, 1971, and will involve an esti mated 7,000 tons of concen trates a year.

title: GLAMOUR STOCKS DECLINE SHARPLY
Sports Today
description: BASEBALL

title: Sports of The Times
description: Denny McLain always did have more brass than a trombone factory. if this qual ity led him into trouble, it also helped make him the great pitcher he still is. That was a rather remarkable exhibition he gave the night before last when he re turned from exile for his first appearance of a season that is approaching the half way mark.

title: Joan Hackett Joins Cast
description: Joan Hackett has been signed by Hillard Elkins and Lester Osterman to play the leading female role in The Roth schilds, the musical based on Frederic Morton's bestselling biography of the banking fam ily. She joins Paul Hecht and Hal Linden in the cast. Michael Kidd will choreograph the show and Derek Goldby will direct the production. It has a book by Sherman Yellen and songs by Jerry Bock and Sheldon Harnick. The attraction opens Oct. 18 at the LuntFontanne Theater.

title: German Measles Declines
description: The city's Health Department reported yesterday that cases of German measles were at the lowest level here in 30 years.

title: Eugene M. Ellis Plans to Marry Miss Conover
description: MAPLEWOOD, N. J., July 2  Mr. and Mrs. George W. Conover Jr. have announced the engagement of their daughter, Miss Patricia Wil liams Conover, to Eugene Martin Ellis. He is the son of Mr. and Mrs. Abraham Ellis of Orange and Miami Beach.

title: A Number of Complaints
description: A single telephone number has been designated for com plaints to the Department of Water Resources (responsible for sewers and catch basins, hydrants and water mains, etc.) and Air Resources (concerned with smoke, soot, fumes, odors, etc.) and the Bureau of Noise Abatement. The number, 2271400 was announced yes terday by Jerome Kretchmer, the city's Environmental Pro tection Administrator.

title: Boating Outlook
description: The United States Weather Bureau issued this forecast at 8 P.M. yesterday for New York Harbor, Long Island South Shore and nearby coastal waters.

title: Detectives Accused by Witness Of Seeking $10,000 Reward
description: A witness testified yesterday that Police Department detec tives had requested a 10 per cent reward after the recov ery of $100,000 worth of elec tronic equipment that had been stolen from a Montgomery Ward truck terminal here.

title: Executive Changes
description: Alex H. Massad has been appointed executive vice president of the Mobil Oil Corporation in charge of exploration and producing of its international divi sion. He succeeds Leonard C. Stevens, who retires Oct. 1. Henry K. Holland becomes executive vic president for exploration and producing of the North American division.

title: New Columbia Post
description: E. Allan Farnworth, profes sor of law at Columbia Univer sity, has been named the first Alfred McCormack Professor of Law, Dr. Andrew W. Cordier, president of Columbia, an nounced yesterday. Professor Farnworth, an authority on commercial law and contracts, has been on the Columbia Law School faculty since 1954. The new professorship was created by an endowment fund estab lished by Mrs. Alfred McCor mack in memory of her hus band, a Columbia alumnus and lawyer, who died in 1956.

title: STOCKS IN LONDON ADVANCE BRISKLY
Installment Credit Rose At a Modest Rate in May
description: WASHINGTON, July 2Con sumer installment credit rose $415million in May, the most since February but still well below the monthly average of recent years.

title: Nixon and Aides Now View Mideast as Main Problem
description: SAN CLEMENTE, Calif., July 2Even as President Nixon has talked to the nation about Indo china, he and his senior associ ates here have become increas ingly preoccupied and alarmed by the volatile situation in the Middle East.

title: Pompidou Sees No Indochina Peace Till U.S. Pullout
description: PARIS, July 2  President Pompidou criticized President Nixon today and declared that peace could not come to Indo china until the Americans made up their minds to get out.

title: G.I. Kills Officer in Korea
description: SEOUL, South Korea, July (Reuters)An officer of the United States Seventh Infantry Division, stationed north of Seoul, was shot to death by an enlisted man early this morn ing, an American military spokesman said. The enlisted man then seriously wounded himself, the spokesman said. The identities of the two were withheld.

title: C.B.S. Reverses Stand
description: The Columbia Broadcasting System reversed itself yester day and agreed to televise onehour segment of the Honor America Day evening entertain ment program, United Press In ternational reported.

title: Court Bars Suit by Black Whose Skin Turned White
description: CLEVELAND, July 2 (AP)A Federal district judge dis missed today a case in which a 33yearold Air Force veteran contended his skin color had changed from black to white as a result of treatment at a Veterans Administration hospi tal here.

title: Change in Victimless Laws Is Urged
description: Commissioner of Investiga tion Robert K. Ruskin, citing case where two policemen al legedly extorted money from man with a woman in a parked car, called yesterday for the repeal or modification of state laws that he said sometimes foster corruntion.

title: Jury in Trial of a Black Panther In New Haven Nearly Complete
description: NEW HAVEN, July 2 A middleaged white man being conc:2red to sit on the jury here for the first of a series of trials of Black Panthers was having difficulty the other afternoon with the precept that a Black Panther or any other person must be presumed in nocent until proved guilty.

title: How Vocal Minority Prevailed on Alexander's
description: The decision by Alexan der's not to build a store at Broadway and 96th Street apparently reflects a case his tory of how relatively small but extremely articulate and active groups can become the voice of a community.

title: NASA, Under Fire, To Reopen Bidding
description: LOS ANGELES, July 2  The National Aeronautics and Space Administration said tonight that it would reopen bidding on a contested $50million satellite project that was awarded this spring to the General Electric Company.

title: Lefkowitz Is Suing To Cut Jet Noise At Airports Here
description: State Attorney General Louis J. Lefkowitz has filed suit against airlines using Kennedy International and La Guardia Airports to require improve ment of noiseabatement de vices on jet aircraft.

title: S.E.C. to Hold Hearings On $15 Stock Surcharge
description: WASHINGTON, July 2The Securities and Exchange Com mission announced today that it would hold public hearings about continuing the special service charge on small stock transactions but that the charge could remain in effect temporarily.

title: Jonsson, Swedish Team Win Modern Pentathlon Titles
description: STOCKHOLM, July 2 (AP)Bo Jansson, 33 years old, of Sweden, and the Swedish team won the world military modern pentathlon championships to day.

title: Mazzinghi Stops U.S. Rival At 1:59 of 5th Round in Italy
N.A.A.C.P. URGES CAMPUS CHANGES
description: CINCINNATI, JULY 2Direc tors of the National Association for the Advancement of Colored; People proposed today a corn; prehensive restructuring of higher education to attack the; causes of campus unrest.

title: Television
description: Morning

title: LUTHERANS URGE OPEN MIND ON SEX
description: MINNEAPOLIS, July 2The Lutheran Church in America spoke out today for fair treat ment of homosexuals.

title: Medicaid Abortion Fees Set
description: ALBANY, July 2 (AP)Physi cians who perform abortions on Medicaid patients will be paid fees ranging from $64 to 220, the State Health Depart ment announced today.

title: Boxer Dies in So. Africa
description: JOHANNESBURG, South Af rica, June 2 (UPI)  Winston Nkoyane, African amateur box er, died in a hospital after sparring with Pierre Fouric, the white South African middle weight champion. A spokesman at Johannesburg General Hos pital said Nkoyane, 21 years old, entered the casualty ward with head injuries Monday night and died early Tuesday.

title: 8Second Session Held Before Senate Holiday
description: WASHINGTON, July 2 (AP) The Senate met for eight seconds today, the second shortest session on record, and then adjourned for the July 4 holiday weekend.

title: A Stroganoff Dish For the Weekend
description: In the menus below, dishes marked with an asterisk are followed by a recipe.

title: City Policeman Is Charged In Fatal Shooting of Wife
description: John McGuire, 47 years old, longtime city policeman, was charged with murder last night in the shooting of his estranged wife, Dolores, at her home in Valley Stream, the Nassau County police said.

title: Subway Supervisors Meet With Mediator in Dispute
description: A state mediator yesterday opened intensive bargaining sessions between the Transit Authority and a union repre senting subway supervisors in an effort to avert a threatened rulebook slowdown, chiefly over nay isues.

title: FULL INQUIRY SET BY I.C.C. ON MOVES OF PENN CENTRAL
description: The Interstate Commerce Commission announced yester day that it had instituted a full investigation into all phases of the operations, accounts and financial transactions of the Penn Central Transportation Company and its affiliates.

title: Article 3  No Title
MICHAEL MALLOY JR
description: J. Michael Malloy Jr., vice president of the legal claims department of Associ ated Aviation Underwriters, died Wednesday, apparently of a heart attack, in his home at 3351 80th Street, Jackson Heights, Queens. He was 48 years old.

title: James Renwick to Wed Miss Bishop
description: MOUNT KISCO, N. Y., July 2Mr. and Mrs. D. P. Bishop of Mill Stream Farms here have announced the engage ment of Mr. Bishop's daugh ter, Miss Elizabeth Fitch Bishop, to Pvt. James Bre voort Renwick, U.S.A., son of Mr. and Mrs. John F. Ren wick Jr. of Bedford. N. Y.

title: TIM's Cartoons: Direct Line to Fame
description: PARISOne way to be im mortal in France is to wear the sword of the French Academy. The other way is to appear in a cartoon by the country's foremost political cartoonist, who signs his work TIM.

title: Chicago Displays an Artistic Vitality
description: CHICAGO. July 2Poor, despised Chicago. How des perately it has struggled to escape its reputation, and how impossibly. From the Fort Dearborn massacre, through the St. Valentine's Day massacre, up to the present day, the name Chi cago has conjured up bleed ing images of violence that assure the city an immortali ty of the sort previously awarded Tombstone, Ariz., and Sodom.

title: Princess Pignatelli Is Bride Of Burt S. Avedon on Coast
description: Princess Luciana Pignatelli, European fashion coordinator for Eve of Roma, and Burt Simm Avedon, president of the Bostonbased cosmetics concern, were married on Wednesday in a civil cere mony in California, where the bridegroom's parents make their home.

title: JOHN ADIKES, 75, OF SAYINGS BANK
description: John Adikes, chairman of the board of the Jamaica Savings Bank, died yesterday in Jamai ca Hospital in Queens after a brief illness. He was 75 years old, and lived at 8436 Ware, ham Road, Jamaica Estates.

title: GARBAGE PROTEST WINS FAST PICKUP
description: After placing their full garb age cans in the street to protest erratic collections in the past and a proposed reduction of the official collection schedule in the future, residents of a Queens neighborhood had their garbage collected immediately last night.

title: CONGRESS DIVIDED ON NIXON'S TALK
description: WASHINGTON, July 2 President Nixon's televised in terview on the Southeast Asian conflict won from Con gress today praise for his des ignation of a new peace nego tiator, some Democratic resent ment in the Senate and a new Republican peace proposal in the House.

title: FIREBOMBS THROWN AT 4 LATIN EMBASSIES
description: WASHINGTON, July 2 (geu ters)Firebombs were tossed at, four LatinAmerican embassies here early today, soon after the Organization of American States approved funds for a spe cial study of terrorism.

title: Wood Pulp Prices Are Raised In Canada After Move by U. S.
description: Several Canadian producers have increased their prices for wood pulp as of July 1, it was announced yesterday. The action seemed to follow similar moves by United States companies that were an nounced around June 15 and also went into effect July 1.

title: TWO STUDENTS LIST RABBIS FAILURES
description: FALLSBURGH, N. Y., July 2 Five hundred Orthodox rabbis listened with mixed feelings as two graduate students  both Orthodox  chided them for their failure to provide answers to religious and social prob lems.

title: Saigon Disappointed at SEATO Action as Talks End
description: MANILA, Friday, July 3The annual meeting of the ministerial council of the Southeast Asia Treaty Organi zation ended several hours ahead of schedule today.

title: Text of Hayes Memorandum on Consultant Contracts
First Strikes by Thai Aircraft Inside Cambodia Are Reported
description: BANGKOK, Thailand, July 2 Thai fighterbombers launched their first air strikes in Cam bodia yesterday, informed sources here said today.

title: CLARKE FOILS BID ON ONEOUT SINGLE
description: DETROIT, July 2 For the third time in a month, Horace Clarke broke up a nohitter in the ninth inning when he sin gled with one down off Joe Niekro tonight as the Detroit Tigers defeated the New York Yankees, 50.

title: POLICE PENSIONER ARRAIGNED AGAIN
description: Former Detective Michael Martin, who retired from the Police Department last month before the completion of his departmental trial on charges of stealing and selling confi dential police information, ap peared in Criminal Court yes terday to face prosecution for the same alleged offense.

title: Gore Faces Toughest Challenge
description: CHATTANOOGA, July 2 I'm astride The Southern Stra tegy, said Senator Albert Gore, arid he's a real bucking bronco.

title: Foreign Affairs Computer and Abacus
description: LONDONOne who has com pleted a lengthy trip through four republics and three auton omous subrepublics of the So viet Union feels entitled to re word Lincoln Steffens: I have seen the future and it worksthe hardest possible way.

title: Lon Nol Announces He and Sirik Matak Exercise Full War Power in Cambodia
description: PNOMPENH, Cambodia, July 2Premier Lon Nol asserted today on his own behalf and on that of Deputy Premier Sisowath Sink Matak that they jointly have full power to make all governmental decisions dur ing the war emergency.

title: Patrolman Dies in Crash
description: A 31yearold policeman was killed early yesterday when a patrol wagon in which he was a passenger skidded on the wet pavement and struck a concrete abutment at Franklin D. Roose velt Drive and 16th Street. He was identified as Paul V. Dona din of 30.10 Terrace Road, Wan tagh, L.I. The driver of the wagon, Patrolman Joseph Sul livan, was reported in fair con dition at Bellevue Hospital.

title: CASE OF JUDGE'S SON SENT TO YOUTH UNIT
description: When 17year old Theodore Rosenberg was arrested with three friends on a drug charge last month, his father, State Supreme Court Justice Samuel R. Rosenberg, called a fellow judge out of bed to go to the precinct and arraign the four.

title: G.O.P. in Virginia Is Showing Independence
description: RICHMOND, June 29  In Alexander Heard's book A TwoParty South? he relates an anecdote about a venerable Virginia Republican who meets and cynically Wens to the ambitious plans of a young whippersnapper determined to build and strengthen the state party.Son,, the old man says after hearing the grandiose strate gies, you've got to keep in mind that there are al ready more deserv ing Republicans in Virginia than there are jobs for them.

title: Lindsay and 2 Aides Take South Bronx Walking Tour
description: Mayor Lindsay took a onc hour walking tour in the South Bronx last night, stopping to talk with residents about hous ing problems, the drug crisis and other community issues.

title: Dwight H. Ellis, Broker In Wall Street 41 Years
description: Dwight Holme Ellis, a retired stockbroker, died Wednesday Bethesda Memorial Hospital, Del Ray Beach, Fla. He was 83 years old and lived at 100 North Ocean Boulevard, Del Ray Beach.

title: 3 SCHOOL DISTRICTS FACING FUND CUTOFF
description: WASHINGTON, July 2 (AP) Reviving a civil rights weap on that was largely abandoned nearly a year ago, the Depart ment of Health, Education and Welfare threatened three seg regated Southern school dis tricts today with loss of Fed eral funds unless they dis mantled dual systems for blacks and whites.

title: Punches Pulled at City Hall
description: Jack Dempsey, who cele brated his 75th birthday on June 24, yesterday was pre sented with the city's Bronze Medallion at City Hall by Mayor Lindsay, who hailed him as a great New Yorker. Mr. Dempsey, the former heavy weight boxing champion, threw a playful right to the Mayor's jaw and invited Mr. Lindsay to throw a jab at his jaw. The Mayor threw a playful left.

title: ANDRE L. BOVAY, 49, UNITED NATIONS AIDE
description: Andre L. Bovay, a staff member of the United Nations secretariat for 23 years, died Wednesday at the Harkness Pavilion of the ColumbiaPres byterian Medical Center, after a long illness. He was 49 years old and lived in Dobbs Ferry, Njx.

title: Beame Withholds Fee to Coniultant; Questioning Ethics
description: City Controller Abraham D. Beanie stopped payment yester day on $1.5million worth of consulting contracts granted by the city to McKinsey Associates, because of two questions of, ethics.

title: Brezhnev Promises to Increase Agricultural Investments 70%
description: MOSCOW, July 2Commu nist party leader Leonid I. Brezhnev told the party's Cen tral Committee today that in vestments in the nations agri culture would be increased by 70 per cent in the 197175 five year plan.

title: Article 78153663 -- No Title
description: LONDON, July 2Detectives from Scotland Yard uncovered stores of arms and ammunition in raids early today on homes in the west London district of Fulham and Hammersmith. Little has been disclosed offi cially, but it is believed that the police who have detained number of men, suspect the arms were about to he smug gled to Northern Ireland.

title: Retired Executive Killed
description: LYMAN, Me., July 2Win field H. Sawtelle, 84 years old, a retired executive of the Corn Products Refining Company, was killed in an auto accident here yesterday. He lived in Westfield, N. J., before coming here in 1948.

title: Two Senior Vice Presidents Elected at Pan Am Airways
description: John C. Leslie has been elect ed senior vice presidentinter national affairs and John C. Pixie senior vice president and general counsel of the Pan American World Airways. Both are directors of the company.

title: PRICES ON AMEX CONTINUE TO FALL
description: The long decline of stock prices on the American Stock Exchange continued for the ninth session in a row yester day. The index slumped to 119.95, down 0.09 from Wednes ;day's level.

title: GM Agrees to Pay $50,000 For Defective Backup Light
description: WASHINGTON, July 2 (UPI) General Motors Corporation has agreed to pay $50,000 in lieu of civil penalty claims for manufacturing certain 1970 model Chevrolets and Buicks with backup lights that violate Federal safety standards, the Transportation Department said today.

title: PIIILLIES TRIUMPH BY 64, 32 SCORES
Negro Plans to Run Against Humphrey In Senate Primary
description: MINNEAPOLIS, July. 2 (AP) Earl D. Craig Jr., a Negro active in the New Democratic Coalition, announced today that he would challenge Hubert H. Humphrey for the Demo cratic nomination for the Sen ate in the Sept. 15 primaryif he can raise $20,000 in cam paign funds in the next two weeks.

title: HELEN COMSTOCK, 77, EXPERT ON ANTIQUES
description: Helen Comstock, an author and authority on antiques and wife of HeInuit Siber, the artist, died Wednesday at her home in South Peacham, Vt., after long illness. She was 77 years old.

title: Panthers Plan Boycott Of World Youth Assembly
description: Two spokesmen for the Black Panther party announced yesterday that their group would not take part in the United Nations World Youth Assembly opening next Thurs day.

title: Suburban Restaurant That Merits Visit
description: ***Villa Pierre, Glen Cove Road, Glen Cove. L. I. (516) OR 12890. The Villa Pierre is a cut above the vast majority of the suburban restaurants in America.

title: Stefanie Pri4ge Will Be a Bride
description: WESTPORT, Conn., July 2 Mr. and Mrs. William F. Prigge of Westport, have an nounced the engagement of their daughter, Miss Stefanie Prigge, to George Forest Kramer, son of Mrs. Rozanne E. Kramer of Santa Fe, N. M., and adopted son of Clarence J. Kramer of Washington, D. C.

title: Ocean Hill District, A Legal.Nonentity, Names New Chief
description: Although it has ceased to exist legally, the Ocean Hill Brownsville Experimental School District announced yes terday the appointment of new unit administrator for the eight schools in the area.

title: Gilmour Is Back Driving at Westbury
description: WESTBURY, L. I., June 2 Bud Gilmour returned to night to the Roosevelt Race way paddock, where he had been banned for 3 years, and began shaking hands.

title: JURYTRIAL RULE LIMITED BY STATE
description: ALBANY, July 2  The State Court of Appeals ruled today that a recent United States Supreme Court decision guaranteeing the right to a jury trial to persons accused of crimes punishable by more than six months in prison does not apply to trials begun before the decision was handed down on June 22.

title: MISS PETRIDES LEADS A SPIRITED PROGRAM
description: During the last nine years, the West Side Orchestral Con certs Association has brought dozens of outdoor programs to Riverside Park. A shortage of funds trimmed this summer's schedule to two, but at least the weatherman cooperated and goodly crowds turned out at 103d Street, both for the open ing concert on June 24 and the final one on Wednesday.

title: 2 American Ship Hijackers Want to Quit Cambodia
description: PNOMPENH, Cambodia, July 3 (AP)  More than three months after hijacking a United States munitions ship to Cambodia, Clyde W. McKay Jr. and Alvin L. Glatkowski wish they were anywhere but in Cambodia.

title: Paisley Critical in Commons
description: LONDON, July 3The Rev Ian Paisley Ulster's militant Protestant leader charged today in his maiden speech as member of the House of Commons that men and women are being slaughtered on the streets of Belfast because British soldiers stationed there had failed to protect them.

title: 5 DEAD IN BELFAST AS BRITISH TROOPS AND SNIPERS FIGHT
description: BELFAST, Saturday, July 4British troops battled civilian snipers early today in a Roman Catholic area of Belfast where 5 persons were killed and nearly 50 injured in rioting last night. The deaths brought to 12 those killed in disturbances here in the last week.

title: Antiques: Political Protests in Silver
description: Instead of wearing inexpen sive pins, American colonists recorded their political sentiments on their good silver and china.

title: Heavy Weather Prevents Tahiti Yacht Race Report
description: LOS ANGELES, July 3 (AP) sStrong winds and poor weather forced cancellation of the rollcall today in the Los AngelestoTahiti yacht race as the leaders sailed nearer to Papeete.

title: Canada in the 1970's
description: Canada's White Paper projects important shifts foreign policy priorities, but it is reassuring on three points about which there has been some concern this country: it is not antiAmerican, it is not neoisolationist, and it does not envision a Canadian withdrawal from the Atlantic Alliance.

title: Market Place:
description: Secondguessing is never kind, but if the names are changed to protect the stock broker, perhaps it's pardonable.

title: CHEMICAL OPENING A BANK IN LONDON
description: The Chemical Bank announced yesterday the formal opening of an international bank in London that it has formed in partnership with three other major banking institutions  Baring Brothers & Co., Ltd., London, Credit Suisse, Zurich, and the Northern Trust Comnanv. Chicago.

title: More Towns Are Closing Beach Areas to Outsiders
FORDHAM PREP ENDS TIE TO UNIVERSITY
description: The Rev. Eugene J. O'Brien, president of Fordham Preparatory School in the Bronx, announced this week that the school had been granted its own charter and had been legally separated from Fordham University.

title: Africans Ask Pontiff For Married Priests
description: PARIS, July 3The bishops of five former French colonies in Africa have appealed to Rome for permission to ordain married men as priests.

title: CITY IS PETITIONED FOR VOTE ON WAR
description: Petitions signed by 36,796 New Yorkers opposed to the undeclared war in Indochina were presented yesterday to the City Clerk in an effort to place the war issue on the November ballot.

title: BlueCollar Blues...
description: A confidential report to President Nixon, which has just come to light, revolves about the highly uncontroversial fact that millions of frustrated bluecollar workers are overripe for a political response to economic and cultural, pressures.

title: Miss Mary Jo Cook Affianced To Daniel Patrick Santo Pietro
description: FLORAL PARK, L.I., July 3 Mr. and Mrs. Joseph C. Cook of Floral Park have announced the engagement of their daughter, Miss Mary Jo Cook, to Daniel Patrick Santo Pietro of San Diego, Calif. and Rio de Janeiro.

title: TRADE EXPANDING FOR AFRICAN BLOC
description: One of the first major dents in France's dominant commercial position in her former African possessions has been made with new tariff cuts by four Central African countries.

title: White House Drawn Into Island Dispute
description: SAN JUAN, P. R., July 3As if Cambodia Vietnam cam pus violence and the limping Dow Jones average were nol enough President Nixon may now have to settle a smolder ing dispute between the United States Navy and the 900 resi dents of Culebra who resen the fact that their otherwise idyllic island is a target for missiles and bombs.

title: Japan Exports Increase
description: TOKYO, July 3 (Reuters)Japan's exports in June rose to 1.7billion, or the secondhighest level only after a record of 1.77billion marked last March, the Ministry of International Trade and Industry said today. The official figure based on the bank certifications of export declarations showed that June total was up 8.7 per cent from $1.56billion in May and up 23.6 per cent from $1.37billion in June last year.

title: German Reserves Decline 47 Million Marks in Week
description: FRANKFURT, West Germany, July 3 (Reuters) The Federal Bank said today that West Germany's monetary reserves fell by 47 million marks to 33,824,000,000 marks in the week to June 30.

title: LaidOff Workers Growing Resentful on Relief
Miss Gay White Wed Here to Army Officer
description: Miss Gay Montague White and First Lieut. Raymond Roy Hitchcock, U.S.A., were married here yesterday afternoon in the Dana Chapel of the Mathison Avenue Presbyterian Church by the Rev. William A. McOuoid.

title: Independence Day
description: ParkingSunday parking rules in effect.

title: BROOKLYN FIREMEN HARASSED BY BRICKS
description: With bricks and stones being thrown at them, firemen arriving at a blaze in the Brownsville area of Brooklyn last night withdrew until the youths throwing the missiles had been dispersed by the police. No one was reported injured.

title: Just Plain Old Satchmo Turns 70 Sweetly
description: To the roar of fireworks on this Fourth of July, add one sweet sound of trumpet it is Louis Armstrong's 70th birthday.

title: NEW FARES ASKED BY PENN CENTRAL
description: The Penn Central asked again yesterday for zonal fares on part of its New Haven commuter line, for monthly flashcard tickets and for a sharp rise in the price of 10ride tickets.

title: Leander Lobell Is 21 Favorite In Pacing Semifinals Tonight
description: WESTBURY, L. I., July If George Wampetich is right, fans at Roosevelt Raceway tomorrow night will see one of America's most promising 3yearolds in action.

title: CAMPAIGN THEME GIVEN FOR G.O.P.
description: SAN CLEMENTE, Calif., July 3President Nixon's chief adviser on domestic affairs said today that a major theme of Republican campaigns next fall would be what he called the refusal of the Democratic leadership in the House and Senate to help make government more responsive to the nation's needs.

title: YALE EIGHT WINS FROM IRISH CREW
description: HENLEYONTHAMES, England, July 3 (AP)A east lightweight crew from Yale University and a pair of strong scullers from California advanced today to the last day of the Henley Royal Regatta.

title: Honor System Ending On Delaware Turnpike
description: DOVER, Del., July 3 (AP)  The Delaware Turnpike's drive now pay later honor system for tolls will be discontinued tomorrow, less than one month after it was instituted. Under the system, motorists lacking exact change for the automated tollbooths were supposed to take preaddressed envelopes and send in their money later.

title: CLENDENON SINGLE SCORES 2 IN NINTH
description: PHILADELPHIA, July 31 The Mets, after having been deposed as the leaders in the National League Eastern Divi sion for a few hours, regained first place by a fraction of a percentage point tonight. They rallied in the ninth inning to, defeat the Phillies, 43, at Connie Mack Stadium.

title: Miss Patricia Reynolds Plans January Nuptials
description: WESTBURY, L. I., July 3Mr. and Mrs. Peter Callan Reynolds have announced the engagement of their daughter. Miss Patricia Callan Reynolds, to William Felton Barrett 3d. He is the son of Mr. and Mrs. Barrett Jr. of Great Barrington, Mass. A wedding next January is planned.

title: Our Alienated Rights
description: One hundred and ninetyfour years ago the Founding Fathers asserted their independence with a ringing Declaration of man's unalienable rights.

title: Harry Berlfein, Reporter For Women's Wear Daily
description: Harry Berlfein, a reporter for Women's Wear Daily for many years, died yesterday after a heart attack while visiting a friend here. He was 64 years old and lived at 120 Carver Loop Coop City, the Bronx.

title: They Lived in Tent While Their$1.4Million Hose Was Built
Television
description: 5:30 (4) Modem Termer

title: Drivers Veto Cleveland Pact
description: CLEVELAND, July 3 (AP)Drivers for the Gleveland Transit System, who have stayed off the job for three days in a wildcat strike, voted down a proposed new contract today. The 2,000 transit workers started the unauthorized walkout following the expiration of the old contract on Tuesday. The drivers rejected a 65cent hourly pay rise over two years in the proposed contract. They now receive $3.75 an hour.

title: An Immodest Proposal
Kocsis 21Shot Victor In Senior Amateur Golf
description: GLENEAGLES, Scotland, July 3 (AP)Charles (Chuck) Kocsis, 57 years old, won the fifth international amateur senior golf championship today by 21 strokes over his nearest challenger in the field of nearly 200 from 16 countries.

title: WALTER O. BRIGGS, OWNED THE TIGERS
description: DETROIT, July 3 (AP)Walter 0. Briggs Jr., former owner of the Detroit Tigers, died in hospital here this morning after a long illness: He was 58 years old.

title: Italians Set for Vacation Amid Economic Alarms
description: ROME, July 3As this country gets ready for a comfortable summer vacation, Italians are hearing authoritative warnings of economic recession and a tightmoney crisis.

title: Irish Group Pickets B.O.A.C.
description: The National Association for Irish Justice picketed the Fifth Avenue office of the British Overseas Airways Corporation yesterday demanding the freeing of Bernadette Devlin.

title: Firevvorks Men Taking Bang Out of the Fourth
description: DETROIT, July 3There'll be fewer bangs in Fourth of celebrations tomorrow, the makers of fireworks say.

title: Saigon Students Are Making the U.S. a Major Target
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, July 3  If only the Americans would go away, we Vietnamese could settle the war between ourselves.

title: DEMAND IS SMALL FOR NEW ISSUES
description: Three companies managed to make first public offerings of their stock this week in another period of desultory market activity.

title: Matthews's Soling Wins
description: GREENWICH, Conn., July Dean W. Matthews of the Greenwich fleet won his third race in three starts on Long Island Sound with Big Splurge today in the opening of a special Soling Class holiday geries being sailed in conjunction with the Indian Harbor Yacht Club's threeday event for Yacht Racing Association fleets based east of Rye.

title: Nixon Criticized in Press
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, July 3The Lebanese press today criticized President Nixon's remarks Wednesday night in Al Anwar a proEgyptian daily, described them as the dynamite that has blown up the bridges that Secretary Rogers and his aides had spent months to build.

title: Entertainment Events
description: Theater

title: AUSTRALIAN WINS TITLE FOR 3D TIME
description: WIMBLEDON, England, July 3Mrs. Margaret Court wont her third AllEngland tennis) title at Wimbledon today. The great Australian defeated Mrs. Billie Jean King, 1412, 119, in a battle that raged 2 hours and left the windblown crowd on center court drained on emotion.

title: PANEL ON 76 ASKS WIDE CELEBRATION
description: WASHINGTON, July 3President Nixon received reammendations today that Philadelphia be the site of an international exposition during the nation's bicentennial in 1976 and that other major observances be held at Boston, Miami and Washington.

title: NIXON TO APPROVE SPENDING CEILING
description: WASHINGTON, July 3President Nixon is on the verge of signing, with some reluctance, a bill that would bar him from increasing spending to stimulate the economy if he felt he should do so.

title: Article 3  No Title
Miss Koner Dances PoignantFarewell At Jacob's Pillow
description: LEE, Mass., July 3Pauline Koner's dance The Farewell, conceived as a tribute to the late Doris Humphrey, with whom Miss Koner was associated, is one that does not lose the magic I always associate with the first time I saw it.

title: HOSPITAL SHIFTS ON STERILIZATIONS
description: The Northern Westchester Hospital in Mount Kisco, N. Y., which was sued in May by 27yearold mother of three because she was denied a sterilization operation, changed its rules this week and agreed to perform the operation.

title: Police Here Urged to Require College Degree for Promotion
description: Two studies financed by the Justice Department have recommended that graduation from college become a requirement for promotion in the city's Police Department.

title: Radio
description: 89 A.M., WRVR: Netherlands Chamber Orchestra. Szymon Goldberg, conductor; Hans Henkemans, piano. Don Juan: Two Excerpts Gluck Piano Concerto in B flat (X. 238) Mozart Trio for String Orchestra.... Van Delden Symphony No. 39 in G minor... Haydn

title: Consumer Unions Optimistic as 30Nation Talks End
description: BADEN, Austria, July 3Consumerprotection experts left here in a buoyant mood tonight, convinced that their efforts to shield families from unreasonable prices and unfair business methods were rapidly developing into a powerful international movement.

title: Israeli Says Peking Seeks To Stir Revolt in Mideast
description: TEL AVIV, July 3 (Reuters)  A former Israeli military intelligence chief warned today of a Chinese danger in the Middle East and said that Peking hoped to bring Communist revolution to the area through the Arab guerrilla organizations.

title: Russia's Gavrilov Scores In High Jump at Kiev Meet
description: KIEV, U.S.S.R. (AP)Valentin Gavrilov, Russia's bronze medalist in the 1968 Olympics, won the high jump with a leap of 7 feet 2 inches today in the finale of the twoday Brothers Znamensky track and field meet at Central Republic Stadium.

title: Boy Making Fireworks Is Blinded in One Eye
description: FRANKLIN SQUARE, L. I., July 3 (UPI)A 13yearold boy, who was blinded in one eye when chemicals he was using to make fireworks exploded in his face, was in critical condition at Franklin General Hospital today. Doctors were trying to save his right hand.

title: City Is Sued by Own Law Aide, Alleging Outsider Favoritism
description: The city, which faces thousands of lawsuits filed by disgruntled citizens each year, now has to contend with one brought by a member of its own Law Depertment.

title: Comedian and Patriot
description: I think, said Leslie Towns Hope, this is a good day to sit down and count your blessings.

title: Roundup: Cubs Feel Sting Of Pirates'
description: It wasn't wishful thinking and it wasn't a boast. It was a simple statement of a fact the Chicago Cubs had painfully learned in the previous 3 hours 45 minutes.

title: Socialist Worker Begins Campaign in Harlem
description: Paul Boutelle opened his campaign as the Socialist Workers party candidate for Congress in the 18th Congressional District, in Harlem, yesterday with a street rally at 125th Street and Seventh Avenue.

title: Pnompenh Opens Treason Trial of Absent Sihanouk
description: PNOMPENH, Cambodia, July 3The treason trial of Prince Norodom Sihanouk opened, here today without the defendant's presence or anyone to testify on his behalf.

title: The Path to Europe
description: LUXEMBOURGAs the talks began on enlargement of the Common Market, two men with vital roles on opposite sides were asked for their estimate of the prospects. They gave the same reply: the crux will lie not at the negotiating table in Brussels but in Britainin British public opinion.

title: SUITCASE BECOMES A HOLIDAY SYMBOL
description: The suitcase was yesterday's symbol of the Fourth of July weekend as thousands of New Yorkers went into the second day of the migration from the city for the holiday or the beginning of summer vacation.

title: 14 in Protest Arested
description: WASHINGTON, July 3 (AP)Fourteen persons were arrested in an outbreak of scuffling and bottle throwing yesterday as 250 demonstrators renewed demands that the city provide the boor with furniture.

title: ANDERSON TAKES JUNIOR EPEE TITLE
description: Grant Anderson was the captain of his high school crosscountry team in Kenosha, Wis., two years ago but that didn't prevent his coach from kicking him off the squad when Anderson missed a couple of practice sessions.

title: Harvard's Hale, a Tory, Linked To Betrayal of His Yale Cousin
description: Yale University has acquired a 1777 letter that lends support to the suspicion that its alumnus Nathan Hale was betrayed by a Harvard man.

title: GILBERT CARDS 77 AND TRAILS BY SIX
description: LONDON, Ontario, July 3Bob Stone, a 40yearold silverhaired golf professional from Independence, Mo., hitched a ride to the London Hunt and Country Club today. When the stranger left him at the door he said, politely, Hope you do well, but I hope you finish second because I want a Canadian to win.

title: Astronauts of Soyuz 9 Honored at the Kremlin
description: MOSCOW, July 3 (Reuters) Russia's two Soyuz 9 astronauts won high awards and praise today from Soviet leaders for their recordsetting 18day space flight last month.

title: Article 2  No Title
Fast Music Tropical Victor
description: MIAMI, July 3 (AP)M. M. Bittman's Fast Music led all the way in the Deep South Handicap at Tropical Park today, holding off Black Pipe to win by half a length. Fast Music covered the 5 furlongs in 1:03 25 and paid $8, $4.60 and $3 for $2 across the board.

title: Laos Reports the Recapture Of Mountain From Enemy
description: VIENTIANE, Laos, July 3 (Agence FrancePresse) Laotian Government forces have reoccupied Phou Kate, a mountain that was seized by the North Vietnamese June 19, an official spokesman of the Laotian Defense Ministry announced today.

title: Hospitals Delay Most. Abortions Until After Holiday Weekend
description: No abortions were performed yesterday in most city hospitals, elective surgery being postponed until Monday so that surgeons and other members of the hospitals staffs could observe the Independence Day holiday.

title: REOPENING IS SET BY DOLLY MADISON
description: PHILADELPHIA, July 3 (AP)  The courtappointed trustee for Dolly Madison Industries, Inc., said today the company would reopen its furniture manufacturing operations July 6.

title: 5 NEGRO CLERGYMEN WILL VISIT MOSCOW
description: Five Negro clergymen in the metropolitan area will make 10day visit to Moscow next month as guests of the Russian Orthodox Church.

title: GEORGE W. CECIL, 78, EXADVERTISING AIDE
description: PHILADELPHIA, July 3George W. Cecil, a retired vice president and director of the N. W. Ayer & Son, Inc.., the advertising agency, died yesterday in Pennsylvania Hospital. He was 78 years old.

title: NIXON MAY APPOINT NEGRO CONSULTANT
description: SAN CLEMENTE, Calif., July 3White House officials said tonight that there had been informal staff discussion about the possibility of asking prominent Negro to become a parttime consultant to President Nixon on civil rights and related matters.

title: PATRIOTIC READING AGAIN SAVES SITE
description: MIDDLEBROOK HEIGHTS, N. J., July 3 (UPI)A reading of the Declaration of Independence tomorrow will preserve for another year the historic campsite here where George Washington is believed to have first flown the 13star flag officially before his troops.

title: British Government Seeks Restrictions On New Immigrants
description: LONDON, July 3 (AP)Britain's Conservative Government announced proposed legislation today to curb immigration into Britain from Commonwealth countries.

title: U.S. BUDGET DEFICIT OF $12BILLION SEEN
description: WASHINGTON, July 3 (AP)  The Council of State Chambers of Commerce said today that the 1971 Federal deficit could rise to $12.5billion, nearly 10 times the Nixon Administration's estimate of $1.3billion.

title: Greek Orthodox Express an Ambivalent Ethnic Pride
VELVET ROCK GROUP OPENS STAND HERE
description: The Velvet Underground was playing experimental rock in 1965 when the Beatles just wanted to hold your hand and San Francisco was still the place where Tony Bennett left his heart.

title: Meadowbrook Tops Myopia In Polo Semifinals, 86
description: BETHPAGE, L. I., July 3Goals by Russell Corey and Alan Corey 3d in the closing in the closing chukker helped Vreadowbrook defeat Myopia, 36, in a semifinal of the Northeast Intercircuit 12goal tournament at Bethpage State Park today.

title: FULBRIGHT RECALL FAILS IN ARKANSAS
description: LITTLE ROCK, Ark., July 3 (UPI)A campaign to recall Senator J. W. Fulbright, Democrat of Arkansas, ended today when his opponents petition fell 4.500 signatures short.

title: 140 Teachers and Students Leave Here to Visit Ghana
description: A group of 140 teachers andl students headed by Dr. Lawrence N. Jones, dean of students at the Union Theological Seminary, left for Ghana last night from Kennedy International Airport.

title: F. C. WACHSM1TH, 61, PRESS CLUB LAWYER
description: Frank C. Wachsmith, a lawyer for the Overseas Press Club and formerly for The Associated Press, died yesterday of a heart attack at Mount Sinai Hospital. He was 61 years old and lived at 129 East 82d Street in Manhattan.

title: Chicago Teamster Pact Brings New National Rise
description: CHICAGO July 3Truck drivers of the Chicago area won their demand early today for a wage increase of $1.65 an hour over 36 months. Immediately afterward drivers in the rest of the nation were granted a revised wage increase of $1.85 an hour over 39 months.

title: Executive Airlines Cites Changes of Two Officers
description: BOSTON, July 3 (AP)Executive Airlines, Inc., which calls itself the nation's largest commuter airline, announced change of command today with Walter Beinecke Jr. stepping down as chairman and Joseph C. Whitney as president.

title: House Unit Criticizes Pentagon On $176,000 Paid to a Doctor
description: WASHINGTON, July 3 (AP) A, San Diego psychiatrist made $176,000 on a military health insurance program in 1968, a House subcommittee reported today, and the Pentagon did not look into the payments until questioned by Congress.

title: MacPherson Scores
description: MAMARONECK, N.Y., July 3 A. Shawhan Fox won his third Shields Class race of the season with Strider on Long Island Sound today and George M. (Doak) Isdale Jr. captured his fourth Etchells22 event with Rampant during the 14th Yacht Racing Association championship regatta.

title: WAR FILM DROPPED BY BERLIN FESTIVAL
description: BERLIN, July 3 (AP)The jury at the 20th annual West Berlin Film Festival has dropped from competition West German movie about an alleged American atrocity in Vietnam, authoritative sources reported today.

title: Frances Parkinson Keyes Dies; Writer and Washington Hostess
description: NEW ORLEANS, July 3 (AP)  Frances Parkinson Keyes, novelist, magazine editor, chronicler of Washington society, and the widow of a New Hampshire Governor and United States Senator, died at her home here today. She was 84 years old.

title: DR. HENRY GUZE, A PSYCHOANALYST
description: MONTCLAIR, N. J., July 3  Dr. Henry Guze, a psychoanalyst and adjunct professor of anthropology at Drew University, died Wednesday of cardiac arrest at Mountainside Hospital here. He was 51 years old.

title: Moynihan Detects Improvement In Negro and White Relations
description: Daniel Patrick Moynihan, counselor to President Nixon, has suggested that Negrowhite relations are getting better.

title: Nasser Treated in Soviet For Diabetes and Sciatica
description: MOSCOW, July 3 (UPI)President Gamal Abdel Nasser of the United Arab Republic consulted Soviet doctors today for treatment of diabetes and sciatica, diplomatic sources said. He has undergone treatment in the Soviet Union in the past for both ailments.

title: Mistress Triumphs
description: BABYLON, L. I., July 3A fleet of 202 yachts, the largest turnout in recent years, started today, in the annual Fourth of July weekend regatta of the Babylon Yacht Club. A southerly wind that veered to the east gave the skippers a fullsail breeze throughout the afternnon.

title: Court Cuts Term of Woman Who Insulted Greek Regime
description: ATHENS, July 3  A special courtmartial today cut to 11 months the original fouryear prison sentence of Mrs. Angheliki Mangakis for insulting the authorities by protesting that her husband had been tortured during police interrogation.

title: DEWAN 2D CHOICE IN A FIELD OF 10
description: With the greatest earner among horses now in training Nodouble of the Verna Lea Farmheading, the list, the Suburban Handicap has attracted a field of 10 for its 84th running today.

title: Theater: Richard III
MONEY SQUEEZE IS FELT IN EUROPE
description: PARIS, July 3Tight money is creating problems for business and financial enterprises in Europe the way it has in the United States.

title: Hoberman, Personnel Chief For City, Retires at 55
description: Solomon Hoberman, the city's Personnel Director and chairman of the Civil Service Commission, stepped quietly into retirement yesterday after three decades in city government.

title: 20 Hurt on French TV Show
description: AVIGNON, France, July 3 (AP)Twenty actors and ballet dancers were injured when heavy wooden stage setting fell on them during the filming of a television show in nearby Villeneuve les Avignon. The star, Ludmilla Tcherina, escaped injury. The show was being filmed for the stateowned television system.

title: Bridge:
description: STOCKHOLM, July 3Two Italian pairs chased after an Austrian partnership in the world pair championship here tonight, with the American representatives virtually out of contention.

title: Singer to Remain As Chief Executive Of the City Center
description: Norman Singer will remain as chief executive officer of City Center of Music and Drama, Inc., it was announced yesterday by Richard M. Clurman, center board chairman.

title: ... and Black Despair
description: Almost as though anticipating a shift in the direction of public concern from the least privileged to the next to the least, black leaders are warning of crises to come. A Black Declaration of Independence drawn up by a committee of Negro churchmen, mixing doubtful analogy with some very painful truths, concludes with the ultimatum that unless their people receive full Redress and Relief, they will move to renounce all Allegiance to this Nation....

title: Pattee Canyon, $3.60, Wins $55,450 Handicap on Coast
description: INGLEWOOD, Calif., July (AP)Pattee Canyon, winner of the recent Twilight Tear Handicap in Chicago, made it two stakes victories in succession today by taking the $55,450 Beverly Hills Handicap against eight rival mares and fillies at Hollywood Park. Pattee Canyon returned $3.60, $2.80 and $2.80 for $2 across the board.

title: MOST HAPPY FELLA SETS GOSHEN MARK
description: GOSHEN, N. Y., July 3Grand Circuit time, a fiveday week offered here annually to harness racing fans, was concluded this overcast, humid afternoon at the 133yearold Historic Track.

title: GAIN IN EARNINGS LISTED BY UTILITY
description: The New England Electric System reported yesterday consolidated net income of $14,435,018, equal to 98 cents a share for the five Months ended May 31, compared with $13,571,274, or 92 cents a share, for the like 1969 period.

title: Illinois Vote Approved
description: SPRINGFIELD, Ill., July 3 (UPI)Gov. Richard B. Ogilvie yesterday approved a $750million antipollution bond referendum that will be on the ballot in the November election. The bonds would provide funds to upgrade solid waste disposal municipal sewage treatment and solid waste disposal facilities throughout Illinois.

title: WOMEN GOLFERS IN TIE FOR LEAD
description: MUSKOGEE, Okla., July 3 (AP)Donna Caponi, the defending champion, and Carol Mann, the 1965 winner, battled each other and stifling heat today but remained in a deadlock for the lead at the halfway point of the United States Women's Open Golf championship.

title: Norway Is on Watch At NATO's Frontier
description: KIRKENES, Norway, June 27A fresh wind, blowing straight from the Pole, raises little waves on the inlet, and the Soviet frontier guard grabs his greentopped cap as he watches the strangers through field glasses. The Norwegian colonel grins and says that at least the monotony of the Russian's day has been broken.

title: 200 YOUTHS BREAK UP PROGRAM IN CAPITAL
description: WASHINGTON, July 3 (UPI) About 200 youths chanting smoke marijuana on the fringes of a blues festival on the Washington Monument grounds forced the cancellation of the program tonight.

title: Matisse Exhibition Attracts 200,000 In Paris in 2 Months
description: PARIS, July 2About 200,000 people have visited the Matisse show that opened at the Grand Palais off the ChampsElysees a little over two months ago.

title: Wathen Knebelkamp Dies at 69; ExPresident of Churchill Downs
description: LOUISVILLE, Ky., July 3 (UPI)  Wathen R. Knebelkamp, who retired as president of Churchill Downs Race Track last December, died today after an apparent heart attack. He was 69 years old.

title: A Correction
description: An article in yesterday's New York Times dealing with the use of drugs for children with learning disabilities mistakenly stated, because of a transmission error, that the drug treatment was not used for children with learning or behavior problems and was used in connection with mental retardation, emotional disturbance or psychosis. The article should have said that the treatment is not used for children whose learning or behavior problem is connected with mental retardation, emotional disturbance or psychosis.

title: FESTIVAL REVIVES 1780 HAYDN OPERA
description: AMSTERDAM, July 3The first known performances of Haydn's La Fedelta Premiata since the 18th century were enthusiastically received this week by audiences at the Holland Festival.

title: Princess Sonja Miscarries
description: OSLO, Norway, July 3 (Reuters)Crown Princess Sonja, 32yearold wife of the heir tc the Norwegian throne, suffered a miscarriage this morning, her doctors announced. Her condition was described as satisfactory. The former Sonja Haraldsen, daughter of an Oslo businessman, married Crown Prince Harald, only son of King Olav V, in August, 1968. They have no children.

title: A Catholic Deacon, Losing New Faith, Rejoins Anglicans
description: ROCHESTER, July 3 (AP)An Anglican priest who adopted Roman Catholicism and later became the first married man to be ordained a Catholic deacon in the United States has left his new faith.

title: Thailand Denies Carrying Out Bombing Strikes in Cambodia
description: BANGKOK, Thailand, July (UPI)Thailand today denied that her air force planes had carried out bombing raids in Cambodia.

title: Malcolm Lovell Is Named Assistant Labor Secretary
description: SAN CLEMENTE, Calif., July 3 (UPI)President Nixon nominated Malcolm R. Lovell Jr. today for promotion to Assistant Secretary of Labor for Manpower.

title: Judith Adams Is Bride Here
description: Miss Judith Ellen Adams and Daniel Andrew Anderson, graduates of the Northwestern School of Music were married here yesterday in a JudeoChristian ceremony performed antiphonally at the Riverside Church by the Rev. Dr. Jesse Lyons of the church and Rabbi Samuel Halevi Baron of Forest Hills.

title: Hapoel Beats Spurs, 20
description: KANSAS CITY, July 3 (AP) Hapoel of PetahTikvah, Israel, struck twice in the first half and went on to blank the Kansas City Spurs, 20, in an international soccer match be. fore 3,087 fans last night.

title: Letters to the Editor of The Times
description: To the Editor: On the Fourth of July we celebrate the fact that we are a selfgoverning people rather than servants paying tribute to some foreign power. It is a special day of thanksgiving for our hard won and hard to hold freedom of thought, speech, press and assembly. We raise our flag as a testimonial symbol of our right to individuality as long as that individuality is not clearly inconsistent with the general welfare or the security of the nation.

title: NIXON AIDE DEFENDS BUDGET FOR HEALTH
description: WASHINGTON, July 3 (UPI) The Nixon Administration defended its health policies and budget today, calling reports of a low Federal health priority untrue.

title: In Memoriam
description: BLACKMANLeo. He will always be mourned by the many who loved and respected him.

title: U.A.R, SAYS IT HIT TWO ISRAELI JETS
description: CAIRO, July 3The United, Arab Republic reported today that its antiaircraft troops had hit two more Israeli fighterbombers in the Suez Canal combat zone and along the western shore of the Gulf of Suez.

title: McGovern Asks Nixon Aid For a Food Stamp Drive
description: WASHINGTON, July 3 (AP)Senator George S. McGovern, a leading Senate advocate of expanded Federal food pro grams, called today for Nixon Administration support for a new drive to increase funds for food stamps.

title: CITIZEN LAWSUITS ON ECOLOGY URGED
description: WASHINGTON, July 3Representative Morris K. Udall urged today the enactment of a law to assure and facilitate the right of citizens to file suits in Federal courts for the protection of the environment.

title: I.O.S. Negative Cash Flow Fell to $37Million in May
description: GENEVA, July 3 (Reuters)Investors Overseas Services (I.O.S.) said today that, according to provisional figures, its net negative cash flow last month fell to $36million from $89million in May.

title: In Tonga, It's Sign of Respect
description: NUKU ALOFA, Tongo  If they look as if they, had taken the mats off the floor and wrapped them around their waists, they are welldressed Tongans.

title: Boat Hits Mine
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, July 3 (AP)Fortysix South Vietnamese civilians were killed today when a passenger river boat struck a floating mine south of the demilitarized zone. Local officials said it was the highest toll from such an incident in memory.

title: Feeding While Flying
description: WASHINGTON, July 3The job of serving meals promptly to all the passengers in a large modern aircraft has challenged the manufacturers of the planes.

title: LEGISLATIVE CALL HALTED IN ALASKA
description: ANCHORAGE, Alaska, July 3 (AP)  Gov. Keith H. Miller has canceled his call for a special session of the state legislature, scheduled for Monday.

title: ELVIN JONES PLAYS JAZZ IN GARDEN
description: Any group that is led by Elvin Jones starts off with one of the most powerful and explosive rhythmic foundations to hel found in presentday jazz. But the quartet that the drummer brought to the Jazz in the Garden series at the Museum of Modern Art Thursday night hadi more than his own pyrotechnics to distinguish it.

title: Markets Are Closed
description: All stock, bond and commodity markets were closed yesterday in observance of Independence Day. Banks were open in New York but closed in New Jersey and Connecticut.

title: Article 1  No Title
NIXON AIDE SAYS U.S. DOESN'T PLAN A MIDEAST FORCE
description: SAN CLEMENTE, Calif., July 3The White House continued today to voice President Nixon's growing concern over the Soviet military presence in the Middle East but said that there were no plans to send American military personnel there.

title: Two Held in Capital Slaying
description: WASHINGTON, July 3 (AP)Two 18yearold boys were arrested yesterday and charged with homicide in the slaying of a Georgetown University law student during an attempted robbery. The victim was identified by the police as Jeffrey B. Crandall, 22, of Canisteo, N. Y. He was working as a summer intern in the office of Representative James F. Hastings, Republican of upstate New York. The police identified the two youths charged in the case as Clifton L. Person and Rudolph V. Washington Jr., both of Washington.

title: Books of The Times
description: So attractive and so winning has the husband and wife team of Franklin and Mary Wickwire made Charles, Earl Cornwallis, that it would not take much more to make him an American hero. Cynics might say that a general whose surrender brought victory to colonial arms and made July 4th possible deserves at least an honorary place in the

title: Greece Press Concerned
description: ATHENS, July 2The Greek Press is voicing concern over what is being construed here as sign of separatist tendencies in the Greek Orthodox Archiocese of North and South America.

title: HighPower Device Exploded by French
description: PARIS, July 3 (AP)France exploded an experimental nuclear device described as one of high power above a lagoon at its Mururoa Atoll test site in the South Pacific today, the Defense Ministry announced.

title: Holding Company Drops Plan to Buy Thrift Unit
description: The Imperial Corporation of America, a holding company owning about 13 savings and loan associations, announced yesterday terminaton of its agreement to purchase 96 per cent of the stock of Southern California Savings & Loan Association in Los Angeles, for $30million in cash and securities.

title: Rough Riders Bow, 3514
description: OTTAWA, July 3 (AP)The Canadian Football League allstars powered their way to a 3514 victory over the defending Grey Cup champions, the Ottawa Rough Riders, last night in the first Canadian allstar game since 1958.

title: CAPITAL PREPARES FOR JULY 4 EVENT
description: WASHINGTON, July 3 The nation's capital was preparing today for up to 400,000 participants in Honor America Day an event tomorrow dedicated to respect for flag and country on the Fourth of July.

title: WIDE STUDY URGED ON BIRTH CONTROL
description: GENEVA, July 3A group of scientists, sociologists and theologians recommended today a wide discussion of questions arising from new birthcontrol methods in view of what it called the worldwide need for population control.

title: Soviet Will Airlift Supplies To Quake Victims in Peru
description: LIMA, Peru, July 3 (AP)A fleet of 65 Soviet jet cargo planes will arrive in Lima next week with tons of medical supplies for survivors of the earthquake disaster, the Peruvian military government announced today.

title: Health Agency Reports No U.S. Polio Deaths in 69
description: WASHINGTON, July 3As far as the National Communicable Disease Center has been able to learn, there was not a single death from polio in the United States last year.

title: Gen. Abrams Undergoes Gall Bladder Surgery
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, July 3 (UPI)Gen. Creighton W. Abrams, United States military commander in Vietnam, underwent successful surgery in Japan today for the removal of his gall bladder. The surgery had been delayed until now so he could direct the recent United States operation in Cambodia.

title: Bomb Discovered Outside Apartment Of a Judge Here
description: A bomb that the police said could have caused extensive damage was found outside the apartment door of Supreme Court Justice Jawn A. Sandifer yesterday at 2255 Fifth Avenue. Justice Sandifer and his family were said to be vacationing in New Jersey at the time.

title: Major League Baseball
description: American League

title: Wedding in Spain For Diana Donovan
description: MADRID, July 3  Miss Diana Donovan and Jose Ignacio del Campo Ruiz were married in a religious ceremony here last evening at the Torrejon Air Base chapel.

title: PUBLIC EDUCATION SAID TO FACE PLOT
description: SAN FRANCISCO, July 3 (UPI)  George D. Fischer, president of the National Education Association, warned today of a conspiracy against public education and urged teachers to form a political group to combat it.

title: Battle of the Hemlines Is Looming at Stores
description: Individually, we're smaller. Collectively, we're bigger. And we won't stand for a diversion of our merchandise the big stores when and if they decide to buy the long skirts, said Henry Doneger, president of Henry Doneger Associates, a New York buying office.

title: NATIONWIDE CITED IN AN S.E.C. SUIT
description: LOS ANGELES, July 3 (AP) The Securities and Exchange Commission alleges in a Federal court suit that Nationwide Investment Corporation has converted to its own use at least $326,000 in collateral from investors. The action, filed in United States District Court yesterday, says the investors have borrowed more than $30million from the Beverly Hills based firm.

title: London Bill Rate Falls
description: LONDON, July 3 (Reuters)Average rate at today's tender of treasury bills fell to 6.842 per cent from 6.855 per cent last week This week's 120 million offer of 91day bills met applications of 213,845,000. Applicants for bills dated Monday to Friday at 98/5/10 sterling received about 38 per cent. Next week to 100 million bills will be offered, replacing 80 million maturities.

title: Revocation of Radio License Called Political by McIntire
description: COLLINGSWOOD, N. J., July 3 (UPI)The Rev. Carl McIntire. the fundamentalist radio preacher, said today the revoking of the license of a Media, Pa., radio station by the Federal Communications Commission was political and reprisal, which will be fought all the way to the Supreme Court.

title: IT'S MARIMBA DAY FOR GUATEMALANS
description: GUATEMALA, July 3 (AP) The Fourth of July in Guatamala is Marimba Day.

title: Kohl Heads Agency
description: The TriState Transportation Commission has chosen John C. Kohl, New Jersey's new Commissioner of Transportation, as its chairman. He succeeds Charles J. Urstadt of New York in the chairmanship, which rotates annually among New York, New Jersey and Connecticut.

title: STOCKS IN LONDON SHOW A DECLINE
N.A.A.C.P. Opposes U.S Effort To Require a Reporter to Testify
description: CINCINNATI, July 3  Delegates to the N.A.A.C.P.'s 61st annual convention expressed today their strongest possible opposition to the attempt by the United States Justice Department to require Earl Caldwell, a reporter for The New York Times, to testify before a Federal grand jury investigating the Black Panther party in San Francisco.

title: Times Sq. Vice Persists Despite Patrols
description: Policemeh are much in evidence in the Times Square area on warm summer nights, but despite their welcome presence, a solitary stroller was accosted repeatedly during an hourlong walk one night recently.

title: Grant Gains Archery Title, Beating Metzger by Point
description: NEW BRUNSWICK, N. J., July 3  After three days of competition in the 91st Eastern Archery Association championships at Rutgers University today, Bill Grant of Newark was declared winner in the men's division. He won by one point, with 3,584, to 3,583 for Brian Metzger of Sillerville, Pa.

title: RIGO GAVE $1,000 FOR NIXON IN 68
description: TRENTON, July 3  The prosecution's key witness in the trial of former Mayor Hugh J. Addonizio of Newark testified today that he had ordered $1,000 paid to the NixonAgnew committee in what defense lawyer called a violation of Federal law

title: 2 THREATS FOILED BY BULLPEN ACE
description: When a baseball team finds itself locked in a losing streak, however modest, nothing seems to go right. That was the case last night when the New York Yankees lost to the Washington Senators, 43, before 14,795 fans.

title: Phipps's Pass The Drink Wins by Neck at Arlington
description: CHICAGO, July 3 (AP)Pass The Drink, owned by Ogden Phipps, closed strongly and won the $32,500 North Shore Handicap before a crowd of 22,271 at Arlington Park today.

title: Fifth Crash Victim Dies
description: SAN ANTONIO, Tex., July 3 (AP)A fifth victim died today of injuries suffered as a Navy jet trainer crashed into two houses here the night of June 25. He was Mark Latson, 12 years old, who was at play near his home when the plane cracked up, spraying fuel on his garments before flames broke out.

title: Ferry Crushes Boat
description: BLOCK ISLAND, R. I., July (AP)The Block Island ferry missed her berth by 20 feet today and demolished one $20,000, pleasure craft and caused minor damage to another. Officials said the ferry's engine would not reverse because of malfunction and the boat failed to slow down.

title: CHI CHEN CUPS 220YARD MARK
description: LOS ANGELES, July 3Chi Cheng lowered the world record for the 220yard dash to 22.6 seconds today in the trial heats of the women's national A.A.U. championships at the University of California, Los Angeles. She was aided by a tailwind of 1.9 meters per second, onetenth under the allowable maximum.

title: GOLDBERG CALLS. NIXON LAX ON JOBS
description: Arthur J Goldberg, the DemocraticLiberal candidate for Governor, accused the Nixon Administration yesterday of toolittle, toolate approach to the problem of supplying summer jobs for the nation's youth.

title: A Voyageurs National Park
description: The Administration has announced its endorsement of a proposed Voyageurs National Park to preserve part of the famed forested lake region along Minnesota's northern border. This highly inspirational and historic route of the FrenchCanadian voyageurs of the seventeenth and eighteenth centuries is one of the few remaining places in the country that really deserve addition to the national park system.

title: DENVER SUIT SCORES EASED ABORTION LAW
description: DENVER, July 3Six Denver lawyers, one of them the chief sponsor of Colorado's liberalized abortion law, filed suit yesterday in Federal District Court asking that the law be declared unconstitutional.

title: Beame Says City Administrator Should Do Work of Consultants
description: City Controller Abraham D. Beame said yesterday that the city could save substantially on outside consultants by returning to the City Administrator's office the responsibility for making management studies.

title: Bank of Japan Sees Halt To Sustained Price Rises
description: TOKYO, July 3 (AP)The Bank of Japan reported today that there were clear signs in June indicating a halt in the sustained climb of Japan's wholesale prices.

title: General Tire in Accord
description: AKRON, Ohio, July 3 (AP)The General Tire & Rubber Company and the United Rubber Workers union reached tentative agreement on a new threeyear contract. The contract covers 4,000 union members at plants in Akron and Waco, Tex.

title: MAYOR MAY LIMIT 5TH AVE, CLOSINGS
description: Heeding the outcry from Fifth Avenue merchants, Mayor Lindsay formally confirmed yesterday that closing the avenue to vehicular traffic on Saturdays might be limited to July 11 and 18.

title: Soviet Eye Doctor Finds Forms For Aid Take Time Here, Too
description: A Russian doctor has been struck by the similarities between the bureaucracyenmeshed Soviet physician and his American counterpart who spends much of his time filling out forms for research grants from private and public agencies.

title: Prime Minister Heath and Princesses Watch Women's Wimbledon Final
RESEARCHERS CUT LINK TO STANFORD
description: MENLO PARK, Calif.  A young physicist was explaining something called magnetic levitation, or maglev, a concept that calls for the use of superconducting magnets to operate highspeed trains. A smile crossed his face, and he reached into his desk for a printed card that read: Maglev, Not War.

title: Town in Canada Awaits New Railroad
description: FORT NELSON, British Columbia  When American G.I.'s pushed the Alaska Highway through the thick forests of British Columbia during World War II, Fort Nelson was little more than river furtrading post.

title: Pompidou Upholds Brandt on East
description: BONN, July 3President Pompidou today endorsed the attempts made by Chancellor Willy Brandt to reach accords with the Communist countries of Eastern Europe.

title: 3 Killed by Live Wire
description: LAEGER, W. Va., July 3 (AP) A Short Ridge, W. Va., woman and her two daughters were electrocuted near here last night when their car stopped on a high voltage power line felled by lightning. The State Police said Mrs. Sarah Short, 42 years old, and her daughters, Darlene, S. and Mary Gale, 20, (lied when they got out of the vehicle to investigate.

title: Egyptians Indignant at Nixon Remark on Arab Aims
description: CAIRO, July 3  Egyptians reacted with indignation and apprehension today to a remark by President Nixon that the Arabs still aspired to drive Israel into the sea.

title: U.S. Wrestling Hopes Are High In World Meet Starting Today
description: EDMONTON, Alberta, July 3 (AP)The United States is expected to be among the top three in the freestyle competit:on and could be one of the surprise teams in the Greco Roman events of the world amateur wrestling championships that start tomorrow

title: In Cambodia, Gloom Returns After the U.S. Pullout
description: PNOMPENH, Cambodia, July 3  With all United States troops withdrawn from Cambodia, highly placed Cambodians in private conversations are returning to a mood of gloom about the North Vietnamese and Vietcong invasion.

title: Portuguese Recall Envoy After Pope Sees Africa Rebels
description: ROME, July 3Portugal recalled her Ambassador to the Vatican today in protest against an audience that Pope Paul VI granted to three leaders of liberation movements in Portugal's African territories.

title: ROGERS AND THAI CLASH IN MANILA
description: MANILA, July 3The United States and Thailand clashed here today over the Thais bitter attacks on members of the United States Senate and the reluctance of Thailand to provide troops to Cambodia without a United States guarantee to finance them

title: Losing Candidate Seeking New Lower East Side Vote
description: A criminal lawyer who lost the Democratic primary for Assemblyman by 57 votes on the lower East Side said yesterday that he had obtained a show cause order that he hoped would force a new contest in the 60th Assembly District.

title: Topics: Reflections on Independence Day
description: On the 194th Independence Day, these reflections crowd to the forefront of our new times:

title: Elisabeth Ellis Wed in Suburbs To Joseph Pirri
description: RIDGEFIELD, Conn., July Miss Elisabeth Sterry Ellis, a descendant of Myles Standish, was married here this afternoon to Joseph Interlandi Pirri. The Rev. Aaron Manderbach performed the ceremony in St. Stephens Episcopal Church.

title: DISTINCTIVE WINS BY NOSE IN JERSEY
description: OCEANPORT, N. J., July 3 (AP)Herbert Allen's Distinctive scored a finalstride victory by a nose over Tearing Around in the $27,775 Rumson Handican at Monmouth Park today.

title: Helen Moore Is Bride
description: BIRMINGHAM, Ala., July 3 Miss Helen Sherry Moore of Darien, Conn., and Lloyd Reed Wilson of Birmingham were married here this afternoon in Canterbury United Methodist Church by the Rev. Alan Montgomery. The bride is the daughter of Hugh Grady Moore of Darien, Conn regional manager of Chevrolet Motor Division of General Motors, and of Mrs. Moore. The bridegroom is the son of Dr. Charles Henry Wilson, an orthopedic surgeon and chief of staff at St. Vincent's Hospital in Birmingham, and Mrs. Wilson.

title: A Feminine Touch at Rakes Boutique
description: In the last few years, any number of women's degigners have tried their hands at men's clothes.. Arnold de Vignier Copper is reversing the process.

title: CarlosMaria Velazquez; Uruguayan Envoy Was 52
description: LONDON, July 3 (UPI)CarlosMaria Velazquez, Uruguayan Ambassador to the Soviet Union and former head of the Uruguay mission to the United Nations, collapsed and died of a heart attack today in a hotel here. He was 52 years old. An embassy spokesman said Dr. Velazquez, his wife and seven children were en route to Spain for a vacation.

title: MAILERS SAY WRIT MAY BRING STRIKE
description: The president of Mailers Union No. 6 warned yesterday that a court move by The Long Island Press aimed at blocking further shop meetings or slowdowns might precipitate a strike in the continuing newspaper dispute.

title: A Soviet Report Condemns Mismanagement of F arms
description: MOSCOW, July 3The Central Committee of the Communist party approved a report today condemning mismanagement in Soviet agriculture, admitting food supplies were inadequate and promising increased production of grains, meat, vegetables and other foods.

title: Catholic Church in Ireland Removes Friday Meat Ban
description: DUBLIN, July 3 (AP)The Roman Catholic Church in Ireland removed the ban against eating meat on Friday today and said members may now eat meat every day except Ash Wednesday and Good Friday.

title: Hanoi Terms the Naming Of Bruce a Correction
description: HONG KONG, July 3 (Reuters)  The North Vietnamese Foreign Minister, Nguyen Duy Trinh, said today that the appointment of David K. E. Bruce as the new United States negotiator at the Paris peace talks was a correction of America's previous attitude toward the negotiations.

title: Article 5  No Title
Volkswagen to Build Sedan With FrontWheel Drive
description: BONN, July 3The Volkswagen Company announced today a clear break with traditiona new model car equipped with a frontwheel drive and watercooled engine.

title: MRS. DAVID C. BEVAN
description: GLADWIN, Pa., July 3Mrs. Mary Heist Bevan, wife of David C. Bevan, chairman of the finance committee of the Penn Central Company, died here today. She was 60 years old.

title: New Books
description: A Clearing in the Fog, by Dania Macomber (World, $5.95). The effect a missing woman has on the lives of five people.

title: Audrey L. Stier Is Wed To Donald J. Adams
description: CROTON ON HUDSON, N. Y., July 3Miss Audrey Lois Stier and Donald Jeremy Adams were married here today in a ceremony performed by Rabbi Michael A. Robinson at the bridegroom's home.

title: CANADA RESERVES CONTINUE TO RISE
description: OTTAWA, July 3Canada's foreign exchange reserves continued to rise in June even though the Government has allowed the Canadian dollar to float freely in foreign exchange trading since June 1.

title: NICOLA ZIROLI
description: URBANA, Ill., July 3 (UPI)Nicola Ziroli, a painter and a professor of art at the University of Illinois, died Wednesday at Mercy Hospital here. He was 62 years old.

title: 9 Guerrillas Reported Killed
description: TEL AVIV, July 3An Israeli spokesman announced today that nine Arab guerrillas who had crossed the Jordan River on a sabotage mission in the Israelioccupied west bank were killed last night.

title: British Jet Carrying 112 Is Hunted at Sea off Spain
description: BARCELONA, Spain, Saturday, July 4A chartered British airliner with 112 aboard, including 105 vacationers going to the Costa Brava resort area of Spain, was believed to have crashed in the sea off the coastal village of Mataro 18 miles northeast of here, last night.

title: Police in St. Louis Revoke Curb on News Information
description: ST. LOUIS, July 3 (UPI)The St. Louis County Police Department has dropped its controversial news guidelines under criticism from news media.

title: Father's Life Saved As Son Cuts Live Wire
description: ELIZABETHTOWN, Ky., July 3 (AP)Leroy Miller, Charles Sherrard and Mr. Sherrard's 17yearold son, Larry, were standing in an alley today fighting a fire at a downtown store.

title: Skylab: Bridge To Future
description: When two Soviet cosmonauts spent 18 days last month orbiting the earth exceeding by four days the fiveyearold American record  the feat served to revive criticism in American scientific circles that the United States program did not provide for enough scientific research in space, particularly on the medical effects of long space flights. Last week the National Aeronautics and Space Administration announced plans to rectify that lack.

title: Gail M. Thomas Plans Marriage
description: DARIEN, Conn., July 3Mr. and Mrs. Zolton Thomas of Darien have announced the engagement of their daughter, Miss Gail Marcia Thomas to Sidney Bishop Congdon 3d, son of Mr. and Mrs. Congdon Jr., also of Darien. The wedding is planned for Aug. 8 in St. Luke's Episcopal Church here.

title: The Papers of George Mason
description: The winter of 1771 was a hard one in Virginia. On Feb. 17, George Mason of Gunton Hall sat down and wrote an angry letter to one Alexander Henderson, a justice of the peace for Fairfax County: There has been such shameful Havock made of the Deer during this Snow, when the poor Creatures cou'd not get out of any Body's Way, that I hope the Magistrates & Gentlemen of the County will think it their Duty to make an Example of the Offenders. There followed a list of 16 men, with the number of deer each had illegally killed, together with Mason's calculation that the county might take in 200 in fines if the Magistrates will exert themselves properly.

title: The Promise of Skin Beauty from Lemons
description: The beautifying proper ties of lemons have been recognized for centuries.
