Both the United Federation of Teachers and the school's own local governing board had become so obsessed with each other's adversary position that they seemed locked, almost against their will, into a power struggle that made the children pawns between the battle lines. During this academic year that has now drawn to a close, however, it is clear to objective outside ob servers that I.S. 201 has moved from a state of turmoil to an atmosphere of cooperation and optimism.

title: Seminary to Turn From Academic to Urban Work
description: New York Theological Sem inary, faced with financial dis aster, has decided to suspend its traditional degreegranting curriculums in favor of oneyear specialized training pro grams for the inner city min istry.

title: 15 MORE CAB DRIVERS HELD UP OVER CITY
description: Fifteen more taxi drivers re ported being held up yesterday, making a total of 28 through out the city since Friday night. Two men were killed in the robberies.

title: Whittier Eager to Be Site of Nixon LibraryMuseum
description: WHITTIER, Calif.An Egyp tian pharaoh had his pyramid and an American President has his memorial library and mu seum. Whittier is campaigning to give its hometown boy who made it to the topRichard Milhous Nixon  whatever im mortality concrete and steel can provide.

title: Election and the Court
description: WASHINGTON, July 5In his new book, The Hidden Crisis in American Politics, published last week, Samuel Lubell argues that the key to President Nix on's Southern strategythat is, the key to persuading South erners to vote for him and not for George C. Wallace in 1972Is found in Mr. Nixon's at titude toward the Supreme Court. The one battle most white South erners feel they are fighting is with the Court, writes Mr. Lubell, an analyst of voting pat terns, and Nixon has effec tively identified himself with that cause. Only Nixon can change the makeup of the Court to satisfy Southern as pirations.

title: Marine Union Elects Head
description: Albert Parente has been elected president of the Brother hood of Marine Officers, a 700 member union of deck and engi neer officers. Other officers chosen last week were Dennis A. Roland, secretarytreasurer, and John J. Gardella and Harold A. Browski, both vice presi dents. Mr. Parente succeeds E. Joseph Farr who has retired after heading the union for 30 years.

title: Mary Ellis Carrere Is Affianced To George Hasseltine, Geologist
description: NEW ORLEANS, July 5Miss Mary Ellis Carrre a computer programer with the Shell Oil Company here, and George Howard Hasseltine, a geologist with the Mobile Oil Company, also in New Or leans, have made plans to be married here Aug. 29.

title: Canada's Largest Airline
description: MONTREAL, July 5Twenty two of the crash victims were employes of the airline or members of their families, traveling on company passes. Such passes are known in the trade as con passes  con tingent on space available and valid only providing that no paying passenger is deprived of a seat.

title: Police to Lecture on Litter
description: BOSTON. July 5 (AP) Weary motorists may soon be approached by Massachusetts state policemen for a chat about littering. As part of a crackdown on highway litter ing, state troopers will stop at roadside rest areas to talk with motorists about the prob lems and penalties of littering.

title: City Is Mixed Blessing To Young Businessmen
description: To the young businessman, New York means something entirely different from what it does to an artist.

title: Israel Reports Plane Lost
description: JERUSALEM, July 5Israel announced today the loss of a plane to ground fire in the course of a daylong attack on Egyptian guidedmissile sites and artillery along the Suez Canal.

title: POLES CRUSH STARS IN SOCCER, 7 TO 1
description: HEMPSTEAD, L. I., July 5Ruch Churzow, the second best soccer team in Poland this year, routed the New York AllStars, 71, at Hostra Sta dium tonight before 3,427 fans who paid about $9,000. The proceeds will go to Rudy Lamonica, a young soccer player who lost his right leg last April as a result of cancer.

title: NATO Termed Vulnerable in North
description: KOLSAS, Norway, July 1Commanders and planners at North Atlantic alliance head quarters here stressed today the vulnerability to Soviet at tack of the alliance's northern flank.

title: Bach Society Meets Today
description: The International Bach So ciety, founded and directed by Rosalyn Tureck, will open its fourth annual congress at 6 P. M. today in the Library of the Performing Arts auditor ium in Lincoln Center. The congress will meet for lectures and performances Mondays through Thursdays for three weeks.

title: Personal Finance: Combating Inflation
description: Everybody talks about in flation, but very few people know exactly what to do about it.

title: Cayne Wins Star Sailing
description: Gerard Cayne sailed Lily IV to victory in all three races and won the Hoxsie Trophy in the Star Class regatta at City Island yesterday.

title: Proxmire Scores Pentagon's Electronic Detector
description: WASHINGTON, July 5 (AP)Senator William Proxmire as serted today that the Pentagon has spent more than $2billion so far for a still secret electron ic detection system that cannot tell the difference between en emy soldiers and innocent civil ians.

title: West Virginia Representative Tells of 11Year Struggle, Still Going On, to Cut Pollution at Power Plant
description: WASHINGTON, July 5When the smog covers the sun. said Representative Ken Hechler of West Virginia the other day, you have one way of telling it's morning  the birds start coughing.

title: Highway Incident Reflects Hostility of Indochina Allies
description: ON ROUTE 5, Cambodia, July 3The South Vietnam ese soldiers crouched in the grass on the side of the road, aiming their rifles and a ma chine gun at the Cambodians clustered at a checkpoint only a few feet from them. For more than 10 minutes, the Vietnamese kept their galls trained on the other men.

title: LINVILLE'S BEAST TAKES Y.R.A. SAIL
description: MAMARONECK, N. Y., July 5 A fading westerly stranded 109 boats of the Yacht Racing Association's record fleet of 156 on Long Island Sound today. The 47 finishers represented three of the 12 classes that sailed under the Orienta Beach and Yacht Club.

title: TUGOFWAR AIMS TO END OLD FEUD
description: SCHENECTADY, N.Y., July 5 A tugofwar here today be tween 300 men from two sub urban towns designed to settle a 150yearold argument drama tized by an undisputed fact of modern life: the Mohawk River needs cleaning up.

title: L. ROBERT FINVER
description: SOUTH ORANGE, N.J., July 5L. Robert Finver, vice presi dent and regional sales manager for Supervisor Investor Ser vices, Inc., a Chicagobased mu tual fund, died at his home here today. He was 39 years old.

title: State of the Labor Market
description: The Labor Department has reported a drop in the seasonally adjusted unemployment rate from 5 per cent in May to 4.7 per cent in Junebut has empha sized that this implies no essential change in the underlying employment situation. In fact, there are reasons for concern that the job market actually worsened in June rather than improved.

title: Brooklyn Boy Is Killed By Firecracker Blast
description: A 16 year old boy was fatally injured Saturday night while setting off fireworks near his home in the Bay Ridge section of Brooklyn.

title: Saijo Retains Title, Beating Crawford In 15Round Fight
description: SENDAI, Japan, July 5 (AP)  Shozo Saijo of Japan re covered from a firstround knockdown and scored a ma jority 15round decision over Frankie Crawford of Los An geles tonight Saijo retained his World Boxing Association Featherweight crown.

title: City Gets Dr. Mead To Aid on Conduct In Housing Projects
description: The city's Housing Authority, concerned about the relations between its staff and its tenants and about vandalism in housing projects, recently sought the advice of Dr. Margaret Mead, the anthropologist, and now plans to distribute Dr. Mead's comments among staff mem bers.

title: Keino Wins 2Mile Run
description: LONDON, July 5 (AP)  Kip choge Keino, Kenya's Olympic gold medal winner, won a two mile race in 8 minutes 29 sec onds in a prep for the Common wealth Gaines at Edinburgh, Scotland, starting on July 16.

title: DONNYBROOK CAPS TRANSAM EVENT
description: BRAINERD, Minn., July 5A Trans American race ended here today with a swinging of fists, a great deal of pushing by participants and peacemak ers and a formal protest by the runnerup, George Follmer of Arcadia, Calif.

title: BOND MEN EXPECT RATE DIP TO GO ON
description: Interest rates are still headed downward.

title: Behind Nixon's Policy on War: Fear Not of the Left but of the Right
description: SAN CLEMENTE, Calif., July 5As President Nixon pointed out on television the other night, only history can judge the effectiveness of what he has done in Cambodia.

title: Blacks Within the System Gloomy Despite Progress
description: There has been some prog ress, yes, but there is more resistance to Negro aspirations today than at any time in re cent history, said Gloster B. Current, director of field ad ministration for the N.A.A.C.P.'s 1,700 branches across the country.

title: Elizabeth, in Canadian Arctic, Is Welcomed by 1,200 Eskimos
description: FROBISHER BAY, North west Territories, July 5 Queen Elizabeth II greeted her Eskimo subjects here today at the beginning of the first royal tour of the Canadian Arctic.

title: Hijacked Plane in Cuba
description: RIO DE JANIERO, July 5 (UPI)A spokesman for the Brazilian airline Cruzeiro do Sul said today that a plane that was hijacked yesterday with 60 per sons aboard arrived today at the airfield of Santiago de Cuba. Passengers were allowed to leave the plane at stopovers in Cayenne, French Guiana, and Georgetown, Guyana.

title: Cambodian Tribunal Condemns Sihanouk to Death in Absentia
description: PNOMPENH, Cambodia, July 5  A Cambodian military tribunal, trying Prince Noro dom Sihanouk in absentia on charges of treason and corrup tion, today condemned the de posed Chief of State to death by firing squad.

title: LIBYANS TAKE OVER 4 OIL DISTRIBUTORS
description: TRIPOLI, Libya, July 5 (AP)  The Libyan revolutionary Government nationalized all four oildistributing companies in the country last night. But oil production, controlled by some 30 big foreign companies, was not affected.

title: HUNTER TITLE WON BY MARK MY WORDS
description: NEW CANAAN, Conn., July 5Karen Timberman, who was injured in a spill some months ago, rade Mark My Words to the junior working hunter championship at the New Ca naan Bridle Path Association horse show today.

title: City Continues to Be Mecca for Artists
description: Dennis Rocjan studies at the Columbia University School of Pharmacy and works in the drugstore in St. Clare's Hospital. But phar macy is not what lured this strapping, 21yearold youth here last year from Camp bell. Calif.

title: 108 DIE IN CRASH OF CANADIAN JET; MANY FROM U.S.
description: TORONTO, July 5An Air Canada DC8 plane crashed while trying to land at Toronto International Airport this morn ing after two of its four jet en gines had fallen off. All 108 persons aboard were killed.

title: Roundup: Cubs Get Draw In Battle but Lose Game
description: Leo Durocher gave away six inches and 37 years to Dock Ellis yesterday, but Durocher had his equalizerhis lip. A fervent argument Between the pair started a twoteam freeforall as Du rocher's Cubs bowed at Chi cago to the Pittsburgh Pi rates, 52, and sank to fourth place in the National League's Eastern Division.

title: Susan Nichols, Fabrics Editor, Engaged to Wed
description: BUFFALO. July 5Mr. and Mrs. Stephen Otis Nichols have announced the engage ment of their daughter. Miss Susan Wilma Nichols, to Roger Carl Schumacher, son of Mr. and Mrs. Carl Henry Schumacher. The wedding is Planned for October.

title: F.T.C. Considers Regulation Requiring Cigarette Ads to List Tar and Nicotine Ratings
description: WASHINGTON, July 5 The Federal Trade Commission has quietly taken the first step toward promulgating a regula tion requiring the listing of tar and nicotine ratings in cigar ette advertisements.

title: FELTON G. CLARK, NEGRO EDUCATOR
description: BATON ROUGE, La., July 5Dr. Felton G. Clark, retired president of Southern Univer sity, one of the nation's leading black educators and a contro versial figure in early efforts to integrate lunch counters in Louisiana, died today at the Ochsner Foundation Hospital in New Orleans. He was 66 years old.

title: Television
description: Morning

title: Coast Motorcyclist Dies
description: FREEPORT, III., July 5 (AP)Clarence Felton, 31 years old, of Glendale, Calif., died yester day in a pileup during a motor cycle race at Freeport Raceway.

title: FRISELLA HELPS KOOSMAN WIN 5TH
description: PHILADELPHIA, July 5The Mets, protecting a precarious lead in the National League's Eastern Division, wobbled to a 54 victory over the Phillies to day at Connie Mack Stadium. It was their third straight tri umph in a fivegame series after losing two games to the Phils on Thursday night.

title: Britain's European Bid
description: Britain's third effort in nine years to enter Europe's sixnation Common Market takes the world, not just Europe, to the threshold of fundamental change. What is at stake in the negotiations that opened in Luxem bourg last week is far more than a new trading arrangement. Success would create a tennation union of 250 million people with an annual output of $550 billion, larger than that of the U.S.S.R. and second only to that of the United States. It would mean a Third Giant on the world scene, not only in economic terms but, ultimately, in politics, diplomacy and defense.

title: HUSAK DELIVERS ATTACK ON DUBCEK
description: PRAGUE, July 5 (Reuters)Gustav Husak, First Secretary of the Czechoslovak Commun ist party, today delivered his first personal attack on Alex ander Dubcek, his predecessor as party leader, accusing Mr. Dubcek of having led the coun try to the brink of disaster.

title: Ruth Rubin Bride Of Marshall Gluck
description: Miss Ruth Rubin, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Moses Rubin of Kings Point, L. I., was mar ried here yesterday afternoon to Marshall Jay Gluck, son of Mr. and Mrs. Benjamin Gluck of Long Beach, L. I. Rabbi Mordecai Waxman performed the ceremony at the St. Regis Sheraton Roof.

title: DAVID SAPERTON, CONCERT PIANIST
description: BALTIMORE, July 5David Saperton, a concert pianist and teacher, died today at Johns Hopkins Hospital. He was 80 years old and lived at 344 West 72d Street in New York.

title: SEATTLE PRO'S 67 CAPS LATE SPURT
description: LONDON, Ontario, July 5Kermit Zarley no longer objects to being called, the pro from the moon. Bob Hope, the comedian, gave him that desig nation after Zarley won the 1968 Kaiser open in Napa, Calif.

title: VICTOR BY STROKE ON A 77 FOR 287
description: MUSKOGEE, Okla., July 5 (AP)Donna Caponi's four foot putt on the final hole gave her a second straight United States women's open folf cham pionship by one stroke over Sandra Spuzich and Sandra Havnie today.

title: GREEK PAPER ASSAILS TIMES FOR EDITORIAL
description: ATHENS, July 5Nea Poli teia, an Athens newspaper that often reflects the thinking of the militarybacked Govern ment, today sharply criticized a recent editorial in The New York Times on United States arms aid to Greece.

title: The Coming Change of Generations in the Kremlin
description: Like other communities where news is tightly controlled, Mos cow tends to have many and interesting rumors. It's not sur prising, therefore, that last weekend's Tass announcement of Leonid I. Brezhnev's ca tarrhal ailment stirred up in stant reports that he is seriously ill, and that major changes are imminent in the Kremlin ruling group.

title: JOINT PLEA TO AID CAMBODIA IS MADE BY U.S. AND SAIGON
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, July 5The United States and South Vietnam joined today in ap pealing to their allies in the Indochina war to provide urgent aid to Cambodia.

title: Philippines Not At Parley
description: MANILA, July 5  For the first time since 1966, the Philip pines is not attending the an nual Vietnam allies conference in Saigon.

title: New Bowl Keeps Food Cold
description: What could be more pleas antly useful on a hot sum mer day than a big bowl that would keep its contents cold even when far from a re frigerator or an electrical outlet?

title: SUMMER DEMAND IN STEEL LAGGING
description: PITTSBURGH, July 5Steel producers report sluggish sum mer demand but the promise of a busy winter.

title: Explosions Damage 36 School Buses In Eastern Texas
description: LONGVIEW, Tex., July 5 (UPI)Two dozen bombs ex ploded simultaneously in a school district maintenance yard late last night, damaging 36 school buses parked there for the summer.

title: The Theater: Charley's Aunt Returns
Letters to the Editor of The Times
description: To the Editor:

title: KY TIES FREE VOTE TO COALITION RULE
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam Monday, July 6Vice President Nguyen Cao Ky said during the weekend that antiCommunists in South Vietnam would accept a coalition government with the Communists if it were the re sult of free elections.

title: GRANTS WILL AID POLLUTION STUDY
description: The Ford Foundation an nounced grants of $2.2million yesterday to combat environ mental problems ranging from garbage disposal to noise abate ment.

title: 25 See Queens Man Drown
description: AMITYVILLE, L. I., July 5A 32yearold man drowned in a backyard pool here yesterday. as 25 onlookers stood nearby, assuming that, although he was known to be a poor swim mer, his splashing was a form of water play. Julius Gresham, of 10915 Merrick Boulevard. St. Albans, Queens, jumped into the deep end of the pool at 796 Clocks Boulevard. West Amityville, during a gathering of friends for a barbecue. When Mr. Gresham finally sank to the bottom, a neighbor pulled him from the pool.

title: Article 1  No Title
Sports Today
description: BASEBALL

title: Berlin Film Fete Is Broken Off In Rift Over Movie on Vietnam
description: BERLIN, July 5 (Reuters)The Berlin Film Festival was broken off today following a dispute over the jury's opposition to a film showing the rape and mur der of a Vietnamese girl by American soldiers.

title: Books of The Times
description: These two novels go nicely together. Irvin Faust's is emotional, highly charged, full of tomorrow's headlines: militant young people taking on the Establishment; law andorder policemen who take extralegal precautions to protect society from the kids, a modified backtoAfrica movement that finds its inspiration in the history of the Zulus, other assorted city dwellers and the city itself. There is a grand finale, in which part of the city goes up in smoke, with the hero, Stanley Patton Buchta, who has just escaped from the burning, taking in the sight from a distance with a pair of field glasses. Is Mr. Faust trying to tell us something?

title: Mortality Rates Higher for Indians
description: OTTAWA  A baby born on a Canadian Indian Reserve has less than half the chance for survival that a typical white Canadian baby has.

title: Member Nations of E.F.T.A. Set Record for Trade in April
description: GENEVA, July 5Trade be tween the member nations of the European Free Trade As sociation in April exceeded the monthly total of $1billion for the first time.

title: State Aides Urge Youth Involvement In Drug Programs
description: Two education officials yes terday urged increased involve ment of youths in planning and offering educational programs to combat the spread of drug use.

title: CITY FILLS NEW POST ON TRANSIT PLANNING
description: A Federal specialist on new urban mass transportation sys tems has been appointed by the City Planning Commis sion to the newly created post of director of transportation and regional planning. He is 33yearold Dick G. Lam.

title: Postal Reform: Last Hurdles
description: Reform of the American mail service survived one more ordeal last week when the Senate passed its version of the Post Office reorganization bill. Two, possibly three, barriers remain to be hurdled before the country can hope to have a postal system efficient enough to get letters regularly from New York to Philadelphia overnight.

title: Greene and Silvester Win In Track at Rotterdam
description: ROTTERDAM, the Nether lands, July 5 (Reuters)Charlic Greene and Joy Silvester, world record holders from the United States, sparkled today at an in ternational invitation track and field meet.

title: Bridge:
MLAIN IS BEATEN BY ORIOLES, 2 TO 0
description: BALTIMORE, July 5 (AP)Boog Powell drove in two runs with a badhop single and a sacrifice fly as the Baltimore Orioles beat the Detroit Tigers and Denny McLain, 20, today. Jim Palmer pitched a threehit ter for the victory.

title: Talent Is the First Step For a Moiseyev Dancer
description: Those Ukrainian peasants and Adzhar warriors leaping across the Met stage tomor row night, when the Moiseyev Dance Company opens a threeweek run, may be city bred subway straphangers like the rest of us.

title: P.B.A. Asks Delay in Civilian Inquiry on Police
description: The head of the Patrolmen's Benevolent Association said yesterday that a special com mission scheduled to begin an investigation into charges of police corruption today should defer action until its legality had been decided.

title: News Summary and Index
description: South Vietnam and the United States ap pealed yesterday to Thailand, South Korea, Australia and New Zealand to help the Cam bodia regime of Premier Lon Nol. There was no immediate response from the representa tives of those nations meeting in the Allied Nations Ministerial Conference in Saigon. [Page 1, Column 8.]

title: 2 Pilots Rescued From Peak
description: HAMILTON AIR FORCE BASE, Calif., July 5 (UPI)Two Marine Corps pilots were res cued by a National Park Service helicopter today from the snowcovered peak of 11,000 foot Mammoth Mountain in the Sierras, where they had spent the night after bailing out of their crippled plane. The fliers, whose names were withheld by the military authorities, appar ently were uninjured.

title: MEXICANS CHOOSE A NEW PRESIDENT
description: MEXICO CITY, Monday, July 6Mexicans voted for a new President and Chamber of Dep uties yesterday and Luis Eche verria Alvarez, the candidate of the governing Revolutionary Institutional party, claimed vic tory three and a half hours after the polls closed.

title: Maye Charges Vast Peril in Shifting of Firemen
description: The president of the Uni formed Firefighters Association charged yesterday that the Fire Department was endangering vast areas of Queens, Staten Island and lower Manhattan by taking firemen and equipment from them to supply highhaz ard ghetto neighborhoods like Brownsville and Harlem.

title: Startling Abuse of Drugs Is Found in Business World
description: Drug abuse in the business world has increased to a star tling extent and has become an ominously growing problem, the New York Chamber of Com merce said in a report released yesterday.

title: International Loans Listed for Week
description: WASHINGTON, July 5The following is a list of loans and other aid extended last week by United States and other international lending agencies here:

title: Fulbright Denounces Agnew as an Upstart
description: WASHINGTON, July 5 (AP)Senator J. W. Ful bright, Democrat of Arkan sas, said today that Vice President Agnew inspired some people to radical actions, and he called Mr. Agnew 'an upstart man.

title: Life Asks Nixon to Announce Plan to Quit Vietnam in 71
description: Life magazine called on President Nixon yesterday to announce publicly that a total military withdrawal froth Viet nam would be completed by the end of 1971.

title: Eva Cline Betrothed To Paul H. Freeman
description: SOUTHFIELD, Mich., July 5 Mr. and Mrs. Stephen Cline have announced the en gagement of their daughter, Miss Eva Susan Cline. to Paul Harvey Freeman, son of Mr. and Mrs. Jules Freeman of Miami, formerly of New Hyde Park, L. I. The wedding will take place here Aug. 15.

title: WATERFRONT UNIT ASKS NEW POWER TO CUT PIER THEFT
description: The Waterfront Commission sharply criticized the shipping industry yesterday for deplor ably inadequate efforts to pre vent theft and pilferage from the $20billion in general cargo handled annually on the piers of New York harbor.

title: Front Page 1  No Title
Ballet Theater Stars New Teams in Two Works
description: Basically, there are only two stories that are told in classic ballet; one is boy gets girl and the other is boy loses girl. Over the weekend, the American Ballet Theater presented ex amples of both at the State Theater. On Saturday evening, Lupe Serrano and Royes Fer nandez were lovers in Swan Lake and on Sunday evening, Eleanor D'Antuono and Ted Kivitt shared the tragic fate of Giselle.

title: Chess:
A CABINET CRISIS IS FEARED IN ITALY
description: ROME, July 5Pressure on Premier Mariano Rumor's Gov ernment increased over the weekend to a point where Italian politicians spoke of the possibility of a Cabinet crisis.

title: Im Nasty Scores Twice in Hunters At Newbury Shou
description: NEWBURY, Mass., July 5Sherry Greenberg's I'm Nasty from the Rock Bottom Farms of Lagrangeville, N. Y., was a double winner today as the Ould Newbury horse show wound up four days of com petition here.

title: World Hurdle Mark Tied
description: BERLIN, July 5 (UPI)  An nelie Jahns of East Germany tied the world record and set a European mark in the women's 200meter hurdles today at an East German track and field championships meet in Erfurt. She was clocked in 25.8 sec onds, equaling the time of Pam Kilborn of Australia.

title: British Abandon Ships Locked in Suez Canal
description: CAIRO, July 5 (Reuters)The last of the British crews of four ships stranded in the Suez Canal's Great Bitter Lake since the 1967 Arab Israeli war abandoned the vessels and flew home today.

title: Mahler, Bernstein and Ozawa Attract 22,489 to Tangle wood
description: LENOX, Mass., July 5Brooding skies that threat ened rain but did not deliver it did little to discourage at tendance at the opening week end of the annual music fes tival at Tanglewood in the Berkshire Hills. The paid ad missions were 22,489, about 1,650 over last year's total.

title: Jerry Nusbaum, Columnist For Newark StarLedger, 86
description: NEWARK, July 5Jerry Nus baum, a longtime columnist for The Newark StarLedger, died today. He was 86 years old.

title: PANAMA CANAL SETS NEW USAGE RECORDS
description: BALBOA HEIGHTS. C. Z., July 5  Increasing coal ship ments from Hampton Roads, Va., to Japan helped set new records in tolls, cargo tonnage and ship transits through the Panama Canal during the year ended June 30.

title: KNOWLES RECORDS 17TH, 18TH SAVES
description: Just when the New York Yankees hoped to be at their best, they were at their worst.

title: American Universities Urged to Stop Proliferation of Incompatible Degrees and Adopt Unified System
description: CAMBRIDGE, Mass., July 5  American universities have been urged to unify and sim plify academic degrees in a report prepared for the Car negie Commission on Higher Education. The report, written by Dean Stephen H. Spurr of the University of Michigan, found the proliferation of in compatible degree structures unhealthy.

title: 2 African Teams in Peking
description: TOKYO, July 5 (UPI)Two Government delegations from Tanzania and Zambia arrived in Peking today aboard a special plane for a visit to Communist China, Hsinhua, the Chinese press agency, reported.

title: Wembley Cricket Victor
description: The Wembley Cricket Club defeated the Staten Island C. C. by 48 runs yesterday at Wal ker Park, S. I. Wembley scored 122 and the losers 74.

title: Market Slide: Most Who Depend on Stock Income Hurt
description: LOS ANGELES, July 5A 38yearold engineer at the Lockheed Aircraft Corporation here planned to use his profit from his 300 shares of Lock heed stock as a stake to open a law practice. But the 19month long bear market has ruined his plan.

title: Bunk Bed for Saving Space
description: That bunk trundle bed in bright red lacquer, which dramatizes a mirrored room on Bloomingdale's fifth floor, offers handsome sleeping ac commodations for threeone each in the upper and lower sections and one in the trun dle that pulls out like a drawer at the base. The Ital ian design ($475), altnough most practical for chil dren's rooms, is sophisticated enough to be at home in adult quarters, too. Anything but juvenile are the bed's rounded contours, brass accents and wood pulls on the trundle (a drawer that might double for toy or clothing storage if not used as a bed). Most of the de signs in the store's refur bished model rooms are sale priced, but the bunk bed, be ing shown for the first time, is not.

title: About 150 Feared Drowned In India as Launch Capsizes
description: MASULIPATAM, India, July 5 (Reuters)  About 150 peo ple were feared drowned to day when a large launch cap sized in the Krishna River near this southern port town.

title: Power Failure Disrupts London Subway Service
description: LONDON, July 6 (AP) A power failure halted much of London's vast subway net work for an hour tonight, trapping 200,000 persons un derground in conditions of sweltering heat.

title: Markham J. Geller Will Marry Donna Margaret Hirsh in Fall
description: Miss Donna Margaret Hirsh and Markham J. Geller, 1970 graduates of Syracuse and Princeton Universities, respec tively, plan to be married in the fall.

title: MAILERS AT POST BAR DISTRIBUTION
description: Union mailers seeking to win contract gains from The New York Post prevented the news paper from distributing most of its editions yesterday.

title: Information Agency Film on Agnew Presents Him as Forthright and a Foe of Racial Discrimination
description: WASHINGTON, July 6The film starts with a slow pan of an airplane. It looks as if it's going to be a movie about airplanesone of those shiny documentaries that trace flight backward in color from a sparking jet lumbering out of its hanger to Icarus's wax wines.

title: Article 7  No Title
High Dublin Official Tours Belfast Riot Area Secretly
description: DUBLIN, July 6Dr. Patrick J. Hillery, the Irish Republic's Foreign Minister, disclosed here tonight that he went to Northern Ireland unannounced today to talk with residents in the riottorn Lower Falls Road area of Belfast.

title: BRITON IS AHEAD IN WORLD RIDING
description: LA BAULE, France, July 6 (UPI)Harvey Smith of Britain le the world jumping horse championships today after two of three aualifying trials.

title: American Express Develops Card Authorization Unit
description: The card division of the American Express Company has developed a new, multifunc tional automatic card author ??zation terminal that is said to make easier and more conven ??ent purchases at such outlets as hotels, restaurants, airlines, car rentals and shops that honor the American Express Card. Des ??gnated the Act I, the new unit processes special magnet callystriped cards through an automatic link with twin IBM System 360 computers at the card division's headquarters.

title: A Listing of New Books
description: GENERAL

title: Chief of Campus Unrest Study
description: WASHINGTON, July 6The career of William Mat thew Byrne Sr. is a tough act to follow.

title: Earnings at A. &
description: The Great Atlantic and Pa cific Tea Company, second in size to Sears, Roebuck & Co. among American retailers, re ported level earnings yesterday for the first fiscal quarter, end ed May 30, on a 3.6 per cent increase in sales.

title: Article 11  No Title
Dr. Gross, Rutgers President Since 1959, Retiring Next June
description: NEW BRUNSWICK, N. J., July 6Mason Welch Gross, presi dent of Rutgers, the State Uni versity, for the last 11 years, today announced his retirement from that post effective Sept. 1971.

title: City Aide's Concern Got Consulting Fees
description: A company headed by An drew P. Kerr received $212,000 in city managementconsultant contracts while Mr. Kerr served as the unpaid director of the project management staff of the city's Policy Planning Council.

title: City Off track Betting to Use Phones
description: Until they can get offtrack betting parlors into operation, pity officials will rely heavily Dn telephoned bets. The city hopes to raise about $50mi1 Lion during the first year of offtrack betting.EDMONTON, Alberta, July 6 (Canadian Press)Janos Var ga of Hungary won the world GrecoRoman amateur wrest ling title in the 125pound division today when he battled to a 22 draw with Rustem Kazakov of the Soviet Union, the defending champion.

title: Rogers Meets Cambodian Foreign Chief
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, July 6  The Cambodian For eign Minister, Koun Wick, flew to Saigon from Pnompenh for a hastily arranged visit today at the invitation of Secretary of State William P. Rogers. Dur ing his fivehour stay he sought to explain his Government's po litical, military and economic problems to allied leaders here.

title: Americans Find Brutality In South Vietnamese Jail
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, July 6  An American who visited South Vietnam's larg est civilian prison last Thurs day reported here today on what he described as the in human conditions and intimi dation existing there.

title: British Surprised
description: LONDON, July 6  British officials appeared flabbergasted late tonight by Dr. Hillery's trip to Belfast. They spoke guardedly, awaiting reaction, from their political leaders.

title: Captains Testify on Crash in Ambrose Channel
description: The masters of the fishing boat Tampa III and the freight er Mormacglen, which collided Saturday morning in fog shrouded Ambrose Channel, told the Coast Guard yesterday that neither heard the other's fog signal.

title: Heart Transplant Checkup
description: RICHMOND, July 6 (UPI)The world slongest living heart transplant recipient, Louis B. Russell Jr., is back in Richmond for routine tests at the Medical College of Virginia. He received as new heart Aug. 24, 1968. He returned yesterday and will re main two weeks for his regular sixmonth checkup. He is an Industrial arts teacher in In dianapolis.

title: Mrs. Arnold Cream Dies; Jersey Joe Walcott's Wife
description: CAMDEN, N. J., July 6 (AP) Mrs. Lydia Cream, wife of the former world heavyweight boxing champion, Jersey Joe Walcott, died at their home here Saturday. She was 54 years old.

title: Middletown Hospital to Get New Administration Wing
description: A new administration build ing is to be added to the Middletown State Hospital in Middletown, Orange County. which serves 3,000 mentally ill patients from Orange, Sullivan and Ulster Counties.

title: New Dean at City College
description: Oscar L. ChavarriaAguilar, chairman of the department of languages and linguistics at the University of Rochester, will become dean of liberal arts and sciences at City College of New York, effective next Feb. 1, Joseph Copeland, acting presi dent, has announced. Profes sor ChavarriaAguilar succeeds Sherburne F. Barber, who re signed as of Sept. 1 but will serve for an additional se mester.

title: Mrs. Ann E. Anable Is Remarried
description: BANCOCK, N. H., July 6Mrs. Ann English Anable and T. Gordon Hutchinson were married here this morn ing. The Rev. George Stewart performed the Presbyterian ceremony at the home of the bride's father, State Senator Robert English. The bride is the daughter also of Mrs. A. Grew English of Greenwich, Conn., and the granddaugh ter of the late Joseph C. Grew, the United States Am bassador to Japan.

title: Morgan Stanley &
description: Morgan Stanley & Co. an nounced yesterday that six new general partners have been ad mitted to the firm. The new partners, who bring the firm's total to 34, have also been elected managing directors of Morgan Stanley & Co., Inc., a senarate entity.

title: FILMS GET REPRIEVE AT BERLIN FESTIVAL
description: BERLIN, July 6 (UPI)Berlin Film Festival officials ruled today that movies still scheduled to be shown would be, even though a dispute over one about Vietnam ended the fes tival competition yesterday two days early.

title: Article 20  No Title
74 BY OSTROWSKI WINS GOLF MEDAL
description: ?? July 6  George Ostrowski, a 17yearold from the Glen Cove High School golf team, scored a 37, 3774 to win the medal in the Long Island Golf Associa tion junior championship at the Brookville Country Club today. Par for the 6,447yard course is ng 3672.

title: 4 Private Schools Will Merge Some Services
description: Four private secondary schools here announced agree ment yesterday to merge some of their academic and business operations in an effort to re duce costs, to eliminate dupli cation and to provide enriched Academic offrings.

title: INCOME INCREASES AT HANOVER BANK
description: The gradual if irregular trend toward lower interest rates in the money market may be benefiting bank earn ings, reports from major banks suggested yesterday.

title: MRS. PHILIP G. STRONG
description: WASHINGTON, July 6Mar got Berglind Strong, the wife of Brig. Gen. Philip G. Strong, U.S.M.C. retired, died here yes terday after a long illness. She was 66 years old and lived here.

title: Susan Harriet Weist to Be Wed
description: Mr. and Mrs. Edward C. WEst of New York have lade known the engagement of their daughter, Miss Susan Harriet Weist, to Philip Sim mons Douthit, son of Mr. and Mrs. Claude Douthit Jr. of Palm Beach, Fla., and Watch Hill. R. I.

title: A Lively Coast Theater Finds a Matching Audience
description: LOS ANGELESFollowing a dispute with Actors Equity, Gordon Davidson, artistic director of the Mark Taper Forum at the Los Angeles Music Center, recently post poned Harvey Perr's new play, Rosebloom. He sub stituted Paul Sills Story Theater. Some of Mr. David son's subscribers were out raged. We wanted to see Rosebloom,  insisted one.

title: Rogers Sees War Reduced
description: SAIGON, July 6 (AP)Secre tary Rogers said today that the level of the Vietnam war had been reduced and that this would be reflected in what he called very low American cas ualties for the last week. He said the reduction in casualties was in line with President Nix on's intentions for the two month incursion into Vietnam ese Communist sanctuaries in Cambodia.

title: Farley, Olympian, Named Princeton Swimming Coach
description: PRINCETON, N.J., July 6William W. Farley, former free style Olympian, was appointed head coach of swimming at Princeton University today.

title: A HEARING DENIED IN CONFLICT CASE
description: A request by a City Council man for a court hearing on con flictofinterest charges against Bruce A. Gimbel, president of the department store chain and a former member of the Metro politan Transportation Author ity, was denied yesterday by State Supreme Court Justice Isidore Dolinger.

title: Tour Agency's Difficulties Strand Youths in Europe
description: PARIS, July 6 (AP)United States Embassy officials said today that several thousand American students apparently were stranded in Paris, Rome, Geneva and Vienna by financial difficulties of the United States tour organization through which their trips had been booked.

title: Egypt Claims Israeli Jet
description: CAIRO, July 6 (Reuters)An Israeli Skyhawk jet fighter bomber was hit during a four hour raid on Egyptian positions in the central and northern sec tors of the Suez front tonight, a military spokesman said.

title: Ocean Hill School's Dispute Revived by Oliver's Charge
description: A dispute continued yester day over control of the eight schools in what was formerly the Ocean Hill Brownsville Demonstration School District.

title: Baird Sees Vindication
description: BOSTON, July 6 (AP) Mr. Baird said today that the deci sion vindicated him of the ac cusation of being a sexual pied piper.

title: WALTER F. COLBY, ATOMIC PHYSICIST
description: WASHINGTON, July 6Dr. Walter Francis Colby, a physi cist and professor emeritus at the University of Michigan, lied at his home here today. He suffered a heart attack last May. He was 89 years old.

title: Grand Prix Racing Autos Get Safety Modifications
description: LONDON, July 6 (Reuters)Formula One cars in this month's British Grand Prix will be made safer following an emergency meeting of the Grand Prix Drivers Associa tion.

title: Meeting Opens to Plan Next Vietnam Pullout
description: HONOLULU. July 6 (UPI)A fiveday conference to work out the details of the with drawal of 50,000 more Amer ican troops from Vietnam openedtoday at the head quarters of Adm. John S. Mc Cain Jr., commander of United States forces in the Pacific.

title: Civic Unit Urges U.S. to Close Skid Row Blood Banks in City
description: The Federal Government should shut down 42d Street and other skid row commercial blood banks before hepatitis carrying blood donors cause a national health crisis, the New York Council on Civic Affairs said yesterday.

title: Dow Slips 13.48 as Glamour Shares Lead a Retreat
description: The stock market fell sharply yesterday as glamour issues, where enchantment has turned into disenchantment on Wall Street, proved especially vulnerable.

title: Peron, Urging Revolt, Pledges Return
description: PARIS, July 6 (UPI)Juan D. Perbn called today for a violent revolution in Argentina like that in Cuba and said he would return when the time was ripe.

title: Westchester Children, Rich and Poor, Go to Day Camp on Island in Sound
description: NEW ROCHELLE, N. Y., July 6David's Island, where soldiers formerly were sta tioned at Fort Slocum and where the Consolidated Edi son Company hopes to build four nuclear generators, to day became an unusual sum mer day camp.

title: Article 16  No Title
Brazil Is Challenging a Last Frontier
description: RIO DE JANEIRO, July 6  The Brazilian nation is battering, clearing and burn ing its way into the heart of South America to open and settle what may be the last unknown frontier in the worldthe immense Amazon Basin.

title: Mary A. Talbott Engaged to Wed Anthony Zinsser
description: RICHMOND, July 6 Mr. and Mrs. John R. Talbott Jr. have announced the engage ment of their daughter, Miss Mary Ann Talbott, to An thony Zinsser, son of Mr. and Mrs. August Zinsser Jr. of Glen Cove, L.I. A September wedding is planned here.

title: Rogers Discusses Problem
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, July 6 Koun Wick, Cambodia'sForeign Minister, conferred with Secretary of State Wil liam P. Rogers here today on the unresolved problem of Thai military assistance to Cam bodia.

title: AMEN LIST DROPS FOR 10TH SESSION
Nixon Returns to Capital After a Western Vacation
description: WASHINGTON, July 6 (AP) President Nixon ended his Western working vacation of nearly a fortnight tonight, re turning to Washington for con tinued concentration on domes tic and international issues.

title: Disabled Veterans in Saigon Step Up Building on Public Lana
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, July 6If the Government is will ing to give land to the peas ants, why should it not give houses to disabled war 7vet erans? the former South Vietnamese paratrooper asked bitterly.

title: NATO WILL PURSUE TROOPCUT TALKS
description: BRUSSELS, July 6  The United States and its allies in the North Atlantic Treaty Or ganization intend to explore vigorously the Warsaw Pact nations recent offer to discuss the reduction of armed forces on foreign soil in Europe.

title: Corporate Issues Again Set Pace in Strong Gain
description: Corporate bond prices climbed exuberantly yesterday in a per formance that dealers described as the strongest yet in the mar ket's advance that began three week. A on.

title: RACISM IS LINKED TO PRISON BRAWL
description: PHILADELPHIA, July 6 (UPI) Police Commissioner Frank L. Rizzo said today that the riot Saturday at Holmesburg Prison in which 103 persons were injured was caused by barbarians and had definite racial patterns.

title: Hijacker of Plane to Cuba Gets First Life Sentence for Offense
description: NEWNAN, Ga., July 6 (AP)Lorenzo Edward Ervin Jr., 25 years old, was sentenced today to life imprisonment on two counts of aircraft hijacking. The sentence was imposed here by Federal District Judge Albert Henderson.

title: MADDOX WANTS LAW BARRING ROCK FETES
description: ATLANTA, July 6 (Reuters) Gov. Lester G. Maddox an nounced today that he would seek legislation to prohibit pop music festivals such as the one held in Georgia last weekend for 250,000 young people.

title: Denial by Cairo Paper
description: CAIRO, Tuesday, July 7 (Reu ters) Egypt today denied re ports from Israel that Soviet per sonnel were manning Egyptian antiaircraft missile positions responsible for the loss of Is raeli planes raiding the Suez Canal front last week.

title: Jersey High. Court Upholds State's Mortgage Agency
description: TRENTON, July 6 (AP)The state's highest court upheld today the legality of the mort gagefinance agency created two months ago at the urging of Gov. William T. Cahill to allevi ate what Mr. Cahill called a serious housing shortage in New Jersey.

title: Cambodian Units Report Recapture of River Town
description: PNOMPENH, Cambodia, July 6 (AP)Cambodian troops re captured the river town of Saang today while other forces beat off an enemy threat against the important highway town of Kompong Thom, 100 miles north, with the aid of South Vietnamese warplanes, the Cambodian command reported.

title: DEAN CRITICIZES TEACHER TRAINING
description: The dean of Teachers Col lege, Columbia University, said yesterday that American edu cation colleges were not doing an adequate job because, among other failings, they were out of touch with school classrooms.

title: ADA L. COLE
description: ELIZABETH, N.J., July 6Ada L. Cole, a public school school teacher here for 46 years, died yesterday at Miza beth General Hospital after a brief illness. She was 87 years old and lived at 404 Westmin ster Avenue. She retired in l 948.

title: Trouble in Somerville
description: SOMERVILLE, N. J., July 6 (AP)Young Negroes stormed through a downtown area breaking windows tonight pro testing City Council delays on a housing project in this Somer set County town.

title: Gov. McNair Says Germans Delay Carolina Construction
description: COLUMBIA, S. C., July 6 (UPI)Gov. Robert E. McNair said today that officials of the BASF Chemical Corporation had delayed plans to construct facilities in Beaufort County until at least 1972.

title: Mets Trounce Cardinals, 103, as Agee Gets 4 Hits, Including 18th Homer
description: It took the New York Mets long enough to reach the top, but once there they have dis played the protective ferocity of a large mother lion whose cubs are attacked.

title: N.E.A. Delegates Appeal for End to Government Funds for Private Schools
description: SAN FRANCISCO, July 6The National Education Asso ciation, at its 108th annual con vention here, has called on Federal and state governments to withhold new aid for private schools and to withdraw the help such schools now receive from tax funds.

title: Article 8  No Title
Louisiana Tax Rise Signed
description: BATON ROUGE, July 6 (AP)  Gov. John J. McKeithen signed into law today three tax increases that will bring in more than $120million a year The package includes a one cent sales tax increase, a three cent rise in cigarette taxes, an 82centagallon whisky tax in crement and removal of the state income tax exemption on Federal taxes.

title: CAMPUSES TO SEE NEWSTYLE PLAYS
description: Creative Management Associ ates, one of the country's larg est talent agencies, has joined forces with G.H.V. Packages & Productions, Inc., to present Off Broadway works in the growing college theater market.

title: Wood, Field and Stream
description: CALLICOON, N. Y., July 6 A standing Joke in this upper Delaware River coun try is that one of these days Candy Candeloro, salesman superior, is going to sell some gullible citizen the Brooklyn Bridgeprobably at an end ofseason price.

title: PROF. CARL F. KAYAN OF COLUMBIA DEAD
description: MOUNT KISCO, N.Y. July 6 Carl F. Kayan, formerly a professor of mechanical engi neering at Columbia University and an expert on refrigeration and heat transfer technology, died yesterday at Northern Westchester Hospital, here, after a brief illness. He was 70 years old and lived on Rodd Roade in Katnnah.

title: DU PONT TO RAISE GASADDITIVE PRICE
description: E. I. du Pont de Nemours & Co. announced yesterday that it would raise prices by 2 per cent, effective Aug. 8, on tetraethyl lead, an anti knock additive for gasoline.

title: RACKING HIGHWAYS ARE LAID TO TRUCKS
description: WASHINGTON, July 6 (AP) The nation's interstate high ways are cracking up from heavy truck traffic that may force many hundreds of mil lions of dollars in repairs, Gov ernment investigators reported today.

title: WOMEN TO STUDY HOMES FOR AGED
description: WASHINGTON, July 6Seven affluent young wome have come to Washington from Farmington, Conn., to challeng the practices and concepts fol lowed in nursing homes for th aged.

title: StrawHat Houses Fewer but Happier
description: The downward trend in summer theater is contin uing this season. Tight mon ey. poor management and a lack of hit properties are some of the explanations given for the decrease.

title: ALTON E. LAUGHLIN
Redemptions Rise On Savings Bonds
description: WASHINGTON, July 6 (UPI)  Savingsbond redemption ex ceeded sales by $30million last month as savers continued to withdraw their funds, appar ently in search of a better re turn on their money.

title: ArMy to Take Pretrial Step In Case of Songmy Figure
description: ATLANTA, July 6 (AP)The Army announced today that it Would go ahead with a pretrial Iriceeding in the courtmartial of Sgt. Esequiel Torres, 22 years old, of Brownsville, Tex., charged with murder in the al leged Songny massacre.

title: JACKSON JURY TOLD OF STATE RIOT LAW
description: JACKSON, Miss., July 6A state judge told the Hinds County Grand Jury today that its investigation of violence at Jackson State College must be guided by state law, which per mits a peace officer to kill a human being in lawfully sup pressing any riot.

title: Weather Reports and Forecast
DRAFT CHIEF SAYS SINCERITY DECIDES OBJECTOR STATUS
description: WASHINGTON, July 6Dr. Curtis W. Tarr, the Director of Selective Service, told local draft boards today that the primary criterion for a con scientious objector was whether his beliefs were sincere and deeply held and not whether they were comprehensible to board members.

title: TODAY'S PROBABLE PITCHERS
description: St. Louis at New York (8 US P.M.) Torrez (6.8) vs. Gentry (75).

title: Dance: Debuts in Giselle
description: A dancer's debut in one of the two leading roles in Giselle is both a trial and an initiation. The tension is frightening, simply because the dancer is dancing some thing his or her predecessors have been dancing for about 130 years now. There is a sheer accumulation of tradi tion here that must lie heavy on any dancer rash and brave enough to dance the ballet.

title: BIRTH LAW UPSET IN MASSACHUSETTS
description: BOSTON, July 6The United States Court of Appeals for the First Circuit ruled unconstituH tional today the Massachusetts law designed to withhold con traceptive devices from un married persons.

title: MRS. MARY CALANDRILLO
description: UNION CITY, N.J., July 6Mrs. Mary A. Calandrillo, mother of Harry M. Calandrillo, Union City's Director of Pub lic Safety, died Friday in Pol ?? hospital, Jersey City, af ter a long illness. She was 56 ?? old.

title: How Banks Rallied on a Loan for Chrysler
description: The nation's major commer cial banks, rallying together tc head off what they freely con cede could have been a serious financial panic, assembled a loan package of more than $400million for the Chrysler Financial Corporation in just five business days.

title: Saratoga Ball Set for Aug. 7
description: The Saratoga Performing Arts Ball will move outdoors for the first time this year. Five hundred guests from New York, Philadelphia and Washington gather on the lawn of the amphitheater on Aug. 7 for the sixth annual benefit for the Saratoga Per forming Arts Center.

title: FADING YANKEES TO MEET ORIOLES
description: The New York Yankees, with eight losses in their last 10 games, inconsistent fielding of late by their shortstop, a hit ting slump by their top batter and three consecutive defeats pinned on their former No. 1 hurler, open a threegame series against the Orioles, the Eastern Division leaders, at Baltimore tonight.

title: In The Nation: A Right Not to Be DataBanked?
description: WASHINGTON, July 6Do you have a right not to be stored in a computer, where you can be called up for instant investigation by any bureaucrat or law officer who considers you a person of interest or who may want to provide some one elsemaybe your employer with facts about you? If you haven't thought about that, it's high time you did.

title: Nixon Panel Calls Hearings in Public On Campus Unrest,
description: WASHINGTON, July 6  The President's new Commission on Campus Unrest, despite urgent time pressure, will conduct public hearings, probably start ing within two weeks.

title: Leopard Escapes at Orly
description: PARIS, July 6 (UPI)A 33 pound leopard escaped from its cage at Orly airport today and disappeared into a wheat field. The police were called in with twp zoo specialists armed with tranquilizer guns and nets to try to take the cat alive.

title: SILVER FUTURES AT VOLUME PEAK
description: Trading in silver futures on the Commodity Exchange of New York reached a record of 3,218,000,000 ounces in the first half of this year, it was an nounced yesterday by Matthew S. Fox, president of the ex change.

title: RAILS DISCUSSING ANEW RATE RISE
description: The nation's railroads are talking again about seeking an other freight rate increase. Meanwhile, five big lines in the ErtSt have applied to the Inter state Commerce Commission for authority to increase their basic oneway coach and first class passenger fares by 10 percent.

title: CENSUS PRESAGES CUTS IN URBAN AID
description: Preliminary figures from re gional census bureaus around New York State have indicated a sharp decline in the popula tion of upstate cities that may mean the loss of financial aids, to urban areas.

title: Tenants in Struck Buildings Face Long Climbs
description: While the pickets circled out side in the sun on Park Avenue Mrs. Annette Forman stooc frowning in the cool, elegant lobby, holding a pillowcase ful of the Monday wash.

title: Department Store Sales Down in June
description: Saies in New York's largest department stores in June showed an evident worsening of already sluggish consumer buving.

title: Kosygin Arrives in Rumania for Signing of Treaty
description: BUCHAREST, July 6Pre mier Aleksei N. Kosygin re ceived a coolly correct re ception here today at the be ginning of a visit centered on the longdeferred signing of a new SovietRumanian friendship and mutual assist ance treaty.

title: Officer Saw No Foot Marks In Home Where 3 Were Slain
description: FORT BRAGG, N. C., July 6 (AP)  A military policeman testified today that he had seen no foot tracks in the house where Capt. Jeffrey MacDonald of the Green Berets is accused of slaying his pregnant wife and two children last Feb. 17.

title: Lindbergh Says Technology, if Not Curbed, May Destroy Man
description: WASHINGTON, July 6 (AP) Charles A. Lindbergh, who made aviation history with his solo flight across the Atlantic Ocean 43 years ago, says that it is time to take a critical look at technology and its side effects.

title: Yugoslav Town Hopes Improved Albanian Links Will Aid Tourism
LOUISIANA OFFICIAL CITED FOR PERJURY
description: NEW ORLEANS, July 6 (UPI)  A Federal grand jury in dicted Attorney General Jack P. F. Gremillion of Louisiana today on five counts of perjury. It said he lied last January when he denied having interests in a bankrupt loan company.

title: No Title
description: PORT WASHINGTON, L. I., July 6Alton E. Laughlin, a lawyer for the American Tele phone and Telegraph Company at his retirement in 1962, died yesterday in Manhasset Medi cal Center after an operation. He was 71 years old and lived here at 31 Pine Street.

title: Washington: For the Record
description: THE PRESIDENT

title: U. S.Thai Talks on Aid to Cambodia Reported Snagged
description: PNOMPENH, Cambodia, July 6American discussions with Thailand over the possible dis patch of Thai troops to Cam bodia are reported to have bogged down over Thai de mands that the United States underwrite a large share of the cost.

title: Two at Hospital Charged With Selling Marajuana
description: Two employes at Montefiore Hospital in the Bronx were ar rested yesterday on charges of selling dangerous drugs to un dercover agents of the office of Bronx District Attorney Bur ton B. Roberts.

title: THANT ASKS U.N. UNIT TO WIDEN CONCERNS
description: GENEVA, July 6  Secre tary General Thant urged the United Nations Economic and Social Council today to con centrate on action rather than plans and to concern itself increasingly with the eco nomic management of the world's resources  human and physical.

title: Need for Renewal Action
description: WASHINGTON, July 6The Special House committee that returned from two weeks in Vietnam reported today that it had observed some conditions which required remdial or cor rective action at the prison on Con Son. It said it had re ceived assurances that the situation would be thoroughly investigated.

title: NEWMANS IN DEAL FOR GAMMA RAYS; Joanne Woodward Will Sta? Husband to Direct Film
description: Film rights to The Effect of Gamma Rays on Maninthe Moon Marigolds, the off Broadway hit by Paul Zindel, have been acquired by the in dependent Newman Foreman Company, headed by Paul New man, the actordirector, and John Foreman, the producer. The comedydrama about a bitter mother and her two troubled daughters opened. last April at the MercerO'Casey Theater 340 Mercer Street.

title: SENATE REJECTS BID TO CUT SPACE FUNDS
description: WASHINGTON, July 6 (UPI) The Senate narrowly defeat ed today the first of several at tempts to cut the $3.3billion space budget.

title: At Adolfo, Midi Lengths Still Look New
description: Now that the rest of fash ion has caught up to Adolfo in the matter of midi lengths, felt skirts and swashbuckling capes, there was an air of hushed ex pectancy yesterday at the St. Regis Hotel as the milli nercouturier introduced his fall collection.

title: Letters to the Editor of The Times
description: Preferential Voting

title: JUBILATION FINISHES 6TH IN SAIL TO TAHITI
description: PAPEETE, Tahiti, July 6 (UPI)The 48foot cutter Jubi lation crossed the finish line of the Los AngelestoTahiti race late yesterday, the sixth yacht to finish.

title: Sihanouk Aides Reject Trial
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, July 6 (AP)Prince Norodom Si hanouk's government in exile today rejected as illegal the trial and death sentence im posed on the Prince in absentia by a military court of the Cam bodian Government yesterday. Prince Sihanouk was deposed as Cambodia's chief of state March 18 and has since been in exile in Peking.

title: Alexandra Carter Moulton Betrothed
description: ST. LOUIS, July 6Mr. and Mrs. John R. Moulton have announced the engage ment of their daughter, Miss Alexandra Carter Moulton, to Peter Jeffcott Pell, son of Mrs. Jeffcott Pell of Rome and Clarence C. Pell of Old Westbury, L.I.

title: Article 1  No Title
description: OHRID, Yugoslavia, June 25 Relations between Albania and Yugoslavia, which have ranged in the postwar years from camaraderie to hostility to cautious cooperation, have now reached the point where officials of this dazzling little resort openly express the hope that tourists will someday visit them by traveling over Alba nian roads.

title: Article 15  No Title
BeechNut Unit Looking Around
description: A spokesman for the confections division of BeechNut, Inc., confirmed yesterday that because of a policy disagree ment with Young & Rubicam, the division is talking to selected group of agencies.

title: ISRAELI SAYS JETS NOW FACE ROCKETS FIRED BY RUSSIANS
description: JERUSALEM, July 6Israel's chief of staff said today that in the last six days Israeli planes had been in intensive combat involving groundtoair missile sites along the Suez Canal and that the missiles had been in stalled and were partly oper ated by Soviet personnel.

title: Mrs. Hartford to Divorce A&P Heir, Lawyer Says
PRICES ARE MIXED IN LONDON STOCKS
Roundup: McDowell Steps On 2d to Get Out of Jam
description: Sam McDowell and Duke Sims performed their special ties last night, but Alvin Dark, the Cleveland manager, gave McDowell something new for his act.

title: A Negro Prosecutor Denied In Inquiry Into Chicago Raid
description: CHICAGO, July 6 (UPI)fudge Joseph A. Power denied today the Black Panther party's request that a black coprose nitor be appoihted to investi gate the Dec. 4 police raid on a Panther apartment. The raid left two party leaders dead.

title: STOKES TO MEDIATE IN TRANSIT DISPUTE
description: CLEVELAND, July 6Mayor Carl B. Stokes will meet tomor row with representatives of the Cleveland Transit System and union officials in an attempt to end a sixday wildcat transit strike that has crippled Cleve land's public transportation.

title: Child to Mrs. R. M. Strauss
description: WESTBURY, L. I., July 6 A daughter was born June 25 to Mr. and Mrs. Richard M. Strauss at the North Shore Hospital in Manhasset. Mrs. Strauss is the former Miss Regina Joyce Falk. Her husband is chairman of the department of physical edu cation and director of ath letics at Woodlands High School in Hartsdale, N. Y. The child has been named Lisa Beth.

title: EXTURNPIKE AIDE IS JAILED IN BRIBERY
description: Harry Lightstone, a Pennsyl vania lawyer who was once District Attorney of Schuylkill County and General Counsel of the Pennsylvania Turnpike Commission, was sentenced yesterday to a year in prison for solicitina a bribe.

title: Campus Panelist Upset That Nixon Lets A gnew Speak
description: CAMBRIDGE, Mass., July 6 (UPI)  Joseph Rhodes Jr. a member of the Presidential Commission on Campus Unrest, says he is disturbed that Presi dent Nixon has not been able to control Vice President Ag new's rhetoric.

title: The Patron Saint of Bakers
description: PARIS  The shrine of French bread is a modest bakery at 8 Rue du Cherche Midi, whose owner, Pierre Poilane, has been called the patron saint of bakers.

title: Norwalk Sewage Plant Set
description: NORWALK, Conn., July 6Plans for a $5million secondary sewagetreatment plan off the east bank of the Norwalk River adjacent to present water pol lutioncontrol facilities have been disclosed. Public Works Commissioner F. William Grum man said that if approval was granted by the state Water Resources Commission work would start Sept ??

title: PAPUANEW GUINEA TO GAIN IN AUTONOMY
description: SYDNEY, Australia, July 6Prime Minister John Gorton an nounced tonight that Australia would grant the territory of Pa pua and New Guinea control of many of its internal affairs.

title: War Casualties
description: WASHINGTON, July 6 (UPI)  The Defense Department today identified the following men from the New York area as having been killed in Southeast Asia:

title: JACKSON AWARDED CONSERVATION PRIZE
description: WASHINGTON, July 6Sen ator Henry M. Jackson of Wash ington, chairman of the Senate Interior Committee, was award ed today the Bernard M. Baruch Conservation Prize for 1969 for his work in behalf of environ mental legislation during the 1960's.

title: Advertising: Monsanto to Farm Out Work
description: The Monsanto Company, after the first of the year, will give up four of its ad vertising agencies and will contract out the work for merly done by them to inde pendent service companies.

title: Boiardo Granted a Mistrial in Jersey Case After Heart Attack
description: TRENTON, July 6Anthony (Tony Boy) Boiardo, a 56yearold reputed Mafia leader, who suffered a heart attack last night in the Somerset County Jail, had his trial severed to day from that of Hugh J: Addo nizio, exMayor of Newark, and four other men who are on trial here for extortion.

title: FANS NAME ALLEN TO ALLSTAR TEAM
description: Richie Allen of the St. Louis Cardinals beat out Willie Mc Covey of the San Francisco Gi ants, the National League's most valuable player of 1969, in the final voting for the 1970 AllStar team, and Hank Aaron of the Atlanta Braves led the fans roll with 1.394.847 votes.

title: A Sounder Suffrage
description: Government based on the consent of the governed must give to the governed an adequate means registering that consent. While the American system may do this as a general rule, so many exceptions have developed over the years that an overhauling the voting machinery is clearly in order.

title: Madrid Has No Comment
description: MADRID, July 6 (UPI)Un der terms of General PerOn's permission to reside in exile in Spain, he is not allowed to engage in politics or make po litical statements publicly. The Spanish Government had no im mediate comment on the inter view published today.

title: Front Page 1  No Title
Clay's Conviction on Draft Upheld by Appeals Court
description: NEW ORLEANS, July 6 (UPI) The United States Court of Appeals for the Fifth Circuit to day upheld the draftevasion conviction of Cassius Clay, the former heavyweight boxing champion.

title: FIGHT in Rochester Means Job Training and Houses
description: ROCHESTER, July 6On the site of an old hospital in this city's predominantly black Third Ward, most of the foundation has been poured for a grassroots housing project that will pro vide new living quarters for 149 lowincome families.

title: Hard Landing Preceded Canadian Airliner Crash
description: TORONTO, July 6The Air Canada DC8 that crashed yes terday killing all 108 persons aboard had first made a hard landing at Toronto Interna tional Airport, a senior Govern ment official said today.

title: HUGO T. SPECK, 64, NEWS AGENCY AIDE
description: GARLAND, Tex., July 6 (UPI) Hugo T. Speck, a World War, II correspondent, died here yes terday. He was 64 years old.I

title: Entertainment Events
description: Concerts

title: Congressional Record: 8 Seconds, 112 Pages
description: WASHINGTON, July 6 (AP)  The Congressional Record for July 2 runs a bit more than 112 pages  not surpris ing except that the Senate met for only eight seconds that day and the House did not meet at all.

title: RESERVE COMMITTEE REPORTS APRIL VOTE
description: WASHINGTON, July 6The Federal Reserve's Open Market Committee voted unanimously for a policy of moderate growth in money and bank credit over the months ahead at its meeting of April 7, a re port of the meeting disclosed today.

title: APARTMENT TIEUP STARTS IN THE CITY OVER $40 PAY RISE
description: A strike against 2,500 apart ment buildings in Manhattan, Brooklyn, Queens and Rich mond was called at 10 A.M. yesterday by Local 32B of the Building Service Employes In ternational Union. The build ings, mainly rentcontrolled, house about half a million people.

title: Zzyzx's Visitors Bathe In Springs and Advice
description: ZZYZX, CalifOne evening 27 years ago, Dr. Curtis Springer went out for a walk near his home in Hollywood. Passing a secondhand book store, he spied a volume about the mineral springs of the Pacific Coast on sale for 25 cents.

title: JOAN BIRD FREED IN $100,000 BAIL
description: Joan Bird, one of 13 Black Panthers awaiting trial here on bombconspiracy charges, was released from the Women's House of Detention yesterday on $100.000 bail.

title: Greece and Bulgaria Reach 3Point Development Accord
description: ATHENS July 6 (AP)The Greek Foreign Ministry an nounced a thre4point agree ment on technical development and tourism today with neigh boring Bulgaria, as part of an effort to improve relations with Easternbloc countries. Earlier this year, Greece signed a bar ter agreement with Albania.

title: Sports Today
description: BASEBALL

title: Bill Rates Register Advance At Treasury's Weekly Auction
description: WASHINGTON, July 6 Treasury bill rates advanced at today's auction from last week's levels, the Government reported late this afternoon.

title: USLIFE ACQUIRES STERLING STOOK
description: The USLIFE Corporation has acquired more than 85 per cent of the stock of the Ster ling Savings and Loan Associa tion of Riverside, Calif., through an exchange of shares. The exchange offer has been extended subject to termination without notice to the remain ing stockholders of Sterling. basis of 0.484 USLIFE common share for each share of Ster ling with the issuance of maximum of 511,131 shares of USLIFE. The transaction was valued at more than $12.7mil lion.

title: Group Investigating Corruption Starts Work Despite P.B.A. Plea
description: The commission investigat ing charges of corruption in the New York Police Depart ment went to work yesterday despite a plea from the Pa trolmen's Benevolent Associa tion that the commission defer action until its, legality had been decided.

title: A Fashion Career Beckons
description: Not all adolescents are all churned up inside. Yvette Williams, who is 18 years old, is quite serene. Oh, she's a bit nervous about going to live in Denmark for a year in September, but then her mother has promised to go with her for a week and get her settled.

title: Article 4  No Title
House Unit Uiges Fast Vietnam Pullout
description: WASHINGTON, July 6A special House committee that just returned from two weeks in Southeast Asia recommend ed today that the withdrawal of United States ground troops continue at least as fast as now scheduled.

title: Reluctant Allies
description: Premier Kosygin and other Soviet dignitaries re ceived a correct if cool reception on their arrival Bucharest yesterday. The visitors from Moscow, well aware that the Rumanians are reluctant allies, could hardly have been surprised. Leonid I. Brezhnev decided not even to come to Bucharest, showing his displeas ure by hiding behind a diplomatic illness.

title: City Opera Drops Los Angeles Trip; Deficit Rise Cited
description: The New York City Opera's fourth annual Los Angeles sea son, scheduled to open Nov. 16, was canceled yesterday by the Music Center Opera Associa tion. Lawrence E. Deutsch, vice president of the West Coast as sociation, attributed the deci sion to call off the threeweek season to spiraling costs and increasingly unmanageable def icits.

title: Tourist Slain in Capital
description: WASHINGTON, July 6 (AP) William H. Darden a tourist from New Haven, Conn., was shot and killed today as he scuffled with three youths demanding money outside a restaurant. The police said that Mr. Darden, driving north after a weekend trip, had stopped to get food for his 9yearold daughter at 3:30 A. M. He was confronted by the youths when he returned to his car. The po lice later arrested three teen lagers and charged them with homicide.

title: FINLEY PLANNING CIRCUS FOR SEALS
description: OAKLAND, Calif., July 6 (UPI)Charles O. Finley, the P. T. Barnum of professional athletics, told his first news conference here as owner of the Oakland Seals today that I know absolutely nothing about hockey.

title: Article 3  No Title
Spears and Vallo Lead Westchester Qualifiers
description: BRIARCLIFF MANOR, N. Y., July 6Richard A. Spears the Port Jervis Country Chit and Theodore A. Vallo of the Southern Dutchess C. C. scored a oneunderpar 70's today a Briar Hall C. C. this gave then a twostroke edge in the West chester sectional qualifying fo the 48th New York State Gol Association championship.

title: Court Order Delays Mountaindale Rock Festival
description: A borscht circuit or rock mu sic festivals that seemed to be developing in the Catskills af ter last August's Woodstock Festival suffered a new setback yesterday.

title: Struggle in the Desert: Power vs. Environment
description: FORT MOHAVE, Nev.Here in the southern tip of the Nevada desert, a brand new black and white striped smokestack juts 500 feet above the sagebrush. It sym bolizes an important aspect of a nationwide strugglePower vs. Environment.

title: JOB CORPS CENTER SET PAR O??EENS; $2Million Contract Awarded for Training at Ft. Totten
description: WASHINGTON, July 6A twoyear, $2.3million contract to establish and operate a Job Corps training center at Fort Totten in Queens has been granted to the RCA Service Company, a division of the RCA Corporation, the Labor Depart ment announced today.

title: Poems by Kali: A Little Black Girl Speaks Her Mind
description: It was fitting that Kali Grosvenor dedicated her first book of poetry, Poems by Kali, to three little black girls who were killed in a church bombing in Birming bam Ala in 1963.

title: C.B.S. Man Leaves Moscow
description: MOSCOW, July 6 (AP)Wil liam Cole, correspondent of the Columbia Broadcasting System, in Moscow since August, 1968, left here today in compliance with an expulsion order issued a week ago. The action was the latest in a series of expulsion of newsmen by the Soviet Union and the United States.

title: Cyprus Foes of Tie to Greece Are Biggest Winners in Voting
description: NICOSIA, Cyprus, July 6 (UPI)The moderate Unified party, whose platform rejects union with Greece, has emerged as the strongest political party in Cyprus following elections to the House of Representatives yesterday. The Akel, or Com munist party, almost dou bled its strength, unofficial re turns showed tonight.

title: Sports of
description: Take a guess. How many games do you think the Dodgers have played in Los Angeles since Walter O'Malley packed his carpet bag in Ebbets Field and started his private California Gold Rush? Some die hard Brooklyn fans, still carrying the torch, might sigh deeply and mutter in despairing tones, It seems only like yes tprday. It's later than they think.

title: DEMOCRATS SET BROADCAST PLANS
description: WASHINGTON, July 6 (AP)  The Democrats announced to day the format of their free time broadcast over the Colum bia Broadcasting System tomor row night amid demands by the Republicans for equal time to reply.

title: SATELLITE VISIBILITY FORECAST THIS WEEK
description: WASHINGTON, July 6 (AP) The heaviest and most com plex unmanned spacecraft ever placed in orbit, the Orbiting As tronomical Observatory OAO2, should be visible to the unaided eye this week in the Middle At lantic states, the National Aero nautics and Space Administra tion said today.

title: Deaths
description: AUSTINEvangeline M. Former Ziegfeld Fol lies Girl of Manhasset, L.I. On July 6, 1970. Widow of Gilbert V. Austin, devoted mother of G. Turner Austin of Atlanta, Georgia. Also survived by two grandchil dren. Friends may visit Tuesday 35 and 7.9:30 P.M. Service Wednesday 10 A.M. the Fairchild Chapel, 1570 Northern Blvd., Manhasset. Contributions M the Nassau Heart Association, Mineloa, L.I., would be appreciated. Interment private.

title: Bridge:Rubin and Westheimer Show Prowess in Stockholm Play
Civil War Prison Site Backed
description: WASHINGTON, July 6 (AP) A House Interior subcom mittee approved today a bill to make the site of the Civil War prison at Andersonville, Ga., a national historic site. The cemetery near the prison, along with the land separating them, would be included in the 495acre site.

title: 5 Women Scientists Start 2Week Stay Under Sea
description: ST. JOHN, Virgin Islands, July 6 (AP)  Five women scientists plunged into the warm waters off this tiny island today to live and work for two weeks at the bottom of the sea.

title: Investor Public Grows 53% in 5 Years
description: The shareholder population of the United States soared 53.3 per cent in the last five years to 30.85 million indi viduals, or one in every six Americans and one in every four adult Americans, the New York Stock Exchange reported yesterday.

title: Valiant to SailAgainst Heritage Today in America's Cup Trial off Newport
description: NEWPORT, R. I., July 6 Competition in the America's Cup observation trials will be gin here tomorrow, almost but not quite on schedule.

title: Jellyfish Control Voted
description: WASHINGTON, July 6 (AP)The House voted today to ex tend until June 30, 1973, the program to provide for control or elimination of jellyfish in coastal waters. The legislation, sent to the Senate by voice vote, would authorize appropri ations of $733,000 for control programs during the three years.

title: Major League Baseball
description: National League

title: DEFENSE CALLS 7 IN SWEIG'S TRIAL
description: The defense opened and closed its case yesterday in the conspiracy perjury trial here of Dr. Martin Sweig, suspended chief administrative aide of House Speaker John W. Mc Cormack, after calling only seven witnesses. The Govern ment had called 46.

title: POUND TUMBLES TO 9MONTH LOW
description: LONDON, July 6  The pound, continuing a twomonth slide in foreignexchange mar kets, tumbled 14 more points today to $2.3914. This is the lowest level since last October, when the revaluation of the West German mark helped spark sterling's strong recov erv.

title: Congressmen Told of Tour
description: The two Democratic Con gressmen told yesterday of see ing men kept in tiger cages on their tour of the South Viet namese prison island.

title: Article 10  No Title
Key Issue in Strike: Rent Control
description: On April 20 an old contract expired for 25,000 door men. porters and elevator operators in 5,000 apartment buildings here. The landlords said they could not meet wage demands without rent increases, which were pro hibited by the city rentcontrol law.

title: Article 19  No Title
Wedding Is Held Here For Mrs. Miodownik
description: At Congregation Kehilath Jeshurun here yesterday Mrs. Gerda Blumenthal Miodow nik of New York, widow of Alfons Miodownik, was mar ried to Leon Daniel, who re tired last year as president of Pix, Inc. Rabbi Haskel Lookstein performed the cere mony.

title: Lira Continues to Fall
description: PARIS, July 6the resigna tion of Premier Mario Rumor against the background of new social unrest in Italy touched off further selling of the lira in foreign exchange markets to day.

title: VICTORY SIZABLE IN MEXICAN VOTE
description: MEXICO CITY, July 6A sizable victory for Luis Eche verria Alvarez, presidential can didate of the governing party, emerged today in returns from Mexico's national election.

title: Rosemary's Bill and Doctor Star, Bred at Montauk Farm, Score at Aqueduct
description: All that any of the 37,501 horseplayers at Aqueduct yes terday had to do was to play the New Yorkbreds. Following that system, they were bound to come out ahead of the game. There were only four Empire State foals on the program, and twn of them won WATKINS GLEN, N. Y., July 6 (UPI)  The world driving champion, Jackie Stewart of Scotland, announced today that he would drive a new Chaparral 2J when it makes its racing debut in the Canadian American championship here next weekend.

title: Deaths
description: SCHNEIDERAbraham, beloved husband of Miriam, devoted father of Susan and Joan, dear brother of Jack and Bessie, devoted soninlaw of Sidney and Gus Levine, re vered uncle. Services Tuesday, 10 A.M., at Nassau North Chapels, 55 North Station Plaza (opp. R.R. sta.), Great Neck, L.I. In lieu of flowers, the family reguests that donations be made to the Leukemia Re search Fund, Long Island Jewish Hospital, c/o Dr. Arthur Sawitskn. Shiva will be ob served at 81 Oxford Blvd., Great Neck, L.I.

title: Mexico's PresidentElect
description: For a man with only token opposition, Luis Echever ria Alvarez campaigned strenuously for the Presidency of Mexico. He traveled 30,000 miles, visited 850 towns and villages in 221 days and was seen by more than a fifth of Mexico's 48 million people.
