He won about 80 per cent of the votes in a turnout that was fairly heavy despite a don'tvote drive by young dissidents.

title: Plan to Build Vacation Town Divides Upstate Community
description: EAST TAGHKANC, N.Y,The lives of the 727 people who live on the remote farms and in the thick woodlands of East Taghkanic, 125 miles north of New York City, may soon be sharply and irrevoca bly chaneed.

title: Television
description: Morning

title: WRITEOFF OF TAXES SUSPENDED BY BONN
description: BONN, July 6  The West German Government an nounced today a sevenmonth suspension of degressive de preciation allowances for in dustry as a means to assist the central bank in its fight against inflation.

title: Instrument of Death
description: Humanity must perforce prey on itseltnike mon sters of the deep, observed William Shakespeare in King Lear. Man has indeed been fiendishly success ful in devising ways to destroy his supposed enemies, and himself.

title: NEW RELIEF GRANTS TO BEGIN HERE SOON
description: The city's Department of So cial Services is preparing to implement a new system of grants to welfare recipients now living in hotels so they can buy enough furniture to set up their own households.

title: Wilson Hicks, a Former Editor Of Life Magazine, Dies at 73
description: HOMESTEAD, Fla., July 6Wilson Hicks. former execu tive editor of Life magazine and a lecturer on photojour nalism at the University of Miami, died at his home here yesterday, apparently of a heart attack. He was 73 years old.

title: Books of The Times
description: Whether Two Sisters is a novel in the form of a memoir, as the jacket de clares, or a memoir in the form of a novel, as the title page insists, it is none theless inadequate. Out of desperation, writes Mr. Vidal, I have abandoned the usual form in order to deal directly with myself. Nonsense. He has made fun of TWO SISTERS. By Gore Vidal. 256 pages. Lit tle, Brown. $5.95.

title: Belfast Leader Astounded
description: BELFAST, Northern Ireland, July 6Prime Minister James D. ChichesterClark issued the following statement late to night:

title: Israeli Report on Missiles Questioned by U.S. Aides
description: WASHINGTON, July 6American officials reported 8to day that Egypt's Sovietbuilt missile defense system had been improved recently but they dif fered with Israel's assessment I of the extent of the buildun.

title: 75 Million Lutherans
description: GENEVA, July 6There are 75,124,215 Lutherans in the world today, according to sta tistics compiled by the World Lutheran Federation.

title: Turning Mother Into Teacher
description: The shy ones stayed close to their mothers knees and, fingers in mouths, eyes enormous, looked longingly into the playroom of Mount Sinai Hospital's pedi atric clinic where bolder children were actually enjoying the inevitable wait for the doctor.

title: News Summary and Index
description: A senior Israeli military official said yes terday that Israeli planes had been in inten sive combat involving missile sites manned by Soviet crews. Three Israeli aircraft were downed by SAM2 missiles, whose crews consist of both Egyptian and Russian per sonnel. Five SAM2 sites have been damaged, but Israeli planes have not yet attacked any SAM3 sites, whose crews are entirely Soviet. [Page 1, Column 8.] American offi cials reported that Egypt's missile defense system had been improved but they dif fered with Israel on the extent of the buildup. [1:67.]

title: STEEL PRODUCTION DECLINES FOR WEEK
description: Steel production declined last week by 3.6 per cent, compared with output in the preceding week, the American Iron and Steel Institute re ported yesterday.

title: Article 9  No Title
Hugs and Clinches in Sports World
Article 13  No Title
Competing Portfolio Managers Are Replaced at Mutual Funds
description: The idea that mutual funds can best be managed by hiring several portfolio managers to compete against one another suffered a sharp setback yester day when the Competitive Cap ital Corporation discharged all eight of its managers in an ef fort to improve perform ance.

title: Pamplona Fiesta Begins
description: PAMPLONA. Spain, July 6 (UPI)The weeklong fiesta of the running of the bulls began today.

title: Article 6  No Title
Home Warns British of Expanding Soviet Power
description: LONDON, July 6Sir Alec DouglasHome, Foreign Secre tary in the new Conservative Government, warned today against the growth of Soviet power at sea and in the Middle East.

title: FIREMEN'S UNION TO BACK BUCKLEY
description: The Uniformed Firemen's As sociation with 28,000 members will publicly announce today its endorsement of James Y. Buck ley, the Conservative party candidate for United States Senator.

title: ANDRE PHILIP DIES; FRENCH ECONOMIST
description: PARIS, July 6  Andre Philip, the economist who was several times a Finance Minister and one of thestanchest proponents of European unity in the Social ist party, died here last night. He was 68 years old.

title: Rains in Karachi Kill 15
description: KARACHI, Pakistan. July 6 (AP)About 15 persons, mostly young children, have perished in the last three days here be cause of heavy rains that have swept away primitive homes. More than 100 people were in jured. The city's telephone net work was disrupted and airline flights were suspended.

title: Contaminated Fish Found In Part of Tennessee River
description: MONTGOMERY, Ala., July (AP)A warning about con taminated fish was extended today to portions of the Ten nessee River in Alabama, Ten nessee and Mississippi.

title: Mayor Hails P.A.L For Play Program At Harlem Opening
description: Mayor Lindsay had encourag ing words for the Police Ath letic League's summer play street program yesterday at opening ceremonies on 114th Street in Harlem. But several local residents were skeptical about the kind of play that usually takes place on the block between Seventh and Eighth Avenues.

title: BARBABLU PICKED FOR $125,000 TROT
description: WESTBURY, LI., July 6Barbablu, a twotime victor over the world champion, Une de Mai of France, last fall, was selected today as the fourth foreign entrant in the 12th edi tion of the $125,000 Roosevelt International world champion ship trot on July 18 at Roose velt Raceway, George Morton Levy, the track president, an nounced Une de Mai, who won the event last year; Lyon of Sweden and Stylish Major of New Zealand already have ac cented invitations.

title: Peru Prepares for Arrival Of 65 Soviet Relief Planes
description: LLMA, Peru, July 6 (Reuters) Peruvian authorities today were preparing for the ex pected arrival tomorrow of 65 Soviet transport planes with relief supplies for earthquake stricken areas of northern Peru.

title: Kowloon Dispute With China Revived
description: HONG KONG, July 6The discovery of two old Chinese cannon in the Kowloon Walled City has focused new public attention on this crowded, cramped quarter of Hong Kong with its reputation as a haunt of drug addicts and criminals and its history as a sensitive issue in ChineseBritish rela tions.

title: McAlpin Left $1.5Million To Mental Health Research
description: William R. McAlpin Jr., a 39yearold Rockefeller heir who fell to his death early this year from a Florida hotel, be queathed $1.5million, a record to the National Association for Mental Health for study of hereditary factors of mental illness, the organization dis closed yesterday.

title: Umpire Gorman Is Oat A Month With Injuries
description: CHICAGO, July 6Tom Gorman, recovering in Wes ley Memorial Hospital follow ing his first injury in 20 years as a major league umpire, learned today that he would be on the sidelines at least a month.

title: Market Place: Income Funds Begin to Shine
description: It was probably inevitable that the income funds would begin to shine. After all, everybody with money in the stock marketincluding those who owned income stockshas lost money.

title: Castro Replaces Sugar Industry and Education Chiefs
description: MIAMI, July 6Premier Fi del Castro of Cuba replaced his Ministers of the Sugar In dustry and Education today.

title: Asbury Park Beset Again by Violence In Spite of Curfew
description: ASBURY PARK, N. J., Tuesday, July 7The police arrested scores of persons last night and early this morning as this seaside com munity suffered its third straight night of violence, vandalism and looting. For the first time, a 7 P.M.to 6 A.M. curfew was in effect.

title: Rifleman Slays 2 Lions That Killed Youth at Zoo
description: PORTLAND, Ore., July 6 (AP) Two lions that killed a youth at the Portland Zoo Saturday night were dead today, victims of a nighttime rifleman.

title: Italian Cabinet Quits in Dispute Over Socialists Ties With Reds
description: ROME, July 6 The four party coalition Government of Premier Mariano Rumor re signed today in a dispute over the Socialists cooperation with Communists

title: TV: America as Seen by Tocqueville
description: A portrait of the United States as a nation bubbling with ferment and industry, dedicated to freedom, inde pendence, individualism and equality but with a tendency for tyranny that it barely kept in check was drawn 135 years ago, in 1835 by a 30yearold French aristocrat. Count Alexis de Tocqueville. ville.

title: Article 2  No Title
Burch Predicts F.C.C. Activity Will Level Off in Next Year
description: WASHINGTON, July 6 (AP) Dean Burch, chairman of the Federal Communications Corn mission, said today that the commission had been maybe hyperactive during his nine months as its head and may be due for a levelina off.

title: PEACEFUL UNION WINS JERSEY RACE
description: OCEANPORT, N. J., July 6 (AP)  Live Oak Plantation's Peaceful Union outlasted her rivals today after gaining the lead leaving the backstretch and won the $7,000 Smart Deb Purse at Monmouth Park.

title: BROOKS ROBINSON HITS GRAND SLAM
description: BALTIMORE, July 7  A grand slam home run by Brocks Robinson with nobody out in the 10th inning gave the Balti more Orioles a 62 victory to night in the start of the first important series played by the New York Yankees in five years.

title: Cairo Reports an Israeli Skyhawk Jet Hit
description: CAIRO, July 7An Israeli Skyhawk fighterbomber was reported to have been hit by antiaircraft fire today during a raid on Egyptian positions in the central sector of the Suez Canal.

title: Airline Ticket Tax Bill
description: WASHINGTON, July 7 (UPI) A bill was introduced in the House today to repeal a section of the Airport and Airway Revenue Act of 1970 that for bids tickets and advertisements from listing the exact amount of the new 8 per cent Federal users tax on airline tickets.

title: Main Temple Ruins at Angkor Reported Undamaged by Foe
description: PNOMPENH, Cambodia, July 7 (AP)  Communist troops who have pulled out of part of the ancient temple ruins at Angkor have left them undam aged after an occupation of more than a month, authorita tive sources reported today.

title: NEW LAW SETS OFF DISPUTE ON WHALES
description: The scientist who recently reported that whales sing songs of haunting beauty disclosed yesterday that strong efforts were being made to remove whales from the list of pro tected animals included in the newly enacted Federal endan gered species act.

title: Calm Police Official
description: ASBURY PARK, N. J.July 7A little more than two years ago, Thomas. Sydney Smith, the black Chief Of Police of Asbury Park, told members of the Asbury Park Kiwanis Club:

title: Sports of The Times
description: Big league ballplayers ordinarily don't have a high opinion of the intelligence quotients of the fansexcept when those fans say nice things about them. But now that the balloting has been completed for the starting lineups for the AllStar game at Cincinnati next Tuesday, the flanneled heroes should make grudging admission that not all fans are dopes.

title: Giants'
description: Bruce Maher, 32 years old, a defensive back of the New York Giants and a 10year National Football League player an nounced his retirement from professional football yesterday.

title: It's a Dirty, Brash City, A Youth Delegate Finds
description: About 300 youths from around he world learned yesterday that New York City has five boroughs, that city dog licenses cost more than marriage licenses and that taxi drivers often make obscene gestures at other drivers.

title: New York A. C. Saber Team Takes Sixth U.S. Title in Row
description: A graduate of the United States Naval Academy and two natives of Hungary carried the New York Athletic Club to its sixth straight national saber team championship at the Hotel Commodore yesterday.

title: Oil Exploration a Peril to Everglades
description: FORT LAUDERDALE, Fla., July 7A new threat to the Florida Everglades has been created by the people who had original claim to the two mil lion acres of virgin wilderness, the Seminole and Miccosukee Indians.

title: University Officers Praise Vanderbilt at Memorial
description: NEWPORT, R. I., July 7 (AP) Harold S. Vanderbilt, the rac ing yacht skipper and inventor of contract bridge, was eulo gized today at a memorial serv ice at Trinity Episcopal Church. He died Saturday at the age of 86.

title: Joseph Chamer to Marry Celia Menendez on Aug.29
description: Miss Celia Juliana Men endez, a research associate in the Columbia University department of biological sciences, will be married Aug. 29 in St. Ignatius Loyola Roman Catholic Church to Joseph Stephen Chamer, who is working for a Ph.D in biochemistry at the New York Medical College.

title: HOUSE UNIT VOTES LATIN BANK HELP
description: WASHINGTON, July 7The House Banking Committee ap proved today a further contri bution of more than $1billion over the next three years by the United States to the Inter American Development Bank.

title: Ostrowski and Franciewicz Gain Junior Golf Semifinals
description: OLD BROOKVILLE, L. I., July 7George Ostrowsld, Glen Cove High School, and Ed Franciewicz, Huntington High, will meet tomorrow in the semi final round of the top half of the draw in the Long Island Golf Association junior cham pionship. Play will continue over the 6,447yard, par 36, 3672 Brookville Country Club course.

title: 12 SENATORS URGE VOLUNTEER ARMY
description: WASHINGTON, July 7A dozen Senators, spanning the political spectrum, introduced a bill today that would end the military draft and establish an allvolunteer Army by next July 1.

title: SENATE UNIT ACTS ON BANK GROWTH
description: WASHINGTON, July 7The Senate Banking Committee ap proved the onebank holding company bill today in a version that is not only considerably less restrictive than.the one passed by the House but also less restrictive than that orig inally proposed by the Adminis tration.

title: BOND PRICES RISE, EXTENDING RALLY
description: The bond market's robust rally moved into its fourth week yesterday, gaining strength as prices continued to advance and interest rates kept moving downward.

title: MARJORIE PARADIS, NOVELIST, 84, DIES
description: Marjorie Bartholomew Para dis, author and widow of Adrian Frederick Paradis, died last Thursday at LeRoy Hospi tal. She was 84 years old and lived in Brooklyn and in Pleas antville. N. Y.

title: U.S. Car Painter Irks Paris HorseRacing Fans
description: PARIS, July 7Earl A. Scheib, a painter of automo biles, gave the racing crowd here a lesson in the art of horse trading last week but he outraged French hippic sensibilities because his jock ey's silks carried the head of a horse in profilesymbol in this country for a horsemeat shoe.

title: Northwest Airlines Struck By Clerical Workers Union
description: MINNEAPOLIS, Wednesday, July 8 (AP)A national strike by clerical workers of North west Airlines began at 2 this morning despite the company's offer of a 33.4 per cent pay in crease over three years.

title: Belgrade Invests in Impoverished South
description: PRISTINA, Yugoslavia  To an aging monk, the lonely cus todian of a famous 13thcentury Serbian Orthodox church near here, the gently rolling plain of Kosovo is the Serbian Siberia.

title: House Unit's Report On Vietnam Termed Whitewash by Aide
description: WASHINGTON, July 7A staff member of a special House committee that toured the war zone in Indochina today termed its report a whitewash and said the panel had suppressed significant findings.

title: Panthers Await Newton's Return
description: SAN FRANCISCO, July 7On the empty storefronts around the Black Panther headquarters here the posters of Huey P. Newton are worn and tattered now.

title: Market Place:
description: In case you haven't noticed it, the growth stocks have taken an awful pounding in the first six months of 1970. By contrast, the growth stocks were notable for their buoyancy in the bear market of 1969.

title: OFFICE IS INVADED IN OCEAN HILL RIFT
description: A shouting crowd of black youngsters invaded the Brook lyn office of Assemblyman Sam uel D. Wright yesterday after he announced the appointment of a district school superintend ent by the new local governing board of District 23, which in chides the Ocean HillBrowns ville section.

title: John T. French, Executive In Toledo Convention Group
description: TOLEDO, Ohio, July 7John T. French, executive vice presi dent of the Toledo Area Con vention Bureau, died of a heart ;attack last night while attend ing a meeting of Masonic of ficers as potentate of Toledo's Zenobia Shrine. He was 54 years old.

title: Mario Lanza's Mother Dies
description: LOS ANGELES, July 7 (Reut ers)  Mrs. Maria Lanza Co cozza, who launched the sing ing career of her son, Mario Lanza, died last night after a stroke. She was 65 years old. Mr. Lanza died of a heart at tack in a Rome clinic 11 years ago, and his mother became guardian of his four orphan children. Mrs. Cocozza is sur vived by, her husband, Antonio.

title: RULING IS PUT OFF ON 5TH AVE. COACH
description: A decision on the fate of Fifth Avenue Coach Lines, Inc., was postponed in Federal Dis trict Court yesterday, Judge Edward C. McLean gave in terested parties until Friday to file any further papers relating to the validity of proxies cast at the annual meeting June 15.

title: 7 Vice Presidents Elected To Board of Smith, Barney
description: Smith, Barney & Co., Inc., announced yesterday that seven vice presidents have been elected to the board of direc tors.

title: Dispute Over Railroad Firemen Began With Diesel Locomotives
description: In 1924, America's first die selpowered locomotive was built for the New York Central Railroad.

title: Interracial Camping Is a New Feature Of Fresh Air Fund
description: An experiment in interracial living is taking place in the woods of the Fresh Air Fund's camping center in Dutchess County.

title: City Issues Behavior Code For High School Students
description: A new policy statement that details the rights and re sponsibilities of the city's 275,000 high school students and declares that no student has the right to interfere with the education of his fellow students has been approved by the Board of Education.

title: Charles Tobias Is Dead at 72; Writer of Many Popular Songs
description: Charles Tobias, who with his brothers Harry and Henry wrote hundreds of songs for Broad way shows, films and individual singers, died yesterday of liver ailment at North Shore Hospital in Manhasset, L. I. He was 72 years old.

title: Democrats Charge Nixon With Performance Gap
description: WASHINGTON, July 7The Democratic National Com mittee, opening a novel televi sion assault on President Nixon, laid down the political theme tonight that the Republican Ad ministration was developing performance gap between its promises and its deeds.

title: Return Home Awaited
description: PARIS, July 7On a quiet suburban campus some played PingPong, some washed clothes, while others stood around wondering what their parents were thinking.

title: Weinberger Names Aide
description: WASHINGTON, July 7 (AP) Basil K. Mezines, now execu tive assistant to Caspar W. Weinberger, chairman of the Federal Trade Commission, has been named to head the com mission's newly formed Bureau of Competition. Mr. Mezines has been an antitrust lawyer with the F.T.C.

title: Heart Transplant Gains
description: STANFORD, Calif., July 7 (UPI)A retired Air Force major, Stanford University's 25th heart transplant patient, was reported today in satisfactory condition. He is Carlyle Townswick, 48 years old, who received his new heart in an operation performed Saturday night by a team of doctors headed by Dr. Norman A. Shumway.

title: Gustava de Rothschild Is Wed in Paris
description: PARIS, July 7Miss Gus tave E. de Rothschild, daugh ter of Baron and the Baroness Elie de Rothschild, was mar ried today in a religious cere mony to Marc E. Leland, general counsel for the Peace Corps in Washington. He is the eon of Mr. and Mrs. Her bert A. Leland of San Fran cisco.

title: Brokerage Move Set
description: In the latest of a series of Wall Street merger announce ments, Thomson & McKinnon Auchincloss, Inc., said yester day that it would acquire at least 15 branches of Blair & Co.. Inc.

title: Soviet Airlift of Supplies To Aid Peru Is Postponed
description: LIMA, Peru, July 7 (Reuters) An immense Soviet airlift of supplies to earthquakestricken northern Peru scheduled for to day has been postponed.

title: Radio
description: Music

title: Asbury Park Blacks List 21 Demands, Putting Emphasis on Jobs
description: ASBURY PARK, N. J., July The Mayor of this embattled city stood at the corner of Main Street and Springwood Avenue this afternoon and gave his evaluation of the cause of two days of rioting and looting here.

title: Lever Brothers Elects
description: J. Warren Moore has been elected a director of the Lever Brothers Company. He is senior vice presidentadministration of American Airlines, Inc. He was treasurer of Lever Brothers from 1958 until 1968, when he joined American Airlines.

title: U.S. TENNIS STARS UPSET IN SWEDEN
description: BAASTAD, Sweden, July 7 (AP)Three members of the United States Davis Cup squad were beaten at the start of the $33,000 Baasted open tennis tournament today.

title: Agnew of Red Gap
description: The U.S.I.A.'s investment of $80,000 in a splitscreen color film about Spiro T. Agnew for overseas audiences was doubtless justified both by world interest and by the need to explain the Vice President to puzzled friends of this country abroad. The United States has few public relations problems of greater magnitude.

title: National of North America And Trade Bank in Merger
description: The National Bank of North America, an affiliate of CIT Financial Corporation, an nounced yesterday its previ ously proposed consolidation with the Trade Bank & Trust Company, New York, had been consummated.

title: Festival Promoter Convicted
description: BLOOMINGTON, III., July 7 (AP)The promoter of a rock music festival at Kickapoo Creek was convicted today of criminal contempt of court for staging the event in violation of a court order. Judge Leland Simkins of Circuit Court with held sentence against L. David Lewis, promoter and owner or the farm where the festival was held, until he examines financial records.

title: SWISS SEEK MEANS TO CHANGE PARITY
description: GENEVA, July 7The Swiss Government announced formal ly today that it would move to transfer to it the authority now reserved to Parliament to alter the value of the Swiss franc.

title: McDonnell Douglas Gets $247.9Million Navy Job
description: The McDonnell Douglas Corporation received yesterday a Navy contract totaling $247.9million. Included in the award is a $121.6million award for RF4E reconnais sance aircraft and $59.5million for the TA4J trainer jet.

title: NIXON CALLS O.A.S. MODEL FOR WORLD
description: WASHINGTON, July 7In a gesture designed to convey his continuing interest in Latin American relations, President Nixon tonight praised the po litical, social and economic work of the Organization of American States as an example of regional cooperation for the world.

title: ROZELLE MOVES TO AVERT STRIKE
description: Commissioner Pete Rozelle moved yesterday to avoid strike in pro football. He sought to prolong the negotia tions between the Players Asso ciation and an owners commit tee.

title: Pilot of Ditched Plane Testifies Public Address Unit Was Out
description: SAN JUAN, P. R., July 7The pilot of a chartered DC9 jetliner that ran out of fuel and ditched in the Caribbean on May 2 testified today that he could not warn his passengers before the ditching because the plane's public address system was out of order.

title: AGNEW SEES NEED TO AID A MINORITY
description: WASHINGTON, July 7Vice President Agnew said today that there were too few policy making officials in the Federal Government who had a Spanish American heritage.

title: Domestic Air Express Elects
description: Martin Whitten was named yesterday as president and chief executive of Domestic Air Ex press, Inc. He succeeds Barrett M. Fisher, who remains a direc tor. Mr. Whitten had been pres ident and director of the Na tional Carloading Corporation, a unit of American Export In dustries. Inc.

title: Standard Diet for Premature Babies Is Questioned
description: A new study has raised the question of whether premature babies receive adequate nour ishment from standard for mulas.

title: 8 OFFERED PLACES ON CURTIS CUP TEAM
description: Cynthia Hill of South Haven, Mich., low amateur in the re cent United States women's open golf tournament, was one of eight golfers invited yester day by the United States Golf Association to represent the United States against Britain and Ireland in the Curtis Cup matches at the Brae Burn Coun try Club in West Newton, Mass., Aug. 7 and 8.

title: Sales of W. T. Grant Co. Grew 5.8% Last Month
description: The W. T. Grant Company, one of the country's major op erators of variety stores and department stores, reported yes terday a 5.8 per cent gain in June sales. Total volume rose to $97,032,841 from $91,730,907.

title: Phillips Meeting on July 30
description: The Phillips Petroleum Com pany said yesterday that its quarterly meeting of directors, usually scheduled for the sec ond Monday in July, would be adjourned until July 30 and held in Anchorage, Alaska, to allow directors to tour the com pany's operations there. Action on the thirdquarter dividend will be taken at that time.

title: U.S. FACES FRANCE IN TRACK TONIGHT
description: PARIS, July 7  The first United States track team to visit Paris since 1936 begins threemeet European series to morrow night against France.

title: Anxiety on Mideast: U.S. Sees New Urgency
description: WASHINGTON, July 7De spite some internal argument about specific Soviet deploy ments and longterm Soviet in tentions, the Nixon Administra tion is now negotiating on the Middle East with a new sense of urgency and anxiety.It has warned the Russiansand it is itself convincedthat Israel will go to great lengths to avoid losing con trol of the air over both banks of the Suez Canal. And it accepts the basic Israeli judg ment that improved Soviet air defense forces have been edged up to the canal zone, jeopardiz rig that control.

title: Letters to the Editor of The Times
description: To the Editor:

title: FILMS GIVEN PRIZES DESPITE FETE'S END
description: BERLIN, July 7 (Reuters)A Swedish and a French film shoWn at the Berlin Interna tional Film Festival, which col lapsed Sunday, won interna tional Critics Union prizes here today.

title: Drug Arrest in Boston
description: BOSTON, July 7 (UPI)Irene M. Kline, 22 years old, of Newton, Mass., was ar rested at Logan Airport early today when she claimed trunk that the police said con tained $250,000 worth of marijuana. The police said that the trunk had been under surveillance since it arrived from the West Coast four days ago.

title: DEFENSE GETS DELAY IN ADDONIZIO TRIAL
description: TRENTON, July 7The ex tortion conspiracy trial of Hugh J. Addonizio, former Mayor of Newark, and four other de fendants here was adjourned tonight until Thursday after defense lawyers told the court they were not yet ready to present their cases.

title: Television
description: Morning

title: A.E.C. DENIES STEPS AGAINST 2 CRITICS
description: WASHINGTON, July 7 (AP) The Atomic Energy Commis sion denied today published charges quoting two of its scientists as saying they had been persecuted by the com mission for having publicly criticized A.E.C. radiation safety policies.

title: Evers Brings Hope and Jobs In Year as Fayette's Mayor
description: FAYETTE, Miss., July 7One year as Mayor has not changed Charles Evers, but this tiny town will never be the same.

title: Sweig Trial Here Told He Posed as McCormack
description: A New York subcontractor testified yesterday that he had heard Nathan M. Voloshen and Dr. Martin Sweig say This is Speaker McCormack to tele phone callers in the Washington office of House Speaker John W. McCormack.

title: Pioneer Five Sends Davis To Floridians for Simmie Hill
description: PITTSBURGH, July 7 (AP)The Pittsburgh Pioneers traded Warren Davis, a forward, to the Miami Floridians today for Sim mie Hill, a former Midland (Pa.) high school star.

title: Miss Eckhaus To Be a Bride
description: Mr. and Mrs. Joseph Eck haus of New York have an nounced the engagement of their daughter, Miss Marilyn Eckhaus, to Mortimer J. Alt shuler Jr., son of the late Mr. Altshuler and the late Mrs. Rita Louise Alstone.

title: Agnew Watches Selling Well, but...
description: ANAHEIM, Calif., July 7 (UPI)A general practitioner has been selling Spiro Agnew wristwatches here for the last few weeks.

title: 2 Shot in Melee After PurseSnatching
description: An attempted pursesnatch ing on the upper West Side last night turned into a melee in which at least four persons, in cluding two policemen, were injured and 14 shots were fired.

title: Murder Hearing Is Secret
description: FORT BRAGG, N. C., July 7 (AP)  A hearing on murder charges against Capt. Jeffrey MacDonald, accused of slaying his pregnant wife and two chil dren, continued today behind closed doors. Col. Warren V. Rock, the presiding officer, re sumed the hearing in secret de spite an appeal to the Pentagon by Captain MacDonald's attor neys to keep it open. Colonel Rock said no word had been re ceived from the Pentagon.

title: 6 BLACKS ACQUITTED IN CONSPIRACY TRIAL
description: LOUISVILLE, July 7  The Louisville Black Six were ac quitted today of conspiracy charges filed in connection with racial disorders here in May, 1968.

title: Senate Rejects Space Cuts; Adds to Fund for Renewal
description: WASHINGTON, July 7The Senate narrowly rejected today two attempts by liberals to cut the nation's space budget as part of a campaign to reorient Government priorities toward everyday human needs.

title: Nearly 100 of Staff At Amex Are Laid Off
description: The American Stock Ex change has laid off nearly 100 more employes, spokesman confirmed yester day. The reduction follows the dismissal of 100 workers last May 1 and reduces the current staff to about 850.

title: U.S. to Help Saigon on Troops'
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, July 7President Nixon has prom ised the South Vietnamese Government $100million to build badly needed housing for its soldiers and their families, President Nguyen Van Thieu disclosed today.

title: Project to Recover Chemical in Plant Smoke Planned
description: BOSTON, July 7A large scale experimental project to re cover sulphur dioxide pollutant from power plant smoke and convert it into resalable com mercial chemicals will begin in 15 months under a plan an nounced here today.

title: Penn State Opens Memorial Display Of O'Hara's Works
description: John O'Hara's scorn for his critics lives again in a memorial exhibition of the writer's work which opened yesterday at the University Libraries of Pennsyl vania State University.

title: 46 SHOT IN RIOTING AT ASBURY PARK; CURFEW IMPOSED
description: ASBURY PARK, N. J., July Violence broke out anew this afternoon in the streets of this resort city, which has already been shaken by two nights of rioting in the predominantly black West Side ghetto.

title: FORD TOLD TO SELL SOME PARTS UNITS
description: DETROIT, July 7The Ford Motor Company today was or dered to sell its big spark plug plant and give up the spark plug business for 10 years, dis pose of a battery plant and give up the name Autolite, the trade name Ford used to build its replacement parts business.

title: Gulf Islands Seashore Bill Approved by House Panel
description: WASHINGTON, July 7 (AP) A bill to establish an 18,000 acre Gulf Islands National Sea shore off the coasts of Florida and Mississippi was approved today by a House Interior sub committee.

title: Avoiding More Penn Centrals...
description: In its last desperate efforts to avoid bankruptcy by seeking a $225million shortterm loan guarantee from the Department of Defense, the Penn Central sub mitted a confidential financial plan and forecast. This plan indicated that Penn Central's management expected to lose $271 million this year. Next year, however, it would have done better: management foresaw losses of only $221 million!

title: Foreign Affairs: Children of the House
description: LONDONThe persistent vi tality of Britain's Parliamentary system is in a sense symbol ically reaffirmed by the new House of Commons which for the first time in its history in cludes the fourth successive generation of one family, albeit a rather unusual family named Churchill.

title: PANTHERS SEEKING TESTS ON WITNESS
description: NEW HAVEN, July 7Law yers for Lonnie McLucas, Black Panther on trial here in the slaying of a party member suspected of being an informer, asked today that a psychiatrist of their choice be allowed to examine a key prosecution wit ness.

title: U.S. REAFFIRMS STAND ON MONEY
description: PARIS, July 7The United States has reaffirmed its posi tion in favor of greater ex changerate flexibility in the face of opposition, by France and by the staff of the Interna tional Monetary Fund in Wash ington.

title: CORNELIUS A. BURKE
description: ELIZABETH, N. J., July 7Cornelius A. Burke, a surveyor and a member of the Board of Public Works here for many years, died yesterday at St. Elizabeth's Hospital after short illness. He was 81 years old and lived at 728 South Street. He retired in 1956. Mr. Burke had long been a Dem ocratic leader here.

title: The Proceedings In the U.N. Today
description: Economic and Social Council Working Group on South ern Africa, Commission on Human Rights10:30 A. M.

title: BOB WOODHOUSE SCORES ON FILLY
description: While most of the jockeys were struggling to keep their horses from bearnig out on the final turn, Bob Woodhouse made his move aboard Arachne and the filly went on to cap ture the $15,000 feature at Aqueduct yesterday.

title: Lisbon Says Differences With Vatican Are Ended
description: LISBON, July 7 (Reuters)Premier Marcello Caetano of Portugal said today that the Pope's controversial audience last week with three antiPor tugese guerrilla leaders had been clarified.

title: New Books
description: The Night Crew, by J. R. Goddard (Little, Brown. $5.95). The ad ventures of a fourman fire fighting squad.

title: Article 1  No Title
Youth Jailed in Flag Wearing
description: HONEY LAKE, Calif., July (AP)A 19yearold student has been sentenced to serve 120 days in Lassen County Jail and to pay a $250 fine for wearing the American flag as a poncho. The sentence was handed down yesterday by Judge Scott Kirby. The lawyer for Greg Alinson, the student, said the conviction would be appealed.

title: Trucking Officials Approve Contract, See Rate Rises
description: CHICAGO, July 7 (UPI)National trucking industry offi cials have approved a new con tract with the International Brotherhood of Teamsters. The truckers predicted sharp, quick rate increases.

title: Ambition and Spontaneity of Coast Troupe Pay Off
description: LOS ANGELES  The Company Theater, the off Off Broadway theater of Los Angeles, was founded in 1967 by a group of students, most of them dropouts from the University of Southern Cali fornia. Despite many adver sities, and with no advertise ments, the group persisted until wordofmouth, nation al recognition, offers to tour (so far, all rejected), and small foundation grants caught up with it.

title: Miss Lauren Levy Is Married To Simon Adams in England
description: Miss Lauren Taylor Levy, daughter of Dr. and Mrs. Hyman Levy of New York, was married at the Registry Office in Oxford, England, yesterday to Simon Lester Adams, who is doing re search for his doctoral thesis in English history at Balliol College. He is the son of Mr. and Mrs. Jasper Bernard Adams of New York. His father is president of Wind sor & Newton, Inc., British artists supplies manufactur ers. Dr. Levy is a cardiol ogist.

title: Holiday Weekend Toll 540
description: CHICAGO, July 7 (AP)Traffic accidents during the Fourth of July weekend took 540 lives across the country. The final toll was well below the 611 counted a year ago, which was the highest for any threeday observance of the holiday. The National Safety Council had estimated in ad vance that 560 to 660 persons might die in traffic over the weekend.

title: Soviet Captures Team Trophy, Winning 5 GrecoRoman Titles
description: EDMONTON, Alberta, July (AP)The Soviet Union added to its goldmedal total at the world amateur GrecoRoman wrestling championships last night, winning five individual titles and taking the overall team trophy for the second suc cessive year. The Russians won last year in Argentina.

title: $2,472,025 Granted by U.S. To Combat Delinquency
description: WASHINGTON, July 7 (UPI) The Department of Health, Education and Welfare an nounced today grants to proj ects in certain model cities to conduct a wide variety of anti juvenile delinquency programs.

title: Advertising: 10Gallon Campaign for REA
description: When you walk into a news conference and they hand you a Stetson along with the press kit, you've got to figure something's up. Then when you realize that the three longhaired guys lounging in dolently against the wall are none other than Lois (George), Holland (Ron), Callaway (Jim), you're sure of it.

title: NEW U.S. ARMS AID DUE FOR CAMBODIA
description: WASHINGTON, July 7The Nixon Administration is draft ing plans for a $50million pro gram of military aid for Cam bodia in the coming year as part of its continuing effort to bolster Premier Lon Nol's Gov ernment against Communist forces.

title: Washington: For the Record
description: Appropriations. President Nixon signed a bill providing more than $6billion in new appropriations for the fiscal year 1970. More than half the money is for increased civilian and military pay.

title: Oil and Gas Searches Urged
description: WASHINGTON, July 7 (AP) Representative Edwin W. Ed wards, Democrat of Louisiana, urged today that the Interior Department allow a resumption of offshore oil and gas explora tions in the Gulf of Mexico. The department suspended all oil and gas lease sales in the area last February after a fire and leak at a Chevron Oil Com pany platform.

title: Ramsey Clark Attacks Nixon Record on Integration
description: WASHINGTON, July 7For mer Attorney General Ramsey Clark charged today that the Nixon Administration acted sluggishly against traditional school segregation, failed to act at all against new segrega tion techniques and then mis led the public on the extent of actual desegregation.

title: Miss Terril Wein to Be Bride Of Paul B. Lichtman, Lawyer
description: CLARION, Pa., July 7 Miss Terril Lynn Wein, a marketing research field di rector of N. T. Fouriezos & Associates, Inc., in New York, and Paul B. Lichtman, theatrical lawyer with the International Famous Agency, Inc., in New York, plan to be married on July 26 at the Pittsburgh Hilton.

title: Chief of Elizabeth Arden Announces His Retirement
description: Carl W. Gardiner announced yesterday his retirement as president of the Elizabeth Arden Sales Corporation after 21 years with the cosmetics producer and salon operator. He has been chief executive officer since the death in October, 1966, of Elizabeth Arden Graham, the company's founder.

title: WILLIAM E. RICHARDS
description: BELLPORT, L. I. July 7William E. Richards, chairman of the board of the Peoples National Bank of Long Island, died today in Brookhaven Hos nital after a short illness.

title: Text of Board's Statement on the Rights and Responsibilities of High School Students
description: In each high school there should be established an elec tive and representative stu dent government with offices open to all students. The stu dent government will estab lish reasonable standards for candidates for office. All stu dents should be allowed to vote in annual elections de signed to promote careful consideration of the issues and candidates.

title: DR. C. N. HUGH LONG, YALE PHYSIOLOGIST
description: HAMDEN, Conn., July 7 (UPI)  Dr. C. N. Hugh Long, former dean of the Yale University school of medicine and Sterling Professor Emeritus of Physiolo gy, died yesterday at Pema quid Beach, Me., apparently of a heart attack. He was 69 years old.

title: Sports Today
description: BASEBALL

title: TWO BRITONS REACH WORLD RIDING FINAL
description: LA BAULE, France, July (AP)  Two British riders, German and an Italian quali fied today for Friday's four man final of the world jumping championship.

title: 5 Children Die in Fire
description: PHILADELPHIA, July 7 (AP) Five children burned to death today in a quickspreading fire that engulfed their 7twostory row house in South Philadel phia.

title: 3 Groups in City Given $700,000
description: Three New York City cul tural and educational organ izations have received match ing grants totaling $700,000 from the National Endow ment for the Arts, it was learned yesterday.

title: STOCKS ON AMEX EXTEND DECLINE
description: For the 11th consecutive session, prices on the Ameri can Stock Exchange slumped yesterday. Its index closed at 19.63, down 0.12 points from the previous day. It was the lowest level since May 26 when it stood at 19.36.

title: Emily MacDonald Weds a Doctor
description: PHILADELPHIA, July 7Miss Emily Anne MacDon ald, daughter of Mrs. Percy MacDonald of Elkins Park, Pa., and the late Mr. Mac Donald, was married here to day to Dr. Francis Heed Ad ler, professor emeritus of ophthalmology at the Uni versity of Pennsylvania and immediate past president of the American Academy of Ophthalmology. The Rev. Tom Turney Edwards, rector of St. Paul's Episcopal Church, performed the ceremony in the garden at Cleve Gate, Dr. Adler's home in Chest nut Hill.

title: CITY THREATENING RENT REDUCTIONS IN BUILDING STRIKE
description: The Lindsay administration threatened yesterday to order rent cuts in buildings that have been struck by maintenance and service workers. The strike, which began early Mon day in Manhattan, was expected to spread to Queens, Brooklyn and Staten Island today.

title: Bridal Planned By Mary Kerr
description: Mrs. Andrew Kerr of To ronto has announced the en gagement of her daughter, Miss Mary Kerr, to James G. Wallach. He is the son of Mr. and Mrs. Ira D. Wallach of Scarsdale. N. Y.

title: Bridge:
description: Some plays are so spec tacular and improbable that it is hard to imagine them occurring in real life. The defensive play required by the diagramed deal was de scribed in a recent issue of the Bridge World by Robert Ewen, a talented young New York bridge writer. One suspects that he was em ploying the art of the novel ist rather than that of a reporter.

title: Dance: Moiseyev Magic
SIR ALLEN LANE, 67, OF PENGUIN BOOKS
description: LONDON, July 7Sir Allen Lane, founder and head of Penguin Books, died tonight of cancer in the hospital at North wood, Middlesex. His age was 67.

title: CITY UNION AWAITS FULLPAY PENSION
description: The chief negotiator of union that represents 120,000 city employes said yesterday that he expected to reach agree ment tomorrow on a new con tract with the city that would provide retirement with full pay after 40 years of service and half pay after 20 years.

title: BANKS'
BEAME HOLDS UP 2D CONSULTNG FEE
description: City Controller Abraham D. Beame asked the city's Board of. Ethics yesterday to inves tigate the roles of three city officials involved in two con sultant contracts totaling $1.7 million.

title: Cambodian Town Is Just a Ruin
description: SAANG, Cambodia, July 7 No one lives in this once flourishing market town any more, and there is hardly a place left to live.

title: NEW HAVEN SEEKS RULING ON PENNSY
description: The New Haven Railroad's trustee, Richard Joyce Smith, has asked the Federal Court in New Haven to permit him to intervene in the reorganization proceedings of the Penn Central Transportation Company.

title: Soviet History of Siberia Denounces Peking Claims
description: MOSCOW, July 7, (AP)A new Soviet history of Siberia accuses Communist China of trying to create a territorial problem over large stretches of Siberian lands.

title: Tories Keeping British Economy Tight
description: LONDON, July 7  Britain's economic squeeze will be con tinued by the Conservative Gov ernment for the time being, lain MacLeod, Chancellor of the Ex chequer, told the House of Commons today.

title: Senegal Is Curbing Guinean Guerrillas
description: ZIGUINCHOR, Senegal, July 7 (AP)Senegal supports the efforts of nationalist guerrillas to free Portuguese Guinea from Lisbon's rule, but she has, clamped down on some of the guerrillas activities.

title: JONATHAN ADAMS
description: CROTONONHUDSON, N. Y., July 7Jonathan Adams, the 20yearold son of David Adams, executive vice president of the National Broadcasting Company, died today at Phelps Memorial Hospital after a bicycle accident Monday night. He lived at 142 Old Post Road here.

title: Rent Law a 3Way Chess Match; Profit, People, Politics the Pawns
description: Why does a fiveroom rent controlled apartment on River side Drive cost $500 a month when an apartment identical in size and layout on the floor below cost only $240?

title: SOYBEAN FUTURES CLOSE IRREGULAR
description: Following Monday's sharp break, futures prices of soy beans and wheat closed irregu larly yesterday on the Chicago Board of Trade.

title: Butcher &
description: PHILADELPHIA, July 7 (AP)Butcher & Sherrerd, one of Pennsylvania's largest broker age firms, plans to reduce spending, cut some salaries and trim its staff by 20 per cent.

title: Roundup: Pirates Keep Pace With Clemente's Bat
FIREMEN STRIKE 3 BIG RAIL LINES; NIXON CALLS HALT
description: WASHINGTON, July 7 Railroad firemen and their union allies struck three of the nation's largest railroads to day, disrupting freight and commuter traffic in 16 states. This evening, President Nixon invoked his emergency powers and ordered that the strike be halted.

title: led Harris to Direct Broadway Comedy in the Fall
description: Jed Harris, the 70yearold producerdirector who has become a legend in his own time, is returning to Broadway after an absence of 14 years. In late Sep tember, he plans to produce and direct a comedy called Great Day for the Race by Angus Dalrymple.

title: Article 3  No Title
Vacuum Cleaner Racer Makes Debut Sunday
description: Just when the Canadian American Challenge Cup needs a shot in the arm, along comes Jim Hall to the rescue with a radically new race car based on the ground effect principle. In esthetic terms the Chaparral 2J is boxy and homely; but aero dynamically it is beautiful so much that Hall thinks it can win a few Can Am races. To give the Chevrolet pow ered 2J an appro priately theatrical debut, Hall has hired the most expensive foot in racing, Jackie Stew art, to drive it in next Sun day's CanAm at Watkins Glen, N. Y. Stewart, the world driving champion, be gan testing the Chaparral yesterday at the Glen. This will be Stewart's first Can Am race.

title: STRIKE THREATENING 2 BRONX HOSPITALS
description: Negotiators for the Albert Einstein College of Medicine and Local 1199, Drug and Hos pital Workers, sought last night to avert a strike set for 6 A.M. today that would affect 1,800 employes and 1,550 pa tients at two city hospitals.

title: Learnin+Experience=Knowledge, Survey Shows
IRVING H. DUFINE
description: STAMFORD, Conn., July 7Irving H. DuFine, president of DuFine & Co., Inc., a New York advertising agency, died at his home here today, apparently of a heart attack. He was 60 years old.

title: Driver Belts Ordered On Trucks and Buses
description: WASHINGTON, July 7 (UPI)The Government an nounced today a new regula tion requiring drivers of com mercial trucks and buses in interstate commerce to wear seat belts beginning next year.

title: Miner's Widow Sues
description: BENTON, Ill. July 7 (AP)A miner's widow has filed suit seeking $175,000 in damages from a coal company for the death of her husband from lung disease.

title: Brezhnev Doctrine Omitted
description: BUCHAREST, July 7 (AP)Diplomats said the. Rumanians had resisted Soviet efforts to insert in the treaty the so called Brezhnev Doctrine of limited sovereignty that was used to justify the Sovietled military intervention in Czecho slovakia in 1968. The doctrine is named for Leonid I. Brezhnev, the Soviet party leader.

title: 2 Korean Red Agents Killed On Peak Near Seoul Airport
description: SEOUL, South Korean, July 7The Government announced tonight that South Korean troops killed two North Korean agents in a gunfight this after noon on a mountain six miles west of Kimpo International Airport. The airport is 15 miles west of the center of Seoul.

title: Italians Favoring Divorce Assail Cabinet Resignation
description: ROME, July 7Some 50 members of the Italian Divorce League picketed the Chamber of Deputies and the Senate this afternoon to protest against the resignation of Premier Mario Rumor's Cabinet. They said the action would delay passage of a bill legalizing divorce.

title: Firemen Support Buckley
description: James L. Buckley, the Con servative party's Senate candi date, formally received the backing of the Uniformed Fire fighters Association within the city yesterday with words of appreciation for an endorsement from men who have not wav ered in their confidence in America or in their belief in the values for which she stands.

title: ROCK GROUP SPARKS BUCHAREST MELEES
description: BUCHAREST, July 7 (UPI)The first official appearance in Rumania by an American rock bandBlood, Sweat and Tears broke up in a nearriot, wit nesses said today.

title: Peace Corps Authorization Of $98Million Clears House
description: WASHINGTON, July 7The House passed today a $38.8 million authorization bill for the Peace Corps by a vote of 316 to 46. The measure now goes to conference with the Senate.

title: Man Who Shot Neighbor Wins Insurance Claim
description: TRENTON, July 7 (UPI)The New Jersey Supreme Court ruled yesterday that a homeowner's liability in surance policy covered a case in which he shot his neighbor.

title: Power Struggle Over Housing
description: The thousands of tenants already inconvenienced by the building service workers strike and the thou sands more who will suffer if the strike spreads are essentially victims of a hopeless power play by organized landlords. The real contest is between the landlords who have refused to sign a contract with Local 32B of the Building Service Employes Interna tional Union and the City Council. By provoking the strike of their elevator operators, doormen, superin tendents and other employes, the landlords are trying to force the City Council to reconsider its recently passed rent control bill to provide more generous rent increase provisions. The immediate pressure is on the Mayor, who has the bill before him for signature.

title: Russians Assail Puppet Delegates At Youth Parley
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., July 8The Soviet delega tion to the World Youth As sembly, sounding like Mos cow's regular diplomatic team, today demanded the exclusion of representatives from the puppet nations of South Korea, South Viet nam and Nationalist China.

title: BUCHAREST SIGNS PACT WITH SOVIET
description: BUCHAREST, July 7Ru mania and the Soviet Union signed a new treaty of friend ship here today, extending 20year pact concluded in 1948.

title: Foes Ready for City Cable TV Hearing
description: Opponents of New York City's plan to negotiate future cable television agreements by competitive bidding are pre paring arguments for public hearings before the Board of Estimate on July 23.

title: HERITAGE TRAILS IN NEWPORT SAIL
description: NEWPORT, R. I., July 7A sparkling scene of unlimited visibility was dulled by some very limited competition today in the opening round of the America's Cup observation trials.

title: JARRING'S MISSION HELD IN ABEYANCE
description: GENEVA, July 7Secretary General Thant said at a news conference here today that he and Dr. Gunnar V. Jarring, his special representative for the Middle East, had agreed not to reactivate Dr. Jarring's peace mission for the mo ment.

title: REAGAN DENOUNCES HATFIELD'S REMARK
description: SACRAMENTO, Calif., July 7 Gov. Ronald Reagan today angrily described as rid iculous a statement by a fellow Republican, Senator Mark O. Hatfield of Oregon, that the party might turn to Mr. Reagan for its Presidential nominee in 1972 and deny re nomination to President Nixon unless economic conditions im proved and the Vietnam War ended.

title: Canada Opens Crash Inquiry
description: TORONTO, July 7 (Canadian Press)A fiveman inquest jury was sworn today to deter mine the cause of the crash Sunday of an Air Canada DC8 jetliner that killed 108 persons. Dr. H. B. Cotnam, chief coroner for Ontario, took the jury on a tour of the crash area four miles north of Toronto Inter national Airport, then ad journed the inquest until Sep tember.

title: Pro Taken to Cleaners Recovers His $20,006
description: ST. ANDREWS, Scotland, July 7 (Reuters)After win ning the United States Open, Tony Jacklin tucked away the prize money in a suitand got taken to the cleaners.

title: U.S. Aid for Piano Workers
description: WASHINGTON, July 7 (AP) Unemployed workers of the Story and Clark Piano Com pany, Grand Haven, Mich have been declared eligible for Federal assistance because of increased imports of pianos. Deputy Under Secretary of Labor George H. Hildebrand announced the certification today.

title: SUBWAY FOREMEN AUTHORIZE STRIKE
description: The Subway Supervisors As sociation voted 635 to 14 last night to authorize a strike against the Transit Authority to back its wage demands in contract to replace the one that expired June 30.

title: Mr. John Punches His Hats Into Shape
description: Many years ago (perhaps after he made Greta Garbo the slouch hat that became her trademark) Mr. John, who scorns modesty in any form, crowned himself Em peror of Fashion.

title: Greely Gets Racing Posts
description: LOUISVILLE, Ky., July 7 (AP) Bill Greely, 32 years old, was named assistant racing secre tary at Churchill Downs and Keeneland today.

title: Daily News Going to 10c In the Metropolitan Area
description: The Daily News announced yesterday that, starting tomor row, the price of its paper would be increased from 8 to 10 cents in the city and suburban areas.

title: Marjorie Rambeau Dies at 80; Broadway and Screen Actress
description: PALM SPRINGS, Calif., July 7 (AP)  Marjorie Rambeau, whose stage and screen career spanned almost 70 years and who was twice nominated for Academy Awards, died at her home here yesterday at the age of 80.

title: MONDAY NIGHT FIGHT
description: New Orleans  Percy Pugh, 143 pounds, New Orleans, out pointed Adrian Davis, 142, Wash ington, 10 rounds.

title: H.E.W. Assistant Secretary Leaves for University Post
description: WASHINGTON, July 7James F. Kelly, Assistant Secre tary, Controller, of the De partment of Health, Education and Welfare, announced his resignation today.

title: 31st DownHow Many to Go?
description: The CenterLeft Government of Premier Mariano Rumor, Rome's 31st since World War II, took office only three months ago after a sevenweek crisis, the longest since 1945. Its resignation and the increasing frequency and duration of political crises in Italythe current one is the fifth in two yearsstein from factional feuding within the governing Christian Dem ocratic and Socialist parties over two interrelated issues: social reform and cooperation with the Com munists.

title: ALWYN LEE, WRITER FOR TIME MAGAZINE
description: Alwyn Lee, a contributing editor of Time magazine, died in Rome Monday after a short illness. He was 58 years old and in recent years lived at villa near Rome. Formerly he lived at the Finney Farm in CrotononHudson. N. Y.

title: Bonn and Warsaw Open Parley on Consular Ties
description: WARSAW, July 7 (UPI)West Germany and Poland opened talks today on estab lishing consular relations.

title: Firemen, in Program to Curb Harassment, Talk Things Over With TeenAgers
description: The fireman was trying to explain the frustration of struggling to turn on a hydrant as neighborhood children stand around and jeer, and his audience of youngsters looked more or less sympathetic.

title: Napoles to Defend Title
description: VIENNA, July 7 (AP)Jose Mantequila Napoles of Mexico, the world welterweight cham pion, will defend his title against European champion Hans Orsolics of Austria, the European titleholder, at the Vienna Stadhalle Sports Arena Nov. 20.

title: Mailers at Post Return to Work as Court Directs
description: Bowing to a court's tempo rary restraining order, about 40 mailers yesterday suspended chapel or union, meeting during working hours at The New York Post that would have crip pled production and halted dis tribution of the papers.

title: Books of The Times
description: The rapid deployment and support of a force of over one quarter of a million men to an area 10,000 miles from our shores clearly demonstrates that our logis tics system has that capability. Never be fore has this country been able to field and support in combat so large a force in so short a time over so great a distance.

title: News Summary and Index
description: International The United Nations Secretary General, U Thant, said at a news conference in Geneva yesterday that he and Dr. Gunnar V. Jarring, his special representative for the Middle East, had agreed not to reactivate Dr. Jarring's mission at the present time. Mr. Thant said, however, that the Swedish dip lomat could return to New York or the Middle East whenever he thought the situa tion justified it. [Page 1, Column 5.]

title: Arms Talk Session Held
description: VIENNA, July 7 (Reuters)The United States and the Soviet Union held their 22d ses sion of the strategic arms [limitations talks today.

title: I.O.S. INCORPORATING A NEW GERMAN UNIT
description: GENEVA, July 7Investors Overseas Services announced today another Internal shakeup with the ousting of Erich Mende, former West German Vice Chancellor, from the Mu tualfund empire.

title: Varied Line Wanted
description: The Northrop Corporation and the Gates Rubber Com pany have begun preliminary discussions on a possible pur chase by Northrop of Gates's majority holding of the Gates Learjet Corporation. A spokes man indicated the talks were of such a preliminary nature that no actual dollar value could be set at this time.

title: HOUSE PANEL LIMITS TV CAMPAIGN FUNDS
description: WASHINGTON, July 7 (AP)A Senatepassed bill to limit broadcast spending by candi dates for Federal offices in gen eral elections was expanded by a House Commerce subcommit tee today to cover races for Governor and primaries.

title: Soviet Orbits Cosmos 352
description: MOSCOW, July 7 (AP)  The Soviet Union launched today No. 352 in its series of unmanned Cosmos satellites, Tass reported. The official press agency said that the craft was orbiting the earth every 89.5 minutes at an angle of 51.8 degrees, ranging 192 to 127 miles from the earth.

title: McBrides, With a 68, Take FatherandSon Golf Title
description: LOCUST VALLEY, LI., July 7  Joseph McBride and his son, Michael, of the Arcola Country Club, posted a 34, 34 68 and won the Metropolitan Golf Association fatherandson championship today. McBride had won in 1964, 65 and 66 with an older son, Terry. Play was over the 6,516yard, par71 Piping Rock Club course.

title: Note to Policy Makers
description: The latest shareholder cen sus by the New York Stock Ex change shows there are 30.85 million American investors. Be hind the statistics are some very real political considera tions for the policymakers in Washington and for the representa tives of the na tion's voters in Congress. One out of four adult Americans is now a shareholder, which means one of four potential voters either owns stock directly in Amer ican corporations or owns stock indirectly through a mutual fund.

title: GiveAways by Banks Roil Retailers
description: Bankers don't like it and retailers don't like it, but the consumer seems to love it. It's as if you were getting something for nothingal most.

title: Critic of Islam Is Acquitted in Lebanon
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, July 7The Lebanese penal court of appeals acquitted a Syrian writer, Dr. Sadiq Galal alAzm, on a charge of having criti cized Islam and fomented strife among religious factions. The decision was widely regarded as a milestone in the struggle for freedom of thought and expression in Arab lands.

title: Grand Jury Criticizes Poor Planning by Yonkers in Hiring SnowRemoval Contractors
description: WHITE PLAINS, July 7A special Westchester County grand jury has blamed poor planning and mismanagement by city officials on all levels of responsibility for the dif ficulties surrounding snow re moval in Yonkers after the big snowston of Feb. 9, 1969.

title: 3,500 Stranded Students Get Airlift Home as Agency Fails
description: PARIS, July 7 (AP)Hun dreds of young Americans flew home from Europe today in an emergency airlift arranged for 3,500 students temporarily stranded by the financial col lapse of a travel agency in Cin cinnati, Ohio.T. Budge Hyde, acting presi dent of the agency, Word Academy, Inc., said in Rome he hoped to have all the student, home within five or six days The agency has filed for bank ruptcy, spokesmen said.

title: Drunk Tests Mostly Positive
description: LONDON (AP)  More than half the 51,403 breath tests given to English and Welsh motorists last year showed the drivers had had too much to drink.

title: Bargain at Charley's Aunt
description: Charley's Aunt, the revival of the Brandon Thomas farce, now playing at the Brooks At kinson Theater, will admit all children under 14 years of age who are accompanied by an adult at half price, starting to day.

title: Democrats Cheer Goldberg's Attack on Governor
description: Arthur J. Goldberg, the Dem ocratic candidate for Governor, was loudly cheered yesterday at a meeting of his party when he attacked Republican policies and Governor Rockefeller's sup port of them.

title: ... as the Rails Are Struck Again
description: The strike of the United Transportation Union against three railroads over the elimination of thou sands of firemen's jobs could scarcely have come a worse time from the standpoint of the financially beleaguered railroad industry.

title: Retail Store Sales Fell by 1% in May After April Gain
description: WASHINGTON, July 7Retail sales declined 1 per cent in May after a sizable increase in April, the Com merce Department reported today.

title: Aussie Surfer Triumphs
description: DURBAN, South Africa, July 7 (UPI)Midget Farrelly, an Australian surler, won the Durban 500 international com petition today and the first prize of $1,400.

title: Baudouin Back in Belgium After a Tour of the Congo
description: BRUSSELS, July 8  King Baudouin returned tonight from a tour of the Congo that marked the newfound friend ship between Belgium and her former colony after years of bloodshed and mutual distrust.

title: $40 Million U.S. Aid for Arts on Way
description: In the Congressional clamor over major issues like the war in Indochina and the troubled economy, it has gone almost unnoticed that Con gress has agreed with the President that the arts and humanities should have sub stantially increased Federal support.

title: Fresh Yankee Wins in Quebec For International Trot Berth
description: POINTE AUX TREMBLES, Quebec, July 7Fresh Yankee, a familiar figure in international trotting circles, captured the Canadian Trotting Champion ship at Richelieu Park tonight. The victory automatically moved Fresh Yankee at Roose velt Raceway on the night of July 18.

title: JORDAN IN ACCORD WITH GUERRILLAS
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, July 7A fourman committee represent ing the United Arab Republic, the Sudan, Libya and Algeria has worked out a formula that it believes will insure future good relations between the Palestinian commandos and the Jordanian Government.

title: In a Medieval Setting, a Banquet Fit for Knights
description: TENAFLY, N.J.  What was it like to be alive in the Middle Ages? Drs. Bard and Madeleine Cosman may not know exactly, but they can certainly make a good guess.

title: Pesticide Hearings Set
description: ALBANY, July 7The State Department of Environmental Conservation will hold a public hearing on pesticides on Aug. 3 in New York City. Governor Rockefeller's office also an nounced today that hearings would be held in Rochester on Aug. 5 and in Albany on Aug. 7.

title: Trade Legislation Taken Up  in House
description: WASHINGTON, July 7 The House Ways and Means Committee began detailed con sideration of trade legislation today and tentatively decided to give President Nixon modest tariffcutting authority.

title: City Acting to Publicize The Firefighter's Task
description: To help curb the harass ment of firefighters, Mayor Lindsay promised yesterday steps to improve public ap preciation of the firefight er's job.

title: Play to Be Benefit For Lunch Project
description: EAST HAMPTON, L. I., July 7Guild Hall here will be the scene of the Yale Repertory production of Ovid's Metamorphosis on Friday, to aid East Hampton's Year Round Head Start. The privately financed project provides hot lunches for its 3to 5yearold children.

title: Obituary 1  No Title
description: Announcements of deaths marriages, births and engagements may be tele phoned to OXford 53311 until 11 P.M. in suburban offices. 9:00 A.M. to 4:30 P.M. Monday through Friday Newark (201) MArket 33900; White Plains (914) WHite Plains 95300; Hempstead (516) IVanhoe 36660; Commack (516) 5435400; Stamford (203) 3487767.

title: PATZIER IS VICTOR ON JERSEY TURF
description: OCEANPORT, N. J., July (AP)Fred W. Hooper's Patzier charged from nexttolast today under Garth Patterson and won the $10,000 Summer Scandal Purse at Monmouth Park.

title: 2 WOMEN SAILORS IN TIE FOR LEAD
description: GREENWICH, Conn., July 7  The American Yacht Club crew of Rye, N.Y., with Mrs. Rudolph J. Schaefer 3d, as skip per, and the Larchmont Y.C., Mrs. Susan Houdingas helmswoman, tied for the lead for the women's sailing cham pionship of Long Island Sound today after four races in the 37th annual Syce Cup regatta were held off the Belle Haven Club.

title: NEW LOAN IS SOUGHT BY TRANS CARIBBEAN
description: WASHINGTON, July 7 (AP) Trans Caribbean Airways has asked the Civil Aeronautics Board for permission to borrow an additional $2million from American Airlines to meek debts on which T.C.A. is in de fault and can no longer post. pone payments.

title: Rams'
description: TAMPA, Fla., July 7 (AP)Larry Smith, running back for the Los Angeles Rams, injured the hamstring muscle in his right leg yesterday while run ning 40yard daghes with Flor ida quarterback John Reaves.

title: BREAKFAST CEREALS FACE TRUST STUDY
description: WASHINGTON, July 1 (UPI) The Federal Trade Commis sion ordered today an investi gation into the breakfast cereal industry to determine whether sugar coatings and cartoon commercials were hiding puffedup prices and a lack of vigorous competition.The antitrust study marks the Government's first formal look at whether oligopoly control of an industry hinders free com petition. An oligopoly is an in dustry controlled by a few com panies.

title: Jack lin Choice as 134 Tee Off In Today's British Open Golf
description: ST. ANDREWS, Scotland, July  For many years a pres tige title to be seized by some interloper from abroad, the British Open starts tomorrow with a native son, Tony Jacklin, as the firm favorite in the cast of 134.

title: NET FOR ELI LILLY ADVANCED IN HALF
description: Eli Lilly & Co. achieved rec ord sales and earnings in the first half of this year, it report ed yesterday, despite a smaller secondquarter gain than in the first three months.

title: Panel Asks National Health Insurance
description: WASHINGTON, July 7A detailed proposal for compre hensive national health insur ance was made public today by a private group of influential persons in medicine, philan thropy, civil rights and the Congress.

title: Secret Irish Visit Deplored by Home
description: LONDON, July 7The sur prise visit to Belfast by the Irish Republic's Minister for External Affairs, Dr. Patrick Hillery, was officially deplored in Britain today.

title: Knicks Star Starts an Ad Agency
description: Dick Barnett, ad man, will be working right next door to Dick Barnett, basketball star. Terribly convenient.

title: Angolan View: The War Is Here to Stay
description: LUANDA, AngolaThe ma jestic fortress that dominates the bay of this bustling capital of Portuguese Angola was once a museum, but it has served as headquarters for the Portu guese Army since the national ist guerrilla offensive began in 1961. Now there is a campaign under way to turn the 17th century Sao Miguel Fortress back into a museum.

title: Article 2  No Title
Rogers Pledges Removal Of Nerve Gas on Okinada
description: TOKYO, Wednesday, July 8 (Reuters)  Secretary of State William P. Rogers promised Japan today that the Nixon Ad ministration would do every thing pOssible for the early re moval of nerve gas from the island of Okinawa, the Japa nese Foreign Minister, Kiichi Aichi, said today.

title: Westbury Fashions Deal
description: David Rosenthal, chairman of Westbury Fashions, Inc., has purchased for cash 165,500 shares of the apparel concern's common stock from Hy Rabin, president, and Marcus Rabin, a former officer, director and principal shareholder. As a re sult of the sale, Mr. Rosenthal now owns 165,500 common shares and Hy Rabin owns 172,000.

title: DOW DROPS BY 6.30 TO END AT 669.36
description: Stock prices drifted lower yesterday after a rally attempt at midsession failed to generate buying enthusiasm. The Dow Jones industrial average, finish ing once again at its lowest level of the day, dropped 6.30 points to 699.36.

title: PRICES OF STOCKS EASIER IN LONDON
description: The London stock market caused slightly yesterday as lack of buying interest brought a mark down in prices by deal ers.

title: Teacher Ability Seen Gaining as Issue
description: Albert Shanker, president of the United Federation of Teach ers, predicted yesterday that accountability of teachers for their performance might re place economic issues as the major point of conflict in New York's public school system.

title: 4 Indicted in Bronx for Alleged Sewer Service of Summonses in Civil Cases
description: Four processservers were indicted in the Bronx yester day for swearing that they had personally served summonses when, it was alleged, they had not actually done so.

title: BOMB BLAST ROCKS HAITI'S CONSULATE
description: Three persons were injured yesterday when a pipe bomb exploded at the Haitian Con sulate here. A short time later, explosive devices were found at Portuguese and South African Government offices here.

title: Nixon Signs Bill to Provide Social Security Protection
description: WASHINGTON, July 7 (AP)  President Nixon signed to day legislation to prevent So cial Security beneficiaries from being shortchanged despite this year's acrosstheboard in crease.

title: Embassy Knows of Cages
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, July 7 (Reuters)American officials who advise the South Vietnam ese on prison matters were aware of the tiger cages that hold about 500 men and women prisoners on Con Son, a United States Embassy spokesman said here tonight.

title: Fiddler, by a Turkish Troupe, Gets Warm Receptipo in Athens
description: ATHENS, July 7A Turkish porduction of Fiddler on the Roof before a Greek audience may sound like Babel, but there it is spelling success.

title: Miss Hutchinson And John Phelan Engaged to Wed
description: NEWPORT BEACH, Calif., July 7Mr. and Mrs. John Monks Starr Hutchinson have announced the engage ment of their daughter, Miss Wynne Starr Hutchinson, to John Hugh Phelan of New York, son of the late John Phelan and the late Mrs. Mar garet Courtney Phelan.

title: GROTE AND AGEE HELP DOWN CARDS
RISE IN STATE AID IS PROMISED CITIES
description: Governor Rockefeller said yes terday that despite preliminary census figures indicating a sharp decline in urban populations the state's cities would actually re ceive more unrestricted finan cial aid in the 197172 fiscal year.

title: Economics Chief Says Saigon Plans Devaluation Move Soon
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, July 7Economics Minister Pham Kim Ngoc said today that the Government planned to carry out a devaluation of the piaster this summer in deed, if not in name.

title: U.S. Lacrosse Team Loses
description: ADELAIDE, Australia, July 7 (Reuters)A touring American lacrosse team, the Boston Lan cers, was defeated 238, by the Victoria State team today.

title: Executive Changes
description: Richard C. Bateson has been elected a vice presi dent of the International Telephone & Telegraph Corporation. He formerly was an associate general counsel.

title: DISCLOSURE RULES URGED FOR BROKERS
description: WASHINGTON, July 7An investment analyst who said he was speaking in the name of newly created National Share holders Association told Con gress today that stockbrokers should be required to make the same disclosures about the operation of their own firms as publicly held corporations were.

title: The Men Who Tell City How to Run the City
description: The corporation that talked the Federal Government out of extra overseas bomber bases has helped to talk the New York City government into revision of rent controls, slip pery water for its fire engines and a reassignment of police detectives in a sharp break with tradition.

title: Commercial Paper Storm Abates
description: The commercial paper mar ket, which has been the center of the financial storm that has swept through Wall Street since the default of the Penn Cen tral Transportation Company appears to have passed through the worst of its crisis.

title: Politician, Not Diplomat
description: DUBLIN, July 8On Mon day afternoon in Belfast women and old men stood in the doorways of their tight row houses in the Roman Catholic Falls Road area and talked of the British Army raid of the weekend, of the curfew and of the battles be tween Catholics and soldiers. in which five civilians were killed.

title: Hong Kong Bans Concubines
description: HONG KONG, July 8 (Reu ters)Hong Kong's Legislative Council passed a law today banning the ancient Chinese custom allowing men to take concubines. The law, which will como into force next year, says: No man may take a concu bine and no woman may ac quire the status of a concu bine.

title: BRAZIL IS READY TO ELECT AIDES
description: RIO DE JANEIRO, July 8Gen. Emilio G. Medici, the President of Brazil, today named the last three of 22 candidates for state guberna torial elections in all of Brazil's states next Oct. 3.

title: SAIGON DISCLOSES DRIVE IN CAMBODIA
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, July A (Reuters)The South Viet namese military command an nounced the start of a new operation in southeastern Cam bodia today.

title: Jury Sketch by a Defendant Causes Delay in Tate Case
description: LOS ANGELES, July 8 (Reu ters)A courtroom sketch led today to a further delay in the trial of four defendants ac cused in the murder of Sharon Tate, the actress and others.

title: ORIOLES TRIUMPH WITH3RUN RALLY
U. S. Notifies Seoul of Its Plan For Removal of Some Troops
description: WASHINGTON, July 8The State Department said today that the United States had offi cially informed the Government of South Korea of its intention to withdraw some of the 60,000 American troops in that coun try.

title: In The Nation: Family Assistance in Need of Help
description: WASHINGTON, July 8The socalled family assistance pro gram is a legislative Janus that probably could have emerged only from a conservative Ad ministration. On the one hand it provides for putting able bodied welfare recipients to work and allows them to keep a percentage of what they earn. Thus it holds out, to those who regard welfare recipients as deadbeats, the possibility of people working themselves off the rolls.

title: ROGERS GIVES SATO PLEDGE ON OKINAW A
description: TOKYO, July 8 (AP)Sec retary of State William F. Rogers told Premier Eisaku Sato today that the breakdown in the textile negotiations between the two Governments last month would not affect the agreement on the Okinawa to Japanese rule in 1972, a high United States official said.

title: Penguin, Paperback House, Will Be Merged Into S. Pearson, British Holding Company
description: LONDON, July 8  Penguin Books, the great paperback house, is to be taken over by S. Pearson & Son, a British holding company with major publishing interests.

title: STOCKS ON AMEX SHOW SMALL RISE
description: Stocks on the American Stock Exchange reversed the long downward trend yesterday and moved up as measured by the exchange's index. It closed at 19.76. un 0.13.

title: Finley Short of Cash To Close Seals Deal
description: Charles O. Finley, the owner of baseball's Oakland Ath letics, failed to meet the $4.5million purchase price for the National Hockey League's Oakland Seals, Trans National Communications Inc., an nounced late last night.

title: Nixon's Science Panel Weighs Setting Up Policy Organization
description: WASHINGTON, July 8 The President's Science Advi sory Committee is considering the merits of setting up a new organization to help guide na tional science policy.

title: Moroccan Referendum Set On Democratic Constitution
description: RABAT, Morocco, July 8King Hassan II announced to night that a new Moroccan con stitution would be submitted to a national referendum July 24 and that if it was approved, Morocco would return to par liamentary democracy with legislative elections next month.

title: Navigator in Ditching of DC9 Scores Procedures
description: SAN JUAN. P.R. July 8A crewman who survived the ditching of a DC9 jetliner in the Caribbean May 2 leveled sharp criticism today at many of the airline industry's stand and emergency ocean ditching procedures.

title: Chester Stratton, Actor, Dead; Played Variety of Feature Roles
description: LOS ANGELES, July 8Ches ter Stratton, an actor whose career included the theater radio, television and motion pictures, died at his home here yesterday apparently of a heart attack or a stroke. He was 57 years old.

title: BALTIMORE JUDGE DROPS LEAK CASE
description: BALTIMORE, July 8Federal District Judge Roszel C. Thom sen decided today to drop his attempt to get The New York Times to divulge the source of information for its articles con cerning a secret grand jury re port.

title: Flying Tiger Corporation Buys 520,000 Shares of Car Concern
description: The Flying Tiger Corpora tion formed July 1 as a hold ing company that owns the Flying Tiger Line, purchased yesterday 520, figures shares of common stock of the North American Car Corporation. This is 16.6 per cent of the out standing stock.

title: Short Fuse at Suez....
