description: A creeping escalation by both sides in the embattled Suez Canal zone adds urgency to Secretary of State Rogers's proposal for a limited ceasefire to facilitate negotiations for an ArabIsraeli peace settlement.

title: Sinatra, a Backer Of Kennedys, Plans To Support Reagan
description: SACRAMENTO, Calif., July (Reuters)Frank Sinatra, a life long Democrat who campaigned hard for the Kennedy Brothers, today joined the campaign to reelect Gov. Ronald Reagan, conservative Republican.

title: All Star Pitchers
description: Selected by Earl Weaver, Baltimore Or ioles manager.

title: Senator Smith's Right Hip Replaced in 3Hour Surgery
description: Senator Margaret Chase Smith underwent a threehour operation at Columbia Presbyte rian Medical Center yesterday in which her right hip was re placed, according to a hospital spokesman, who added that the 72yearold Maine Republican came through in fine shape.

title: Personal Finance
description: Nature abhors a vacuum, according to the old axiom. For a while there has been an empty space, a kind of no man'sland, in the securities business with regara to the small investor. But not any more.

title: GENERATING PLANT DRAWS PROTESTS
description: NEW HAVEN, July 8  A conservation group disclosed today that it had filed a formal protest with the Federal Power Commission to block plans to study the feasibility of building a huge hydroelectric plant in either Northwestern Connecti cut or Southwestern Massachu setts.

title: Chile Devalues Escudo
description: SANTIAGO, Chile, July 8 (AP)  The Government has devalued the escudo for the 11th time this year. The new rates are 11.81 to 12.01 escudos for each United States dollar for buyers and 11.83 to 12.03 for sellers.

title: City Aides and Beame Renew Battle Over Consultants
description: In a continuing controversy over the city's use of outside consultants, Mayor Lindsay and ControlLer Abraham D. Beame yesterday challenged each oth er's figures on the pace of the city's construction program.

title: Executive Changes
description: John C. Duncan has been elected senior vie president, effective Oct. 1 of St. Joe Minerals Cor poration. He formerly was executive vice president and a director of W.R. Grace Co. He will con tinue as a director of that company.

title: How to Tell Meteorite From Hole in the Ground
description: ESSEX, N. Y., July 8 (AP) That hole in the ground in this Lake Champlain hamlet was thought to have been caused by a meteorite, and experts, including one from the Smithsonian Institution in Washington, came to study the, crater.

title: Excerpts From Nixon's Message on Indian Affairs
WATER WAYS TROUPE TO PLAY IN YONKERS
description: The 45 member American Waterways Wind Orchestra. conducted by Robert Boudreau will give the first concert in tour of Hudson River commu nities on July 19 in Yonkers. The twoweek trip is sponsored by the Hudson River Valley Commission.

title: Market Place
Bulls Look for Step in Right Direction
description: Larry Sawyer said he was tight end; Brian Waters identi fied himself as a defensive back; Dominick LaVacca as quarterback and a flanker; Al Chandler as a cornerback, and Greg Akula as a split end. But it was not the names that were important to Alan Webb, coach of the Long Island Bulls.

title: Clay's Bouts Are Canceled
description: CHARLESTON, S. C., July 8 (AP)Cassius Clay's sched uled sparring bouts tomorrow were canceled today. Clay was scheduled to fight two three round exhibitions in a county owned auditorium, but the County Council refused permis sion to use the building. At tempts to obtain a speedway for the bouts fell through.

title: Theodorakis Arrives Here For U.N. Youth Assembly
description: The Greek composer Mikis Theodorakis flew in from Paris yesterday to adress the World Youth Assembly at the United Nations saying of his native land that a dark age is ruling the country now.

title: Miss Kirsten Cheered as Mimi
description: An audience estimated at 40,000 people serenaded Dor othy Kirsten Tuesday night, singing Happy Birthday to the soprano at Crocheron Park in Queens. The occasion was the Metropolitan Opera's first concertinthepark version of La Boheme this summer.

title: FREDERICK C. FEUS
description: ENGLEWOOD, N. J., July Frederick C. Feus, an assist ant treasurer of PrenticeHall Inc., publishers, died Saturday at Englewood Hospital. He was 64 years old and lived in Tena fly.

title: Hunter Concerts Reduce Prices for Old Listeners
description: Seven concert series and travelfilm series will be offered at reduced rates to persons over 65 years old this fall by the Hunter College Concert Bureau. Tickets, at $1 each, go on sale Aug. 15, for programs including a Beethoven sonata cycle by the pianist Claude Frank on eight Sunday after noons; folk concerts; recitals by wellknown performers; programs of choral and wind music; an early music series, and two recitals of 19th cen tury piano music by Ivan Davis.

title: Books of The Times
description: It is a safe bet that Americans know less about Japan than any country with which they have been intimately concerned. We fought a devastating war with her have had emotional hangups and guilt feelings over the use of the two atomic bombs and have carried out one of the most remark able and successful occupations a victor nation ever imposed on a beaten foe. (It may well be that the greatest memorial to Gen. Douglas MacArthur will be his admin istration of Japan under the occupation rather than any battle fought during the war.) Japan is now a major trade partner and an economic rival and a puzzling ele ment in our defense calculation in the Far East. Yet most Americans know little of her history, less of the shape and develop ment of her institutions and nothing of her great men.

title: U.S. IS DISTURBED BY VIETNAM JAIL
description: WASHINGTON, July 8 (Reu ters)The State Department said today that the United States Government was very concerned about reported pri son conditions at Con Son, an island in South Vietnam.

title: House Plans a Test Today On CooperChurch Curb
description: WASHINGTON, July 8 (AP) House leaders decided late today to schedule for tomor row the first test of the Senate imposed limitation on Presiden tial action in Cambodia.

title: CITY OBTAINS WRIT TO ASSIST TENANTS IN BUILDING STRIKE
description: The city obtained an injunc tion last night barring land lords, in effect, from further organized resistance to a pro posed new contract with strik ing building maintenance and service workers.

title: Bridge:
description: One of the best collections of bridge deals ever pub lished, and almost certainly the biggest, appeared last month. It is a series of four paperbound books by Alfred Sheinwold published by Pock et Books at 75 cents.

title: Indonesia Assures U.S. on Investments
description: The Minister of Mines for Indonesia said here yesterday that some of his nation's 120 million citizens eventually and inevitably would look with envy at the hundreds of millions of dollars in foreign capital that was expected to be invested in the country's mining and petro leum development.

title: Neighborhoods Get Horror Film Dual Bill
Panel Urges a Tax or Subsidy to Spur Unleaded Gas
description: WASHINGTON, July 8 (UPI) A Government technical com mittee recommended today a Federal tax or a subsidy to make it cheaper for motorists to use gasoline free of lead which is considered a prime cause of air pollution.

title: TOP RED'S CAPTURE REPORTED BYTHAIS
description: BANGKOK, Thailand, July 8 (AP)The Thai Government an nounced today the capture of the highest ranking Thai Com munist and said that the ar rest would severely cripple the clandestine Communist move ment in Thailand.

title: STOCKS ADVANCE ON LONDON BOARD
In Roswell, N. M., Closing of Air Base Wasn't the End
description: ROSWELL, N. M.From World War II until three years ago, the Air Force was Roswell's biggest cash crop Then, with little warning there was blight.

title: Article 3  No Title
description: Daily average volume on the New York Stock Exchange in 1969 was more than 500,000 shares below the level needed by member firms to cover ex penses on their commission business, the exchange reported yesterday.

title: Robert Kennedy Jr. Hurt
description: HYANNIS, Mass., July 8 (UPI)Robert F. Kennedy Jr. fell 25 feet from a tree across the street from the Kennedy compound this evening, fractur ing his wrist. He was taken to the Cape Cod Hospital in Hyan nis, where a spokesman said that he was in fine condition and would be released tomorrow.

title: House Votes Easing Of Antitrust Curbs For Newspapers
description: WASHINGTON, July 8The House of Representatives approved today legislation immunizing from attack under the antitrust laws all existing joint operations of separately owned newspapers and most future arrange ments of the same kind.

title: A Listing of New Books
description: A Yard of Sun: A Summer Comedy, by Christopher Fry (Oxford Uni versity, $4.95). A play in book form.

title: COMMUNISTS OFFER TO SUPPORT POWELL
description: The Communist party offered yesterday to reconsider run ning a candidate in the 18th Congressional District in Har lem and to join an independent coalition behind Adam Clayton Powell if the independents backed the party on foreign and domestic policy.

title: A Panel Will Screen Marshal Nominees
description: Balked in his attempt to abolish the city marshal sys tem, Mayor Lindsay named a screening committee yes terday to suggest nominees for the fobs.

title: London Has a Hot Night
description: LONDON, July 8 (Reuters)Thunderstorms at darwn today ended London's hottest night in nine years. Dozens of homes were struck by lightning. Tem peratures lingered in the 70s all night and early morning.

title: 14 Senate Doves Ask That F.C.C. Force the Networks to Provide TV Time
description: WASHINGTON, July 8A bipartisan group of 14 Senators filed a complaint today against the three television networks charging that they were being denied an opportunity to pre sent their views against the Administration's policy in Viet nam.

title: The Proceedings In the U.N. Today
description: Opens nineclay meeting 9:30 A.M.

title: JERSEY RACE WON BY DOUBLE RIPPLE
description: OCEANPORT, N. J., July 8 (AP)Victor Mosca's Double Ripple left the gate first, drew off to a seven length lead on the backstretch and outlasted What A Dream to win the $44,750 Molly Pitcher Handicap by threequarters of a length today at Monmouth Park.

title: TV Ads Prove a Rich Lode for Actors
description: Actors, from Off Broadway beginners to Hollywood su perstars, are beating a wide new path to solvency and riches in the 60second mini drama called the TV com mercial. Riding in the van guard are their agents, who quickly learned that 10 per cent of a salable face or voice is the next best thing to a stake in the fabled El dorado.

title: MRS. IRVING KOLODIN
description: Mrs. Irving Kolodin, wife of the music critic and associate editor of Saturday Review died Tuesday night of a heart attack at the age of 63.

title: Thiokol Gets Contract
description: BRISTOL, Pa., July 8 (UPI)The Thiokol Chemical Corpora tion announced today receipt of a $12.9million Air Force contract for the production of solid fuel rocket motors.

title: Wood, Field and Stream
description: WOLFEBORO, N. H., July  John Heathcote, a re tired detective who has been fishing the waters of Lake Winnipesaukee for 30 years has only one complaint about it. It's too large.

title: Sports Today
description: Mets vs. Montreal Expos, at Shea Stadium, Roosevelt Avenue and 126th Street, Flushing Meadow, Queens, 8 P.M. (TelevisionChannel 9, 8 P.M.) (Radio WJRZ, WNBCFM, 8 P.M.)

title: Montauk's Spirit and Optimism on Rise Again
description: MONTAUK, L. I., July 8There's a rhythm in land's end here, not only of surf and seasons, but also of spirits and labors.

title: A Question of Timing: Early Bird Sets Record and Then Comes the Rain
Miss Sharpe To Be a Bride
description: COLUMBUS, Ohio, July 8  Miss Mildred La Verne Sharpe, a lawyer with the Office for Civil Rights of the Department of Health, Ed ucation and Welfare, plans to be married Aug. 15 in Washington to Dr. Oliver Morse, professor of law at Howard University Law School.

title: AIRLINE'S SERVICE CURBED IN STRIKE
description: MINNEAPOLIS, July 8 (AP)  Northwest Airlines operated at 35 to 40 per cent of nor mal in its nationwide system today after clerical workers had gone on strike and mechan ics and some pilots honored their picket lines.

title: 35CITY TV NETWORK IS PLANNED BY G.E.
description: The General Electric Com pany previewed yesterday via closedcircuit television in Chi cago, Detroit and the Hotel Biltmore here the forerunner of a permanent, closedcircuit cus tom color TV network. G. E. spokesmen said the new service, called the Command Perform ance Network, will be avail able for use in 21 cities next Oct. 1. It will be expanded in 1971 to 35 cities.

title: Alf rink in Rome to Discuss Dutch Clergy's Opposition to Priestly Celibacy With Pope
description: ROME, July 8Bernard Car dinal Alfrink, Roman Catholic primate of the Netherlands, ar rived today for talks with Pope Paul VI on the celibacy of priests.

title: Dame Laura Knight Dies at 92; Artist Noted for Circus Themes
description: LONDON, July 8  Dame Laura Knight, the painter of circus, theater and race track scenes, died today at her Lon don home. She was 92 years old.

title: 13 PANTHERS HERE FACING FALL TRIAL
description: The trial of 13 Black Panthers for an alleged bomb conspiracy here will not begin until September, members of the prosecution and defense said yesterday.

title: Gold and Foreign Assets In South Africa Off in Week
description: PRETORIA, South Africa, July 8 (Reuters)South African gold holdings fell 2.7million rand, to 674.7million rand and total gold and foreign assets, fell 7.4million rand, to 897.7 million rand last week. One rand is equal to $1.40.

title: I.C.C. Aide Backs Western Rail Merger New York Bank Rebuffed on Pennco Bid
description: A merger of the Chicago, Rock Island & Pacific and the Union Pacific Railroads, to be followed by purchase of almost half of the Rock Island's track age by the Southern Pacific Company, was recommended to the Interstate Commerce Com mission yesterday by its ex aminer, Nathan Klitenic.

title: Lindsay Tankoos to Be Bride Of Gregory J. Geelhood Aug. 15
description: DARIEN, Conn., July 8Mrs. William Granniss Tan koos of Darien has an nounced the engagement of her daughter, Miss Lindsay Tankoos, to Gregory James Geelhood, son of Mr. and Mrs. Kenneth L. Geelhood of Northbrook, Ill. The wedding is planned for Aug. 15 at St. Luke's Episcopal Church here.

title: Resor on Visit to Taipei
description: TAIPEI, Taiwan, July 8 (Reu ters)Secretary of the Army Stanley R. Resor arrived in Taipei today for a oneday visit at the invitation of the Chinese Nationalist Government. Mr. Resor conferred with Defense Minister Huang Chieh and other Chinese defense officials this afternoon.

title: Peace Corps Seeking Urban Jobs for ExVolunteers
description: WASHINGTON, July 8The Peace Corps announced today a pilot program designed to place returned volunteers in urban jobs where their skills and ex perience will benefit society.

title: 25 Judges Experience A Night Behind Bars
description: CARSON CITY, Nev., July 8 (AP)Twentyfive judges are spending the night sleep ing on prison cots behind barred doors at the Nevada State Prison.

title: There's Something New at Altman's: Shop That Has Authentic Old Clothes
description: One thing that's been miss ing in department stores is the thrift shop. That breach has been filled by Altman's with a cozy, lamplighted room on the sixth floor called Yesterday's News. While Connie Boswell, Jimmy Dor sey, Glen Gray and Bing Crosby perform venerable tunes such as One Rose on Shop a hidden record Talk player, bright young things who barely remember the fifties are plowing through racks of nineteenthirties and forties clothes gurgling, Isn't that funky? The shop is filled with vintage clothes, which Lewis Winter has been collecting over the years. Mr. Winter is a former Seventh Avenue merchandiser with a passion for earlier decades. He lives in an art deco house in New York, for instance, and he found collecting such fun that he gave up his job to devote full time to it.

title: ELLIOTT WINNER IN TITLE FENCING
description: Joseph Elliott of the Mori Fencing Academy in Beverly Hills Calif., won the national epee title last night on the strips of the Hotel Commodore's grand ballroom.

title: FOE OF I.B.M. WINS A ROUND IN COURT
description: ST. PAUL, July 8 (AP)One of four companies suing the International Business Ma chines Corporation in a com plicated antitrust case was granted a qualified temporary restraining order today.

title: GRAIN FUTURES SHOW ADVANCE
description: After their rise slowed per ceptibly in the previous two days prices of wheat and soy bean futures continued their rather rapid climb yesterday on the Chicago Board of Trade. Other grain futures prices, ex cept for those of rye followed the example set by the wheat contracts.

title: Boston U. Names a Dean
description: BOSTON, July 8 (AP) Bos ton University today named Dr. William J. Newman, a professor of history and political science as acting dean of the school's College of Liberal Arts.

title: Bears Trade Pyle to Saints
description: CHICAGO, July 8 (AP)The Chicago Bears traded Mike Pyle, their center for nine seasons, to the New Orleans Saints today for an undisclosed draft choice.

title: Investor Insurance Program Set Mutual Fund Exemptions Asked
description: The Securities and Exchange Commission and a securities in dustry task force apparently reached agreement yesterday on a proposed insurance plan for investors at a special meet ing in Washington.I believe the commission has been satisfied on all their initial main objections, said Ralph D. DeNunzio, chairman of the task force and vice chairman of the New York Stock Exchange, when he was reached by tele phone in Washington.

title: Laborites Elect Jenkins Deputy Leader of Party
description: LONDON. July 8Roy Jen kins was elected deputy leader of the Labor Party today. In the, opinion of many he thus becomes Harold Wilson's heir presumptive.

title: MINE BUREAU HIRING 100 NEW INSPECTORS
description: WASHINGTON. July 8 (AP) The United States Bureau of Mines will hire more than 100 new coai mine inspectors over the next two months to bring its inspection force to almost 500. its highest level ever.

title: Britain Proposes Reviving Control Commission in Laos
description: LONDON, July 8 (AP) Britain called on 11 nations today to help reactivate the International Control Commis sion for Laos as a first step toward restoring peace there.

title: BANKERS TRUST EXPANDS INCOME
description: The Bankers Trust New York Corporation. a $9.78billion reg istered bank holding company, reported yesterday that income before security transactions edged up slightly in the second quarter from the corresponding 1969 period, though it was not enough to raise the pershare earnines above $1.34.

title: HARRY M. WOLTER
description: STANFORD, Calif., July 8 (AP)Harry M. Wolter, coach of the Stanford University baseball team from 1923 to 1949, died yesterday. He was 85 years old,

title: Connecticut Said to Keep Polluted Beaches Open to Avert Shim Violence
description: NORWALK, Conn., July 8Some polluted beaches in Con necticut are being deliberately kept open illegally by health officials to avoid possible riot ing in the slums, a witness charged at a hearing today.

title: A MOSCOW DISSIDENT IS DECLARED INSANE
description: MOSCOW, July 8 (Reuters) Natalya Gorbanevskaya, a 33yearold Russian poet, has been declared insane after being investigated for alleged antiSoviet slander, sources close to dissident circles said today.

title: 207 ABORTIONS DONE IN CITY'S HOSPITALS
description: New York City's municipal hospitals reported yesterday that during the first week that the new abortion law has been in effect 207 pregnancies had been terminated.

title: BIG BOARD RALLIES AS DOW IS UP 12,73
description: The stock market turned around yesterday after absorb ing a pounding earlier this week and produced a brisk rally that was going strong at the final bell with the tape one minute late.

title: Teacher Writes a Satire on Plight of the City's Schools
description: Having survived strikes, riots, demonstrations, count erdemonstrations and decen tralization, the city public school system is now sum moned in the summer lull to prove that it can survive satire, too. A satirist has risen from its own ranks.

title: Provocative Visit
description: The surreptitious visit by Ireland's Foreign Minister to Catholic areas of Belfast constitutes an unfortunate escalation of the explosive ProtestantCatholic con frontation. As Sir Alec DouglasHome says, it magni fies the difficulties for those who are working restore peace in Northern Ireland. It will further endanger those very Catholic communities with whom Dr. Hillery was trying to demonstrate Eire's solidarity.

title: Roundup: Hart of Giants Ties 59YearOld Mark
description: Jim Davenport did a lot for the San Francisco Giants in 13 seasons, but he never made a more beneficial move for them than he did Mon day.

title: SENATE APPROVES A $20,000 CEILING ON FARM SUBSIDY
description: WASHINGTON, July 8  The Senate unexpectedly approved today a $20,000 limit on the amount of money the Govern ment would pay to any indi vidual farmer under Federal crop control programs in the next year.

title: Cooling the Economy
description: BONN, July 8  The West German Government announced !today a sixpoint program to dampen the overheated econ omy through temporary tax lincreases and advance pay ments on income taxes.

title: Tax on Xand RRated Films Voided by Federal Court
description: TAMPA, Fla., July 8 (AP)A Federal judge has forbidden the city of Clearwater to levy a special tax on theaters show ing Xand Rrated movies.

title: Griffith and Tiger Show Their Form Before Coney's Hot Dog Crowd
Midnight Organ Recital Planned at Music Hall
description: Richard Leibert chief or ganist of the Radio City Mu sic Hall since its opening in 1932, will play a twohour recital there at midnight. Friday, July 17, as a feature of the American Theater Organ Society's 15th annual convention here. The con vention, expected to bring 1,000 enthusiasts from this country, Canada and Eng land, runs from July 11 to July 18.

title: VIRGINIA PANEL SETS CURBS ON SODA ASH
description: RICHMOND, July 8 CAP) The Olin Corporation told the State Water Control Board yes terday that it was being forced to shut down production of soda ash at its Saltville plant because there was no way to treat the streamkilling wastes from the plant.

title: INTREPID, VALIANT IN SHOW DOWNSAIL
description: NEWPORT, R. I., July 8Intrepid and Valiant won again today in the America's Cup ob servation trials, setting the stage for a confrontation to morrow.

title: An Author Who Makes Pasta, Cooks It And Writes About
description: WASHINGTON, Conn. This is one of the oddest pasta dishes, Jack Denton Scott was saying, but one of the best for summer.

title: Agnew Forgets Hickel For a Few Moments
description: WASHINGTON, July 8Walter J. Hickel, the Secre tary of the Interior, has had a less than placid relation ship with the White House since writing that letter to President Nixon. And today he was forgotten by Vice President Agnew, whom he criticized in the letter.

title: Bruce and Paris Talks
Marine's Trial to Begin
description: WASHINGTON, July 8 (UP1) United States District judge John Lewis Smith Jr. said to day he lacked jurisdiction to slop the courtmartial of a Ma rine Corps private accused of killing 16 Vietnamese civilian last February. Pfc. Samuel G. Green. of Clevland, is sched died to go on trial July 20 in Vietnam.

title: A Nixon Aide Denies Report by N.B.C.
description: WASHINGTON, July 8Dr. G. Alexander Heard, Presi dent Nixon's special adviser on campus problems, denied today that he was preparing a report for the President saying that student unrest had destroyed Columbia University and the University of California at Berkeley as great academic institutions. The National Broadcasting Company, in news programs last night and today, said that such a report would be pre sented to Mr. Nixon next week.

title: Brooklyn Rabbi Pays A Call on Gen. Franco
description: MADRID, July 8 (Reuters)Rabbi Chaim U. Lipschitz of Brooklyn today met Generalis simo Francisco Franco, the man he credits with having inter vened to save more than 60,000 Jews from the Nazis in the World War II.

title: MOST YIELDS DIP IN BOND MARKETS
description: Most interest rates con tinued to march briskly toward lower levels yesterday, but Government securities limped behind the parade.

title: Mexican Students Open a Drive To Free 100 Political Prisoners
description: MEXICO CITY, July 8  A new campaign began in Mexico's universities today for the acquittal of Mexican politi cal prisoners, particularly stu dents jailed in 1968.

title: Aquanauts Jolted by Quake But Habitat Is Undamaged
description: ST. JOHN, Virgin Islands, July 8 (AP)  The first all female team of American aqua nauts were in their underwater chamber today when an earth quake shook the Virgin Islands and surrounding Caribbean area.

title: Agreement Ends OneDay Bronx Hospital Strike
description: A tentative contract agree ment between the Ein stein Medical College of Ye shiva University and the Drug and Hospital Union last night ended a oneday work stoppage by union members at the col lege and Lincoln Hospital and the Municipal Hospitals Center in the Bronx.

title: FILION RETURNING NO LONGER ANGRY
description: WESTBURY, L. I., July 8When Herve Filion left here June 27, he was harness racing's last angry man. That was after the $94,335.42 Reali zation Trot had been staged at Roosevelt Raceway and Filion had stormed out in a huff aft er Harness Racing Commission officials had declined to take an additional test of Crain Han over.

title: Boeing Gets Big Radar Plane Contract
description: WASHINGTON, July 8 The Air Force announced to day the selection of the Boeing Company of Seattle to carry out the first phase of a $2 billion program to improve the nation's defense against invad ing aircraft.

title: PRESIDENT URGES WIDER INDIAN ROLE IN AID FOR TRIBES
description: WASHINGTON, July 8 President Nixon denounced to day centuries of injustice to the American Indians and pro posed a comprehensive pro gram to give them dignity and control over their destiny.

title: TV FILMS TRIMMED F.T.C. SURVEY FINDS
description: WASHINGTON, July 8 (AP)  The American viewing pub lic got less than a whole mov ie in 84 per cent of the films broadcast by the major tele vision network during a six month period last year, the Federal Trade Commission said today.

title: NASA SAID TO WEIGH INTERNATIONAL FEAT
description: HOUSTON, July 8 (Reuters) The United States may cele brate its 200th anniversary in 1976 with a big international venture in space, informed sources at the spacecraft center here say.

title: Oyster Bay's Crew Captures Syce Cup For Sailing Crown
description: GREENWICH, Conn., July 8 The SeawanhakaCorinthian Yacht Club crew from Oyster Bay, L. I., with Mrs. W. Perry Neff as helmswoman, won the 37th annual women's sailing championship of Long Island Sound for the Svce Cup today.

title: Canada Housing Starts Up
description: OTTAWA, July 8 (AP)Can ada's housing starts on a sea sonally adjusted basis rose at an annual rate of 137,700 units in June from 125,500 in May and 201,100 units a year earli er, preliminary figures released by the Central Housing and Mortgage Corporation disclosed.

title: U.S. BOLSTERS AID FOR HOUSING HERE
description: Federal authorities have in formed New York City officials that they can expect S33.3mil lion in additional funds for ur ban renewal housing planned in nine neighborhoods.

title: Mahaffey Leads by 3 Shots
description: WICHITA, Kan., July 8 (UPI) John Mahaffey, the National Collegiate golf champion from the University of Houston, blazed around Wichita Country Club in a competitive course record of 65 today, taking threestroke lead in the second round of the western amateur golf tournament with a total of 136.

title: U.S. RULING PLANNED ON FANNY MAY BOARD
description: WASHINGTON, July 8 (AP)  The Justice Department con firmed today that it had been asked for a ruling on conflict ofinterest questions involving four board members of the Fed eral National Mortgage Asso ciation. Fanny May, as it is called, is a privately owned corporation chartered by the Government to deal in the sec ondary mortgage market. The Department of Housing and Ur ban Development made the request.

title: Antitrust Ruling Called Unwarranted by Ford
description: DETROIT, July 8Henry Ford 2d called today a Fed eral Court decision to strip the Ford Motor Company of its spark plug business and make it give up the name Autolite wholly unwar ranted. He said the com pany was undecided whether it would appeal.

title: Poll Finds Voters Favor Democrats On Prosperity Issue
description: PRINCETON, N. J., July 8The Democratic party, by a 44 to29 per cent margin, is seen by a sample of the nation's voters as the party that will do the better job of keeping the country prosperous for the next few years, the Gallup Poll re sorted today.

title: Student Dies in Chile Clash
description: SANTIAGO, Chile, July 8 (AP)A oneday strike called by Chile's organized labor movement erupted into vio lence tonight. Striking workers and students clashed with the police in the streets and a 17yearold student was killed by gunfire. Two students were re ported wounded. Troops and policemen patrolled the streets of Santiago and all public transportation was halted.

title: Dangerous Levels of Mercury Found in Lakes and Streams in 14 Eastern States by U.S. Investigators
description: NEW ORLEANS, July 8 Government investigators have found potentially dangerous levels of mercury in lakes and streams in 14 Eastern states.

title: BLACKS ON PATROL AT ASBURY PARK
description: ASBURY PARK, N. J., July  A 28man patrol of black residents walked the streets in this seaside resort city's black community tonight to calm bit ter residents and to halt the racial disturbances that have raged off and on since Satur day night.

title: Narcotics Raids Net 15
description: FORT MEADE, Md., July 8 (AP)At least 15 persons have been arrested in a series of narcotics raids at Fort Meade and in the surrounding areas, the police said today.

title: Quips by Nixon Enliven Women's Press Dinner
description: WASHINGTON, July 8 President Nixon spoke to night to the Women's Na tional Press Club 50th Anni versary Dinner, but 83yearold Alice Roosevelt Long worth, whose father was in the White House before the club was organized, got the biggest standing ovation without saying a word.

title: Israelis Expecting Forces To Counter Suez Missiles
description: JERUSALEM, July 8There is a growing feeling here among Israelis that their Government will have to make some sharp response to the threat posed by the Soviet antiaircraft mis sile system now operating on the Egyptian side of the Suez Canal.

title: National Health Insurance Plan
description: The rapidly rising cost of medical care in this coun try, as well as concern over those groupsnotably slum dwellers and residents of rural areaswho have difficulty getting adequate medical help, has produced a flood of proposals for reorganizing both the structure of American medicine and the methods by which it financed. The institution of national health insurance has strong support among many reformers, and a new and detailed blueprint for such a system has just been made public by a group of distinguished citizens originally organized by the late Walter Reuther. Some form of national health insurance could well be reality before this decade is over.

title: 3 Railroads'
description: WASHINGTON, July 8 (AP) Service resumed on three ma jor rail lines today as a Presi dential panel prepared to in vestigate the cause of a brief selective walkout by the Unit ed Transportation Union.

title: Jury of Four Women and Eight Men Begins Deliberations in Federal Conspiracy Case Against Sweig
description: A jury of four women and eight men began deliberating the fate of Dr. Martin Sweig suspended chief administrative assistant of House Speaker John W. McCormack, last night.

title: Taxi Board Threatens Shutdown In Pleading for Night Protection
description: A spokesman for the Metro politan Taxicab Board of Trade said yesterday that the board would ask fleet owners to pull their cabs off the street from midnight until 6 A.M. until the city provided more police pro tection in highcrime areas.

title: BIG RETAIL CHAINS SHOW SALES RISE
description: Several major retail chains, including two in the supermar ket field, reported yesterday increased sales in June com pared with yearearlier levels.

title: ITALIANS CONSULT ON A NEW PREMIER
description: ROME, July 8  Pitesident Giuseppe Saragat opened for mal consultations with political leaders today in a search for a successor to Premier Mariano Rumor, who resigned with his Cabinet on Monday.

title: 48,999 See Mets Beat Cards, 75, for 6th in Row
description: The Mets are doing their thing early this season, all right. They defeated the St. Louis Cardinals, 75, yesterday before an afternoon Shea Sta dium crowd of 48,999, swept the threegame series and ex tended their best winning streak of the year to six games.

title: Bank of France Charge
description: PARIS, July 8The Bank of France said today it has raised its minimum reserve requirements for commercial banks to 7.5 per cent from 6.5 percent.

title: Lindsay BrushOff Brings a 2d Threat Of Truck Embargo
description: The threat of a truckers em bargo on deliveries in New York City was renewed yes terday after representatives of Teamsters Joint Council No. 16 and of management failed to get Mayor Lindsay's personal attention to their demands for police protection.

title: Chess:
description: A book of interest to all American chess buffs is the 1969 United States Chess Championship and World Championship Zonal Quali fier by Morton Siegel, a national master.

title: Chicagoan Slain on Bus
description: CHICAGO, July 8 (AP)One man was killed and five per sons were wounded yesterday by a blast from a sawedoff shotgun fired through the rear window of a Chicago Transit Authority bus on the South Side. The dead man was Cordell Hirsch, 23 years old, of Chicago. The police said the shooting was apparently linked to gang warfare.

title: INJUNCTION HEARING ON MAILERS PUT OFF
description: A hearing on a petition by The New York Post for an in junction to prevent Mailers Union No. 6 from holding union meetings at the paper during working time was adjourned yesterday until next Thursday.

title: Buckley Pledges Support That Nixon Can Count On in Senate
description: The Conservative party's candidate for United States Senator, James L. Buckley said yesterday that he would back both President Nixon's efforts to win peace in the Middle East and Southeast Asia and his foreign policy in general.

title: Cairo Hints Milder Line On U.S. Peace Proposals
description: CAIRO, July 8Cairo's offi cial spokesman said today that despite denunciations by Arabs of the latest United States peace proposals on the Middle East, Egyptian officials were studying them, even between the lines, in the hope of find ing something to discuss.

title: Agnew Says Speeches Stirred No Disorders
NETWORKS STRESS ANTIDRUG THEMES
description: The picture in the television commercial is of the morgue at Bellevue Hospital. The camera leads the viewer into the Medical Examiner's mortu ary to a series of refrigerated compartments in which bodies are stored. The door of one compartment slams shut and a voice says:

title: ASIANS URGING U.S. NOT TO WITHDRAW
description: TOKYO, July 8South Viet nam and Cambodia, and South Korea, Thailand and Philippines as well, have told Secretary of State William P. Rogers that the United States must not re duce its military, political and economic commitments in the Pacific region in any serious way.

title: Use of Grand Jury's Data By the P. S. C. Is Upheld
description: A state appeals court ruled yesterday that a regulatory agency as well as law enforce ment bodies had the right to inspect grand jury transcripts for use in civil matters.

title: D'Amboise in Energetic Who Cares?
description: SARATOGA SPRINGS, N.Y., July 8Who Cares? is ballet about boys and girls intoxicated with the sparkle of their own champagne spirits, and none tingles the palate so piquantly as Jacques d'Amboise. He is tiger of sophisticated and yet innocent energy as he bounds after his three loves, winsome Marnee Morris, con fident Karin von Aroldingen and glittering Patricia Mc Bride.

title: Disabled Jet Lands Safely
description: A fourengine jet cargo plane landed safely at Kennedy Inter national Airport last night after the pilot reported trouble in one of the plane's engine's. The plane, Boeing 707, took off at 8 P.M. and landed without inci dent at 8:05.

title: Top Round Wins by HalfLength, Completing Aqueduct Triple for Belmonte
description: Top Round proved to be of prime quality in the feature race at Aqueduct yesterday. James Cox Brady's 4yearold filly scored an impressive vic tory over C. V. Whitney's Watch Fob in the 1 116mile turf event for fillies and mares with the favored Princess Pout winding up third in the field of seven.

title: The Other Women Band Together to End Alimony and Send ExWives to Work
description: Alimony junkie (n.)A woman who lives on alimony from her exhusband, Usually content to sit around the house, over eating, drinking heavily, and watching television all day long. Loathe to take a job, or remarry. Major goal in life: Making life miserable for her former spouse.

title: New North Sea Gas Find
description: LOS ANGELES, July 8 (UPI) A new North Sea gas well discovery was announced today by the ConocoNational Coal Board group and a Signal Oil & Gas Company group. The well is the third discovery well of the last five exploratory tests to be drilled by the ConocoNCB group in the area. Conoco is an abbreviation for Continental Oil Company.

title: Article 1  No Title
description: Harold Stirling Vander bilt, yachtsman, originator of contract bridge and railroad financier, has left $41million to Vanderbilt University and $9million to other education al or charitable institutions in six states.

title: Roslyn Weinstein Prospective Bride
description: NEWTON, Mass.. July 8The engagement of Miss Ros lyn Beth Weinstein to Stuart Holland Orkin, son of Dr. and Mrs. Lazarus A. Orkin of New York, has been an nounced by the future bride's mother, Mrs. Jacob Weinstein.

title: 2Week Bride of O'Dwyer's Son Dies at Age of 26
description: Two weeks ago, Myrta Hargen O'Dwyer was a happy bride, posing for photographers with her husband, Rory O'Dwyer, and his father, Paul O'Dwyer, who two days before had been defeated in his race for the Democratic nomination for the Senate.

title: Small Brokers Affected
description: WASHINGTON, July 8A spokesman for the mutual fund industry asked the Congress today to exempt from the cov erage and costs of the proposed brokerdealer insurance plan those small brokers who sell only mutual funds and fund underwriters who do not do general securities business.

title: Vice President Service Badge Set
description: WASHINGTON, July 8 (UPI) President Nixon ordered to day the creation of a VicePresi dential Service Badge to be awarded to military personnel who have been assigned to duty in the office of the Vice Presi dent.

title: 30 Hurt by Pamplona Bulls
description: PAMPLONA, Spain, July 8 (Reuters)More than 30 men were injured here, one serious ly, when they took part in Pam plona's famous running of the hulls today on the second dad of the annual weeklong San Fermin festival. The men were hurtmost suffered bruisesat the narrow entrance of the hull ring.

title: Dutch Protesters Create Random Crosswalks to Fight Development Plan
description: AMSTERDAM, the Nether landsIn the Netherlands where the puton has been developed into weapon of nonviolent resistance, foes of the automobile and the wrecker have come up with a new one. They are painting zebras  pedestrian cross ings that give the walker the right of waywhere none are supposed to be.

title: RANKIN DISPUTES P.B.A. ON INQUIRY
description: The city's Corporation Coun sel, J. Lee Rankin, asked the State Supreme Court yesterday to reject a legal move by the Patrolmen's Benevolent Assoc iation that seeks to block an investigation of allegations of police corruption.

title: Evidence of Moving Earth Plates Is Found
description: Oceanographers from the Navy and Princeton University believe discoveries on the Pa cific Ocean floor southwest of Central America support the view that the earth's crust is formed of gigantic plates that oush and Dull at one another.

title: MRS. HART TAKES FIVESTROKE LEAD
description: BERNARDSVILLE, N.J., July 8Mrs. A. Sherburne Hart of Essex County, the Women's Metropolitan Golf Association champion, took a big step toward another title today.

title: RESERVE BANK FINDS EFFECTS OF SLOWING
description: In a review of business con ditions during May, the Federal Reserve Bank of New York cited yesterday declines in major economic categoriesindustrial output, employment working hours, private wages and salaries.

title: Sports of The Times
description: Even if Dave Maggard never wins anything else his career as track coach of the University of California at Berkeley, we must be grateful to this 250pound, short haired shotputter for infusing some sanity into sports. Maggard's track team, built around two sprinters named Eddie Hart and Isaac Curtis, who wear their hair in the Afro style, won the National Collegiate championship last month. CalBerkeley had been associated with de feat, losing to the Regents, to Ronald Reagan, the courts and the fuzz. Mag gard turned the image around. I just don't agree with people who make a big thing out of mustaches and long hair, he has said. Within reason, every guy is an individual.

title: MORRIS MARKIN OF CHECKER CABS
description: KALAMAZOO, Mich., July Morris Markin, founder and Corporation of the Checker Motors Corporation died yesterday at Bronson Hospital after having suffered a heart attack. He was 77 years old.

title: Rita Moreno Given Role
description: Rita Moreno has been signed to succeed Linda Lavin in the Neil Simon comedy, Last of the Red Hot Lovers, starting July 27 at the Eugene O'Neill Thea ter. She will be costarred in the showshow with James Coco, Marcia Rodd and Doris Roberts.

title: Saved by the Law
description: From Manhattan and the Everglades alike comes small but encouraging evidence that sound laws can deflect man from his normal course of thoughtlessly destroying the diminishing wildlife of the planet. This city's stores have been advertising the sale of crocodile handbags at drastic reductions in price (sale of croco dile skins forbidden after Sept. 1); and reports from the National Park officials in Florida indicate that alligatorpoaching has all but come to a stop (sale of alligator skins already forbidden in New York).

title: LAW ON RESIDENCY IS VOIDED IN BOSTON
description: BOSTON, July 8 (AP)A Federal court panel ruled un constitutional today a Massa chusetts law that requires year's residency before a person can be registered to vote.

title: Pacification Struggle: Saigon and Foe Compete for Young Talent
description: SOMEWHERE IN SOUTH VIETNAM, July 5An Amer ican general and his civilian and military intelligence spe cialists filed into the austere living room of a young Amer ican who is the chief adviser to the local South Vietnamese province chief.

title: Troopers a Major Force at Asbury Park
description: ASBURY PARK, N. J., July 8 The command post for the police control of the racial dis turbances here was abruptly moved late today from a clut tered Police Department office on the second floor of the Mu nicipal Building on downtown Bangs Street to the high school on Sunset Avenue.

title: Skoplje, Razed by 1963 Quake, Rising as New City From Ruins
description: SKOPLJE, Yugoslavia, June 26 The air of this riverside city is soft with the fragrance of linden blossoms and harsh with the weight of plaster dust. Only at night can one hear the rush of water through the Vardar River's rocky bed. By daylight the clang of girders and the clash of piledrivers overwhelm all other sounds.

title: Several Producers Of Lead Cut Price
description: Several major producers of lead reduced their prices yes terday by 1 cent a pound to 15.5 cents a pound, but the company that started the ac tion and one of its biggest corn petitors disagreed on the need for the cut.

title: EDGAR M. BRANIGIN DETROIT POLITICIAN
description: DETROIT, July 8 (UPI) Edgar M. Branigin, former newspaperman, politician and Wayne County Clerk, since 1947, died at Jennings Memo rial Hospital yesterday. He was 70 Years old.

title: Czech Assembly Dismisses Dubcek From Deputy Seat
description: PRAGUE, July 8 (Reuters)The Czechoslovak Federal As sembly today unanimously ap proved the dismissal of Alexan der Dubcek, former party lead er, as a deputy and accepted the resignation of former Pre mier Oldrich Cernik.

title: Washington; For the Record
description: Activities. The President met with eight leaders of the Taos Pueblo Indian tribe, two officers of the National Congress of American In dians, Vice President Agnew, Interior Secretary Hickel, Secretary of Health. Educa tion and Welfare Richardson, and two advisers, Donald Rumsfeld and Leonard Gar ment, before sending a mes sage to Congress on Indian affairs. Later, the President conferred with Defense Sec retary Laird and Daniel Patrick Moynihan, counselor to the President.

title: WACHOVIA ACCUSED ON COURIER SERVICE
description: The American Courier Cor poration of Lake Success, L. I., has filed suit against the Wachovia Corporation and three of its subsidiaries in WinstonSalem, N. C., charging violations of the antitrust laws and the Federal banking laws.

title: French Hold 2 in Drug Case
description: NICE, France July 9 (AP)An insurance agent and a judo instructor have been arrested in a continuing investigation of drug smuggling between France the United States and Mexico police informants said today. The drive began last April when agents of the United States Bureau of Narcotics and Dangerous Drugs arrested three French nationals in New York on herion possession charges.

title: Vanderbilt's Will Gives $41Million To the University
Ad Council's Campaign To Attack Drug Abuse
description: The Advertising Council yesterday unveiled the new fivepronged campaign against drug abuse that might well turn out to be the biggest volunteer advertising effort in its history.

title: TRW SET RECORDS IN NET AND SALES
description: TRW, Inc., set records for sales and earnings in the sec ond quarter and first half, H. A. Shepard. chairman, reported from the company's Cleveland headquarters yesterday.

title: Linebacker to Join Cowboys
description: KNOXVILLE, Tenn., July 8 (AP)Steve Kiner, allAmerica linebacker at Tennessee last fall, said today he had signed a bonus contract with the Dal las Cowboys of the National Football League.

title: U.A.W. SAYS GOALS ARE REASONABLE
description: DETROIT, July 8 The United Automobile Workers said today that its contract de mands could be met from the profits of the automobile in dustry.

title: Letters to the Editor of The Times
description: To the Editor:

title: F.T.C Wants CocaCola to Give $100 Prizes to Thousands More
description: WASHINGTON, July 8The Federal Trade Commission, in a step it described as innova tive in the consumer field, is trying to force the CocaCola Company to pay $100 each to thousands of unsuccessful con testants in a promotional game called Big Name Bingo.

title: Bridal Planned By Miss Daley
description: GREENWICH, Conn., July 8Arthur Daley, sports col umnist for The New York Times, and Mrs. Daley have announced the engagement of their daughter, Miss Kath arine Blake Daley, to Paul Francis Fennelly, son of Mr. and Mrs. Earl L. Fennelly of Frackville. Pa.

title: O.A.S. Unit to Draft Pact on Terrorism
description: WASHINGTON, July 8 The General Assembly of the Or ganization of American States ended a twoweek meeting here today with a call for urgent action on a convention to de clare that acts of terrorism, including kidnappings of for eign diplomats, constitute in ternational crimes.

title: NEW TEST SHOWS A RISE IN JOBLESS
description: WASHINGTON, July 8The second quarter of this year showed the first really signifi cant rise in unemployment and easing of the labor market dur ing the current economic slow down, according to a new measure of unemployment de veloped outside the govern ment.

title: JURY LAYS BLAME FOR IND COLLISION
description: A Queens County grand jury said yesterday that the May 20 subway collision that killed two persons and injured about 70 others was caused by a series of grossly negligent human errors and several inherently dangerous and defective as pects of the subway system it self.District Attorney Thomas J. Mackell said that although the grand jury's findings could not form the basis of any indict ments, something should be done immediately about the subway system because it isn't. safe. This was immediately de nied by Dr. William J. Ronan, head of the Metropolitan Trans portation Authority.

title: Screen: A Poitier Sequel
Advertising: Hystron Is Going Freelance
description: As Adrian M. Butash, the marketing director of Hy stron Fibers, Inc., recalls it when he read this column Tuesday I went white.

title: Rumanians See Gains in Soviet Friendship Pact
description: BUCHAREST, July 8  The 48hour visit of the Soviet Premier, Aleksi N. Kosygin, ended in cordiality today, and Government spokesmen de dared that the new friendship treaty signed during his stay represented an encouraging im provement in relations between the two Communist nations.

title: News Summary and Index
description: The feeling is growing among Israelis that there must be some quick, sharp response to the Soviet Union's installation of a mis sile system in the Suez Canal area, it was reported yesterday from Jerusalem. Gov ernment officials and the press both have been talking of the situation in the most serious terms. [Page 1, Columns 56.]

title: GERRIE SUE JACOBSON
description: Gerrie Sue Jacobson, a group leader of the Metropolitan New York Council of American Youth Hostels, died of head in juries yesterday in the Bangor (Me.) Medical Center after being thrown from her bicycle. She was 22 years old and lived at 11045 71st Road, Forest Hills, Queens.

title: John Templeton Jr. Will Marry Josephine J. Gargiulo on Aug. 2
description: FORT LEE, N. J.; July 8 Mr. and Mrs. Orlando Gar giulo of Fort Lee, and Capri, Italy, have announced the engagement of their daugh ter, Dr. Josephine Joan Gar giulo, to Dr. John M. Temple ton Jr., son of Mr. Temple ton of Nassau, the Bahamas and the late Mrs. Judith Dud ley Templeton of Nashville.

title: Rep. Wyman Runs Again
description: MANCHESTER, N. H., July 8 Representative Louis C. Wy man, Republican of New Hamp shire, announced today that he would seek reelection to a fourth term in Congress.

title: Irish Minister Rejects British Criticism
description: LONDON, July 8  The Irish Foreign Minister. Dr. Patrick J. Hillery, tonight rejected of ficial British criticism of his secret tour of a riottorn Ro man Catholic neighborhood in Belfast on Monday.

title: Bipartisan House Group Acts to End Secret Votes
description: WASHINGTON, July 8 (UPI) A bipartisan group including liberals and conservatives joined today in an effort to take the secrecy out of House votes. and won the support of the leaders of both parties.

title: Union Wins $500 a Week
description: LOS ANGELES, July 8 (UPI) The pay of sheet metal workers here will rise to $500.40 a week under terms of a new contract that ended a week long strike today.

title: EDGAR A. BLENDOW
description: FORDS, N.J., July 8Edgar A. Blendow of 10 Wisteria Drive, formerly president and secretary of the Continental Insurance Company, Newark died Sunday in Perth Amboy General Hosptial. He was 78 years old and lived here at 10 Wisteria Drive. He retired in 1959 after 50 years with the insurance company.

title: Head of Baptist Foundation Out on Bail in Theft Case
description: STOCKTON, Calif., July 8 (AP)  The Rev. Tillman Sher ron Jackson, president of the Baptist Foundation of America Inc., is free on $5,000 bail on three indictments charging him with theft and taking part in bribes.

title: Violence in Asbury Park
description: There is particular irony in the outbreak of racial hostility and violence in Asbury Park, an aging holiday resort of the white middle class. Asbury owes its origin to the fact that a New York businessman visited the Ocean Grove camp meeting in 1870 and was inspired to develop a large summering place nearby for temperance advocates, so that no wicked influences might encroach on the adjoining camp meeting.

title: ... and Elements of a Truce
description: To be effective, any ceasefire agreement for the explosive Suez front must encompass a number essential elements.

title: Nixon's Car Safety Chief Ready to Quit
description: WASHINGTON, July 8 Douglas Toms, the Nixon Administration's automotive safety chief, is considering private employment after less than six months in office and may leave Washington by the end of this year.

title: 10 Nations Delay Money Step West Germans Act on Inflation
description: PARIS, July 8The major industrialized nations decided today to go slow on introduc ing greater flexibility to the monetary system.

title: Tenants Coping With Strike Emergency
description: Mounting garbage in apart ment hallways, basements and on doorsteps is a nuisance to tenants of buildings struck by maintenance and service work ers here, but city and health officials said yesterday that the situation was still far from critical.

title: Du Pont to Expand Plant
description: E. I. du Pont de Nemours & Co., Inc., said yesterday it planned a multimilliondollar expansion of its plant in New Johnsonville, Tenn., to increase production of titanium dioxide white pigment by more than 20 per cent.

title: Big Board Volume in 1969 Below BreakEven Point
I.T.T. Sees Earnings Well Up for All 1970
description: The International Tele phone and Telegraph Cor poration's 1970 earnings will be substantially above last year's, the chairman and president, Harold S. Geneen, said yesterday.

title: JURY IS COMPLETED IN PANTHER SLAYING
description: NEW HAVEN, July 8Jury selection in the first of a series of trials of Black Panthers here was completed today with the seating of a third alternate juror.

title: ALCOHOL IS LINKED TO BRAIN DAMAGE
description: GAINESVILLE, Fla., July (UPI)  The man who starts drinking martinis at lunchtime may be washing away his abil ity to learnand to remember even after he has sobered up, no matter how much he eats, Dr. Gernard Freund be lieves.

title: Extra Care Is Required for Pets As Oppressive Dog Days Arrive
description: Every day is a dog day in this the Chinese Year of the Dog. And to the astronomi cally minded, these are the days when Sirius, the dog star, rises and sets with the sun. It is also the period when canine discomfort is at its peak. The dog owner can help his pet get through the sweltering hours News with just a little extra care. If the dog is shown on the summer cir cuit, the owner should be certain the win dows of the car are open. At too many summer shows, a call is made over the public address system that a dog is suffering in a closed car.

title: Japan to Lend $20Million For Mexican Power Units
description: TOKYO, July 8 (Reuters)Japan's exportimport bank signed an agreement here today to supply Mexico with a $20 million loan for hydro and thermal power projects.

title: Miss Mooney Iowa Teacher Plans Nuptials
description: Miss Katherine Alice Mooney, a 1969 graduate of William Penn College, and Frank Martucci, who re ceived a Bachelor of Arts de gree this May from William Penn, will be married Aug. 8 in Forest Hills, Queens.

title: In Green England, Green Peril
description: LONDON, July 8The gardeners and fishermen of England have been warned that a vegetable menace has escaped from captivity. It is called the giant hogweed.This extraordinary plant grows up to 15 feet high in three months and may have stems 6 inches in diameter. It looks like an inflated version of the ordinary hogweed, or cow parsnip, but physicians have just alerted the country to the difference.

title: BRANDT IS HOPEFUL ON MOSCOW PARLEY
description: BONN, July 8Chancellor Willy Brandt said today that he had reason to hope for ulti mate success in efforts to con clude a nonaggression treaty with the Soviet Union.

title: GOLDBERG BACKED BY U.A.N. IN STATE
description: SYRACUSE, July 8  The United Automobile Workers of New York State endorsed Ar thur J. Goldberg for Governor today, and the candidate, flying here to accept the endorsement said the Democratic party could learn a needed lesson from labor.

title: 3 SENTENCED TO LIFE BY ATHENS TRIBUNAL
description: ATHENS, July 8An Atnens military tribunal sent 10 per sons to prison on sedition charges today with sentences ranging from two years to life. It also sentenced one of their attorneys to a year in jail for contempt of court.

title: Rock Festival's Sponsors Sue Critics for $150,000
description: NEW HAVEN, July 8 (UPI)Sponsors of the Powder Ridge Rock Festival countered a sched uled hearing today on an in junction against the show by fil ing a $150,000 damage suit. The suit names officials and 23 pri vate residents of Middlefield and asks that the injunction hearing be moved from Middle town Superior Court to United States District Court in New Haven.

title: Jacklin On His Way to Record Round When Rain Halts British Open
Dissident Poet Tells of Days of Terror in a Soviet Mental Hospital
description: LONDON, July 9On Feb. 5, 11969, Natalya Gorbanevskaya the Soviet poet who recently was committed to a mental hos pital for a second time and de clared insane after being ac cused of antiSoviet slandersent a letter signed by 170 peo ple to the Soviet leaders, the Supreme Court and the Prose cutor General. It protested against the trials of dissident intellectuals.

title: Bossi Outpoints Little And Wins Title in Italy
description: MONZA, Italy, July 9 (AP) Carmelo Bossi of Italy out pointed 34yearoldFreddie Little of the United States in a close 15round decision to night and won the world junior middleweight boxing title.

title: U. S. Sues Mississippi to Force Integration of Schools in Fall
description: WASHINGTON, July 9The Justice Department, carrying out a threat it made last month, began today a legal push to require recalcitrant Southern school districts to desegregate by September.

title: FESTIVAL OF FILMS OPENS IN THE PARK
description: We're not what you would call film buffs, said William Todd, but we're thoroughly enjoying this. Mr. Todd, his wife and her cousin, a visitor from Illinois, were comfortably relaxing on the grass atop Cen tral Park's Cedar Hill, watch ing the premiere of Movies in the Park. Shortly before 9 P.M. on Wednesday, when the 90 minute program began, the Todds and their visitor walked over from their apartment on East 75th Street and joined several thousand persons seated close together on the slope.

title: MORTON THREATENS SUIT AGAINST C.B.S.
description: WASHINGTON, July 9 (AP)The Republican National Chair man has threatened to sue if the Columbia Broadcasting Sys tem does not answer promptly his demand for free air time to reply to Democratic broadcasts.

title: TEXAS GULF SET TO SETTLE CLAIM
description: TORONTO, July 9  The Texas Gulf Sulphur Company has agreed to pay $27million to settle a $400million claim against its $2billion base metals Kidd Creek Mine at Timmins, in northern Ontario.

title: June Darling, in First Race, Wins Rich Stakes on Coast
description: INGLEWOOD, Calif., July 9 (UPI) June Darling, making the first start of her career, captured the $70,625 Lassie Stakes for 2yearold fillies at Hollywood Park today by near ly three lengths.

title: Kuhn Names Johnson As Administrative Aide
description: Johnny Johnson, a vice president of the New York Yankees and a member of their organization since 1947, will move to Commisioner Bowie Kuhn's staff as admin istrative officer of baseball on Aug. 1.

title: MISS KING TAKES FENCING LAURELS
description: Harriet King, a browneyed brunette from San Francisco, won the women's national foil fencing title last night for the third time.

title: PHILIP D. HAAB, 72, A STOCKBROKER HERE
description: Philip Darlington Haab, a senior partner in Thomas, Haab & Botts. stockoption brokers and dealers, died yesterday at St. Vincent's Hospital after an illness of three months. He was 72 years old and lived at 860 Fifth Avenue and at Tuthill Road. Shelter Island. L.I.

title: L. JAMES GUMPERT
description: BOYNTON BEACH, Fla., July, 9L. James Gumpert, retired. executive vice president of B. T. Babbitt, Inc., former man ufacturers of cleansing products with offices in New York. died here yesterday after a long ill ness. He was 78 years old and lied al the Pine Tree Golf Club in Delray Beach.

title: Fog Forces a Postponement of Observation Trials
description: NEWPORT, R. I., July 9Score one for fog in the America's Cup observation trials. It was the only winner here today.

title: 2 Dismissed in Racial Slur
description: BECKLEY, W. Va., July 9 (UPI ) Mayor John H. Mc Culloch dismissed today one police officer and handed an other a 30day suspension after both admitted taunting a Negro boy who dated a white girl. The Mayor said he had dis missed Gary A. Roark and sus pended Talmadge Alley without pay after they admitted they had taunted James Poindexter last June 19.

title: Waterfront Study Urges Denial Of Carpentry Concern's Permit
description: A Waterfront Commission hearing examiner has recom mended that the CC Lumber Company, the port's largest ma rine carpentry concern, be de nied a license to stay in business.

title: MAYOR IS CRITICIZED ON POLITICAL JOBS
description: The Citizens Union said yes terday that it was deeply troubled that Mayor Lindsay let city officials hold positions in political parties, and it called on him to obtain a ruling on the practice from the Board of Ethics.

title: Allegra Mertz, 1961 Debutante, Betrothed to Owen Torrey Jr.
description: WEST PAWLET, Vt., July 9Mr. and Mrs. James Mc Clenahan Mertz of West Pawlet, and Rye, N.Y., have announced the engagement of their daughter, Miss Allegra Standing Mertz to Owen Cates Torrey Jr. The prospec tive bridegroom is the son of Mrs. Owen C. Torrey of New York and the late Mr. Torrey.

title: NATO Aides Say Armed Force Of Russians Is at Flood Tide
description: BRUSSELS July 9Authori tative Western military sources contend that the Soviet Union is at flood tide in a vast ex pansion of conventional and nu clear military strength.

title: FRANCIS MANCUSO, FORMER JUDGE, 82
description: DAYTONA BEACH, Fla., July 9 (AP)Francis X. Mancuso, a former judge of New York's Court of General Sessions who was also a leader in Tammany Hall, died here yesterday after being stricken in his oceanside apartment. He was 82 years old.

title: On East 53d St., a Capsule of the Shopping Scene
description: One could put a fence around the East 53d Street block between Second and Third Avenues and package it as a small city. It's the block that has almost everything, including an easy going air where shopkeepers buy things from each other or sit on the stoops and chat.

title: Angela M. Hill To Be a Bride
description: Miss Angela M. Hill and Henry L. Weldon plan to marry next winter.

title: Patriots Sign Two Backs
description: BOSTON, July 9 (AP)The Boston Patriots announced to day the signing of R. C. Gam ble and Art McMahon, draft selections two years ago, for the 1970 National Football League season. Gamble is a running hack and McMahon is a defensive back.

title: Jacklin Then Cards 70 and Ties Nicklaus for Second as Rain Lashes Course
description: ST. ANDREWS, Scotland, July 9That's more like it. Lee Trevino had a pair of 68's for 136 in the wind and rain after blowing his top and took the lead halfway through the British Open golf tournament! today.

title: Treasury's Silver Is Dwindling
description: The United States Treas ury, at last running short of the silver it can sell to indus trial consumers, has informed these users and the produc ers of the metal that its last weekly auction of silver will be the session of Nov. 10.

title: WHITE WILL MANAGE BUCKLEY'S CAMPAIGN
description: F. Clifton White, the Repub lican strategist usually credited with engineering Barry Gold water's Presidential nomination in 1964, was named yesterday to manage the campaign of James L. Buckley, Conservative party candidate for the United, States Senate.

title: The Proceedings In the U.N. Today
Letters to the Editor of The Times
description: To the Editor: The President has revived the domino theory in his TV inter view by citing as evidence the views of Lee Kuan Yew and Tunku Abdul Rahman. In the past both of those leaders stated very grave reservations about the U.S. intervention in Vietnam and publicly urged far stronger emphasis on peaceful negotiation than we have given.

title: HOUSE THWARTS EFFORT TO ADOPT WAR FUNDS CURB
description: WASHINGTON, July 9With the Nixon Administration's sup port, the House leadership thwarted an attempt by anti war Representatives today to force an immediate vote on the Senate's CooperChurch amend ment restricting future military operations in Cambodia.

title: COMMERCIAL CREDIT EXPANDS FINANCING
description: The Commercial Credit Com pany of Baltimore and its par ent company, the Control Data Corporation of Minneapolis, an nounced yesterday that Com mercial Credit had obtained sub stantial additional bank financ ing to bolster its present $1.1 billion in lines of credit at the banks. Negotiations for the fi nancing were reported in yes terday's editions of The New York Times.

title: Rauschenberg Art: Chance to Catch Up
description: It all depends. If you have been following Robert Rauschenberg's recent ex hibitions assiduously, you saw his Currents (...an active protest attempting to share and communicate my response to and concern with our grave times and place) at Automation House last month, his Stoned Moon series in the display rooms of his dealer, Leo Castelli, at one time or an other, and perhaps you even went as far as Philadelphia to see his print retrospective at the Institute of Con temporary Art a couple of months ago.

title: 73 Cities Told to Open Construction Jobs to Negroes
description: WASHINGTON, July 9 (UPI) Secretary of Labor James D. Hodgson said today more jobs for blacks must be opened in the construction trades this. summer or Federal quotas may be enforced in 73 cities.

title: Shifting National Priorities
description: The Senate has again showed some determination to shift national priorities to urgent domestic needs by passing an $18.6billion appropriations bill that exceeded Administration requests by $1.2 billion. The most significant increases were in urban renewal assistance ($400 million) and water and sewage grants ($300 million), both areas in which the need for additional Federal effort is selfevident.

title: Reagan Decries Move
description: SACRAMENTO, Calif., July Gov. Ronald Reagan said to day the Federal effort to make California raise benefits to families with needy children would add $70million to the costs of an already too ex pensive program.

title: Iran Gives Order of Merit To Pan Am Protocol Chief
description: A royal Iranian decoration, the Order of Merit, has been conferred on Ladislav J. Ska loud, chief of protocol of Pan American World Airways.

title: 10 Firemen Injured
description: Then firemen were slightly injured late last night in a two alarm fire that destroyed commercial building at 2338 Eighth Avenue at West 126th Street next door to the offices of The Amsterdam News.

title: Washington: For the Record
description: ACTIVITIES. President Nixon sent to Congress a plan for establishing an en vironmental protection agen cy and a national oceanic and atmospheric administra tion. He presente d the De fense Distinguished Service Medal to Gen. Earle G. Wheeler, retired chairman of the Joint Chiefs of Staff, and appointed John W. Dean 3d, Associate Deputy Attorney General, as counsel to the President. Mr. Nixon received an oil painting on outdoor preservation from Franklin Forsberg, publisher of Field and Stream magazine, met with Gov. Winthrop Rocke feller of Arkansas: and signed several minor bills.

title: Braves Recall Navarro
description: ATLANTA, July 9 (UPI)The Atlanta Braves recalled a 34yearold righthanded pitcher, Julio Navarro, from their Rich mond, Va., farm club of the International League today. He is slated to start Saturday night in the Braves game against the Cincinnati Reds in Atlanta Sta dium.

title: Coast Teacher Arrested
description: HOLLYWOOD, July 9 (UPI) Angela Davis, a philosophy instructor at the University of California, Los Angeles, who was dismissed by the board of regents last month in a contro versy over her membership in the Communist party, was ar rested last night on outstanding traffic warrants, four for park ing violations and one for not having her driver's license and vehicle registration papers in her possession.

title: LAIRD SAYS SOVIET BUILDS UP ICBM'S AT INTENSIVE RATE
description: WASHINGTON, July 9Sec retary of Defense Melvin R. Laird said today that the So viet Union was continuing to deploy intercontinental ballis tic missiles at a rate that would dramatically increase its offen sive nuclearstriking force.

title: Television
LTV PRESIDENCY RESIGNED BY LING
description: A management reorganization at LingTemcoVought, Inc., be gun in May was completed yes terday, leaving the founder of the conglomerate, James J. Ling, out of active participation in the affairs of the company.

title: Ocean Hill School District Is Losing Its Special Status
description: The chairman of the new Community School District 23 in Brooklyn said yesterday that the threeyearold Ocean Hill Brownsville demonstration pro ject would no longer have any special status.

title: Ann M. Wiener Plans to Marry At Naval Chapel
description: Mr. and Mrs. Ernest Guest Wiener of Rio de Janeiro have announced the engagement of their daughter, Miss Ann Margaret Wiener, to John Walker Richmond 3d, son of Commander Richmond, exec utive officer of the Naval Sta tion in Brooklyn, and Mrs. Richmond.

title: Israeli Nurses Halt Strike
description: TEL AVIV, July 9 (AP)Is rael's 11,000 nurses today called off their general strike after four days to allow mediation on their demands for higher pay. The Central Committee of the Nurses Union agreed to a twoweek moratorium.

title: No Panic Button Need
description: WASHINGTON, July 9The Congressional Joint Economic Committee received today a generally reassuring picture of the nation's financial markets, the future of interest rates and even the problem of liquidity.

title: Dance: Balanchine Touch Infuses Geneva Ballet
description: GENEVA, July 9There is a little corner of Switzerland that is fast being annexed by the New York City ballet in general and by George Bal anchine in particular. The place is the Geneva Opera House.

title: In Memoriam
description: DITCHIKLoulse (Post). Gone but will never be forgotten by mother, sister and brothers.

title: N.F.L. PLAYERS TOLD : SKIP CAMP AWHILE
description: DALLAS, July 9 (AP)The National Football League Play ers Association sent special de livery letters to its members today ordering them not to re port to training camps until further notice.

title: Widely Traveled Youth Delegate
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., July 9Lars Christensen en joys jazz and F. Scott Fitzgerald, speaks four lan guages, has some doubts about the institution of mar riage and likes international conferences.

title: J. W. L. RUSSELL
description: PLEASANTVILLE, N.Y., July 9J. W. L. Russell, assistant to the chairman of Union Carbide Eastern, Inc., in New York, died today in a London hospital. He was 54 years old and lived at 25 Wilton Road.

title: G.O.P. in Alabama Decides Against Opposing Wallace
description: MONTGOMERY, Ala., July 9 (Reuters)  Republican party leaders said today that they would offer no candidate to oppose George C. Wallace in the Nov. 3 general election for Governor, leaving him only token opposition.

title: News Summary and Index
description: Defense Secretary Laird said at a news conference at the Pentagon yesterday that the Soviet Union continued to deploy new intercontinental ballistic missiles despite the strategicarmslimitation talks with the United States. His assertion contradicts re ports from other officials that no sites for the largest Soviet missiles have been built since August. [Page 1, Column 8.]

title: Ginsberg, Leaving City Welfare Job, Claims Limited Successes
description: There were times when he, got roaches on his raincoat visiting a Bowery shelter, when ?? wrote out his resignation and the Mayor tore up up, when he stayed awake nights vorrying about how crowded the children's shelter was.

title: Columbia Names Professor
description: Columbia University an nounced the appointment yes terday of Nathan I. Huggins as a professor of history. A spe cialist in American attitudes to ward the poor, Mr. Huggins is currently an associate professor of history at the University of Massachusetts in Boston. Columbia said he was the fourth black person to become a full professor on the university faculty.

title: Harlem TeenAger Is Killed by Heroin; 102d to Die in '70
description: A 14yearold Harlem youth, whose body was found late Tuesday evening on the roof landing of a tenement across the street from his home at 71 West 112th Street, was reported yesterday to have died of an overdose of heroin.

title: ISRAEL EXPECTED TO STEP UP RAIDS ON MISSILE SITES
description: WASHINGTON, July 9Is rael was understood today to have informed the United States that she intended to step up sharply raids against Soviet missile installations in the United Arab Republic, but not to resume her deep penetra tion attacks against the Egyp tian heartland.

title: Narcotics Curb Proposed
description: WASHINGTON, July 9 (AP)  A bill designed to reduce the unlawful entry into the United States of narcotics such as heroin, morphine and cocaine was introduced today by Representative Dante Fascell, Democrat of Florida. The meas ure would authorize the Presi dent to suspend economic or military assistance under for eign aid programs to any na tion that does not take steps to prevent narcotics produced or processed in that nation from entering the United States unlawfully.

title: Agriculture Appropriation
description: WASHINGTON, July 9 (AP) The Senate passed today an $8billion Agriculture Depart ment appropriations bill that includes a $20,000 annual limit on the amount a farmer can he paid for not growing crops.

title: MRS. TRACY'S TEAM TAKES GOLF TITLE
description: ENGLEWOOD, N. J., July 9 Mrs. William Tracy and her daughter, Mrs. John Sheik of Essex Fells, won the 43d an nual Women's Metropolitan Golf Association motherdaugh ter championship today.

title: LISBON'S POLICY VEXES ANGOLANS
description: LUANDA, AngolaThe new affluence in this Portuguese ter ritoryfostered by a 10yearold war with nationalistshas led many here to criticize the nature of its relationship with Portugal. Lisbon's Ministry for Overseas Provinces is accused of viewing Angola with a co lonial mentality.

title: Sears and Penney Report June Sales Hit Lows for 1970
description: Sears, Roebuck & Co. and the J. C. Penney Company, the country's two largest retailers of general merchandise, re ported yesterday their lowest monthly sales for the year in June.

title: Seeks McCormack's Seat
description: BOSTON, July 9 (UPI)For mer Representative Laurence Curtis says he plans to run for the seat to be vacated with the retirement of Speaker John W. McCormack. Mr. Curtis, 76 years old, is the first Republi can candidate for the seat, which Mr. McCormack has held for 42 years.

title: King Beats Bahaman Ace
description: TOESNBERG, Norway, July 9 (AP)John B. Symonette of the Bahamas, aboard John B, was defeated by King Olav V of Norway in Norna X in the last of four 5.5Meter yacht races today, but emerged as the overall winner of the event.

title: A Bit Late, A Fountain Is Spouting
description: One year after its comple tion and seven months after its dedication by Mayor Lind say, the Delacorte Fountain at the southern tip of Wel fare Island began spewing a plume of water into the air on a regular basis yesterday, under a hazy sky.

title: Senate Vote Puts $20Million Limit On Aid to Business
description: WASHINGTON, July 9 (UPI) The Senate voted unani mously today to bar Presi dent Nixon from helping the Penn Central Railroad or oth er businesses by big Govern mentbacked loans without prior Congressional approval.

title: Reorganization's Impact
description: WASHINGTON, July 9Following is a list of exist ing agencies that would be regrouped under an inde pendent Environmental Protection Agency and the new National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration of the Department of Commerce if Congress does not object to President Nixon's reorganization plans:

title: Communist Rules For Revolt Viewed As Durable Fraud
description: Among a spate of broad sides, leaflets and ultraconserv ative books distributed at the New England Rally for God, Family and Country, which ended earlier this week in Boston, was a stack of flyers labeled Communist Rules for Revolution.

title: CONFIRMATION ASKED ON NEWTON VERDICT
description: SAN FRANCISCO, July 9 (Reuters)  Huey Newton's chance of being released from jail were put further in doubt today by a request from the State Attorney General's office that the manslaughter convic tion against the Black Panther party leader be confirmed.

title: Fireworks Hurt Boy, 17
description: Samuel Velez, 17 years old of 829 Schenck Avenue, Brook lyn, was injured in his third floor apartment about 2:15 P.M. yesterday when fireworks ex ploded after he lit the fuse and tried to place them in a cannis ter. Parts of three fingers on his right hand were amputated at Brookdale Hospital, the police said.

title: 69 FILIPINO BISHOPS ASSAIL GOVERNMENT
description: MANILA, July 9The church, hierarchy of this predominantly Roman Catholic nation de nounced yesterday what it termed Government abuses, and urged public vigilance to pro mote governmental responsi bility.

title: A Federal Evaluator Puts $17,654 Value On Oswald's Papers
description: DALLAS, July 9 (AP)  A Federal court evaluator says that personal property left by Lee Harvey Oswald, assassin of President Kennedy, is worth S17,654.

title: THREAT TO NIXON LAID TO L.I. MAN
description: HEMPSTEAD. L.I., July 9A 24yearold man who was questioned and then released after the bombing of Manhat tan Police Headquarters last month was arrested today on a Federal warrant charging him with threatening the Jives of President Nixon and Vice Presi dent Agnew.

title: Rock Festival's Counsel Withdraws Plea on Ban
