Obviously, anywhere included New Haven, where eight Black Panthers were about to go on trial at the very edge of the Yale campus in connection with the slaying last year of Alex Rackley, party member whose murder the police attributed to a suspicion by the Panthers that had been acting as an informer.

title: Abortion Referrals Barred
description: The Medical Society of the State of New York has announced that it is not referring individuals to agencies or physicians who perform abortions. The society, which said it had been receiving calls and mail for names of physicians and hospitals, asked interested persons to look up health departments of cities and counties in the state, and the State Health Department.

title: National Grange Backs U.S
description: WASHINGTON, July 10 (AP) President Nixon got a petition from the National Grange today voicing the support of more than 105,000 members for our American system of government. The Master of the Grange, John Scott. presented the petition.

title: Tenants Cope With Apartment Strike
description: Michael Lehmann, 18 years old, was returning home from the post office yesterday with a stack of mail in hand when he ran into Felipe Sanchez, the superintendent of 473 West End Avenue, a rentcontrolled building on the corner of 82d Street.

title: NIXON PICKS PANEL ON PRODUCTIVITY
description: WASHINGTON, July 10 President Nixon appointed 23 persons today to the new National Commission on Productivity and challenged them to help the nation achieve a balance between costs and productivity that will lead to more stable prices.

title: White Motor Unit Orders
description: White Industrial Power, Inc., a division of the White Motor Corporation, announced yesterday that it had received orders worth more than $4.5million for 71 high horsepower diesel locomotive engines from the A. E. Goodwin Company of Australia.

title: American Friends at Rallies in Peking
description: HONG KONG, July 10 Frank Coe and Sol Adler, two aging former officials of the United States Treasury Department, appear to be filling the social niche formerly occupied in Peking by Anna Louise Strong, the 84yearold American leftist who died last March after years of service in the cause of Chinese Communism.

title: IRC Fibers Sets Expansion
description: The I R C Fibers Company, a subsidiary of the American Cyanamid Company, announced yesterday that it would spend more than $10million to expand the polyester filaments capacity at its plant in Painesville Ohio. The enlarged facilities will he ready for production in late 1971.

title: BANK OF KENYA JOINS WITH BRITISH BANK
description: NAIROBI, Kenya, July 10 (Agence FrancePresse)  A new partnership between the Kenyan Government and National and Grindlays Bank was announced here today by Finance Minister Mwai Kibaki as part of our efforts to have greater control of the economic side of the country.

title: Mr. America Drops Crewcut for Coiffure
description: ATLANTA  Hair of all shapes, hair of all colors, hair falling over ears, creeping over collars, reaching for the shoulders: the individual coiffure Is the new fascination of the middleAmerican male.

title: News Summary and Index
description: Jacob D. Beam, the United States Ambasgador to the Soviet Union, met with the Soviet Foreign Minister, Andrei A. Gromyko, in Moscow yesterday as Moscow published a cautious first evaluation of American peace proposals for the Middle East. Soviet and American officials were silent on the substance of the meeting, confirming that it occurred but refusing to say how long it lasted. Some Western diplomats believed that efforts to reach a peace formula had reached a critical stage. [Page 1, Column 5.]

title: 4 INDICTED IN THEFT OF SUNDAY PAPERS
description: A guard and three truck drivers for The Daily News were indicted yesterday and charged with stealing $3,500 worth of Sunday newspapers and selling them on their own.

title: GENERAL'S COPTER FOUND IN VIETNAM
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Saturday, July 11  The United States command announced yesterday that searchers had found the wreckage of the helicopter of Maj. Gen. George W. Casey, the commander of the First Cavalry Division (Airmobile), but withheld most details pending the completion of recovery operations.

title: Stengel Here for 80th Birthday Fete
description: Smith, a recuat from the Cent ?? who pitched the last inning against the Superbas. the score was 7 to 3.

title: Topics: On Dividing the Country
description: More and more frequently, the charge is being made that, because of the actions and attitudes of the Vice President, the Nixon Administration is dividing the country.

title: Champion of the Indian
description: WASHINGTON, July 10LaDonna Crawford Harris has never been the tea party sort of Senate wife. When she gets ahold of a cause she's like a terrier, says one friend, she just won't let it go. This week, the White House spoke on the cause that Mrs. Harris most fiercely championsWoman Indian rights and the wife of in the the former DernNews ocratic National Chairman, Senator Fred R. Harris of Oklahoma, was quick to respond with cautious praise.

title: 3 Stars Giving Concerts To Aid Multiracial Schools
description: LONDON, July 10 (Reuters)  Frank Sinatra, Bob Hope and Sir Noel Coward will give two concerts here to raise funds for an organization that seeks to set up multiracial schools all over the world.

title: Physician Is Named to Head The U. of Texas System
description: AUSTIN, Tex., July 10 (AP)  Dr. Charles A. LeMaistre, 46yearold physician, was named chancellor of the University of Texas system today

title: The City's Consultants
description: The history of New York municipal government during the past few years has been a gelatinous struggle to revise its outmoded equipmentCharter, zoning, administrative organizationto deal with a staggering multiplicity of problems in modern terms and with uptodate methods. When he took office, Mayor Lindsay inherited a creaky 19thcentury apparatus whose gears had been stripped by endless political accommodation. The very magnitude of the modern municipal workload and the unprecedented nature of today's urban problems required radical new techniques.

title: SENATE VOTES GRANT FOR U.N. EXPANSION
description: WASHINGTON, July 10 (AP) The Senate passed by a vote of 39 to 21 today a bill authorizing a $20million grant toward the expansion of the United Nations Headquarters over the protests of some Senators that the United States was paying a disproportionate share of the cost.

title: Communist Nations Agree To Form Investment Bank
description: MOSCOW, July 10 (Reuters) Seven Communist countries signed an agreement here today to set up an international investment bank in Moscow, it was officially announced. Rumania, the eighth member of the Communist economic organization, refused to join the bank at a meeting in Warsaw in May.

title: UTILITY RATE RISE TIED TO POLLUTION
description: CHICAGO, July 10  The Commonwealth Edison Company was granted a 4.5 per cent increase in its electrical rates today provided that the company spends an estimated $200million for air and water pollution controls.

title: Miss Ellen Kramer Becomes Affianced
description: Miss Ellen Barbara Kramer and Robert Zaplin, graduates of Adelphi University, plan to be married next June.

title: Youth at the U.N.
description: After an inauspicious beginning, the U.N.'s World Youth Assembly appears to be settling down to serious business with at least some prospect that a new generation can bring fresh perspectives to a tired old world's perplexing problems.

title: State Crime Aide Named
description: ALBANY, July 10 (AP)Edgar D. Croswell, who discovered the Apalachin conference of Mafia leaders while a state police sergeant in 1957, will be the administrative assistant in the State Organized Crime Task Force.

title: City to Bar Cars Today On 5th Ave.
description: For seven hours today, starting at 10 A.M., a 15block midtown stretch of Fifth Avenue will be closed to all traffic except seven minitrains that will snake their way amid the Saturday shopping crowds.

title: Goldberg Scales 42Foot Ladder To Meet Construction Workers
description: SCHENECTADY, N.Y., July 10Arthur J. Goldberg earned stripes today as a campaigner and labor man as he ran up 42foot ladder to meet with construction men on the job.

title: Hospital Takes Credit Cards
description: SOMERVILLE, Mass. (AP)Somerville Hospital has become the first hospital on the East Coast to accept credit cards in payment of patients bills.

title: Arcari Keeps Boxing Title As Roque Is Disqualified
description: LIGNANO SABBIADORO, Italy, July 10 (AP)Bruno Arcari of Italy retained the World Boxing Council version of the world junior welterweight boxing title tonight after the French challenger, Rene Roque, was disqualified for butting in the sixth round. The Frenchman, who scaled 139 pounds, had opened cuts above both of Arcari's eyebrows. Arcari weighed 139.

title: Rome's Seaside Pleasures Fade Away
description: ROME, July 10One of the summer pleasures of Rome used to be the nearness of the beaches. No longer.

title: DANIEL POLLOCK
description: Daniel Pollock, an investment broker, died at his home in West Palm Beach, Fla., yesterday. He was 74 years old and had formerly lived at 11 Riverside Drive here.

title: Motel Mania: Traveling America Never Leaves Home
description: OVERLAND PARK, Kan., July 6As the prairie sun swings to the west, still high but slumping behind the wispy afterthoughts of clouds in the allconsuming sky, the dusty cars start peeling off the highway.

title: SCHILLER BACKS INFLATION FIGHT
description: BONN, July 10 (AP)Economics Minister. Karl Schiller told the Bundestag Parliament today the Government's program to combat inflatiOn was necessary to restore equilibrium in the West German economy.

title: 2 DANCE TROUPES LEAVING HENRY ST.
description: Two major dance companies, the Alwin Nikolais Dance Theater and the Murray Louis Dance Company, have separated permanently from the Henry Street Settlement Playhouse, their longtime base on the Lower East Side.

title: MOUNT AINDALE FETE IS BLOCKED IN COURT
description: MONTICELLO, N. Y., July 10 (AP)Justice Russell Hunt of the State Supreme Court reserved decision today on an injunction motion, effectively blocking plans for a rock music festival this weekend at Mountaindale. in the Catskills.

title: Radio
description: Music

title: Perle Mesta Gives a Party in London
description: LONDON, July 10 (AP)Perle Mesta threw her first pary in London in 17 years last night, and everything was the way it used to be.

title: New Japanese Ambassador To Washington Is Named
description: TOKYO, July 10 (UPI)Japan appointed a new ambassador to the United States today to conduct diplomacy during a critical period in trade relations.

title: Park Denies Seoul Agreed To Cutback in U.S. Forces
description: SEOUL, South Korea, July 10 (UPI)  President Chung Hee Park said today that the United States should not unilaterally cut back its forces in Korea.

title: GOLDBERG ACCUSED OF SKIPPING ISSUES
description: PATCHOGUE, L. I., July 10Paul Adams, the Conservative party candidate for Governor, tonight accused Arthur J. Goldberg, the Democratic candidate, of blocking discussion of important state isues by centering his campaign on the war in Vietnam and the sending of planes to Israel.

title: Pamela A. Ellis Plans Nuptials
description: HADDONFIELD, N. J., July 10Mr. and Mrs. Edward Huston Ellis Jr. have announced the engagement of their daughter, Miss Pamela Atkinson Ellis, to Bryant Wynkoop Bozarth, grandson of Mr. and Mrs. Norman 0. Wynkoop of Pleasantville, N. Y.

title: New Coalition in Finland
description: HELSINKI, Finland, July 10 (AP)Five parties agreed today to enter into a coalition under former Foreign Minister Ahti Karjalainen, resolving a long government crisis. The new Government, expected to have a base of 140 of the 200 seats in Parliament, will include the Social Democrats, the Center party, Swedish People's parry, the Liberal party and the People's Democratic League, or Communists.

title: 2 Tomes of Science Biography Issued
description: The first comprehensive biographical reference work covering science exclusively has just made its debut with publication of the initial two of a 13volume Dictionary of Scientific Biography.

title: New York A.C. Wins National Epee Title And Takes Trophy
description: The New York Athletic Club trio of George Masin, Steve Netburn and Paul Pesthy gained narrow victory over the New York Fencers Club last night and won the national pe team fencing championship at the Hotel Commodore.

title: Tariff Aide to Retire
description: WASHINGTON, July 10 (UPI)Roland L. Lee, chief of the textiles division of the United States Tariff Commission for the past 20 years is retiring, the commission announced today.

title: Chief Executive Resigns Fanny Farmer Positions
description: Fanny Farmer Candy Shops, Inc., announced yesterday in Boston that G. Edward Brooking Jr. had resigned as president, chief executive officer, director and chairman of the executive committee.

title: A Handwritten Memo by Sweig Persuaded Jury to Convict Him
description: A short bit of Dr. Martin Sweig's own handwriting on Government Exhibit No. 5 in evidence persuaded the jury to convict him of one of the seven counts against him, a poll of the jurors disclosed yesterday.

title: 2 Top Orthodox Rabbis Score Blanket Abortion Permission
description: The two top leaders of Orthodox Judaism in this country issued a joint statement yesterday condemning indiscriminate and blanket abortions.

title: STOCKS ON AMEX CLIMB SLIGHTLY
description: Once again stock prices were nudged ahead on the American Stotk Exchange yesterday. The index.ziosed at 19.93, up 0.04.

title: Smiles Brighten Subway Conductor's Day
description: A redhaired subway conductor's oneman experiment in giving riders on the West Side IRT a little more information and a little more courtesy is getting a response that makes him very happy.

title: Jim Walter Corp. Posts Drop in Earnings
Justice Department Curbs Use of 1899 Pollution Act
COMECON SETS UP INVESTMENT BANK
description: MOSCOW, July 10 (Reuters)  Seven Comecon countries signed an agreement here to set up an international investment bank in Moscow, it was announced today.

title: 300 Craft Expected to Start Larchrnont's Week Today
description: The cruising yachts entered in the Larchmont Yacht Club's Race Week sailing numbered 61, but fewer were expected to start for one reason or another, Donald B. King. the race committee chairman, said yesterday.

title: COCACOLA GAMES DEFENDED AS FAIR
description: WESTPORT, Conn., July 10 (UPI)  Glendinning Companies, Inc., which set up and operated the CocaCola Company's Big Name Bingo contest, denied today tentative charges by the Federal Trade Commission that the contest was unfair. Glendinning said that the number of winners was proof that the contest was on the level.

title: Carol Kolodny Betrothed
description: ROSLYN HEIGHTS, L. I., July 10Mr. and Mrs. Saul Kolodny have announced the engagement of their daughter, Miss Carol Ann Kolodny, to Richard L. Lees. He is the son of Dr. and Mrs. William M. Lees of Lincolnwood, Ill. The future bride and bridegroom are graduates of the University of Michigan. Her father is an assistant vice president of distribution of American Sugar Company. Her fianc's father is a thoracic surgeon and professor of surgery at University of Chicago and Loyola University.

title: MAILERS DELAY TIMES DELIVERIES
description: For the second night in row, the distribution of the first edition of The New York Times was delayed last night because of a union meeting held by the mailers. However, they returned to work after The Times served their president with a restraining order barring disruption of normal procedures.

title: PREMIERDESIGNATE TO BE NAMED IN ITALY
description: ROME, July 10President Giuseppe Saragat announced today that he would name Premierdesignate tomorrow.

title: Suit Filed by Mother of Boy Whose Death Set Off Riots
description: AUGUSTA, Ga., July 10 (UPI) Mrs. Cornelia Oatman, the mother of a 16yearold Negro boy whose death touched off riots here in May, has filed $4million suit against Richmond County Sheriff E. R. Atkins and other officials.

title: Youth Assembly Clashes Over Move to Oust Delegates
description: UNITED NATIONS, N.Y., July 10Led by Lars Thalen, a strongwilled Swede wielding a swift gavel, the World Youth Assembly stopped a leftist group's drive today to exclude young participants from Nationalist China, South Korea and South Vietnam.

title: Bills Sign 3 Kickers
description: BUFFALO, July 10 (AP)John Rauch, coach of the Buffalo Bills, announced today the signing of three kickers. They are Justin Canale, formerly of the Boston Patriots and Cincinnati Bengals; Grant Guthrie of Florida State and Steve Schroeder of Pacific University.

title: MARKET NOTCHES A THIRD ADVANCE
description: The stock market closed higher yesterday for the third consecutive day, with many issues reaching their best levels near the closing bell.

title: HUSSEIN APPEARS VICTOR IN ACCORD
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, July 10The authority of the King Hussein's Government within his kingdom was reasserted tonight in an agreement with Palestinian guerrillas sponsored by Egypt, The Sudan, Libya and Algeria.

title: FRANK P. GRECO
description: RIDGEWOOD, N. J., July 10 Frank P. Greco, president of Comet Industries, Inc., manufacturers of industrial sewing machines in Paterson, died at Valley Hospital yesterday after a brief illness. He was 54 years old and lived in Wyckoff.

title: 2 on Gaillard's Yacht Dead
description: ST. HELIER, Jersey, July 10 (AP)Maritime authorities today found the bodies of two women passengers and the wreckage of the yacht of former Premier Felix Gaillard of France. Officials said, however, that there was no trace of Mr. Gaillard or the third passenger aboard the yacht, which sailed yesterday from Jersey.

title: 2 CONVICTED IN PLOT ON WILKINS SOUGHT
description: A Queens County Supreme Court Justice issued arrest warrants yesterday for two black militants, Herman B. Ferguson and Arthur Harris, who had been convicted of conspiring to murder Roy Wilkins, executive director of the National Association for the Advancement of Colored People, and Whitney Young Jr., executive director of the Urban League, in 1968.

title: China Frees U.S. Bishop
description: HONG KONG, July 10The Most Rev. James Edward Walsh, a 79yearold Roman Catholic bishop from Maryland, arrived in Hong Kong today after 12 years of imprisonment in Communist China.

title: TRAVEL AGENCIES SCORED IN SENATE
description: WASHINGTON, July 10 (UPI) Aroused by the stranding of 3,000 students in Europe, Senator John J. Williams demanded today a Congressional investigation into travel agencies.

title: ... and a Signal From China
description: There is stirring human drama in the saga of Bishop James E. Walsh who walked to freedom in Hong Kong yesterday after almost 12 years in a Chinese prison. The tragic fate of Hugh F. Redmond, another American prisoner of the Communist Chinese, gives somber evidence of the despair that can overcome an individual in a seemingly hopeless situation. Yet so indomitable was Bishop Walsh's spirit, so strong his faith, that he has survived and is now free at the age of 79.

title: American Steel Broker Asks Orderly Trading Abroad
description: Philipp Brothers, a major New York metals broker, charging that shipments of American steel often are stalled in foreign ports while unscrupulous traders seek to change or wriggle out of their purchase contracts, is circulating a memorandum among producers and other brokers in an effort to create some orderly I trading rules.

title: Dayco to Lift Price Of Cushion Foam
description: The Dayco Corporation an nounced yesterday that it would increase prices by about 8 per cent for latex foam rubber furniture cushioning, effective July 31. The rises were attributed to higher costs of labor, raw material, packing and freight.

title: Husky Petroleum Sets Up A $30Million Drilling Fund
description: The Husky Petroleum Corporation, a United States subsidiary of Husky Oil, Ltd., announced yesterday that it had closed the sale, through Goodbody & Co., of $30million of limited partnership units for threeyear drilling fund, Husky Exploration, Ltd.

title: Letters to the Editor of The Times
description: To the Editor:

title: PALESTINIANS LIST RISE IN OPERATIONS
description: BEIRUT, Lebanan, July 11 The central miiltary office of the Palestinian commando move ment has issued statistics pur port to show a rapidly increas ing level of operations against Israel in 1969 and the first half of 1970.

title: GOV. SHAFER ASKS PRISON TAKEOVER
description: PHILADELPHIA, July 11A move for the state to take over operation of all county prisons in Pennsylvania has been initi ated by Gov. Raymond P. Shafer.

title: JEAN PETTEBONE
description: LOS ANGELES, July 11 Jean Pettebone, a press agent who represented many Holly wood stars, died here today at the age of 56.

title: Plans for Merging 9 Churches Will Be Discussed in 12 Cities
description: The Consultation on Church Union, an organization designed to plan the uniting of nine ma jor Protestant denominations into one church with 25 million members, has decided to reveal the details of its plan early next fall.

title: STENGEL CONDUCTS FESTIVE REUNION
description: Casey Stengel celebrated his 80th birthday at Shea Stadium last night before sellout crowd of 55,000 fans and four dozen men who played with him, against him and for him during his halfcentury in baseball.

title: Slum Spread Hits Citywide Realty Values
description: For the first time in a quarter century, a borough of New York has seen its overall property values de cline. The unhappy distinction belongs to the blight stricken Bronx.

title: Chicken plus
description: Some things, like clams on the half shell and lemon juice, or nutmeg and spinach, just naturally go together. Any catalogue of compatibility would have to include such good things of mummer as eggplant and green peppers and onion and garlic and fresh, fullfleshed tomatoes. These happen to be the ingredients of a dish called chicken San Juan, which also contains chorizo (Spanish sausage), a Most compatible addition. Another chicken dish, which combines tomatoes and cream, is also given.

title: Big Boeing Award Is Hailed in Seattle
description: SEATTLE, July 11It seemed to be a ray of hope after a long time when hope was scarce. Gov. Daniel J. Evans of Washington called it a psychological boost. Local economists predicted that its immediate impact on a serious unemployment situation in metropolitan Seattle would be minimal.

title: AMERICANS LACK WE COMPETITION
description: The national fencing champion ships concluded at the Hotel Commodore yesterday, leaving the impression that the United States still has a long way to go to be much of a threat in the Olympics two, six or 10 years from now.

title: HUNTER CROWN WON BY WHAT'S UP FRONT
description: MORRISTOWN, N. J., July 11 What's Up Front, owned by Mrs. William Johnson of Con vent Station, N. J., captured the stake today and the 5 points he was awarded for the triumph enabled him to win the regular working hunter championship at the Hilltop Stables Horse Show.

title: Green Berets, in War Since '62, Said to Be Pulling Out This Year
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, July 11The Green Berets, troops of the United States Special Forces, who were the first American fighting men in this country early in the nineteen sixties, will be phased out of South Vietnam by the end of this year, according to reliable military sources.

title: Yankee Peddler Comes to Spring Valley
description: SPRING VALLEY, N. Y.  A re markable increase in the number of lost children is expected at the 11th annual Yankee Peddler Day here on Saturday, July 25. Children who re port themselves lost during this event are given a ride on a mounted police man's horse so that they can spot their parents in the crowd.

title: Canada Dry Names Division Head
description: Benjamin C. Davis Jr., has been promoted to president and general manager of the international division of the Canada Dry Corporation. He will report directly to James D. W. Blyth, president and chief executive officer.

title: Miss Jane A. Shattuck to Be Wed Oct. 3
description: PELHAM, N. Y., July 11 Miss Jane Adair Shattuck, a great  granddaughter of Frank G. Shattuck, founder of the Schrafft's restaurant chain, and Robert Otto Lepple plan to be married Oct. 3 in the Community Church of Pelham.

title: Jersey Land Concern Told To Pay Back HomeBuyers
description: Attorney General Louis J. Lefkowitz announced yester day that a New Jersey land sales company was to pay back $120,000 to New York State home  buyers and $2,000 in court costs to the state, after an investigation by his office.

title: Drama Mailbag
description: TO THE EDITOR:

title: GALLSTONES LAID TO LIVER DISORDER
description: From medical studies on American Indians, two research ers have elaborated a radical proposal that a common type of gallstone affecting many other Americans as well as In dians may result from a dis order of the liver, not the gall bladder.

title: Behind a Strike: Issue of Rent
description: New York is a city of tenants. Some 2.1 million of the city's 2.8 million families rent their apartments, a per centage that housing experts say is probably double that of any other American city.

title: All the clichs of the war story, cleaned and shown anew
description: I grew up taking it for granted that I would have to serve in the Armyand, like a college student cramming for finals, I went to an enormous number of war movies and read an enormous number of war books to pick up as many tips as possible. When the time came and I went into the Army, our country wasn't at war. Although I was grate ful, I could not dismiss the cotton mouthed, anticipatory excitement I felt in Korea when we were slammed onto alertnor could I forgive the momentary sense of disappointment I felt when the alert was cancelled. Would I have been a good combat soldier? Well, because of Robert Gaffney's, A World of Good, I think I know how I would have behaved.

title: U.S. Aide Dismissed For Obscene Show
description: WASHINGTON, July 11 (UPI)The United States Of fice of Education says it has dismissed a young summer intern on charges that he pre sented an obscene slide show, in a Government building.

title: Unveilings
description: FRIEDMANArthur. In loving memory un. Yelling will be help on Sunday. Julu 12 at 11 A.M. at Old Mount Carmel Cemetery.

title: Human Sexual Inadequacy
description: Sexual inadequacy makes psychic invalids of thousands, more likely tens of thousands of Americans each year, and fractures or disrupts countless marriages. In this book for the first time two competent inves tigators report and analyze the treatment of a series of patients with this affliction. They show that immediate and fiveyear therapeutic results are amazingly good, with an overall cure rate of 80 per cent. Such a rate would be extraordinary for any chronic disorder; it is phe nomenal in the treatment of inade quate sexual functioning, which in the hands of other therapists has been notoriously resistant to cor rection.

title: Nancy F. Cook Is Wed on L. I. Sound
description: OLD GREENWICH, Conn., July 11Miss Nancy Ferris Cook and William C. Brooks Jr., were married at 5:30 A.M. today on the dock of her parents home on Long Island Sound.

title: ROCHE TROUNCES LAYER BY 63, 61
description: DUBLIN, July 11 (AP)Tony Roche trounced Rod Layer, 63. 61, in the allAustralian final of the Irish open tennis cham pionshin today.

title: Student Paper Gets Freed of Censors In U.S. Court Ruling
description: NEW HAVEN, July 11The United States District Court in Connecticut has ruled that students of Rippowam High School in Stamford may pub lish independent newspapers without having the contents screened by school officials in advance.

title: HOMELESS ASK AID IN ASBURY PARK
description: ASBURY PARK, N.J., July 11  Leaders of the black com munity in this seaside resort appealed today for residents to contribute clothing and house hold goods to families burned out of their apartments daring disturbances earlier in the week in which more than 100 people were arrested and 165 injured.

title: Garagiola Is Honored
description: COLUMBIA Mo., July 11 UPI Jim Garagiolit, the for mer St. Louis catcher who is now a broadeaster, will join his boyhood buddy, Yogi Berra, in the Missouri Sports Hall of fame I I is elect ion was an nounced today by executive secretary Don Faurot ling, of the hall.

title: Personality:
description: NEWARK, July 11  In the winter of 1937, when Edward J. Simmons was an 18yearold graduate of Bishop Loughlin Memorial High School in Brooklyn, he landed a job as a shorthand stenog rapher with the Triangle Con duit and Cable Company over in Manhattan. They starting salary was only $18 a week, but Mr. Simmons did not re main at that level for long.

title: FELIX GAILLARD LED THE FRENCH
description: PARIS, July 11  The body of Felix Gaillard, 50 years old a former Premier of France, was found today in the English Channel near the island of Jersey following a yachting ac cident.

title: SUEZ AREA STRUCK BY ISRAELI PLANES
description: TEL AVIV, July 11 (Reuters) Israeli jets went into action twice today against Egyptian positions along the Suez Canal, an army spokesman said here.

title: Dayan Triumphs'by 6Lengths in $50,000 American Trotting Championship
description: Dayan Triumphs'by 6Lengths in $50,000 American Trotting Championship

title: John R. Edmonds Weds Jean C. Wylie
description: BETHANY, Conn., July 11 Miss Jean Christie Wylie, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Alexander Pearson Wylie of Woodbridge, was married here this afternoon in Christ Episcopal Church to John Rolland Edmonds, son of Mrs. Jean Wilson Edmonds of Nor walk and John Kirkpatrick Edmonds of New York. The ceremony was performed by the Rev. Bruce E. LeBarron.

title: Trotters and Trainers From Around the World Prepare for $125,000 Roosevelt International on Saturday
Zoot Sims: Not the New Thing but the Real Thing
description: EXT Tuesday night the jazz lovers of this city will find themselves bending to the south with the religious instincts of good Mos lems turning to the east. The pull on their pieties will be exerted by the Half Note, that Shrine of High Schrei on. Spring and Hudson Streets, where the resident jinn, tenorman Zoot Sims, will be uncapping his horn for a very long playing engage ment.

title: Betty Jacobs Is Fiancee
description: ROCKVILLE CENTRE, L. I., July 11Miss Betty Louise Jacobs, who expects to re ceive a master's degree in psychology from Columbia University this summer, plans to he married in late Septem ber to Kenneth E. Malech, a graduate of the University of Pennsylvania Wharton School of Finance and Commerce. Mr. and Mrs. Herbert E. Jacobs have announced the engagement of their daugh ter to the son of Mr. and Mrs. Abraham Malech of Kansas City, Mo. Mr. Jacobs is president of Sportswear International, Ltd., importers of women's sportswear. Mr. Malech is a commodity broker.

title: World Bank Sets Tokyo Office
description: TOKYO, (Reuters) July 11 The International Bank for Reconstruction and Develop ment will open a Tokyo of fice early in November, to maintain close contact with the Japanese Government and financial circles, the Finance Ministry said this week.

title: KLECATSKY WINS TWICE IN ROWING
description: Humid weather, severe head wind and curious pleasure boaters did not deter the row ing races in the Pelham Bay Park regatta yesterday.

title: New Zealanders Waging Drive To Save Lake From Industry
description: AUCKLAND, New Zealand, July 11  New Zealand is one of the few comparatively ad vanced countries in the world where big cities are still free from smog, where even in mid winter urban dwellers can still enjoy clear days. Yet even in New Zealand pollution is be coming a major issue.

title: Science
description: When a slight earthquake shook the Virgin Islands one night last week, five women aquanauts were sleeping in a steel underwater chamber on the bottom of a secluded bay. Awakened by the tremor, they quickly checked their habitat, Tektite 2, and telephoned to the control center topside that no damage had been done.

title: Judith P. Grape, C. E. Barnett 3d Wed in Suburbs
description: SOUTHPORT, Conn., July 11Trinity Episcopal Church here was the setting this afternoon for the marriage of Miss Judith Pierreppont Grape, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Dudley H. Grape of Fair field, Conn. and Charles Eb bert Barnett 3d. The bride groom is the son of Mr. and Mrs. Barnett of Detroit.

title: Astros Beat Giants in 14th
description: HOUSTON, July 11 (UPI) Johnny Edwards hit a sacrifice fly in the bottom of the 14th inning tonight to score Cesar Cedeno and give the Houston Astrns a 54 victory over the San Francisco Giants.

title: T. E. Lawrence and others are alive and well and living in sin
description: Connoisseurship is one of the forms of displaced creativity. Critical as he is, the connois seur enters into a fond com plicity with the minds that produce what appeals to him; he finds himself expressed, evinced and very nearly thoughtintobeing by them. Usually, however, that is enough: he looks into the heart of vellum bindings, Eskimo soapstone statuettes, unwieldy monuments to the vulgarity of Victorian tastewhatever his fetish isand is content.

title: Wartime Pnompenh Losing Its Charm
description: PNOMPENH, Cambodia, July 9Pnompenh used to be a city where the loudest noise was the Sunday bells of the Roman Catholic churches. Now the days are punctuated by rifle shots.

title: FRANK A. HALSTEAD
description: Frank A. Halstead, a super visor in the New York Times plant protection department, I died yesterday at the age of 56. He lived at 26401 Langston Avenue in Glen Oaks, Queens, and was a retired member of the New York City Fire De partment.

title: The Season for Sleuths To Dig in New Mexico
description: SANTA FE, N.M.Among the bonuses for students and other enthusiasts who visit archeological excavation sites in New Mexico is the proximity of Indian pueblos to many of the digs. Several universities hold field sessions in arche ology in the state each summer, and the dig sites are visited, too, by tourists brushing up on their knowledge of this region's heritage.

title: Apartment Living Gains Favor
description: LOS ANGELES, July 11Ex cept for convinced cave dwel lers in New York and a few other big cities, Americans have traditionally thought of apart ments as halfway houses. As soon as they could afford the down payment, they would buy a house. That is no longer so.

title: Chicago Transit Fares Now 2d Highest in U.S.
description: CHICAGO, July 11 (UPI) Chicagoans began paying the secondhighest urban transit fares in the nation this week.

title: Buckley and Miss Broyles Take Junior Swim Crowns
description: BLAIRSTOWN, Iowa, July 1 (AP) Representatives of the Air Force Academy Swim Club took first place in both the men's and women's divisions of the Amateur Athletic Union na tional junior long distance swimming championships in Hannen Lake yesterday.

title: Sports Today
description: BASEBALL

title: Dreadful Doings At Dunwich
description: CONSIDERING the rather large body of superior supernatural fiction turned out by Howard Phillips Lovecraft before he died in 1937, it seems indeed strange that movie makers have made so little use of his stories and of the haunted, Yoknapataw phan world he conceived and placed somewhere ?? northern Massachusetts, a world that is complete with its own, very distinctive geography, history and mythology. Roger Corman mixed Love craft (Charles Dexter Ward) with Poe to make The Haunted Palace in 1963, and two years later Daniel Haller, Cor man's art directorturnedfilm director, adapted Lovecraft's The Colour Out Of Space as Die, Monster, Die, which I have never seen. (I also missed The Shuttered Room two years ago.) Thus, it was with very real pleasure I antici pated The Dunwich Horror, produced by Corman and directed by Haller, which opened at neighborhood theaters this week.

title: Group Purchases Land For Wildlife Sanctuary
description: WASHINGTON, July 11 (AP)The Nature Conserv ancy, a private group, an nounced yesterday that it was buying 15,028 acres in Arizona, including Aravaipa Canyon, for a wildlife sanctu ary.

title: LOCUST PROBLEM STUDIED IN LONDON
description: LONDON, July 9Locusts damaging food crops in Asia and Africa have an unwitting helperman.

title: FirstTime Campers A Tough Test
description: IT WAS TO he a test. Could two dyed inthewool city slickers find happiness in the woods, camping at one of the new private campgrounds that have be come so popular in recent years?

title: Here Comes the Post Graduate
description: LAWRENCE TURMAN moved to the head of the producing class with The Graduate. Now he's preparing a film ver sion of still another novel by Graduate author Charles Webb. This one is called The Marriage of a Young Stock broker. The script, about the love life of the postgraduate set, has been written by Lor enzo Semple, Jr., who won the New York Crit'cs award in 1968 for his screenplay of Pretty Poison. Richard Ben jamin has been signed for a starring role and shooting should start in Los Angeles in October for 20th Century Fox.

title: Richardson Names Aide
description: WASHINGTON, July 11 (AP) Elliot L. Richardson, Secre tary of Health, Education and Welfare, announced yesterday the appointment of Jonathan Moore to the new post of coun selor to the department.

title: The Merchant's View:
description: The latest word from the shopper's front is that the consumer is still being diffi cult, recalcitrant and down atthemouth.

title: Buckley: Serious Contender In Three Way Race
description: In New York City, where politicians often judge the success of their news con ferences by the number of television cameras lined up along the back wall, James L. Buckley attracted three cameras to his announce ment last Thursday that his campaign for the United States Senate would be man aged by F. Clifton White.

title: CLEVELAND BESET BY LABOR STRIFF
description: CLEVELAND, July 11 Three major strikes, two of them wildcats, have left Cleve land without public bus serv ice, garbage collections and construction of new homes, schools and commercial build ings.

title: Bruch Defeats Silvester In Discus Throw in Sweden
description: MALMOF. Sweden, July 11 (AP)Rikard Bruch of Sweden and Jay Silvester of Spanish Fork, Utah, recorded the long est discus throws in the world this year as they finished 12 in a track meet today.

title: CONFLICT IN DATES POSER TO GOLFERS
description: Last week there were many golf tournaments in which all types of mixed events were held. Many conflicts were prev alent and when the tourneys were over several had resulted in ties.

title: A's Pour Across All Runs in First 2 Innings for 111 Triumph Over Brewers
description: A's Pour Across All Runs in First 2 Innings for 111 Triumph Over Brewers

title: George V. Allen Is Dead at 66; One of 16 Career Ambassadors
description: DURHAM, N. C., July 11 Career Ambassador George V. Allen, who held key information posts in the State Department during some of most critical periods in the nineteenfifties and served in some of the world's most sensitive areas, died today of an apparent heart attack at his farm in nearby Bahama. He was 66 years old.

title: Miss Bonnie Ann McNell Plans Wedding
description: DARIEN, Conn., July 11 Miss Bonnie Ann McNell and Stewart Marshall Anderson, both of San Francisco, plan to be married here Aug. 15 at St. John's Roman Catholic Church.

title: ARGENTINE LABOR GAINING STRENGTH
description: BUENOS AIRES, July 11 Argentina's oncepowerful labor movement, ailing after three years of suppression by a mil itary Government, appears to be entering a political and eco nomic renaissance.

title: Miss Simonton Is Married in Rye
description: RYE, N. Y., July 11Miss Linda Davis Simonton and Yeoman 3d Cl. James Ander son Stainaker, U.S.N., were married here this afternoon. The Rev. Dr. Joseph P. Bishop performed the cere mony in the Rye Presbyterian Church. A reception was held at the American Yacht Club.

title: 2 Errors by Bernie Allen Help Yanks Score 3 in 8th
description: WASHINGTON, July 11 Bernie Allen of the Washington Senators might have been a minor sort of hero tonight, but he disqualified himself from any honors by committing two errors that led to all the New York runs in a 31 victory by the Yankees.

title: Salem State Names Head
description: SALEM, Mass, July 11 (AP) Dr. Frank L. Keegan, 45 years old, former associate dean of faculties at Cleveland State University, was unani mously elected president of Salem State College this wrek by the Massachusetts Board of Trustees of State Colleges.

title: U.S. Business:
description: CHICAGO, July 11 (UPI) Jervis Langdon Jr., Chairman and President of the Rock Island Lines, expressed belief this week that an Interstate Commerce Commission exam iner's report on the merger of the Rock Island with the Union Pacific could pave ?? way to a general settlement of realignment problems of the Western railroads. this week that an Interstate Commerce Commission exam iner's report on the merger of the Rock Island with the Union Pacific could pave ?? way to a general settlement of realignment problems of the Western railroads.

title: Symonette Takes Opener In King Olav Cup Sailing
description: HANKOE, Norway, July 11 (AP)John B. Symonette of the Bahamas, in John B, won the first 5.5meter race today in the King Olav Cupseries. Sec ond was King Olav V of Nor way in Norna X.

title: POPULATION RISES BY 35% IN FLORIDA
description: MIAMI, July 11 (UPI)  The population of Florida, paced by the gold coast counties of Dade and Broward, grew by 1,721,538 people in the last decade and now has a popula tion of 6,673,098.

title: Former City U. Educator Named Unity College Head
description: UNITY, Me., July 11 (UPI) Lawrence M. Reichel, 40 years old, of Saranac Lake, N. Y., has been named president of Unity College, a fouryear liberal arts school.

title: U. S. Tourists Return to Paris, but They Spend Little
description: PARIS, July 11  With Charles de Gaulle out of office, American tourists are back in record numbers  the young in more or less hippie costume, toting knapsacks and guitars, the older in gaudy sportswear, carrying cameras. But they are not spending the way they used to do.

title: Friday Night Fights
description: LIGNANO SABBIABORO Italy  Bruno Arcari, 139 pounds, Genoa, Italy, declared winner over Rene Roque, 139 Lyon, France. Roque disquali fled in sixth round for butting Arcari retained his Work Boxing Council junior welter weight title.

title: Sovereignty Pointed Up
description: YELLOWKNIFE, Northwest Territories, July 10  Queen Elizabeth of Canada traveled 5,000 miles across the Arctic this week impressing on Cana dians that their big, rich north land is their inheritance to de velop and protect.

title: Jersey County Orders Flag Slogan on Its Cars
description: MOUNT HOLLY, N. J., July 9, (AP)The governing board of a southern New Jersey county has voted unanimously to require all countyowned cars to carry flag decals with the slogan, Our Flag: Love It or Leave.

title: Every Black Woman Is Lena
description: ON a warm summer afternoon re cently, actress Ruby Dee came flying out of her house and across her big green lawn, hurrying to say goodbye to some friends. For sev eral moments she stood talking with them and when their car drove off, she raised her slender arm and flapped like a banner.

title: LAWRENCE SCORES IN SEA CLIFF SAIL
description: SEA CLIFF, L. I., July 11 Andy Lawrence's Sonata II won Star Class honors today in the second race of the Sea Cliff Yacht Club's threeweekend Commodore series on Hemp stead Harbor.

title: Greek Writers Opposed to Regime Publishing Book Stating Faith in Freedom
description: ATHENS, July 11George Seferis, a Nobel Prize winner, and 17 other Greek writers who oppose the militarybacked Government have published a volume of new works in Greece as a statement of faith in the right to free intellectual and artistic creation.

title: WESTIE IS WINNER IN VERMONT SHOW
description: BURLINGTON, Vt., July 11 A West Highland white terrier, Ch. DeGo Hubert, owned by Jane Esther Henderson of Stockton, N. J., was best of 1,115 dogs at the 17th annual show of the Champlain Valley Kennel Club today.

title: PHILS' 7RUN 9TH ROUTS CUBS, 104
description: CHICAGO. July 11 (AP)Tony Taylor's tiebreaking triple in the ninth inning capped a seven run explosion that gave the Philadelphia Phillies a 104 vic tory over the Chicago Cubs to day.

title: A New Colossus Of Rhodes? Purists Versus Promoters
description: RHODES, Greece  Opinions on this verdant, 545squaremile island 12 miles off the coast of Turkey are divided over whether or not to build a modernday colossus, one that might resemble the great Colossus of Rhodes of antiquity that stood for 56 years as one of the Seven Wonders of the Ancient World.

title: BEACH AN ISSUE IN EAST HAMPTON
description: EAST HAMPTON, L.I., July 11This picturebook village of sculpted hedges, shaded ave nues, sandy beaches, spacious lawns, saltboxes and windmill sails has been an artists' mecca for almost a cenutry.

title: Article 4  No Title
In Memoriam
description: ALEXANDERRussell C. Always with love. MINA AND LINDA.

title: WADKINS CAPTURES WESTERN AMATEUR
description: WICHITA, Kan., July 11 (AP)  Lanny Wadkins of Rich mond, a member of the 1969 Walker Cup team, defeated Charlie Borner of North Platte. Neb., 4 and 2, today to win the Western Amateur golf cham pionship at the Wichita Country Club.

title: In The Nation: Democracy in Action
description: WASHINGTON, July 10 President Nixon had good rea son to be elated, as was re ported when he heard that the House had supported him in pre liminary votes on the Cooper Church amendment to restrict future military operations in Cambodia. But there may have been some side effects that will not be so welcome, to him or to those Democratic leaders who apparently worked closely with him to achieve the vic tory.

title: MRS. SIDNEY DIAMOND
description: Mrs. Hannah Markstein Dia mond, secretary and member of the hoard of directors of the Lenox Hill Neighborhood Association, and wife of Sidney A. Diamond, a lawyer, died Fri day at Columbia Presbyterian Medical Center after a long ill ness. She was 51 years old and lived at 1130 Park Avenue.

title: Riggs Slates Tennis Clinic
description: Bobby Riggs will conduct a tennis clinic for children of the Association for the Help of Re tarded Children. July 20, at his Boulevard Gardens Courts in Woodside, Queens. Eight young sters from the organization, ages 8 to 10, who have ex pressed an interest in the sport will get their first lessons from the former national singles champion.

title: Jersey Hogweed May Be Giant
description: SUMMIT, N. J. July 11The Maurer family was worried that the towering plant press ing against the backporch screen might be a rashinduc ing giant hogweed so the county agricultural agent looked at it this morning and said judiciously:

title: South Africa Radio Bars Nonwhites From Contest
description: JOHANNESBURG, South Africa, July 11 (Reuters)An antigovernment newspaper said today that a South African Radio Corporation decision to ban nonwhites from a Beethoven music com petition was sick racialism.

title: Ancestral memories, natural laws, primitive needs
description: Four years ago the French Canadian writer, MarieClaire Blais wrote a remarkable novel, A Season in the Life of Em manuel. I call it a novel for convenience, but more precise ly the book is a Gothic ro mance. The empirical facts the story recites are offered not on their own account but as the appurtenances of dream, night mare, fantasy. The child Em manuel receives the gifts of time and place as if their only purpose were to sponsor the next acts of his inner life. Now Miss Blais has written another fiction that emerges from the same context of feeling. The characters have different names, and there is a demonstrable change in the nature of the prime feeling, but the inner milieu is continuous with that of A Season. The new book was written in two parts, pub lished separately in Canada as Manuscrits de Pauline Ar change (1968) and Vivre! Vi vre! (1969): the parts are now brought together as one fiction in Derek Coltman's excellent translation.

title: DARTMOUTH GROUP HELPS THE HUNGRY
description: A group of Dartmouth College sociology students who became interested in hunger and wel fare after reading a state report spent nine weeks investigating the problem in Lebanon, N. H., and helped obtain Federal sur plus food for 80 families who did not know they were eligible.

title: Royals Sink White Sox
description: KANSAS CITY, July 11 (UPI)  Bill Butler hurled threehit shutout and drove in a run with his second hit of the season tonight as the Kan sas City Royals defeated the Chicago White Sox, 40.

title: Marlboro Fete Opens by Candlelight
description: MARLBORO, Vt., July 11 Officially the 20th Marlboro Music Festival opens tonight, though without any special observances. Special observ ances are not in the Marl boro style. Unofficially the festival opened last night with a concert in the dining room before a highly critical audi ence made up largely of mem bers of the music staff.

title: Raymond Laporte, Former Diplomat, Is Dead in France
description: PARIS, July 11  Raymond Laporte, a French career diplo mat who was Consul General lin New York City from 1958 to 1963, died here Thursday of heart attack. He was 58 years old.

title: Miss Caroline Crawford Bride Of Alfred W. Baker Jr. of Navy
description: NEW CANAAN, Conn., July 11Miss Caroline Craw ford, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. William Randall Craw ford Jr., was married here this afternoon to Petty Of ficer 3d Class Alfred William Baker Jr., U. S. N. He is the son of Mr. and Mrs. Baker of Zanesville, Ohio.

title: Recordings
description: THE question of contro versy in art is a can of worms. While con troversy rages, the in trinsic values of the artwork in the spotlight are difficult to discuss because the con troversy tends to rise out of nonartistic issues which are usually social, political or economic. Was Strauss's Sa lome so controversial at its premiere in New York be cause the dissonant score pushed music theory another step past tonality, or was it because the Dance of Seven Veils threatened Victorian morality? Was Pete Seeger prevented from singing all of his antiVietnam war song. The Big Muddy, on the nowdefunct CBSTV Smoth ers Brothers Comedy Hour a few years ago because the ditty shattered folksong tradi tions or because the big fool who said to push on in the lyrics was a carica ture of Lyndon Johnson? pushed music theory another step past tonality, or was it because the Dance of Seven Veils threatened Victorian morality? Was Pete Seeger prevented from singing all of his antiVietnam war song. The Big Muddy, on the nowdefunct CBSTV Smoth ers Brothers Comedy Hour a few years ago because the ditty shattered folksong tradi tions or because the big fool who said to push on in the lyrics was a carica ture of Lyndon Johnson?

title: Banks See Fund Lack For Oil Hunt
description: A shortage of capital and a lack of investment incen tive pose problems for the petroleum industry in meet ing worldwide requirements for oil in the seventies, ac cording to recent studies by New York's two largest banks.

title: Bridal Is Held For Miss Smith
description: ELIZABETH. N. J., July 11 Miss Margaret Gorman Smith and Allen David Mitch ell were married this morning at the Roman Catholic Church of the Immaculate Concep tion by the Rev. John J. Gor man, a cousin of the bride, who also celebrated the nup tial mass.

title: Joyce A. Grimes Wed in Maine
description: PORTLAND, Me., July 11 Miss Joyce Ann Grimes, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. John Harvey Grimes of Port land, was married here today to Donald P. Ricklefs, son of Mr. and Mrs. Donald F. Rick lefs of Portsmouth, N. H., at St. Patrick's Roman Catholic Church.

title: Railroads Plagued Still by Issue of Work Rules
description: Three of the nation's major railroadsthe Baltimore & Ohio, the Southern Pacific and the Louisville & Nashville  were struck by the United Transporta tion Union last week as the re sult of a longstanding dispute over the elimination of firemen's jobs.

title: On the up and up
description: For years, Fane Solomon, a Bay Street merchant in Nassau, had been in love with the sea and ships and collecting nautical knicknacks and antiques. So what could have been more logical, when he decided to have a weekend retreat erected on the eastern tip of the island, than a building in the shape of a lighthouse? Two British architects, Arnold Frank Robjohns and Henry Melich, drew the plans, and in 1963 the 70foottall tower of concrete and steel, striped red and white, was built atop a hill of coral, a stone's throw from the sea, in one of the island's exclusive residential areas. The twobed room, threebath house, which is five stories high, is a treasure trove of ship models and nautical an tiques. A teak and mahogany staircase spirals around the inside of the tower from the first floor the libraryto the top, the living room. There's a bedroom and bath on the second and third floors, a kitchen and dining area on the fourth. An elevator makes living on the vertical feasible.

title: HEARD SHOOTS 69 TO TRAIL BY SHOT
description: MILWAUKEE, July 11 (AP) Deane Beman got birdies on the last two holes today for a 68 and moved into a tie with Don Massengale for the third round lead in the $110,000 Mil waukee open golf tournament.

title: TALKS OPEN IN SEOUL ON U.S. TROOP CUTS
description: SEOUL, South Korea, July 11 United States and South Ko rean military officials opened preliminary talks here today on the United States plan to with draw some of the 64,000 Ameri can troops and airmen from Korea, while South Korean Gov ernment leaders began softening their opposition to the troop cutback.

title: Trevino in $160,000 Golf
description: SUTTON, Mass., July 11 (AP) Lee Trevino, who narrowly missed winning the British Open, was entered officially today in the $160,000 Avec Golf Classic Aug. 20 through 23 at Pleasant Valley Country Club.

title: Milton and Anna: Book Two
description: One of the most profound intellectual changes in the last decade has been the emergence of the monetarist school of economics, led by Professor Milton Friedman of the University of Chicago, from what was once re garded as practically the lunatic fringe of the eco nomics profession to a posi tion in center stage, with great influence on the con duct of national economic policy.

title: SILENT MAJORITY OF BLACKS FORMED
description: WASHINGTON, July 11An organization known as the Na tional Black Silent Majority Committee, which some mem bers say will seek to increase the black vote for Republican candidates, has been organized with financial help from a Re publican party organization.

title: Can a Black Man Get a Fain Trial in This Country?
description: I am appalled and ashamed that things should have come to such pass that I am skeptical of the ability of black revolutionaries to achieve fair trial anywhere in the United States.

title: Article 6  No Title
description: HARDNOSED China watchers may ar gue that American tourists will be tak ing commercial flights to the moon before they ever get to visit Communist China. But optimists  a growing number of them, including several respected tour operators and officials of one major airlinehave interpreted recent stirrings in Washington and Peking as evidence that the Bamboo Curtain may soon rustle open, provid ing Americans with their first oppor tunity to visit the Chinese mainland since Mao Tsetung's Communist take in 1949.

title: Fitness Advocate Plays 18 Holes in 40 Minutes
description: MIAMI, July 11 (UPI) To challenge the image of the plump and lazy golfer riding the course in an elec tric cart, Dr. Joe Brownholtz jogs from shot to shot and claims a record for speedy rounds.

title: AllStar Game Facts
description: TeamsNalional League All Stars vs. American Leagur All Stars.

title: Schools: Some Gains, But Still Large Problems
description: WASHINGTONTo the 25 In tense young attorneys respon sible for school desegregation problems in the Department of Justice, it was one of their best weeks in the Nixon Administra tion.

title: Mutual Troop Cuts
description: After two years of silence, the Warsaw Pact's positive response to NATO proposals for reciprocal force reductions is a major step toward the EastWest settlement in Europe that has eluded the world for a quartercentury since World War II.

title: Transit Costs Up, but Fare Is Called Sale
description: The subway and bus operat ing budget for the city for the next fiscal year Is up 20 per cent over the previous year, but the 30cent fare is safe, at least through 1971, the Metro politan Transportation Author ity reported yesterday.

title: A Pledge To Indians Of a New And Better Deal
description: WASHINGTON  It took a quarter of a century, but Rich and M. Nixon began to make good last week on a pledge to his Whittier College football coach. In the process, he may have given American Indians their only real cause for opti mism since the United States signed the first Indian treaty in 1778.

title: Is This Any Way to Run a Steambath?
description: ALTHOUGH He is widely alleged to be dead, God still receives a con siderable amount of attention from modern writers. After all, if you want to make metaphors for the absurd ity and nastiness of the world we live in, one way to do it is to imagine the sort of absurd and nasty person (mod ern gods are highly anthropomorphic) who would create and maintain such world. If you are bitter and angry at the world (which often goes with a percep tion of it as absurd and nasty), you can relieve your feelings by demeaning and deriding the God you have created. And if your bent is toward comedy, you can have a sardonic and blasphemous good time in playing on the incongruitygap between the conventional image of God and your own disreputable version of Him.

title: Miss Schwab to Wed
description: ROCKVILLE CENTRE, L. I., July 11  Mrs. Murray E. Schwab has announced the engagement of her daughter, Miss Susan Merel Schwab, to Joel Etiel Wilson, son of Mr. and Mrs. Ami Wilson of East Meadow, and Miami. The future bride, daughter also of the late Mr. Schwab, is a Columbia University grad uate and expects to receive a registered nurse's degree from Columbia's School of Nursing next month. Her fianc, a Knox College grad uate, is a student at the New York University Grad uate School of Business Administration.

title: Street. Tavgan Net Victors
description: BURLINGAME, Calif., July 11 (AP)Ferdi Taygan of Fram ingham, Mass., and Drew Street of Salt Lake City defeated Billy Martin of River Forest, Ill., and Howard Schoenfeld of Rochester, Minn., 36, 97, 75, today for the boys' 14yearand under doubles title in the na tional junior hardcourt tennis championships.

title: APOLLO CREW UPSET ON WORKER MORALE
description: HOUSTON, July 11 (UPI) The Apollo 14 commander, Capt. Alan B. Shepard, ex pressed concern that cutbacks and layoffs in the space pro gram may cause low morale among engineers and technici ans preparing his moonship for launching in January.

title: A Lesson From the Cedars of the Lord
description: AMONG the lofty peaks of the Lebanese Moun tains on the east ern Mediterranean, one tiny, green dot of color can be seen in the bare expanse of snow high on the slopes of Mt. Qornet Es Sauda (10, 115 feet). This small group of ancient trees stands as a stark reminder of man's thoughtless destruction of his natural environment.

title: U.S. Reports Finding 7 Bodies In General's Copter in Vietnam
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, July 11 (UPI)The United States command said today that seven bodies had been recovered from the wreckage of a helicopter that had carried Maj. Gen. George William Casey, the commander of the First Cavalry Division (Air mobile).

title: Driver Who Left Keys In Car Liable in Crash
description: PHILADELPHIA, July 11 (UPI)A motorist has been held liable in a $21,500 dam age suit on the ground that he invited the theft of his automobile, which later fig ured in an accident, by leav ina the keys in the car.

title: Peace Movement, $74.80, Triumphs in Detroit Race
description: DETROIT, July 11 (AP) Peace Movement, a 361 choice, won the $46,350 Milette Handi cap for fillies and mares today at the Detroit Race Course.

title: Hubert M. Greist 3d Marries Miss Annalise Marie Evenson
description: RIVERSIDE, Conn., July 11 Miss Annalise Marie Even son, daughter of Herbert W. Evenson of Greenwich and Mrs. Helene Belange Evenson of Riverside, was married here this evening to Hubert Milton Greist 3d. He is the son of Mr. and Mrs. Griest Jr. of New Haven and Pine Orchard.

title: From Broadway to Dog Show
description: Howard Atlee is a well known figure on the Broad way scene. He has been press agent for some top theatrical hits. On the dog show stage, Atlee plays a leading role and a diversified one. He has starred as a breeder, owner, handler, founded a specialty club and served as a judge at match shows.

title: A PLAYOFF TODAY
description: ST. ANDREWS, Scotland, July 11Doug Sanders, who had to qualify to enter, and Jack Nick laus have tied for first at 283 in the British Open golf champion ship that neither seemed able to win. They meet in an 18hole playoff tomorrow.

title: Dietz, AllStar Nominee Of Giants Spiked on Foot
description: HOUSTON, July 11 (UPI) Dick Dietz of the San Francisco Giants, named to the National League AllStar team for the first time, was forced 10 leave tonight's game with the Hon ston Astros after being spiked on the big toe of his left foot.

title: Loan to Australia
description: Australia has obtained a $26.6million loan from the United States ExportImport Bank to help finance the pur chase of four Boeing 747 jets and related equipment. The total contract price is about $140.2million. The Govern ment agency lent the Gov ernment of Australia $23.8 million in 1968 to cover part of the predelivery payments for the planes. Both loans are at 6 per cent annual in terest and are repayable over about three and a half years starting in late 1975.

title: Midsummer Bees
description: Now the bees thrive. They are in clover, both literally and figuratively, for the flowers they patronize for pollen and nectar are in full midsummer bloom. Stand beside a meadow or even at the edge of a suburban lawn rich with clover and you can hear the bees almost any afternoon, the low, unmistakable drone of thou sands of winged honey gatherers at work. Watch any country roadside and you will see them, at the daisies, the hawkweed, the milkweed, the primroses, the berga mot and the bloom on the elderberries.

title: Tigers Sign Pitcher
description: DETROIT, July 11 (UPI)  David Baye, the Detroit Tigers' 14th pick in last month's free agent draft, signed a contract today. He is a 6foot3inch, 185pound righthanded pitcher from Southern Connecticut Col lege.

title: Tadas Uskuraitis, a Designer, Marries Pauline Ellen Price
description: MANHASSET, L. I., July 11 Miss Pauline Ellen Price was married here today in the Congregational Church to Tadas Uskuraitis, a graduate of the Rhode Island School of Design who is director of the design department of J. C. Penney, Inc. in New York.

title: Lawmakers to Sweat It Out
description: BOSTON, July 11 (UPI) Massachusetts state legislators in the House and Senate were informed this week that be cause of a breakdown in eler trical equipment t he State House airconditioners would be out of operation for months.

title: Instant Fishing Village A New Trend in Resorts
description: MAHON, Island of Minorca, Spain Like a pile of sugar cubes, the village of Binibeca huddles above a cove shel tering a minisandbeach on the rocky south coast of this, the most northerly of the Balearic Islands. Tile roofs top ping a folkart jumble of irregular houses leaning against each other and boats, nets and lobster pots scattered in front of massive boathouse doors recall old fishing villages on small har bors all around the Mediterranean.

title: Miss Ann C. Williams Is Bride Of Edward Woll Jr. in Boston
description: BOSTON, July 11  The Gordon Chapel of Old South Church here was the setting for the wedding today of Miss Ann Chilton Williams, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Ben Ames Williams Jr. of Jamaica Plain, and Edward Woll Jr., son of Mr. and Mrs. Woll of Wenham. The Rev. Frederick M. Meek performed the cere mony.

title: Raising Bail for the Panthers
description: On April 2, 1969, 13 members of the Black Panther party in New York were rounded up by police and charged with conspiracy to bomb public places. Since that day, almost all of them have been locked in jail cells, released only for brief court appearances, awaiting trial that is now likely to begin sometime late in September. Bail for the Panthers was set in amounts ranging from $50,000 to $100, 000. The Panthers, all of them declared legally indigent, have been unable to raise the money, and their lawyers, despite pleas to high state courts, have been un able to get the bail reduced.

title: Nancy Herger, A.W.Duryee Jr. Are Married
description: PORT ALLEGANY, Pa., July 11  Miss Nancy Patricia Herger and A. Wilbur Duryee Jr., son of Dr. and Mrs. Dur yee of New York and Pawl ing, N. Y., were married here this morning.

title: HomeGrown Seed Is Spice for Soup of Pot
description: TARRYTOWN, N. Y., July 11 (UPI)When 57yearold Antonio Carrozzi goes to court Thursday, his wife will accompany him with a pot Of soup for the judge.

title: Porsches First, Second and Fourth in Watkins Glen Six Hours of Endurance
description: WATKINS GLEN, N.Y., July 11John Wyer's Britainbased Porsche factory team won an easy race today, taking the first two positions in the Wat kins Glen Six Hours of En durance, part of the world, manufacturers' championship. A Ferrari finished third.

title: Divine Disobedience
description: To The Editor:

title: ARNAUD MARTS, 82, EXBUCKNELL HEAD
description: Arnaud Cartwright Marts, former president of Bucknell University and a professional fund raiser, died yesterday at. Doctor's Hospital. He was 82 years old and lived at 41 Park Avenue.

title: UNITY HALL WINS DELAWARE STAKES
description: STANTON, Del., July 11 (AP) Christiana Stables' unbeaten Unity Hall decisively defeated Deceit, her rival for the 2year old filly title, today in the $24,850 Blue Hen Stakes at Delaware Park.

title: Saigon Police Halt Protest Including U.S. Marchers
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, July 11  Policemen using tear gas broke up a march today by South Vietnamese students and a visiting American delegation here to assess the peace move ment.

title: Pentagon Disclaims Knowledg
description: WASHINGTON, July 11 (UPI) A Pentagon spokesman said today that he knew nothing of the deaths and that the Defense Department's historian would have to search the records be fore the account could be verified.

title: Newton Expected to Set Up Headquarters in Harlem
description: The Black Panther party said yesterday that it planned to use Harlem as a parttime head quarters for the party's founder and minister of defense. Huey P. Newton, who is scheduled to be released from a Califor nia jail in a few weeks.

title: Six Iroquois Tribes Seek Unity And Power Lost for 200 Years
description: GENEVA, N. Y., July 11 Members of the six tribes of the Iroquois Confederacy, which broke up in the French and Indian War, gathered here this weekend to seek ways of restor ing some of their old power.

title: Sports of The Times
description: Casey Stengel made his first ?? on the New York scene in 1912 as a rookie player on the Brooklyn Superbas. He later was an outfielder for the New York Giants, manager of the Brooklyn Dodgers manager of the Boston Braves, manager of the Yankees and manager of the Vets. He has tasted success and failure. He pre fers success.

title: Japan Starts Study On Building Tanker Of 1,000,000 Tons
description: TOKYO, July 11Japan the world's shipbuilding leader for more than 10 years, has begun to study the construction of a 1,000.000  deadweight  ton oil tanker.

title: A noseholding diatribe, complete with novel and movie script
description: Gore Vidal, the author of Myra Breckinridge, complains throughout this snappish little essay (disguised, perhaps with a smile of knowing apology, as both a novel and a book of memoirs) that the young no longer read. Considering the source of this complaint, it sounds like Marie Co relli sighing in 1922 that romance is fading from the world. The young, seems, read Tolkien and Kurt Vonne gut. This, Mr. Vidal concedes, may be just as well, as there is no longer any writing worth a cultivated soul's attention. And in the United States, there never has been. What clods Melville, Hawthorne and Mark Twain are when compared to Victor Hugo and George Eliot! Look at Proust and William Faulknerhow can we think that literature can survive a latitudi narianism which allows a wide mouthed hick from Mississippi into the company of the wraith of the Boulevard Haussmann?

title: Zuta, like Moses, must deliver the goodsthat is, his people
description: And I will send thee unto Pharaoh that thou mayest bring forth My people, the children of Israel out of Egypt, says God, and David Zuta, the narra tor of Yoram Matmor's extraor dinary novel answers, Who? Me??

title: 10,000 Hurt by Fireworks During July 4th Weekend
description: BOSTON, July 11 (AP)Ap proximately 10,000 persons  mostly childrenwere injured by fireworks during the Fourth of July weekend this year, ac cording to the National Fire Protection Association.

title: Atlanta Police Award Certificates of Merit
description: ATLANTA, July 11 (UPI)  Atlanta policemen, con ducting an experimental drive to change the police image. have given out several hun dred certificates of merit and passes to Atlanta Braves baseball games, as rewards for good citizenship.

title: Puerto Rican Named Miss Universe
description: MIAMI BEACH, July 11 (AP)  Miss Puerto Rico, Marisol Malaret Contreras, was named Miss Universe 1970 tonight, edging out Debbie Shelton of the United States.

title: The Loves of a Loser
description: MILOS FORMAN, the Czechoslo vak film director, is eating chunks of watermelon in the breakfast nook of a tidy, one family home in Beechhurst, Queens, looking every inch the American sub urbanite in his wheat jeans and striped body shirt. In fact, he's taking a lunch break on the set of his first American movie, which is being shot in this house and at other locations around New York.

title: Atlanta's Troubled AAA Battling to Come Back
description: ATLANTA, July 11One day in early 1969, before money dried up and when people still were thinking in terms of turning a fast profit in the stock market, a young man named Jackie G. Wil liams was walking around Atlanta with a check in his pocket made out to him for $3.6milion.

title: Security, Adhesion of Hall Car Is Lauded by Stewart, Driver
description: WATKINS GLEN, N. Y. July 11For one of the few times in his career, Jackie Stewart is high on a new race carin this case the Chaparral 23  but he ac knowledges he has a great deal to do before he feels completely at ease with Jim Hall's radical design. Stewart says he has to make more ad justments to the car than the car has to make to him. We're not married yet, the world driv ing champion says. We're having a bit of a fighting affair the Chaparral 2J is a bold concept introduced by Hall, the Texas designer builderdriver, who is fa mous for his racecar innova tions. says he has to make more ad justments to the car than the car has to make to him. We're not married yet, the world driv ing champion says. We're having a bit of a fighting affair the Chaparral 2J is a bold concept introduced by Hall, the Texas designer builderdriver, who is fa mous for his racecar innova tions.

title: Foreign Affairs: Irish Hawks Are Rising
description: DUBLINThe greatest dan ger of the present Irish situa tion is that extremist elements will take over In both the Re public and the six counties of Ulster, creating an absolutely senseless and wholly avoidable crisis. Hawks are rising this weekend on both sides of the horder.

title: SETTER IS CHOSEN IN FIELD OF 1,185
description: RIVERHEAD, L. I., July 11 Rory, an English setter more formally known as Ch. Can berra's Legend, was best today of 1,185 dogs at the Riverhead Kennel Club show. Handled by her owner, Mrs. Joyce Rosen of Commack, L. I., the setter gained her second bestinshow award in a month, when she was selected by James Wright of Lake Ronkonkoma. L. I.

title: Nancy A. Sweet, 1966 Debutante, Becomes Bride
description: LAKE PLACID, N. Y., July 11 Miss Nancy Adams Sweet and Lawrence Lewis Master were married here this after noon in St. Eustace Episcopal Church by the rector, the Rev. Frederick C. McQuade Jr. The Rev. William D. Hayes assisted.

title: Stamps
description: As noted here briefly last week, a 6cent Dwight David Eisenhower de finitive stamp will be issued at Washington next month. It will replace the Franklin Delano Roosevelt 6 cent stamp (1966) which, with the current 6cent Flag stamp (1968), have been the normal definitive stamps for the car riage of firstclass domestic mail (in addition to various commemorative stamps of similar denomination).

title: GRAFTERS FACING TAX PROSECUTION
description: The Internal Revenue Service has prosecuted 24 local and state lawenforcement officers in the last few years, many for failing to report bribes on their incometax returns.

title: Padres Win on Homer
description: SAN DIEGO, July 11 (AP) Clarence Gaston hammered leadoff ninthinning homer to night as the San Diego Padres beat the Los Angeles Dodgers, 43.

title: Movies
City Hospital Shift Brings Major Rise in Utility Bills
description: The city's new Health and Hospitals Corporation will be billed for hundreds of thousands of dollars a year in added util ity charges because of the sepa ration of the municipal hospi tals from the regular city gov ernment, a high official said Yesterday.

description: TWO WEEKS AT YALE

title: One man against the sea
description: You are compelled to say, after reliving at safe remove the experience contained within this book, that the English have produced, and still do, some of the most singular and mys teriously constituted people imaginable.

title: Point of View
description: The word for construction wages is runaway. Although wages in general have been rising rapidly in the last few years throughout the economy, the inflationary impact of skyrocketing settlements in the construction industry deserves the term astronomi cal. During the first quarter of 1970, the firstyear contract increase was at the alarming rate of about 18 per cent three times the rise in the cost of living.

title: Margo Wallace Fiancee Of Lieut. J. B. Richman
description: DENVER, July 11Miss Charlotte Margaret Wallace, niece of Mrs. Harry S. Tru man of Independence, Mo., will be married here on Aug. 2 in the Evans Chapel of the University of Denver to Lieut. Jerome Barry Rich man, U.S.A.F., son of Mr. and Mrs. Murray Richman of Odenton. Md.

title: On the Boardwalk: What a Difference A Century Makes!
description: ATLANTIC CITY, N.J.The town that gave you Miss America, saltwater taffy, the diving horse and the stops on a Monopoly board now gives you a cen tennial. The arches overhead acclaim the venerability of the institution under foot the Boardwalk at Atlantic City is 100 years old this year.

title: Late Listings for Today's TV
description: The following information about today's television pro grams was not available in time to appear in Section 2.

title: Stephen Richard Kerbs Weds Susan M. Mudd in Connecticut
description: NEWTON, Conn., July 11  Miss Susan Mary Mudd was married today to Stephen Richard Kerbs just four weeks after her brother, Kyle Chris tian Mudd, and the bride groom's sister, Joanne, were married.

title: Officer Tells CourtMartial He Ordered G.I. to Kill Man
description: LONGBINH, South Vietnam, July 11 (AP)First Lieut. James Brian Duffy told an Army court martial here today that he had ordered Specialist 4 John R. La Nasa to execute a Vietnam ese prisoner suspected of be ing a Vietcong.

title: Susan Hadden And a Biologist Wed in Suburbs
description: SOUTHPORT, Conn. July 11  Trinity Episcopal Church here was the setting this afternoon for the mar riage of Miss Susan Gay Hadden and Alexander Ed ward Richard Woodcock. The ceremony was performed by the Rev. Francis X. Cheney, assisted by the Rev. Richard A. Watson of St. Joseph's College in North Windham, Me., who is the bride's uncle.

title: STAKES RACE GOES TO PATTEE CANYON
description: CHICAGO, July 11 (AP)  Pattee Canyon, carrying high weight of 129 pounds, posted a sixlength victory today in the $53,400 Matron Stakes at Arl ington Park.

title: Anniversaries
description: KAYEBrenda. All my love, thanks for wonderful five years, happy anniversary.

title: 2 Black Players Pay Debt to Tennis With Clinic for Watts Youth
description: LOS ANGELES, July 11 (AP)Richard Williams is a black tennis player living in Watts. Last summer he thought what had been good for him just might be good for his brothers and sisters.

title: Eileen Denari, Buyer, Engaged To James Ludwig, Saks Officer
description: TIMONIUM, Md., July 11 Miss Eileen Mary Denari, a buyer for Saks Fifth Avenue in New York, and James J. Ludwig, a vice president of Saks and general manager of its San Francisco branch, have become engaged.

title: WEST GERMAN RIDER WINS FRENCH EVENT
description: LA BAULE, France, July 11 (Reuters)  Alvin Schocke mochle of West Germany piloted Wimpel to victory today in the Remy Martin Prix d'Honneur at the international I horse show. Wimpel had a time advantage of 6.2 seconds in winning in 1 minute 15.3 sec onds.

title: Brazen Brother Triumphs
description: BOSTON. July 11 (AP)  Jaclyn Stable's Brazen Brother pulled away to an easy victory in the $22,080 Mayflower Stakes today before a crowd of 18.070 at Suffolk Downs.

title: 2 Leftist Students Named As Kidnappers of Aramburu
description: BUENOS AIRES, July 11 (AP)  Two leftist students, one killed in a gunbattle and an other still being sought, were identified by Argentine police today as the kidnappers of for mer President Pedro E. Aram buru.

title: Long a winner
description: The Great American Shirtdress has gone to new lengths for autumn and, with so many midis looking as if they had been designed for a costume party, somehow the shirtdress, in this latest incarnation, never looked better.

title: 197 YACHTS BEGIN RACE TO MACKINAC
description: PORT HURON, Mich, July 11 (AP)A fleet of 197 yacht: headed northward today at the start of the 45th annual Port HurontoMackinac Island sail boat race.

title: Reader's Report
description: The Rock

title: For Young Readers
description: Seventeen  year  old Wendy Altar dyce in Lee Kingman's novel, THE PETER PAN BAG (Houghton Mifflin, $3.75), is perhaps speaking for many of today's teenagers when she tells her parents home is just not the center of our lives.
