Exasperated by silver napkin rings, games of Monop oly and her father's dominating intellectual discussions in their subur ban household, rebellious Wendy runs away feeling that whatever my own thing is, I know I can't find it here. I have to find it somewhere else by myself.

title: 1.600 Secretaries to Attend Convention Here This Week
description: Commissioner Neal L. Moylan of the New York State Depart ment of Commerce will be the principal speaker when the 25th annual convention on the National Secretaries Associa tion opens at the Americana Hotel Wednesday.

title: NEW BEDFORD NEGRO KILLED
description: NEW BEDFORD, Mass, July 11 (AP)A Negro youth was killed and three black youths were injured tonight when oc cupants of two cars driven through a Negro neighborhood fired into a crowd on a corner, police said.

title: Rye Futures End Trading In Chicago
description: The declining importance of rye as a major crop and a resultant lack of futures trading volume, was the reason given by the Chicago Board of Trade recently for scheduling the suspension of futures trading this month.

title: New Revolt Is Proclaimed Against Sultan of Muscat
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, July 11 Four revolutionary groups in Oman, the interior province of the Sultanate of Muscat and Oman, in the southeastern sec tor of the Arabian peninsula, are reported to have merged and proclaimed a new revolt against Sultan Said Ibn Taimur.

title: It Was a FrontOffice Kind of Movie
description: Mr. Macdonald replies. I'M sorry Mr. Rush and Mr. Kaufman were upset by my review. I'm not with out humanity, except pro fessionally, and I wouldn't want to give needless pain to such dedicated artists (We spent two years of our lives making Getting Straighta rash investment of time) and to the highminded execu tives of Columbia Pictures who let them create without interference. (Though why should they have interfered? It was a frontoffice kind of movie.) But, as critics and surgeons know, it is some times necessary to give pain if health is to be preserved. Still, I didn't anticipate such a prolonged roar of agony. Dick and Bobwe seem to be on firstname termsmay not be angry but they are ter ribly terribly hurt. Also in coherent, even by Hollywood standards of discourse. They would have been well ad vised either to write nothing such defenses are rarely best undertaken by the auth ors themselvesor else to boil it down. Ouch! would about cover it. who let them create without interference. (Though why should they have interfered? It was a frontoffice kind of movie.) But, as critics and surgeons know, it is some times necessary to give pain if health is to be preserved. Still, I didn't anticipate such a prolonged roar of agony. Dick and Bobwe seem to be on firstname termsmay not be angry but they are ter ribly terribly hurt. Also in coherent, even by Hollywood standards of discourse. They would have been well ad vised either to write nothing such defenses are rarely best undertaken by the auth ors themselvesor else to boil it down. Ouch! would about cover it.

title: Use of Argus Tower in Bermuda Race Upsets Long
description: I think there is no ques tion that it was poor judg ment by the committee to use the Argus Tower as a mark of the course during the Bermuda Race, said Sumner A. (Huey) Long, owner of the powerful ketch Cndine, a participant, last week. Ondine was one of yachts that had trouble be cause the light on the tower, 25 miles southwest of Ber muda, was difficult or impos sible to see at night, de pending upon individual cir cumstances. It was intro duced this year in an effort to increase the chances for windward sailing. yachts that had trouble be cause the light on the tower, 25 miles southwest of Ber muda, was difficult or impos sible to see at night, de pending upon individual cir cumstances. It was intro duced this year in an effort to increase the chances for windward sailing.

title: Plane Ditching Stirs Doubts at Inquiry
description: SAN JUAN, P. R., July 11 For years, airline crews havel dutifully gone through elabo rate drills in swimming pools and huge aircraft markups practicing how to evacuate a jetliner forced down at sea.

title: Clinton L. Rossiter 3d Is Dead; Historian and Political Scientist
description: ITHACA, N.Y., July 11 Clinton L. Rossiter 3d, histori an, political scientist and pro fessor at Cornell University, was found dead today of heart attack in the basement of his home here.

title: Action for 1970 British Commonwealth Games
description: LAST Wednesday, on the eve of the opening of the 1970 British Com monwealth Games, an intercommonwealth sports festival similar to the world wide Olympic Games, Britain issued three multicolored hor izontal stamps depicting ac tion of participating athletes. They were printed by Thomas de la Rue, the British stamp printer, by their Delacryl process. tion of participating athletes. They were printed by Thomas de la Rue, the British stamp printer, by their Delacryl process.

title: Miss Margaret Esme Simon Affianced to Brian L. Berger
description: Dr. Carol T. Simon of New York and George M. Simon of Albany have announced the engagement of their daughter, Miss Margaret Esme Simon, to Brian Leslie Berger. He is the son of Dr and Mrs. Harold Berger of Elizabeth, N. J. The wedding is planned for Aug. 23 at the Plaza Hotel.

title: Democraticc Aide Resigns
description: WASHINGTON, July 11 (UPI)  Mrs. Geri Joseph, vice chair man of the Democratic National Committee since 1968 has re signed to work in the Senate, campaign of former Vice Presi dent Hubert H. Humphrey, Mary ??

title: 2 STAUB HOMERS
description: The Montreal Expos defeated the New York Mets for the sec ond straight time last night, 62, and tipped them into sec ond place in the Eastern Di vision of the National League.

title: LAWRENCE V. BURTON
description: Lawrence Vreeland Burton, a former editor of Food Indus tries magazine, died Thursday in Wayne, Me. He was 81 years old and lived at 187 Garth Road in Scarsdale, N.Y.

title: STRIKE CONTINUES IN BUILDINGS HERE
description: New York City's apartment strike drifted through its sixth day yesterday, with any major turn appearing to await the out come of court hearings sched uled for tomorrow.

title: Drilling for Oil Shows Decline
description: HOUSTON, Tex., June 27 (AP)Another sharp down ward trend has developed for domestic oil and gas drilling operations.

title: In the Mailbox
description: To the Editor:

title: Lauren K. Rossi Vermont Bride
description: BARRE, Vt., July 11Miss Lauren Kay Rossi was mar ried this afternoon to Spe cialist 4 John Franklin Van Deren 3d, U.S.A. The Rev. Roland Rivard performed the ceremony in St. Monica's Roman Catholic Church.

title: Flashing Headlights Work Device That Aids Drivers in Trouble
description: A new warning system en abling a motorist to be a Good Samaritan and alert highway patrols to a fellow driver in trouble is being tested in Florida.

title: Turnpike Food: Worth a Detour
description: Four wellknown food crit ics rate restaurants along the metropolitan area's super highways as ghastly. But, like good soldiers resigned to eat ing their Krations, masses of motorists eat turnpike food without comnlaint.

title: A dictionary that can be read like fiction
description: This is a very handsome reprint of a pioneering piece of lexicography that was begun in 1890 and com pleted in 1904. Of J. S. Farmer, who did most of the wordharvesting, we know little except that he was a philologist in the days when philol ogy was a kind of artbefore, that is, it changed into the rather grim science of linguistics. Of W. E. Hen ley we know that he was the crippled English poet whose head was bloody but unbowed.

title: Florida Track. Citing Loss. Will Close Next Saturday:
description: CASSELBERRY, Fla., July 11 (AP)Citing a loss of $700,000 in less than three months, Semi nole Turf Club officials con firmed reports today that the track would close next Satur day.

title: Daryl Acheson Bride of Robert Westbrook
description: SIASCONSET, Mass., July 11Miss Daryl Acheson, daughter of William G. H. Acheson of New York and Siasconset and the late Mrs. Acheson, was married here this afternoon to Robert Stanley Westbrook of New York, son of Mrs. Novie Westbrook of St. Louis, and the late Mr. Westbrook.

title: Johnny Cash Is Indebted To a Judge Named Sue
description: MADISONVILLE, Tenn., July 11His name is Sue. And that is why Judge Sue K. Hicks has received two record albums from Johnny Cash, along with two autographed pictures of the singer.

title: New Marina Eases South Shore's Berthing Jam
description: POINT LOOKOUT, L. I.A $450,000 recreational marina that was opened here last month by the Town of Hemp stead has alleviated the short age of transient boating facili ties on the South Shore.

title: VICTORS GET FIVE IN FIRST, 6 IN 2D
description: OAKLAND, July 11 (AP) The Oakland Athletics poured across 11 runs in the first two innings as they ended a batting stump with an 111 victory over the Milwaukee Brewers today.

title: A WESTCHESTER AREA AGAIN BLACKED OUT
description: WHITE PLAINS, July 11 For the second successive night, communities in central West chester County were without electricity as Consolidated Edi son technicians and officials tried in vain to trace the mys terious malfunction that cut off lights, airconditioners and elec tric clocks of more than 18,000 families.

title: ROGERS IS HOPEFUL OF SERIOUS REPLY TO MIDEAST PLAN
description: LONDON, July 11Secretary of State William P. Rogers said at a news conference today that the United States hoped that the Soviet Union and the United Arab Republic would provide a comprehensive re sponse to the American peace plan for the Middle East after President Gamal Abdel Nasser completed his current visit to Moscow. Mr. Rogers expressed his be lief that the delay in replies from Premier Aleksei N. Kosy gin of the Soviet Union and President Nasser indicates that they are giving it serious con sideration.

title: Home Improvement
description: IN recent years the trend has been growing to ward locating the home laundry center in or near the living areas of the house (on the first or second floor) rather than downstairs in the basement. Modern automatic clothes washers and dryers do not have to be located next to a set of laundry tubs or a sink the way earlier models did, so they can be installed in almost any loca tion the homemaker desires, so long as suitable water, drain and electric lines can be provided.

title: Geoffrey Buckley, Filmmaker, Marries Nancy Louise Morton
description: NEW CANAAN, Conn., July 11The marriage of Miss Nancy Louise Morton, a 1970 graduate of Sarah Lawrence College, to Geof frey Bright Buckley, an in dependent filmmaker, took place in the garden at the home of Mr. and Mrs. M. Thayer Ivison, stepfather and mother of the bride.

title: Fresh Air Camps Present Musicals To Slum Children
description: For most of the boys and girls enjoying Fresh Air Fund country vacations this summer. a short subway ride would take them from their blighted neigh borhoods in various parts of the city to Manhattan's mid town theater district.

title: How to Do It
description: If revolutions were fought with books instead of bullets our cities would already be in ruins. And blood would be pouring through their gut ters. Book racks everywhere are be ginning to creak under an everin ceasing number of works devoted to the destruction of the existing order, wellpackaged handbooks on how to annihilate the Establishment distrib uted by such giants of American capitalism as Random House and Mc GrawHill, in fact by almost all of commercial publishing.

title: Project at Fort Dix Prepares Soldiers for College
description: FORT DIX, N. J.  In the educational center here were 15 soldiers newly en rolled in an unorthodox City University of New York pro gram that aims to lead them directly from the service into college.

title: SCOTT SETS PACE IN LIGHTNING SAIL
description: NORTON, Conn., July 11 Manton Scott, the 1969 North American junior champion from the host Noroton Yacht Club, held a 1point lead for the Governor of Connecticut Cup today. He gained the edge in the first two races of the three event Lightning Class Regatta that was sailed on Long Island Sound in a 67knot southwest breeze. The series ends tomor row.

title: The Summer Mildews
description: TOWARD the middle of summer, phlox and li lac foliage often be come covered with a white substance that mars the lovely greenness in the garden. It's that old fungus problem mildew.

title: Ma Bell's Monopoly Slips?
description: How times change! That most monopolistic of all mo nopoliesthe American Tel ephone and Telegraph Com panyis finally faced with the threat of competition.

title: 9 YOUNG PEOPLE DIE IN CRASH ON COAST
description: SAN FRANCISCO, July 11 (AP)A headon collision on Golden Gate Bridge approach ramp kilted nine young people early today and injured three others.

title: Card of Thanks
description: SALOMONEThe family of the late D.J. Salomone wishes to express their most sincere and deeply felt gratitude and appre ciation to all their relatives and friends for their offerings or sympathy and condolences. To the Rev. Thomas Boyle of St. Patrick's Church for his priestly care and ministration to Brother Jonathan Ringkarro, O.S.F. and the many fathers and brothers of the Society of Jesus for their offerings of masses and prayers on the occasion of our recent be reavement

title: 191 Kilts n Kapers First at Monmouth
description: OCEANPORT, N. J., July 11 A toothache kept Kilts n Ka pers' trainer, Hal Goodwin, from seeing his filly score major upset today in capturing the $57,450 Monmouth Oaks at Monmouth Park.

title: News of The Camera World
description: ANY serious photogra pheramateur of pro fessional  can cre ate the lighting con venience and background flexibility of a studio any where, indoors or out, by us ing an assortment of light weight aluminum poles, crossbars and supporting hooks available from the Brewster Corporation, Old Saybrook, Conn. 06475. Tele scoping aluminum tension poles with rubber top and bottom pads to prevent mar ring or slipping, provide quickly installed vertical sup ports. Called Polecats, and made in various sizes to fit ceilings from four to 16 feet in height (extensions are available to go still higher), these poles are used to sup port a variety of accessories or wide rolls of seamless pa per for backgrounds. Prices vary from $16.95 to $24.95, depending on size. scoping aluminum tension poles with rubber top and bottom pads to prevent mar ring or slipping, provide quickly installed vertical sup ports. Called Polecats, and made in various sizes to fit ceilings from four to 16 feet in height (extensions are available to go still higher), these poles are used to sup port a variety of accessories or wide rolls of seamless pa per for backgrounds. Prices vary from $16.95 to $24.95, depending on size.

title: Graduation Exams An Italian Ordeal Even Without Dante
description: ROME, July 11  The en vironmental crisis and a re flection by Albert Einstein on the mystery of life were among the themes offered to 240,000 young and mostly nervous Ital ians for written examination this week.

title: Black Exodus to Suburbs Found Increasing Sharply
description: WASHINGTON, July 11  Contrary to all expectations, migration to suburbs by Amer ican Negroes appears to be sharply increasing.

title: Marriage Announcement 1  No Title
description: TO ADVERTISE announcements of anniversaries, births, engagements and marriages, call The New York Times Classified Advertising Dept. (212) OXford 53311. Closing time for Sunday issue is 6 P. M. Thursday.

title: Forest Trail. $20. First
description: MIAMI, July 11 (AP)Joseph M. Roebling's Forest Trail, coming on from last place, scored a twolength victory to day in the Julia Tuttle Handi cap at Tropical Park. The fa vored Feature Attraction was second and Royal Demise third.

title: Mrs. Thomas Has Son
description: A son was born on June 24 to Mr. and Mrs. Franklin A. Thomas of Brooklyn at the New York Hospital. Mrs. Thomas, the former Dawn C. Gill, is an author of children's books. Her husband is presi dent of the BedfordStuyve sant Restoration Corporation. The child has been named Kevin Anthony.

title: Letters to the Editor of The Times
description: British Rule in Ireland

title: SEARCH NARROWS FOR SCHOOL CHIEF
description: Dr. Harvey B. Scribner, the 56yearold State Education Commissioner of Vermont, has emerged as the leading candi date for the new post of Chan cellor of the city school system.

title: Frederick Platt 3d Marries Miss Waring in Connecticut
description: MADISON, Conn., July 11  Miss TinaMay Waring, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Orville Taylor Waring 2d of Madison, and Frederick Jo seph Platt 3d, son of Mr. and Mrs. Platt Jr. of Dalton, Pa., were married here this after noon at the First Congrega tional Church on the Green. The Rev. Franklin A. Bower performed the ceremony and a reception was given at the Country Squire in Killing worth.

title: 3 COMMANDS LEAD CAMBODIAN REBELS
description: Three Cambodian Communist leaders operating in separate geographical regions are in command of Cambodian guerril las who seek to overthrow the Government of Premier Lon Nol, an official Chinese Com munist publication has dis closed.

title: For Coops, Too, Maintenance Charges Are Going Up
description: Tenants of rental apart ments throughout the city have gotten the word in bold headlines that they will have to pay their landlords more each month because of the recently enacted revision of the city's rentcontrol law and a concomitant relaxation of the guidelines governing rentstabilized buildings. But the tens of thousands of New Yorkers who live in coopera tive apartment housesand are therefore exempt from rent control and rent stabili zation  are receiving simi larly depressing word in less spectacular fashion  usual ly in a letter that begins, placidly enough, Dear Neighbor... or Dear Co operative Owner...

title: Man With a Lonely, but Fighting, Heart
description: Dick Tiger was unwrapping gauze from his hands after his workout.

title: The Polluted Potomac: Sewage and Politics Create Acute Capital Problem
description: WASHINGTONThe heat of summer is enveloping the na tion's capital, and with it has come the annual resurgence of a problem residents have come increasingly to dread: A stom achturning miasma rising from the Potomac River.

title: Martha Ellen Willoughby a Bride
description: WARRENTON, Va., July 11 Miss Martha Ellen Wil loughby, daughter of Col. Wil liam H. Willoughby, U.S.A., retired, and Mrs. Willoughby of Broad Run, was married here today to Robert Daniel Cole, son of Mr. and Mrs. Robert Cole of Port Wash ington L. I.

title: Bethpage Polo Team Plays Brookville This Afternoor
description: Bethpage, the runnerup to Meadowbrook in the North eastern 12goal polo tourna ment earlier this month, will play Brookville this afternoon at the Bethpage (L. I.) State Park field.

title: The World
description: JERUSALEMWe are not as impressionable as we were back in 1967, an Israeli official said over the heavy, NorthEuropean unch that officials here offer their guests and that is as little suited to Jerusalem's dazzling climate as the black kaftans of the Hassidim.

title: A. F. Thurber Weds Miss Lemaire
description: NORWALK, Conn., July 11 Miss Diana Louisa Lemaire and Arthur Forrest Thurber were married here this after noon at the Lemaire resi dence on Old Lantern Road by the Rev. Gilbert Hellwig of the Emmanual Baptist Church in Ridgewood, N. J.

title: News of the Realty Trade
description: The Allied Stores Corpora tion, which owns Stern's and several other department store chains, has leased more than 200,000 square feet of floor space in the office building rising on the site of Stern's old 42d Street store.

title: Jazzmen at Newport Hail King Satchmo
description: NEWPORT, R. I., July 11 If you don't love him, Maha lia Jackson declared last night as she dedicated the final selec tion in her portion of the open ing program of the Newport Jazz Festival to Louis Arm strong, then I don't think you know how to love.

title: Bridal in South For Mrs. Roper
description: WILLIAMSBURG, Va., July 11Mrs. Mary Grattan Roper, widow of Robert P. Roper, former executive vice president of Philip Morris, Inc., was married here this morning to Dr. Jess Harrison Davis, president of the Stevens Institute of Tech nology in Hoboken, N.J.

title: BENISCH SCORES IN RESOLUTE SAIL
description: PORT WASHINGTON, L. I., July 11  Charles Benisch's Vixen made off with Resolute Class honors today as 60 boats sailed with the Port Washington Yacht Club in the Cow Bay area competition, Yacht Racing As sociation of Lone Island Sound.

title: Tennis Panchos Draw Young Garden Partners
description: At Madison Square Garden Thursday night, the two Panchos of tennisGonzales and Segurawill each have as a doubles partner a 15 yearold player.

title: Hi Yo Honda, Away, or Hand Me My Bullhorn, Kemo Sabe
description: THE people who make our television shows for us are breaking their backs these days to give us pro grams dealing with contemporary issues. We didn't realize how fanatical some of them had become until a pro ducer friend of ours invited us to a se cret screening of the pilot for a new series.

title: Samuel Hofstadter Dead at 75; Served on State Supreme Court
description: Samuel H. Hofstadter, whose opinions and polemics set judi cial milestones at frequent in tervals during his 37 years as a justice of the State Supreme Court, died of an apparent heart attack in his sleep on Friday ati his apartment at 12 East 86th Street. He was 75 years old.

title: ANTIDRUG PROJECT MAY BE DISSOLVED
description: Fourteenyearold Michael D'Orleans attends school in an area below 59th Street and west of Fifth Avenue that the State Narcotic Addiction Con trol Commission has cited as one of the worst drug addiction areas in the city.

title: Plan for the Environment
description: President Nixon's proposed reorganization of envi ronmental agencies is a statesmanlike move which could prove to be almost as historic in its own way as the great alphabetical upheavals of the early Roose velt Administration.

title: Indians Top Red Sox, 31
description: CLEVELAND, July I I (UPI) Buddy Bradford's homer with two on base and another clout by Graig Nettles helped Sam McDowell to his 13th victory of the season today as the Cleveland Indians defeated the Boston Red Sox. 31.

title: RICHMOND PICKS  SLADE, COLT BACK
description: The Richmond (Va.) Saints picked a quarterback, Gordon Slade of Davidson, as their firstround draft choice yester day as the Atlantic Coast Foot ball League held its first player draft of personnel likely to he available from the National Football League.

title: Hawkeye Posts Upset
description: LOUISVILLE, Ky., July 11 (AP)Hawkeye, owned by Wil liam Hawkins of Evansville, Ind., was the upset winner to day in the $15,000 Junior Derby at Miles Park.

title: Shame Is Still The Harvest
description: THESE are difficult times for news men. Journalism, especially tele vision journalism, is under attack for presenting a onesided view of the news. But, as I found during sixweek visit to central Florida for the filming of MigrantAn NBC White Pa per, a show investigating the living conditions of migrant workers, some of television's severest critics are the very people who make it difficult for journal ists to present a balanced story.

title: RISCH'S 293 WINS U.S. GOLF HONORS
description: LEMONT, Ill., July 11 (AP) Bob Risch of Gardena, Calif., withstood a closing charge by Mike Zimmerman of Kettering, Ohio, today to win the national public links championship by three strokes. Risch shot a 76 for a 5overpar 293.

title: Irish Reel Takes Sprint At Lincoln and Pays $5.20
description: LINCOLN, R. I.. July 11 (AP) Circle X Stable's Irish Reel opened up a long lead and held on for a threequarier length victory over fastdosing Tiger Boy tinkly in the $4.000 Connect icut Purse at Lincoln Downs.

title: Minor Leagues
description: INTERNATIONAL LEAGUE

title: Culture Is Our Business
description: In this his latest book Marshall McLuhan returns to his first love, ad vertising, and continues that guided tour so brilliantly begun in his Me chanical Bride 20 years ago. I say book, but with its selection of re cent ads on the righthand pages and a mindblowing aphoristic com mentary on the left, it is really more like a slide show.

title: Phyllis Ruggeri Becomes Bride
description: GREENFIELD. Mass., July 11Miss Phyllis Ann Rug geri and Richard Austin Whit ing 3d, son of Mr. and Mrs. Whiting Jr. of Bedford Vil lage. N. Y., were married here this morning. The bride's par ents are Mr. and Mrs. Sebas tian J. Ruggeri of Greenfield.

title: Bostwicks Advance To Golf Semifinals
description: MAMARONECK, N. Y., July 11The versatile Bostwick brothers, Pete and Jim, who excel at golf, court tennis, rac quets and ice hockey, scored again at golf today by gaining the semifinals of the John G. Anderson Memorial tourna ment.

title: Karen Moe Betters World 200 Record In Butterfly Swin
description: SANTA CLARA, Calif., July 11 (UPI)Karen Moe, a rela tive unknown from Orinda, Calif., pulled the surprise of the Santa Clara Invitational swim meet today by bettering a world record in the women's 2011meter butterfly.

title: Susan Secor Wed to John Humes Jr.
description: WESTBURY, L.I., July 11 Miss Susan Secor, daugh ter of Mrs. Thomas LeBoutil lier of Old Westbury, and the late Jay K. Secor of Perrysburg, Ohio, was mar ried here this afternoon to John Portner Humes Jr., son of Mr. Humes, Ambassador to Austria, and Mrs. Humes of Vienna and Locust Val ley.

title: Did you know that bees like blue?
description: At a time when it often looks as though all changes in man's relationship to nature had been for the worse, it is comforting to remember that only since the 19th century have we come to regard wilder ness as valuable and beautiful in itself, not to be exploited but preserved. In this past year we have been given a number of distinguished books that ex plore a small wild area in depth, suggesting clues and pathways toward the future.

title: Truman Library Popular
description: INDEPENDENCE, Mo. July 11 (AP)The Truman Library's two millionth visitor viewed exhibits and Presidential mem orabilia this week. The visitor was Jacob Dykwell of Grand Rapids, Mich. He was present ed an autographed picture of former President Harry S. Tru man, taken on a special tour of the library and greeted in the lobby by the assistant director of the library, Dr B. K. Lobrist. The Library was opened in Sep tember of 1957.

title: Saigon Repatriates 86 Prisoners
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, July 11 (AP)South Vietnamese au thorities sent 62 war prisoners and 24 fishermen back to North Vietnam today. The 86 men were taken in a South Vietnamese Navy vessel to a point six miles off North Viet nam and delivered to two mo torized junks.

title: COBLE REVAMPS MORGAN'S YACHT
description: NEWPORT, R.I., July 11 Three waterfront happenings this week reflected the status of the America's Cup defense trials as much as what hap pened at sea.

title: Nixon Flies to Camp David
description: THURMONT, Md., July 11 (AP)  President Nixon, accom panied by Mrs. Nixon and their Irish setter, King Timahoe, flew today to the Presidential moun tain retreat, Camp David, for an overnight stay.

title: Letters:
description: TO THE FINANCIAL EDITOR: I quote from the most capable pen of Thomas E. Mullaney in The Times of June 28th: Quite propheti cally, about a year ago the official spokesman for the Federal Reserve Bank of New York warned that losses in the financial markets would not deter the central bank in its drive to control inflation. At that time, Thomas C. Waage, a vice president of the bank, said that those who doubted the Federal Re serve's resolve would be in for a particularly painful experience, and added: al ready, some participants in the financial market are bleeding, and there will be more.

title: Can You Answer These?
description: The following are examples of questions on science posed to young adults in a survey of Americans' educational achievement. The first results of the federally supported study were released last week. Answers to the questions are given below, with the percentage of persons answer ing correctly shown in parentheses.

title: Movie Mailbag
description: Oops, Sorry

title: Jackson Heights Tract Cleared By Volunteers for a Play Area
description: Fifty young children, teen agers, adults, politicians and students from the Lexington School for the Deaf yesterday started clearing a threeblock, ratinfested tract in the Jack son Heights section of Queens.

title: Susan Reynolds Williams Bride Of William E. Hart in Rochester
description: ROCHESTER. July 11  Miss Susan Reynolds Wil liams, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. George Rafter Williams of Buffalo, was married here this afternoon to William Earl Hart, son of Mr. and Mrs. Harry J. Hart of Pitts ford. The Rev. William P. Jenkins performed the cere mony in the First Unitarian Church.

title: Merchant Marine Academy New Montclair Soccer Foe
description: Montclair State College's soccer team, champion of the Metropolitan Intercollegiate and New Jersey College Confer ences, will face only one new opponent during the coming season: the United States Mer chant Marine Academy, which moved into Division I of the Metropolitan Conference. The Mariners will meet the Indians Oct. 24.

title: Leading Motorboat Drivers to Race
description: The Hennessy Grand Prix will be held Wednesday, but if anyone tells you that this world championship ocean race was once the Around Long Is land Marathon, don't laugh. It's true.

title: FLINTSTONE WINS HORSE SHOW TITLE
description: LAKEVILLE, Conn., July 11 Nancy Baroody thought she was finished with small ponies when she sold Midget to Sindy Paul six months ago. The 14 yearold Miss Baroody had rid den the talented gray mare tc the national highpoint cham pionship four years in a row.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: TO THE EDITOR:

title: On Wall Street: A New Breed of Managers
description: Out of the chaos of deep financial distress and the worst bear market since the Depression, a new generation of managers is taking charge on Wall Street. Their emergence is vitally im portant to all investors, for the future of the securities industry will be in their hands.

title: Susan Thayer Is Bride Of Roy B. Remmert Jr.
description: RYE, N.Y., July 11Christ's Episcopal Church was the set ting here this afternoon for the marriage of Miss Susan Perry Thayer to Roy Bertram Remmert Jr., who expects to receive a master's degree in finance next month from the University of Oklahoma. The ceremony, performed by the Rev. Dr. Wendell Phillips, was followed by a reception at the home of Mr. and Mrs. Walter N. Thayer, parents of the bride.

title: Blacks in South Africa Developing a New Awareness
description: JOHANNESBURG, South Africa, July 7The policy of racial separation, designed to preserve white privileges, is stirring among blacks a new consciousness of their identity that represents a challenge to the Nationalist Government's plan for separate but harmoni ous racial development.

title: Staten Island Wins Cricket
description: The Staten Island cricket Club defeated the Hartford West Indians yesterday at Walker Park, Staten Island scoring 145 runs for sever wickets to the West Indians 144 for six declared.

title: Major League Baseball
description: Sunday, July 12, 1970

title: Reactions to Experiment Are Mixed on 5th Avenue
description: Come along dear. a pedes trian said to his wife on Fifth Avenue yesterday. We're sup posed to walk in the street not on the sidewalkin the street. He tugged her arm. What good is it if they keep out cars and you won't walk in the streets?

title: Dead Duck Gets a New Lease on Life
description: POINT REYES, Calif.Practically dead duck. That was the diagnosis, offered just a year ago by a Marin County official, of plans to develop Point Reyes National Seashore. But to day, the 53.000acre northern California peninsula appears to have a healthy fu ture. After a period of wild land spec ulation, during which private interests threatened to cut up the area, President Nixon has finally signed a bill authoriz ing the expenditure of $38million over the next three years to complete acqui sition of the park.

title: Intellectuals As an Ethnic Group
description: AMERICA'S intellectual elite, nor mally secure from criticism, has been taking some lumps latelyand not just from Spiro Agnew. Writing in The Nation, John McDermott has accused lowerlevel members of the elite of thinking of themselves as missionaries bringing culture to the heathens, and Michael Lerner, in The American Scholar, anticipated Agnew with the sugges tion that the intellectual leaders may be snobs. Culture is indeed mission aried at some of the workingclass institutions (state colleges are what I have in mind) at which exiled members of this elite are forced to teach to earn their daily bread, and snobbery is as present among this elite as among other groups of human beings.

title: Dumping Curb Proposed
description: WASHINGTON, July 11 (AP) House hearings have been scheduled for July 27 and 28 on a bill to create marine wild life sanctuaries by restricting the dumping of wastes. The bill's sponsor, Representative M. Murphy, Democrat of Staten Island, drafted it after a Gov ernment laboratory published a study that said the dumping of sludge was making New York's Lower Bay a vast Dead Sea where nothing lived.

title: French Minister Warns Britain On Wide Currency Fluctuation
description: PARIS, July 11  Foreign Minister Maurice Schumann of France has warned Britain that her Common Market candida ture would be quashed again if she permitted her currency to fluctuate more widely as part of a world monetary reform.

title: Susan Townley Is Wed in Alaska
description: CHUGIAK, Alaska, July 11 Miss Susan Townley of Girdwood, Alaska, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Philip Beards ley Townley of Llewellyn Park, West Orange, N.J., was married here this afternoon to George Charles Keppel, Jr. of Anchorage. He is the son of Mr. Keppel of Keokuk, Iowa, and the late Mrs. Kop pel.

title: Economy: Bond Market May Herald Good News
description: WASHINGTONIn a nation starved for good news, a heart ening development has been tak ing place in the last three weeks: The bond market has gone up.

title: RUMANIANS PRESS FLOOD RECOVERY
description: CLUJ, Rumania, July 5  Heavy summer rainstorms, which added inches of water to lowlying areas and muddy streams in this already soggy corner of Rumania, have failed to dampen a remarkable na tional effort to recoup the vast losses suffered during a month of repeated flooding from mid May to midJune.

title: CHARLES H. DUELL, PUBLISHER, IS DEAD
description: SHERMAN, Conn., July 11 Charles Halliwell Duell, found er and former president of the New York book publishing firm of Duell, Sloan & Pearce, died after a heart attack here last night while attending a meeting of the Nairomi Land Trust, a conservation organization. He was 64 years old and lived on Cozier Hill Road here.

title: Carol Craft Is Bride of C. B. Schaefer
description: SCARSDALE, N.Y., July 11 Miss Carol Ann Craft and C. Barry Schaefer were married here this afternoon in the Roman Catholic Church of the Immaculate Heart of Mary by the Right Rev. Msgr. John J. Caldwell, assisted by the Rev. Kenneth Walter of the Linden Presbyterian Church. A reception was given at the Shenorock Shore Club in Rye.

title: IBROCIA'S Y ACHT WINS PREDICTEDLOG TEST
description: BLOCK ISLAND, R.I., July 11 The 57th annual Block Island predictedlog contest was won today by Joseph Brocia Jr., former commodore of the East ern Cruiser Association, in the yacht, Vixen II. His percentage error was 1.62 over a course of 103.1 nautical miles.

title: Jets, Giants Report This Week If Labor Accord Is Reached
description: The pro football training season is scheduled to open on Tuesday, provided an agreement is reached be tween the player's associa tion and an owners' commit tee.

title: Oregon Licenses a Dump for Radioactive Waste Over Protests of Ranchers
description: ARLINGTON, Ore., July 11  The State Board of Health has finally signed a license for stor age of radioactive waste on a desolate mesa near Arlington.

title: CONCORDE TO GET ITS CRUCIAL TESTS
description: LONDON, July 11The su personic airliner Concorde be gins a fight for survival next week as crucial tests get under way.

title: Queen Hears Indian Chief Assail Ottawa
description: THE PAS, Manitoba, July 11 (UPI)A Canadian Indian chief told Queen Elizabeth H today that the Canadian Government had failed to live up to its promises to the Indians of so cial advancement and equality of opportunity.

title: Abernathy in Plea to Nixon
description: WASHINGTON, July 11 (AP) The Rev. Ralph David Aber nathy said this week that he had asked President Nixon to appoint a Negro to one of the four newly created Federal district judgeships in Georgia.

title: Wood, Field and Stream
description: MANCHESTER, Vt., July 11  Imagine a classroom pitched alongside a rippling stream that gurgles sooth ingly. Overhead spread oaks and maples providing dap pled shade. And all around robins, thrush and red winged blackbirds seem to be chirping Come and get it.

title: Princeton Is Planning a Course On Role of Engineer in Society
description: PRINCETON, N.J., July 11 Princeton University students, in a course to be offered next fall by the department of Aero space and mechanical sciences, will be investigating Govern ment projects dealing with technology, including weapons systems.

title: Judge, Citing Disruption, Bars Student's Sitting During Pledge
description: A Federal judge in Brooklyn has ruled that a Hicksville, L.I., youth cannot remain seated as a protest while his classmates rise to recite the Pledge of Allegiance because the youth's action has disrupted the class room.

title: New Outboard Motor Is on Its Way
description: The development of a new 50horsepower outboard mo tor based on a twocylinder loopcharged design has been announced by Johnson Mo tors. It is expected to be available later this summer.

title: Paxton's Universality
description: TOM PAXTON 6: Torn Paxton (Elektra EKS 74066). Tom Paxton. folk singer, poet and vetnan of the McDougal Street music wars of the early sixties, has hung in there, content to stick with the bare tones of his talent, unseduced by the rich fleshi ness of electronic gimmickry. It has been a wise decision. Paxton makes the kind of music that is deceptively un prepossessing, based on sim ple melodies, rudimentary rhyming and the description of familiar, everyday events. One step removed from mu sical soap opera, you say? Perhaps, in the sense that Saturday night at the local tavern (Saturday Night), and the stories of wounded war veterans (Jimmy New man) and unhappy relation ships (Annie's Going To Sing Her Song) are familiar not just to the urban liberals who make up the majority of the folk music audience, but to the vast millions of Middle America as well. But maybe universality is a better de scription than musical soap opera for Paxton's music. It has been a wise decision. Paxton makes the kind of music that is deceptively un prepossessing, based on sim ple melodies, rudimentary rhyming and the description of familiar, everyday events. One step removed from mu sical soap opera, you say? Perhaps, in the sense that Saturday night at the local tavern (Saturday Night), and the stories of wounded war veterans (Jimmy New man) and unhappy relation ships (Annie's Going To Sing Her Song) are familiar not just to the urban liberals who make up the majority of the folk music audience, but to the vast millions of Middle America as well. But maybe universality is a better de scription than musical soap opera for Paxton's music.

title: Architecture
description: WHAT happens when architects build for themselves? All hell breaks loose for eight years. From 1962 to 1970, the American Institute of Archi tects has been trying to build a new headquarters in Wash ington, and its role has been a paradigmatic example of the client nightmare. The process offers some shaky illumina tion of institutions and es thetics.

title: Policy Rates Rising for Malpractice
description: The rates that physicians pay for malpractice insurance are rising sharply around the coun try, sometimes doubling in cost. A 65 per cent increase will go into effect for doctors practic ing in New York on Sept. 1.

title: A Step To Curb The Huge Farm Subsidies
description: WASHINGTON  Senator James O. Eastland has been braced for some time for bad news from the House of Repre sentatives. Legislation that would reduce the subsidies paid to farmers by the Federal Gov ernment has been under study by the House Agriculture Com mittee, and the Senator would stand to lose much of the $146, 000 in subsidies he receives for his Mississippi cotton plantation.

title: AMERICAN TRIMARAN 4TH IN BRITISH SAIL
description: PLYMOUTH, England, July 11 (AP) The frontrunning trimaran Trumpeter, the only American entry in the round Britain yacht race, fell intc fourth place today after the 550mile second stage from Crosshaven, the Irish Republic to Castlebay in the outer Hebrides.

title: CROWDS STROLL IN FIFTH AVENUE
description: The pedestrian was king along midtown Fifth Avenue yesterday, but some merchant princes were not so sure this was good for business.

title: BOY, 2
description: A 2 boy was ad mitted to BronxLebanon Hos pital in critical condition yes terday morning after his mother told authorities that he had swallowed an LSD tablet. The mother was arrested on a charge of endangering the child's life.

title: Business Index Rises for Week
description: The New York Times Weekly Index of Business Ac tivity rose to 388.2 from 358.8 a week earlier. A year ago it was 368.9.

title: U.S. War Prisoners Died at Hiroshima, A Japanese Asserts
description: TOYKO July 11 (UPI)A Japanese man who said he had guarded United States prisoners at Hiroshima during World War II asserted today that 23 Amer ican prisoners of war had been killed or fatally injured in the atomicbomb blast that ravaged the city nine days before the war anded.

title: Jud gable, $80.60, Takes Dwyer By Length and Half at Aqueduct
description: Judgable, the next to the out sider in the betting in the $84, 450 Dwyer Handicap at Aque duct yesterday, raced in front all the way to capture the mile andaquarter event.

title: Jane Bastanchury to Meet Elizabeth Shea in Golf Final
description: COLORADO SPRINGS, July 11 (AP)Jane Bastanchurv, the 1969 winner, and Mary Eliza beth Shea shot sparkling goll today and gained the final of the Broad moor women's in vitation eolf tournament.

title: Tracking Down A New Menace: Mercury
description: Last December in Alama gordo, N. M., three children in a family of 10an 8year old girl, 13yearold boy and their 20yearold sisterfell seriously ill and were rushed to the hospital. Although the older girl improved slowly, the two younger children lapsed into a coma from which they have yet to emerge.

title: 6c U.N. Peace and Progress Sold Out
description: THE 2,400,000 Peace and Progress 6c stamp re leased by the United Nations on June 26 as part of a threestamp and sou venir sheet commemoration of the 25th anniversary of the world organization, was sold out on the first day of sale here at U.N. Headquarters, and at a special firstday ceremony in San Francisco. Sellouts were also indicated at more than 70 United Na tions facilities which sell U.N. stamps overseas. The stamp will not be reprinted.

title: Medicine
description: Group medical practice on a prepayment basis geared to preventive medicine would be emphasized and encour aged. Hospitals and other fa cilities would be paid not on a costplus basis, but on a level worked out in advance. The intention would be to reward economy and effi ciency and to penalize waste.

title: Agnew Affirms Partisan Role But Bars Presidential Ambition
description: Vice President Agnew has acknowledged that his political role in the Administration some times forces him into a hard line stance, but he has dis avowed Presidential ambitions for himself.

title: John Norwood Weds Mrs. Ruth Havemeyer in Southampton
description: SOUTHAMPTON, L.I., July 11 Mrs. Ruth Hill Have meyer, daughter of Mrs. Frederick C. Havemeyer of New York and Southampton and the late Mr. Havemeyer of Tuxedo Park, N.Y., was married here this afternoon to John Norwood, vice presi dent of Sport Magazine and a former amateur sports car driver.

title: EXPERTS ASSESS PEKING'S MOTIVE
description: HONG KONG, July 11Spe cialists in Chinese affairs here were reluctant today to at tribute political significance to Communist China's release of the Most Rev. James Edward Walsh, a 79yearold Roman Catholic bishop.

title: A league with two strikes on it
description: Who here has heard of the New Orleans Crescent Stars, the Baltimore Black Sox, the Pennsylvania Red Caps of New York, the Detroit Wolves? Not many, probably. But they were among the dozens of Negro baseball clubs that barnstormed across America in the first half of this century, fielding some of America's greatest ballplay ers. A few of the betterknown Negroleague teamsthe Kan sas City Monarchs, the Newark Eagles, the Homestead Grays were as good (and proved it) as any team in the white ma jor leagues; still their stars were unable to penetrate or ganized white baseball. In his thorough, welldocumented book, Only the Ball Was White, Robert Peterson covers the erratic history of Negro baseball from the 1880's to the 1960'sperhaps the most mel ancholy chapter in all of Amer ican sport.

title: Chess
Enrollment at Colleges Leveling Off in Summer
description: For the first time since the Korean War, enrollment at col lege and university summer ses sions around the country has apparently failed to grow this year. In some cases, it has dropped sharply.

title: OFFICERS DOUBT A SPEEDY PULLOUT
description: WASHINGTON, July 11  Knowledgable military sources here believe that the Nixon Administration's Vietnam strat egy may require it to keep a large American military con tingent in South Vietnam. roughly 150,000 to 200,000 men, as late as 1972.

title: That rare and marvelous figurean original
description: On the map of American literature Nathanael West left a small scar. He composed a modest quantity of fiction, four slim volumes of Which two are amusing but inconsequential and one, Miss Lonelyhearts, is an unqualified success. He died in a ghastly car accident at the age of 37, as if to reinforce that vision of gratuitous cruelty which he saw as the secret of things. Little known or read during his lifetimeonly a few of his contemporaries, like Edmund Wilson and James T. Farrell, recog nized his giftsWest became the object of a cult after his death. The black humorists of recent years have often acknowledged themselves disciples, though at least to one reader the relation of their work to his seems like that of slack nihilism to brilliant ferocity.

title: JAMES H. WEAVER, SPORTS OFFICIAL, 67
description: COLORADO SPRINGS, July 11 (AP)James H. Weaver, commissioner of the Atlantic Coast Conference, a collegiate sports organization, died here today of a heart attack. He was 67 years old and lived in Greensboro. N.C

title: Miracles, Information, Recommended Reading
description: THE other day I went over to the Museum of Modern Art for the press preview of the new Infor mation show. As it happened, the show was not yet fully installed. Much of the machinery wasn't working. Some of the  what shall we call it ? visual data was not yet in place. There were few wall labels indentifying the  what shall we call them?contributors to the exhibition. None of this was unusual. Museum staffs work on very tight sched ules. Even the most conventional exhi bitions involve headcracking logistical problems, and Information is no con ventional exhibition. In any case, the ab solute deadline for getting everything into place is not the press preview, which takes place during the day, but the poshier preview, complete with free drinks and beautiful people, which takes place in the early evening.Museum staffs work on very tight sched ules. Even the most conventional exhi bitions involve headcracking logistical problems, and Information is no con ventional exhibition. In any case, the ab solute deadline for getting everything into place is not the press preview, which takes place during the day, but the poshier preview, complete with free drinks and beautiful people, which takes place in the early evening.

title: The Ticking of the Atomic Clock
description: LONDONScientific admin istrators are not immune from the hucksterism that seems to afflict so many bureaucrats the urge to promote their specialty. Just as airport au thorities think more and bigger airports are man's most urgent need, and the road people con sider highways more satisfying than cities, so those who ad minister atomicenergy pro grams have been powerful ad vocates for the wider use of atomic energy in society.

title: Letters: A Mysterious Case For the Skyjack Guards
description: TO THE EDITOR:

title: Where Are the Savios Of Yesteryear?
description: THE Free Speech Movement. In these times when teargas can isters arch over the green swards and blood runs from bullet wounds onto campus paths, there is a distant, almost quaint ring to the name, like the National Association for the Advancement of Colored Peo ple or the Society for a Sane Nuclear Policy. Yet five academic years ago the movement exploded into the na tional consciousness as an impolite and insistently unfamiliar challenge to the authority of university admin istratorsin some eyes, to authority in general. The immediate focus of the movementUniversity of Cali fornia students' demands that they be allowed to solicit on the Berkeley campus for noncampus causes  was considerably more civil libertarian than radical. And the movement failed in the end to resolve much or any thing.

title: Coast Judge Bids Prisons Provide Clergy to Muslims
description: SAN FRANCISCO, July 11 (AP)A Federal judge has or dered officials at 13 state pris ons to provide paid clergy and religious literature to Black Muslim inmates. Muslim inmates.

title: Teach Us to Be Detached Voyeurs
description: DWIGHT MACDONALD is not a tough critic only a confused one. There are other more demanding and uncompro mising critics who will in stantly reject a fraud. These critics are the new generation of moviegoers who have taken film as their own medium, as their personal art form and instrument of com munication. It is they who are lined up every night in record numbers to see Get ting Straight. Strange that the movie does not offend them it Macdonald.

title: Minsky, a Full Brother To Nijinskv. 2d in Bow
description: DUBLIN, July 11 (Reuters)  Minsky, a 2yearold full brother to Charles W. Engel hard's Nijinsky, was beaten in his debut today by Loch Lomond at the Curragh Race course.

title: To Be Modern, You Must Look Back
description: WELL, it's true  his name is not on everyone's lips not yet, anyway. And there's absolutely noth ing exotic about him. But Richard Dufallo (the name doesn't rhyme with buffalo put the accent on the a) doesn't care. Oh, he'll tell you that sometimes he's sorry he's not Indian, like Zubin Mehta, or Japanese, like Sei ji Ozawa, or black, like Hen ry Lewis. I'm not even Jewish! he adds with a laugh. It is also true that he's not a 25yearold boy genius of the baton, nor has he recently been called in to replace a suddenly indisposed towering maestro, only to be hailed one himself. ji Ozawa, or black, like Hen ry Lewis. I'm not even Jewish! he adds with a laugh. It is also true that he's not a 25yearold boy genius of the baton, nor has he recently been called in to replace a suddenly indisposed towering maestro, only to be hailed one himself.

title: GOLDBERG'S VICTORY WAS BY 41,592 VOTES
description: ALBANY, July 11Arthur J. Goldberg defeated Howard J. Samuels, his opponent in the Democratic gubernatorial pri mary, by 41,592 votes.

title: The Battle of Murray Hill
description: Can a large investing real estate company and a local community find happiness together? Yes, but it takes 14 months of mutual negotiation, the exercise of rational expertise on the part of the community and enlight ened selfinterest from the developer. Can it happen in New York? It has, with the Murray Hill Association and Planning Board No. 6 and Laird Prop erties, Inc.

title: Crowley, Rookie, Connect; With One on in Eighth Detroit Rally Checked
description: DETROIT, July 11A rookie Terry Crowley, belted a two run homer in the eight inning that sent the Baltimore Orioles to a 65 victory over the Detroit Tigers today.

title: Short Circuit Hinted in Fire That Killed Iceland Premier
description: REYKJAVIK, Iceland, July 11 (UPI)An electrical short cir cuit may have touched off the fire that killed Premier Bjarni Bencdiktsson of Iceland, his wife and a grandson, the police said today.

title: NOCCALULA IS 2D IN 1 MILE RACE
description: WESTBURY, L. I., July 11 Dayan, who broke three times in his last outing, moved truly in tonight's $50,000 American Trotting Championship, cap tured the 1mile classic and moved into a spot in next week's $125,000 International here at Roosevelt Raceway.

title: There Were Sightseers Before There Were Roads
description: SALT RIVER CANYON, Ariz.If our guess is correct, the breathtaking views of Arizona's Salt River Canyon on transcon tinental U.S. 60 attracted sightseers cen turies before any roads existed here.

title: Memorial Services
description: BURTONLaurence Vreeland, PhD., of Scars dale, N.Y. Memorial service will be held In the Chapel of St. James The Less Church, Scarsdale, N Y. on July 14, at 11o'clock.

title: Anthony Donargo, 70. Dies; ExChief Borough Engineer
description: Anthony J. Donargo, a former chief engineer for Manhattan, died here Friday. He was 70 years old and lived at 430 East 20th Street.

title: Tapes of Playoff on TV
description: Taped highlights of the play off between Jack Nicklaus and Doug Sanders for the British Open golf championship today will be televised via satellite by the American Broadcasting Company (Channel 7). The cov erage will begin at 4:30 P.M.

title: Germans and Jews
description: Five years ago, the liveliest topic in German history was, rather sur prisingly, the question of German responsibility for the coming of World War I, and the controversy that started with the publication of Fritz Fischer's massive book on the subject aroused wide interest in America, in the general reading pub lic as well as in scholarly circles. That is all pass now, and the latest fashion is Weimar intellectuals. In Germany, the memoirs of Kurt Hiller, the father of Ahtivismus, are far out selling Fischer's second volume, while in this country the last two years have seen the publication of Peter Gay's book on Weimar culture, Istvan Deak's account of the Weltbiihne circle, and Harold L. Poor's study of Kurt Tucholsky, to mention only the best of a large and growing crop.

title: ST. LOUIS BEATEN 6TH GAME IN ROW
description: ST. LOUIS, July 11 (UPI) Matty Alou tripled home the tying run and scored the win ning run on a fielder's choice in the ninth inning tonight as the Pittsburgh Pirates scored an 87 victory over the Cardi a n 87 victory over the Cardinals.

title: Headliners
description: Back in May Secretary of the Interior Walter J. nickel caused a flurry when he wrote a letter to President Nixon complaining about the Administration's policies toward youth and criticizing Vice Presi dent Agnew's tough speeches. One result was nationwide publicity for Mr. Hickel, who until then had been working in the shadows other Cabinet officers. But apparently he didn't make much of an im pression on the Vice President. Last week Mr. Agnew was giving Washington reporters the names of those who participated in a meet ing between President Nixon and a group of American Indians whose affairs fall under the Interior Department. The Vice President paused and asked, Who was the other Cabinet officer who was present? Someone responded, Secretary Hickel. Secretary Hickel, Mr. Agnew nodded, I should remember him.

title: Mary C. Wellington Married in Ithaca
description: ITHACA, N.Y., July 11 Miss Mary Christine Welling ton, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. George H. Wellington, was married here this afternoon to Richard David Daly, son of Mr. and Mrs. Ira D. Daly of Ridgewood. N. J.

title: Cleanup Planned for Houston Channel
description: HOUSTON, July 11An am bitious effort to reduce pollu tion and the potential for fires and explosions in the Houston ship channel has been under taken by the relatively new Gulf Coast Waste Disposal Authority.

title: Miss Cynthia Alley, Teacher, Wed
description: MILLBROOK, N. Y., July 11Miss Cynthia Alley and Wodbury H. Andrews were married here this afternoon. The Rev. John G. Beaven performed the ceremony in Grace Episcopal Church.

title: Indian Police Report Killing Leader of Maoist Movement
description: HYDERABAD, India, July 11 (Reuters)  The police have killed the founder of the Maoist Naxalite movement in Andhra State in southern India and one of his top aides, it was an nounced today.

title: MARSHALL GANS
description: NORWALK, Conn., July 11 Marshall Gans, president of the Harris and Gans Fuel Company and a civic leader, died today at Norwalk Hospital after long illness. He was 65 years old and lived at 3 Bayne Street.

title: CATHOLIC DISTRICT OF BELFAST SEALED
description: BELFAST, Northern Ireland. Sunday, July 12 (Reuters) British troops tonight sealed off roads leading to Roman Cath olic areas of Belfast following an explosion in a Protestant district.

title: Coins
description: MISS EVA B. ADAMS, former Director of the Mint, has been elected to the board of directors of the Medallic Art Company of this city, it was announced by William T. Loath, president.

title: CHEHAB IS FAVORED TO HEAD LEBANESE
description: BEIRUT., Lebanon, July 11 With Parliament expected to elect a new president for Leb anon by the end of July, Maj. Gen. Fuad Chehab, who served in the office from 1958 to 1964, appears to be the strong est candidate. But the Soviet Ambassador has become a star of the election campaign.

title: Complaints About Cars Lead Consumers' List
description: WASHINGTON, July 11 (AP)More Americans com plain about their automobiles than any other consume item.

title: Ivor C. Armistead 3d Marries Miss Melinda Susan Daggett
description: HOHOKUS, N. J., July 11 Miss Melinda Susan Daggett and Ivor Cary Armistead 3d, son of Mr. and Mrs. Armi stead Jr. of Ridgewood, were married here this afternoon in St. Bartholomew's Epis copal Church. The ceremony was performed by the Rev. Haywood Levy.

title: Gen. Munoz Grandes, 70, Dies; Spain's Former Vice President
description: MADRID, July 11 (Reuters) Capt. Gen. Augustin Munoz Grandes, chief of staff of the Spanish armed forces and for mer Vice President of Spain, died here tonight. He was 74 years old.

title: Wendy Gailmor Shuns Frills In Marriage to David Newton
description: WESTPORT, Conn., July 11 Miss Wendy Gailmor and David Newton were married here today in the woods out side the rough sawn cedar house the bridegroom de signed and built and in which they will live.

title: Democrats Zero in On Their Target: Nixon
description: WASHINGTON  As the un seen voter shakes money out of his cookie jar and stuffs it into an envelope to send to the Democratic party in Washing ton, a voice observes: You don't have to wait until 1972 to vote against Richard Nixon.

title: U.S.Shows Impatience At Pennsy
description: Jonathan O'Herron had the oppor tunity two weeks ago to speak up for the nation's railroads in one way that would be sure to get him a hearing to rub Washington's nose in the fact that the railroads are the targets of repressive regulation not applied to most other industries.

title: STUDENTS ACTIVE ON FALL POLITICS
description: PRINCETON, N. J., July 11 While many of their fellows are soaking up the summer sun, students at dozens of colleges across the country are already hard at work preparing for po litical campaigns next fall.

title: Soggy Day in Venice Town
description: VENICE. THE 35th Venice Bien nale opened with the gusto of a soggy Opera Buffa. On preview day, in the lovely garden area which houses the Biennale, critics in search of art works made their way among wheel barrows, masons mixing plas ter, and carpenters pounding boards.

title: Okada Wins by Knockout
description: OYAMA, Japan, July 11 (AP) Japan's junior featherweight boxing champion, Coichi Okada, knocked out the No. 2 con tender of South Korea, GuTek Kim, in the ninth round of a scheduled 10round nontitie bout today.

title: OHIO FUNDS SOUGHT IN KENT STATE STUDY
description: RAVENNA, Ohio, July 11 The Portage County prosecut ing attorney, Ronald J. Kane is seeking state funds for a grand jury investigation into the Kent State University dis turbances in May that resulted in the fatal shootings of four students by Ohio National Guardsmen.

title: How It Was Done
description: He is extremely intelligent, re sponsible and really a professional. His writing is well structured and has a great deal of style. He's been very cooperative as far as promoting the book, and it really was a pleasure working with him.

title: FISHMAN IS VICTOR IN MARINER SAILING
description: AMITYVILLE L. I., July 11 Manuel Fishman registered a three  second triumph over George Wrage for Mariner Class honors today as the Unqua Corinthian Yacht Club's weekend invitation regatta got under way.

title: Criminals At Large
description: For over 20 years the pulps poured upon an avid public a vast flow of short detective fic tions. Some of it was, to be sure, quite bad, but some was also alive with the vigor of the hardboiled tale, and nearly allaside from a few antholo gies and the works of a handful of honored writersis unavail able, except in the original form to the most assiduous of searchers. In England, too, prior to the deluge in the Unit ed States, The Strand and Cassell's Magazine were the homes of some of the finest mystery fiction.

title: Coney Island Hospital Post
description: Frank Hays, a former assist ant director at Mount Sinai Hospital, has been appointed administrator of Coney Island Hospital, it was announced yesterday by the city Health and Hospital Corporation. Mr. Hays was chosen by a repre sentative or minunity board, the announcenlent said. Most re cently, he has been director of a task forte in charge of de veloping a purchasing, supply and logistic control system for he new corporation.

title: Curbing Farm Subsidies
description: The Senate has voted to set a $20,000 limit on the subsidy payments that the Federal Government can make next year to an individual farmer or farmoper ating corporation. While that limit is still too high and may be circumvented by farm splittingthe Sen ate's move is important in demonstrating that the influence of wealthy farm proprietors in Congress may be running out.

title: Civil Liberties Aide Named
description: MANCHESTER, N. H., July 11 (AP)The New Hampshire Civ il Liberties Union announced Wednesday that it had named David Hamlin, 25 years old, recent head of the news bureau at Nasson College in Spring vale, Maine, as executive direc tor.

title: At the United Nations: A New Look for Tourism
description: AFTER THREE years of intensive work all around the world supporting the de velopment of tourism as a key industry and economic hope for developing na tions, the United Nations InterRegional Adviser on Tourism went out of busi ness on July 1 in anticipation of a major change, probably by midautumn, in the U.N.'s handling of tourism projects.

title: The Hot Summer Comes to Asbury Park
description: ASBURY PARK, N. J. The sign on the door of the Monmouth Community Ac tion Program here says No jobs available. For 40 places in the program's neighbor hood center, there were 700 applicants. There are 246 jobs in the Neighborhood Youth Corps, compared with twice that number last year.

title: MINE POST NOMINEE ASKS TO WITHDRAW
description: WASHINGTON, July 11(UPI) J. Richard Lucas, nominated to direct the Bureau of Mines, has asked President Nixon to withdraw his name from con sideration.

title: Martha Welch Married To Dr. Anthony Horan
description: RYE, N. Y., July 11Miss Martha Grace Welch, whose greatgreatgrandfather, Dr. Thomas Bramwell Welch, founded the fruit juice in dustry in the United States, was married here this morn ing at Christ's Church (Epis copal) to Dr. Anthony Hard ing Horan. The Rev. Dr. Wendell Phillips performed the ceremony.

title: Donna M. Sandmaier Bride of Officer
description: WAYNE, Pa., July 11 Donna Marie Sandmaier, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Philip J. Sandmaier Jr. of Radnor, was married here this noon to Lieut. Charles Buford Carden, U.S.A., son of Mr. and Mrs. Buford W. Carden of Tulsa, Okla.

title: WELLS CAPTURES WORLD MAT TITLE
description: EDMONTON, Alberta, July 11 (Canadian Press)Wayne Wells of the University of Oklahoma won the first gold medal for the United States in the world amateur freestyle wrestling chamnionshio today.

title: Big Power Link Is in Operation
description: BRISTOL, Va., June 27 The nation's two largest pow er systems have placed in op eration, just east of here, an extrahighvoltage transmis sion link for the exchange of power.

title: 5th Term in House Sought
description: CONCORD, N. H., July 11 (AP)  Representative James Cleveland, Republican of New Hampshire, filed yesterday t(i seek renomination in the ?? publican primary for a fifth term.

title: Bay State Governor Bars Guns for Vehicle Inspectors
description: BOSTON, July 11 (AP) Gov. Francis W. Sargent ve toed a bill this week that would have empowered the state's 300 Registry of Motor Vehicles inspectors to carry weapons and exercise other police powers.

title: Spotlight:
description: When it comes to making movies, every picture is a oneofakind item. And to judge from some of the fi nancing arrangements being made to get these movies produced, there seem to be almost as many ways to raise the money for making them.

title: AUTO UNION URGES BAN ON GAS ENGINE
description: WASHINGTON, July 11 (UPI) The United Automobile Work ers joined six conservation groups today in urging Congress to set air pollution control standards so tough they would banish the internal combustion engine from autos within the next five years.

title: Law
description: WASHINGTON  After years in which American law operated on the assumption that sex was likely to get out of hand unless it was hemmed in by laws, the constitutional right and propriety of governmental interference with the private sexual morals of adults is com ing under a broad attack.

title: Bridge
description: IF a novice wanted to know how I to distinguish between an expert bidder and one of limited experience, one would advise him to study the incidence of cuebidsa bid made in the opponent's suit. The expert will throw in such a bid at least three times as often as the nonexpert.

title: Miss Dell'Agnese Becomes a Bride
description: NORWALK, Conn., July 11 Miss Stephanie Alice Dell'Ag nese, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Fioravanti Dell'Agnese of Rowayton, was married here this morning to David Michael Brown, son of Mr. and Mrs. William M. Brown Jr. of Wilton. The Rev. Stan ley Koziol performed the ceremony in St. Joseph's Ro man Catholic Church and a reception was held at the Sil vermine Inn.

title: Gary Peacock Weds Nancy Brown
description: UPPER MONTCLAIR, N.J., July 11Miss Nancy Jeanne Stephenson Brown and Gary George Peacock were mar ried at the home of the bride's parents, Mr. and Mrs. Harold Leslie Brown, here this afternoon in a cere mony they wrote themselves.

title: Nixon and Congress: Lots of Rough Spots
description: WASHINGTONSome months ago, in an attempt to repair the. White House's frayed relations with Congress, it was arranged for President Nixon to take evening trips down the Potomac with members of Congress on the Presidential yacht Sequoia. The President never showed up for even one of the trips, and eventually the idea was aban doned.

title: The Glamorous Road to Bankruptcy
description: When the mighty Penn Central Transportation Com pany was forced to its knees three weeks ago because it could not borrow money fast enough to pay off its debt, many in the business and financial world saw it as an inevitable outcome of the Government's policy to curb inflation by making money scarce.

title: IAKOVOS, IN GREECE, DEFENDS REFORMS
description: ATHENS, July 11Archbish op Iakovos, the Greek Orthodox Archbishop of North and South America, warned today that un less his Church kept up with changing times, it would for feit the trust of the new gener ation of GreekAmericans.

title: Patricia Wolfe Is Bride of Doctor Here
description: Miss Patricia Jill Wolfe, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Les ter S. Wolfe of Great Neck, L. I., was married here last evening to Dr. Jeffry R. Nu renberg, son of Dr. and Mrs. Joseph Nurenberg of Wing dale, N. Y. Rabbi Nathan A. Perilman performed the cere mony at the Pierre.

title: THOMAS STANLEY OF VIRGINIA, 79
description: MARTINSVILLE, Va., July 11 (AP)Thomas Bahnson Stanley, Governor of Virginia when the United States Supreme Court ruled in 1954 that Prince Ed ward County must desegregate its public schools, died today. He was 79 years old.

title: A Major Breakthrough Is Sought in HighTemperature Aerospace Alloys
description: Metallurgists seeking new hightemperature alloys are shooting for the biggest breakthrough in aerospace materials since aluminum.

title: Amex and Counter Stocks Halt Slide
description: On the American Stock Ex change last week, after 11 successive trading sessions of steadily declining prices as measured by the index, Wednesday brought an up turn. More activity on the upside came Thursday and Friday.

title: 2 Biafran Soldiers Found
description: LAGOS, Nigeria, July 11 (Agence France  Press)  Two Biafran soldiers who did not know the Nigerian civil war had ended were recently ar rested hiding in Rivers State, it was reported here today. The men were tried and found guilty of the unlawful possession of firearms. However, a Port Har court magistrate freed them and advised them to return to their homes, The Lagos Daily Times reported.

title: News Summary and Index
description: SUNDAY, JULY 12, 1970

title: Gallup Survey Finds Negroes Disapprove of Nixon's Policies
description: PRINCETON, N.J., July 11 Statements by Negro leaders that President Nixon has little support among the nation's Ne gro population are borne out by survey results compiled in six consecutive measurements over the last four months, the Gallup Poll reported today.

title: WAR STAND SPLITS EPISCOPAL CHURCH
description: HARTFORD, July 11The Episcopal Diocese of Connecti cut has called on its member parishes to refuse to partici pate in a fund drive to support, student antiwar strikes.

title: From Grand Ole Opry to U.S. Senate? High Noon for Tex Ritter
description: EASTWARD out of Knoxville, U.S. 411441 runs straight to ward the Smoky Mountains and a land with roughhewn heroes whose names seem lifted from legend rather than history: Davy Crockett and Sam Houston, who lived there, and Andrew Jackson, the Tennessean who first carried the banner of the common people into the White House. Past Shooks Gap, the two lane highway begins to curve slightly northward, to Sevierville, a mountain town which serves small tobacco farms, leaving the big tourist trade to Gatlinburg, 11 miles southward.

title: Chatham College to Allow Freshmen to Pick Courses
description: PITTSBURGH, July 11Stu dents entering Chatham College this fall will find that they can design their own course of study without being bound by the curriculum requirements of the past.

title: Hogan Says He'll Play In Westchester Classic
description: HARRISON, N. Y., July 11 (UPI)Ben Hogan, forced to curtail tournament participa tion because of a knee in jury, notified sponsors of the $250,000 Westchester Golf Classic yesterday he would compete in the event July 30 to Aug. 2 over the Westchester County Club's West Course.

title: Marriage Held For Miss Cohn
description: ARMONK, N. Y., July 11 Miss Nancy Elizabeth Cohn and James Schaap Weinberg were married here this morn ing in St. Stephen's Episco pal Church. The Rev. Patrick J. Zacarra, assistant execu tive director of the New York Mission Society, performed the ceremony.

title: CLEAN WATER COST PUT AT $33BILLION
description: WASHINGTON, July 11 (UPI) A national survey indicates that it will take $33billion to $37billion in public funds to fight water pollution effective ly over the next six years.

title: West Point Builds
description: A 4,500seat auditorium capable of seating the entire cadet corps at West Point will be the main feature of a new $16.8million Cadet Union building for the United States Military Academy.

title: Music
description: EVER since John Banis ter began presenting the first public con certs in London in 1672, impresarios have prob ably complained of poor attendance, audiences of un satisfactory programs and less than great performers, artists of insensitive listeners, composers of not getting played. The complaints seem louder than ever today, so much so that the entire con cept of concerts as we know them is being questioned.

title: Miss Tarkington Becomes Bride Of W. R. Moller
description: GREENWICH, Conn., July 11  Miss Molly Ann Tark ington was married here this afternoon to William Richard Moller Jr., son of Mrs. Moller of New York and the late Mr. Moller. The bride's pa rents are Mr. and Mrs. Andrew W. Tarkington of Greenwich.

title: POVERTY PROGRAM SCORED BY NEGRO
description: FARMVILLE, Va., July 9 I had to quit, the Rev. Fran cis Griffin said yesterday, be cause I feel I was a part of a terrible hoax being played on black and on all poor peo ple.

title: Reds Down Braves, 76
description: ATLANTA, July 11(UPI) Tony Perez and Bernie Carbo hit homeruns and Woody Wood ward drove in two rims tonight in pacing the Cincinnati Reds to a 76 victory over the Atlan ta Braves.

title: Valerie Burghardt Plans Nuptials
description: MAHOPAC, N. Y., July 11 Mr. and Mrs. R. Walter Burghardt have announced the engagement of their daughter, Miss Valerie Pear sall Burghardt, to Peter Michael Hayes. He is the son of Mr. and Mrs. Peter Lind Hayes of New Rochelle, and Las Vegas, Nev. Mr. Hayes and his wife, Mary Healy, are the stage, radio and television nersonalities.

title: Maybe It's Corny, but Niagara Falls Still Delights Honeymooners
description: NIAGARA FALLSAnd still the new lyweds pour in, as they have for more than 100 years, to watch the falls fall. Some are olderbut most are under 30 and they stroll arminarm alongside the two roaring cataracts, squealing like children when the mist soaks their hair and their honeymoon clothes.

title: An Isthmus Of Surprises Searches for Its Identity
description: TO MOST North Americans, Latin Amer ica, which is always coming up in the news, means Mexico and South America. What has been missed is the isthmus that bridges North and South America, sometimes known as Middle America.

title: Steinkraus Seeks Foreign Team For the National Horse Show
description: Bill Steinkraus, the captain of the United States Eques trian Team, is doing double duty in Europe. Not only is he riding in international shows with the U.S.E.T but he is acting as a scout for the National Horse Show.

title: Dance
description: PERHAPS the most use ful aspect of our three major classic ballet companies, the New York City Ballet, American Ballet Theater and City Cen ter Joffrey Ballet (the Hark ness Ballet can no longer be taken seriously, not until we see what happens to that oddly Byzantine organiza tion), is quite simply how dif ferent each is from the others. They are so different that it doesn't even pay to have favorites, or even to make too many comparisons.

title: A Plan To Insure Health Care For All
description: WASHINGTONIn recent years there has been a rising chorus of voices, individual ly and in concert from ex pert panels, saying that the American health care system is in trouble and needs to be changed.

title: The New Shows
description: STEAMBATH, a play by Bruce Jay Friedman, divid ed the ten critics evenly. Clive Barnes: There is much to admire in the quality of Mr. Friedman's writing, but the basic idea is trite (it recalls Sutton Vane's Outward Bound) and moreover not capable of much dramatic develop ment. Here we have a group of people in a steam bath, we learn their stories, and one by one they pass through the door that leads to heaven, hell, infinity or backstage. Mr. Friedman's concept of God as a man trying to divert himself with party games and the exercise of his power is amusing. But it is a remote joke and one that cannot build within the play. The play has been staged by Anthony Perkins firmly and vigorously. The acting was good from top to bottom. Mr. Perkins is fine as the hero, Tandy, but perhaps a little too Wasplike (if you'll pardon the expression) for the play. Hector Elizondo played God with wit, charm and the right offhand, will ful grace. For Jay No vick's opinion see Page 1.

title: Advertising:
description: Over a period of about month and a half Al Hampel. then copy chief at Young & Rubicam, had some six or sc clandestine meetings with Victor Bloede, who had hero president of Benton & Bowles for a year.

title: Hope for U.S. Soccer
description: Today the United States Soccer Football Association concludes, in Chicago, its threeday annual meeting one which might be the most important in its history. For it has been discussing the setting up of a national coaching scheme, under a na tional coach; and there are possibilities that the coach may he Dettmar Cramer.

title: A Look At What Americans Know and Can Do
description: The release last week of the first results of the National As sessment of Educational Prog ress, a longterm project to de termine the hard facts about what Americans know, reminded some observers of an old In dian fable in which six blind beggars were invited to touch a passing elephant so they might know what the animal was like.

title: Judge Stresses Addicts' Rehabilitation
description: One after another the de fendants shuffled up to face Judge Irwin R. Brownstein in State Supreme Court in Brook lyn. Most of them pleaded guilty to possessing or trying to sell small quantities of heroin. Most of them were addicts who had promised to go straight but had been returned to court again and again.

title: PHANTOM MARKER MARS RACE WEEK
description: LARCHMONT, N. Y., July 11 The midSound area a mile from the finish line smoked more than a little from the bright blue flame of strong language today and there were an uncounted number of frus trated, confused and angry sailors who did not know where to look for what they sought.

title: LINES HARDENING ON DIRECT VOTING
description: WASHINGTON, July 11  The fight to win Senate ap proval for direct popular elec tion of the President has be gun behind the scenes, with serious concern among the or ganizers that it may fall short of success.

title: Alitalia Orders Its Fifth 747
