description: The Boeing Company an nounced yesterday that Ali talia, the Italian ariline, had signed a letter of agreement for its fifth Boeing 747, plus options for delivery of more of them through 1975. The agreement is subject to ap proval of the Alitalia board and the Italian Government.

title: Photography
description: BEHOLD Miss Elsie de Wolfe lolling on satin cushions amidst the potted palms and ori ental vases of her house on East 17th Street. The year is 1896, and the vision of fin de sicle insouciance and swank comes to us in one of the 60odd black and white pho tographs in the Metropoli tan Museum's fascinating and in many ways deeply moving exhibition. Six American Documentary Photographers, 18901914. Miss de Wolfe was at the time a popular actress, but she later achieved far greater fame as an interior decorator and in ternational hostess, and in her old age as Lady Mendl, wife of a British diplomat 12 years her junior, delighted the newspaper readers of two continents with her pranks. Documentary Photographers, 18901914. Miss de Wolfe was at the time a popular actress, but she later achieved far greater fame as an interior decorator and in ternational hostess, and in her old age as Lady Mendl, wife of a British diplomat 12 years her junior, delighted the newspaper readers of two continents with her pranks.

title: The Week in Finance:
description: THE Administration's game plan for controlling the economy and curbing inflation seems to be working fairly well nowat least in the eyes of the investment community.

title: Atlantic City Expecting Bonanza in Conventions
description: ATLANTIC CITY, N. J., June 27Conventions and expositions are expected to generate more than $1billion in business here in the nine teenseventies, according to Wayne Stetson, manager of the Atlantic City Convention Bureau.

title: Bonn Votes a Surcharge On Taxes to Curb Inflation
description: BONN, July 11  The West German Parliament approved today a Government bill to combat inflation through a number of tax measures, includ ing a 10 per cent refundable surcharge on personal and cor poration taxes.

title: Gardens
description: WHAT visual delights the insects of yard and garden offer. These often maligned residents in the green world are too often abhored or ignored when, in fact, many are beautiful to behold.

title: Culture was his beat
description: Following his particular Amer ican dream, the young man of letters has a number of direc tions in which to point, like a setter marking birdsthe nov el, history, drama, etc. Along the way thereto he can find, if lucky, more or less related jobs for food money. On the basis of No Whippings, No Gold Watches, Louis Kronenberger quietly boxed the compass of all desirable objects, in the process holding down all the enviable jobs. Since the twen ties, a No Vacancy sign before some real goody likely has meant simply that Kronen berger already was there.

title: Thumbnail Sketches of the Players Voted to Start in Baseball Classic
description: CATCHER  Johnny Bench. Cincinnati Reds, only 22 years old but in his third full season in the majors and his third AllStar game. A native of Oklahoma City, Johnny led the league with 18 passed halls in his 1968 debut season but had so much obvious class he won rookieof theyear honors. Bats and throws right handed.

title: Summer Fairs in the Northeast
description: HEADING the summer vacation best seller list of events is the fair  coun try, county and state. Exhibits, star headlined shows, contests, prizes, good eating and rides make the fair a popu lar attraction for the entire family. Among the fairs scheduled in the North east and Canada this season are:

title: Music Mailbag
description: The New York Times asked Mr. Rudolf Bing, general man ager of the Metropolitan Op era, whether he wished to reply to Luciano Berio's ar ticle of July 5. A Night at the Opera, Or What's Wrong With the Met. lzis letter follows:

title: Intrepid and Weatherly Score In America's Cup Trial Races
description: NEWPORT, R. I., July 11 Ficker was quicker, and so was Intrepid today as the America's Cup Observation Trials resumed after two fog cancellations.

title: BULTERMAN WINS LUDERS16 RACE
description: GREENWICH, Conn., July 11 Jacques F. Bulterman, at the helm of the Luders16 sloop. Onrust, and Mr. and Mrs. Wil liam H. Foulk Jr., with Cotinga in the Soling Class, were win ners of 41/2mile races on Long Island Sound today.

title: I.C.I. Will Set Export Record
description: LONDON, July 11 (UPI)  Britian's largest indus trial complex, Imperial Chem ical Industries, said this week its exports of plastic film material would set a record $28.8million this year up 20 per cent from the 1969 total.

title: Bowling Green Hires Crable
description: Lloyd W. Crable, who coached Cuyahoga Community College of Cleveland to undefeated track seasons in 1969 and 1970, has been named assistant track coach at. Bowling Green State University in Ohio.

title: Italian Moderate Named to Try to Form Coalition Government
description: ROME July 11President Giuseppe Saragat today asked Giulio Andreotti, a moderate Christian Democrat with close ties to the Vatican, to form a new government.

title: Allies May Use Guerrillas To Hit Foe's Supply Lines!
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, July 11  Allied strategists are planning to use the enemy's own tacticguerrilla warfare to try to frustrate North Viet nam's efforts to develop an al ternate supply route for its forces in Cambodia and south ern Darts of South Vietnam.

title: Merrill Adickes Wed to David Rich
description: SMOKE RISE, N. J., July 11 Miss Merrill Isabel Adickes, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Herbert John Adickes, was married at home here this afternoon to David N. Rich, son of Mr. and Mrs. Nelson B. Rich of Mirror Lake, N. H., and Delray Beach, Fla. The Rev. John Luttrell, an Epis copal minister, performed the ceremony.

title: RED TROOPS ENTER CAMBODIA RESORT
description: PNOMPENH, Cambodia, July 11In a resumption of major military action, the Vietnamese Communists were reported this morning to have entered the strategically situated mountain top resort of Kirirom, about 60 miles southwest of Pnompenh.

title: Education
description: SAN FRANCISCOCity high schools have been in turmoil during the past academic year, and educators have tended to attribute the students unrest al most exclusively to external causesthe Vietnam War, ra cial conflict, permissive child rearing.

title: The Poconos Are Booming Again
description: EAST STROUDSBURG, Pa.  The old, wooden 19thcentury railroad station which once was the hub of summer activity in this busy Poconos community has made a temporary comeback has been dressed in bunting and flags and is serving as the headquarters for the town's 100th anniversary celebra tion.

title: Art
description: LAST February, 119,000 people at tended the elaborate and rather disappointing exhibition of Afri can sculpture at the National Gallery in Washington, and another 36,000 saw it in a somewhat improved presentation at the Brooklyn Museum before it closed there last month. I wish that each of these 155,000 people could see another African exhibition that has turned up unexpectedly. It was unex

title: NEUROLOGO NEXT IN 1MILE RACE
description: INGLEWOOD, Calif., July 11 Pleasure Seeker, scoring his first major stakes victory, won the $162,100 Hollywood Gold Cup today by 3 lengths at Hollywood Park.

title: 384 OF THE ENEMY REPORTED KILLED IN KHESANH FIGHT
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Monday. July 13  A United States helicopterborne assault and a B52 raid that followed were reported today to have killed at least 384 North Viet namese soldiers and to have wounded many more. American officials termed the action the sharpest setback in months for enemy forces in South Vietnam.

title: IRENE W. MATLEY
description: WASHINGTON, July 12 (UPI) Irene William Matley, who sang in Porgy and Bess, died today in District of Columbia General Hospital. She was 38 years old.

title: Mayor Killed in Guatemala
description: ZACAPA, Guatemala, July 12 (AP)  Mayor Marco Aldana Sanchez of Zacapa and a wom an were killed by gunfire from a passing car last night as they stood talking on a street corner, the police reported today.

title: Sports of The Times
description: This week Madison Square Garden severs itself from the mass of sports fans. The ticket applications are coining in and piling high as those wellknown Knick and Ranger fans, the giant corporations, shovel their money into the round brown building.

title: Japan's Hopes High For Congo Copper
description: BRUSSELS, July 12Japa nese mining interests, which moved into the former Belgian Congo when its relations with Belgium were at a freezing point, have struck it rich and by October, 1972, hope to ex tract 54,000 tons of copper per year from their new conces sions in Katanga Province.

title: Borek Takes Charity Golf
description: WOODMERE, L. 1., July 12 Gene Borek of the Pine Hollow Country Club shot a 34, 3367, three under par, to lead a field of 40 professionals and 120 amateurs today in the annual one  day Five Towns United Fund charity golf tournament at the Woodmere Club.

title: Jobless Rate Rise to 5% By End of Year Predicted
description: The nationwide unemploy ment rate, now approximately 5 per cent, is expected to in crease to 5 per cent by the end of this year, according to Herbert Bienstock, regional director here of the Bureau of Labor Statistics.

title: Montreal Bomb Dismantled
description: MONTREAL, July 12 (AP) Policemen dismantled early to day a 150pound bomb set to go off behind the main office of the Bank of Montreal in the city's financial district. It marked the third time in three days that Montreal police had disengaged dynamite bombs be fore they could explode.

title: PROPOSAL FOR L.I. ASKS MAJOR SHIFT IN DEVELOPMENT
description: HAUPPAUGE, L. I., July 12 A comprehensive plan for Long Island proposes major changes in housing and trans portation patterns, aggressive park acquisition and the review of zoning at the county level to combat deterioration and obsolescence.

title: L WOLFE GILBERT, COMPOSER, DEAD
description: LOS ANGELES, July 12 L. Wolfe Gilbert, composer of more than 250 songs, including Ramona, the first motion pic ture theme song, died today of a stroke. He was 83 years old.

title: Mosbacher Added to List Of Intrepid's Contributors
description: NEWPORT, R. I., July 12 Emil (Bus) Moshacher has be come a contributor to the Intrepid cause in the America's Cup defense campaign, ending rumors that he might be called upon to skipper Valiant if the need arose.

title: F.T.C. Proposes Stricter Rules On Mail and Vocational Schools
description: WASHINGTON, July 12 The Federal Trade Commission has proposed new guidelines that would establish signifi cantly tighter standards for the nation's correspondence schools and private vocational institutions.

title: Grornyko and Riad Confer
description: MOSCOW, July 12 (UPI) The Foreign Ministers of the Soviet Union and of the United Arab Republic. Andrei A. Gro myko and Mahmoud Riad, con ferred on Middle Past policy to day in a continuation of talks begun by President Gamal Abdel Nasser of Egypt and Soviet leader.

title: Wayne N. Aspinall Weds Mrs. Best
description: GRAND JUNCTION, Colo., July 12Mrs. Essie Jeffers Best, widow of Frank Best, was married here this after noon to Representative Wayne N. Aspinall, Demo crat of Colorado. The Rev. Glenn Brown performed the ceremony in the Crossroads Methodist Church.

title: Jersey Workers End Strike
description: ST. HELIER, Jersey (UPI)A state of emergency on this Eng lish Channel island ended today when 1,400 striking Govern ment dockworkers, garbage col lectors, airport maintenance men, firemen and other em ployes returned to work.

title: British Team to Search For Morag the Monster
description: LONDON, July 12Is Moran fact or fiction?

title: JOINT COMPANIES WITH REDS SEEN
description: WASHINGTON, July 12  A lowprofile Government mis sion to the countries of Eastern Europethe first of its kind has returned with the conclu sion that in at least two of these countries it may be possible for United States companies to es tablish profitmaking joint ven tures.

title: Jersey Junk Yard Burns
description: CARLSTADT, N. J., July 12 Clouds of heavy smoke, visible in New York City seven miles to the east, billowed over this Bergen County community to night from burning rubbish and old tires in an isolated junk yard. The police said the fire of undetermined origin, caused no injuries or damage.

title: Traditional Role Comes Under New Attack
description: In this day and age, what should a university be, what do you regard as its mission?

title: Students in Europe Find Corporate Life Lacking
description: RIXENSTRT, Belgium, July 12 At an unusual forum in this serene Walloon village, five students from Europe's oldest graduate school of business judged the modern corporation and found it lacking.

title: Mrs. Meir Says Cairo Ignored Bid for Talks
description: PARIS, July 12 (AP)Mrs. Golda Meir, the Israeli Pre mier, says her Government proposed secret negotiations to the United Arab Republic two weeks ago but never received an answer.

title: Troops on Alert in Ulster On Eve of Orange Parades
description: BELFAST, Northern Ireland, July 12Nearly 18,000 soldiers and policemen moved into tacti cal positions in rainswept Northern Ireland tonight, the eve of big parades celebrating Protestant domination of the torn country.

title: Threat Seen to Academic Freedom
description: [Earlier Mr. Brewster had referred to a society that is tempted to give up on taking the risk of freedom gen erally. He was asked at this point to elaborate on the reference.]

title: HOWARD W. BOYNTON
description: UTICA, N. Y., July 12How ard W. Boynton, former treas urer and director of Handy & Harmam, refiner and fabricator of precious metals in New York, died yesterday in a hospital here lie was 80 years old and lived in Stamford and in West Orange. N.J.

title: Roundup: Cubs Clawing Back Into Race
description: The Chicago Cubs appear well again and ready to do battle for the top spot in the National League Eastern Di vision. Since their late June tailspin, in which they lost 12 straight games, one short of the club record set by the 1944 wartime team, the Cubs have won six of their last eight games, including a 102 victory yesterday over the Philadelphia Phillies in Chi cago.

title: Bostwicks Post 4and3 Victory In Anderson Golf Tourney Final
description: MAMARONECK, N. Y., July 12 The Bostwick brothers, Pete and Jimmy of Long Island's Meadow Brook Club, play a sport in every season. Today they captured the John G. An derson Memorial golf tourna ment with a 5underpar best ball team score in the final at Winged Foot Golf Club. They beat Fred Kask, the Connecti cut amateur champion, and Bill Brew of Weathersfield, 4 and 3.

title: 100 Demonstrators Protest Greek Orthodox Plans
description: The PanHellenic Fellowship, dedicated lo the preservation and protection of the Greek lan guage, staged a protest demon stration yesterday arros the street from the headquarters of the Greek Orthodox Archdio cese of North and South Amer ica at 10 East 79th Street.

title: THREE RAN RALLY BEATS CARDS, 76
description: ST. LOUIS, July 12 (AP) Al Oliver snapped a 44 tie with a leadoff homer in the 10th inning today and the first place Pittsburgh Pirates gained a 76 victory over the St. Louis Cardinals.

title: Mother Identifies Girl. 17, Found Dead in Canarsie
description: A girl whose body, was found late Saturday on a lot in the Canarsie section of Brooklyn was identified by her mother yesterday as Wendy Abramson, 17 years old.

title: 2 Boards Protest City Cut in Funds For Traffic Study
description: Two community planning boards have protested a nearly $10,000 deduction that is be ing made from a $50,000 grant awarded to a private consultant to study Queensboro Bridge traffic. The amount being cut is to reimburse the city for rent, furniture, equipment and other overhead, because the study will be conducted in of fice space of the City Planning Commission.

title: Zulu Chief Urges SelfRule in South Africa
description: DURBAN, South Africa, July 2The new chief of the Zulus has forcefully challenged the. South African Government to put into effect its policy of black selfrule.

title: Chess:
description: Castling kingside is usually normal procedure for both players in the majority of chess games. Castling on the queen wing has a suspicious look. It seems lefthanded and needlessly provocative. Instinctively, many buffs be lieve that a king, on the queen flank, is sulking in unhealthly terrain.

title: Rita Jeanne Haggerty Married To Charles William Metz 3d
description: Miss Rita Jeanne Haggerty and Charles William Metz 3d were married yesterday after noon in the Church of St. Ber nard on West 14th Street, founded in 1868 by the Rev. Gabriel A. Healy, a maternal greatgreatgranduncle of the bride.

title: Church Council Gets a Home
description: The Staten Island Division of the Council of Churches of the City of New York (Protestant) yesterday formally dedicated its new headquarters in the Mount Augustine Roman Cath olic Retreat House, 144 Campus Road, Grymes Hill. The retreat house, which offered to share its facilities with the council, is across the street from Wagner College.

title: SOUTH AFRICA BLACKS FORM STUDENT UNION
description: JOHANNESBURG, South Africa, July 12A group of nonwhite students has broken away from the National Union of South African Students, the largest student organization in South Africa, and formed their own exclusively nonwhite South African Students Organization.

title: TWO DEAD MARINES SIGHTED IN OLD MINE
description: WINTERHAVEN, Calif., July 12 (AP)The bodies of two marines presumed to have died of carbon monoxide poisoning while exploring an abandoned gold mine were sighted today by rescue teams.

title: Rogers Expects No Moves By Hanoi for Peace Now
description: LONDON, July 12  Secre tary of State William P. Rogers has concluded during his two week journey in Asia and to Britain that the Communists have no immediate interest in negotiating a peace settlement in Vietnam.

title: Saudi Plane to Beirut Hijacked to Damascus
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, July 12 (Reuters)A Saudi Arabian Boeing707 jet airliner with more than 140 people aboard was brought here tonight after having been hijacked at gunpoint to Damascus, Syria. It returned later to Jidda, Saudi Arabia.

title: READING STRESSED IN PUPIL PROGRAM
description: WASHINGTON, July 12An innovative master plan designed to counter the academic retar dation of students in the city's nearly allblack school system will be considered by the Dis trict of Columbia's board of ed ucation tomorrow night.

title: Miss Universe Excited At Prospect of Travel
description: MIAMI BEACH, July 12 (UPI)The new Miss Uni verse, Marisol Malaret Con treras, said today that she was excited about the pros pect of traveling around the world.

title: Comanche, Kiowa, Potawatomi and Social Tribes Attend
description: SOUTHAMPTON, L. I., July 12For a while there, it looked as if parties for minority underdogs of one sort or another would come to a screeching halt.

title: Drowned Youth Saved By Quick Rescue Work
description: A Navy doctor, the Coast Guard and the cardiacarrest unit of Peninsula General Hospital teamed up yester day afternoon to save the life of a Brooklyn youth who was thought to have drowned at Bergen Beach on Jamaica Bay.

title: 4 From Pennsylvania Die As Plane Crashes in Jersey
description: FRANKLIN TOWNSHIP, N.J., July 12 (AP)Four Pennsylva nians died today when their light plane crashed into a wooded area north of Route 40 in this Gloucester County com munity.

title: PITCHER SUFFERS HIS EIGHTH LOSS
description: WASHINGTON, July 12Mel Stottlemyre, one of three Yan kee players on the American League AllStar team, hardly looked the part today as he was battered by the Senators on their way to a 73 triumph at Robert F. Kennedy Stadium.

title: Steinbeck's Son Denies Demonstrating in Saigon
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, July 12 (AP)One of three United States newsmen arrested yes terday during a student dem onstration here said today that they had been seized because they were taking pictures of police activities.

title: Life Article Rebutted By Mayor of St. Louis
description: ST. LOUIS, July 12 (UPI) Mayor Alfonso J. Cervan tes said today that he could not wait a year or more for his lawsuit to prove that the recent article in Life magazine linking him with the underworld was untrue so he has issued an article.

title: Secret Ballot Misplaced
description: With most other American institutions being subjected to rebellious scrutiny, it was un likely that certain venerable practices of Congress would long escape critical attention. The improbable vehicle for such examination is one of those Legislative Reorganization bills which periodically allow Con gress to study itself in a mirror specially designed to reassure it that, in spite of a few minor flaws, it is still the fairest one of all.

title: Hoen Downs Weld in 4 Sets In New England Net Final
description: BRETTON WOODS, N. H., July 11 (AP)Ted Hoehn, a 28yearold teaching pro at Stowe. Vt., defeated topseeded Ned Weld, 32, of Weston, Mass., 86, 97. 68. 64. ill the final of the first New England Lawn Tennis Association Mount Washington open tour nament.

title: ISRAELIS BLOW UP A JORDANIAN FORT
description: TEL AVIV, Monday, July 13 An Israeli commando force crossed into Jordan during the night and blew up a Jordanian Army fortification, killing at least four Jordanian soldiers, military spokesman said here today.

title: News Summary and Index
description: MONDAY, JULY 13, 1970

title: Crown Takes Full Charge Of General Dynamics Unit
description: Henry Crown, the Chicago financier who has been moving to regain control of the General Dynamics Corporation, has tak en full charge of the company's profitable subsidiary, the Mate rial Service Corporation, it was announced yesterday.

title: NIXON AS PRESIDENT FRIGHTENS HUNTLEY
description: Chet Huntley, who will retire Aug. 1 after 14 years as the New York half of the National Broadcasting Company's Hunt leyBrinkley team of newscast ers, has told a Life magazine interviewer that he is over whelmed by what he regards as the shallowness of President Nixon and frightened by the fact that he is President.

title: MORGAN IS NAMED ALLSTAR RESERVE
description: Gil Hodges, manager of the National League AllStars, said yesterday that Joe Morgan, Houston Astro second baseman, would replace Felix Millan of Atlanta on the squad for tomor row night's game at Cincinnati.

title: McClellan to Open Hearings On Bombings Across U. S.
description: WASHINGTON, July 12 (AP) Senator John L. McClellan, declaring that political terror ists have begun guerrilla war fare on a national scale, an nounced today the opening of hearings into bombings this year.

title: KETCHUP II FIRST IN A CLOSE FINISH
description: LARCHMONT, N.Y., July 12 The timelimit rule in yacht racing says that if one yacht finishes within the prescribed period, it is an official race for all the yachts in that class.

title: FILIPINO SETTLERS ANGER TRIBESMEN
description: TUBAYONG, the Philippines, July 12The unequal contest between pagan hill tribesmen and Christian lowlanders that has cast a pall of violence and fear in this frontier area of the Southern Philippines has now been put before President Fer dinand E. Marcos.

title: Books of The Times
description: What a corrective this family portrait is to the current literature of alienation, doubt, and existential angst. Here is cer tainty, identity, pragmatism, high achieve ment and complete satisfaction in doing one's work. It's a good thing, writes Jim Drinker, the least feted of the four broth ers, during what the author describes as feverish rash of family medals and honorary degrees. It's a good thing I'm here to bring the family reputa tion down to nor mal.

title: Burned Satellite Repaired
description: WASHINGTON, July 12 (AP) A 110pound satellite that was severely damaged by fire last Dec. 10 has been refurbished successfully and is rescheduled for launching next spring, the National Aeronautics and Space Administration said today. The repair of the Small Scientific Satellite cost the Goddard Space Flight Center at Green belt, Md.. $114,000 but put the $4million program back on its track, officials said.

title: U.S. ARMY TRIMS CLUBS IN TAIWAN
description: TAIPEI, Taiwan, July 12 The United States military of ficers' clubs in Taiwan have discontinued the memberships of American business execu tives, lowerranking foreign diplomats, and some Chinese nationals. The privileges of missionaries may be removed later.

title: Pope Rejoices Over Release of Bishop by China
description: ROME, July 12  Pope Paul VI expressed joy today that Communist China had freed the Most Rev. James Edward Walsh, an American mission ary bishop, from prison and said he would like to see in this decision a sign of better days.

title: SADECKI HASTENS DOWNFALL IN 9TH
description: The kind of baseball that made the New York Mets fa mous long before they became glorious cost them another de feat at the hands of the Mon treal Expos at Shea Stadium yesterday.

title: 4 Die in Plane Crash
description: DAVENPORT, Okla., July 12 (UPI)Four persons died when their twinengine Piper Co manche crashed through 50 foot trees late yesterday and disintegrated three miles north of here. Wreckage was strewn along a 150foot trail from the wooded area to an open field and twisted aircraft parts were buried in mud a foot deep. There was no immediate identi fication of the victims.

title: Open Foes to Meet Again
description: PHILADELPHIA, July 12 (AP)Jack Nicklaus, who won the British Open golf champion ship today, and Doug Sanders, whom he beat by one stroke, will meet again this week at the eight annual Whitemarsh Country Club Classic here.

title: Plaque Honors Press Agent
description: A bronze plaque honoring Ben Kornzweig, the theatrical press agent who died on Oct. 10, was dedicated Saturday at the Eugene O'Neill Memorial Theater Center in Waterford Conn., by the Association of Theatrical Press Agents and Managers. Mr. Kornzweig, who represented the O'Neill Center, was a charter member of the group.

title: Migrant Camps Assailed
description: WASHINGTON, July 12 (Reu ters)Senator Walter F. Mon dale charged tonight that camps tor migratory laborers in Texas and Florida were similar to con crete cages in which political prisoners were held on South Vietnam's Conson Prison Is land. In a speech prepared for Senate delivery tomorrow the Minnesota Democrat said a study finds the lives of hun dreds of thousands of our fel ow citizens manipulated and managed in such a way as to ?? them to subhuman sta tus. I am shorked and outraged ??eyond belief.

title: GILLESPIE IS STAR OF JAZZ FESTIVAL
description: NEWPORT, R. I., July 12 After paying tribute to Louis Armstrong on Friday night, the Newport Jazz Festival yes terday turned to a wide variety of jazz styles and jazz groups, but once again a trumpeter turned out to be the key to the day's programing.

title: LAST HOLE BIRDIE CLINCHES VICTORY
description: ST. ANDREWS, Scotland, July 12Jack Nicklaus won the British Open by a stroke from Doug Sanders in their 18hole playoff today. It took an eight foot downhill putt under al most intolerable pressure on the home hole for a birdie 3 to stave off Sanders's stirring challenge down the stretch.

title: Syphilis Cases Are Up Sharply, Reversing Trend in Last Decade
description: The rate of infectious syphilis, which has been steadily de creasing during recent years, increased in the last year by 8.5 per cent, a national health society reported yesterday.

title: CHI CHENG BREAKS WORLD DASH RECORD
description: MUNICH, West Germany, July 12 (AP)Chi Cheng of Taiwan set a world record in the wo men's 200meter dash today with a time of 22.4 seconds.

title: Attendance Drop Kills Revivals of 2 Shows
description: A sharp drop in theater business in the early days of July killed two shows last week. Charley's Aunt with Louis Nye and Maureen O' Sullivan and Room Service with Dick Shawn, both re vivals, closed Saturday night.

title: Racial Issues Raised in Strike By Black Workers in Jackson
description: JACKSON, Miss., July 12A strike by black municipal work ers here has turned into a racial dispute that appeared to day to raise the prospect of a violent confrontation.

title: Citizens on U. S. Coasts Rally to Save Tidal Marshes
description: An unorganized but exten sive movement is under way in coastal areas to save the na tion's salt marshes.

title: STEEL PRODUCERS AWAIT AUTO PLANS
description: PITTSBURGH, July 12Steel producers are anxiously await ing word of the buying plans of automobile companies. Mill officials are hoping the auto companies will provide a gen eral lift when they place orders for late August and for Sep tember.

title: Portrait of the Golfer as a Happy Man: Happy Victor, Happy Competitor, Happy Husband
JAVITS SEES NIXON BACKING GOODELL
description: Senator Jacob K. Javits said yesterday that he expected President Nixon to come here this fall to campaign for the Republican ticket headed by Governor Rockefeller and Sen ator Charles E. Goodell.

title: Advertising: They Frown on Moonlighting
description: A quick canvass of agency executives (at least among those who found the need to work on a Friday after noon in July) showed that almost to a man they were opposed to their creative people moonlighting.

title: Nicklaus Wins British Open
description: Jack Nicklaus won the British Open golf champion ship yesterday at St. An drews, Scotland, The Colum bus, Ohio, pro sank an eight foot birdie putt on the final hole of the 18hole playoff to defeat Doug Sanders of Houston by one stroke. Nick. laus shot a 72. Sanders a 73. Details on Page 42.

title: Dublin: Epistles of a Saintly O'Casey
description: DUBLIN  Lovehate rela tionships between selfexiles and their native countries are a well known phenome non, and nowhere can they be seen clearer than in the case of Ireland and her voluntary expatriates. James Joyce ban ished himself, but could never rid himself of his ingrained Irishness, and his writings became saturated with in timations of an emotional and in tellectual, love hate tug of war. Nothing sums up Joyce's attitude with such crisp acidity better than a few lines from his poem, Gas From a Burner

title: Harrelson Hurts Ankle
description: BELMONT, Mass., July 12 (AP)  Ken Harrelson of the Cleveland Indians twisted his injured right ankle and was forced to withdraw from a memberguest golf tournament yesterday at Belmont Country Club.

title: Tanzanian Treason Trial Entering Third Week
description: DAR ES SALAAM, Tanzania, July 12  The trial of seven leading Tanzanian political fig ures on charges of treason will enter its third week tomorrow, and lawyers expect it to con tinue for four more weeks.

title: War Games Fascinate Diverse Generals
description: In the unlikely setting of the rolling Jamaica campus of St. John's University, host of college graduates and undergraduates of various political attachments gath ered over the weekend to play war games.

title: Unlikely Cargo: a Whale
description: SAN PEDRO, Calif., July 12 (UPI)The freighterpassenger ship President Grant steamed into San Pedro Harbor today with a dead 50foot gray whale draped around her bow. David Sexton, an assistant engineer, said the ship ran into the whale shortly after midnight after rounding Pt. Conception.

title: Pravda Criticizes 2 Novels Attacking Soviet Intellectuals
description: MSCOW, July 12Pravda. the Communist party news paper, today attacked as ide ologically vicious and artistic ally weak two novels that had stirred the indignation of lib eral Soviet intellectuals.

title: Darts Beat Spurs by 20 For 2d Weekend Triumph
description: The Washington Darts of the (North American Soccer League posted two triumphs within 24 hours over the weekend. The Darts, newcomers to the six team pro league, blanked the Kansas City Spurs, 20, in Washington yesterday, after they had defeated the Dallas Tornado, 20, in Dallas Satur day night.

title: A Veteran of Rome's Political Scene
description: ROME, July 12  At the age of 51, Premierdesignate Giulio Andreotti is still young by the standards of Italian politics.

title: Baseball Transactions
description: NATIONAL LEAGUE

title: U.S. Urges Latin Countries Not to Relax Boycott of Cuban Regime
description: WASHINGTON, July 12The United States is pressing a drive to persuade LatinAmerican countries not to relax the dip lomatic and economic boycott against the Castro Government in Cuba.

title: Personal Finance
description: An easy and thoughtful gesture a parent or grand parent can make for a child's future is a gift of securities to be held in a custody ac count.

title: 250 Arrested at Rock Fete
description: PALO ALTO, Calif., July 12 (UPI)  Police arrested more than 250 young people today during a rockthrowing, win downbreaking melee that broke out after a rock music concert in a downtown park.

title: Ky Arrives in Bangkok
description: BANGKOK. Thailand, July 12 (Reuters)Vice President Nguyen Cao Ky of South Viet nam flew to Bangkok today for, three days of talks with Thai military leaders and said he was worried about the situation in Cambodia.

title: 11 College Presidents Caution Money Crisis Imperils Future
description: An acute financial crisis is threatening the solvency or growth of many institutions of higher learning as they seek to rebuild public confi dence and resist any en croachment on their freedom, according to presidents of major colleges and universi ties in this area.

title: Rogers Informs Heath Of U.S. Policy in Africa
description: LONDON, July 12Serre tary of State William P. Rogers, in talks with Primp Minister Heath today, said that the increased identifica tion of American Negroes with black African causes was a factor in the United States opposition to British plans to resume the sale of arms to South Africa.

title: Mothers to Protest War
description: BOSTON, July 12 (AP)A group of women who call them selves Concerned American Mothers plans to go to Wash ington Wednesday to press for an end to the war. A march they plan in front of the White House Friday is scheduled to coincide with a reception for Prince Charles and Princess Anne of Britain.

title: Windigo Paces the Fleet In Mackinac Sailing Race
description: MACKINAC ISLAND, Mich., July 12 (AP) Windigo, the longest yacht in the competi tion, cruised to a 15mile lead today over favored American Eagle in the 46th annual Bay view Yacht Club's race from Port Huron to Mackinac.

title: Exercising Takes Off Years
description: Housewives, grandmothers, teachers and singers troop out of a dressing room in their leotards and bare feet, and then, facing a wall of mirrors, get to work on re laxation, a pretty strenuous undertaking.

title: Alice Crimmins Indicted Again in the Deaths of Her Children
description: Alice Crimmins is to be ar raigned in Queens Criminal. Court today on new charges of firstdegree murder and first degree manslaughter in the deaths of her two young chil dren in 1965.

title: FAMILY STONE OPENS FOREST HILLS FETE,
description: Sly and the Family Stone, the San Francisco soul band, helped the Forest Hills Music Festival start its 10th season Saturday.

title: MRS. JOHN BASS
description: Mrs. Johanna Bass, wife of John Bass, a retired sugar ex ecutive and philanthropist, died here Saturday night. She was 69 years old and lived at 200 Central Park South and Miami Beach.

title: International Loans Listed for Week
description: WASHINGTON, July 12The following is a list loans and other aid extended last week by United States and other international lending agencies here:

title: U. S. Rugby Team Wins
description: CANBERRA, Australia, July 12 (Reuters)  The University of California's Rugby Union team defeated an Australian National University fifteen, 186, today.

title: Injury From Bomb Exploded On July 4 Kills L.I. Boy, 16
description: SYOSSET, L. I., July 12 A 16yearold boy injured July 4, when he set off a pipe bomb he made, died today at 4:30 A.M. in Syosset Hospital of head injuries suffered in the explosion.

title: MINES ARE PICKETED FOR BIGGER PENSIONS
description: MULLENS, W. Va., Monday, July 13 (AP)A dissident group of coal miners seeking liberal ized pension benefits set up picket lines early today at mines in West Virginia.

title: BALLET THEATER ENDS ITS SEASON
description: The American Ballet Theater, justifiably proud of its new pro duction of Petrouchka, pre sented two performances of it yesterday at the close of the company's season at the State heater. In the evening, Royes Fernandez danced Petrouchka for the first time this season. Diana Weber and Han Ebbelaar were the Dancer and Black amoor, respectively, at the matinee.

title: The Proceedings In the U.N. Today
Soviet Wrestlers Add Crown In FreeStyle to GrecoRoman
description: EDMONTON, Alberta, July 12 (Canadian Press)The Soviet Union remained the master in the world amateur wrestling championships, which ended last night. Soviet grapplers, who dominated the GrecoRoman events, captured their second straight team title with brilliant performances in the freestyle, taking four gold medalsall in the heavyweight classes.

title: Hearing on Police Study Begins Today
description: The question of whether alle gati on s of widespread cor ruption within the New York City Police Department should be investigated by a special fiveman commission is sched uled to be argued today before State Supreme Court Justice Harry B. Frank.

title: Excerpts From RoundTable Discussion by Heads of Colleges
description: What do you consider to be some of the most basic problems confront ing your university or college?

title: GUARD SUMMONED TO INDIANA AREA
description: MICHIGAN CITY, Ind., Mon day, July 13 (AP)Gov. Edgar D. Whitcomb ordered 150 Na tion Guard troops into Michigan City early today following a second night of disorders in the predominantly Negro North Side.

title: Tennis Match Serves the Poor
description: Senator Jacob N. Javits and Arthur Ashe combined sagacity and a delicate touch at the net yesterday to out finesse Jim Brown and Herb FitzGibbon in a goodhu mored exhibition tennis match in Central Park.

title: Board Member Is Appointed By Institute of Management
description: Ben S. Gilmer, who recently retired as president of the American Telephone & Tele graph Company, has been elect ed a director of the American Institute of Management, management research organiza tion.

title: Ra II Reaches Barbados After Crossing the Atlantic
description: BRIDGETOWN, Barbados July 12(Reuters)The papy rus reed boat Ra II with its captain, the Norwegian ex plorer Thor Heyerdahl, ar rived today in Bridgetown after a 57day voyage from Morocco.

title: Champion French Jockey Signs With Wildenstein
description: PARIS, July 12Yves Saint Martin, the French champion jockey, yesterday signed a threeyear contract to ride for the 300horse stable of Daniel Wildenstein, are dealer and philanthropist.

title: MISS MEYER WINS 3D TITLE IN SWIM
description: SANTA CLARA, Calif., July 12 (AP)Debbie Meyer won the 800meter freestyle event to day for her third victory in the finale of the annual Santa Clara invitation swimming meet.

title: New Jersey Yachtsman Crosses Atlantic Alone
description: PLYMOUTH, England, July 12(AP)A 44yearold Amer ican yachtsman slipped into Plymouth yesterday after a lone voyage across the Atlan tic. He didn't tell anyone here about it until today.

title: Elaborate Plans for Prince's Tomb Stir Yugoslays
description: CETINJE, Yugoslavia, June 28 PrinceBishop Peter 11, who ruled here from 1530 to 1851 as Montenegro's temporal and ecclesiastical head, was a poet, a philosopher a crack shot who enjoyed blasting lemims thrown in the air and a billiard addict who had mules carry his own table to his mountainous realm.

title: Despite Progress in Auto Safety, Future Effectiveness of Federal Program Is in Doubt
description: WASHINGTON, July 12  The Federal auto safety pro gram, despite acknowledged shortcomings, has earned credit even from its critics for curb ing the incessant rise in high way deaths. While the number of fatalities has continued to grow, the rate of increase has declined.

title: Major Bills in Congress
SOME COMMENTS BY PRESIDENTS ON CENTRAL ISSUES
description: DR. COPELAND: For students with strong motivation, with a career in view, we have a pretty good formula, or basis for it. (But) now we have a lot of other students who come in without any clearly marked career destination.

title: Dayton, Ohio, to Get A Negro as Mayor After a Long Fight
description: DAYTON, Ohio, July 12 On Wednesday morning, Day ton is scheduled to become the nation's fourth largest city with a black Mayor.

title: SIFFERT PORSCHE FINISHES SECOND
IndustryLabor Battle Line Is Emerging Over Pending JobSafety Legislation
description: WASHINGTON, July 12 Eleven months after the Presi dent submitted an occupational safety and health message, say ing, With the advent of a new workplace technology, we must now give similar attention to workplace safety and health. Congress seems ready to act.

title: Serendipity on Fifth Avenue
description: A couple of exuberant young people sat in the middle of Fifth Avenue Saturday afternoon, smiling at the passersby. Passersby smiled back.

title: French Political Revival
description: Dismay and even a touch of panic has been set off in France's Gaullist party by its defeat in a single parliamentary byelection in a distant province far from Paris.

title: Protestants and Catholics Name Priest a Professor
description: One of the topranking Bibli cal scholars in the English speaking world has accepted the first joint professorship of fered by a Protestant divinity school and a Roman Catholic seminary.

title: 10Year Legislature
description: This will be a 10year Legis lature, said Stanley Steingut, the Democratic leader of the State Assembly, as he talked about the November election of 150 Assemblymen and 57 State Senators. We're trying to make voters understand that the Legislature means more to their everyday life than the Presidency  and that the parties that control the Legislature next year will probably control the state for 10 years.

title: JOBLESS RISE HELD NO INFLATION CUB
description: WASHINGTON, July 12A member of the Federal Reserve Board said over the weekend he doubts that a higher unem ployment level than now would bring any faster progress against inflation.

title: A Big Bill Clatters Up Lifterless Coast Town
description: MOUNT VERNON. Wash., July 12 (UPI)  The roads around this northern Wash ington town were litterfree today, but a loc?? financial concern wound up with a $12.000 trash bill.

title: Sports Today
description: HARNESS RACING Roosevelt Raceway, Westbury, L. I; 8 P.M.

title: U.S. Appears to Speed Up Plane Shipments to Israel]
description: WASHINGTON, July 12The United States appears to have accelerated its shipments of F4 Phantom fighterbombers to Israel, but at the rate that officials here refused to discuss.

title: Rights Unit Accuses New York Stock Exchange of Antiblack Bias in Hiring
description: The State Division of Hu man Rights has found that the New York Stock Exchange re fused to hire a black man as an employe solely because of his race. It has ordered the exchange to recruit minority group workers and submit pe riodic reports to the commis sion for the next two years of the results of this effort.

title: Van Campen Heilner, Writer And Zane Grey Protege, Dead
description: MADRID July 12 (AP)Van Carnpen Heilner, author, ex plorer and protege of the late author Zane Grey, died here today. He was 71 years old.

title: A Cambodian Soldier, 14, Goes to War
description: KOMPONG THOM, Cam bodia, July 12Sok Khieu went into the battle line to day in this most beleaguered of Cambodian towns, SO miles north of Pnompenh, trying manfully not to look like child. For a soldier who in sists he is 14 but looks younger he did not do badly.

title: Tow Rope Kills Youth
description: HONOLULU, July 12 (AP) Byron Arola, 14 years old, was killed yesterday after he picked up a bright yellow rope that fell on a beach here and began wrapping it around his right arm. The rope, attached to a glider tow truck 1,000 feet away, whipped the boy off his feet and dragged him 100 feet across the beach into a chain link fence. He died four hours later in a hospital.

title: Nult Wins Kayak Slalom
description: LEAVENWORTH, Wash., July 12 (AP)Dave Nutt, 21yearold collegian from Hanover, N. H., won the national kayak slalom championship yesterday cover ing the 27 gates on the Wenat chee River's 800meter Slalom course in 289.6 seconds.

title: Disenchanted Students Seek Reform
description: Could you elaborate, Mr. Brewster, on the points you made about disenchant ment with the political process, the rigidity of education, and what is re quired to cope with this.

title: Madame Butterfly Look Flutters Through Rome Fashion Shows
description: ROME, July 12For one giddy week, Rome is where the fashion action is. The Ger mans, the Japanese, the Eng lish, the Americans and the Israelis, among others, have come here to be feted, flat tered and fascinated by the downfall of the hemlines. For plunged they have, all over the placein the salons, where the fall collections are being shown, at the cocktail parties and dinners, where the only alternative to calf or ankle length skirts is pants, and even on the streets, where the interna tional hippie girls have taken to long printed peasant skirts.

title: Red China Orders Bonn Locomotives
description: BONN, July 12A leading West German engineering com pany has signed a contract for delivery of 30 dieselhydraulic locomotives worth 80million marks (about $22million) to Communist China, a spokesman for the company said today.

title: Conscience and the Draft
description: Selective Service Director Curtis W. Tarr has made life somewhat easier for some potential draftees but not for their draft boards with his memorandum de fining criteria for conscientious objection.

title: Kimura Beats South Korean
description: TOKYO, July 12 (AP)Isaac Kimura of Japan outpointed Kao Chenam of South Korea in 10round bantamweight bout in Tokyo today. Kimura weighed 114 4/5 pounds, Kao 114 1/5.

title: Gretel's Designer En Route
description: SYDNEY, Australia, July 12 (Reuters)Alan Payne, the de signer of Gretel II, the Aus tralian America's Cup con tender enplaned tonight for New York. He will try to speed up the yacht's arrival at New port, R.I. for the challenge series with France, Gretel H is aboard a freighter in the Pacific, and not expected at Newport or fore Aug. 5.

title: STOWE PRIZE TAKEN BY GORDON SETTER
Baptists Meet in Tokyo
description: TOKYO, July 12 (AP)The World Baptist Alliance opened the 12th Baptist World Congress in Tokyo today, with Vice Pres ident William R. Tolbert of Liberia addressing 10,000 dele gates from 77 countries. Mr. Tolbert, the alliance president, said there was a growing neces sity for Christian philosophy to purify the world of today, so prone to armed clashes and war.

title: Judith Kinoy Is Bride
description: WILLIAMSVILLE, Vt., July 12The marriage of Miss Ju dith Kinoy, daughter of Ernest Kinoy, playwright and screen writer, and Mrs. Kinoy of Yonkers, to Hyam Barry Sie gel, a junior at Syracuse Uni versity, took place here this afternoon. Rabbi Yechiael Landers performed the cere mony at the Kinoy's summer home.

title: New Books
description: FICTION

title: Suspect Arrested on Coast In a Second Family Slaying
description: LOS ANGELES, July 12 (UPI) The police tonight arrested suspect in the bludgeon deaths of three members of a Los An geles area family. The suspect was identified as Gerard Trent Jr., 24 years old, of Los An geles.

title: Puzzle Card Is the Basis For a Table
description: When Paul Mayen sends out his Christmas greetings, they are small metallic puz zles that recipients are likely to save as art objects once they have put them together.

title: Commission on Productivity
description: In naming the members of his new National Commis sion on Productivity, President Nixon appears to have employed the commission device for one of its most ancient and least worthy purposes: to simulate action while in fact delaying or preventing it.

title: U.S. Team Gains Polo Final
description: MIDHURST, England, July 12 (Reuters)A visiting polo team from Boca Raton, Fla., scored a 109 victory over Stowell Park of England today and qualified for the Gold Cup final, the English polo championship. In the final the American will meet Windsor Park, the cup defender, for which Prince Philip plays.

title: The Carswell Campaign Runs Into Stormy Weather
description: FORT LAUDERDALE, Fla., July 12George Harrold Cars well's first official day on the political stump in Florida began last week just as his nomination to the United States Supreme Court last winter had started out: sunny and clear with no signs of disturbance on the horizon.

title: LAYMEN CRITICIZE PARISH SCHOOL AID
description: LA JOLLA. Calif., July 12 The National Association of Laymen, an organization of 12,000 Roman Catholics, has decided that one of its prime activities this year will be op position to state aid to paro chial schools.

title: Modernizing Marxism
description: Rumanian Communist leader Nicolae Ceausescu seems to believe that a good offense is the best defense. That is the most reasonable interpretation of his remarkable speech following the signing of the SovietRumanian friendship treaty, and the open soub delivered to the Rumanians by Soviet party chief Leonid I. Brezhnev. In this speech Mr. Ceausescu has gone beyond the simple assertion of Rumania's inde pendence. His new theme is the need for a worldwide debate among Communists to modernize their Marxist Leninist ideology and bring it into accord with current realities.

title: New Bedford Gets Curfew To Ease Racial Tensions
description: NEW BEDFORD, Mass., July 12The Mayor of this troubled city today imposed a 9 P.M. to 5 A.M. curfew until further no tice after attempts to develop a black and white dialogue were engulfed in Negro anger.

title: Screen:HelloGoodbye
description: An item titled Hello Goodbye looks and sounds like something that Fran coise Sagan might have thought up during a lunch hour at the Cannes Film Fes tival, scribbled on a small table napkin and peddled to a desperate moviemaker.

title: 5  Work Program By Hoving Troupe Opens Dance Fete
description: NEW LONDON, Conn., July 12The 23d season of the American Dance Festival began with particularly strong per formances here last night in a program by the Lucas Hoving Dance Company.

title: CREALY CONQUERS GOYEN IN SWEDEN
description: BAASTAD, Sweden, July 12 (UPI)Dick Crealy of Australia crushed Georges Goven of France, 63, 61, 61, today in the final of the $33,000 Baas tad Grand Prix tournament.

title: Giants Vs. Eagles Sept. 5
description: PRINCETON, N.J., July 12 (AP)  The annual preseason football game between the New York Giants and the Philadel phia Eagles, arranged by the New Jersey Jaycees, will be held Sept. 5 at Palmer Stadium.

title: Bridge:
description: A partnership that has fourfour fit in both spades and hearts might be forgiven for assuming that either can be selected as the trump suit. But some such fits are more equal than others, as George Orwell might have said. The relative strength of the suit became a factor on the dia gramed deal, which was play ed in the world team cham pionship in Stockholm last month.

title: Jones Outpoints Peralta
description: BUENOS AIRES, July 12 (AP) Eddie Jones of the United States defeated Avenamar Peralta of the Argentine, the South American champion, in a 10round middleweight bout last night.

title: ASBURY PARK STORES DRAW BUYERS AGAIN
description: ASBURY PARK, N.J., July 12 (AP)Business on the beaches and boardwalk of Asbury Park was near normal today. The re sort city was nearly deserted at the start of the weekend be cause of four days of rioting, burning and looting in which 165 people were injured, more than 100 people were arrested and more than $4million worth damage was done.

title: Thomas and Colon Victors In 5,000Meter Races Here
description: Albert Thomas and Tony Colon won 5,000meter runs yesterday in competition con ducted by the Road Runners Club of New York at Van Cort landt Park, the Bronx.

title: JERSEY CENTRAL MEETING PAYROLL
description: The Central Railroad of New Jersey, which had to get finan cial assistance from the Norfolk & Western and Chesapeake & OhioBaltimore & Ohio Rail roads to meet its $1.2million July 3 payroll, expects to be able to meet this Friday's pay roll on its own, according to Clarence Jackman, the line's chief operating officer.

title: Big Vineyards Ready to Talk to Union
description: DELANO, Calif., July 12  Cesar Chavez's fiveyear cam paign to organize farm work ers took a major step forward last week when the big vine yards indicated for the first time that they were interested in negotiating union contracts.

title: London Agog at a Financial Supermarket
description: LONDON, July 12Tradition alists in the City are aflutter over the prospect of a finan icial supermarket crowding into their narrow streets.

title: PETTY SHOWS WAY IN 300 AT TRENTON
description: TRENTON, July 12 (AP) Richard Petty of Randalman, N. C., drove his blue, 1970 Plymouth Superbird to victory today in the Schaefer 300mile NASCAR Grand National race at Trenton Speedway.

title: Cranko Takes Dances to Monte Carlo
description: MONTE CARLO, Monaco, July 12  Ballet is almost as at home at Monte Carlo as gambling, and in fact they have much in common. It was between World War I and World War II that ballet knew its finest days in Monte Carlo, for it was then, first under Serge Diaghilev and later his successors, that the old Ballet Russe used the town, and the Principality of Monaco, as its working base.

title: JERSEY BEST GOES TO ENGLISH SETTER
description: SHORT HILLS, N.J., Juy 12 A bird dog who is flying high on the dog show circuit added another piece of silverware to her owners' collection today. She was named best in a field of 1,348 dogs at the Twin Brooks Kennel Club fixture on The Mall. She is Ch. Canberra's Legend, an English setter owned by Dr. and Mrs. George N. Rosen of Commack, L.I.

title: Israelis Say They Killed The MostWanted Guerrilla
description: TEL AVIV, July 12 (Reuters) The most wanted guerrilla in Israeliheld territory was killed Friday after more than two years at the top of wanted lists, it was announced today.

title: Music:Casals Directs as Marlboro Festival Opens
description: MARLBORO, Vt., July 12 There was a great deal of good music at the two open ing concerts of the Marlboro Music Festival. Indeed, there was nothing but good music. Nevertheless, as is inevitable when so glamorous a veteran as Pablo Casals participates in a program there was one sentimental favorite over the weekend, and that was, of course, Mr. Casals. The 93 yearold cellist conducted Beethoven's Egmont Over ture last night as a sort of warmup, and this afternoon he directed, as the closing number on the program, Bach's Brandenburg Con certo No. 6.

title: Charleston, W. Va.: Homes or a Highway?
description: CHARLESTON, W. Va., July 12This state capital, nestled in the narrow green Kanawha Valley of the Appalachian) Mountains, has become a test, ing ground for the Nixon Ad, ministration's policy of financ ing highways only after ade quate replacement housing is fully ready for people living in the highway's rightofway.

title: Liz Allan Retains Title
description: PINE MOUNTAIN, Ga., July 12 (AP)Liz Allan of Win ter Park, Fla., won her fifth straight women's championship today in the Masters water ski tournament. Rickey McCormick of Independence, Mo., took the men's overall title. Miss Allan is 19 years old and McCor mick 18.

title: MONTHLY FIGURES ISSUED BY CANADA
description: TORONTO, July 12  In the United States, economists and business analysts have talked wistfully for years about getting one comprehensive, monthly figure on the strength of the economy. They still must settle for Washington's quarterly data on the gross national product.

title: 3 More French Newsmen Are Captured in Cambodia
description: PNOMPENH, Cambodia, July 12 (Agence FrancePresse)A threeman French television team was captured by a Viet cong patrol near the historic ruins of Angkor Wat in north eastern Cambodia last week, bringing to 23 the number of newsmen missing in the Cam bodian war.

title: S.E.C. Suit Asks Receiver For Boone Fried Chicken
description: LEXINGTON, Ky., July 12 (AP)Two corporations and six men connected with them, including Albert B. Chandler, former Senator from Kentucky, are being sued by the Securities and Exchange Commission.

title: BONDPRICE CLIMB MAY SLOW A BIT
description: Bond prices are going to con tinue to rise, but not as fast as they have for the last four weeks.

title: WILLIAM SALZMAN, JUDAIC SCHOLAR
description: NORWALK, Conn., July 12 William Salzman, former presi dent of the Standard Bag Cor poration and a founder of insti tutions concerning Hebrew studies, died at Norwalk Hospi tal yesterday. He was 87 years old and lived at 1120 Park Ave nue.

title: Lubell Says Study Of '69 Voting Here Shows Racial Trend
description: A new study asserts that the pattern in New York City's vot ing for Mayor last year indi cates that the polarization of racial feeling has become prob ably the strongest political force agitating New York City's voters.

title: BEMAN'S 276 WINS MILWAUKEE OPEN
description: MILWAUKEE, July 12 (AP)  Deane Beman shot a three underpar 69 today and post ed a threestroke victory in the $110,000 Milwaukee open golf tournament.

title: Col. Clayton E. Wheat. 88. Chaplain at West Point
description: ORMOND BEACH, Fla., July 12Col. Clayton E. Wheat, for mer chaplain and head of the English department at the United States Military Academy at West Point, died yesterday here, where he had resided in recent years. He was 88 years old.

title: Letters to the Editor of The Times
description: Senators Back National Health Plan

title: Brookville's Overtime Goal Halts Westbury in Polo, 65
description: BETHPAGE, L. I., July 12 Sixteenyearold Peter Hender son Jr. scored in suddendeath overtime today to give the Brookville polo team a 65 vic tory over Westbury at Beth page State Park.

title: DOCK LABOR TALKS RESUME IN BRITAIN
description: LONDON, July 12 (UPI)  Representatives of British dockworkers and their employ ers resumed talks today amid apparently waning prospects, that the country's first total port shutdown in 44 years could be averted.

title: RACES SHORTENED FOR LACK OF WIND
description: NEWPORT, R.I., July 12  It's a little early to start calling Heritage a Southern Belle, but at least she's not an absolute wall flower anymore.

title: Village Youths Find Friend in Doctor
description: Jofrey Arlen, M.D., does not have an answering service, but he sleeps on a mattress on the floor in the back of his office. His head is usually off the pil low at the first ringing of the doorbell by a patient on a bad trip.

title: Sports Guide Magazine Is Coming
description: The publisher and managing editor of Jock, New York the local sports magazine that was recently suspended and soldwill soon be corning out with an altogether new magazine called Sports Guide.

title: Canada's Equestrian Team Defeats France in Jumpoff
description: LA BAULE, France, July 12 (Reuters)Canada won the cup of Nationsthe final event at the Internaional horse and jumping show tonight after iumooff with France.

title: Miss Dorfman, Art Librarian, Becomes Bride
description: POCANTTCO HILLS, N. Y., July 12Miss Nancy Lee Dorfman and William Laurens Pressly Jr. were married here this afternoon in the Union Church by the Rev. Marshall L. Smith.

title: Rossiter Funeral Services Set for Tomorrow at Cornell
description: ITHACA, N.Y., July 12 (AP) A funeral service is scheduled Tuesday at Cornell University for Clinton I. Rossiter 3d, poli tical scientist and expert on the American Presidency who died yesterday at the age of 52. The noon service will be conducted at Sage Chapel.

title: CITY WEIGHS PLAN TO RUN BUILDINGS
description: The city is considering a plan under which apartment house strikers would return to oper ate essential services, and the city would collect rents to pay them.

title: Political Steps to End War Are Urged by Montgomery
description: WASHINGTON, July 12 (AP) Cyrus S. Eaton, the Cleveland industrialist and longtime advo cate of closer ties with the So viet Union, said today that the famed British soldier, Field Marshal Viscount Montgomery believed a political end to the war in Vietnam is the only pos sible way to end that war.

title: Agency Seeking Foster Homes for Black and Puerto Rican Children Gets Warm Response in South Bronx
description: Most people who happen to visit the South Bronx only see the garbagestrewn streets, the burnedout decaying buildings and the hundreds of people who have crossed the border into despair. They think of the high crime rate, of the welfare roll and of drug addiction, which is rampant in the area.

title: Money Problems Peril Curriculum Changes
description: We hear a lot about the financial plight of the university, but there is hardly an area where people aren't now talking about financial stringency. Just how critical is the financial stringency of colleges and universities and what can be done about it?

title: Black Academy Names 3 Leaders to Hall of Fame
description: The Black Academy of Arts and Letters announced yester day that three prominent black Americans will be enrolled in its newly established Hall of Fame.

title: JURY APPEARS SET AT MANSON TRIAL
description: LOS ANGELES, July 13 (UPI) The selection of 12 perma nent jurors was apparently com pleted today at the murder trial of Charles Manson and three young women members of his family.

title: Beck Retains First Place In Modern Pentathlon
description: SAN ANTONIO, Tex., July 13 (UPI)Dr. Bob Beck of San Antonio shot 194 out of a pos sible 200 today to maintain his lead in the United States mod ern pentathlon championship at Fort Sam Houston.

title: STOCKS IN LONDON SHOW SLIGHT GAIN
description: Prices on the London stock market closed moderately higher yesterday on the strength of Wall Street's firm ness on Friday and cautious optimism for avoiding a threatened strike by British dock workers.

title: Boy, 4, Is Killed in Fire
description: A 4yearold boy was killed and his mother and father were injured yesterday in a fire in the family's basement apart ment at 159 West 78th Street, near Columbus Avenue. The body of the boy, James Major, was found in the bedroom.

title: Daughter Is Born to Steven A. Seidens
description: A daughter was born to Mr. and Mrs. Steven Arnold Seiden of New York last Fri day in the Lenox Hill Hos pital. Mrs. Seiden is the for mer Miss Katherine Curtis Cohen. daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Paul A. Cohen of New York. The child, the couple's second daughter, who is a granddaughter also of Mrs. Leon Sciden of New York and the late Mr. Sciden, is named Hilary Anne. Her father is partner in Herzfeld & Stern, members of the New York Stock Exchange.

title: Cambodians, Fighting at Resort, Report Many in Garrison Killed
description: PNOMPENH, Cambodia, Tues day, July 14 (Reuters)Cam bodian troops were reported today to have fought their way into the beleaguered resort of Kirirom, but to have arrived too late to save many of the 400 man garrison in the town.

title: A Zambian Government Report Indicates Big New Copper Find
description: LUSAKA, Zambia  Hopes have been raised for develop ment of a big new Zambian copper mine 100 miles north of Lusaka on old workings.

title: Two Schoolboys Get OnceinaLifetime Chance With Tennis Masters
description: On the green UniTurf court in the Felt Forum yes terday, Richard (Pancho) Gonzales yelled across the net to Francisco (Pancho) Se gura as two 15yearold high school tennis champions joined them for a practice session.

title: Jewish Leader Hails Nixon On His Middle East Policy
description: President Nixon was praised yesterday by the chairman of the Conference of Presidents of Major American Jewish Organi zations for leaving no ground for miscalculation to a poten tial aggressor in the Middle East.

title: PICKER CAPTURES 6TH TRIAL IN ROW
description: NEWPORT, R.I., July 13  Intrepid's second promotional button in the Americ's Cup trials has already been pro grammed: Catch 22.

title: U.S. Vietnam Force Cut to 411,500
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, July 13  The United States com mand reported today that the number of American troops in, South Vietnam had dropped to 411,500, the lowest in more than three years.

title: PRESSURES FELT BY BANK CONCERNS
description: The last four of the nation's top 10 banking organizations to disclose their profits for the first half of 1970 reported yes terday.

title: JAMAICAN ATTACKS NATIONALIZING PLAN
description: Robert Lightbourne, Jamai ca's Minister of Trade and In dustry, yesterday sharply criti cized a recommendation for the nationalization of banks and mining and other enterprises in the Caribbean.

title: U.S. Gives Mexico Aircraft and Funds To Fight Narcotics
description: SAN DIEGO, July 13  The United States gave Mexico $1 million in aircraft and financial aid today for control of drug traffic across the border.

title: CINERAMA TO BUY PLUME & ATWOOD
description: Cinerama. Inc., announced yesterday an agreement in principle to acquire Perfect Film and Chemical Corpo ration's 50.5 per cent stock in terest in Plume & Atwood In dustries. Inc.

title: Rome Fashion Harks Back to America's Past
description: ROME, July 13On the way to the showings in the couture salons one passes furniture shops with gleam ing white plastic wares that turn up in the most tradi tional homes in the form of globular lamps or translucent ice buckets. But the fashion people have turned their backs on the ugly, polluted, overpopulated modern world.

title: Miss Deborah F. Wynne Engaged
description: SEASIDE PARK, N. J., July 13Mr. and Mrs. Kenneth Wynne Jr. of North Haven, Conn., and Seaside Park, N. J., have announced the engage ment of their daughter, Miss Deborah Fielding Wynne, to John Robert Lewis, son of Mr. and Mrs. Clyde Lewis of Poughkeepsie, N. Y. The wedding is planned for No vember in Hamden.

title: Unprofessional Conduct
description: A policeman's vote is as free as any other citizen's. As an individual, he has the right that anyone else has to endorse a candidate for public office and to make known his choice. While these are his privileges as a citizen, it is essential that they be kept separate from his status as an officer of the law. Certainly they ought not to be exercised on his behalf by a professional policemen's organization.

title: Hartford Will Accept Credit Card for Towing
description: HARTFORD, July 13 (UPI) Beginning today, parking offenders can use credit cards to pay towing costs.

title: ITALIANAMERICANS PROTEST AT N.B.C.
description: About 150 ItalianAmericans picketed the offices of the Na tional Broadcasting Company at 49 West 49th Street, for three hours yesterday evening to pro test alleged defamation of Ital ians by a program shown on Channel 4 Sunday evening.

title: STEEL PRODUCTION RISES 0.7% IN WEEK
description: Steel production rose last week by 0.7 per cent over out put the week before, the Ameri can Iron and Steel Institute reported yesterday in Washing ton.

title: Where Hope Lies in Ulster
description: It is a great relief that the Orange Day celebrations in Northern Ireland have been carried off apparently without bloodshed and with only minor acts of law lessness. There is no cause even for temporary com placency, however; an uneasy truce was maintained by the largest British peacekeeping force deployed in the North since the partition of Ireland in 1921, by a virtual state of siege, and by sealing off Catholic areas in the cities.

title: Abortions in City Hospitals Total 64 Over Weekend
description: The City Health and Hospi tals Corporation reported yes terday that 64 abortions had been performed in municipal hospitals over the weekend, that 679 women were awaiting abortions and that 1,324 were awaiting screening for abortion appointments.

title: ROCK FETE PROCEEDS TO BE SHARED HERE
description: The producers of this week end's threeday rock festival on Randalls Island said yesterday that an undisclosed portion of the profit would be contributed to the Young Lords, the White Panthers and other groups for their community projects.

title: PICKETS SHUT DOWN 16 MINES IN 3 STATES
description: CHARLESTON, W. Va., July 13 (AP)  A small group of miners' widows and disabled miners, including a man who lost both legs in a mine acci dent, closed down at least 16 mines in three states today to dramatize their demands for liberalized tension benefits.

title: Suit Accuses F.B.I. of Checking Peace Group's Bank Records
description: The Fifth Avenue Peace Parade Committee has filed a suit in Federal Court charging that the Federal Bureau of In vestigation used confidential bank records to obtain informa tion about opponents of the war in Indochina.

title: The Dollar and the Market
description: The case for increased exchange rate flexibility has been brought home to the United States over the past three years. The political onus traditionally attached to devaluation or even upward revaluation of curren cies led Britain, France and West Germany into over long delays in making needed adjustments. As became increasingly evident that larger adjustments would be necessary, massive waves of speculation shook the West's monetary stability.

title: BIG BOARD REPORT OMITTED INTEREST
description: WASHINGTON, July 13The New York Stock Exchange, in calculating the earnings of its member firms to make its case for an extension of the special surcharge on small orders, did not include a major item of in come for member firms that its own economic consultants said should have been included.

title: VIRGINIA DEMOCRATS PICK NOMINEE TODAY
description: RICHMOND, July 13 (AP) Virginia Democrats will pick a nominee for the Senate from three candidates, rated mod erate to liberal, in a primary election tomorrow. The winner will run against Senator Harry F. Byrd Jr., an independent, and Ray L. Garland, a Repub lican in November.

title: Sports Today
description: BASEBALL

title: Hamlet, Its Men With Vietcong, Resists Pacification
description: BINHSON HAMLET, Souti Vietnam, July 10The trouble in Binhson hamlet is all the missing men. They left to join the Vietcong.

title: Bonn Minister Will Visit London and Washington
description: BONN, July 13Foreign Min ister Walter Scheel of West Germany is expected to fly to London and Washington later this week to discuss the forth coming negotiations between Bonn and Moscow for a treaty on renunciation of force.

title: New RNA Research Is Reported to Aid CancerVirus Study
description: WASHINGTON, July 13 For years scientists have as sumed that the master chemical called DNA always dictated the pattern for transmission of hereditary characteristics. Now it appears that this master chemical of life is sometimes produced on orders from an other chemical.

title: Advertising: Chicago Agency Gets Braniff
description: After a good number of years with a succession of New York ad agencies, Bra niff International of Dallas is taking its advertising account West. Starting Oct. 15 its agency will be Clinton E. Frank, Inc., Chicago. The air line said yesterday that its advertising and promotional budget is $8million a year.

title: Whites Fear Ouster by Indians In Dakota Reservation Dispute
description: NEW TOWN, N.D., July 7 In a sudden reversal of roles, the white homesteaders of this region are living in fear that the Indians will run them off the land.

title: U.S. Plans Inquiry On Trade Accord Of Common Market
description: WASHINGTON, July 13  The Government announced to day an investigation into the possible adverse effects on United States exports of the special trade agreements ne gotiated by the European Eco nomic Community with Morocco and Tunisia.

title: AUTO SALES FELL INJULY 110 PERIOD
description: DETROIT, July 13The four car makers today reported that their dealers delivered 181,491 new United Statestype auto mobiles July 110, down 1 per cent from sales of 183,123 in the yearearlier period.

title: William Hoeferlin Is Dead; Mapmaker, 72. Led Hikers
description: ORANGEBURG, N.Y., July 13  William Hoeferlin, who mapped out and maintained over 50 trails in New York State and New Jersey died yes terday, apparently after a heart attack while leading his hiking group, the Wanderbirds, near the Hudson River here. He was 72 years old and lived at 556 Fairview Avenue, Ridgewood, Queens.

title: COLLEGE HEARINGS TO OPEN TOMORROW
description: WASHINGTON, July 13 Two university presidents and two student leaders will be among the first witnesses Wednesday when the new Pres ident's Commission on Campus Unrest begins three days of televised public hearings.

title: Trade War With Europe
description: PARIS, July 13The warning is being heard with in creasing frequency, almost as if the forces have irreversibly been set in motion: The United States and the Euronean Economic Community are on the brink of a trade war.

title: Australian Predicts Big Profit For City in Offtrack Betting
description: R. Kenneth Davis, general manager of the offtrack bet ting system for the State of Victoria in Australia, predicted yesterday that New York City would net $2billion in the next decade from offtrack betting.

title: Hirohito Visits Expo Again
description: OSAKA, Japan, July 13 (AP) Emperor Hirohito and Em press Nagako paid their second visit to Expo '70 today and toured the Dutch and Swiss Government pavilions.

title: INJURED ALLSTARS CREATE CONCERN
description: CINCINNATI, July 13 (UPI) Earl Weaver, the Baltimore manager who is handling the American League players in tomorrow's AllStar Game, has an idea for screening those excused from playing because of injuries.

title: Nixon Recalls Radical Days in Reunion With Whittier '34 Classmates
description: WASHINGTON, July 13 (UPI)  President Nixon de scribed himself today as a student radical and failed to recognize at a White House reunion of the Whittier Col lege class of 1934 a girl he once dated. His old class mates called him Mr. Presi dent instead of Dick.

title: Baffle Is Retired to Stud; Injured Leg in Coast Race
description: INGLEWOOD, Calif., July 13 (UPI)  Baffle, winner of the California and Inglewood Hand icaps at Hollywood Park this season, was retired to stud to day because of a leg injury, Johnny Longden, his trainer, announced.

title: Eban Asks Informal Talks With Egyptians on Peace
description: JERUSALEM, July 13For eign Minister Abba Eban of Israel proposed today that Is raeli and Egyptian represent. atives meet informally with out prejudice to their respec tive positions to start breaking the diplomatic deadlock on the Middle East.

title: Executive Changes
description: Herbert J. Grubb has been elected executive vice president of Colonial Penn Life Insurance Company. Prior to joining Colonial Penn in 1968, he was assistant vicepresidentgroup division, Continental Casaulty Company.

title: DR. JACOB M. ROSS, 87, BROOKLYN PRINCIPAL
description: HOLLYWOOD, Fla., July 13, Dr. Jacob M. Ross, former] principal of Midwood High] School in Brooklyn, New York, died in a hospital here yester day. He was 87 years old and lived at 3001 South Ocean Drive.

title: Conners Beats Solomon
description: BURLINGAME, Calif., July 13 (AP)Jim Connors of Los An geles won the 18yearsand under final of the national jun ior hardcour t tennis cham pionships yesterday by defeat ing Harold Solomon of Silver Spring, Md., 64, 75, 64.

title: Umpires Call a Strike
description: ALBUQUERQUE, N. M., July 13 (AP)The city's park and recreation baseball umpires voted 35 to 2 yesterday to strike Wednesday night in an effort to get 50 cents a game more. They now receive $3.50 for working a softball game and $7 for a baseball game.

title: AnnaDietlinde Skazel to Be Bride
description: The engagement of Miss Anna  Dietlinde Skazel to Stephen Edward Gilhuley, son of Mr. and Mrs. Edward John Gilhuley Jr. of Upper Nyack, N. Y., has been announced by the future bride's parents, Mr. and Mrs. Hans Dieter Skazel of Vienna.

title: Court Rules Against Powell In Suit Seeking 2d Primary
description: Representative Adam Clayton Powell was rebuffed yesterday in his legal effort to force new primary election in the 18th Congressional District, where he was narrowly de feated for the Democratic nomi nation by Charles B. Rangel in the June 23 primary.

title: Files for 4th House Term
description: CONCORD, N. H., July 13 (AP)Representative Louis C. Wyman filed today to seek the Republican nomination for a fourth term from New Hamp shire's First Congressional Dis trict.

title: 2 Bodies Lifted From Mine
description: WINTERHAVEN, Calif., July 13 (AP)The bodies of two 20 yearold marines overcome by carbon monoxide in an aban doned gold mine were lifted out of the mine today by sheriff's deputies. The victims were iden tified as Cpl. Robert Knight of Buffalo, and Lance Cpl. George Lopez of Omaha.

title: EMERGENCY CITED AT 14 DWELLINGS IN BUILDING STRIKE
description: The Lindsay administration declared yesterday that emer gencies existed in 14 strike bound East and West Side buildings. It said the buildings were heaped with garbage and lacked elevator service and hot water.

title: Newest Dustin Hoffman: Rock Composer
description: Georgie Soloway has a pri ?? Cessna and lives in a penthouse on top of the Gen eral Motors Building. He is 40 ish, an enormously success ful rock composer. Suddenly, someone named Harry Kel lerman begins to destroy sys tematically all of his person al and professional relation ships by telling everyone what a rat he is.

title: Sports of The Times
description: CINCINNATI, July 13More than three decades ago a couple of Cincinnati pitch ers, Lee Grissom and Gene Schott, made an unforgettable contribution to photo graphic history. For the benefit of enter prising cameramen whose pictures were irresistible to newspapers throughout the country, the two prankish players stepped into a rowboat at the old Red Leg park, Crosley Field, and rowed the boat over the centerfield fence.

title: SOVIET POSTPONES PARTY'S CONGRESS UNTIL NEXT MARCH
description: MOSCOW, July 13  The Communist party's Central Committee announced today that the 24th party congress would be postponed to next March.

title: Treasury Bill Rates Decline at Weekly Auction
description: WASHINGTON, July 13  Treasury bill rates declined at today's auction from last week's levels, the Goverment reported late this afternoon.

title: EXNEWARK AIDE ACCUSED AT TRIAL
description: TRENTON, JulyA defense witness said under crossexam ination here today that An thony P. LaMorte, former Di rector of Public Works of Newark, who is on trial for ex tortion conspiracy with former Mayor Hugh J. Addonizio, ac cepted a gift of airplane tickets to Florida and free lodging there from a contractor doing business with the city.

title: Notre Dame U. Fills Post of Provost
description: The new position of pro vost at the University of Notre Dame has been filled by the Rev. James T. Burt chaell, the 36yearold chair man of the university's de partment of theology. His appointment is effective Seat. 1.
