title: Spina. Who Opposed Gibson, Gets Newark Police Post
description: NEWARK, July 13 (AP) Dominick A. Spina, former New ark Police Director, who lost his job when Kenneth A. Gib son was elected Mayor last month, was appointed today as staff assistant to the Chief of Police.

title: 747 Skids Off Runway
description: SAN JUAN, P. R., July 13 (UPI)A Pan American Boeing 747 jet skidded off the runway onto soft ground at Isla Verde International Airport today while landing. Passengers were unloaded and taken into the terminal by car. The giant jet suffered no damage and its flight schedule was not inter rupted. There were no injuries.

title: Bridge
description: Psychic bids are rarely at tempted in serious tourna ment play, but there were a few examples in the recent world pair championship in Stockholm. The diagramed deal was perhaps the only case in which both pairs tried to steal from each other, and the result was distinctly comical.

title: The Proceedings In the U.N. Today
PRINCETON NAMES NEGRO HEAD COACH
description: PRINCETON. N. J, July 13  Lawrence T. Ellis, dean of boys and coach of track and crosscountry at Jamaica High School in Queens was named today as Princeton University's as bead coach of track and crosscountry.

title: Begins Prosecution of a Suit Clark Filed on Segregation
description: U.S. RENEWS FIGHT ON I.L.A. IN TEXASHOUSTON, July 13  The Nixon Administration began prosecuting today an 18 monthold suit charging the In ternational Longshoremen's As sociation with illegally main taining 37 segregated union lo cals in Texas.

title: HOLIFIELD CONDEMNS NUCLEAR PLANT PLAN
description: OAK RIDGE, July 13 Rep resentative Chet Holifield, Dem ocrat of California who is chair man of the Congressional Joint Committee on Atomic Energy, joined Senator Albert Gore. Democrat of Tennessee, tonight in denouncing what they said was the Nixon Administration's proposal to seal the nation's only nuclear fuel plants.

title: Pearl River G.I. Dies in War
description: WASHINGTON, July 13 (AP) The Defense Department an nounced today that Pfc. William T. Dorsey of Pearl River, N. Y., of the Army, had been killed in action in Southeast Asia.

title: Book by de Gaulle Finished
description: PARIS, July 13 (AP)Former President Charles de Gaulle has finished the first volume of a planned series of three books that will constitute memoirs of his 11 years as head of the French state. His publisher, Plon of Paris, said the volume, entitled Le Renouveau,The Renewalwould appear in the autumn. It will cover the for mer President's activities from 1958 to 1962.

title: LOCAL ROLE URGED IN ROAD PROGRAM
description: WASHINGTON, July 13  Donald H. Elliott, chairman of the New York City Planning Commission, urged Congress to day to give local governments a greater voice in the planning of Federal highway projects.

title: Daroff Officer Appointed
description: Nicholas Mancini has been appointed vice president for production and quality of H. Daroff & Sons, a subsidiary of Botany Industries, Inc. He suc ceeds Michael Mutolesc, who died last week.

title: RICHARD C. HEMINGWAY
description: LARCHMONT, N.Y., July 13  Richard Christian Heming way, president and director of Newsrad, Inc., an electronic concern in New York, died at his home here today, appar ently of a heart attack. He was 61 years old.

title: 5 British Sailors Accused Of Mutiny Over a Sitdown
description: LONDON, July 13 (Reuters) Five British sailors aboard minesweeper, the Iveston, were charged with mutiny today over a sitdown protest they allegedly made because they considered their ship had been too long at sea.

title: U.S. TROOP CUT PLAN ASSAILED BY SEOUL
description: SEOUL, South Korea, July 13 (AP)  Premier Chung II Kwon said today he and all 19 members of his Cabinet would resign if the United States carried out a plan for a reduction of 20,000 troops in South Korea.

title: June Wood Ailing Plans Nuptials
description: BRONXVILLE, N. Y., July 13  Mr. and Mrs. Arthur Davies Wingebach have an nounced the engagement of Mrs. Wingebach's daughter, Miss June Wood Ailing, to Samuel Hunter Richey, son of Mrs. C. Buff Scott of Rye and John M. Richey of New York and Bridgehampton, L. L The wedding is planned for Sep tember.

title: PETER J. COLLINS
description: NORWALK, Conn., July 13 Teter J. Collins, architect and engineer, died yesterday at Norwalk Hospital. He was 61 years old and lived at 68 Can terbury Lane in Walton.

title: New Burlington Division
description: To consolidate its sales of homefurnishing products, Burl ington Industries, Inc., has formed a division called Burl ington House Consumer Prod ucts. Raymond E. Kassar, a Burlington group vice presi dent, will coordinate product marketing and styling. Horace Jones, Burlington executive vice president, will he the group's senior executive.

title: Letters to the Editor of The Times
description: British Election

title: A NIXON JOB OFFER IS HELD REBUFFED
description: WASHINGTON, July 13 The White House choice for di rector of Volunteers in Service to America is reported to have rejected the appointment be cause of sharp disagreement with President Nixon's Indo china and domestic policies.

title: Fire on Harlem Bridge Delays 45,000 on Penn Central Up to 2 Hours
description: At least 45,000 Westchester County and Connecticut com muters were delayed up to two hours yesterday morning by a fire on the Penn Cen tral's Harlem River draw bridge. Railroad officials said it was the worst tieup on the line in at least two years.

title: Tenants in Struck Apartments Find Garbage Disposal Difficult
description: For thousands of tenants in struck apartment houses here, a major problem is garbage, disposal.

title: Police and Strikers Clash
description: ST. JOSEPH, Mich., July 13 (AP)The police clashed with 300 picketers outside the strike bound Whirlpool plant in St. Joseph today, and one man was reported injured in the scuffle. The picketers, members of Local 1918 of the International Asso ciation of Aerospace Workers and Machinists, had gathered at the plant's main gate in an ticipation of a backtowork movement by some employes.

title: False Beard Affronts A Blue Law in London
description: LONDON, July 13 (AP) Emlyn Williams, the British actor, got permission to read some works of Charles Dick ens tonight at a special per formance at the Royal Festi val Hall here.

title: Newcombe Gains 3d Round
description: HOYLAKE, England, July 13 (Reuters)  The Wimbledon champion, John Newcombe of Australia, sailed through his secondround match in the North of England tennis cham pionships today.

title: Bradshaw of Steelers Suffers Leg Injury in AllStar Practice
description: PITTSBURGH, July 13 (UPI), The Pittsburgh Steelers said that Terry Bradshaw, theirs rookie quarterback, suffered a minor injury today in a work out for the College AllStar Game at Chicago and would be brought back here for an examination.

title: L. I. Press Rises to 10 Cents
description: The Long Island Press, an afternoon daily with a daily circulation of 440,000, raised its newsstand price yesterday to 10 cents, up from a nickel. The price of its Sunday edition will remain 30 cents, the paper announced. The Press said that recent wage settlements was a consideration in raising its newsstand price, which had been 5 cents since 1950.

title: Lawyer Tells Court City Has Need for Commission Investigating Police Corruption
description: Arguing that police corrup tion occasionally reaches ende mic conditions here, a lawyer for t he city said yesterday that the special investigating commission appointed by the Mayor was needed to develop methods to prevent such graft.

title: Pettifoggery Is Laid to U.S. Negotiators
description: WASHINGTON, July 13Pet tiffogery has hampered Ameri can conduct of international negotiations over the years, an authority on the art of nego tiating has told the Senate.

title: California Father Charged In Bludgeon Slayings of 2
description: SAN GABRIEL, Calif, July 13 (AP)Siegfried Fred Senff, a 38yearold, Germanborn father of two, was charged today with murder, attempted murder and arson in the clawhammer at tack on his family and subse quent house fire, the police said.

title: 69 DERAILING LAID TO BUCKLED TRACK
description: The National Transportation Safety Board said yesterday that the buckling of a welded steel rail was the probable cause of a highspeed passen ger train derailment at Glenn Dale, Md., on June 28, 1969.

title: Baseball Transactions
description: NATIONAL LEAGUE

title: COURT SETS HEARING IN COACH LINES CASE
description: Judge Edward C. McLean of the Federal District Court here yesterday ordered a hearing Thursday on a proposed settle ment of condemnation proceed ings involving Fifth Avenue Coach Lines, Inc., and its sub sidiary, Surface Transit, Inc.

title: REPEAL OF A.S.P. BLOCKED IN HOUSE
description: WASHINGTON, July 13  The House Ways and Means Committee rejected today a major provision of the Nixon Administration's trade bill the provision to repeal the American Selling Price sys tern of customs valuation.

title: FROEHLING UPSETS M'MILLAN, 64, 63
description: WASHINGTON, July 13 (AP) The three topranked Amer icans, led by Stan Smith of Los Angeles, registered victories today in the first round of the $35,000 Washington Star inter national tennis tournament.

title: EQUAL HIRING UNIT HIT BY M'CLELLAN
description: WASHINGTON, July 13 Senator John L. McClellan, Democrat of Arkansas, charged the Equal Employment Oppor tunity Commission today with harrassment of businesses and exceeding Congressional intent in using its authority.

title: United Funds Take New Name and Call For Wider Program
description: The United Funds and Coun cil of America announced here yesterday that it had changed its name to the United Way of America.

title: Party Backs Andreotti's Bid To Form a Cabinet in Rome
description: ROME, July 13  Premier designate Giulio Andreotti re ceived the formal endorsement of his own party, the Christian Democrats, today for an at tempt to rebuild a governing coalition.

title: U.S. RULING CLEARS FANNY MAY'S BOARD
description: WASHINGTON, July 13 (UPI) The Justice Department ruled today that Gen. Lucius D. Clay, board chairman, and three other directors of the Federal National Mortgage Association had not violated conflictofin terest laws even though they were associated with concerns doing business with Fanny May.

title: 2 Coast Heart Patients Die
description: PALO ALTO, Calif., July 13 (AP)The deaths of two heart transplant patients over the weekend were announced today by the Stanford University Medical Center. Francis J. Mc Mahon, 50 years old, of Ather ton, who received a new heart May 21, died Saturday. Irwin Donald Louderback, 49, of San Francisco, who received a transplant May 19, died yester day. The causes of death were undetermined pending autop sies.

title: Prince Replaces Franco At Funeral of War Hero
description: MADRID, July 13 (AP) Prince Juan Carlos presided In place of Generalissimo Fran cisco Franco today at the fun feral of Capt. Gen Agustin Mufios Grandes, Spanish war hero and a friend of the Chief of State.

title: PERRY EGBERT, 76, EXHEAD OF ALCO
description: ITHACA, N. Y., July 13 Perry T. Egbert, retired chair man of the board and president of Alco Products, Inc., manufac turers of locomotives and other machines, died yesterday at his home here, apparently of a heart attack. He was 77 years old.

title: Marcos Holds Trial of Tribal Chief and Drops 2 Murder Charges
description: MANILA, July 13In an ex traordinary trial in his palace office, President Ferdinand E. Marcos today suspended mur der charges against the chief of a pagan hill tribe accused of killing two members of the Philippine national police.

title: Black Area in Indiana City Calm As Guard Enforces a Curfew
description: MICHIGAN CITY, Ind., Tues day, July 14The streets of this city's North Side black neighborhood were deserted this morning as National Guard troops and the state and local police enforced a 9 P.M.to6 A.M. curfew.

title: AMEX UP SLIGHTLY ON LIGHT VOLUME
description: In a lackluster day, stocks on the American Stock Ex change managed to inch up ward to 19.96 as measured by the exchange's index. The in crease was 0.03 above the close on Friday. Volume was a dull 1,674,940 shares in the slowest day since May 11, when just over 1,600,000 shares changed hands.

title: Crime Bill for Washington Agreed On by Conferees
description: WASHINGTON, July 13A SenateHouse conference com mittee reported out today tough anticrime bill for the Dis trict of Columbia that contains provisions permitting the pre ventive detention of certain suspected criminals and no knock entry by the police.

title: MRS. MITCHELL SAID TO HAVE F.B.I. GUARD
description: President Nixon has ordered Federal Bureau of Investigation protection for Mrs. John N. Mitchell, wife of the Attorney General, but she believes that the families of Cabinet mem bers would be safer living in a protected compound, it was re ported yesterday.

title: BRANDT MEETS POPE ON EASTERN EUROPE
description: ROME, July 13Chancellor Willy Brandt had an audience with Pope Paul VI today and was reported to have received encouragement for West Ger many's policy of seeking im proved relations with Poland and other Eastern European states.

title: In The Nation: For Want of a Horse?
description: ORONO, Me., July 13The Maine election campaign prob ably will do little to change Senator Mike Mansfield's view that the Democrats do not as yet have an agreed challenger or a winner for the Presidential campaign of 1972. A really smashing victory, sweeping the whole Democratic state ticket into office, could give this state's Senator Edmund S. Muskie an important lift; but such a victory may not be in the cards this year.

title: TactFinding in Saigon
description: Under belated pressure from the United States Embassy, the South Vietnamese Government has prom ised provisionally to abolish the inhuman tiger cage punishment cells uncovered by two unorthodox Con gressional investigators, Representatives Augustus F. Hawkins of California, and William R. Anderson of Tennessee. The two Congressmen departed from an otherwise routine factfinding junket to visit the prison and expose the tiger cages which had been described to them by a former prisoner.

title: Rumania Emigration Policy
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, July 13 (AP)The Rumanian Govern ment told the Jordanian Gov ernment today that it allowed only 30 Jews a year to emigrate to Israel, Ahdullah Zurikat, the Jordanian ambassador to Leb anon said. Jordanian news papers in recent days have been criticizing Rumania for allow ing large numbers of her Jewish population, estimated at 100, 000, to leave.

title: ULSTER IS CALM AS 100,000 MARCH
description: BELFAST, Northern Ireland, July 13Pounding drums and waving orange banners, nearly 100,000 marchers trooped past barbedwire barriers in North ern Ireland today to celebrate Protestant control of this tor tured state.

title: House Panel Urges U.S. to Investigate Tiger Cage Cells
description: WASHINGTON, July 13 A House watchdog committee today demanded a prompt and thorough Federal investi gation of conditions at South Vietnam's Con Son Prison, where tigercage imprison ment and savage mistreat ment of human beings was charged last week by two Representatives who visited the scene.

title: Robert Patterson. 54. Dies; Dun & Bradstreet Executive
description: WYCOMB, Pa., July 13  Robert E. Patterson, a market ing executive with Dun & Brad street, Inc., in New York, died after a heart attack while play ing tennis Saturday at the Buckingham Racquet Club. He was 54 years old and lived here for 19 years. Mr. Patterson, who had been with Dun & Brad street since 1935, was director of research and development.

title: Prof. Robert P. Hamilton, 73, Of Columbia Law School, Dies
description: Robert Patrick Hamilton professor emeritus of law at the Columbia University Law School, where he taught for 36 years, died here yesterday at St. Luke's Hospital. Mr. Hamil ton, who lived at 39 Claremont Avenue, was 73 years old.

title: ADM. AUSTIN DOYLE, HELD TAIWAN POST
description: PENSACOLA, Fla., July 13 Vice Adm. Austin K. Doyle, former Chief of Naval Air Training, died today at the Pensacola Naval Air Station Hospital after a short illness. Admiral Doyle, who has lived here ever since he retired from the Navy 12 years ago, was 72 years old.

title: Screen: Quackser Fortune Arrives
METREVELI JOINS U.S. OPEN TENNIS
description: For the first time since 1962 the Russians will compete at Forest Hills. Two men and two women will play in the $160, 000 United States Open tennis championships starting Sept. 2 at the West Side Tennis Club in Queens.

title: New Baseball Symblem, Embol TongueTwister for Awed Kuhn
description: CINCINNATI, July 13As AllStar players gathered for one of baseball's two major annual shows, officials dis played today some of the promotional gimmicks they hope will attract additional attention to the game.

title: Anne P. Bailey Is Future Bride Of S. H. Watters
description: WESTPORT, Conn.. July 13 Miss Anne Purvis Bailey and Stephen Hapgood Wat ters. June graduates of Deni son University, plan to he married on Aug. 29.

title: Article 1  No Title
Neighborhoods: City Island Is Adrift on Growth Plans
description: In 1761, some burghers living on a spindleshaped island in what is now Long Island Sound devised an am bitious plan to develop the place as a booming seaport that could compete with and someday overshadow the then burgeoning city of New York. The scheme failed, but the name chosen for the envi sioned metropolisCity Is landlingers.

title: Wise, Condon and Corwin Win As Juniors Sail at Larchmont
description: LARCHMONT, N. J., July 13 Blaine Wise and Creighton Condon, both of the Larchmont Yacht Club, and Wally Corwin of the American Yacht Club came out of the harrowing sail ing that began the threeday teenaged portion of Larchmont Race Week as winners today.

title: Police Pickets Protest Consulate Duty
description: Offduty policemen carrying placards and an American flag picketed the station of the 19th Precinct on East 67th Street yesterday to protest the use of city policemen for guard duty in front of consulates and United Nations missions in the area.

title: CeylonNorth Korea Link
description: COLOMBO, Ceylon, July 13 The Government of Ceylon has extended full diplomatic recog nition to North Korea. Since it came to power in May, the coalition regime of Mrs. Siri mavo Bandaranaike, the Prime Minister, has recognized East Germany and has pledged to establish full relations with North Vietnam and the provi sional revolutionary govern ment of the Vietcong.

title: APARTHEID BLOCKS A SHOW BY SLEDGE
description: JOHANNESBURG, South Af rica, July 13Percy Sledge, an American Negro soul singer whose popularity on tour here won him special Government permission to appear before white audiences, has come up against the curtain of apartheid in Bloemfontein, capital of the Orange Free State.

title: REFORM DEBATE BEGINS IN HOUSE
description: WASHINGTON, July 13 The House embarked today on what could stretch into weeks of angry debate over changing ageold Congressional proce dures.

title: Washington: For the Record
Garbage Pickup Plan Fails
description: CLEVELAND, July 13 (UPI) Efforts to collect garbage for the first time in a week failed today when truck drivers called in sick in sympathy with strik ing garbage collectors. City of ficials had planned to have the drivers make their regular routes, with residents loading the trucks themselves, but un ion officials told their drivers not to go out unless there was a regular collector on each truck.

title: GREEK LEADER GETS PANEL OF ADVISERS
description: ATHENS, July 13Greece's militarybacked Government announced the formation of 13man board of advisers today to help Premier George Papa dopoulos administer the coun try.

title: SOYBEANS UP LIMIT ON A CROP REPORT
description: Following a Government crop report, issued late Friday, some soybean futures prices rose the daily limit yesterday on the Chicago Board of Trade.

title: Entertainment Events
New Books
description: FICTION

title: Soviet RadioTV Agency Is Raised to Ministry Rank
description: MOSCOW, July 13 (Reuters) The Kremlin today upgraded control of Soviet radio and television by establishing a full government state committee to run it.

title: ARAB SIDE REPORTS REPELLING ISRAELIS
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, July 13 Jordanian and Lebanese mili tary spokesmen reported re pulsing Israeli thrusts today.

title: Books of The Times
description: From the beginning, writes Fredrick W. Turner 3d in his superb introduction to Geronimo's autobiography, the Chiricahua raised their males to be strong, swift, deepchested runners, rustlers of stock and raiders of pack trains, good hiders and dodgers, and implacable haters of nontribal neighbors. Look through any collection of photographs of the Apache and you will see looking out at you faces that neither give nor ask quarter, faces broad and un smiling (what indeed was there to smile at?), set with eyes so deep and hot that they appear almost glazed and strangely milky, and still all these years later seem to scorch the very pages they are printed on. photographs of the Apache and you will see looking out at you faces that neither give nor ask quarter, faces broad and un smiling (what indeed was there to smile at?), set with eyes so deep and hot that they appear almost glazed and strangely milky, and still all these years later seem to scorch the very pages they are printed on.

title: Conservationists Start to Buy An Ecological Gem in Arizona
description: The Nature Conservancy has announced that it has made a $75.000 down payment on a 22squaremile ecological gem Arizona that will be Preserved as a nature sanctuary.

title: Jazz Falls Prey To Electronics In Newport Bill
description: NEWPORT, R. I., July 13 Although rock has been banned from the Newport Jazz Festival by the City Council, the dire effects of the highly amplified elec tronic instruments usually associated with rock linger on. Yesterday, the last day of the threeday festival, a large part of the afternoon program was buried under electronic murk not so much because of the loudness it self but because the elec tronic instruments tend to fuzz together to produce a rasping, unidentifable mush.

title: Westmoreland Visits G.I.'s at Fire Base in Vietnam
description: FIRE SUPPORT BASE VEG HEL, South Vietnam, July 13 Gen. William C. Westmoreland, back in Vietnam for the first time since he left two years ago to be Army Chief of Staff, dropped in today at this post near Hue and voiced optimism about the war.

title: Anne Dolores Davis Is Fiancee Of Richard A. R. Pinkham Jr.
description: RYE, N. Y., July 13Mr. and Mrs. Armand M. Morrell have announced the engage ment of Mrs. Morrell's daugh ter, Miss Anne Dolores Davis, to Richard Alden Ray Pink ham Jr., son of Mr. and Mrs. Pinkham.

title: Last Call for Whales
description: If Japanese influence prevails, as now seems likely, the continued existence of the most fabulous creature on earth is in gravest jeopardy. Supported by the repre sentatives of Russia and Norway, the Japanese mem bers of the International Whaling Commission have flatly rejected a scientifically based proposal that whale quotas be drastically reduced in the Antarctic, where some twofifths of the world's whaling now done.

title: Homemakers of the Future: Marriage Is Only One Goal
description: In junior and senior high schools throughout the coun try, the initials FHA do not usually bring to mind the Federal body in Washington that makes loans to prospec tive home owners. Instead, they refer to the Future Homemakers of America, an organization of 600,000 teen age girls who hope someday to be the wives and mothers of America.

title: Thieves and Vandals Still at Work On Pay Phones, but So Is Company
description: Right now the odds are that at least one of every 10 out door pay phones in Manhattan is out of order and probably is swallowing customers' dimes without yielding so much as penny's worth of service.

title: HAIR CLUE REPORTED AT SLAYING HEARING
description: FORT BRAGG, N. C., July 13 (UPI)An Army hearing of ficer was told today that hair found on a hairbrush in the apartment of Capt. Jeffrey MacDonald, who is accused of slaying his wife and daughters, did not belong to any member of the MacDonald family.

title: SENATORS CLASH WITH RIGHTS AIDE ON NIXON POLICIES
description: WASHINGTON, July 13In a heated confrontation in an echoing Senate hearing room today, the Nixon Administration argued that it was pursuing the only legally permissible school desegregation policy.

title: Big Crime Rise Is Worrying Hong Kong
description: HONG KONG, July 13  A rash of murders by gangs of youths whose favored weapons are triangular files, knives, iron bars and meat cleavers, and the disclosure of official statistics showing a 28 per cent increase in crime over five years have aroused public concern.

title: Pioneer Five Signs Yates
description: PITTSBURGH, July 13 (AP) Don Yates, former basketball star at the University of Min nesota, signed with the Pitts burgh Pioneers of the American Basketball Association today.

title: Computer Manufacturer Also Reports Mark for Revenues
description: The International Business Machines Corporation continued its revenue and earnings growth in the second quarter with the highest results of any quarter in its history. It also lifted its figures for the first half to records, according to the coin pany's midyear report issued yesterday.

title: Senate Extends Health Aid
description: WASHINGTON, July 13 (UPI) The Senate approved by voice vote today a fiveyear extension of Federal programs to improve health care training. The esti mated cost is $591.1million.

title: ALTMAN ACCUSES LANDLORDS HERE
description: Benjamin Altman, the city's Commissioner of Rent and Housing Maintenance, charged yesterday that the apartment house workers strike had been provoked by 22 hardcore, greedy and irresponsible land lords whom he identified by name.

title: Brooke in New Bedford To Ease Racial Tension
description: NEW BEDFORD. Mass., July 13Reports of fires and of confrontations between the po lice and Negroes circulated through the Negro community in the West End here this af ternoon while Negro residents and elected officials held long sessions on ways to head off further violence.

title: RALLY RULE ASKED FOR WHITE HOUSE
description: WASHINGTON, July 13The Government announced today 1 that it was proposing new regu lations to limit the size of demonstrations in front of the White House but to allow un limited public gatherings on the Ellipse and the grounds of the Washington Monument behind the White House.

title: Harvard Gets $622.200
description: CAMBRIDGE, Mass., July 13 (AP) Harvard University an nounced receipt today of grants totaling $622,200 for its Ken nedy School of Government. The grants were $600,000 from the Alfred P. Sloan Foundation of New York and $22,200 from the Russell Sage Foundation, the announcement said.

title: INCREASE IS URGED IN MONEY SUPPLY
description: WASHINGTON, July 13 Two former Government econ omists urged today that the Federal Reserve Board permit a somewhat greater increase in the money supply than was the case in the first half of this year, partly in order to help restore liquidity in the economy.

title: EXPERIENCED MEN MUST AWAIT PACT
description: The 26 National Football League teams have agreed to prohibit experienced players from reporting to training camp, pending a settlement in continuing negotiations with the N.F.L. Players Association.

title: LAST OF TROOPERS LEAVE ASBURY PARK
description: ASBURY PARK, N. J., July 13 (AP)This seashore community returned closer to normal to day, following racial disturb ances, with the withdrawal of the last of the State Police troopers called to help quell the disorders.

title: ROMNEY EXPECTS HOUSING SUCCESS
description: WASHINGTON, July 13 (AP)  George Romney, Secretary of Housing and Urban Develop ment, said today that he fully expected to reach by next year an annual goal of producing 600,000 federally assisted low income housing units.

title: PowersGentile Total 284 to Win Ike Golf Team Title by 8 Shots
Bishop Freed by Red China May Go to Meet Pope Paul
description: HONG KONG, July 13 (AP) The Most Rev. James E. Walsh, a Roman Catholic bishop freed by Communist China three days ago after 12 years in prison, may he flown to Rome for a meeting with Pope Paul VI when the doctors decide he is fit to travel.

title: Dance Festival Wins Friends at Home
description: NEW LONDON, Conn. July 13  Connecticut College's American Dance Festival, for more than two decades the hallowed ground upon which the giants of moderndance have created some of their best work, is breaking ground as well as sanctifying it this year.

title: Nixon Picks Ambassador To Serve in Pnompenh
description: WASHINGTON, July 13 President Nixon has decided to step up diplomatic relations with the new Cambodian Gov ernment of Premier Lon Nol by naming Emory C. Swank, a senior diplomat, as the first United States Ambassador to Cambodia since 1965.

title: F.B.I. Brands Black Panthers Most Dangerous of Extremists
description: WASHINGTON, July 13The Federal Bureau of Investigation today branded the Black Pan ther party as the country's most dangerous and violence prone of all extremist groups.

title: 69 BY WRIGHT LEADS L.I. GOLF BY STROKE
description: CEDARHURST, L. I., July 13  Jimmy Wright of Inwood, began his quest today for the Long Island Professional Golf ers Association 54hole medal play championship with a 34, 35  69 over the par 35. 35  70 Rockaway Hunting Club. layout that measures 6,304 vards.

title: Jersey CleanAir Unit Asks Limitations on Use of Autos
description: TRENTON, July 13 (AP) The New Jersey Clean Air Council recommended today that the state place limitations on the use of automobiles, trucks and buses to alleviate what it called a highly danger ous airnollution condition.

title: State, Citing Blast, Tells Con Ed to Fix Gas Leaks
description: The Public Service Commis sion ordered the Consolidated Edison Company yesterday to reduce the everpresent haz ard of underground explosions by setting up a more effective system of detecting and repair ing naturalgas leaks.

title: More Concerns Cut Prices of Products Containing Copper
description: Several more major compa nies announced yesterday that they were reducing prices for copper and brass mill products by three cents a pound of cop per content and by one cent a pound lead content.

title: UNESCO Bars Germans
description: GENEVA, July 13  The United Nations Economic and Social Council refused today to give a seat to East Germany on the world organizations Economic Commission for Eu rope.

title: The Rent Controller
description: In February, 1969, a mild mannered Reform Democrat from the Bronx named Ben jamin Altman rose on the floor of the Assembly to re buke Mayor Lindsay for pussyfooting around with rent control for uncontrolled apartments. Rent control and 1.5 million people have gone by the boards while the Mayor sat hack and did nothing to protect them from rent gouging, the As semblyman charged. Eighteen months later, Mr. Altman is Mayor Lindsay's Commis sioner of Rent and Housing Maintenance, the second ranking housing job in the city (the first is that of Hous ing and Development Ad ministrator). In the post, to which he was appointed in January, the 51yearold ad ministrator is charged with handling the explosive rent control issure.

title: U.S. Aides See Evidence Hanoi Troops Shift South
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, July 13American intelligence of ficials have turned up evidence of a movement toward South Vietnam by some North Viet namese regiments well north of the demilitarized zone.

title: 2 CITY BANKS SEEK YONKERS OFFICES
description: The Manufacturers Hanover Trust Company and the Chem ical Bank, expecting that a pending merger will enable New York City institutions to establish branches in Yonkers, have applied for permission to open offices in the Westchester city, the weekly bulletin of the New York State Banking De partment disclosed yesterday.

title: Striking Blacks in Jackson, Miss., Fight Evictions
description: JACKSON, Miss., July 13 In the hot, stuffy meeting hall of this city's striking refuse collectors, two young Missis sippi lawyersone black and one whitehave taken 15 legal cases from lowsalaried black workmen to help them avoid evictions and foreclosures on household item loans.

title: Montgomery Asserts Eaton Broke Confidence on Nixon
description: LONDON, July 13 (UPI) Field Marshal Viscount Mont gomery said today that the United States industrialist, Cy rus S. Eaton, had broken a con fidence in making public a let ter saying President Nixon was totally unfit to be Commander in Chief of the United States armed forces.

title: JUNIOR GOLF MEDAL WON BY ZAHRINCER
description: WHITE PLAINS, N. Y., July 13George Zahringer of Rye Golf Club; Ronald Goldberg, Split Rock, and Gary Spears, Port Jervis, scored 78's today at the Knollwood County Club and led the way through the Westchester sectional qualify ing round of the New York State junior golf championship. Zahringer was named medalist after a match of the cards.

title: Queens Liberals ReElect Shaw After Dispute Over State Control
description: The Liberal party in Queens reelected J. Stanley Shaw as its county chairman last night at a turbulent meeting marked by charges of boss control at the state level.

title: South Africa's 600,000 Indians Having a Bitter Time
description: PHOENIX, South Africa, July 1The multiracial Mahatma Gandhi Memorial Center here stands as a challege to the in creasingly segregated society around it.

title: American Eagle Is First To Finish Mackinac Sail
description: MACKINAC ISLAND, Mich., July 13 (AP)  The 12Meter sloop American Eagle was the first across the finish line today in the annual Port Huronto Mackinac race, but on correct ed times Charisma of Chicago was the overall winner in Class A.

title: STOCK PRICES RISE AS VOLUME DRAGS
Congress Fund Bill Voted
description: WASHINGTON, July 13 (AP) The Senate passed today bill appropriating $413.9million to finance the salaries and op erations of Congress during the current budget year. The bill was sent to a joint conference committee that will work out differences with the lower ver sion passed earlier by the House.

title: NEW GROUP TO BACK A BILL TO END WAR
description: WASHINGTON, July 13 (AP) A citizens committee was set up today to organize grass roots support for a bill to re quire United States withdrawal from Indochina.

title: Airline Agency Puts Rise hi '69 Passengers at 11.5%
description: MONTREAL, July 13 (Cana dian Press)The International Air Transport Association to day reported an 11.5 per cent Increase in total scheduled pas senger traffic by member air lines in 1969. The Montreal based organization has 104 member airlines91 active and 13 associatein 85 countries.

title: COURT DISMISSES UMPIRES' APPEAL
description: The United States Court of Appeals for the Second Circuit ruled yesterday that two um pires fighting their discharge by the American League were not victims of an antitrust vio lation.

title: Market Place:
description: It may well be that the best thing the economy and the stock market have going for them is the prohibitively costly burden of waging war in Indochina.

title: Rev. John Warren. Rector Of Christ Church on L. I.
description: ALBUQUERQUE, N.M., July 13The Rev. John N. Warren, rector of Christ Episcopal Church in Oyster Bay, L.I.. for 27 years, died here today after a long illness.

title: Proxmire Demands Goldwater Withdraw Charge on Secrecy
description: WASHINGTON, July 13  A sharp dispute over charges that a Senator had made public highly classified information on the Army's electronic battle field project broke out on the Senate floor today.

title: CENSUS RECHECKING ARRANGED IN STATE
description: WASHINGTON, July 13 (AP) Any city or town in New York State can demand and get a census recheck, Representa tive Daniel E. Button. Republi can of New York, said today.

title: SERVER TO START AGAINST PALMER
QUEENS DEMOCRATS NAME BLACK LEADER
description: The Queens County Demo cratic Committee designated its first black chairman last night, elevating Assemblyman Guy Brewer from vice chairman to the post formerly held by Ralph De Marco. Mr. De Marco will seek election later this week as Queens County Democratic leader.

title: High Court in Boston Allows Car Insurance Rates to Rise!
description: BOSTON, July 13 (AP)Mas sachusetts motorists will have to pay an estimated total of $23million in additional insur ance premiums this year as the result of a ruling today by the State Supreme Judicial Court.

title: U.N. YOUTH PARLEY CURBS TWO GROUPS
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., July 13Youthful participants from South Vietnam and Na tionalist China were denied the right to speak at the World Youth Assembly today, prompt ing 30 delegates from 19 coun tries to walk out in protest.

title: Du Pont, in Reversal, Restores Drug to Addiction Researchers
description: E. I. du Pont de Nemours & Co., the giant chemical pro ducer, said today that it was reversing a decision taken only last week that would have cut off supplies of a drug to re searchers who think it may prove effective in the treat ment of heroin addicts.

title: Noccalula Named 8th Starter In $125,000 International Trot
F.T.C. Confirms Decree On SCM's Sales Methods
description: The SCM Corporation said yesterday that the Federal Trade Commission had com pleted a review of SCM's office copier marketing practices by upholding a provisional order issued in April.

title: The Rolling Crepe Is a Broadway Hit
description: The Rolling Crepe has come to Broadway, and it's not a singing group but a Volkswagen microbus parked at 115th Street offering crepes filled with chicken and sherry or ratatouille or spiced apple. sherry or ratatouille or spiced apple.

title: McDonnell Douglas Withdraws Offering of Notes at This Time
description: Corporations with mediumgrade credit ratings are find ing it increasingly difficult to borrow money. This trend, which started when the Penn Central Transportation Com pany tiled for reorganization on June 21, became more evident yesterday.

title: Pyongyang Cabinet Shuffled
description: TOKYO, July 13 (AP)North Korea announced a cabinet re shuffle today in which Pak Sung Chul, the Foreign Minis ter, was shifted to the new post of Second Deputy Premier. The North Korean Central News Agency said that Mr. Pak was succeeded by Ho Dam, who has been Deputy Foreign Minister since 1962. Japanese observers interpreted Mr. Pak's new ap pointment as a promotion.

title: President Will Attend AllStar Game Tonight
description: WASHINGTON, July 13 President Nixon will throw out two first balls at the annual AllStar Game in Cin cinnati tomorrow nightone each for the American and National Leagues.

title: Penn Central Told To Hold a Dividend
description: Federal Judge John P. Fullam of the District Court in Phila delphia directed the Penn Cen tral Transportation Company yesterday to segregate and hold in escrow, subject to further court orders, the $1.50ashare dividend payable tomorrow on the common stock of the Pitts burgh & Lake Erie Railroad.

title: CONSULTANTS DID 10 BRIDGE STUDIES
description: A $50.000 study of Queens boro Bridge traffic is the fifth such study since 1968, the eighth since 1963 and the 10th since 1948.

title: Real Shells Adorn This Gold Jewelry
description: Bucherer, a Swiss con cern that makes and sells watches and fine jewelry, has opened its first shop in this country with an exhi bition of jewelry that looks like the cache of a mermaid. The pieces are the work of Gilbert Albert, an award winning European jewelry designer and craftsman. For its first retail ven ture out of its own country, where there are 12 Bu cherer shops, the 82year old, familyowned company chose the plaza of the Gen eral Motors Building at Fifth Avenue and 59th Street. Mr. Albert's jewelry, mostly twisted and textured ribbons of moltenlooking gold, is set with such unusual stones as highly polished seashells. There are also sev eral pieces set with what are believed to be meteorites.

title: Senegal Charges Incursion
description: DAKAR, Senegal, July 13 (Agence FrancePresse)  The Senegal Government charged today that Portuguese troops seized 10 hostages from a vil lage in Senegal July .. and took them back across the frontier into Portuguese Guinea. The in cident was said to have taken place at the village of Sare Sory after a Portuguese bom bardment.

title: British Dockers Cancel Strike And Set Vote on Contract Offer
description: LONDON, July 13 (UPI) Britain's longshoremen can celed a call for the first na tionwide dock strike in 44 years tonight four hours before it was to begin and agreed to con sider a revised contract offered by port managers.

title: American Can Co. Cites Peak in Its Profits and Volume
description: Records in sales and earn ings were posted by the West inghouse Electric Corporation in the quarter and six months ended June 30, the Company reported yesterday.

title: News Summary and Index
description: TUESDAY, JULY 14, 1970

title: MRS. DAVID R. PAIGE
description: CANTON, Ohio, July 13  Mrs. Frances Lincoln Paige, widow of David R. Paige, died of a heart ailment in a hospital here Saturday. She was 76 years old and lived at 356 22d Street Northwest. Mrs. Paige was a daughter of the late Charles M. Lincoln, former for eign news editor of The New York Times.

title: Project in South Bronx Begins Under U.S. Model Cities Plans
description: Mayor Lindsay broke ground yesterday in a blocksquare vacant lot on East 143d Street to begin construction of the first Model Cities housing proj ect in the South Bronxa 309 apartment public housing proj ect.

title: DR. SAMUEL B. HARRIS
description: LINDEN, N.J., July 13Dr. Samuel B. Harris, a dentist here for many years and a leader in the Jewish commu nity, died yesterday at Rahway Memorial Hospital, after a heart attack, He was 58 years old and lived at 5 Raritan Road.

title: Wood, Field and Stream
description: MONTAUK, L. I., July 12 Nick Monte, proprietor of Gurney's Inn, who started angling as a 4yearold in Brooklyn's Gowanus Canal with a piece of string and diaper pin, wasn't surprised yesterday by unexpected news.

title: Major League Baseball
description: Tuesday, July 14, 1970

title: Australian Iron Mine Gets Financing
description: New financing for the $300million Robe River iron ore mining project in Austra lia was announced yesterday by officials of American con cerns participating in the multinational development.

title: Duke N. Stern Marries Susan Annan Guernsey
description: EDGARTOWN, Mass., July 13  Miss Susan Annan Guernsey and Duke Nordlin ger Stern were married here this afternoon in St. An drew's Episcopal Church by the Rev. Thomas Fuller. A reception was held at the Edgartown Yacht Club.

title: Coast Millionaire Upset By Publicity and Politics
description: LOS ANGELES, July 13 He is not happy to be inter viewed, this grayhaired, florid  faced multimillionaire pacing the rug in a parlor of his mansion in West Los Angeles. He does not like publicity.

title: U.S. GIVING $900,000 FOR ARTS IN SCHOOLS
description: The Office of Education and the National Endowment for the Arts will make grants total ing $900,000 for professional artists to perform and teach in elementary and high schools.

title: ADJOURNMENT GIVEN IN MAILERS' DISPUTE
description: A hearing in State Supreme Court in Manhattan on an ap plication for an injunction to bar Mailers Union No. 6 from interfering with normal produc tion at The New York Times was put over yesterday to Thursday.

title: ROBERT WOOD, 47, DETECTIVE, DIES
description: Robert (Sonny) Wood, a de tective in the New York City Police Department and a former professional basketball player, died of a cerebral hemmorhage Saturday at the Columbia Presbyterian Medical Center. He was 47 years old and lived at 2223 98th Street, East Elm hurst in Queens.

title: Mrs. Crimmins Collapses After Facing Charges
description: Mrs. Alice Crimmins collapsed and fell to the floor in a faint in the Fresh Meadows, Queens, police station yesterday as she was booked on new charges of murder and manslaughter in the deaths of her son and daughter five years ago.

title: War Casualties
description: WASHINGTON, July 14 (AP) The following servicemen from the New York area were identified by the Defense De partment today as having been killed in Southeast Asia:

title: Educational Assessment
description: When the National Assessment of Educational Progress was first proposed nearly ten years ago the organized voice of school administrators spoke out strongly in opposition. Despite all the rationalizing jargon, their attitude reflected the traditional fear comparisons which might expose the incompetence or inadequacy of some school systems as measured against the superior accomplishments of others. Yet it is exactly such a yardstick that is essential to the correction of failures and soft spots in the huge and diverse public school enterprise.

title: The Sludge of Unbridled Lies
description: On Aug. 25, 1968, a handful of Russians demon strated for two or three minutes in Red Square against Soviet aggression in Czechoslovakia before being arrested.

title: U.S. Takes Skeptical View
description: WASHINGTON, July 19The United States took a skeptical view today toward reports from India that the Soviet Union was trying to promote an interna tional conference on Indochina.

title: Indians Stage Prayer Vigil to Force U.S. to Return Land in South Dakota
description: PINE RIDGE, S. D., July 10  On top of Sheep Mountain, a lonely butte in the Badlands, an angry group of Oglala Sioux is protesting what they call the latest piece of treachery; and bad faith by the Govern ment.

title: Gen. Groves of Manhattan Project Dies
description: Lieut. Gen. Leslie R. Groves, director of the World War II Manhattan Project, which de veloped the atomic bomb and ushered in the nuclear age, died Monday night at Walter Reed Army Medical Center in Wash ington. The retired general, who was 73 years old, had suf fered a heart attack at his home earlier in the evening.

title: U.S. Steel to Increase Production at Fairless Works
description: The United States Steel Cor poration announced yesterday in Pittsburgh that it would add substantially to the basic steel making capacity of its Fairless Works, one of the company's major integrated mills.

title: Modern Designers In Piracy Protest
description: A small group of modern furnishings designers, and a few friends, picketed the Dione Lucas Gourmet Center yesterday afternoon for en gaging in design piracy.

title: AMEX PRICES OFF IN QUIET TRADING
description: It was another listless day on the American Stock Ex change yesterday, so much so that, had there not been a big block trade, the volume would have been the smallest in four years.

title: Goldwater Says President Errs on Filling Positions
description: WASHINGTON, July 14 (AP) Senator Barry Goldwater, Re publican of Arizona, said today that President Nixon makes a mistake every time he names a Democrat or a leftist Republi can to an Administration job.

title: Finns Form New Cabinet, Ending FourMonth Crisis
description: HELSINKI, Finland, July 14 The political crisis that start ed in March when most of the parties in the Government suf fered losses in the parliamen tary elections ended today when Dr. Mai Karjalainen, a 47yearold former Premier, formed a new broadly based Government, just three days before President Urho Kek konen is to leave for Moscow and Washington.

title: CITY STANDS FIRM AGAINST CHANGES IN NEW RENT LAW
description: Deputy Mayor Richard R. Aurelio intervened yesterday in the ninedayold apartment strike, calling about 30 land lords to City Hall to warn them not to expect further changes in the rent control law.

title: First Semiannual Report
description: Merrill Lynch, Pierce. Fen ner & Smith, Inc., the largest securities concern, disclosed yesterday that its profit in the first half of 1970 had declined 123 per cent to $13.9million.

title: Ousted Suffolk Aide Loses Job Appeal,
description: The Republican leader of the Town of Brookhaven, Richard D. Zeidler, was guilty of mis conduct as chairman of the Suffolk County Water Author ity, the Appellate Division, Second Department, ruled yes terday.

title: Pamela C. Reeves To Wed in Spring
description: MANHASSET. L. I. July 14 Miss Pamela Carol Reeves a senior at Villanova Uni versity, plans to be married next spring to Lieut. (jg.) Richard A. Kennedy, U.S.N., a Villanova graduate and flight officer stationed in Oceana, Va.

title: GRASS RACE WON BY FAVORECIDIAN
description: A small, but loud, chorus of booing that greeted Angel Cordero Jr., before each early appearance at Aqueduct yes terday turned into a mass of disapproval after the feature race.

title: Bridge:
description: One of the biggest swings against the Dallas Aces in the qualifying play for the world championship in Stock holm last month occurred on the diagramed deal against Brazil. The Aces, of course, survived the setback and went on to win the world title.

title: Mitchell Gives States to Aug. 3 to Act on Vote at 18
description: WASHINGTON, July 14At torney General John N. Mitchell said today he was giving the states until Aug. 3 to pledge full compliance with the new Voting Rights Act that lowered the voting age to 18 years.

title: Rudolf Orthwine Is Dead at 76; Publisher of a Dance Magazine
description: Rudolf Orthwine, business man, inventor and printer, who was publisher of Dance Magazine, died Monday at Uni versity Hospital after a long illness. He was 76 years old and lived at the New York Athletic Club, Seventh Avenue at 59th Street.

title: Pollution Is Shocking At Sea, Heyerdahl Says
description: BRIDGETOWN, Barbados, July 14 (Reuters)Thor Hey erdahl, leader of the trans Atlantic expedition on the papyrus reed boat Ra II said today that on some days he and his crew had been re luctant to wash because of pollution in the ocean.

title: JOAN MANLEY NAMED A PUBLISHER AT TIME
description: Joan Manley, who served as director of sales for TimeLife Books, has been appointed pub lisher of the sales division of Time Inc., it was announced yesterday by Rhett Austell, ex ecutive vice president.

title: CAMBODIAN FORCE BATTLES ENEMY ON KEY HIGHWAY
description: PNOMPENH, Cambodia, July 14A battle raged tonight about 55 miles from Pnompenh on the highway linking the cap ital with the port of Kompong Som, the former Sihanoukville.

title: STOCKS RETREAT ON LONDON BOARD
description: Prices on the London stock market lost earlier firmness yesterday as most slipped mod erately following news of an increased June deficit in Brit ish trade.

title: Sports Today
description: BOXING

title: Phone Hearing Set
description: ALBANY, July 14The New York Telephone Company was granted permission today by the State Public Service Com mission to apply for a rehear ing on a commission order that increased the utility's rate charges by $104.9million.

title: Tractor Maker Reports
Justice for the First Americans
description: When Europeans first arrived on this continent and spread into its interior, they found a people whose ancestors had come from Asia 25,000 years earlier and had long since mastered the North American environ ment as hunters, agriculturalists, or fishermen. The various Indian tribes boasted complex cultures and religious systems, technologies adequate to their needs, and proud traditions.

title: SIMON & SCHUSTER WON'T BE MERGED
description: Norton Simon, Inc., the bil liondollar conglomerate, and Simon & Schuster, Inc., the 46 yearold publishing house, an nounced jointly yesterday that negotiations for the acquisition of the book publisher by the conglomerate have been termi nated.

title: Addonizio Trial Witness Tells Of Kickback to Rigo's Company
description: TRENTON, July 14A minor excavating contractor, testify ing today at the extortion con spiracy trial of former Newark Mayor Hugh J. Addonizio and four other defendants, said he did a $1,600 job at the request of a major contractor on a Newark city project, received a check from the city for $20,000 in 1968, and kicked back the difference$18,400to the ma jor contractor.

title: Washington: For the Record
RCA and Caterpillar Earnings Fell in Quarter and First Half
description: A drop in sales and earn ings in the quarter and six months ended June 30 was an nounced yesterday by the RCA Corporation.

title: 500 FROM CON SON FLOWN TO SAIGON
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, July 14More than 500 prisoners have been flown on American] military planes from the Con Son Prison to Saigon and are awaiting release, a South Viet namese Government spokesman said here today.

title: Preston Foster Is Dead at 69; Film Star Began Career in 30's
description: LA JOLLA, Calif. July 14 (AP)Preston Foster, who played heroes and villains for more than two decades in movies and then became a tele vision star died here today after a long illness. He was 69 years old.

title: TACKING INCIDENT CITED BY VALIANT
description: NEWPORT, R. I., July 14 The heavyweights of the Amer ica's Cup defense trials re sumed their slugfest today, and again it was Intrepid that floored Valiant.

title: The Cast
description: LA MARIE VISON, a play be Shui Terayama. Directed by Mr. Terayama; scenery and lighting by Mr. Terayama; costumes by Miyako Kawamura, Antony Bassee and Yasueo Takahashi; them music by Itsuro Shimoda; makeup de signed by Miyako Kawamura; staff ??ed by Mr. Kawamura; staff assist. a it director. Kiyomasa Kawakita; stage manager, Karen De Francis. At La Mania E.T.C., 74A East Fourth Street.

title: BROKER COST RISE IS TRACED TO 60'S
description: WASHINGTON, July 14A spokesman for the member firms of the New York Stock Exchange said today that they should have tried to raise their sales commissions on stock transactions back in the early nineteensixties. They attempted no such increase at the time, he added, only because total profits were going up so fast that they failed to notice how much their costs were rising and their profit margins nar rowing.

title: Washington Board Votes Curriculum Stressing Reading
description: WASHINGTON, July 14  The District of Columbia school board has voted to de vote the curriculum of the city's grade schools and junior high schools next year to teaching children to read.

title: SOVIET AIDE ENDS NEW DELHI TALKS
description: NEW DELHI, July 14  Nikolai P. ??ryubin, a Soviet Deputy Foreign Minister, left this morning after having con ferred with Indian officials about the prospects of a new Indochina conference.

title: POLICEMAN SEIZED ON WOMAN'S CHARGE
description: A 23yearold policeman was arrested early yesterday after he allegedly broke into the apartment of a young woman on the Lower East Side. After he was charged with burglary and assault, he was suspended from the force.

title: VoteRigging Dismays a Vietnam Province
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, July 14A case of flagrant voterigging has discouraged officials and reinforced the cynicism of villagers in a small province along South. Viet nam's coastline.

title: It's a OneHit Feast For Hickman After Night of Cold Cuts
description: CINCINNATI, July 14 Pete Rose walked into the National League clubhouse, smiling and limping. One af ter the other, the other play ers grabbed his hand.

title: Bache Sees a Profit Turnaround; Merrill Lynch Earnings Off 23%
description: Bache & Co., one of the na tion's largest brokerage houses, incurred a $10million capital decline in the four months ended May 31, but it has ap parently turned the corner to profitability after more than a year of financial distress.

title: Books of The Times
description: MALTAVERNE [Un adolescent d'autrefois]. By Francois Mauriac. Translated by Jean Stewart. 195 pages. Farrar, Straus & Giroux. $5.95.

title: COURVILLE TAKES SIXTH IKE CROWN
description: LARCHMONT, N. Y., July 14 Jerry Courville's Eagle 3 on the narrow, 480yard 17th hole at Bonnie Briar during the sec ond of today's two 18hole rounds enabled the Connecticut amateur to gain a onestroke margin for his sixth Ike golf tournament victory. It was also his second triumph in a row in the event.

title: Driver of Newfangled Boat Hopes Only to Finish
description: POINT PLEASANT, N. J., July 14  Ed Wukowitz will not win tomorrow's Hennessy Grand Prix ocean race.

title: Galitzine Gets New Ideas From Her Old Porcelains and Screens
description: ROME, July 14Princess Irene Galitzine denied that there was anything remark able about her prints at the dinner party for a few hun dred close friends and fash ion followers held in her apartment after her fashion showing Monday evening.

title: Janet Sue Gage To Be a Bride
description: SCARSDALE, N. Y., July 14Miss Janet Sue Gage and Thomas Peter Scheweitzer will be married here Aug. 15 in the Hitchcock Presbyte rian Church.

title: Hickel Acts on Mercury Waste; Sees Intolerable Health Peril
description: WASHINGTON, July 14 (UPI)Interior Secretary Wal ter J. Hickel ordered Federal experts today to find the sourc es of newly discovered mercury pollution in the nation's water ways. He called the pollution an intolerable threat to the health and safety of Ameri cans.

title: With Scott and Bing on Way, Capitals Trade Armstrong
description: WASHINGTON, July 14 (AP)  Warren Armstrong, the American Basketball Associa tion's rookie of the year the season before last, was traded by the Washington Capitals to Kentucky today for cash and the right to the Colonels' first round round draft pick next season.

title: Wide Family Planning Aid For Poor Passed in Senate
description: WASHINGTON, July 14The Senate passed by voice vote today a bill calling for a mas sive program to bring family planning services to all Ameri can women who cannot afford them.

title: DOOR OF CHASE BANK IS DAMAGED BY BOMB
description: An explosive device went off at 2:33 A.M. today, damaging the front door of the Chase Manhattan Bank branch at 599 Broadway at East Houston Street.

title: KarylLynn Kopelman Engaged
description: MAGNOLIA. Mass., July 14 Miss KarylLynn Kopel man, daughter of Dr. and Mrs. Bernard Kopelman, plans to be married Aug. 16 to Dr. Neil J. Stone, son of Mr. and Mrs. Milton J. Stone of Highland Park. III.

title: In Memoriam
description: COHENHarry C. Passed away July 15. 1969, dearly beloved and adored husband of Jean (nee Halpern), father and grand father. A beautiful human being, loved and respected by all, gentle and kind, had a most beautiful philosophy of life. Cher ished memories, so sadly missed, so lov ingly remembered. May the joy he sought in life he his in heaven.

title: City Chaining Trees in Park to Thwart Thefts
description: The Parks Department has started using chains and shackles to keep thieves from digging up newly planted trees and shrubs and carting them away.

title: HARRY W. LAIDLER, ECONOMIST, DEAD
description: Dr. Harry C. Laidler, an author, economist and a found er of the League for Industrial Democracy, died yesterday at Adelhpi Hospital atfer a short illness. He was 86 years old and lived at 292 Garfield Place, Brooklyn.

title: Market Place
description: In the shadow of the worst bear market in modern his tory, observers are question ing some basic Wall Street tenets.

title: A Shop That Sells Table Accessories Along With Cooking Demonstrations
description: When passersby  busi nessmen, shoppers, women pushing strollers  stopped one day recently to peer at the activity in the store win dow on Third Avenue near List Street, Mrs. Kenneth Zieeel paid no attention.

title: Rogers Has Meeting With Russian Envoy On European Issues
description: WASHINGTON, July 14The Soviet Union was understood to have informed the United States officially today of the interest of Warsaw Pact powers in exploring with the North Atlantic alliance the reduction of outside forces in Central Europe.

title: The Proceedings In the U.N. Today
NonPartisan League Sends a Star
description: CINCINNATI, July 14 President Nixon threw out two first balls before the AllStar Game tonight, then tossed three balls the other wayto fans seated in the stand.

title: Paris Tevye to Sing Here
description: Tickets are on sale at the Philharmonic Hall box office for the New York debut con cert of Ivan Rebroff on Aug. 6. The GermanRussian bass, who starred as Tevye in the Paris production of Fiddler on the Roof, will have the assistance of a balalaika ensemble for part of his program.

title: Rock Concert Is Canceled By South Carolina Festival
description: BEAUFORT, S. C., July 14 (AP)A rock concert which was to have been part of Beau fort's Water Festival, July 20 26, has been canceled because of what city officials here call high public feeling following a reecnt festival at Byron, Ga.

title: INTERACTION WINS ON JERSEY GRASS
description: OCEANPORT, N.J., July 14 (AP)  Mike Miceli brought In teraction between horses in a daring move near the finish and held off a threat by Per sister to win the Rockland County Association Purse at Monmouth Park today.

title: MONSANTO PLANS TO CURB CHEMICAL
description: WASHINGTON, July 14 The only American manu facturer of an industrial chem ical called PCB has decided to restrict sales of the chemi cal because of mounting evi dence that it can induce birth defects in animals.

title: Policy Dispute Denied as the Reason for Rejection of VISTA Post
description: WASHINGTON, July 14  Apparently yielding to White House pressure, Richard Blumenthal said today that his decision to decline appointment as director of Volunteers in Service to AmericaVISTA had not been based on dis agreement with Administration policies dealing with the poor.

title: Tour de France Racers Still Pedal Hard, but the Fans Are Losing Interest
description: TOULOUSE France, July 13 Bravo! and Allez! The cheers are ringing along the turnpikes again as the great annual bicycle race, the Tour de France, snakes its way through the countryside.

title: 7 Men, 5 Women Sworn As Jury at Manson Trial
description: LOS ANGELES, July 14 (UPI) A jury of seven men and five women was sworn in today at the Sharon Tate murder trial after each promised to give the defendants an impartial and fair hearing.

title: Italian PremierDesignate Talks With Party Leaders
description: ROME, July 14 (Reuters) Representatives of three of Italy's four traditional govern ment partners met today with Premierdesignate Giulio Andre otti for talks on a new coali tion government.

title: MRS. CUSHING'S DUO LEADS BY SHOT ON 74
description: EAST HAMPTON, L. I., July 14  Mrs. Cutting Cushing of Meadow Brook and Laura Leon ard of Piping Rock posted a twooverpar 35, 3974 today to lead the women's Long Is land Golf Association's 36hole better  ball of  partners tourna ment over the 5,643yard Maid stone Club layout.

title: Moeller, Sanitation Chief, Quits; 17th Aide of Lindsay to Resign
description: After two years of supervis ing New York City's efforts to collect its garbage, clean its streets and plow its win ter snows, Griswold L. Moel ler submitted his resignation yesterday.

title: Miss Eileen Bingham Is Betrothed
description: WHITE PLAINS, July 14 The engagement of Miss Eileen Theresa Bingham to Paul Gregory Tuttle of Lynchburg, Va. son of Mrs. Mavis Beryl Tuttle of Denver and Ronald A. Tuttle of Oak land, Calif., has been an nounced by the future bride's parents. Mr. and Mrs. Frank R. Bingham.

title: NET AT MELLON BANK IS UP FOR FIRST HALF
description: The Mellon National Bank and Trust Company, Pittsburgh, the largest hank in Pennsylvania, reported yesterday consoli dated net income for the first half, before securities transac tions, of $24.601,000, or $2.46 a share, up 3.2 per cent from the yearearlier $23,837,000, or $2.38 a share.

title: Films Seek to Woo New Opera Fans
description: Rolf Liebermann believes there may be life in the old opera house yet and that films and television can be used to interest new young audiences. In Germany we have found that television promotion of opera is quite a success3 to 5 million may see an opera that perhaps 2.000 could see in the opera house.

title: Witness in a Theft Case At Airport Here Is Slain
description: WASHINGTON. July 14 (AP)  The Justice Depart ment has disclosed that its, main witness in a conspiracy case involving $43million in stocks and securities stolen, from the United States mails was found shot to death two days after a grand jury re turned a sealed indictment in a secret session.

title: Holder Sues General Dynamics, Charging False Reports for '69
description: A stockholder suit has been filed against the General Dynamics Corporation; its auditor, Arthur Andersen & Co., and a group of its present and former directors charging that false statements were made in the company's annual and quarterly reports for 1969.

title: Group in Ocean Hill Demands Ouster of Local School Official
description: A letter sent to Mayor Lind say and other public officials on the stationery of the Ocean Hill  Brownsville Commu nity Education Center in Brook lyn has warned that we'll burn down Ocean HillBrownsville unless Assemblyman Samuel D. Wright is removed from the area by Aug. 1.

title: NuclearMissile Trucks Shown at Bastille Day Parade
description: PARIS, July 14France cel ebrated a noisy Bastille Day to day as leftists rioted and right ists cheered a parade that brought Foreign Legionnaires and nuclearmissile trucks into the heart of Paris.

title: RICHARDSON ASKS CURB ON BENEFITS
description: WASHINGTON, July 14 The new Secretary of Health, Education and Welfare, Elliot L. Richardson, urged the Sen ate not to raise the latest Social Security benefit increase above the 5 per cent voted by the House in May.

title: Une de Mai, Choice, Gets No. 3 For $125,000 Trot on Saturday
description: WESTBURY, L. I., July 14 Bravo, halfshouted Jean Mary, who will drive Tidalium Pelo of France in Saturday night's $125,000 International Trot at Roosevelt Raceway.

title: Villager Industries Is Sued By 2 Holders in Class Action
description: Villager Industries Is Sued By 2 Holders in Class Action

title: Spain Leading Yugoslavia In Davis Cup Tennis, 20
description: BARCELONA, Spain, July 14 (AP)  Manuel Santana and Manuel Orantes scored singles victories today and gave Spain a 20 lead over Yugoslavia in the European Zone A final of the Davis Cup tennis competi tion.

title: ROUT OF U.A.R. UNIT REPORTED BY ISRAEL
description: TEL AVIV, July 14A mili tary spokesman announced here today that Israeli troops routed an Egypitan commando force that landed on the eastern bank of the Suez Canal last night.

title: HARLEM TOUR URGED IN YOUTH ASSEMBLY
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., July 14A burly City College senior invited the World Youth Assembly today, in the name of black American youth, to make a bus tour of Harlem to prove that the United States has colonies.

title: Freud Jung Letters to Appear
description: The complete correspond ence between Dr. Sigmund Freud and Dr. Carl G. Jung his most famous pupil and, eventualy, his fiercest op ponentwill be published as the result of an agreement between their sons to lift 60year embargo on the letters.

title: TRUSTEE DELAY SET FOR PENNSY
description: The Federal District Court in Philadelphia has decided to de fer for another week its des signation of the trustee, or trustees, of the Penn Central Transportation Company.

title: Red Cross Findings Cited By THOMAS J. HAMILTON
description: GENEVA, July 14  Red Cross inspectors have found in two visits that conditions at the South Vietnamese prison at Con Son were not too bad and that a vast majority of the inmates were held as corn mon criminals, reliable sources disclosed today.

title: Knitwear Manufacturers Here Are Hurt by Imports
description: I am the boss has a sometimes false ring for Irv ing Levites, part owner of the Nustyle Knitting Com pany in the Bronx. The word boss conjures up visions of big cigars, ease and con tentment, but these emolu ments do not apply to Mr. Levites.

title: Nancy J. Friedmann to Be Wed To Thomas D. Pincus on Aug. 12
description: SCRANTON, Pa., July 14 Miss Nancy Jane Friedmann and Thomas David Pincus, both of whom received A.B. degrees with honors last month from the University of Wisconsin, will be married here Aug. 12 at the home of the future bride's parents. Dr. and Mrs. Elihu Friedmann, who have made known the engagement of the couple.

title: Jacobson to Be Barred From Saratoga Racing
description: Buddy Jacobson, who had been unsuccessful in getting stall space at Aqueduct after sitting out a 45day suspen sion, learned yesterday he would not be able to race any horses at Saratoga either.

title: Auto Union and Industry Open Crucial Talks Today
description: DETROIT, July 14The Unit ed Automobile Workers and the car makers will open their new contract talks tomorrow in an atmosphere of crisis.

title: House Panel Urges That Federal Courts Be Given Jurisdiction Over Military Crimes of ExG.I.'s
description: WASHINGTON, July 14 A House panel that investigated the alleged killing of Viet namese civilians at Songmy recommended today that the jurisdiction of the Federal courts be expanded to deal with military offenders who have be come civilians.

title: PRESIDENT SEEKS AID OF GOVERNORS
description: LOUISVILLE, Ky., July 14 President Nixon left today what he called the White House isolation booth to seek sup port from Governors of Ap palachian states in freeing iomestie legislation bottled up in Congressional committees.

title: New Books
description: GENERAL

title: PRICES ARE HIGHER IN SEVER FUTURES
description: Silver futures prices rose here yesterday in line with the prices received at the Government's weekly auction sale of fine silver in Washington.

title: Marxist Saws Die Hard
description: The old Marxist charge that capitalist economies depend on war to provide prosperity and full employment dies hard. Not only orthodox Communists but radicals of the New Left take it as axiomatic that what used to be known as mer chants of death and is now called the militaryindustrial complex controls the nation's basic foreign and domestic poli cies. The com plex does this, according to the Marxist doctrine, not by conspiring against the eco nomic interests of business and labor but by actually serving the interests of those who seek higher profits and wages through the expansion of the capitalist system.

title: Griffith 65 Over Tiger in Durable Battle Tonight
description: Dick Tiger of Nigeria and Emile Griffith of the Virgin Islands, two of professional boxing's most durable men, will battle in a scheduled 10 round bout tonight in Mad ison Square Garden.

title: Young Lords Seize Lincoln Hospital Building
description: A group of 150 persons led by members of the Young Lords occupied the old Lincoln Hospital School of Nursing in the Bronx for 12 hours yester day and presented a set of de mands that the hospital's ad ministrator called valid.

title: RACEWAY HOLDERS SHOW SKEPTICISM
description: At the annual stockholders meeting yesterday of Roose velt Raceway, Inc., in West bury, L.I., minority stockhold ers met the Raceway's new managementnow controlled by Irving Mitchell Felt's Madi son Square Garden Corporation and Philip J. Levin's Tansna tion Development Corporation and some expressed doubt about management's intentions and goodwill toward the minor ity.

title: Chi Chang Wins 2 Dashes
description: INNSBRUCK Austria, July 14 (Reuters)Chi Cheng, the Tai wan sprinter who studies and trains in the United States, won the women's 100meter dash today in 11.1 seconds. She also took the 100meter hurdle ievent in 0:13.1.

title: Laird Keeps Close Eye on South Vietnam's Economy
description: WASHINGTON, July 14  The newest and most anxious student of South Vietnam's economic problems here is Secretary of Defense Melvin R. Laird, whose interest is aroused by fears of a precipi tate decline in the morale and effectiveness of Saigon's army.

title: Chou Attends French Fete For First Time Since 1964
description: PEKING, July 14 (Agence FrancePress)  Premier Chou Enlai today attended a French Embassy reception markin France's National Day, the first time he has attended such a re ception since 1964.

title: 180 File for Saigon Senate
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, July 14One hundred eighty candidates will vie for 30 of the 60 seats in South Viet nam's Senate, in elections Aug. 30. The central election committee announced the names of the candidates and the tickets on which they are running today, after the filing deadline of midnight last night.

title: Jewish Groups Say 3 Japanese Concerns Aid Arabs' Boycott
description: A group of 22 American Jew ish organizations accused Japan Air Lines, the Toyota Motor Company and the Nissan Motor Company yesterday of partic ipation in an economic boycott of Israel.

title: BUILDING WORKERS TO GET STRIKE PAY
description: Local 32B of the Building Service Employes Union is mak ing plans to pay benefits to its members if the apartment strike, now in its ninth day, continues through Monday.

title: Nastase, Graebner, Ralston Net Victors; M'Kay Upsets Barth
description: WASHINGTON, July 14 (AP) Topseeded Ilie Nastase of Rumania, playing without prac tice after a 13hour plane ride from Athens, defeated Steve Krulevitz of Baltimore, 62, 75, in the first round of the $35,000 Washington Star international claycourt tennis tournament today.

title: WORLD BANK SETS BOND SALES IN U.S.
description: The World Bank, which has not borrowed money in the American capital market for almost two years, plans to sell a $200million bond issue here July 23.

title: ACTION FOLLOWS CLUBOWNER MOVE
description: In a retaliatory move fol lowing the National Football League club owners' decision to bar experienced players from training camps, the N.F.L. Players Association will request members of the College All Star squad to desert their Evan ston, Ill., headquarters today.

title: Vienna Arms Negotiators Agree to Omit a Session
description: VIENNA, July 14  United States and Soviet disarmament negotiators decided today to skip the next meeting, which would normally been held on Friday, and to meet again next Tuesday instead.

title: Rico Carty: Braves' Man With a Raincheck
description: CINCINNATI, July 14If there was an undercurrent of grateful affection in the voice of Bowie Kuhn when the commis sioner introduced Rico Carty of the Atlanta Braves at an AllStar luncheon yesterday it was understandable. Rico is the guy who rescued Bowie's computerized fan vote from becoming a gigantic booboo.

title: Garelik Eliminates 3 Staff Jobs, But Denies Politics Is the Reason
description: With promises to persist in the course that he has taken independent of the Lindsay administration, City Council President Sanford D. Garelik is eliminating the positions held by three of his top assistants.

title: Tenants in Struck Building Here Cooperate to Maintain Services
description: It's like the whole city is coming together, like a kib butzwe almost like it better running the building by our selves, said Miss Roberta Fishman.

title: Mr. Brezhnev's Wrong Guess
description: Early this month Leonid I. Brezhnev told the Soviet Communist party Central Committee that the year 1970 will be memorable for our party and the entire Soviet people because this year there will take place the 24th Congress of the Communist party of the Soviet Union. Preparations for the Congress, he con fidently predicted, will call forth a new expansion of the political and labor activity of the Communists, of the entire Soviet people. He spoke of the decision to hold the 24th Congress this year as an accomplished fact. Then, less than two weeks after Mr. Brezhnev's speech, the announcement came that the 24th Con gress will not be held until March of next year. Brezhnev had proved a poor prophet.

title: Article 1  No Title
description: THINK FRESH: AID FRESH AIR FUND.

title: New Haven Panther Trial Sees Color Slides of Tortured Victim
description: NEW HAVEN. July 14The jury hearing the case of a Black Panther charged in the kidnapping and murder of a fellow party member saw a series of color slides today that showed the victim with his wrists bound with a clothesline and with a wire hanger around his neck.

title: Foreign Affairs: From Suez to Singapore
description: LONDONStalin saw no dif ference between the policies of either major party that won an American or British election be cause, for Moscow, the basic attitude was always the same. Likewise, when Washington and London regard each other after each governmental change they invariably find continuation in main diplomatic goals. This is one of many facts that bind together the Englishspeaking allies.

title: WRIGHT CAPTURES LONG ISLAND GOLF
description: CEDARHURST, L. I., July 14 Jimmy Wright of Inwood shot a final round of 34, 33 67 to post a fiveunderpar total of 205 and win the Long Island Professional Golfers' As sociation 54hole medal play championship by a stroke at the Rockaway Hunting Club today.

title: Queen Speaks in Manitoba
description: ST. PIERRE, Manitoba, July 14 (Canadian Press)  Queen Elizabeth II spoke in French to a large crowd in the town square today and said open mindedness and a friendly climate were the keys to promising future for French Manitobans. She said that on a recent trip she had realized the fundamental theme of Ca nadian unity.

title: Six Air Inspectors Accused of Perjury On Bribery in Jobs
description: Six inspectors in the city's Department of Air Resources were charged in State Supreme Court yesterday with falsely denying that they had told a fellow inspector about op portunities for bribery in their jobs.

title: Italian Film Wins Top Prize At San Sebastian Festiva
description: SAN SEBASTIAN, Spain, July 14 (Reuters)The Italian en try, Ondata di Calore (Heat Wave), starring Jean Seberg and directed by Nelo Risi, won the bestfilm award tonight at the San Sebastian International Cinema Festival.

title: Itaiian Students Stage SitIn
description: ROME, July 14 (Reuters) Italian university students to day staged a sitin near the architecture department build ing of Rome University to pro test the refusal of the authorities to change the examination sys tem. The police last night re leased 35 students detained dur ing violent clashes at the de partment yesterday at the start of longdelayed final examina tions.

title: 80 Soviet Jews Send Appeals To Legislature on Emigration
description: MOSCOW. July 14  Three groups of Soviet Jews have is sued demands to the Supreme Soviet that they be permitted to emigrate to Israel, accord ing to documents circulating here.

title: Guinness Depicts A Zany Alchemist In Play by Boland
description: LONDON, July 14  In his time, Alec Guinness has played many a saintly part, but none more bizarre than his role in Bridget Boland's new play Time Out of Mind at the Yvonne Arnaud Theater here.

title: 400 YOUTHS CLASH NEAR ERASMUS HALL
description: A policeman was injured and four youths arrested last night after 400 Negro and white youths clashed in the Flatbush section of Brooklyn.

title: National League Wins AllStar Game, 54, on Hickman's Single in 12th Inning
description: CINCINNATI, July 14  The National League won its eighth straight AllStar Game tonight by scoring three runs in the ninth inning and one in the 12th to defeat the American League. 54.

title: Miss Mitchell, Army Officer Plan to Marry
