description: DALTON, Ga., July 14 Former United States Rep resentative Harian Erwin Mitchell of Georgia and Mrs. Mitchell have announced the engagement of their daughter, Miss Marilyn Helen Mitchell, to Lieut. Chester Logan Da vidson Jr. of the Army, son of Dr. and Mrs. Davidson of Chapel Hill, N. C., formerly of New York.

title: 6 SEIZED IN BRONX ON ARSON CHARGES
description: Six persons, three of them 15yearolds, were arrested on charges of arson early yester day morning following five suspicious fires in the South Bronx area during the night.

title: Wasting a Good Congressman
description: A regrettable consequence of last month's otherwise pleasing Democratic primary is the threatened loss of Representative Richard Max McCarthy from the national scene. To run for the Senatorial nomination, Mr. McCarthy had to give up the chance to try for another term in the House of Representatives. His defeat by Representative Richard L. Ottinger, who was our choice among several good candidates, now leaves Mr. McCarthy out in the coldand deprives this state of On excellent member of its Congressional delegation.

title: Mailers Threaten Strike at The News
description: New York Mailers Union No. 6 announced yesterday that its 500 members at The Daily News would go on strike at 12:01 A.M. Friday because their contract nego tiations had reached an im passe.

title: Town Fights Bankruptcy
description: HAMTRAMCK, Mich., July 14 (AP)Faced with the possibil ity of having to declare their city bankrupt, Hamtramck City Council members adopted a $4.9million balanced budget yesterday that requires laying off 7 city employes and leav ing 33 vacancies unfilled. Ham tramck, a factory town of about 30,000 settled by Polish immi grants, is situated in the middle of the city of Detroit.

title: Market Summary
description: Tuesday, July 14, 1970

title: Gonzales, 30 Years at Net, To Be Honored Here Today
description: Pancho Gonzales, the 42 yearold tennis professional, will be the guest of honor to day at a luncheon at the 21 Club sponsored by Martini & Rossi. The luncheon will mark the 30th anniversary of his career.

title: Advertising: Finding Answer in Girl Talk
description: Magazine publishers just love high readership figures. (That's because advertisers do). They are not at all fond however, of the high cost of production and subscription solicitation.

title: U.S. Plans Test of the Teaching of Pupils by Private Contractors
description: WASHINGTON, July 14  The Office of Economic Op portunity said today that it would go ahead with a major test of a new educational sys tem despite disclosures that the first pilot project had been contaminated by irregulari ties.

title: Colombians Get Aid on Family Planning
description: BOGOTA, Colombia July 4 There is a new billboard at Sev enth Avenue and 22d Street here that subtly advertises a service that until recently was only whispered about in tradi tion  bound Colombiafamily planning.

title: U.A.R. Cocktail Party Penetrated by Israeli
description: ATHENS, July 14  The United Arab Republic's em bassy here accused an Israeli singer today of having pene trated a cocktail party given by Ambassador Hassan Ahmed Kamel.

title: Monmouth Jockeys
Promotion of Executives Set by GertzLong Island
description: William P. McNamara has been promoted from vice presi dent and general merchandise manager to the new post of senior vice president in charge of merchandising and sales promotion at GertzLong Island He joined the company in March, 1967, after a 22year career as a FileneBoston mar chandising and managerial ex ecutive.

title: SECRECY IN PANELS UPHELD IN HOUSE
description: WASHINGTON, July 14 Critics of Congressional secrecy lost a crucial round today as the House voted to oppose a move designed to open most committee meetings to the public.

title: HARTFORD FIRE ADDS 2 BOARD MEMBERS
description: The Harfrord Fire Insurance Company, which was acquired in a tender offer last month by the International Telephone and Telegraph Corporation, in creased its 14man board to 16 members yesterday with the election of Harold S. Geneen and Eugene R. Black.

title: TeenAgers Beautifying Hill in Park
description: A month ago a hill on the southern end of Mount Mor ris Park in Harlem was strewn with bottles and trash, and weeds grew in abundance. Now its sloping face is terraced, shored with weathered boards and dotted with marigolds, petunias and geraniums and a weeping willow tree.

title: Lydia Schilling Engaged
description: NORTHPORT, L. I., July 14 Mr. and Mrs. Scott Owen Schilling have announced the engagement of their daugh ter, Miss Lydia MacKenzie Schilling, to Howard Lee Walker Jr., son of Dr. and Mrs. Walker of Munsey Park. The wedding is planned for September at St. John's Epis copal Church in Cold Spring Harbor. The future bride, a graduate of Centenary Col lege for Women, is a student at C. W. Post College, where her fianc is a senior. Her fianc's father is an obstetri cian and gynecologist.

title: Cleaver in North Korea
description: HONG KONG, Wednesday, July 15 (Reuters) A delega tion led by Eldridge Cleaver, minister of information of the Black Panther party of the United States, flew into Pyong yang yesterday for a visit.

title: Magazine Sues, Citing Errors in Phone Book
description: Show magazine, a majority of whose stock is owned by Huntington Hartford, the A. & P. heir, filed a $2mil lion damage suit against the New York Telephone Com pany yesterday for assertedly listing magazine phone num bers incorrectly in the tele phone book.

title: City Reconsidering Resignation Of Aide Rejoining Consultant
description: City Planning Commission of ficials said yesterday that they were reconsidering the status of a key aide who was sched uled to resign his $24,500a year post to take a job with consulting concern that has re ceived $8.4million in contracts from the commission.

title: Ottinger and W alinsky Seek Second Line on Ballot
description: PENN YAN, N. Y., July 14 Petitions went into circulation across the state today to get an extra line on the ballot for two of Arthur Goldberg's run ning mates on the Democratic ticket who now are on that line only.

title: Pennsylvania Nears Rise In Home Mortgage Rates
description: HARRISBURG, Pa., July 14 Gov. Raymond P. Shafer is ex pected to sign a bill sent to him by the Legislature yesterday to raise the interest rate on con ventional home mortgages to 9 per cent the next two years. 9 per cent the next two years.

title: BIG BOARD STOCKS EDGE AHEAD A BIT
description: Share prices eased a bit yes terday as trading activity cm the New York Stock Exchange continued to move at the slow est pace in a month. terday as trading activity cm the New York Stock Exchange continued to move at the slow est pace in a month.

title: MAY INVENTORIES REPORTED DOWN
description: WASHINGTON, July 14 Total business inventories de clined by $275million in May the second largest drop in nine years.

title: CHRYSLER FINANCIAL REPORTS CREDIT USE
description: DETROIT, July 14  The Chrysler Corporation's financ ing the Chrysler Financial Corporation, has used $500 million to $600million of its bank credit lines, Lynn Towns end, the automaker's chairman, said today. He said the compa ny had $800million in such bank lines.

title: Theater: Japanese View
description: Shuji Terayama has been praised as Japan's leading avantgarde playwright, and his work, La Marie Vison (Mink Marie), which he wrote and directed, has been Praised as a masterpiece.

title: Israel Signs Pact With O.A.S. to Widen Rural Development Work in Latin Lands
description: WASHINGTON, July 13 Israel, a country that has won acclaim for its relatively smal but effective technical coopera tion programs in Asia and Afri ca, is expanding similar activi ties in Latin America.

title: LOUISIANA DECRIES OIL CURBS IN GULF
description: NEW ORLEANS, July 14The Department of the Interior was told today that its suspension of oil leases in the Gulf of Mexico offshore area was caus ing an economic depression in Southern Louisiana and will cause a shortage of natural gas this winter to heat Northern homes.

title: Company Loses Its Tax Refund Suit Appeal Planned
description: A Federal judge has substan tially rejected a claim by the United States Steel Corporation for a tax refund of $35million. The 125page ruling here yes terday by District Judge Rich ard H. Levet would allow the nation's largest steel company to recover only about $950,000 of the original claim.

title: In Auto Racing, It's Inches That Count
description: There is a racing adage that you can't beat the inches. The 430cubicinch engine of a Group 7 sports racing car churns out more horsepower than a 299inch engine in a Group 5 sports car, right? So when you have a CanAm race that mixes Groups 5 and 7, it makes an amusing diver sion, but not a serious confron tation. You know let the smaller cars pick up a few modest dollars from that lovely CanAm treasure.

title: ERWIN WEDEMANN
description: RIDGEWOOD, N. J., July 14 Erwin Wedemann, president of Wedemann & Godknecht, Inc., freight forwarders and custom house brokers, in New York, died today, apparently of a heart attack, in his home at 314 Hamilton Road. He was 63 years old.

title: A BROAD VIEW URGED IN DOMESTIC POLICY
description: WASHINGTON, July 14 (AP) A spokesman for the nation's Governors called on Congress today to create a national community development policy to embrace almost all domestic affairs, from population growth to a national housing policy.

title: DAVID ROSENBERG,52, PEDIATRICIAN, DEAD
description: EASTCHESTER, N. Y., July 14Dr. David Abraham Rosen berg, a pediatrician, died today at Montefiore Hospital Medical Center, the Bronx, after stroke. He was 52 years old and lived at 37 Claudet Way.

title: Sugarman Sworn as Head Of Human Resources Unit
description: Jule M. Sugarman was sworn in yesterday as the city's Human Resources Administra tor, succeeding Mitchell I. Gins berg.

title: HARBORS IN CHAOS IN BRITISH STRIKE
description: LONDON, July 14 (Reuters) Nearly half of Britain's 47,000 longshoremen staged an unofficial strike today, defying their union's appeal to carry on work while a wage offer was being considered.

title: Thomas Hart Benton Has A Second Heart Attack
description: OAK BLUFFS, Mass., July 14 (AP)Thomas Hart Benton suf fered a heart attack July 5 but is recovering at Matha's Vine yard Hospital, his wife, Rita, said tonight, Tuesday night.

title: Judith R. Fischman Married Here
description: Miss Judith R. Fischman, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Bernard D. Fischman of New York and Scarsdale, N. Y., was married yesterday to Harmer F. Johnson, who is head of the department of antiquities and ethnograph ical art at the ParkeBernet Galleries. The bridegroom, formerly with Sotheby & Co. of London, is the son of Mr. and Mrs. Stanley G. Johnson of Whitstable, Kent, England. head of the department of antiquities and ethnograph ical art at the ParkeBernet Galleries. The bridegroom, formerly with Sotheby & Co. of London, is the son of Mr. and Mrs. Stanley G. Johnson of Whitstable, Kent, England.

title: Al Douglas, Restaurateur and Fight Promoter, Dies
description: William Alfred (Al) Douglas, a realtor, owner of the Red Rooster cafe in Harlem and a former fight promoter, died Sat urday after a brief illness while vacationing at St. Croix, Virgin Islands. He was 74 years old and lived in Englewood Cliffs, N.J.

title: HOUSE COMMITTEE VOTES FOR CHANGE IN TRADE POLICIES
description: WASHINGTON, July 14The House Ways and Means Commit tee approved today a many sided trade bill that would sub stantially alter the nation's 35yearold policy of gradual re duction of trade barriers.

title: Article 2  No Title
description: GIVING BEGETS JOY. GIVE FRESH AIR FUND.

title: BALANCE OF TRADE SAGS FOR BRITAIN
description: LONDON, July 14Britain's trade position took an unex pected turn for the worse last month.

title: 50 Giants and Jets Rookies Never Had Things So Good
description: The Giants and the Jets didn't plan it this way, but their football seasons will open today with extremely personalized inspection for 50 young players.

title: 9 Canadians Die as Cargo Vessel Sinks in the Seaway
description: MASSENA, N. Y., July 14 The Canadian lake freighter lastcliffe Hall, bound from Quebec to Michigan with a Cargo of pig iron, sank after going on a shoal in the St. Lawrence Seaway early today. Vine of the 21 persons aboard ost their lives.

title: Pension Plan Survey
description: WASHINGTON, July 14 (AP) Leaders of a Senate labor subcommittee announced today the start of a survey of private pension plans. Senator Harrison A. Williams Jr., Democrat of New Jersey, the subcommittee chairman, and Senator Jacob K. Javits, Republican of New York, the ranking majority member, announced the action jointly.

title: SHAKEUP SHIFTS POLICE IN NEWARK
description: NEWARK, July 14A major shakeup in the top levels of the Newark Police Department was announced today by its new di rector, John L. Redden.

title: Supreme Soviet Opens
description: MOSCOW, July 14The newly elected Supreme Soviet, the national legislature, today opened a session that will en dorse a new government and adopt a labor code designed to tighten worker discipline.

title: After 146 Years, a London Raphael Is Authenticated
description: LONDON, July 14  For years, the National Gallery's portrait of Pope Julius II, dulled by the dirt of centu ries, had been considered no more than a good copy.

title: Cab Driver Wounded
description: Robert Horan, a 29yearold cab driver for the Super Cab Company of Queens, was re ported in fair condition early this morning at Harlem Hospi tal after he was shot during an unsuccessful robbery attempt. Three men whom he had picked up at Seventh Avenue and West 145th Street escaped after the shoooting.

title: 3 NAVAL OFFICERS GET COURT SETBACK
description: WASHINGTON, July 14 (AP) Three junior naval officers have met a setback in efforts to block their early discharge that the Navy acknowledged stemmed in part from their antiwar activities.

title: DANIEL A. MULVIHILL, SURGEONS' OFFICER
description: COEUR D'ALENE, Idaho, July 14Dr. Daniel A. Mulvi hill, assistant director of the American College of Surgeons, died here Saturday after at tending a meeting of the col lege. He was 67 years old and lived in Chicago.

title: News on Air Experiments to Seek More Listeners
description: Changes, some permanent, others undertaken as trials, are taking place among the city's television and radio news or ganizations.

title: Knicks' Player Divorced
description: LOS ANGELES, July 14 (AP) Mrs. David Stallworth, wife of the New York Knickerbocker basketball player, was granted a default divorce today in Su perior Court. The court award ed Mrs. Stallworth $500 a month in alimony, $300 a month child support and custody of the couple's 6yearold daugh ter, Dana.

title: New Envoy to Cambodia
description: WASHINGTON, July 14 When Emory Coblentz Swank first heard that he would be named by President Nixon as United States Ambassa dor to Cambodia he reacted in the low key that has al ways marked his career as a Foreign Service officer.

title: Symonette Yachting Victor
description: HANKOE, Norway, July 14 (UPI)Robert H. Symonette of the Bahamas won the King Olav Cup for 5.5meter yachts today. Symonette, also a member of the New York Yacht Club, sailed his boat, John B., to victory in all three races.

title: Major League Baseball
description: Wednesday, July 15, 1970

title: McCreary, 14, Triumphs Again in Larchmont Sail
description: LARCHMONT, N. Y., July 14 Sailors 13 to 17 years of age nursed 279 boats round tri angular courses in a wavering southerly breeze today at the Larchmont Yacht Club's Race Week. The second of three re gattas set aside for juniors was thus gratefully completed as the wind held up a lot better than it did yesterday when con ditions were abysmal.

title: Deal Unites 4 Agencies in 3 Cities
description: Today is the day that four agencies in three cities offi cially pull off a merger. And yesterday, even before it was official, switchboard operators at Bishopric/Green/Fielden, Miami; Lieberman Associates, Allentown, Pa.; and Bishopric/ Lieberman and Lester Harrison Advertising, New York, were already getting in practice by answering calls with, Bishopric, Lieberman, Harrison & Fielden.

title: VIRGINIA PRIMARY WON BY LIBERAL
description: RICHMOND, Wednesday, July 15In a primary election marked by massive voter indif ference, George C. Rawlings Jr., one of Virginia's most liberal Democrats, apparently squeaked to victory yesterday in his bid to be his party's candidate for the United States Senate this fall.

title: U.S. ASKS U.N. ACTION ON DRUG ADDICTION
description: GENEVA, July 14The Unit ed States urged the United Nations today to convene its narcotic drugs commission in special session to map plans to combat the disastrous spread of drug addiction.

title: MORRIS W. KUZBYT
description: EWING TOWNSHIP, N. J., July 14 (AP)Morris W. Kuz byt, state adjutant of the New Jersey American Legion, died yesterday at Mercer Hospital. He was 52 years old and lived here at Ranchwood Drive.

title: Ulster Chief Voices Thanks For Peace on Orange Day
description: BELFAST, Northern Ireland, July 14 (UPI) Prime Minister James ChichesterClark thanked British troops, Northern Ire land's security forces and the people of the province today for having maintained the peace during yesterday's Orange Day celebrations by Protestants.

title: OSCAR HEYMAN
description: Oscar Heyman, founder and head of Oscar Heyman & Broth ers, Inc., a New York jewelry manufacturing concern, died Monday at Beth Israel Hospital after a long illness. He was 81 years old and lived at 1165 Park Avenue.

title: Everybody Agrees All the Close Ones Are Tough to Lost
description: CINCINNATI, July 14It's only an exhibition game, every hardened baseball man knows that, and it's an honor to participate and no disgrace to lose but the American Leaguers acted just as disap pointed after their 12inning loss to the National League tonight as if they had lost game that hurt them in the league standing and in the pocketbook.

title: News Summary and Index
description: WEDNESDAY, JULY 15, 1970

title: CURB ON WAR AID BACKED IN SENATE
description: WASHINGTON, July 14The Senate Armed Services Com mittee has adopted restrictive language intended to keep the Administration from using De fense Department funds for in direct support of the Cam bodian Government.

title: Film Library Hopes to Preserve Plays by Videotape
description: Film or videotape records of Broadway and Off Broad way shows, to be used pri marily for r??earch, educa tional and historical pur poses, are being planned by the film library of the New York Public Library at Lin coln Center.

title: NO LABOR UNREST AT CAMP OF BULLS
description: HEMPSTEAD, L.I., July 15 While the wealthy players and wealthier owners of the Na tional Football League jockeyed for position in their labor dispute, the real working class of football went into action at Nassau Community College to day.

title: Comunity Aide Named
description: Mayor Lindsay announced the appointment yesterday of Nestor Llamas as deputy com missioner of the Community Development Agency, a part of the human resources adminis tration. Mr. Llamas, a former high school export from East Harlem, had been acting ad ministrator for the Northeast region of the United States Office of Economic Opportun ity's community action pro gram. He succeeds Felix Cosme, who resigned from the $27,460 ayear post.

title: Article 1  No Title
Depleted Jets Bank on New Standby at Quarterback
description: HEMPSTEAD, L. I., July 15 Deprived of their experi enced quarterbacks by the pro football labor dispute, the New York Jets signed Bill Kushner, a 23yearold product of the Continental League, today in order to fa cilitate practice sessions.

title: Hijacking Foiled, Brazil Says
description: BRASILIA, July 15 (UPI) The police said today that they had foiled a plane hijacking for the second time this month. They reported the arrest of a Peruvian national, Fernando Vilarian Pajares. 43 years old, at the airport in Belem, and said he had tried to board a Cruzeiro do Sul turboprop plane with a gun strapped to one leg.

title: RENEWAL PROJECT NEARS APPROVAL
description: A commercial complex in Brooklyn's downtown area including three towers and covered pedestrian mall above Fulton Street  was started toward almost certain approval by the City Planning Commis sion yesterday.

title: VIEWERS WISTFUL AT GIANTS' CAMP
description: BROOKVILLE, L. I., July 15  Seventyfive fans and one New York Giant stared wist fully over a fence today as the football training season be Ian.

title: PUBLISHERS DELAY WRIT ON MAILERS
description: Representatives of the city's four major newspapers and the New York Mailers Union No. 6 failed last night to settle a con tract impasse that has led the mailers to threaten to strike The Daily News at 12.01 A.M. tomorrow.

title: Dr. Eric Berne Dies on Coast; Author of Games People Play
description: MONTEREY, Calif., July 15 (AP)  Dr. Eric Berre, the psychiatrist who wrote the best selling book Games People Play, died in a hospital here today after having suffered a heart attack two weeks ago. He was 60 years old.

title: House Panel Says the Army Hampered Investigation Into Songmy Incident
description: WASHINGTON, July 15  Members of a House panel that investigated the alleged mass killing of Vietnamese civilians at Songmy stepped up their criticism of the Army today, contending that it had ham pered their investigation.

title: BRITAIN AND FRANCE BACK JARRING ROLE
description: PARIS, July 15  The For eign Ministers of Britain and France agreed here today that the United Nations should make a fresh peacemaking drive in the Middle East, high ly placed diplomats reported.

title: Belgrade's Ties With Peking Improve
description: BELGRADE, Yugoslavia July 11The slow but significant improvement in relations be tween Yugoslavia and Commu nist China, nations that scorned each other for a dozen years, is being delayed by China's unex plained failure to name an Am bassador to Belgrade.

title: Science Bill Sent to Nixon
description: WASHINGTON, July 15 (AP) The House sent to President Nixon today a compromise bill to authorize appropriations of $537.7million for the present fiscal year for the National Sci ence Foundation, The bill pro vides no financing.

title: OneActers Focus on Sex and Soldier's Letters
Lag in Building a Factor
description: Earnings of the International Paper Company fell 3.5 per cent in the second quarter and 5.59 per cent in the first half, re flecting the depressed condition of the residential building ma terials market, the company re ported yesterday.

title: 13th Boys' Towns of Italy Ball Set
description: WESTBURY, L. I., July 15 The NassauSuffolk Com mittee of Boys' Towns of Italy will hold its 13th an nual International Summer Ball on July 26 at the Cloud Casino at Roosevelt Raceway here.

title: Simon & Schuster Ready to Aid Orphaned Literary Quarterly
description: New American Review, the latest literary quarterly to be left out in the cold, may have found a foster home in Simon & Schuster, Inc., the 46year old publishing house that just terminated merger negotiations with Norton Simon, Inc.

title: Navy Awards Contract
description: The General Dynamics Corpo ration's electric boat division was awarded a $60.5million Navy contract for refeuling and Poseidon missile conversion of two submarines.

title: Griffith Gains Unanimous Decision Over Dick Tiger in 10Rounder at Garden
description: Defiantly dropping his guard, or taunting Dick Tiger with mincing steps and the Ali Shuffle, Emile Griffith streaked to a unanimous 10round deci sion at Madison Square Garden last night.

title: NO SABOTAGE FOUND IN REUTHER CRASH
description: WASHINGTON, July 15 (AP)  The National Transportation Safety Board said today that had found no indication of sab otage to explain the jet air taxi crash that killed Walter P. Reu ther his wife and four other persons May 9.

title: Joe, an East Village Tale, Arrives
Lutherans Hear Cardinal; Joint Unity Effort Is Asked
description: EVIANLESBAINS, France, July 15 (AP)  A Vatican Cardinal proposed today that Lutheran leaders join with the Roman Catholic Church in new efforts toward achieving Chris tian unity.

title: Hotel in Village Step to Nowhere
description: The Greenwich Hotel had room for Anthony Cortez one recent night, his first outside the walls of Rikers Island prison in a year, but he chose to sleep in the park.

title: ALASKAN NATIVES VOTED $1BILLION BY SENATE, 768
description: WASHINGTON, July 15  The Senate overwhelmingly passed today a bill granting the native peoples of Alaska  In dians, Eskimos and Aleuts 10 million acres and $1billion cash compensation in settle ment of a centuryold claim. The vote was 76 to 8.

title: Miss Brennan, Paul Van Hook Plan to Marry
description: Col. Martin J. Brennan, U.S.A., retired, and Mrs. Brennan of Parkchester, the Bronx, have announced the engagement of their daugh ter, Miss Barbara Judge Bren nan, to Paul Elliott Van Hook of New York, son of Mrs. Elliott Boyd Van Hook of Bryn Mawr, Pa., and the late Mr. Van Hook.

title: Cincinnati Disputes Census
description: CINCINNATI, July 15 (UPI) City Manager Richard L. Kra bach has rejected the Federal Government's 1970 census fig ure for Cincinnati and said that the city would have to take its own count to show its popula tion has not dropped below the halfmillion mark.

title: Advertising: Harper Out of Rosenfeld Post
description: Marion Harper Jr. has re signed as president of six monthold Harper Rosenfeld Sirowitz because of the pressures of his other busi ness activities. That was the announcement made yester day by Ron Rosenfeld and Len Sirowitz, the new presi dent.

title: Tanker Is Launched
description: BALTIMORE, July 15  The 62,000ton tanker Overseas Alaska was launched today at Sparrows Point yard of the Bethlehem Steel Corporation. The 731foot, 15.5knot ship is owned by Intercontinental Bulktank Corporation, a sub sidiary of Overseas Shipholding Group, Inc.

title: Mila Schon Joins the Oriental Bandwagon, and Rome Shouts Bravo
description: ROME, July 15Two of their girls have made it and the Italian fashion world is blissful. Mila Schon's collec tion has boosted local pride and stimulated descriptive powers. Everybody is shout ing brava and meravigliosa (marvelous) and lauding her technical brilliance and archi tectural style.

title: Nicklaus Tunes Up For $150,000 Golf With ProAmateur
description: WHITEMARSH, Pa., July 15 Three days after winning the British Open title, Jack Nicklaus was back on the American pro tour today. Happy but tired, he teamed in the proamateur pre liminary to tomorrow's $150,000 Philadelphia Classic at the Whitemarsh Valley Country Club with three amateur part ners he had not met previously.

title: Mexican Congress Weighs Bill To Raise Terrorism Penalties
description: MEXICO CITY, July 15The Mexican Congress was called into special session today to consider a proposed national security law that would sharply increase penalties for terrorism and political kidnapping.

title: Screen: A Radical Twist
Auto Union Opens Bargaining with AntiInflation Plea
description: DETROIT, July 15Leonard Woodcock, president of the United Automobile Workers, said today that a noninflation ary, equitable settlement could, be reached in the industry with out a strike.

title: JOSEPH STEWART, 52, CHEMIST FOR ESSO
description: SCOTCH PLAINS, N. J., July 15  Joseph Stewart, chair man of Project SEED, a pro gram of the American Chemical Society to train disadvantaged persons for professions in chem istry, died Saturday, apparent ly of a heart attack, in his home at 2107 Gallagher Ave nue. He was 52 years old.

title: Abortion Measure Stirs Alarm
description: City officials, physicians and leaders of what used to be the abortionrepeal movement warned the Board of Health yesterday that its proposed amendment to the City Health Code would cancel the very benefits the state's new abor tion law was designed to bring.

title: Briton Reaches High Note at Dog Shows
description: Hindley Taylor, a former opera and concert singer in Britain, hit a high note in the dog show world when one of his Pekingese, Ch. Beau of Kyratown, recently became the Briton's 300th winner of a challenge certificate. That made Taylor the first exhi bitor of any breed in his native land to reach that fig ure since World War II. No. 299 was Ch. Althea Peri of Kyra town, who was named best of breed at Cruft's. native land to reach that fig ure since World War II. No. 299 was Ch. Althea Peri of Kyra town, who was named best of breed at Cruft's.

title: BAR PANEL BACKS NIXON CRIME BILL
description: CHICAGO, July 15The Board of Governors of the American Bar Association approved in principle tonight President Nix on's organized crime control legislation but suggested that several sections be amended.

title: U.S. Trackmen Take Lead
description: STUTTGART, Germany. July 15 (AP)The United States men's track and field team built a slim 5848 lead over West Germany tonight.

title: Rosaria Vignolo Is Bride in Genoa
description: Miss Rosaria Vignolo, daughter of Mr. and Airs. Paolo Vignolo of Genoa, Italy was married there yes terday to Eric Mallory Mun son, son of Mr. and Mrs. Paul English Munson of Scar borough, N. Y. The ceremony was performed in the Church of the Cappuccini.

title: City Bids Landlords Defy Their Leadership in Strike
description: Mayor Lindsay's administration called on landlords yes terday to reject their leadership in the 10dayold apartment strike. The statement came after a meeting between the landlord group and union leaders failed to make any progress toward agreement.

title: Waterfowl Population Up
description: WASHINGTON, July 15 (UPI) The Interior Department re ports that aerial surveys in Canadian and United States nesting areas have found the highest populations of breed ingage waterfowl in recent years.

title: Atomic Power: A Bitter Controversy
description: DENVER, July 15For the first time since the beginning of the nuclear age 25 years ago tomorrow, the powerful and onceunquestioned inter ests that have grown up around this nation's atomic technology are being forced onto the defensive by a ris ing public clamor for reform.

title: Hebrew Union College Head To Give Up Position in 1972
description: CINCINNATI, July 15  Dr. Nelson Glueck will retire from the presidency of the Hebrew Union CollegeJewish Institute of Religion July 1, 1972. He will retain the title of chancel lor.

title: Greece Said to End Ban On Travel by Niarchos
description: ATHENS, July 15A spokes man for Stavros Niarchos said tonight that the Greek Govern ment had lifted the travel re striction imposed on the Greek shipping millionaire after the death on May 4 of his 42year old wife.

title: Maxwell House Increases Wholesale Coffee Prices
description: The Maxwell House division of the General Foods Corpora tion has raised wholesale prices; of ground and soluble coffees effective today. The increase in vacuumpacked ground coffee will be 2 cents a pound. Soluble coffee will be increased I cent an ounce.

title: Chess:
Personal Finance: Money Dispenser
description: The innovative City Na tional Bank or Columbus, Ohio, is firmly convinced that women of all ages particularly those of bank ing agelove Paul Newman, the actor.

title: NEGRO POLITICIAN SLAIN IN MISSOURI
description: KANSAS CITY, Mo., July 15 Leon M. Jordan, one of Missouri's leading Negro poli ticians, was killed early today by three shotgun blasts fired from a car.

title: MEYER L. PRENTIS, G. M. EXECUTIVE
description: DETROIT, July 15Meyer L. Prentis, who retired in 1951 as treasurer of General Motors Corporation, after helping guide the concern through its forma tive years, died today on his 84th birthday, after a long ill ness.

title: DR. CARE PRUTTON; LED IN CHEMISTRY
description: Dr. Carl F. Prutton, an edu cator, inventor and industrial leader in the field of chemis try, died yesterday at the Co lumbia  Presbyterian Medical Center after a long illness. He was 71 years old and lived in Key Biscayne, Fla.

title: Court Declares Pastrana Colombia's PresidentElect
description: BOGOTA, Colombia, July 15 (Reuters)  Misael Pastran 1Borrero, a 46yearold lawyer and economist, was named Presidentelect of Colombia to day by the Supreme Electoral Court.

title: Major League Baseball
description: Thursday, July 16, 1970

title: LINCOLN HOSPITAL HEARS DEMANDS
description: Members of the Young Lords and administrators of Lincoln Hospital yesterday discussed some of the demands made by the group during its occupation of part of the Bronx hospital on Tuesday.

title: Looming Trade War
description: There is growing danger that the protectionist drive in Congress will ensnarl the United States in a trade war with the European Common Market and create grave problems for future relations between the world's two most important trading areas. Even more broadly, if protectionism takes command in this coun try, it could initiate a worldwide disruption of trade capable of threatening prosperity in many countries.

title: Both Sides in South Mistrust Nixon Actions on School Integration
description: JACKSON, Miss., July 15 The Nixon Administration's lat est actions on school desegrega tion in the South have aroused anger on one side and sus picion on the other.

title: HOFFMAN SENTENCED IN TWO CASES HERE
description: Abbie Hoffman, the Yippie leader, pleaded guilty in Crimi nal Court yesterday to resisting arrest during a Black Panther rally here in the spring of 1969. He was sentenced by Judge Arthur Braun to the maximum terma year in jail or a $1,000 fine.

title: The Proceedings In the U.N. Today
Reared in the Food Business but Still Experimenting in Kitchen
description: SANTA ANA, Calif.Rob ert Lawrence Balzer, a fine cook who was ordained as a Buddhist monk and has been a pilot, painter, writer, for eign correspondent, restaura teur, and the operator of a famous specialty food mar ket, is fondest of describing himself as a professional wine expert.

title: Cabinet in Madrid Periled by Scandal
description: MADRID, July 15Spain's Supreme Court has voted to indict two dismissed Cabinet ministers in a financial scan dal and has asked Parliament to lift the immunity of the head of the Bank of Spain so that he, too, may be prosecuted, re liable sources disclosed today.

title: Carol A. Johnston To Marry Aug. 11
description: OLD LYME, Conn., July 15 Miss Carol Andrews John ston and Amos Galpin will marry here Aug. 11.

title: SPAIN WINS DOUBLES, CLINCHES CUP TENNIS
description: BARCELONA, Spain, July 15 (AP)  Manuel Santana and Juan Gisbert defeated Yugo slavia's Zeljko Franulovic and Nicola Spear in doubles today to give Spain an unbeatable 30 lead in the European Zone A Davis Cup tennis final.

title: FRITZ HESS
description: GENEVA, July 15 Fritz Hess, director of the Universal Postal Union from 1949 until his retirement in 1961 died to day in Uetendorf, a village near Lake Thum. He was 75 years old.

title: Danielle Darrieux Prepares for Coco
description: PARISDanielle Darrieux, the piquant, titianblonde star of the French cinema, arrived in New York recently to begin rehearsals for the title role of Coco.

title: College Entrance Unit Names Vice President
description: The appointment of Dr. Stephen J. Wright, former president of the United Negro College Fund, as vice presi dent of the College Entrance Examination Board was an nounced yesterday.

title: Siemreap, Near Angkor Temples, Has Become a Besieged Camp
description: SIEMREAP, Cambodia July 15This besieged town near the Angkor temples has be come an armed camp, with mortar and rocket fire likely to strike by day and by night. Civilian life has become an incongruity among the gun positions, entrenchments and soldiers, and amid the recur rent sound of smallarms fire.

title: ROGERS SEES HOPE FOR VIETNAM TALK
description: WASHINGTON, July 15  Secretary of State William P. Rogers, in an apparent effort to move his position on Viet nam closer to that of the White House, said today that there were reasonable pros pects for the peace negotia tions in the long run but that the shortrun prospects were not bright.

title: Anticrime Bill for Capital Passed by House, 33264
description: WASHINGTON, July 15 (UPI) A compromise version of the Administration's anticrime bill for the nation's capital cleared the House today. It includes controversial noknock and preventive detention provisions.

title: 20 Families Are Evacuated By a Fire in Brownsville
description: Two multiplealarm fires in the Brownsville and Williams burg section of Brooklyn were put under control just before last midnight.

title: SIEGFRIED H. REIGER, OFFICER OF COMSAT
description: WASHINGTON, July 15 (AP) Siegfried H. Reiger, vice presidenttechnical of the Com munications Satellite Corpora tion, died at his home here yes terday. He was 50 years old.

title: CHATTANOOGA PAPER ASKS LAWSUIT'S END
description: CHATTANOOGA, July 15 (AP)The Chattanooga News Free Press, an evening news paper, filed a motion in United States District Court today seeking the dismissal of a $21 mil lion antitrust countersuit filed by the publisher of the paper's morning rival, The Chattanooga Times.

title: FrenchAmerican Relations Get A Bit Tacky in Trot Workouts
News Summary and Index
description: THURSDAY, JULY 16, 1970

title: Crisis on the Campus
description: The effort to politicize American higher education, along with the demonstrations of student unrest, have dominated public thinking about the nation's univer sities and colleges. But for those responsible for the operation of these institutions, the much less publicized financial squeeze on the campus is now an even more intense preoccupation.

title: Joseph H. Spring, Officer Of Dog Show Organization
description: GLEN RIDGE, Pa., July 15 Joseph H. Spring, a director of the Foley Dog Show Organiza tion, Inc., of Philadelphia, died yesterday in Misericordia Hos pital, Philadelphia, of emphyse ma. He was 62 years old. The Foley organization superintends dog shows nationally.

title: WESTIE NAMED BEST IN NEW HAMPSHIRE
STATE MOTOR UNIT TO SPEED SERVICE
description: ALBANY, July 15The De partment of Motor Vehicles has ordered its issuing offices to introduce a series of innova tions to speed service and re duce the time citizens must spend on vehicle transactions.

title: Doctor Gets Hospital Award
description: CHICAGO, July 15 (AP)A Richmond hospital administra tor, Dr. Charles P. Cardwell Jr., was named today to re ceive the American Hospital As sociation's Distinguished Serv ice Award.

title: Carlos to Have Knee Surgery
description: PHILADELPHIA, July 15 (UPI) John Carlos, the Olympic sprinter who has taken up pro football with the Philadelphia Eagles, will undergo surgery to morrow to repair a torn liga ment in the right knee, suffered yesterday while running, and will not be able to resume prac tice for at least six weeks.

title: New York Life Elects
description: George B. Munroe, president and chief executive officer of the Phelps Dodge Corporation has been elected to the hoard of the New York Life Insurance Company.

title: THAI AIDE QUESTIONS RELIABILITY OF U.S.
description: BANGKOK, Thailand, July 15 (AP)Foreign Minister Thanat Khoman suggested today that the United States was on the verge of a national mental breakdown that had affected its reliability as an ally.

title: A Newsroom Is Hinted for Channel 13
description: It is likely that a Ford Foun dationfunded Newsroom is in Channel 13's near future. The nightly news program, once es tablished, could become the focus of an interconnected pub lic television news network.

title: BOTH OF BOND BIDS REJECTED BY CITY
description: New York City rejected the two bids it received yesterday for $170.18million of bonds because of a clerical mistake, and it rescheduled the sale July 28.

title: For Peace: Public Outcry Rises
description: Because of its long military history, the Atomic Energy Commission has traditionally cited national security and operated in secret, holding the public at arm's length and sup plying only those facts it chose to release.

title: Continental Can Net Rose in 2d Quarter
description: The Continental Can Com pany reported record earnings yesterday and increased the dividend.

title: Mrs.Grant Seeks Separation
description: Mrs. Bess Myerson Grant, the city's Commissioner of Con sumer Affairs, began a separa tion suit yesterday in State Supreme Court in Manhattan against her husband, Arnold Grant. Stanley Plesent, a part ner in the law firm of Squadron & Plesent, representing Mrs. Grant, said Mr. and Mrs. Grant had agreed that there would be no comment on the case.

title: Monsanto's Earnings Fall 25%; Net of International Paper Down
Office Building Plans Divide a Town
description: ARMONK, N. Y., July 15 Residents of the sparsely pop ulated town of North Castle, with its treecovered hills and winding country roads, are bitterly debating a pro posal that could bring six corporate headquarters and more than 4,000 cars in peak hours to a residential neigh borhood on its border with Greenwich. Conn.

title: A Correction
description: In an article published in the Judy 12 issue of The New York Times, the corporate affiliation 01 Ring Brothers, a Los An seles apartment building con cern, was incorrectly reported. Ring Brothers is a subsidiary of Monogram Industries, Inc., a diversified Los Angeles com pany.

title: I.M.F. Debt and Drawings To Give Italy $463Million
description: WASHINGTON, July 15The International Monetary Fund announced today a combined drawing and debt repayment that will provide $463million to Italy.

title: TORONTO CRASH LAID TO PRELANDING FLAW
description: OTTAWA, July 14 (Canadian Press)Transport Minister Don Jamieson announced today that improper prelanding procedure in the cockpit of the Air Can ada DC8 that crashed in To ronto on July 5 caused the in itial runway impact that led to the death of 109 persons mo ments later.

title: Miss Wilson To Be a Bride
description: ROCHESTER, July 15Jo seph Chamberlain Wilson, board chairman of the Xerox Corporation and Mrs. Wilson have announced the engage ment of their daughter. Miss Deirdre Wilson, to Joseph Walter Garton, son of Mr. and Mrs. Robert E. Garton of Sheboygan. Wis.

title: F.C.C. CONSIDERS CHANGE IN RULES
description: WASHINGTON, July 15The Federal Communications Com mission suggested today that the fertile new field of spe cialized communications serv icessuch things as data net works and privateline phone hookups for businesseswill develop best through open competition.

title: For War: Output Up
description: The eight interlocked weap ons production plants of the Atomic Energy Commission, scattered from Colorado to. Florida, are currently under going a $314million expansion.

title: Songmy Defendant Says Nixon Sways Army Court
description: ATLANTA, July 15  A threejudge Federal court was told today that Sgt. Esequiel Torres, accused a murder in Songmy, South Vietnam, could not receive a fair trial in any American military court be cuase President Nixon had al ready declared him guilty.

title: Letters to the Editor of The Times
description: Administration Policy

title: Reform Drive in Congress Stalled in House by Dispute
description: WASHINGTON, July 15 (AP) The drive for Congressional reform bogged down today in the House in a dispute over the number of committee staff members the Republicans should have.

title: Industrial Output Decline For June Checked a Bit
description: WASHINGTON, July 15 The Federal Reserve Board's Index of Industrial Production declined again in June, though by somewhat less than in each of the preceding two months, the board announced today.

title: Les Halles Onion Soup Still Lures a Few Visitors
description: PARIS, July 13  The great iron sheds and the streets around them that constituted Les Halles, one of the world's most famous central markets, are mostly dark and silent these nights.

title: Members of Presidential Panel Question Witnesses on Campus Unrest
description: WASHINGTON, July 15  There can be no peace on the nation's campuses until there is peace in Vietnam, witness after witness told the President's Commission on Campus Unrest today.

title: 3 Italian Workers Killed
description: REMPEN, Switzerland, July 15 (Reuters)  Three Italian workers were killed at a hydro electric power station here to day when a torrent of water swept them down a water duct into the station's turbines. Six workers were cleaning the empty duct when the water suddenly swirled through. Two waded to safety and a third was thrown clear.

title: N.E.T. PLANS 3 HOURS ON UNREST HEARINGS
description: Three onehour programs, condensing the day's testimony from the public hearings of the President's Commission on Student Unrest, will be broad cast by National Educational Television tonight, tomorrow and Friday at 10 P.M. on the public television network. In New York, the programs will be carried on WNDT, Channel 13 at 10:30 P.M.

title: MUGGINGS DISTURB BORSTAL BOY CAST
description: As the audience arrived for last night's performance of the Broadway play Borstal Boy at the Lyceum Theater, Peter Hock, one of the actors, stood backstage and told why the cast is nervous when the cur tain goes down these nights.

title: Laver, Seeking His Lost Touch, Plays Rosewall Here Tonight
description: Rod Layer says he is hu man after all.

title: Mrs. Wolf Remarried
description: NEW CITY, N.Y., July 15 Mrs. Dorothy E. E. Wolf of Bournemouth, England, and Ocho Rios, Jamaica, was married today to Stephen G. Doig, a lawyer and town justice of Clarkstown. The ceremony was performed at Mr. Doig's home by the Rev. Warren Martens, minister of the Clarkstown Reform Church. Mr. Doig, a widower, is a former State Assembly man and County Attorney of Rockland County. Mrs. Doig was a widow.

title: First Black Mayor of Dayton, Ohio
description: DAYTON, Ohio, July 15 A young reporter from a black weekly asked James H. McGee today to react to a charge by militants that he does not take a stand on issues involving the black community.

title: Miss Susan Vartanian Is Fiancee
description: OAKLAND, Calif., July 15 The engagement of Miss Susan Vartaniant, an invest ment officer at Standard & Poor's counseling corpora. tion, Intercapital, Inc., in New York, to J. William Barba, a member of the law firm of Shanley & Fisher in Newark and Washington, has been announced by the pro spective bride's parents, Mr. and Mrs. Andranik Vartanian.

title: TWO SHARE LEAD IN JERSEY AT 71
description: WESTFIELD, N. J., July 15 The Echo Lake Country Club, a 6,692yard, par72 layout, has narrow fairways and a two inch growth of rough.

title: West Germans Cut Central Bank Rate From 7% to 7%
description: BONN, July 15Swiftly re sponding to Government action against inflation, West Ger many's central bank eased its brakes on the economy today, lowering the bank discount rate from 7 per cent to 7 per cent, effective tomorrow. This is the basic rate at which commercial banks can borrow from the central bank.

title: Sports Today
description: BASEBALL

title: Poor in Corinth, Miss., Get Trainload of Housing
description: CORINTH, Miss., July 15  An official of the Department of Housing and Urban Develop ment today called this north eastern Mississippi town of 14, 000 the national pacesetter in the providing of new low income housing.

title: Boy, 3. Shot Dead in Crib; Bronx Sniper Is Sought
description: A 3yearold Bronx child was fatally shot in his crib early this morning in an apartment at 375 East 159th Street in the Morrisania section of the: Bronx.

title: Soviet Renames Kosygin And Podgorny to Posts
description: MOSCOW, July 15The Supreme Soviet today reap pointed Premier Aleksei N. Kosygin and President Nikolai V. Podgorny, keeping intact the collective leadership structure established after Nikita S. Khrushchev was deposed in October, 1964. established after Nikita S. Khrushchev was deposed in October, 1964.

title: Calcutta Theater Ticket Aide Is Charged With Accepting Ice
description: The boxoffice treasurer at the Eden Theater, where Oh! Calcutta! is playing, has been accused by New York State Attorney General. Louis J. Lefkowitz, of exacting ice or payments over the listed pricefor tickets to the Off Broadway hit.

title: Ottinger Plans U. S. Suit
description: WASHINGTON, July 15  Representative Richard L. Ot Linger, the Democratic candi date for United States Senator from New York, announced plans today to sue the Federal Government to compel the Jus tice Department to enforce an 1899 antipollution law.

title: Promoter, Who Gave Away Bits of Outer Space, Dies
description: OAK LAWN, Ill., July 15 (AP) James T. Mangan, an indus trial designer and promotion consultant, who once laid claim to all the universe except the earth because nobody else had claimed it, died last night in convalescent home. He was 73 years old.

title: Even the Infant Enjoyed ChristeningIn Central Park
description: Like all proper babies, Christabelle Nita Arndt wore a long white dress at her christening and cried when the water was poured on her head. But that was all that was usual about her christen ing on Tuesday evening.

title: WITTER AND PAINE EXPLORE MERGER
description: Dean Witter & Co. and Paine. Webber, Jackson & Curtis, two of the nation's largest broker age houses, are discussing a possible merger.

title: 7 L.I. Children Die In Camp Bus Crash
description: ALLENTOWN, Pa., July 15 Seven children were killed and 52 other persons injured today when a chartered bus carrying youngsters and counselors from a day camp in Lawrence, L.I., skidded off a rainslick high way near here.

title: Monmouth Jockeys
Addonizio's Lawyers to Recall Key Witness for Prosecution
description: TRENTON, July 15  Law yers defending Hugh J. Addo nizio, former Mayor of New ark, and four other men on trial here for extortion and conspiracy, said today that they would recall Paul Rigo, the prosecution's key witness tomorrow to authenticate ac counting records and other documents.

title: Currents Hamper Search For 5 Bodies in Seaway
description: CORNWALL, Ontario, July 15 (AP)Strong currents hamper ed the search today for the bodies of five persons still miss ing from the sunken Eastcliffe Hall laker, which sunk yester day in the St. Lawrence Sea way 18 miles west of here.

title: STOCK PRICES RISE ON A BROAD FRONT
description: The stock market moved hack into the winning column yesterday as prices advanced on a broad front in more ac tive trading.

title: IRATE AUTO WORKER KILLS 3 AT FACTORY
description: DETROIT, July 15 (UPI)A suspended auto worker ran shooting through an axle plant of the Chrysler Corporation to day and killed three workers in his search for the foremen he felt were responsible for his dismissal.

title: OPEN LETTER
description: To the Revisions Editor of the Standard American Dictionary Sir:

title: 2 POLICEMEN HELD IN $100,000 THEFT
description: Two policemen were arrested here yesterday in the alleged theft of $100,000 that was said to have been turned over to them in a brown paper bag by a man who said he found the money hidden in his car.

title: GEN. SHENG, 75, DIES; EXSINKIANG OFFICIAL
description: Gen. Sheng Shihtsai, a war lord who controlled the vast, strategic province of Sinkiang in western China during the 1930's and 1940's, died on Tuesday in Taiwan. He was 75 years old.

title: Abrams Leaves Hospital
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, July 15 (AP)  Gen. Creighton W. Abrams, United States com mander in South Vietnam, was released from an Army hospital in Japan today after recovering from a gall bladder operation July 3, his headquarters an nounced. released from an Army hospital in Japan today after recovering from a gall bladder operation July 3, his headquarters an nounced.

title: Lonborg Off Disabled List
description: BOSTON, July 15 (UPI)Jim Lonborg, Red Sox hurler who had been sidelined with a shoulder injury, has been taken off the disabled list and Jose Santiago has been optioned to Louisville to make room for him on the roster, the Boston club said today. Santiago was sent to the International League club with instructions he be used as a starting pitcher.

title: Bishop Freed by China Tells of Ordeal
description: HONG KONG, Thursday, July Still shaky from the effects of 12 years' imprisonment in Communist China, the Most Rev. James Edward Walsh told newsmen here today of his ordeal, including a grueling year and a half of interrogation and trial that ended in his sen tencing to a 20yearjail term in Shanghai.

title: WORKSHOPS PLANNED IN COMMUNICATIONS
description: RUTHERFORD, N. J., July 15 A new program in communi cations at Fairleigh Dickinson University, with radio, televi sion and newspaper workshops and a course on the philosophy and practice of journalism, was announced here today by J. Osborn Fuller, president of the university.

title: PENNSY HEARING SET FOR JULY 23
description: PHILADELPHIA, July 15  Federal Judge John P. Fullam set today a hearing for July 23 at which nine banks that are depositories of the Penn Cen tral Transportation Company have been ordered to show cause why they should not be held in contempt of the court's orders for refusing to release $4,512,000 of the railroad's de posits.

title: Soviet Musician Defects On a Tour in Argentina
description: BUENOS AIRES, July 15 (UPI)The Argentine police said today that the first violinist of the Moscow Phil harmonic Orchestra, Naum Fruman had asked for polit ical asylum.

title: DR. FRANCIS A. FREETH
description: LONDON, July 15Dr. Fran cis A. Freeth, a British indus trial scientist, died today at Church Crookham, Hampshire. He was 86 years old.

title: Warships of 5 Nations To Be Displayed Here
description: Ship buffs here will be able to board five warships, flying the flags of the United States, Portugal, Britain, Ca nada and West Germany, this weekend.

title: Alamogordo Plus 25
description: Just before dawn, in the desert near Alamogordo, New Mexico, 25 years ago today, the age of nuclear weapons was born. Those who watched that first atomic bomb explosion were stunned and awed by the giant fireball. One of them, William L. Laurence of this newspaper, described it as a burst of flame such as had never before been seen on this planet, illuminating earth and sky for a brief span that seemed eternal with the light of many supersuns. But secrecy veiled that first test. Not until a few weeks later, when atomic bombs wiped out Hiroshima and Nagasaki, did men all over the world learn what a fateful milestone in human history had been passed.

title: Wanted: A New Sanitation Chief
description: I The city returned yesterday to a familiar tasksearching for a new Sanitation Commis sioner. After trying politicians, managers and engineers in the post, top officials of the Lind say administration are uncer tain now who can handle it.

title: Saigon's Delegation Quits U.N. Meeting And Assails Leftists
description: UNITED NATIONS, N.Y., July 15The five South Viet namese delegates to the World Youth Assembly, who have been prevented from speaking by leftistled hecklers, with drew from the conference to day and charged that they were victims of fascist maneuvers.

title: Anderson, ExTreasury Chief, Said to Have Made '57 Oil Deal
description: WASHINGTON, July 15 (AP) Just before Robert B. Ander son became Treasury Secretary in 1957, The Washington Post said tonight, he completed a deal with oilmen designed to pay him nearly $1million.

title: Weight Increase by ExSmokers Is Laid to Change in Metabolism
description: The reason most people who stop smoking gain weight is not necessarily that they eat more, a new scientific study has found, but that their bodies, in adjusting to the new smokeless routine, undergo changes that make gaining weight difficult to avoid.

title: Miss Brenda Luquer Is Betrothed
description: CAMBRIDGE, Mass., July 14Mr. and Mrs. Thatcher Payne Luquer of Cambridge and Holderness, N. H., have made known the engagement of their daughter, Miss Brenda Payne Luquer, to George Edward Iselin, son of Mr. and Mrs. Edward G. Iselin of Jackson, N. H. A fall wedding is planned.

title: JOSEPH A. MEYER
description: CINCINNATI, July 14Jo seph A. Meyer, former head football coach at Xavier Uni versity and at the University of Cincinnati, died here at his home Monday night at the age of 75.

title: Israeli Commandos Strike in Lebanon
description: TEL AVIV, Thursday, July 16 (Reuters)A military spokes man said here early today that Israeli commandos had struck into Lebanon during the night and had blown up three build ings in the village of Kafr Kala in retaliation for recent guer rilla attacks from Lebanese ter ritory. The village is west of Metulla, the northernmost Is raeli town.

title: 6 COMPANIES SET STUDY OF GAS LINE
description: A proposed $2.5billion gas pipeline stretching 2,500 miles from the North Slope of Alaska to the American Midwest will be studied by a consortium of six major United States and Canadian companies, the group announced yesterday.

title: New Bedford Curfew Lifted
description: NEW BEDFORD, Mass., July 15 (AP)Mayor George Rogers announced the end tonight of a curfew that he had imposed unday after racial disorders that included the fatal shooting of a black youth and the wound ing of three others. With the ending of the curfew, Mayor Rogers told newsmen that the residents of the black com munity in the West End agreed to remove barricades they threw up in the streets leading to the area.

title: British Ports Shut by Strike, Now Official
description: LONDON, July 15Britain's ports were shut tonight by the first national dock strike since 1926.

title: In The Nation: The Democrats in '72
description: WASHINGTON, July 15The pattern of President Nixon's re cent successful ventures out of his selfdescribed isolation booth is instructive. Knoxville, St. Louis, Louisville, Cincinnati the mere names evoke the idea of that heartland of which Mr. Nixon so often speaks. And the big crowds that have greeted him seem in large part drawn from the Middle America to which he most directly appeals.

title: Zoe Caldwell to Leave Colette to Go Abroad
description: Zoe Caldwell will withdraw from the title role in Colette after the Aug. 2 performance to fulfill a prior commitment on the London stage.

title: Ballet: Netherlanders' Retrospective
description: AMSTERDAM, the Nether lands, July 15Nothing suc ceeds like excess, and of all the world's avantgarde clas sic ballet companies the Netherlands Dance Theater is the most gloriously and con spicuously excessive. It is clearly ready to try anything more than once, and its per formances are free, vigorous and exciting.

title: BLACK PARLEY SET IN ATLANTA SEPT. 3
description: The Congress of African Peo ple will meet Sept. 3 to 7 in Atlanta, where, according to its sponsors, institutions will be developed to bring about the liberation of black people.

title: Nixon Would Curb Explosives Industry To Abate Bombings
description: WASHINGTON, July 15  The Nixon Administration an nounced today that it would send to Congress next week a bill to regulate the explosives industry in an attempt to keep dynamite and other high ex plosives out of the hands of terrorists.

title: Y. & R. Losing Some BeechNut and P. & G. Products
description: Having talked to five major agencies as a replacement for Young & Rubicam, Beech Nut, Inc., announced early yesterday afternoon that it was switching its confections division to DancerFitzgerald Sample.

title: Sports of The Times
description: Not everybody thinks that Jim Bouton has achieved insight or even accuracy in his controversial book, Ball Four, a series of spy reports from roof and locker room.

title: FUND OF FUNDS LISTS DROP IN NET ASSETS
description: GENEVA, July 15The Fund of Funds, operated by Investors Overseas Services, said today in its annual report that its total net assets had slid to $402,430,000 on July 1 from $623,004,300 at the close of 1969 and from $797,202,500 at the end of 1968.

title: CONGRESS URGED BY NIXON'S AIDES TO KILL WAR CURB
description: WASHINGTON, July 15  The Nixon Administration strongly urged Congress today to drop the Senate's Cooper Church amendment restrict ing military action in Cambo dia, on the ground that, if en acted, it would infringe on the President's lawful responsibil ities as Commander in Chief.

title: Boost for Family Planning
description: Almost a year to the day after President Nixon delivered a historic message on the world population crisis, the Senate has voted to translate the President's words into action. The measure authorizes the spend ing of nearly $1 billion over the next five years to extend family planning services to all American women who cannot afford them, to expand substantially research on all aspects of birth control and population and to train personnel for family planning programs.

title: New Haven Panther Trial Told About Murder Night
description: NEW HAVEN, July 15A young woman who wanted to qualify for membership in the Black Panther party testified today that she saw Alex Rack ley led from the party's head quarters here with a wire hanger wound around his neck on the night he was murdered.

title: Ailing Lombardi Missing As Redskins Drill Rookies
description: CARLISLE, Pa., July 15 (UPI) Without Coach Vince Lom bardi or the old hands, the Washington Redskins opened their football training camp to day with 39 rookies.

title: 8 ARRESTED HERE BY CRIME FORCE
description: In the first combined opera tion by the Federal joint strike force on organized crime since its creation here a year ago, eight men were arrested yes terday on charges of bookmak ing, loansharking and criminal contempt.

title: Books of The Times
description: SCIENTOLOGY: The Now Religion. By George Malko 205 pages. Delacorte Press. $5.95. Halfway through this mindboggling book, in the middle of a discussion of af finity tone scales, black thetans spitting white energy, the planet Helatrobus, Air craft Door Implants and Gorilla Goals, George Malko pauses to observe, Of course all this struck me as being insane garbage. Of course. Up to this point, Mr. Malko had been so stoically grop ing his way through the mys tagogical smog of L. Ron Hubbard's mind that one wanted to scream at him: But it's pre posterous! Since screaming at books is about as useful as voting in Presidential elec tions, the tension grew until Mr. Malko chose to relieve it. One can thereafter endure Scientology's E meters, Alice games, Havingness processes, gradient scale drills, capping beams and opposition terminalsnot to mention the eight Dynamics, the 24 Logics and the 58 Axioms with that same incredulous gape one brings to the economic theories of Ezra Pound or Wilhelm Reich's Orgone Energy Accumulator or the Protocols of Zion or the Flying Nun.

title: Market Summary
description: Wednesday, July 15, 1970

title: The Lull Before the Storm' at a Ford Plant
description: DEARBORN, Mich., July 15The Rouge automobile complex rises here like a gray mirage. The colors of the Ford Motor Company's giant industrial plant are not sharp and bright. Perhaps it's the smoke that has poured from the stacks for a half century that muted even the color of the sky to a gray. The mountains of coal, the fences and guardposts, the endless and dusty parking lots and the hurrying men, in and out, appear as a scene from the industrial past, from a Charlie Chaplin era, unrelated to the modern one story factories that line the freeways of suburbia with their bright blue or yellow walls and lawns.

title: Criminal Proceedings Sought In Baltimore Harbor Oil Spill
description: ANNAPOLIS, Md., July 15 (AP)  The Department of Water Resources plans to ask the Attorney General of Mary land, Francis B. Burch, to initi ate criminal proceedings against the companies responsi ble for Sunday's 67,200gallon oil spill in the Baltimore harbor.

title: OTTINGER REPORTS COST OF CAMPAIGN
description: Representative Richard L. Ottinger spent more than $1.8 million in his successful cam paign for the Democratic nom ination for United States Sen ator, with $1.7million of the total coming in loans from his mother, according to reports filed yesterday in Albany.

title: MILLION AMERICANS QUIT POVERTY ROLLS
description: WASHINGTON, July 15 (UPI) About 1.1 million Americans were taken off the poverty rolls at least by official Govern ment definitionlast year, the Census Bureau reported today.

title: Swiss Tennis Rained Out
description: GSTAAD, Switzerland, July 15 (AP)Rain washed out the matches in the Swiss interna tional tennis tournament today.

title: THIEU DENOUNCES IMMEDIATE PEACE
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, July 15President Nguyen Van Thieu vowed today to beat to death those of his countrymen who called for immediate peace, in surrender to the Communists.

title: LONE GUNMAN ROBS BANK OF $30,000
description: A tall, welldressed man with Iong blond hair, held up the Chemical Bank at 303 West 42d Street at Eighth Avenue yester day and escaped with more than $30,000.

title: FREDERICK G. GULDI
description: WESTFIELD, N.J., July 15 Frederick G. Guldi of 531 Shackamaxon Drive, an elec trical engineer for the Public Service Electric and Gas Com pany in Newark for 43 years, died yesterday in the Westfield Y.M.C.A. His age was 68 and he had retired last year.

title: Never Jam Today Begins Tour of City Tomorrow
description: But Never Jam Today, Vin nette Carroll's AfroAmerican adaptation of Lewis Carroll's Alice in Wonderland, will be gin a citywide summer tour to morrow at St. Joseph's Roman Catholic Church in the Bronx.

title: STOCKS ON AMEX SHOW AN ADVANCE
description: After its decline on Tuesday the American Stock Exchange Index moved ahead yesterday. It closed at 19.99, up 6 points from what the Exchange calied an adjusted figure of 19.93 for Tuesday.

title: Patrolman Held on Charge That He Grows Marijuana
description: A 30yearold city patrolman was arrested yesterday on a charge of growing marijuana in a vegetable garden in the backyard of his Suffolk County home.

title: NEW PATTERN SEEN FOR TRADE PARLEY
description: GENEVA, July 15  A new pattern for a soft approach to international trade problems may be set here at informal talks to be held be key officials of the United States and its major trading partners.

title: Charles and Anne Begin 3Day Visit in Capital Today
description: LONDON, July 15  Prince Charles and his younger sister, Princess Anne, make their first visit to the United States to morrow in a style that reflects their increased freedom to do and say what they like.

title: PHILIP A. RAY, 58, EXCOMMERCE AIDE
description: SAN FRANCISCO, July 15 (UPI)Philip A. Ray, former Under Secretary of Commerce and a prominent lawyer here, died today after a short illness. He was 58 years old.

title: Lawrence Cowen, 63, ExHead Of the Lionel Corporation, Dies
description: Lawrence Cowen, former chairman and president of the Lional Corporation, manufac turer of model trains and elec tromechanical devices, died yesterday of a coronary throm bosis in his home at 2 Sutton Place South. He was 63 years old.

title: 8 Greeks Honored in Athens For Saving Jews From Nazis
description: ATHENS, July 15  Eight Greeks were honored in Athens today for having helped rescue thousands of Jews from Nazi camps, where 62,000 Greek Jews perished during World War II.

title: YACHTING TROPHY GOES TO WHIPPLE
description: LARCHMONT, N.Y., July 15 Ralph Whipple, a 15yearold from Manhasset, L.I., whose father is a stinkpot advocate, emerged as the big winner to day as the Larchmont Yacht Club's threeday regatta for junior sailors ended.

title: Bus Service to Medical Center In Nassau Blocked by P.S.C.
description: A new bus service that would have provided easy access to public medical facilities in Nas sau County has been blocked by the Public Service Commis sion.

title: Magoon Wins 197Mile Grand Prix Powerboat Race
description: POINT PLEASANT, N. J., (July 15A pair of New Yorkers outclassed the rest of the fleet today in the Hennessy Grand Prix ocean race but failed to outlast a race committee that penalized both drivers and two others for failing to pass a checkpoint properly.

title: BASF CHIEF VIEWS U.S. TRADE ACTION
description: The chief executive of one of West Germany's largest chem ical concerns said here yester day that Congressional refusal to eliminate tariff barriers would have little impact on com panies like his because of the accelerating shift from imports to production in the United States.

title: Market Place:
description: The Japanese, widely re garded as imitators since their closed culture was opened to Western ideas by Commodore Perry in 1854, are now challenging the world with their innovative products.

title: In Boston, Fine Wyeth Retrospective
description: BOSTON, July 15Andrew Wyeth, America's favorite painter as well as its most expensive, has never looked more appealing or more near ly worth the money than he does in the retrospective opening to members tomor row and to the public on Friday at the Museum of Fine Arts. To Mr. Wyeth's well wishers the show will be good news, since his recent exhibition at the White House was so spotty in quality that it did him little credit out side the prestige involved.

title: OneDay Strike at G.E. Plant
description: PITTSFIELD, Mass., July 15 (AP)About 350 white collar workers in the ordnance depart ment at Pittsfield's General Electric Company stayed off the job today in a oneday walkout to protest the alleged bypassing of seniority in recent plant lay offs.

title: Intrepid Beats Valiant 2d Day in Row in First HeavyAir Test of Trials
description: NEWPORT, R. I., July 15 With a Dramamine sou'wester kicking up white caps, the America's Cup committee made a logical decision today.

title: FOE IN CAMBODIA STRIKES IN SOUTH
description: PNOMPEN H. Cambodia, July 15 (Reuters)  A Communist guerrilla force of unknown size was reported today to have struck at Bat Rokar, 28 miles south of Pnompenh, yesterday in an apparent move toward the southern provincial capital of Takeo.

title: CUBA'S SUGAR CROP IS 8.5 MILLION TONS
description: MIAMI, July 15 (AP)The Havana radio said today that Cuba's sugar harvest is nearing an end a million and a half tons short of its goal of 10 mil lion tons but still a record.

title: Thomas Hart Benton Gains
description: VINEYARD HAVEN, Mass., July 15 (UPI)Thornas Hart Benton, the artist, is recuper ating at Martha's Vineyard Flos pital after suffering a heart attack July 5, at his summer home in Chilmark, one of six towns on the island. He is 81 years old.

title: General Dynamics Is Building a Huge Cargo Carrier
description: QUINCY, Mass., July 15At a shipyard that has produced over $200million in losses for the General Dynamics Cor poration, the keel was laid today for a mammoth, boldly designed ship that the com pany is counting on to reverse its fortunes.

title: PEKING MAY SEND ENVOY TO MOSCOW
description: MOSCOW. July 15  Diplo matic sources said today that Communist China had agreed to send a new ambassador to Moscow.

title: ANTITRUST LAWS ON PAPERS EASED
description: WASHINGTON, July 15 (UPI)  The Senate completed Congressional action today on a bill that would exempt fi nancially unstable newspapers from antitrust laws and per mit them to pool their nonedi torial operations with other newspapers to prevent collapse.

title: Soybean Futures, Down Earlier, Rally and Set Highs for Season
description: Soybean futures prices fell sharply in early trading on the Chicago Board of Trade but rallied in the last hour and set new highs for the season.

title: Board of Education Tightens Security
description: The Board of Education has taken legal measures and tightened security at its head quarters to prevent new dis ruptions by supporters of the nowdefunct governing board of the former Ocean HillBrowns ville demonstration district in Brooklyn.

title: Successor Is Reported For Caradon at U.N.
description: LONDON, July 15 (Reuters) Sir Colin Crowe, a career diplomat who is now High Commissioner in Ottawa, is expected to be appointed Britain's new chief delegate to the United Nations, in formed sources said today.

title: Wilson of Tigers Goes To Padres on Waivers
description: DETROIT, July 15 (AP) The Detroit Tigers sold Earl Wilson to the San Diego Padres today for the $20,000 waiver price.

title: LOYOMAYO UPSETS GRAEBNER, 64, 63
description: WASHINGTON, July 15 (UPI) Mexico's Joaquin LoyoMayo upset Clark Graebner of New York, 64, 63, in the second round of the $35,000 Washing ton Star claycourt tennis tour nament today.

title: A Listing of New Books
description: Creamy & Delicious: Eat My Words (In Other Words), by Steve Katz, illustrated by Richard Turn Suden (Random House, $5.95). A collection of short stories.

title: $229,000 IS STOLEN FROM JERSEY BANK
description: HOWELL TOWNSHIP, N. J., July 15Three gunmen robbed a branch office of the Mon mouth County National Bank on a busy seashore highway to day and made off with $229,000 in cash scooped from tellers' tills.

title: BASEBALL SAVORS ALLSTAR SUCCESS
description: CINCINNATI, July 15A violent collision at home plate on the final and deciding play; the enthusiastic attendance of the President of the United States; a 12inning victory for the National League made pos sible by a threerun rally in the home half of the ninth; a fourhour national television show that used up all the prime time in the eastern part of the country and a good share in the western half; a capacity crowd of 51,838 in a magnificent notyetcompleted ball park with the only 99 per cent artificial surface ever used for a major league game these were some of the ele ments that made baseball peo ple feel that last night's 41st AllStar Game was one of their most successful promotions.

title: MISS SMITH WINS IN OPENING ROUND
description: ALBANY, July 15 (AP)  The defending champion, Lancy Smith of Buffalo, and the tour ney medalist, Gail Sykes of Schenectady, won their matches today in the New York State women's amateur golf championship at the Colonie Country Club.

title: STOCKS IN LONDON DECLINE WIDELY
description: Prices on the London stock market declined over a wide range yesterday.

title: Juarez Flourishing on the Divorce Business
description: CIUDAD JUAREZ, Mexico, July 12The divorce mills of Chihuahua State grind fast, and that is good for the econ omy of this Mexican border city.

title: GOLDBERG SCORES WATER POLLUTION
description: ROCHESTER, July 15 Arthur J. Goldberg charged to day that what he characterized as a frightening increase in water pollution in New York State could be traced to breakdown in the enforcement of purewater standards.

title: CITY CLUB SUPPORTS INQUIRY ON POLICE
description: The heard of trustees of the City Club of New York has adopted a resolution that the, club take whatever legal action is possible to support the right of civilian authorities to in vestigate corruption in the Po lice Department.

title: Du Pont Sees No Profit Change
description: WILMINGTON, Del.  E. 1. du Pont de Nemours & Co., Inc., expects to report that secondquarter earnings were about the same as In the first quarter, when they reached $1.93 a share, and that second quarter sales were slightly be low the $937million of the first period.

title: Singapore Seeks Birds Back
description: SINGAPORE (UPI)With ur banization, Singapore's singing birds have taken refuge in thick forests. Ornithologists now are creating bird sanctuaries in places like the Botanic Gardens. King George V Park and other parks, in the hope the birds will return.

title: $11Million Grant to Aid Law Enforcement People
description: WASHINGTON, July 15 (AP)  The Justice Department awarded grants totaling $11 million today to help finance college courses for law enforce ment personnel.

title: Bridge:
description: The start of the vacation season does little to inhibit the tournament enthusiast. Many New York experts will be competing tonight at the New York Hilton, where the first round of a knockout team championship signals the beginning of the Fun City regionals. Some of the players were competing last weekend in the Suffolk championships at Patchogue, L. I.

title: The Times News Service Promotes Three Executives
description: Rob Roy Buckingham, editor and general manager of The New York Times News Service, announced three staff promo tions yesterday.

title: Collegians Shun Practice for a Day in Support of LockedOut N.F.L. Players
description: CHICAGO, July 15 (AP) The College AllStars will re turn to organized practice to morrow after a oneday strike in sympathy with players locked out of National Football League training camps.

title: 6 More Failures Reported For Big Board Members
description: WASHINGTON, July 15There are six member firms of the New York Stock Exchange that are currently in liquida tion, in addition to the four whose failure had previously been announced it was offi cially disclosed today. The icientittes of the firms were not made public. The New York Stock Exchange did, however, let it be known that it intended to reimburse all customers of the failed firms, who might otherwise lose cash or securities that they had left in the custody of these brokers.

title: Rudy Turcotte Scores With Three Martinis, 2 Others at Aqueduct
description: Rudy Turcotte included the Great American Stakes among his three successes at Aqueduct yesterday. The 20yearold jockey from Grand Falls, New Brunswick, steered Edward Sawyer's Three Martinis to decisive victory in the $29,350 feature, a 5furlong event for 2yearolds.

title: Wood, Field and Stream
description: BRIELLE, N. J., July 15 My greatgrandfather is the greeter and boat dispatcher, said 13yearold Johnny Bo gan 4th today. My grand father is the buyer and office manager. My father is the captain of one of our fishing boats. Me? I'm a salesman in the tackle shop.

title: Roosevelt Drivers
RUNOFF IS POSSIBLE IN VIRGINIA VOTING
description: RICHMOND, Va., July 15 The possibility of a runoff elec tion to determine the Virginia Democratic nomince for the United States Senate loomed here today after George C. Raw lings Jr., one of the state's most liberal Democrats, won a slim plurality in balloting yesterday.

title: Rutgers Gets $4.7Million
description: NEW BRUNSWICK, N. J., July 15 (AP)Rutgers Univer sity announced today that it received more than $4.7million in gifts, grants and scholarship and fellowship funds during the last quarter of its fiscal year just ended. About 95 per cent of the money received by Rutgers was in the form of grants and contracts from gov ernment and private agencies.

title: Commercial Paper Down $2Billion at End of June
description: The commercial paper market, where corporations sell heir unsecured i.o.u.'s to investors, dropped more than $2billion in the final three weeks of June, figures published yesterday by the Federal Re serve Bank of New York showed.

title: House Unit Votes to Keep OilImport Quota System
description: WASHINGTON, July 15The House Ways and Means Com mittee completed action today on major trade legislation by voting to prevent the President from ever substituting a tariff on oil for the present system of oil import quotas.

title: Pledge to Increase Protection Averts A Taxi Shutdown
description: A hastily arranged meet ing between Police Commis sioner Howard R. Leary and taxicab fleet owners has once again forestalled daily midnight  to  6 A.M. shutdown threatened by owners of 6,900 fleet taxis.

title: HOUSE DEMOCRATS PRAISE OWN RECORD
