description: Into the hands of a man with no direct experience in the business world has fallen the job of overseeing the na tion's largest railroad com pany and helping its trustees to steer it out of insolvency.

title: AMERICAN EAGLE TAKES SAIL LEAD
description: CHICAGO, July 18 (UPI) American Eagle, a 12Meter Class yacht built for America's Cup trials, churned into the lead today at the start of the 63d annual ChicagotoMacki nac Island yacht race.

title: PRESIDENT WARNS OF PAINFUL STEPS IF DEFICIT GROWS
description: WASHINGTON, July 18  President Nixon warned Con gress today of difficult and painful measures ahead if it persists in running up a budget deficit.

title: Lila T. Romans and Alan Hooper Wed
description: SETAUKET, L. I., July 18  Miss Lila Jane Romans, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. John McDowell Romans of New York and Old Fields, was married here this after noon to Alan Bartlett Hooper. He is the son of Mrs. Robert Alan Hooper of Brooklyn and Sparta, N. J., and the late Mr. Hooper.

title: Smoke Signals the Return to Work of Some Building Employes
description: As word spread through apartment buildings yesterday evening that maintenance em ployes would return to work in buildings that the city had declared in emergency condi tion, wisps of dark smoke crept out of the basement at 230 East 73d Street, where the city had declared a health emergency.

title: Van Nostrand Downs Kahn, Gains Net Final With Barker
description: PORT WASHINGTON, L. I., July 18King Van Nostrand of Brightwaters and Bob Barker of Port Washington reached the final of the New York State. tennis championship for men 35 years and over at the Port Washington Tennis Academy. today.

title: MOTHER REPAYS FRESH AIR FUND
description: Free Fresh Air Fund vaca tions received by two New York City children 20 years ago are being paid back by their mother who now serves the organization as its repre sentative in New Jersey.

title: Music
description: STATISTICS generally bore me, but I do find myself entranced at least once a year when the annual survey of orchestra programs, sponsored by Broad cast Music Inc. and the American Symphony Orchestra League, comes my way. In one respect this publication is a stock market report of public response to musical creativity through the years. One can discover just how well the blue chips (Mozart, Beethoven, Brahms, et al.) are doing, and where the speculative stocks (Boulez, Stockhausen, Xenakis) are heading, and whether the high fliers (Mahler. Ives) are stiii flying high. Trends can be charted, it one so desires, ana there may be new issues worth attention. (I wish I could go on, but I have just exhausted my knowledge of stock market terminology.)

title: How Delay Could Hinder Giants
description: BROOKVILLE, L.I., July 18 The Giants made their first cut of the summer today, a modest twoman severance that dropped the squad to 18 rookies.

title: Lemming Migration In Sweden Revives Usual Superstitions
description: GALLIVARE, Sweden, July 18 (AP)It has been a big year for the lemming migra tion, and the usual stories and superstitions are being dusted off.

title: N. M. Epple to Wed Kathe Weschler
description: ERIE, Pa., July 18The engagement of Miss Kathe Mary Weschler to Nicholas Michael Epple of Cleveland, son of the late Mr. and Mrs. Frederick N. Epple, has been announced by the future bride's parents, Mr. and Mrs. Robert F. Weschler. A wed ding in November is planned.

title: Brazilian Guerrilla Warns Of Additional Kidnappings
description: PARIS, July 18 (Reuters)A Brazilian guerrilla leader said in an interview published here that his men would continue kidnapping diplomats and pub lic figures as long as the Bra zilian Government used torture on its prisoners.

title: Miss Rosemary Power Will Be Bride in Fall
description: Mr. and Mrs. Frank Power have announced the engage ment of their daughter, Miss Rosemary Power, to Chris topher Sparks Dorment, son of Mr. and Mrs. James Dor ment of Montclair, N. J. An October wedding is planned.

title: SlumtoSuburb Commuting For High Pay Has Its Perils
description: Inside Bickford's cafeteria, Charles Price sipped a second cup of coffee and sat near a window where he could keep watch for his driver.

title: Should U.S. Railroads Be Nationalized?
description: Whatever their differ eneesand they are many railroad management and railroad labor in the United States agree in turning a skeptical eye on nationaliza tion the remedy often put forward for the railroads troubles.

title: Text of the President's Statement Voicing Concern on the Budget
description: WASHINGTON, July 18 Following is the text of the budget statement issued to day by President Nixon.

title: DRUG DOSAGE KILLS YOUTH AT FESTIVAL,
description: LOVE VALLEY, N. C., July 18 (UPI)  One youth died today from an overdose of drugs and another was wounded by a shotgun blast fired by a deputy sheriff, shattering the relative calm of the Love Valley Rock Music Festival.

title: Dog Show Calendar
description: TODAY

title: Three Are Arrested in Chicago In Sniper Slaying of Policemen
description: CHICAGO, July 18 (AP) Three young men, including a 14yearold boy, were charged with murder today in the sniper killing of two commu nity relations policemen. All three were in custody.

title: Parks, Head of Hot Rod Group, A Leader in Formalizing Sport
description: YORK, Pa., July 18Be hind the scenes at big drag meets is the man who is rec ognized as having done more than anyone else in the de velopment of drag racing. He is a tall, amiable, hand some and slightly graying man named Wally Parks, who has been involved with cars and racing since his teen  age years. Parks, who speaks in a soft. voice, is presi dent of the Na tional Hot Rod Association, which is conducting the Sum mernationals here this week end.

title: Arthur Treacher  76 and All That
description: ARTHUR TREACHER looked terribly pained, although the occasion hardly seemed to war rant it. He was on the eve of celebrating his 76th birth day (Tuesday), and he was sipping a drink in the cor ner of a comfortable restau rant just a few doors from the theater where he serves as announcer and occasional sparring partner for Merv Griffin on the latter's TV talk show on C.B.S. (Griffin: You were at the Battle of Bunker Hill, weren't you, Arthur? Treacher: Oh, stop being an ass.)

title: TODAY'S PROBABLE PITCHERS
description: California at New York (2, 1 P.M.) Murphy (106) and May (46) vs. Kekich (21) and Cumber land (3.3).

title: A. T. Graves Jr. Weds Miss Marianne Moran
description: GROSSE POINTE, Mich., July 18Miss Marianne Mo ran, daughter of Mrs. Evelyn Rose Moran and Frederick T. Moran, was married here this afternoon to Austin T. Graves Jr., son of Mr. and Mrs. Graves of Darien. Conn.

title: Rozelle Seeks to Revive Negotiations Tomorrow
description: Commissioner Pete Rozelle said yesterday he would try to bring negotiators for the club owners and the National Football League Players' As sociation to the bargaining table tomorrow in an attempt to break a weeklong impasse in their contract dispute.

title: The Challenge of World Poverty
description: The sudden swerves of economic doctrinal fashion seem to take even the most hardened observer by sur prise; in no field of economics has there recently been such a change as in that of the development of the poor areas. At the end of the fifties it all looked well on the way to suc cess. Then, in the second half of the sixties, an everdeepening gloom spread. The willingness to extend aid further was going sour. The defenders of aid could respond only by showing that aid was wellspent and that, in the end, we could hope for a better future. The Pearson Com mission on International Develop ment appointed by the World Bank was especially effective in this de fensive operation.

title: Miss Wendy L. Feagles Is a Bride
description: CHAPPAQUA, N. Y., July 18Miss Wendy Lee Feagles and Earl Linthicum were mar ried here this morning by the Rev. Lee Fairchild, pastor of the Mount Risco Presbyterian Church, at the home of the bride's parents, Mr. and Mrs. Robert West Feagles.

title: News Summary and Index
description: SUNDAY, JULY 19, 1970

title: Navy Said to Shell 3 Fishing Boats Near Fire Island
description: Three private fishing boats participating in a marlin fish ing tournametn in the Atlantic off Fire Island reported being fired upon by an unidentified military vessel yesterday after noon.

title: Gardens
description: WHEN the Robert E. Lee family lived at Arlington House about 110 years ago, their Virginia hillside estate overlooked the nation's capital. The house had an old fashioned greenhouse that was the proud domain of Mrs. Lee, an astute and dedi cated gardener.

title: Letter to the Editor 1  No Title
Words From the Hearings on Campus Trouble
description: The bored student is so cial dynamite. It is no acci dent that bright students at the prestige liberal arts institutions have been, through these past several years of campus uproar, the principal troublemakers. . . . They are saying clearly and unmistakably We want out. We are tired of being treated as children.S. T. Hayakawa, president of San Francisco College.

title: A Town Gets Electricity
description: HART'S LOCATION, N. H., July 18 (AP)Ninetyone years after Edison invented the elec tric light, electricity has comet to this tiny White Mountain hamlet, often the first in the nation to report its Presidenial vote. Hart's Location, with its 13 registered voters, became the last New Hampshire com munity to be electrified Wednesday.

title: A collection of collections of short stories reviewed by James R. Frakes
description: In his generous introduction to Patricia Highsmith's collec tion of 11 short stories, Graham Greene speaks of the author as the poet of apprehension rather than fear, who in her crime novels has created a world of her owna world claustrophobic and irrational which we enter each time with a sense of personal danger. No

title: News of the Realty Trade
description: The Continental Oil Com pany has become the latest large concern to move its headquarters away from Manhattan.

title: RECIPROCAL SHARE ON WAGERS SOUGHT
description: OCEANPORT, N. J., July 18 One of the state's five racing commissioners suggested today that information on New Jersey races be withheld from New York City bettors in offtrack betting parlors.

title: Bedtime story
description: Little girls' rooms tell more about their parents' tastes than their own, for obvious reasons. The three bedrooms shown here, be longing to girls from 3 to 7 years old, reflect the design preferences of their parents, who happen to include an architect, a TV person ality and a business executive. Although the rooms vary widely in cost and style, they have one element in common: a custom made bed sets the mood.

title: Dr. Harold Weisberg, 45, Dies; Brandeis Philosophy Chairman
description: BOSTON, July 18Dr. Har old C. Weisberg, chairman of the philosophy department of Brandeis University and former dean of the Graduate School of Arts and Sciences, died yester day in Massachusetts General Hospital after a long illness. He was 45 years old and lived in Newton.

title: South Vietnamese Students Are Resisting Canadian Efforts to Send Them Home
description: MONTREAL, July 14  A group of antiSaigon students from South Vietnam have band ed together here to resist Cana dian efforts to return them to their wartorn homeland.

title: Foyt Enters Indianapolis 150
description: INDIANAPOLIS, July 18 (UPI) A. J. Foyt, who has won five of the six major races held annually in Indianapolis, filed his entry today for the one he never has taken. Foyt entered the Indy 150 to be run at the raceway July 26.

title: Turkey Bars Team Seeking Noah's Ark From Ararat Climb
description: ANKARA, Turkey, July 18 (AP)Turkey, citing security reasons, has forbidden a Unit ed States expedition seeking Noah's Ark to climb Mount Ararat.

title: 10to1 Shot and 13to10 Favorite Win Divisions of Sheepshead Bay Handicap at Aqueduct
The Week in Finance:
description: WITHOUT any great array of favorable economic, polit ical or international news to propel them, the finan cial markets nevertheless continued to advance last week as a more confident mood enveloped investors and Wall Street.

title: Mays Collects 3,000th Hit As Giants Rout Expos, 101
description: SAN FRANCISCO, July 18 Willie Mays's 3.000th major league hita secondinning sin gle off Mike Wegener  over shadowed Gaylord Perry's four hit pitching today as the San Francisco Giants posted a 101 victory over the Montreal Expos.

title: Television
description: UP IN Tarrytown on Primary night. By all accounts Nelson Rock efeller had been a most gracious host, moving easily among the collectors and the collected who had been asked to Pocantico Hills to celebrate the passage of John Hightower from the New York State Council on the Arts to the Museum of Modern Art.

title: Turner, Thoreau and Debussy together
description: The title, of course, is from A. E. Housman. The text, from the heart and mind of a natural ist whose powers of perception and instant persuasion are com parable to anything I have ever come across in literature. Read ing him, I am looking through binoculars and microscope at once: not in a laboratory, an anechoic chamber, but in some several of those still incredible small patches of woods, fields, downland and unspoiled nature in the south of England.

title: The Nation
description: point of compromise on the CooperChurch amendment it was on the question of provid ing indirect military assistanofie to Cambodia in the form of Thai or Vietnamese troops financed in part by the United States. At one point the Administration indicated that the CooperChurch amendment might be acceptable if the socalled antimercenary provision was modified to permit special allowances for Free World troops going to the as sistance of Cambodia.

title: Moving Up a Struggle
description: In a small segment of the Bronx north of Hunts Point, upwardly mobile minori ty groups are finding a better way of life as firsttime homeowners, willingly accepting what for many is a heavy financial strain.

title: World Trade War Brews
description: Talk of a world trade war has suddenly grown louder and more ominous.

title: Plan for Philadelphia Is Ruled A Violation of Model Cities Act
description: PHILADELPHIA, July 17  The Nixon Administration's ap proach to the Model Cities pro gram suffered a major setback in the courts this week.

title: Fame Takes Psychological Toll
description: Pro football players are, in Dr. Bruce Ogilvie's words, bright, emotionally stable, toughminded, realityoriented, extroverted, ungiving, inordinately proud and possessed of fine psychological endurance.

title: MUSIC FESTIVAL TO AID WAR FOES
description: A 12hour festival of rock and folk music will be held at Shea Stadium starting at noon on Aug. 6 to raise funds for senatorial and congressional campaigns of candidates who have been strong opponents of the war in Vietnam and sup porters of a reordering of na tional priorities.

title: Founder of Zzyzx Spa Convicted on Ad Claims
description: ONTARIO, Calif., July 18 (UPI)Curtis Howe Springer, 73 years old, a radio evan gelist, has been convicted of 10 counts of false advertising concerning two of his prod ucts.

title: Sports of The Times
description: If the friends and relations of Bill Gra barkewitz of the Los Angeles Dodgers search for his name in box scores, they never will find it. Not in its entirety any way. Even under the best of circumstances a box score is a tight and crowded seg ment of agate type, rigid in elasticity. So the printers have chopped down Grabar kewitz to fit and most sports pages throughout the country use Grbkwtz, al though some prefer Grab'witz. It's the same guy, however.

title: KENTON PERFORMS IN CENTRAL PARK
description: We haven't played around New York much in recent years, said Stan Kenton as he stepped out on the stage at the Woliman Rink in Central Park on Friday night, and some of you may not know who we are.

title: Daphne D. Fodor Is Wed in Yonkers
description: YONKERS, July 18Miss Daphne Doreen Fodor, daugh ter of Mrs. Anthony Romeo of Yonkers, was married here this afternoon to Carl Edward Hetherington, son of Mrs. James V. Hetherington of Boston and the late Mr. Heth erington. The Rev. Albert J. Bichanan performed the Epis copal ceremony at the home of the brides's mother and stepfather, Mr. Romeo, who owns the Carriage Inn restau rant in Larchmont, N. Y.

title: Chess
Judith Leslie To Be Married To J. G. Wallick
description: BRONXVILLE, N. Y., July 18Mr. and Mrs. William McIntosh Crouse Jr. have an nounced the engagement of Mrs. Crouse's daughter, Miss Judith Robins Leslie, to Jon athan Gardiner Wallick, a former Marine sergeant. He is the son of Mrs. Cornelius H. Van Vlaanderen of Palm Beach, Fla., and the late L. Duane Wallick.

title: MILLER AND INMAN REACH LINKS FINAL
description: OKLAHOMA CITY, July 18 (AP)Allen Miller of Pensacola, Fla., the defending champion, and Joe Inman Jr. of Greens boro, N. C., the comedalist, downed semifinal opponents to day and will meet in the 36 hole final of the TransMissis sippi amateur golf tournament today.

title: What Happened Behind Scenes as Ling Was Deposed?
description: In the mid1960's, when James J. Ling, then chairman and chief executive officer of LingTemcoVought, Inc.. was dazzling the business world with his corporate empire building and financial maneuverings, a story made the rounds at places where Wall Streeters gossip.

title: Statement On Accord
description: Following is the text of statement agreed upon by representatives of all parties in the apartment strike as made public yesterday at City Hall:

title: Point of View:
description: Nineteenseventy is the year student activists discov ered the corporate annual meeting. Both they and the executives they confronted were surprised at what they found.

title: In Brief: War
description: No Parachute is the finest personal account of World War I air fighting I have ever read. The text is a series of letters written in 1917 by a 22yearold lieutenant to a very new, very much loved wife named GwynethAnn. Arthur Gould Lee eventually became an Air Vice  Marshal, but ex cept for an appendix on the lack of parachutes and an evaluation of Trenchard as a commander, he has not given in to hindsight.

title: The Colors of Summer
description: Strong colors mark the roadsides and old meadows now, wild flowers almost tropical in their look. Spring flowers ran to the lighter shades, but now we get the deep hues, the heavy ones, that we think of as strong sun colors.

title: Blast Hurts 46
description: ATHENS, Ga., July 18 (AP) A gasoline fire and explosion that rocked this north Georgia city has left at least 715 persons homeless, 46 injured and prop erty damage estimated at $500, 000 to $1million, officials said today. The explosion occurred Tate Friday at the Texaco, Inc., oil distributorship just north of the downtown business district.

title: Arrivals by Air Increase
description: A 7 per cent increase in ar rivals of air passengers from abroad over the Fourth of July weekend was reported here last week by the Bureau of Customs. A total of 64,670 passengers were cleared that weekend, compared with 60,710 in 1969. The 1969 Fourth of July traffic was handled by 699 flights, against 641 this year, a reflec tion of the Boeing 747 jumbo jets going into service.

title: JET STAFF BANKS. ON FIRST SIZEUP
description: HEMPSTEAD, L.I., July 18 In the early days of a pro foot ball training camp, the look of a rookie is importanthis physique, the set of his jaw, even his stride.

title: Political Recess Barred
description: MADISON, Wis., July 18 (UPI)  The stale university system's Regents Education Committee ruled out yesterday any fall political recess for students. The unanimous action opposed any plan to call ?? Classes In allow student ?? ?? for ??

title: Tailor Relives Ordeal at Con Son
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, July 18A 28yearold village tailor, who can no longer walk or stand up because, he says. he was shackled, beaten and deprived of sufficient food, wa ter, and any exercise or fresh air at Con Son Prison, talked today of his ordeal.

title: NEW MARKS LOOM FOR HARNESS RACING
description: With Del Insko, Herve Filion and Carmine Abbatiello thus far enjoying their best harness racing seasons ever, new driver records in both race and mon eywinnings could be estabfi lished before 1970 runs its course.

title: Bessie Smith First and Last Dis
description: FOR all the hard times and tragedy that were the constant compan ions of Bessie Smith from her birth to her death, she did have two lucky breaks  although the luck is actually ours rather than hers.

title: A 110DAY STRIKE JOLTS KANSAS CITY
description: KANSAS CITY, Mo., July 18  A construction strike that has crippled the metropolitan area entered its 110th day this weekend with no visible indica tion that the two sides were any closer together now than they were when the work stop page was called April 1. It is the third major construction tieup in Kansas City in the last four years.

title: Eleanor Burke Married Here
description: The marriage of Miss Ele anor Boyd Burke to Brian James Madden took place in the Roman Catholic Church of St. Thomas More here yesterday. The ceremony, performed by the Rev. Rudolf Harvey, was followed by a reception at the Colony Club.

title: Seiji Ozawa Blends the Modern With the Classic at Tanglewood
description: LENOX, Mass., July 18The Boston Symphony Orchestra's Berkshire Music Festival, founded in 1934, is the coun try's oldest major music festi val. From the very beginning, its idyllic setting here at Tan glewood and its high level of artistic excellence have made it a focal point in the summer musical life of the nation and the world. Its past programing under the direction of Serge Koussevitsky, Charles Munch and Erich Leinsdorf usually followed a safely conservative line, and its generous offerings of familiar symphonic fare kept the public coming back in great numbers summer after summer.

title: FAST FELLOW, $28, TAKES COAST DASH
description: INGLEWOOD, Calif., July 18 A Californiabred colt, Fast Fellow from the Gem State Stable, won the $163.900 Hol lywood Juvenile Championship today as the 35 favorite. Moonsplash, ran third in the field of 14 2yearolds.

title: COALITION TICKET URGED ON VOTERS
description: In an unusual election ploy, New York voters are being urged to support a coalition ticket made up of the Con servative candidate for United. States Senator, the Republican candidate for Governor and the Democratic candidate for Con troller.

title: Susan W. Lodge Becomes Bride Of John Peck Jr.
description: BROOKLYN. Conn., July 18Miss Susan Williams Lodge, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Jack Dearnley Lodge of Brooklyn and Quonochon taug, R. I., was married here this noon to Arthur John Peck Jr., son of Mr. and Mrs. Peck of Lawrenceville, N. J.

title: POLLUTION S.O.S. HEEDED IN MAINE
description: BIDDEFORD, Me., July 18  Volunteers by the thousands converged today on the 120 milelong Saco River to answer an S.O.S. call  Save Our Saco.

title: Letters to the Editor of The Times
description: TV Time for President

title: Klecatsky and Castelitto Triumph in Singles Rowing Here
description: The Virginia Boat Club of Richmond, returning to club rowing competition after a lapse of several years, was outclassed by the New York Athletic Club's more experienced oars men yesterday on the Orchard Beach Lagoon in the Bronx.

title: British Classics for Philympia
description: THREE classic stamps are due from Britain on September 18 for Phil ympia, the international stamp ex hibition opening in Olympia Hall, London, that day. Each stamp will re produce a historic 19th century British stamp, each with a portrait of Queen Vic toria. The designs are by David Gentle man, creator of a number of British stamp designs. The printing will be by Harrison & Sons, in photogravure at their High Wycombe plant.

title: Can MiddleAgers Find Happiness at A Swinging Resort?
description: FORTDEFRANCE, Martinique, W. I. Can a couple clinging to their middle class values as they dangle precariously over the generation gap make it with the bikini and gogo set and shed the problems, formalities and stresses of daily life as promised in the brochures of the Club Mediterrane?

title: Edward Macksoud Jr. Weds Miss Alice Kany
description: WOODSTOCK, Vt., July 18 Miss Alice Ann Kany and Edward Macksoud Jr. were married here today in a cere mony that moved from Our Lady of the Snows Roman Catholic Church to a hilltop meadow at Old Bailey Farm, the Macksoud's summer home.

title: Pipe Bomb Shatters Glass At a Bank on Park Place
description: A bomb shattered a glass doorway at the Broadway Sav ings Bank at 5 Park Place last night. The police said the blast went off at 7:50 P.M. The bank was closed and a superin tendent was the only person in the building. He was not in jured.

title: Rise in Uniformity Found Among Nation's Colleges
description: A study conducted for the Carnegie Commission on High er Education has found that col leges and universities are be coming increasingly uniform and are creating a monolithic status system prizing academic specialization.

title: Soviet Hails Youth Assembly
description: MOSCOW. July 18 (AP)The Soviet Union hailed today the work of the World Youth As sembly as a convincing display of the strengthening unity of our planet's younger generation in the struggle for peace and security of nations, against colonialism and racialism.

title: Pincay Unhurt in Fall From Mount on Coast
description: INGLEWOOD, Calif., July 18 (UPI)Laffit Pincay Jr., the leading rider at the meet ing with 89 winners, was thrown from his mount in the first race today at Holly wood Park, but apparently suffered no serious injury.

title: A Year Later: Apollo's Message
description: The world and Neil A. Arm strong have had a year to re flect on his giant leap, the first human step on the moon. Neither can quite comprehend the ultimate meaning of that dramatic event on July 20, 1969.

title: Borrow Pits Are Good Fishing Holes
description: FUN FLON, Manitoba  South of this mining town, highway engineers and the prov ince's Department of Natural Resources have developed a sportsfishing attraction that has more shades of James Bond than of Flintabatty Fiona tin, the storybook character for whom the town was named

title: Rioting Italian Youths Set Police Station Afire in Provincial Dispute
description: REGGIO CALABRIA, Italy, July 18 (AP)Youths hurling gasoline bombs set fire today lo the central police station in this town on the southern tip of Italy, where civic rival ry has touched off six days of rioting, leaving one dead and 300 iniured.

title: WAR FOES YIELD ON COFFEEHOUSE
description: LOUISVILLE, Ky., July 18 Antiwar activists have given up their efforts to keep open a controversial coffeehouse at Muldraugh. Ky., in the middle of the Fort Knox military res ervation.

title: DEVELOPERS BUY CAROLINA ISLAND
description: RALEIGH, N. C., July 18 In a bitter defeat for conserva tionists, Bald Head Island, a semitropical wilderness that lies at the mouth of the Cape Fear, River, has been sold to a pri vate corporation fur develop ment as a posh, multimillion dollar resort.

title: Casper Leads by 2; Weiskopf Pulls Out
description: WHITEMARSH, Pa., July 18 I never knew what was go ing to happen next, asserted Billy Casper after his third round of 71 brought him a two stroke lead and a 54hole ag gregate of 206 today in the 5150,000 Philadelphia Golf Classic.

title: U. S. Business:
description: SEATTLE, July 18  A revolutionary West German engine that has captured the attention of the automotive world in recent years has entered the United States market here by way of Ja pan.

title: Car Makers Get 2 More Years To Meet Standards on Exhaust
description: WASHINGTON, July 18 (AP)  Automobile manufacturers have been granted two more years to meet a weakened ver sion of Federal exhaust stand ards because Government cer tification tests failed to meas ure half of the tailpipe pol lutants.

title: Anne McCaffrey To Marry Sept. 5
description: BRIARCLIFF MANOR, N. Y., July 18Mr. and Mrs. James John McCaffrey have an nounced the engagement of their daughter, Miss Anne Marie McCaffrey, to Stephen Edward Rathmell, son of Mr. and Mrs. John Nicely Rath mell of Muncy, Pa.

title: For Young Readers
description: Collected and edited by Eva H. Kissin. 315 pp. Philadelphia and New York: J. B. Lippincott Company. $4.95. (Ages 12 and Up)

title: Columbia Seeks Bank Membership
description: BOGOTA, Colombia, July 11 (UPI)Colombia applied this week for membership in the Caribbean Development Bank, a regional financing group with headquarters in Bridgetown, Barbados.

title: In France, Worst of Two Economic Worlds
description: PARIS, July 14As has been the case in the United States all year, France is now starting to get the worst of both economic worldsa slowdown in industrial ac tivity and continued inflation.

title: POLITICAL TENSION MOUNTS IN BOGOTA
description: BOGOTA, Colombia, July 18 Twice in the last week, Bo gota has been occupied at night by the Colombian Army.

title: State Legion Elects Officers
description: BUFFALO, July 18 (AP) Raymond T. Wellington of Brooklyn was elected com mander of the New York State division of the American Legion today. He was selected at the closing session of the legion's annual convention to succeed Richard M. Pedro of Tioga County. William A. McKay of Westchester County and An thony Minei of Queens were elected vice commanders; Charles F. Lynch of Queens, treasurer, and the Rev. William G. Kalaidjian of New York, chaplain.

title: BOCA RATON SEEKS ENGLISH POLO TITLE
description: MIDHURST, England, July 18 (AP)An American team, Boca Raton of Tulsa, Okla., plays today in the final of the Cow dray Park Gold Cup, the Eng lish polo championship.

title: Miss Marks Is Bride at West Point
description: WEST POINT, N. Y., July 18 Miss Margaret Ann Marks daughter of Col. Edwin H. Marks Jr. U.S.A., chief of staff at the United States Military Academy, and Mrs. Marks, was married here this afternoon to Lieut. James Fulford Love U.S.A. He is the son of Col. James W. Love, chief of staff at Fort Dix, N. J., and Mrs. Love.

title: Saigon Seizes Editions Of Five Newspapers
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, July 18 (UPI) The South Vietnamese Government con fiscated today's editions of five newspapers, four of them for articles dealing with pris on conditions.

title: Recordings
description: VIRGIL THOMSON, gaz ing down from the aerie of his 73 years and his dizzying crit ical eminence, ticked off Charles Ives the other day in The New York Review of Books, finding Ives, at last, only an inspired dabbler in composition, and even some thing of a bore. About all Thomson could find to like in Ives work, he said, were a few impressionistic pieces such as The Housatonic at Stockbridge.

title: Yanks' Clarke, Howard Join Party for Youths
description: Two New York Yankee standoutsthe second base man, Horace Clarke, and Coach Elston Howardwill team with one of the team broadcasters, Frank Messer. in conducting a free baseball party at Thomas Jefferson Park in Manhattan at First Avenue and 112th Street to morrow at 2 P.M.

title: Rockefeller, in White Levi's, Formally Opens Campaign
description: Governor Rockefefler opened his formal campaign for reelec tion yesterday in as informal fashion as possible.

title: 2 Brooklyn Men Accused In TeenAger's Drug Death
description: Two young Brooklyn men were arrested yesterday morn ing in connection with the death of a teenaged girl last week from a narcotics over dose.

title: But the World Is Inescapable
description: The temper of Congress in the summer of 1970 may have been conveyed accurately enough last week by two appar ently disparate actions. One was the House Ways and Means Committee's approval of the most protectionist trade legisla tion in the last forty years. The other was the agreement of House and Senate conferees on a District of Columbia crime bill introducing into American law for the first time the idea of preventive detention of crim inal suspects.

title: Article 4  No Title
Child to Lovingers
description: SCARSDALE, N. Y., July 18A daughter was born to Mr. and Mrs. Joseph S. Lovin ger of Scarsdale on July 7 at the New York Lying In Hos pital.

title: HARRY A. SKUDIN
description: ATLANTA, July 18Harry A. Skudin, who fought with the Lincoln Brigade in the Spanish Civil War and served as a flight officer with the Canadian Air Force in World War II, died here yesterday after a long ill ness. He was 62 years old.

title: Alabamians Honor a Native Son Justice Black
description: BIRMINGHAM, Ala., July 18 Hugo L. Black, the 84year old Supreme Court Justice, came home to his native state last night and found adulation where once there was only abuse.

title: Field of Travel
description: THE DEPARTMENT OF THE INTERIOR's National Park Service has suspended en trance fees to park areas normally entered by automo bile pending Congressional action on the restoration of the Golden Eagle Passport, which expired March 31. The Golden Eagle Passport, which cost $7 a year allowed the purchaser  and everyone in his private vehicleunlimited inandout privileges at na tional parks, national for est recreation areas, some wildlife refuges and other public lands. It was put into service in 1965.

title: ARAB PACT IN GULF PROPOSED BY IRAQ
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, July 18 President Ahmed Hassan al Bakr of Iraq has proposed the. establishment of an Arab de fense alliance in the Persian Gulf region. He said that the alliance should include the nine independent gulf emirates and Arab gulf powers, referring to Iraq, Saudi Arabia and Ku wait.

title: CURFEW IN PARK BRINGS CLASHES
description: MILWAUKEE, July 18  Around a colorfully lighted fountain in a tiny Milwaukee park, hundreds of young peo ple and scores of policemen played out a nightly drama this week.

title: Words and music
description: Joseph Wechsberg's first love was music. He began taking violin lessons when he was 8. By the time he was 11, he was good enough to pinchhit as second fiddle in a neighborhood quartet presided over by his Uncle Bruno, a fiercely dedicat ed amateur. When he finished at the Gymnasium, however, in his native Ostrava, in Czechoslovakia near the Polish border, his teacher advised him against a violinist's career if he wanted to retain his enjoyment of mu sic. (Kreislers, the teacher pointed out, are the exception.) Today Wechsberg owns an Amati and a Stradivari and plays chamber music for pleas ure wherever he finds a quar tet with a vacant chairin California, Connecticut or Vi enna.

title: Princess Pout Also Scores
description: A thrilling bid by Barbara Hunter's topweighted Pattee Canyon was successful at the last stride in the second divi sion of the Sheepshead Bay Handicap at Aqueduct yester day. Under the heavy burden of 132, Pattee Canyon also car ried the hopes of the favorite. players in the crowd of 46,556 in the 1 3/16mile test for fillies and mares and she paid $4.60 for $2. Her margin over the runnerup, James Cox Brady's Top Round, was a nose.

title: Milestones Can Be Millstones
description: IS Sidney Poitier obso lete? Can he be worn out at 46 while John Wayne, at 63, rolls on, undimin ished, on one lung? That would be a rude question to ask about any conventional movie star, but it can hardly be avoided when an actor, in attaining stardom, has be come, for all practical pur poses, a political point of view and a social symbol, the sort of actor about whom it was written, not so long ago, that he was a credit to his race.

title: Dentist Shortage in Maine Viewed as an Emergency
description: AUGUSTA, Me., July 18 (AP) A shortage of dentists has placed Maine in an emergency dental situation, according to the director of the state's den tal health division.

title: See how they run
description: If you liked Norman Mailer's and Jimmy Breslin's campaign to take over City Hall last year, you'll love this book. I didn't like the campaignI thought it was a monumental exercise in selfindulgence by two of New York's most talented egomani acs but I did like the book their campaign manager has written about it.

title: SingaporeIsrael Air Accord
description: SINGAPORE, July 18 (Reu ters)  Singapore and Israel agreed to allow MalaysiaSin gapore Airlines and El Al Is rael Airline to operate between and beyond their respective ter ritories under an agreement signed yesterday.

title: Calendar of Horse Show Events
description: TodayMillbrook Hunt, Ben nett College Riding center, Route 44, Millbrook, N. Y. Regular, green, amateurowner and junior working hunters; ponies, equita tation. 9 A.M.

title: A genuine tragedy without villains or villainy
description: For 16 days in March, 1921, in the fourth year of the Russian revolu tion and the last days of the civil war, the sailors at the Kronstadt naval base, an island fortress 20 miles west of Petrograd (now Lenin grad), rose against the Soviet Gov ernment. On March 17, after a mili tary siege that left over 10,000 dead and wounded, the rebellion was crushed.

title: Santa Fe Says Surfer C is the Fastest Freight Train in the West
description: The fastest freighttrain in the West  or anywhere else, according to the Atchison, To peka & Santa Fe Railway  is regularly beating its own 40hour schedule between Chi cago and Los Angeles on a route that used to take about 60 hours.

title: Policy of Elks Club Leads to Rejection Of 200 Flag Decals
description: MT. HOLLY, N.J., July 18 The Board of Freeholders of Burlington County voted yes terday to return 200 American flag decals donated by a local Elks lodge.

title: 2 American Marks Bettered By Von Ruden on Coast
description: SOUTH LAKE TAHOE, Calif., July 18 (AP)  Two American) records were surpassed today in an event added to the Ama teur Athletic Union junior pen tathlon competition.

title: Dixon: Maestro Abroad, Stranger at Home
description: THE exile returns. On Tuesday night Dean Dixon, native New Yorker, will conduct the New York Philharmonic in Central Park  his first appearance on an American podium since he left this country 21 years ago be cause, he says, I felt like I was on a sinking ship and if I stayed here, I'd drown.

title: Article 5  No Title
Dole Assails Congress
description: BIRMINGHAM, Ala., July 18 (AP)  Senator Robert Dole, Republican of Kansas, charged today that an irresponsible, unresponsive Congress was blocking President Nixon's ef forts to strengthen the econ omy and deal with other press ing national problems. He made the comment in an address to Alabama Republicans at their state convention.

title: Article 7  No Title
description: PICTURE CREDITS

title: KOCH TOPS SHARPE, 97.75, 57, 86,
description: SAO PAULO, Brazil, July 18 (UPI)Brazil and Canada split the opening singles matches in their American Zone Davis Cup tennis final today.

title: Katherine Ellen McManus Is Bride
description: ALBANY, July 18Miss Katherine Ellen McManus, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Robert L. McManus, was mar ried here to William Stephen Bruin Jr. this afternoon at her parents' home. The bride groom is the son of Mr. and Mrs. Bruin of Warwick Neck, R. I.

title: MARGIN IS A NECK
description: WESTBURY, L. I., July 18 Jean Mary, driving Tidalium Pelo, and JeanRene Gougeon, steering Une de Mai, paid so much attention to each other in the $125,000 International Trot at Roosevelt Raceway to night, they virtually ignored Joe O'Brien and Fresh Yankee, the Canadian champion.

title: Judge Rules Unused Film Is Not Subject to Subpoena
description: SAN FRANCISCO, July 18 (UPI)  Superior Court Judge Lawrence Mana has held that television news film not broad cast may not he subpoenaed in a murder trial. He ruled Thurs day to do so would violate the 1st and 14th Amendments.

title: Sports Today
description: BASEBALL

title: Letters
description: HARDHATTISM, PRO AND CON

title: New York
description: John V. Lindsay was riding through the streets of New York in a mayoral limousine a couple of years ago when he started talking about what it would be like to be a United States Senator: Best job in the world. A pleasant place to work, and all you have to do is show up for a few votes and make a dozen speeches a year. And if the speeches are tough enough, everyone says, Boy has he got guts.

title: French to Call on Italians to Avoid Sea Pollution
description: PARIS, July 18The French coastal authorities, aghast at the mounting pollution of the Mediterranean, have decided to crack down on local polluters and to press Italy to keep her own seaborne filth from drift ing over to the French Riviera.

title: Michael Hertz Weds Deborah Hyson
description: LOCUST VALLEY, L. I., July 18Miss Deborah Owen Hyson and Michael Terry Hertz were married today in a garden ceremony at the home of the bride. Nassau County Judge Alexander Vitale officiated.

title: Point of View
description: The city's builder incentive program, under which developers of luxury housing can build to high R10 densities in lower density zones, is expensive for the city, socially disastrous and doesn't help solve our housing problems. A basic point is that we don't need more luxurythat is, nonsubsidizedhousing, espe cially at currently projected rentals of $125 to $150 per room.

title: Columbia's Coxswain Named Captain of Crew
description: James McHaney of Little Rock, Ark., has been elected captain of the Columbia heavyweight crew.

title: Wood, Field and Stream
description: HARTFORD, July 18Any one planning a trout expedi tion in Connecticut's streams this year has no need to hurry. A new regulation that becomes effective on Sept. 1 extends the season in streams from Oct. 31 to Feb. 28.

title: In Banking, a Scheme That Went Awry
description: Ronald J. Curry, a 66 yearold iron worker who lives near Boston in Med field, Mass., is a bitter man. Last October, Mr. Curry responding to an advertise ment in The Boston Herald Traveller  drew his modest savings of $15.000 out of his local savings bank and sent it to the Seaboard Planning Corporation, a subsidiary of the Seaboard Corporation, a nationwide money brokerage, mutual fund and insurance holding company based in Los Angeles.

title: ACCORD REACHED ON TERMS TO END APARTMENT TIEUP
description: After a fivehour meeting at City Hall, landlord leaders agreed yesterday to recommend a settlement of the apartment strike to their members, aiming at a return of maintenance em ployes on Tuesday.

title: TWA Reaches Agreement With Its Flight Dispatchers
description: Trans World Airlines and its union flight dispatchers have reached a tentative agreement on a threeyear contract, avoid ing a threatened nationwide walkout Friday night, an air lines spokesman said yesterday.

title: Man Immolates Himself in Times Sq.
description: An unidentified man quietly sat down on a curb in crowded Times Square at about 2 P.M. yesterday, poured two cans of a highly flammable liquid over his body, struck a match and burned himself to death.

title: ARAMBURU IS BURIED WITH FULL HONORS
description: BUENOS AIRES, July 18 (AP) Former President Pedro Eugenio Aramburu was buried today with full military honors, two days after his body was found in the basement of a farmhouse 400 miles from Buenos Aires.

title: Seasoned Pilots Are Pacing Hydroplane Circuit
description: WASHINGTON, July 18 (AP) New drivers and new boats are all over the unlimited hydroplane racing circuit this season, but older pilots and craft still lead the field in this comeback year for the fastest sport on water.

title: Science
description: Scientists who grew up in a world where their profes sion was revered are find ing, to their dismay, that there is today a widespread hostility to science. It is evi dent in broad sectors of the public, particularly the young, and is reflected in the attitudes of legislators who control funds for uni versity and laboratory re search.

title: Miss Smith Wed at Home
description: WESTPORT, Conn., July 18The marriage of Miss Christine Louise Smith to Charles Merrill Ambler Jr., son of Mr. and Mrs. Ambler of Jenkintown, Pa., took place here today. The Rev. William T. Bryant of the Greens Farms Congressional Church performed the ceremony in the garden at the home of the bride's parents, Mr. and Mrs. Julian C. Smith.

title: Mafia Believed Behind the ItalianAmerican Protests Over Harassment
description: Bedeviled by the protests of a group of ItalianAmericans over what it feels is discrimina tory treatment, lawenforce ment agencies are convinced the strategy has been initiated by organized crime.

title: C. J. Dunn Marries Lynda Gunther
description: ROSLYN, L.I. July 18 Miss Lynda Pat Gunther and Coulby James Dunn were married here this morning in St. Mary's Roman Catholic Church by the bridegroom's cousin, the Rev. William Mar rin of the Huntington Theo logical Seminary.

title: Education
description: For the first time in American educational and professional history, there is an oversupply of Ph.D.'s. Demands are growing that the universities turn their attention from quantity to the need for a new kind of quality in doctorate production.

title: Business Index Fell in Week
description: The New York Times Weekly Index of Business Activity fell last week to 363.6 from 388.2 a week earlier. A year ago it was 351.7.

title: Movie Mailbag
description: TO THE EDITOR:

title: BRITISH DOCK LEADER WARNS ON TROOP USE
description: LONDON, July 18 (AP)The nationwide dock strike that has idled some 40 British ports might spread to other indus tries if troops are used to un load ships, the leader of the nation's largest union warned today.

title: Man Drowns in Hudson Trying to Save Another
description: A 22yearold man drowned and three others were rescued from the Hudson River nearly two miles above the George Washington Bridge yesterday yesterday afternoon.

title: Advertising:
description: Two weeks ago Tatham Laird & Kudner, of Chicago and New York, diversified by buying a trademagazine publishing company.

title: MISS SMITH KEEPS STATE GOLF TITLE
description: ALBANY, N. Y., July 18 (AP) Lancy Smith captured her third New York State women's amateur golf championship to day by defeating Gail Sykes, 98 in a scheduled 36hole match.

title: BIAGGI ASKS STUDY OF SAILOR'S DEATH
description: Representative Mario Biaggi asked the Navy yesterday to investigate what he called the suspicious death of a Puerto Rican sailor from Manhattan.

title: The World
description: PNOMPENH, Cambodia  The Cambodian Army of 35,000 men had been used mainly to dig ditches and march occasionally in Prince Norodom Sihanouk's pageantperforming both func tions indifferently. Then, four months ago, the armed forces suddenly found themselves faced with the task of defending their country against a battletried in vader.

title: Air Force to End R.O.T.C. At Four More Universities
description: WASHINGTON, July 18 (AP) The Air Force has agreed to disband R.O.T.C. units at four universities over the next two years, it announced yesterday. The action was taken at the re quest of university representa tives, the Air Force said.

title: College AllStars Engage In Limited Contact Work
description: EVANSTON, Ill., July 18 (AP) The College All  Stars who will meet the Kansas City Chiefs in Soldier Field July 31 if National Football League owners and players reach an agreement, worked on punting and fieldgoat kicking this morning, then went to limited contact drills in the afternoon.

title: JOY HELPS OPEN EAST BRONX COOP;Show's Cast Turns Out for Neighborhood Venture
description: The cast of the offBroadway show Joy helped celebrate the formal opening yesterday of the Bronx River Food Coop in the East Bronx.

title: What it means to be an intellectual in Soviet Russia
description: By Valentin Katayev. Translated from the Russian, and with an introduction by Robert Daglish. 222 pp. New York: McGrawHill Book Company. $5.95.

title: Waiting for Nasser
description: The communiqu concluding a nineteenday Moscow visit by President Nasser !eaves the world still await ing Cairo's response to the recent peace initiatives of the United States, the Soviet Union and Israel.

title: COLT REGISTERS 3D VICTORY IN ROW
description: STANTON, Del., July 18 (AP)  Saddle Rock Farm's Twice Worthy outran 11 other 3year olds in the $30,700 Rosemont Stakes at Delaware Park today and equaled the mileandasix teenth track record of 1:41 4/5.

title: Three for The MiniShow
description: ATRIO of small, nifty summer exhibitions has been deployed in the rarely crowded thirdfloor gaileries of the Museum of Modern Art's prints and drawings depart ment. Rescuing about a hun dred modern prints drawings and multiples from museum storerooms, these eyepleas ing and mildly thoughtpro voking minishows we re mounted by three young cura torial assistants whose orien tations are retreshingly dis similar. Pop Art Prints, Drawings and Multiples is given an ambitious historical and stylistic gloss by How ardena Pindell; Donna Stein's cleverly titled Popular Me chanics in PrintMaking is a conscientious anthology of new materials and techniques, and Joan Rosenbaum's Pre liminary Drawings, despite the didactic emphasis of its accompanying wall label on the supposed conceptualiz ing function of drawings preliminary to work in other media, bespeaks an attrac tively personal, connoisseur ing sensibility.

title: Miss Dearing Plans Nuptials
description: Miss Margaret Swearingen Dearing, yacht charter man ager for the Robodor Corpo ration, and Spencer William George Hooker, who is with the IBM World Trade Cor poration here plan to be married in August.

title: ALLIES REOCCUPY A BASE NEAR LAOS
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, July 18  Allied forces established new combat base today at Khamduc, an abandoned United States Special Forces camp 13 miles from the Laotian border in northern South Vietnam.

title: Miss Donna Williams Engaged
description: OLD SAYBROOK, Conn., July 18Mr. and Mrs. John Avery Ingersoll Jr. of Old Saybrook and West Hartford have announced the engage ment of Mrs. Ingersoll's daughter, Miss Donna Turn hull Williams, to Kenneth W. A. Soudan. He is the son of Mr. and Mrs. Alphonse E. Soudan of Glenview, Ill.

title: Australia Voices Concern on Trade
description: SYDNEY, AUSTRALIA, July 4Australia's Acting Minis ter for Trade, Ian Sinclair, says growing protectionism in the United States is causing concern in Australian trade circles.

title: Monmouth Park Posts a Centennial
description: OCEANPORT, N. J.Monmouth Park dubbed the 'resort track because of its many amenities for visitors, especially family groups with children 12 and over will mark the 100th anniversary of its first racing program with a week long round of events beginning Satur day.

title: Britain's Dock Strike
description: It is bad luck for the Conservative Government that, hardly a month in office, it must grapple with Britain's first national dock strike in 44 years. Political justice would have required the late Labor Government to deal with this intractable dispute that could quickly dissipate Britain's hardwon economic gains and bal anceofoavments surplus.

title: Carolyn Sprague Becomes Bride Of W. F. Kracke
description: PLEASANTVILLE. N. Y ., July 18Miss Carolyn Jean Sprague and Lieut. (jg.) Wil liam Frederick Kracke, U.S.N., were married here this after noon in the United Methodist Church by the Rev. William A. Studwell, assisted by the Rev. Harold E. Beliveau, an Episcopal minister.

title: ARMY LIEUTENANT TAKES U.S. CROWN
description: SAN ANTONIO, Tex., July 18 (AP)Army First Lieut. Charles Richards of Tacoma, Wash., won the United States modern pen tathlon national championship today after a tensionpacked second round of shooting.

title: Miss Chi, Aided by Wind, Ties World Dash Mark
description: VIENNA, July 18 (AP) Chi Cheng of Formosa tied the women's world record in the 100meter dash today in clocking 11 seconds at a track and field meet near here.

title: Will we say, It just happened, when the world overpopulates itself to extinction?
description: NEW ORLEANS. SITTING on the edge of her bed in a bleached smock stamped Charity Hospital, her hair in pigtails tied with faded red ribbon, she might easily have been taken for a child only knocking at the door of puberty. But Bonnie Higgins, a frail and unmarried, 18yearold, black highschool senior, had awakened that morning in the maternity ward, six hours after giving birth to a prema tureinfant son. She had no flowers, no visitors (nor the prospect of any, for the hospital said it was too over crowded and understaffed to receive relatives, even husbands, of the indi gent women who come there to give birth). In fact, Bonnie Higgins hadn't even been shown her baby yet when Patricia Rodney, a nurse who intro duced herself as being from Family Planning, started in talking to her about contraception.

title: Aldrin Believes Landing Changed Man's Views
description: HOUSTON., July 18 (Reu ters)Col. Edwin F. Aidrin, who was on his way to man's first landing on the moon this time last year, believes that the event changed man kind's perspective forever.

title: Article 6  No Title
CHECK FINDS MANY FORGET APOLLO 11
description: Only a year after men first set foot on the moon there are signs that even the names of the three Apollo 11 astronauts are fading from the national memory.

title: Article 3  No Title
letter from a friend
description: THERE ARE a few magic hours left in Rome when the visitor can revel in the grandeur of its ancient ruins and baroque architecture and take some snapshots without being run over by a Vespa motorscooter or choked by exhaust fumes filling the narrow, twisting streets.

title: Police Attack on La Paz Paper Underlines Repression of Press
description: LA PAZ, Bolivia, July 18 Twentyfive Bolivian policemen. including three lieutenants, en tered the office of a local newspaper this week and roughed up its staff in an in cident that underlined the vio lence and repression that have been directed against the Boli vian press in recent months.

title: A Glimpse Behind the AllStar Scenes
description: Yeah, there it goes . . . get outta there .... yeah.

title: Many New Schoolteachers Unable to Find Jobs as Nationwide Demand Shrinks
description: Public school superintendents in much of the country, prepar ing for the coming academic year, are being swamped by applications from thousands of qualified teachers unable to find positions in a tightening market.

title: Harbor's Death Alley Being Dredged
description: The roar of dieselelectric machinery, the splash of a grab bucket and the creak ing of dredging gear are be ing heard in New York har bor's death alley.

title: KLINE GIVES 5 NITS AND GETS 3 SINGLES
description: Steve Kline, a 22  year  old rookie pitcher who was work ing in his second major league game, raised both his pitching and batting averages from zero to .500 yesterday as the domi nant force in a 72 triumph by the Yankees over the Oakland Athletics at Yankee Stadium.

title: From the Sports Editor's Mailbox
description: Soccer in Glasgow

title: Tour de France Nears End With Belgian Cyclist Leading
description: VERSAILLES, France, July 18 (AP)JeanPierre Danguillaume of France won the 22d leg of the 57th Tour de France bicycle race today.

title: Length Spurs a Revival on Seventh Ave.
description: Seventh Avenue, the major supplier of fashion merchan dise to the nation, is showing signs of a revival after months of lethargy brought on by indecision on skirt lengths.

title: HARRY FRANCIS COOKE
description: DARIEN, Conn., July 18 Harry Francis Cooke, president and treasurer of Cooke Photo engraving Company of Stam ford, died yesterday at Stam ford Hospital. His age was 56, and he lived at 19 Bittersweet Lane here.

title: Nevada Still Lacks Coach
description: RENO, Nev., July 18 (UPI) The University of Nevada does not have its first Negro coach atfer all. The university an nounced earlier this week that it had hired Cleveland (Chick) Harris, 25 years old, as assist ant football coach. But today the university said Harris had accepted a coaching job at Col orado State University instead.

title: POLICE SEEK INQUIRY INTO SKID ROW RAID
description: LOS ANGELES, July 18 (UPI) The police have asked the United States Attorney Gen eral's office and the District Attorney's office to enter an investigation into the police slaying of two unarmed Mexi cas who did not speak English.

title: Radical Historians on the Move
description: Just after Christmas last year, the American Historical Association expe rienced an attempted revolution. It would be hard to think of a less likely setting for subversion than the sedate parlors of the Sheraton Park and Shoreham Hotels in Washington. Most of the 7,000 historians who came to this 84th annual convention expected to meet old friends, to look for jobs for themselves or their graduate students, and perhaps to listen to an occasional paper on, say, Pre Columbian Contacts with the New World or Ethnic Influences on AustroAmerican Relations, 1885.

title: It's Fourth Down and 100 Yards to Go as Pro Football Pension Dispute Hardens
description: The pro football players and their own ers are a lot more than 100 yards apart in their negotiations over a contract basically concerning fringe benefits such as pension funding and payments for championship games.

title: Belinda Adams Bride Of Donald Dill Eddy
description: GLEN ROCK, N. J., July 18 Miss Belinda Antoinette Adams, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Valda L. Adams Jr., was married here this after noon to Donald Dill Eddy, son of Mr. and Mrs. Roy C. Eddy of Miami. The Rev. Lee R. Bayer performed the cere mony in the Community Church.

title: Blacks and Puerto Rican Added To Newark Board of Education
description: NEWARK, July 18  Mayor Kenneth A. Gibson, a Negro, increased the black representa tion today on the Newark Board of Education by one.

title: Tree Cuts Electric Line
description: RAMAPO, N. Y., July 18A large tree fell onto Route 202 near here this afternoon block ing the road and knocking, down a 13,000volt power line. More than 1,300 Rockland County customers were with not electrical power from 3.25 P.M. until 5:15 P.M.

title: The Nashville Sound
description: Country music is definitely in at the moment: Johnny Cash and Glen Campbell are superstars; Den nis Hopper and Tony Richardson are using country music on the sound tracks of their new movies; and rock groups such as The Band have manu factured yet another hybrid, country rock. The Nashville sound is so popu lar that even Dylan has been re cording there. And so the scene books have begun to arrive, their authors drawn to the subject partly by nos talgiaHemphill is a Southerner, and both he and Roger Williams are work ing journalists living in Atlantaand partly, like so much else about coun try music, by the lure of dollars.

title: The Nation
description: WASHINGTONPresident Nix on, who has been having difficul ties managing the war in Viet nam, appeared last week to have some difficulty managing the rhetoric of his aides on the pros pects for peace.

title: Legend of Gael, Gordon Setter, Best of 1,485 Dogs at Putnam
description: CARMEL, N. Y., July 18 Ch. Legend of Gael C.D., a Gordon setter owned by Mrs. Cheever Porter of New York, was named best in show at the Putnam Kennel Club's 17th show today in a record entry of 1.485.

title: Litchfield, Vesper Score In National Youth Rowing
description: KENT, Conn., July 18The Litchfield Rowing Association of Kent and the Vesper Boat Club of Philadelphia dominat ed the national youth rowing championships on Lake Wara maug today. The winners earn the right to represent the Unit ed States in the world youth championships in Greece Aug. 4 to 8.

title: Santa Tina, 52 Choice, Captures Irish Oaks
description: DUBLIN, July 18 (Reuters)  Lester Piggott, England's champion jockey, scored an easy victory today with the 52 favorite, Santa Tina, in the Irish Guinness Oaks at the Curragh.

title: William Blake: PutUpon Painter of the Patient Job
description: THAT William Blake, the visionary poet and painter of the late 18th and early 19th century, was a man at odds with his time will not be readily ap parent from the splendid ex hibition of his illustrations for the story of Job now on view at the Pierpont Mor gan Library. The 21 water color drawings  beautiful ly rendered and radiant in coloring  are drawn from the Library's collection and will be on view until July 31. They constitute one of the high points of Blake's special art and a marvelously per sonal view of the Biblical story.

title: DANIEL FINK DIES; CIVIL COURT JUDGE
description: Judge J. Daniel Fink of the City Civil Court died Friday in Beekman  Downtown Hospital, after a long illness. He was 65 years old and lived at 390 West End Avenue.

title: LongTime French Communist Embarrasses Party on Ouster
description: PARIS, July 18  An old French Communist whose ca reer dates from a Black Sea mutiny of 1919 has caused his party embarrassment by open dissidence before several mil lion television viewers.

title: John Cotton Marries Karen Elsa Imparato
description: Miss Karen Elsa Imparato, a junior at George Washing ton University was married at her parents' home here yesterday to John Maurice Cotton, who plans to study medicine.

title: Drag Racers Seek Fame and $175,000 in Prize Money
description: YORK, Pa., July 18The wonderful world of drag rac ing, a kaleidoscope of exotic sights, sounds and odors, in vaded this agricultural and industrial area of central Pennsylvania today. By mid afternoon, temperatures at the York U. S. 30 Dragway had soared into the 90's, but drag fans are so dedicated that they are never fazed by a triviality like broiling sun.

title: 6 SCHOOLS IN SOUTH GET TAX EXEMPTION
description: WASHINGTON, July 18 (UPI)The Internal Revenue Service said today that it had) granted income tax exemptions) to six Southern private schools that had promied not to dis criminate on the basis of race.

title: NAMING OF WALSH AS CARDINAL SEEN
description: ROME, July 18The Most Rev. James Edward Walsh, the 79yearold American Bishop who was released last week from a Chinese Communist prison after having served 12 years of a 20year term on spying charges, will probably be proclaimed a Cardinal as soon as he comes to Rome, highly placed Vatican sources said today.

title: Zindel's DropOuts
description: JEROME HELLMAN has discovered some delight ful dropouts. And so he has purchased the rights to Paul Zindel's novel I Never Loved Your Mind, a sadcomic treatment of two kids who ditch the academic life in order to find out what life is really all about. Pro ducer Hellman will make his directorial debut with the film, which will be shot in New York later this year.

title: Prices Up On Counter And Amex
description: Prices on the American Stock Exchange and in un listed issues registered a small gain last week. The in dex closed Friday at 20.19, compared with 19.93 a week before.

title: VENEZUELA FINDS TERROR ABATING
description: CARACAS, Venezuela, July 17As the tempo of terrorist bombings increases from Cana da to Argentina, many Vene zuelans are wondering what happened to their antiGovern ment guerrilla groups.

title: U.S. Unit to Quit Philippines
description: MANILA, July 18 (AP)  A 544man United States Air Force fighter squadron will be withdrawn, from the Philip pines and deactivated this month, the United States Em bassy disclosed today. The 509th Fighter  Interceptor Squadron at Clark Air Base will be inactivated as a unit by next Friday, an embassy spokesman said.

title: Best Seller List
description: This analysis is based on reports obtained from more than 125 book stores in 64 communities of the United States. The figures in the right hand column do not necessarily represent consecutive appearances.

title: Coins
description: SPECIAL series of Greek coins to mark the mil itary coup of April 21, 1967, has been issued by the Bank of Greece in Athens. The monies were struck in gold of 20 and 100 drachmai denominations and in silver of 50 and 100 draclunai values.

title: See No Evil
description: Being a censor, Jack Vizzard tells us in the very first sentence of his memoir, is like being a whore; everyone wants to know how you got into the business. After the backslapping geniality of this begin ning, we are treated to a series of rowdy anecdotes, the punchlines of which were until very recently verboten on the silver screen Mr. Viz zard, a minion of the Code Office, helped police with the Production Code. Indeed, the Code itself (use fully reprinted at the end of the book) specifically forbade the use of the word whore under Article V (Profanity). Thus from the outset Mr. Vizzard's ribald recollections at test to the abiding hypocrisy of all censorship.

title: Witness in Tanzanian Treason Trial Says Conspirator Had Links With U.S. Information Service Official
description: DAR ES SALAAM, Tanzania, July 18The president of the Pan African Congress has testi fied that there were links be tween a United States Infor mation Service official in Lon don and a former Tanzanian Cabinet minister, who, the Government says, planned to assassinate President Julius K. Nyerere and overthrow his Government.

title: Bavasi's Son Promoted
description: SAN DIEGO, July 18 (UPI) Peter Bavasi, the son of Buzzie Bavasi, president of the San Diego Padres baseball team, was named a vice president of the National League club today. The 25yearold Babasi will con tinue to serve as director of the Padres' minor league opera tions.

title: Older Mays Loses SayHey Feeling
description: Say Hey! I just want to get the hell out of here and go home, that's what I want to do.

title: Graham Says Youths Rebel
description: TOKYO, July 18 (AP)The Rev. Billy Graham said today that modern youth had chosen In rebel against God and soci ely. The evangelist told the World Baptist Congress at Tok yo's Budokar Hall that the mass communications industry also was responsible for what was happening to young peo ple.

title: Calendar of Motor Sports Events
description: TodayNascar, Grand Ameri can Division 100mile race at Bryar Motorsport Park, Loudon, N. H., 6 P.M.

title: 10 MOSCOW JEWS CHALLENGE SOVIET
description: The widow of Soviet Yiddish poet and her daughter joined eight other signers last week in an unusual appeal to the Su preme Soviet.

title: JUAN HERNANDEZ, ACTOR, DIES AT 74
description: SAN JUAN, P. R., July 18 (AP)Juan G. Hernandez, the actor who appeared in more than 30 movies under the stage name Juano, died in a suburban clinic here yesterday after suf fering a cerebral hemorrhage. He was 74 years old.

title: Chompion, Gaybrook Swan Race to Suffolk Dead Heat
description: BOSTON, July 18 (AP)C. V. Whitney's Chompion and J. Lieberman's Gaybrook Swan finished in a dead heat in rec ord time in the $27,750 Get. away Day Special today as Suf folk Downs ended its 90dayl race meeting.

title: Movies
description: MOST of the several pans, and a couple of the raves, that have been visited on Catch22 in voke the surprisingly hardy no tion that Joseph Heller's novel is some kind of great book. This lends a distinct ly unreal cast to the general critical dis cussion, corresponding to the pervasive aimlessness and unreality that make sitting through the movie such a marvel of tedium. The fog lifts when one admits that Catch22, the book, is an am bitious and entertaining period piece riddled with cheap preciousness and sentimentality, and that Catch22. the movie, is a remarkably faithful adapta tion of the original which suffers from The selfsame faults. The ultimate fail ure of the film is thus attributable not to directorial or scriptwriting deficien cies, but to Mike Nichols's and Buck Henry's evident and misplaced reverence for Heller.

title: HUME TRIUMPHS IN SHIELDS CLASS
description: GREENWICH, Conn., July 18  Thomas Hume won by 29 seconds with his Shields Class sloop, Pantomine, on Long Is land Sound today and Palmer D. Sparkman by more than six minutes with Lulu in the Soling Class in the Belle Haven club regatta, which was the season's 21st championship event for Yacht Racing Association fleets based east of Rye. They cov ered a a 7mile Gold Cup course in a steady westerly of 5 to 10 knots. It was Hume's seventh victory of the season.

title: Daughter Born to Boyds
description: RUMSON, N. J., July 18 A daughter was horn to Mr. and Mrs. Gary D. Boyd on June 25 at the Monmouth Medical Center in Long Branch. The child has been named Cynthia Melinda.

title: Generous With Whose Land?
description: The Senate's proposal for settling the claims of Alaska's native population is too limited to be an act of national generosity and too narrowly conceived to be a social breakthrough. It would give to each of the state's Eskimos, Aleuts, and Indians some $12,000, a third of which he would get in the form of services and twothirds in shares which should yieldhim a few hundred dollars a year in dividends and which he could sell in twelve years.

title: Anniversaries
description: FARBSTEINRhoda. My love always. Franks for 18 wonderful years Happy Anniversary

title: York Kennel Club Gets Entry of 1,490 For Its First Show
description: Each year sees more all breed and specialty shows. In 1969, there were 1,103, an increase of 46 over the pre vious year. The figure will be higher in 1970.

title: M.I.T. Picks Freshman Coach
description: Frederick V. Lett has been named coach of Massachusetts Institute of Technology's fresh man baseball and wrestling squads.

title: Late Listings for Today's TV
description: The following information about today's television pro grams was not available in time to appear in Section 2

title: Article 2  No Title
description: INTERNATIONAL

title: HUNTER CROWN WON BY LIBERTY AWARD
description: RHINEBECK, N. Y., July 18 Liberty Award, owned and rid den by Bill Morrin of Albany. swept to victory in all three classes today to score 15 points. and win the green working hunter championship at the Springhrook Park horse show.

title: Cornell Alumni Donations Up 60% Over Last Year
description: Cornell University's alumni have increased their unrestrict ed gifts for the school year of 196970 by 60 per cent over the previous year.

title: Frightening Rise in V.D.
description: All of the tragic news today, is not coming from Vietnam, Cambodia or the Middle East. The almost daily reports of the rise in venereal disease to pan demic proportions Is frighten ing. If something isn't done about it, it may well cripple, incapacitate and eventually kill more people than combat.

title: A Razzberry for Strawberry
description: WHEN I went to see The Strawberry Statement, I hon estly didn't expect to see great cinematic art. I only expected, quite unrea sonably it seems, to find something similar to the James Simon Kunen book on which it is based; that is, I was prepared for a coy, cloy ing and comfortably liberal movie about a bunch of real ly sweet kids who get a little angry about the war in Indochina and other nasty things and, in lieu of panty raids (this is 1970 after all), com mit some naughties on cam pus. However, to lift from Kunen's vocabulary, what saw was . . . well, gosh, it was really poopy.

title: Rindt Car Captures Prix Despite Aerofoils
description: BRANDS HATCH, England, July 18Two and a half hours after he was disqualified for the use of illegal aerofoils on his Lotus 72, Jochen Rindt of Austria was declared the winner of today's British Grand Prix to move him far in front in the race for the world drivers' chamnionship.

title: CARMEN RATIFY PACT WITH L.I.R. ON RAISE
description: MINEOLA. L. I., July 18 (AP) The first of 14 unions rati lied a new contract with the Long Island Railroad today extending through 1971. The other unions are expected to follow suit.

title: EXPLOSIVES SALES UNDER NEW RULES
description: Persons seeking to buy ex plosives in New York State will be subject to more stringent licensing rules starting today in an effort to prevent such sales to those who might use them illegally.

title: Yarborough Heads Field of 30 Drivers In Volunteer 500
description: BRISTOL, Tenn., July 18 (AP)  Thirty of NASCAR's top drivers, led by Cale Yarborough of Timmonsville, S. C., will shoot for $32,000 in prize money tomorrow in the Volun teer 500 Grand National auto rice at Bristol International Speedway.

title: CARDINAL ROOKIES REPORT TOMORROW
description: LAKE FOREST, Ill., July 18 (AP)It's the beginning of a long haul back for the St. Louis Cardinals, who open camp with, a threeday routine for rookies, Monday in preparation for the National Football League season.

title: Police Halt a Harvest On Park Avenue Mall
description: Carl Schreyer, 22 years old, and Angela Maher, 19, were arrested yesterday while har vesting marijuana from concrete planter in the di vider mall of Park Avenue South near 25th Street, the notice said.

title: SPARTON TRIUMPHS IN SAPPHO SAILING
description: William H. Borst's Sparton was second to finish and first over all in the 22d annual Sappho Trophy race for cruis ing boats yesterday on Long Island Sound.

title: ISRAELI PHANTOM DOWNED BY U.A.R.
description: JERUSALEM, July 18Israel resumed her bombardment of SovietEgyptian missile batteries in the ventral sector of the Suez. Canal tone today scoring what the Israeli military spokesman termed satisfactory hits on the designated targets, but losing one aircraft.

title: In The Nation: No Sale on Preventive Detention
description: WASHINGTON, July 18  Rarely if ever does a member of Congress or any other politi cian have to face a clearcut choice between going down in flames for virtue or going to bed with the devil. Few choices are ever that simple for any one, and one of the classic examples of recent times is the District of Columbia crime bill now before the Senate.

title: Rents for Luxury Soar
description: The new apartments that are coming onto the market in Manhattan at a rate no faster than a trickle are rent ing at price levels higher than ever in the city's his tory, but are offering some thing less than what was once considered luxury.

title: Washington U. is Defeated By British Columbia Shell
description: VANCOUVER, British Colum bia, July 18 (AP)The Univer sity of British Columbia's eight oared shell scored a halflength victory today over the Univer sity of Washington, the United States intercollegiate and North American champion.

title: Panther Hearing Listed
description: WASHINGTON, July 18 (UPI) A House internal security subcommittee will seek testi mony next week on Black Pan ther activities in Detroit and Indianapolis from former Pan ther officials who broke with the organization. Representative Richardson Preyer, Democrat of North Carolina, the subcommit tee chairman, said today open hearings would be held Tues day, Wednesday and Thursday in Washington.

title: The Plight of Valiant
description: NEWPORT, R. I., July 18 What's wrong with Valiant?

title: Power Failsin Johannesburg
description: JOHANNESBURG, South Af rica, July 18 (AP)  Electric power failed for about two hours at midday today in Johannesburg, South Africa's largest city.

title: MAILERS WIN $72 FROM DAILY NEWS
description: Journeymen mailers at The Daily News have won a wage increase of $72 a week over a threeyear period under terms of a tentative new contract made public yesterday.

title: Ford Tractor Deal
description: DETROIT, June 27 (AP) The Japanese Ministry of In ternational Trade and Indus try has approved a Ford Motor Company proposal to press sales of agricultural and industrial tractors in Japan, Ford has announced. Sixty per cent of ownership of Hakkai Ford Tractor Com pany, Ltd., will be held by Hokkai Jidosha Kogyo, K.K. Ford will hold the remaining 40 per cent.

title: Bridge
description: THE decline in the teaching of Latin in schools has one un fortunate result for bridge playersmany of them find it diffi cult to distinguish between the active voice and the passive voice.

title: CANNON, COUTURE WIN AUTO RACES
description: I ELKHART LAKE, Wis., July 18 (AP)Canadians captured both races in the Continental. Championship series at the Road America track today.

title: 5 GROUPS ASK BAN ON HERBICIDE USE
description: WASHINGTON, July 18Five conservation, consumer and social organizations have asked the United States Court of Appeals for the District of Columbia Circuit to reverse the refusal of Secretary of Agri culture Clifford M. Hardin to suspend the use of the herbi cide 2,4,5T on food crops.

title: William K. Hoffman Marries Carolyn Wetlesen in Nev Dorp
description: Miss Carolyn Wetlesen and William Kenneth Hoffman, hot of New York, were mar ried yesterday afternoon in New Dorp Moravian Church, Staten Island, by the Rev. David A. Schattschneider of Bethlehem. Pa. He was assist ed by the Rev. Charles B. Adams.

title: IND Crash Study Rules Out Equipment
description: A special Metropolitan Trans portation Authority board of in quiry reported after a fourhour study yesterday that equipment failure was not a factor in the subway accident in Brooklyn that injured 37 persons on Fri day.

title: Letters:
description: TO THE FINANCIAL EDITOR:

title: Saigon General Accuses Thais Of Shirking on Cambodian Aid
description: BIENHOA, South Vietnam, July 18A leading South Viet namese general charged today that the leaders of Thailand were shirking their responsibil ity to help defend Cambodia because the United States would not pay them enough money.

title: MOORE TRIUMPHS IN COW BAY SAIL
description: PORT WASHINGTON, L. I., July 18James B. Moore Jr.'s Lure was back in the Resolute Class winner's circle today as 78 boats sailed with the Man hasset Bay Yacht Club in the Cow Bay area, Yacht Racing Association of Long Island Sound regatta.

title: Home Improvement
description: SPECIFICALLY designed for dressing up or re modeling existing kitch en cabinets that now have flush doors, the self adhesive, three  dimensional vinyl panels illustrated at right come in four different patterns and colors, and they are scaled in modular panels that will fit almost every size cabinet door. Made of semi rigid vinyl that resists dents and is fully washable, they are installed by simply peel ing off a protective paper backing, then pressing them into place. The panels come in packages that contain eight 6x12inch modules and eight 6x10inch modules  enough to cover about four average doors. In addition to the pat tern shown, (Colonial, an tique birch color), there is a Contemporary pattern in wal nut, a Continental pattern in antique gold on white, and a Country Classic in light birch tones. Kitchen Cabinet Decor, $3.95 per box. (The DecroWall Corporation, Ex ecutive Boulevard, Elmsford, N. Y. 10523.)

title: Rains Kill 15 in South Korea
description: SEOUL, South Korea, July 18  Fifteen persons have been killed and 11 are missing in ac cidents caused by heavy rains in South Korea over thelast three days, the national flood relief center reported today.

title: VALIANT DEFEATS INTREPID AT LAST
description: NEWPORT, R. I., July 18In what amounted to a handicap event, Valiant finally managed to beat Intrepid here today.

title: SCHOOLBOOK FEES VOIDED IN MICHIGAN
description: LANSING, Mich., July 18 (UP)The Michigan Supreme Court ruled yesterday that all public schools in Michigan must provide free textbooks and school supplies to their students.

title: Spotlight:
description: After 40 years of stock market watching on Wall Street, Ralph A.
