Rotnem re tired 14 months ago as sen ior vice president and direc tor of research for Harris, Upham & Co., Inc., and took up residence in Pride's Cross ing, Mass., a graceful Cape Ann community overlooking the waters of Marblehead Bay.

title: Evers Joins Tiger Staff
description: CHICAGO, July 18 (AP) Walter (Hoot) Evers, a former Detroit Tiger outfielder, was named the club's director of player development today to succeed Don Lund. Lund re signed yesterday to return to the University of Michigan as assistant athletic director.

title: Soviet Relief Plane To Peru Is Missing Over North Atlantic
description: OTTAWA, July 18 (AP)A fourengine Soviet cargo plane carrying earthquake relief sup plies to Peru is missing over the North Atlantic, a spokes man for the Canadian armed forces said today.

title: Learner Uses Model T
description: LISBON, Ohio, July 18 (AP) Brian Kelm, 16 years old. passed his driver's license ex amination driving a 1915 Model. T Ford owned by his father. I never had so much fun, the license examiner, Robert Jack son said this week, fie said that the voulh handled the ve hicle like an expert and parked it on a dime with nine cents change.

title: Hodge of Clarkson Picked for Coaches Hall of Fame
description: Henry R. Hodge, director of athletics at Clarkson College in Potsdam, N. Y., for 23 years, has been elected to the Amer ican Association of College Baseball Coaches Hall of Fame.

title: Americans Find Mexico No Drug Haven
description: MEXICO CITY, July 18At least 187 United States citizens are in prison in Mexico on nar cotics charges  among them at least a dozen young stu I dents or vacationers who were arrested with small amounts of marijuana in their posses sion.

title: Miss Stewart Takes Title Fifth Time in Jersey Tennis
description: EAST ORANGE. N.J., July 18  Pat Stewart of New York captured the New Jersey State women's tennis championship today by defeating Sylvia Hooks of Newark in the final, 64, 63, at the East Orange Tennis Club.

title: Designers of Office Space Widen Their Orbit
description: Within the last decade, in response to the new pres sures for more working peo ple in less working area, a new space science has sprung up  the science of the design of inner space.

title: Joan Bird and Afeni Shakur, SelfStyled Soldiers in the Panther Class Struggle
description: One day early in 1968, Bobby G. Seale, the chairman of the Black Panthers, stood rapping, really rapping on a Harlem street corner and won for his party the loyalty and admira tion of at least one rapt listener.

title: Old Families in a New Toronto
description: TORONTO  Strung out along the northwestern shore of Lake Ontario and home to more than two million inhabi tants, Toronto is like a respectable dow ager who has had a remarkably suc cessful face lifting. Its aura of conserva tism and tradition is blended now with slightly incredulous delight at the trans formation. The dowager is swinging in an air permeated with confidence, well being, pride and vitality.

title: Prince Charles Talks With Nixon for Over an Hour
description: WASHINGTON, July 18  Prince Charles and President Nixon today spent an hour and 20 minutes alone in uninterrupt ed conversation at the White House.

title: PANEL FINDS NEED TO INSPIRE DEBATE ON NATION'S GOALS
description: WASHINGTON, July 18A White House study on national goals has reached the conclu sion that the White House can not set goals for America.

title: Major League Baseball
description: Sunday, July 19, 1970

title: Scheel Confers With Nixon
description: WASHINGTON, July 18 (AP) The West German Foreign Minister, Walter Scheel, con ferred with President. Nixon to day and afterward expressed firm belief that I have the complete support of our allies in seeking a nonaggression pact with the Soviet Union. He said he would go to Moscow on July 26 to negotiate the treaty.

title: To Know Japan See Her Temples
description: THERE WAS a small, bright red maple tree on a steep grass slope by the Mount Koya monastery. I sat beside it and did the Japanese thing: I wrote a poem. It wasn't a very good poem, but I had to do something to mark the occasion. The event was simply being alone, alone in a creative sense I was not accustomed to. I had climbed the long ascent to this famous Bu??ist monastery and asked, in the manner of medieval Europe, for the monks' hospitality. A young acolyte took me to room, showed me the ofuro (honorable bath) and brought me the delicate and strictly vegetarian evening meal.

title: teller, Reynolds, Larsen In OldTimers' Game
description: ANAHEIM, July 18 (UPI) Bob Feller, Allie Reynolds and Don Larsen will pitch for Casey Stengel's American League All Star team in the second Old timers' game at Anaheim Sta dium on Aug. 16. Stengel's team will meet Fred Haney's National League AllStars in a threeinning contest.

title: W. W. Thompson Weds Nancy Demuth
description: CHEVY CHASE, Md., July 18Miss Nancy Chase De muth, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Richard H. Demuth of Bethesda, was married here this afternoon to Petty Offi cer 3d Class William Wade Thompson, U.S.N., son of Mr. and Mrs. Samuel T. Thomp son of Lynchburg, Va. The Rev. Orville S. Chadsev per formed the ceremony in the Chevy Chase Presbyterian Church.

title: Stamps
description: THIS column has, on numrous occasions, pointed to deliberate efforts of various post al authorities to release is sues aimed at increasing the sale of stamps to collectors, rather than to the needs of their communities for nor mal postal services. The stamps, usually, are hand some and mostly multi colored. They frequently car ry reproductions of paintings by distinguished artists; or they may be concerned with popular figures  John F. Kennedy, for example  who have had meaning to many people, as well as stamp col lectors.

title: John J. Astor Weds Fiona Harvey
description: LONDON, July 18John Jacob Astor, elder son of Gavin Astor and Lady Irene Astor, and Fiona Diana Len nox Harvey, daughter of Capt. and Mrs. Roger Harvey, were married today in St. Peter's Church, Edenbridge, Kent.

title: Adaptive School Man
description: Nineteen months ago, as he was leaving Washington to join the Ford Foundation as an adviser in India, Harold Howe 2d lamented the diffi culty of getting the nation's schools and colleges to adapt to changing conditions.

title: Play From a Jail Cell Tested at Drama Parley
description: WATERFORD, Conn.  It was a misty, sodden day at the Eugene O'Neill Memo rial Theater Center, damp enough to depress anyone's spirits, except, apparently, the enthusiastic playwrights, directors, and actors at this year's Playwrights Confer ence here.

title: Spanish Tourist Agency in Stockholm After Protest at Embassy
description: STOCKHOLM, July 19 (AP) A fire bomb was thrown into the Spanish Tourist Agency here today. A result ing fire destroyed the lower floor and filled an upper of fice with smoke.

title: Penury Conviction of Seattle Assistant Chief Discloses a Police Shakedown and Bribery Scandal
description: SEATTLE, July 17A classic police shakedown and bribery scandal has been exposed here in the Federal court conviction on perjury charges of an assist ant chief of police.

title: In Rome, Salesgirls and Princesses Turn Up in Long Skirts
description: ROMEItalian women never were really comfortable in miniskirts, the ex planation goes. They're too close to the Vatican, their legs aren't all that good, they like too look sexy but not exposed.

title: Formals Strike Rare Note at Lawn Party at the Basies'
description: The temperature hovered in the high 80's, and the sun overhead was dazzling in its brilliance but the swimming pool was empty. It wasn't that kind of party.

title: Advertising
description: Boeing, which makes the giant 747 jet, ran fullpage ads last Thursday in 85 newspapers in 46 cities throughout the world, head lined, Take one today and be one in a million.

title: Justice Department Bids Court Realign Schools in Houston
description: HOUSTON, July 19 (AP) The Justice Department has asked the United States Court of Appeals for the Fifth Circuit to order the Houston School District to pair and group 101 schools to achieve greater de segregation.

title: Miss Irene H. Schwarzschild Is Bride of Robert Schwartz
description: At Temple EmanuEl here yesterday afternoon Miss Irene Helen Schwarzschild, a graduate student in educa tion at New York University, was married to Robert Alan Schwartz, who is an associ ate professor of economics and finance at N.Y.U's Grad uate School of Business Ad ministration. Rabbi Mark N. Goldman performed the cere mony.

title: SENATORS SCORE
description: WASHINGTON, July 19 (UPI)Lee Maye's basesloaded single with one out in the ninth inning scored Paul Casa nova and brought the Washing ton Senators a 43 victory over the Milwaukee Brewers today.

title: Disturbance Erupts At U.S. Jail Here; Windows Broken
description: A disturbance broke out in the Federal House of Detention at 427 West Street late last night as inmates broke windows on the second floor of the over crowded facility and threw light bulbs and, rolls of toilet paper to the street.

title: Panayotis Pipinelis Is Dead; Foreign Minister of Greece, 71
description: ATHENS, July 19Panayotis Pipinelis, Foreign Minister and once Premier of Greece, died in a hospital here early this morning following a heart at tack. He was 71 years old.

title: OLD ISSUE FUMES IN LATIN AMERICA
description: BOGOTA, Colombia, July. 19  The Governments of Colom bia and Venezuela are strug gling to prevent a long sim mering dispute over illegal im migration from breaking into serious violence.

title: Tabarly Joins French for Cup Yachting
description: NEWPORT, R.I., July 19  While the America's Cup De fense forces broke camp to day, the French got a major psychological lift.

title: BOND YIELDS SEEN CONTINUING DOWN
description: The credit markets are enter ing a critical period that should go a long way toward determin ing whether the drop in interest rates over the last four and a half weeks is longlasting.

title: Two Admit Arson in Riviera
description: NICE, France, July 19 (UPI) The police said today that two men had admitted seting fires along the French Riviera that burned thousands of acres of countryside during the last four days. One other man has been arrested in connection with the fire.

title: Fans' Reaction Feared
description: SALT LAKE CITY, July 19 (UPI)  Merlin Olsen, player representative for the Los An geles Rams, said a prolonged strike by the National Football League players would tend to turn the fans against the play ers.

title: Cambodians Puzzled by Attacks On Former Major Supply Base
description: LONGVEK, Cambodia, July 18The sprawling Cambodian military supply base here, which once nourished the en tire army but now looks more like an auto graveyard, was attacked by the Vietcong and North Vietnamese last night, the night before, the night be fore that and six other nights since June 24. The commander expects to be hit again tomor row and the day after and the day after that.

title: DRAG RACING TITLE TAKEN BY BROWN
description: YORK, Pa., July 19 (AP) Larry Brown of Vandalia, Ohio; Gene Snow of Fort Worth, and Pete Robinson of Atlanta won titles today in the $175,000 Na tional Hot Rod Association sum mer nationals drag meet.

title: Governor Urged by Beame To Return Subways to City
description: Controller Abraham D. Beame telegraphed Govenor Rockefel ler yesterday asking him to call a special session of the Legislature to return the sub ways to city control.

title: 2 Nebraska Indian Tribes Decry Prejudice and Bigotry of White Neighbors
description: MACY, Neb.The normally docile and undemonstrative Omaha and Winnebago Indians, whose small reservations are on the west bank of the Mis souri 70 miles north of Omaha, have warned the surrounding whites that the Indians will no longer tolerate prejudice, big otry and discrimination.

title: After the Eagle's Landing
description: Houston. Tranquility Base here. The Eagle has landed.

title: COLLIE CAPTURES YORK K.C. AWARD
description: WELLSVILLE, Pa., July 19 Ch. Black Hawk of Kasan, a 4yearold smooth collie, was William L. Kendrick's choice for best in show today over an entry of 1,500 at the York Ken inel Club's first show.

title: RED SOX TROUNCE ATHLETICS, 9 TO 4
description: BOSTON, July 19 (UPI)Rico Petrocelli knocked in five runs in the first two innings today with a home run and a double, leading the Boston Red Sox to a 94 victory over the Oakland Athletics.

title: Israel Reports Jets Raided Egypt, Jordan and Lebanon
description: TEL AVIV, July 19  Israeli warplanes were reported to have attacked Arab targets on three fronts today, striking the Egyptians in the Suez Canal sector and guerrilla positions in Jordan and Lebanon. All the jets returned safely, the Israeli military spokesman reported.

title: Major League Baseball
description: Monday, July 20, 1970

title: International Loans Listed for Week
description: WASHINGTON, July 19The following is a list of loans and other aid extended last week by United States and other international lending agencies here:

title: LIMITED CEASEFIRE IS OPPOSED BY RABIN
description: WASHINGTON, July 19 (AP) Itzhak Rabin, Israel's Am bassador to the United States, said today his country opposed a limited ceasefire in the Mid dle East such as the 90day halt of hostilities reported proposed by the United. States. But he did not reject the suggestion completely.

title: Dr. Howard K. Hyde, Adviser To World Bank in New Delhi
description: NEW DELHI, July 19, (Reu ters)Dr. Howard K. Hyde, an American management adviser for the International Bank for Reconstruction and Develop ment, was killed today when he fell from a tree in his garden. Dr. Hyde, formerly of Washing ton, had climbed a eucalyptus tree to saw oft a branch when he fell his family said.

title: Trumpeter Develops Leaks
description: LERWICK, Shetland Isles, Scotland, July 19 (UPI)The American trimaran Trumpeter, which left here yesterday in third place in the RoundBrit ain sailing race, returned today partly filled with water.

title: Dr. Samuel J. Konefsky Is Dead; Blind Teacher and Author, 55
description: Dr. Samuel J. Konefsky, pro fessor of political science at Brooklyn College and the au thor of books on Justices of the Supreme Court, died Saturday in Lenox Hill Hospital, after a long illness. He was 55 years old and lived at 1225 East 23d Street, Brooklyn.

title: G.M. to Start Publishing Autos' Net Horsepower
description: DETROIT, July 19 (UPI) The General Motors Cor poration will publish the net horsepower of engines in stalled in automobiles, as well as the horsepower of the stripped engines, beginning with the 1971 models.

title: EnvironmentalManagement School Held
description: FORT COLLINS, Colo.  Twentyeight men from in dustry and Government came last June 13 and 14 to the beautiful Colorado State Uni versity campus here at the foot of the Northern Colo rado Rockies.

title: DR. OSWALD JONES, AN INTERNIST, DIES
description: Dr. Oswald R. Jones, a spe cialist in internal medicine who founded and was first director of the CardioRespiratory. Labo ratory at St. Luke's Hospital, died yesterday in Roosevelt Hospital. He was 73 years old and lived at 850 Park Avenue and East Hampton. L. I.

title: Superhighway for Indonesia
description: JAKARTA, Indonesia, July 19 (AP)Indonesia will build her first superhighway, a 31mile, fourlane road between Jakarta and Bogor, in 1972, with the help of a $23.5million loan from the United States Agency for International Devolpment, the official Antara news agency has reported.

title: New Steel Orders Continuing to Lag
description: PITTSBURGH, July 19 There is still no pickup in de mand for steel. With mills ap proaching the time when any fall improvement should start showing up in orders, new busi ness continues to lag.

title: Article 1  No Title
News Summary and Index
description: MONDAY, JULY 20, 1970

title: London Excites and Irks Europe's Mayors
description: LONDON, July 19  The Mayor of Meursault grumbled about the wine. The Mayor of Offenbach complained about the beer and the bread. And the Lord Mayor of Sirmione said the skirts were shocking.

title: FOY'S 15INCH BEAGLE TAKES HIS 6TH BEST
description: NORTHAMPTON, Mass., July 19Lullaby Kennels' and Tom Foy Jr.'s 15inch beagle, Ch. Kings Creek Triple Threat, gained his sixth bestinshow award today at the Holyoke Kennel Club's 21st annual dog show and obedience trials on the Northampton Fairgrounds.

title: Landlords to Vote Tonight on Recommendations for Ending Employes' Strike
description: While some landlords were reported already signing new union contracts yesterday, the Metropolitan Fair Rent Com mitee called a meeting for to night to act on recommenda tions worked out at City Hall late Saturday for setting the apartment strike.

title: Enemy Rockets Strike Saigon For the Fourth Time This Year
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Monday, July 20Enemy forces fired two 100pound rockets into the heart of Saigon early today, setting off explosions that reverberated throughout the downtown area.

title: Allagash Waterway in Maine Becomes National Wild River
description: ALLAGASH, Me., July 19 A 92milelong watery corridor through the forests of northern Maine became today the first stateadministered recreation area added to the National Wild and Scenic River System.

title: Town Has Police Riot Squad but No Riots
description: MIDDLETOWN, N. J.  Capt. Frank Gleason looked out the window of the police headquarters here and watched a man paint a bus blue and white with letter ing that read: Middletown Township Police.

title: WILCOX ROTS 69 FOR SECOND PLACE
description: WHITEMARSH, Pa., July 19 Billy Casper won the $150,000 Philadelphia Golf Classic by three strokes today and further entrenched himself as one of the game's notable players.

title: ALARM IS VOICED ON TRADE POLICY
description: WASHINGTON, July 19Ten former, present and future pres idents of the American Eco nomic Association made public today a statement expressing alarm at the serious threat to United States trade policy posed by protectionist moves in Congress.

title: WHITE SOX LOSE, 82, THEN WIN, 73
description: CHICAGO, July 19 (UPI) Duane Josephson collected four straight hits and drove in two runs today to help the Chicago White Sox beat the Baltimore Orioles, 73, in the second game after the Orioles had whipped the White Sox, 82, in the open er of a twin bill.

title: Is the Recession Over?
description: Preliminary Government data indicate that the nation's total output of goods and services stopped declining in the second quarter. Administration spokes men promptly announced that the downswing has bot tomed out and expressed their confidence that total output will start growing in the current quarter.

title: Keller Feels Close to Mare He Bred and Sold as Yearling
description: In October of 1939, when baseball's clarion cry was, Break Up the Yankees, an unidentified Cincinnati player said, I'd be satisfied if they'd just break up Keller.

title: Rockefeller Names
description: ALBANY, July 19John L. Loeb Jr., a New York City in vestment banker, was desig nated today by Governor Rock efeller as chairman of the re cently established State Council of Environmental Advisers.

title: A Large Water Shortage By 1980 Predicted for U.S.
description: PENTICTON, B.C., July 19 (CP)The United States will be short 50 billion to 100 bil lion gallons of water a year by 1980 if new sources are not found, the annual meeting of the Canadian Water Resources Association was told during the weekend.

title: Low Profile in Germany
description: The visit to Washington of West German Foreign Minister Walter Scheel has been an effort to get the United States to stand up and be counted on one of the most critical issues of this era, achievement of an EastWest settlement in Europe more than a guar tercerthary after World War II.

title: EARTH DAY GROUP ZEROS IN ON AUTOS
description: BLACK LAKE, Mich., July 19  The internal combustion engine emerged as a major symbol and target as environ mental activists met here this weekend to seek new post Earth Day strategies.

title: Miners Support Pickets
description: OSAKA, Va., July 19 (AP) About 65 members and of ficers of United Mine Workers of America Local 1355 voted unanimously today to stop work at Prescott Mine here in sympathy with 11 miners who were dismissed during picket ing at nearby mines last week.

title: Padres, Expos Split
description: SAN DIEGO, July 19 (AP) The Montreal Expos scored one run on Dave Roberas's error in the ninth inning and a second on a single by Jim Fairey to gain a 65 victory today over San Diego after the Padres had won the opener of a twin hill 65

title: ClosedEnd Funds
HUNTER TITLE WON BY SIGNED PIECE
description: MILLBROOK, N. Y., July 19 Dr. Henry Chase, a New York dentist, has owned Signed Piece for a year, but never had ridden the mount to a cham pionship until today.

title: Foyt Drives Ford Torino To Track Record at Dover
description: DOVER, Del., July 19 (AP) A. J. Foyt led on four occasions for a total of 179 laps to win the Dover 200 United States Auto Club stock race at Dover Downs today in a 1970 Ford Torino.

title: Bolivian Regime, Pressed by Army, Weakens Its Leftist Stance
description: LA PAZ, Bolivia, July 18 Under intense pressure from conservative army and busi ness elements, Bolivia's mili tary Government has moved significantly away from the militantly leftist stance it adopted after seizing power 10 months ago.

title: CLARE W. SABIN
description: MANHASSET, L. I., July 19 Clare W. Sabin, who retired as manager of the Connecticut General Life Insurance office at 90 John Street, New York in 1963, died yesterday in St. Francis Hospital, Roslyn. He was 67 years old arid lived at 631 Hunt Lane.

title: Cubs' Hickman Hospitalized
description: HOUSTON, July 19 (UPI) Jim Hickman of the Chicago Cubs entered Methodist Hos pital today with a kidney in fection. Hickman, 33 years old, the National League's fourth leading hitter with a 338 aver age, was scheduled to play against the Astros but became ill shortly before the game and was hospitalized for an exami nation.

title: CANADA WEIGHING TAKEOVER PANEL
description: TORONTO, July 19A par liamentary committee is ex pected to recommend shortly that the Government create an agency to oversee acquisitions of Canadian companies by for eign corporations.

title: JUAN HERNANDEZ, ACTOR, DIES AT 74
description: SAN JUAN, P. R., July 18 (AP)Juan G. Hernandez, the actor who appeared in more than 30 movies under the stage name Juano, died in a suburban clinic here Friday after suf fering a cerebral hemorrhage. He was 74 years old.

title: Former Colombian Minister Is Released by Kidnappers
description: BOGOTA, Columbia, Jury 19 (AP)  Fernando Londoo y Londo??o, former Foreign Min ister who was kidnapped July 9, has been released with the pay ment by his family of a $100, 000 ransom. He said that he was tortured by the kidnappers, who identified themselves as members of the proCastro Na tional Liberation Army.

title: Nixons Return to Capital
description: WASHINGTON, July 19 (AP) President and Mrs. Nixon re turned to the White House to day at the end of a serene day at their Maryland mountain retreat, Camp David. The Presi dent, aides said, worked and relaxed in the sun beside the swimming pool.

title: SOVIET INCREASES BONUSES TO RAISE FARM PRODUCTION
description: MOSCOW, July 19The So viet Union has initiated a broad program to put more meat and dairy products on the tables of this country's 240 million consumers.

title: Personal Finance: I.R.S. Revises Student Rules
description: The Internal Revenue Serv ice has quietly started to tighten up the tax rules it applies to holders of scholar ships and fellowships. The Government's new restrictive stance toward student tax payers began without fanfare on July 1, when it discarded an informal ruling based on a case known as Evans v. I.R.S.

title: Births
description: KAHNMr. and Mrs. Robert Wolff Kahn (nee Gloria Batkin) proudly, announce the birth of a daughter Jennifer Ann, on July 16, 1970, named in loving memory of Antoinette Loinger.

title: Major Bills in Congress
Theater: The Chichester Festival Joins First Rank
description: CHICHESTER, England, July 19In a comparatively few years the Chichester Fes tival has established itself as one of the three or four most important drama festivals in the Englishspeaking world. First under Sir Laurence Oliv ier and later under Sir John Clements, who has furthered its fortubes for the past five years, the Chichester Festival now viesor at least is be ginning to viewith the Roy al Shakespeare Company at Stratford. The Chichester standards are generally high, and I strongly recommend all theatergoing visitors to. Eng land to put Chichester on their itinerary.

title: Race to Fishers Island Under Way With 30 Yachts
description: RYE, N.Y., July 19An 81 mile overnight race to Fishers Island opened the American Yacht Club's 39th annual cruise today. A fleet of 30 started from Scotch Caps into an east northeast breeze of 45 knots.

title: New Mexico Reports 4th Case of Bubonic Plague
description: ALBUQUERQUE, N.M., July 19New Mexico has reported its fourth case of bubonic plague this year, and Dr. Paul Pierce, state epidemiologist, is urging campers in the state's wilderness areas to use insect repellants, and keep their pets restrained and free of fleas.

title: Palafox Beats Riggs
description: LAKE BLUFF, Ill., July 19 (AP)Gustavo Palafox of Little Rock, Ark., won the national senior claycourt tennis title to day by upsetting Bobby Riggs of Plandome, L. I., 64, 61. Riggs is the country's top ranked senior.

title: VINCENT TROTTA SR., ARTIST AND TEACHER
description: Vincent Trotta Sr., an artist who sketched 2,000 portraits of military personnel, from pri vates to threestar generals, during World War II and the Korean war, died Saturday at his home, 14324 41st Avenue, Flushing, Queens. His age was 84.

title: 2 ARMY RESERVES PITCH VICTORIES
description: Rudy May and Tom Murphy, two young pitchers for the California Angels, made a week end trip of 6,000 miles to appear in yesterday's Bat Day double header at Yankee Stadium. On a twoday leaveofabsence from reserve military duty in, California, the pair hurled su perbly as the Angels swept two from the Yankees, 52 and 31.

title: J. D. Washington, Officer Of RealEstate Company
description: James D. Washington, senior vice president and a director of Cushman & Wakefield, Inc., the real estate company, died Fri day at his home, 20 East 68th Street. He was 61 years old.

title: Houston Post Aided by Rivai
description: HOUSTON, Tex., July 19 (AP) The Houston Post, its presses damaged by a fire Fri day night, resumed today a full schedule of publishing with its Monday morning paper with help from its rival. The paper was printed at The Houston Chronicle, an afternoon and Sunday newspaper.

title: Antiwar Miss Montana Gave Up Title Gladly
description: HELENA, Mont., July 19 (UPI)Kathy Huppe, the darkhaired beauty queen who gave up her Miss Mon tana title rather than keep her antiwar views quiet, said today she was glad her short reign was over.

title: Dr. S. P. Taubkin Weds Barbara Bernstein
description: Miss Barbara Lynn Bern stein, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Irving Bernstein of Brooklyn, was married last evening to Dr. Steven Philip Taubkin, son of Mr. and Mrs. Bernard Taubkin of Roslyn Heights, L.I. Rabbi Isadore Fine performed the ceremony in the Tree of Life Center of Flatbush.

title: MSGR. JAMES A. QUINN
description: HAWTHORNE, N.Y., July 19 Msgr. James A. Quinn, who retired as pastor of Ascension Roman Catholic Church, 221 West 107th Street, New York, in 1968, died yesterday in Ro sary Hill Home. He was 79 years old and lived at 63 De Vries Avenue in North Tarry town.

title: CUBS' 6 IN THIRD SINK ASTROS, 71
description: HOUSTON, July 19 (AP)  The Chicago Cubs scored six runs in the third inning today and went on to beat the Hous ton Astros, 71, as Milt Pappas pitched a fivehitter.

title: Ceylon Acts to Cut Constitutional Link To British Crown
description: COLOMBO, Ceylon, July 19 Ceylon took the first step today toward severing all constitu tional links with the British Crown and Parliament.

title: Students Disdain Catskill jobs They Hold
description: MONTICELLO, N.Y., July 19For the last 41 summers, Mrs. Rose Meadoff has studied the styles of genera tions of college students who have come to her employ ment agency here to look for highpaying jobs in Catskill Mountain resort hotels.

title: Nixon Plan for Negro Jobs In Construction Is Lagging
description: WASHINGTON, July 19  Nearly a year after the Nixon Administration began trying to put significant numbers of Negroes on construction jobs across the country, the pro gram is still struggling to get off the ground.

title: Letters to the Editor of The Times
description: Mideast Solution

title: Airliner Crashes in Spain
description: GERONA, Spain, July 19 (UPI)A chartered twinengine jetliner carrying 85 persons crashed today as it was taking off from Gerona Airport. Of ficials said at least one woman was injured and several other persons bruised in the crash. The plane was chartered by Bavaria Airlines.

title: Excerpts From Young's Address to the National Urban League
description: It is obvious that where blacks are concerned, the [Nixon] Administration faces a credibility gap of enormous proportions.

title: Tigers Top Royals On a 3Hitter, 20, Then Triumph, 64
description: KANSAS CITY, July 19 (UPI) Don Wert's tworun double highlighted a sixrun eighth in ning, giving the Detroit Tigers a 64 victory and a sweep of a doubleheader today over the Kansas City Royals.

title: The Ball Had Eyes Yesterday, but the Devil of It Was, It Was Mostly for the Angels
JET IN PHILADELPHIA SKIDS AND INJURES 11
description: PHILADELPHIA, July 19 (UPI)Eleven persons were in jured, none seriously, when a United Air Lines Boeing 737 jetliner aborted a takeoff from Philadelphia International Air port tonight and skidded 300 yards off a runway before halt ing in a field.

title: The Proceedings In the U.N. Today
100 Youths Break Windows, Start Fires in Hagerstown
description: HAGERSTOWN, Md., July 19 (UPI)Ahout 100 teen agers, mostly black, broke windows and set fires in the Negro section of Hagerstown early today after a series of fistfights broke out between whites and blacks at an all night restaurant.

title: Merten's Hydro Is First In Gold Coast Marathon
description: MIAMI, July 19 (AP)Jim Merlen of Oshkosh. Wis. won the 225mile Gold Coast invita tion marathon boat race today at a record average speed of 72.373 miles an hour at the Miami Marine Stadium.

title: Bridge
description: The final stages of major New York knockout team championships are usually a masculine preserve, but the final match played yesterday in the Fun City Regionals at the New York Hilton was an exception. Both groups of fi nalists included two women experts.

title: South Africa Goal Is IronOre Harbor
description: JOHANNESBURG, South Afri ca, July 19The South Africa Iron and Steel Corporation is negotiating with Japanese con cerns for development of an iron ore export harbor at Sal danha Bay near Capetown. The project is estimated to cost about $420million.

title: Project Chief Lobbies Hard to Sell SST
description: WASHINGTON, July 19 William M. Magruder, the Gov ernment's chief salesman for the supersonic transport before an increasingly skeptical Con gress, is a former test pilot and engineer who accepts part of the blame for the aircraft in dustry's present problems but calls the SST crucial to the in dustry's recovery.

title: BOMBING MARKED IN BIRMINGHAM
description: BIRMINGHAM, Ala., July 19 At 10:25 this morning 6year old Alicia Ann Finch was studying the Sunday school les son, In the Image of God, while the Rev. James Thomas Crutcher reviewed his morn ing's sermon. The Task Before Us, in his study.

title: Dahlgren Joins A's Staff
description: OAKLAND, Calif., July 19 (AP)Babe Dahlgren will join the Oakland Athletics this week as the team's batting coach.

title: Van Nostrand Wins Net Title
description: PORT WASHINGTON, L.I., July 19King Van Nostrand of Brightwaters, L.I., won the New York State men's 35years divi sion tennis title today at the Port Washington Tennis Acad emy.He defeated Bob Barker of Port Washington, L.I., 62, 62, in the final.

title: THIEU DOUBTS END OF WAR WITHIN YEAR
description: WASHINGTON, July 19 (AP) President Nguyen Van Thieu of South Vietnam said today that he expected the war in his country to last at least another year but that by the end of 1971 United States troops would oe needed only in supporting roles. He said the supporting role would require more than 50,000 United States soldiers.

title: U.S. SAID TO OFFER ISRAEL CRUSADERS
description: WASHINGTON, July 19The State Department is encourag ing an American aircraft com pany to try to interest Israel in a shipment of modernized F8 Crusader jets to replace the F4 Phantom fighterbombers that Israel has lost, according to reliable sources.

title: Rock Festival Admits All Free After Randalls GateCrashing
description: Sponsors of what they called the city's first politically ori ented rockmusic festival, plagued for two nights by gate crashing, threw down the bar riers for the final program last night and admitted all corners free.

title: Triumph by Fresh Yankee Gladdens an Old Yankee
War Count Captures Title For Hunters at Oyster Bay
description: OYSTER BAY, L.I., July 19 StaStill Farms' War Count cap tured all four classes today to win the amateurowner hunter championship with 20 points at the Northwood Horse Show. Mrs. Sarah Steall rode the aged chestnut gelding.

title: Justice in the Bahamas Tough in Drug Cases
description: NASSAU, the Bahamas, July 19A rugged wall of coral rock and limestone sur rounds Fox Hill Prison where five young Americans are serving sentences meted out by the Bahamian courts for possession of drugs.

title: Woman Killed in Subway
description: A woman was killed in the subway yesterday when she jumped or fell while walking between cars on an IRT Lex ington Avenue train at the 14th Street station. She was identi fied as Amelia Muhlin, 53 years old, who had until a few weeks ago lived at the Warrington Hotel at 161 Madison Avenue.

title: Rockefeller and Buckley
description: In Manhattan, the Silent Ma jority Mobilization Committee is handing out RockefellerBuck ley buttons and literature.

title: ESCAPE CLAUSE' CRUCIAL IN TRADE
description: WASHINGTON, July 19  To domestic industries other than textiles and shoes, and to the greatly varied importing com munity, the crucial element in the trade bill approved last week by the House Ways and Means Committee is the new version of the escape clause of the trade law, Government officials and other trade experts agreed this weekend.

title: DONOHUE'S JAVELIN IS TRANSAM VICTOR
description: ELKHART LAKE, Wis., July 19 (AP)Mark Donohue of Media, Pa., drove his red, white and blue Javelin to victory to day in a TransAmerican cham pionship series race at the Road America track.

title: Monk Creation Given at Dance Event
Chess:
Cargo Security Unit Formed
description: Formation of a new private cargo security group, the New YorkNew Jersey Port Se curity Council, was announced last week. The council com prises the Security Bureau, Inc., an investigative unit, and three port security agenciesMcRob erts Protective Agency, Sullivan Security Service and Lansdell Protective Agency, which sup ply pier guards. The group's objective is improved coordina tion among various organiza tions concerned with cargo se curity in the port.

title: Out, Damned Spot!
description: Like the spot on Lady Macbeth's hand, the stain on the conscience of the United States that was left by the slaughter of civilians in Mylai hamlet, South Viet nam, on March 16, 1968, will not go away.

title: Fete Reprieved, Concerts Stilled
description: One of the city's summer festival events died over the weekend while another held to a thin thread of life. The New York Shakespeare Festi val will survive its July 26 cutoff date and run at least through Aug. 2. But four con certs of the Harlem Cultural Festival were canceled be cause of insufficient funds.

title: Evans, Greene and Liquori Post Victories in Germany
description: MAINZ, West Germany, July 19 (UPI)Lee Evans of the United States, the Olympic 400 meter champion, won the 200 and 400meter dashes today and Charlie Greene and Marty Liquori, fellow Americans, took their specialties at the Mainz invitation track and field meet.

title: Rock Fete in Carolina Ends; One Death and One Shooting
description: LOVE VALLEY, N. C., July 19 (AP)A threeday rock fes tival marked by one death and one shooting drew to a close here tonight.

title: JACKSON NEGROES WON'T END STRIKE
description: JACKSON, Miss., July 19 Black municipal workers here reversed themselves last night and decided to continue their strike against the city of Jack son.

title: Books of The Times
description: Everything we know about Ezra Pound makes us want to know more. The glimp ses we get of him in the Cantos, Mau berley, in the edited manuscripts of T. S. Eliot, in the remarks of Joyce, Yeats, Rob ert Frost, and in the appearances he makes in the careers of William Carlos Williams, John Quinn, H. D. and many others sharpens our curiosity. It's not gossip we are after as clar ity. What was there about the man that made him such a kinetic force in English and American let ters? How was he able to influence men older and younger than him self? What im pelled him to make the shame ful speeches dur ing the Italian years? His life, too, poses nagging questions: the relation of the artist to society, the nature of esthetic response, the virtues and dan gers of expatriation. Everything we rem by and about him insists on further expli. cation.

title: Paris: Tedium Is the Message on TV
description: PARIS  In his last news conference, President Georges Pompidou asked the Office de Radiodiffusion et de Tlvision Franaise to re member that it is the Voice of France. Since French ra dio and television are state controlled and since every government in the world believes it is the country that it administers, there is a, logic in the President's affir mation. But if la tt really is France's voice, then one is led to conclude that the land of Voltaire is being overtaken at lightning speed by illiteracy, to such a degree that all TV an nouncers, directors, produc ers, journalists and writers have in the last year re ceived two fat brochures heard on the air. Not one tenth of them would have been committed even by a schoolboy.

title: BROOKLYN SLUMS AMONG U.S WORST, PLAN PANEL SAYS
description: Brooklyn is presenting the city with some of its most formidable and urgent social and economic challenges, ac cording to a report published yesterday by the City Planning Commission.

title: NASA Foresees Dynamic Program Despite Budget Cut
description: From the time men first walked on the moon a year ago today, the National Aeronautics and Space Administration has been struggling to define and win public support for an am bitious range of postApollo projects and goals. The struggle is now reaching a critical time of decision.

title: NEGRO COALITION TO MEET WHITES URGED BY YOUNG
description: Whitney M. Young Jr. said yesterday that the Nixon Ad ministration ministration was not conscious ly antiblack and that the time had come for a coalition of black groups to negotiate with white leaders to accomplish so cial change.

title: Taxi Drivers Vote to Delay Walkout
description: Union taxi drivers decided last night to postpone a work stoppage that they had planned for 12:01 A.M. tomorrow as protest against the increase in assaults and other crimes against cabbies.

title: Computer Viewed In Eastern Europe As Key to Growth
description: BUDAPESTA young Hun garian escorting an American acquaintance around this spring's big Budapest trade fair proudly showed as the most significant domestic product on display a new thirdgenera tion digital computer that had been built in Hungary with the aid of a French electronic firm.

title: Cambodian Describes Life Under Red Rule
description: PNOMPENH, Cambodia, July 19Tax collection, prop aganda lectures and military recruitment have become features of life in a Cam bodian village controlled by the Vietcong and North Viet namese, according to a youth who has just escaped.

title: FORD FOUNDATION GALLS HOWE HOME
description: Harold Howe 2d, a former, United States Commissioner of Education, has been named a vice president of the Ford Foun dation in charge of its educa tion and research division.

title: World Youth Assembly
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., July 19Not since Nikita S. Khrushchev banged his shoe had the decorous halls of the United Nations reverberated to such goings on.

title: Lil' Buzzard Places First In Hydro Contest on Coast
description: PASCO, Wash., July 19 (AP) Lil' Buzzard captured the Atomic Cup hydroplane race to day, giving Tommy Fults, the driver, his first trophy since 1968.

title: Use of DDT at a 20Year Low, Chiefly Due to Voluntary Action
description: Eight months after the Nixon Administration announced a phasing out of DDT, Ameri can farmers and gardeners are using less of the persistent pes ticide than at any time in the last two decadesbut not be cause of Federal restrictions.

title: Lloyd Morgan Dies at 78; An Architect and a Teacher
description: Lloyd Morgan, an architect and teacher, died at his home in Tarrytown of a, heart attack yesterday. He was 78 years old.

title: Anne and Charles Home As Visit Is Criticized
description: LONDON, July 19 (AP) Prince Charles and Princess Anne returned home today from a visit to Washington that was criticized here as mishandled by the White House and Buckingham Palace. Some British papers also came to the defense of the 19yearold Princess Anne.

title: Sports Today
description: BASEBALL

title: 2D HOMER BY FOY DECIDES 2D GAME
State of Siege Imposed By Colombia's President
description: BOGOTA, Colombia, July 19 (AP)  President Carlos Lleras Restrepo imposed a state of siege tonight, the siva of the inauguration of Colombia's new Congress.

title: Venice Has Ferryboat Strike
description: VENICE, Italy, July 19 (AP) A 24hour strike of personnel of cityrun ferryboats or vapo rettos, left Venice without its main motorized boat traffic on the canals today. The strike, called by the three main unions over demands for reduced working hours, did not affect gondoliers.

title: FOUR AT L. I. CAMP HELD IN ARMS CASE
description: CUTCHOGUE, L. I., July 19 Three black men and a teen aged girl were arrested here this morning and semiautomatic weapons, pistols, ammunition and Black Panther literature were seized after residents near a migrant labor camp reported hearing weapons being fired.

title: LONDON VOWS ACTION ON STRUCK DOCKS
description: LONDON, July 19 (AP)  Prime Minister Heath's Gov ernment today declared its de termination to keep perishables moving in the fourdayold dock strike. The statement followed warnings by union leaders and port officials against using troops to move cargoes on strikebound ships.

title: Dancemobile in Harlem To Begin Season Tonight
description: The Dancemobile program, which presents black modern dancers in black communities under the sponsorship of Mayor Lindsay's Urban Task Force and the city's Parks, Recrea tional and Cultural Affairs De partment, will start its fourth annual season at 8:30 P.M. to day at P.S. 200, 149th Street and Seventh Avenue.

title: Search for a Soviet Plane In the Atlantic Continuing
description: HALIFAX, N. S. July 19 (UPI) Aircraft from three countries continued to search the North Atlantic today for a Soviet cargo plane with 23 persons aboard.

title: BRAZIL LEADS, 21, TAKING DOUBLES
description: SAO PAULO, Brazil, July 19 (AP)Brazil's Davis Cup ten nis team defeated Canada to day in doubles and took a 21 lead in the finals of American Zone play.

title: In Memoriam
description: BLUMHarold L. Cherished memories always beloved dad.

title: Citizens' Group Sees City Shortchanged On U.S. Housing Aid
description: The Citizens Budget Commis sion charged yesterday that New York City was being shortchanged by the Federal Department of Housing and Ur ban Development on funds for the leasing of public housing units.

title: Joan Mayer Wed to Lonnie Mollin
description: Miss Joan Mayer, daugh ter of Mr. and Mrs. Ludwig Mayer of Belle Harbor, Queens, was married yester day afternoon to Lonnie Wol lin, son of Mr. and Mrs. Rob ert Wollin of Brooklyn. Rabbi Allan Blaine performed the ceremony at the Washington Hotel in Rockaway Beach, Ouechs.

title: ROCHE, MISS CASALS TAKE SWISS CROWNS
description: GSTAAD, Switzerland, July 19 (AP)Tony Roche of Aus tralia defeated Tom Okker of the Netherlands, 63, 75, 63, today in the men's singles final of the Swiss open tennis cham pionships. Roche won the top prize of $4.640.

title: RENAULT ACCEPTS COLOMBIAN TERMS
description: MEDELLIN, Colombia, July 19  A plant for assembling Renault automobiles has been opened here on terms that lead ing United States automobile makers are said to have scored, but which some observers con sider to represent the pattern of future private foreign invest ment in developing countries.

title: ALOU'S ALERTNESS BREAKS A 33 TIE
description: PITTSBURGH, July 19 (UPI)  Matty Alou scored the tie breaking run from first base on Richie Hebner's single and an unusual error in the sith in ning, then the Pittsburgh Pi rates added three runs in the eighth for a 73 victory over the Cincinnati Reds today. The triumph gave the Eastern Di vision leaders a split of their fourgame series with the West ern pacesetters.

title: Junior Net Title to Solomon
description: LOUISVILLE, Ky., July 19 (AP)Harold Solomon of Silver Hills, Md., defeated Bob Kreiss of Bel Air, Calif., 64, 64, to capture the 18yearsandunder crown in the national junior claycourt tennis championships today.

title: New Books
description: GENERAL

title: Excerpts From City Planners' Recommendations for Brooklyn's Development
description: This is one of the most varied and troubled districts in the city. Residents whose ancestors fled Europe have resisted the latest influx of newcomers, creating serious tensions. New plans for housing, industry, schools and antipoverty pro grams will help, but these are just a step in what must be a continuous concerted effort to create a healthy, stable environ ment.

title: Navy to Investigate Shelling of Yachts
description: The Navy said yesterday that it would conduct a formal in vestigation into the firing upon three private fishing boats by four destroyers in the Atlantic off Fire Island Saturday.

title: CITY TAPS RESERVE FOR A BUDGET GAP
description: For the first time in five years, the city has had to dip into its socalled rainyday fund, taking out $35.1million of the $84million cash in the fund to balance the expense budget for the year that ended last June 30.

title: Alumni of Newport Festivals Bring Jazz Acts to the Garden
description: A miscellany of jazz acts appeared at Madison Square Garden on Friday and Sat urday nights billed as The Newport Jazz Festival. Some of them had played at the Newport Festival on the preceding weekend. The rest had been there at one time or another.

title: UNIONIZING SLOW IN OFFICE STAFFS
description: Whitecollar unionization is widely regarded as on the up swing. But a survey just com pleted by the National Indus trial Conference Board indicates that the pace is well short of breathtaking.

title: FOREHAND ERRORS HARMFUL TO LOSER
description: WASHINGTON, July 19  Now Arthur Ashe knows how the weekend hackers feel try ing to solve their ground strokes: He couldn't hit a fore hand well enough to win a set off Cliff Richey today in the final of the $35,000 Washing ton International Tennis Tour nament.

title: Merckx Wins 2d Tour de France in Row
description: PARIS, July 19 (AP)Eddy Merckx of Belgium won the Tour de France bicycle race today for the second year in succession.

title: Bethpage's Late Goal Tops Meadowbrook in Polo. 87
description: BETHPAGE, L. I., July 19 Dave Rizzo's third goal of the game, with 30 seconds left to play, gave the Bethpage polo team an 87 victory over Meadowbrook today at Beth page State Park.

title: Some Call Her the Karl Marx of New Feminism
description: Like it or notand she doesn'tKate Millett is be ing called the Karl Marx of the women's liberation move ment. Sexual Politics, the dissertation that gained her a Ph.D. in English and compara tive literature from Columbia University last month and that Doubleday is rushing into capitalist bookstores this week, is the movement's first aboveground political analy sis.

title: CANADIANS AWAIT MAIL UNCERTAINLY
description: TORONTO, July 19Cana dians are playing a new guess ing game this summer: will the postman ring even once? The game starts anew each morning as individuals and campanies wonder whether it's their neighborhood's day to go without mail service.

title: Times Square Suicide Was ExN.Y.U. Student
description: The man who burned him self to death in Times Square Saturday was tentatively identified yesterday as Hin Chi Yeung, 21 years old, of 4186 Gleane Street, Elm hurst, Queens.

title: Hungarian Reform Eases Economic Control
description: BUDAPEST, July 11Sooner or later, all conversations with Hungarian Communists turn to the two  and  a  half  year  old economic reform.

title: 12 SEASONED JETS WILL DRILL TODAY
description: At least a dozen members of the New York Jets will con duct their first informal, un supervised workout of the pro football campaign today at Adelphi College in Garden City, L. I.

title: California Wins in Rugby
description: NEWCASTLE, Australia, July 19 (Reuters)The touring Uni versity of California beat New castle University, 159, today in a rugby match as Randy Thaman kicked four penalty goals. Mike Doyle provided the Bears' other points on a try.

title: FRESH AIR FUND ENRICHES LIVES
description: Ron Mathis had problems, pride and the undirected energy typical of many youths who live in the city's blighted areas.

title: BOBBY ALLISON WINS VOLUNTEER 500 RACE
description: BRISTOL, Tenn., July 19 (AP) Bobby Allison of Hueytown, Ala., with relief assistance from Dave Marcis, won the $32.000 Volunteer 500 NASCAR Grand National race today at Bristol International Speedway.

title: Ending the Landlords' Strike
description: The tentative agreement between representatives of the city, the landlords and the building services workers union prcivides an equitable basis for ending the disruption of essential services that has been plaguing apartment house dwellers. The real strike, of course, has been that of the landlords who sought to use their refusal to sign a contract with Local 32Band the resulting walkout of the union's membersas a club with which to force a change in the city's new rent control act.

title: Burnett Quits Seeking Awards
description: Leo Burnett, Chicago, the country's fifth largest agency, has announced a move that might well shake the business to its foundations. It has resigned from compe tition in all advertising awards contests and will turn the tens of thousands of dollars needed to enter them toward educational purposes.

title: DEMOCRATS APPOINT ENVIRONMENT PANEL
description: WASHINGTON, July 19 (AP) The Democratic party said to day that it had established special committee to deal with environmental problems and accused the Nixon Administra tion of footdragging on at temps to clear up the environ ment.

title: Family Sails for Africa in 31Foot Boat to Escape TV Scene
description: NEW ORLEANS, July 19A family of four left here yester day in a 31foot sailboat bound for Africa.

title: BOCA RATON TAKES ENGLISH POLO TITLE
description: MIDHURST, England, July 19 (AP)Boca Raton became the first American polo squad to win the English championship, posting a 1310 victory today over Prince Philip's Windsor Park team.

title: Games Medals Table
description: EDINBURGH, July 19 (Reu ers)  Commonwealth Games medals table after 24 events.

title: Rory Calhouns Divorced
description: SANTA MONICA, Calif., July 19 (UPI)Rory Calhoun, the film actor and his wife, Lita, have dissolved their 21year marriage in Superior Court, it was disclosed today. The for mer actress was given custody of the couple's three children, Cindy Frances, 13 years old, Tami Elizabeth, 10, and Lorri Marie, 9 in the court action last week.

title: Free Theater Group Gets 4 Grants Totaling $18,500
description: Four grants totaling $18,500 have been awarded to the New York Free Theater, which pro vides workshops for teachers, students and social workers and operates under the sponsorship of the School of Arts at New York University.

title: Boy, 5, Drowns in L.I. Pool
description: MINEOLA, L. I., July 19A 5yearold child, Michael Smith of 34 Sussex Drive, West. Mil ford, N. J., drowned in the chil dren's section of the Mineola pool on Liberty Avenue yester day. The youngster and his parents. Mr. and Mrs. John Smith were ?? ??in Mineola.

title: Wall Street Insurance
description: WASHINGTON, July 19The Securities and Exchange Commission and the Nixon Administration appear to have pushed the securities industry as far as they intend to on the issue of safeguards for the public funds that will be committed to the new plan for insurance against broker age firm failures.

title: FINCH SEES DECLINE IN CAMPUS TURMOIL
description: WASHINGTON, July 19 (UPI)Robert H. Finch, White House counselor, predicted to day that student disorders had peaked and said President Nix on's special advisers on campus unrest would turn in a basi cally optimistic forecast this week.

title: DELURY SAYS CITY FACES SNOW TROUBLE
description: The head of the sanitation men's union warned yesterday that there might be a snow emergency this winter because the city was not preparing for such a contingency.

title: MRS. RANKIN WINS BY A SHOT ON 209
description: SPRINGFIELD, Ohio, July 19 (AP)Mrs. Judy Rankin, aided by, an eagle 3 on the 17th hole, posted a closing fiveunderpar 68 for 209 and won the $20,000 Ladies Professional Golf Asso ciation Jaycee open golf tourna ment by one shot today.

title: Moshe Shapiro Eulogized At Funeral in Jerusalem
description: JERUSALEM, July 19 (UPI)  President Zalman Shazar, Premier Golda Meir and the en tire Cabinet led thousands of Israelis at the state funeral to day of Moshe Haim Shapiro, Interior Minister and National Religious party leader who died Thursday at the age of 68.

title: 721 Aboard Burning Norwegian Ship Are Rescued
description: SANTA CRUZ DE TENERIFE, Canary Islands, July 19More than 700 passengers and crew men abandoned a burning cruise ship, the Fulvia, in the Atlantic Ocean today after an explosion in the engine room.

title: PHILS WIN TWICE IN NINTH, 94, 42
description: LOS ANGELES, July 19 (AP) Jim Hutto walloped a pinch hit, grandslam homer in the ninth inning of the opener and Mike Ryan delivered a tworun shot in the ninth of the second game as the Philadelphia Phil lies swept a doubleheader from the Los Angeles Dodgers, 94 and 42, today.

title: The Crisis of the Universities
description: PALO ALTO, Calif.  When the opening salvo of the student rebellion was fired at Berkeley in 1964, optimists saw in it the beginning of sweeping educa tional reforms and the reaffir mation of academic freedom. Less confident observers were concerned over a movement that justified questionable means in the pursuit of only vaguely conceived idealistic ends. These pessimists were worried about the political radicalization of the campuses.

title: Miller Beats Inman, 4 and 3, In TransMississippi Final
description: OKLAHOMA CITY, July 19 (AP)Allen Miller downed his Walker Cup teammate, Joe In man Jr., 4 and 3, and retained the TransMississippi amateur golf title today.

title: A Modest Proposal
description: If the owners and the Players Association cannot end their dispute quickly, it is quite possible that the College AllStar Game will be called off and some of the early ex hibitions be treated as rookie games.

title: MARIA DE KAMMERER, A PORTRAIT PAINTER
description: Maria de Kammerer, a por trait artist and teacher of por traiture, died of cancer yester day morning at Roosevelt Hos pital. She was 67 years old and lived at 22 East 60th Street.

title: Young Lords and Police Clash At Newark Puerto Rican March
description: NEWARK, July 19The an nual Puerto Rican Day parade here today was disrupted by clashes between the Young Lords and the police. Five per sons were arrested and two policemen were reported slightly injured by thrown bricks in the disturbance, which centered around a City Hall reviewing stand.

title: McDowell Posts 14th Triumph, Retiring 24 in Row, Fanning 14
description: BLOOMINGTON, Minn., July 19 (AP)Sam McDowell yielded two hits and a run in the first inning, then retired 24 straight batters today in pitching the Cleveland Indians to a 31 vic tory over the Minnesota Twins.

title: Wilson Set to Name His Shadow Cabinet
description: LONDON, July 19  The strategy of the Labor party's opposition in the House of Commons is expected to take shape this week with the as signment by Harold Wilson, the party leader, of shadow port folios.

title: Calley Wants Charges Dropped or Civilian Trial
description: WASHINGTON, July 20 (AP) Lieutenant William L. Calley Jr., charged with murder in the alleged Mylai massacre in 1968, asked today for a halt in gen eral courtmartial proceedings against him and dismissal of the charges.

title: MRS. BOWER'S 72 CAPTURES MEDAL
description: GREENWICH, Conn., July 20 Mrs. Albert B. Bower of the Pelham Country Club, the de fending champion, won the medal by four strokes today with a oneunderpar score in the qualifying round of the an nual Women's TriCounty Golf Association championship tour nament.

title: ALFRED V. BRADY, 72, BAYONNE EXMAYOR
description: BAYONNE, N.J., July 20 Former Mayor Alfred V. Brady died yesterday in Bayonne Hos pital. He was 72 years old and lived at 74 West 34th Street.

title: MALL IS PROPOSED FOR MADISON AVE.
description: A group of merchants pro posed to Mayor Lindsay yester day that Madison Avenue from 79th Street south to possibly 57th Street be made a pedes trian mall Tuesdays from 7 to 10 P.M.

title: MRS. BINH IS READY TO RETURN TO PARIS
description: NEW DELHI, July 20 (UPI) Mrs. Nguyen Thi Binh, Foreign Minister of the provisional revo lutionary government of South Vietnam, said today that she was willing to return to the Vietnam peace talks in Paris now that President Nixon has named David K. E. Bruce the United States chief negotiator.

title: Iain Macleod Dies in London; New Chancellor of Exchequer;Chief Conservative Spokesman on Financial Affairs Top Bridge Player
description: LONDON, Tuesday, July 21 lain Macleod, Chancellor of the Exchequer, died of a heart at tack tonight at his official resi dence, 11 Downing Street. He was 56 years old, and under went an operation for acute ap pendicitis on July 8.

title: White Youth Killed in Kansas; Negro Companion Is Wounded
description: LAWRENCE, Kan., July 20 (UPI)A white youth was shot to death tonight and a Negro companion injured north of the University of Kansas campus in this racially tense city.

title: Lon Nol Going to Bangkok
description: PNOMPENH, July 20 (Agence France  Presse) Premier Lon Nol will head a delegation to Bangkok on Tuesday to discuss possible participation by Thai land in Cambodian military ef forts against the Communists.

title: C.M. Gets U.A.W.'s Demands And ls Surprised by the Size
description: DETROIT, July 20  The United Auto Workers presented their new economic demands to General Motors Corporation to day, and Earl Bramblett, G.M.'s top negotiator, said: On their face, the economic demands are more extensive and even more far reaching than had been in dicated by anything we had heard or read about.

title: F.T.C. SCORES MOVE BY GENERAL MILLS
description: WASHINGTON, July 20 (UPI) The Federal Trade Commis sion said today that the ac quisition by General Mills, Inc., of a big producer of packaged frozen seafood may have substantially lessened competition in the food in dustry.

title: Army Forcibly Takes Samples Of Hair From Accused Captain
description: FORT BRAGG, N. C., July 20 (AP)  Military policemen scuffled with Capt. Jeffrey R. MacDonald's civilian lawyers today, took the captain into protective custody, then re moved hair from his head and body, presumably to use as evi dence in prosecuting murder charges against the Green Beret physician.

title: The Use of Consultants
description: The fact that New York has mounted a massive attack on its administrative and planning ills by using all the professional expertise it can get has somehow been turned into the suggestion that this is the biggest gravy boat since Boss Tweed. A more rational assump tion is that the city has not only stepped up the magnitude of its attack on its problems, but that it has taken a position of leadership in utilizing modern management methods and specialized professionalism.

title: Fund Issue Delays Atom Inspection Plan
description: VIENNA, July 20A dispute over the allocations of costs is delaying the completion of the International Atomic Energy Agency's basic proposals for checking on violations of the treaty to ban the spread of nuclear weapons.

title: 352534 Is the Signal Then Hold That Line
description: ORLANDO, Fla., July 20 (AP)Orlando's professional football team is negotiating to sign a woman player. Pat Palinkas, who measures 35 2534, would hold the ball for her placekicker husband.

title: BRANDT FOES BALK ON MOSCOW TALKS
description: BONN, July 20  West Ger many's powerful conservative Opposition in Parliament broke the last thread of foreignpolicy accord with the Government of Chancellor Willy Brandt today. It refused to send a delegate with Foreign Minister Walter Scheel to Moscow for treaty negotiations next week.

title: NIXON AIDE URGES RISE IN ECONOMY, PROMOTED BY U.S.
description: WASHINGTON, July 20  President Nixon's chief eco nomic adviser told Congress to day that the task of Govern ment policy now was to pro mote expansion of the economy. He strongly implied that this would require a more rapid growth of money and credit than was the case in the first half of this year.

title: Segregated Slum Threat Fought on West Side
description: Middleclass elements of the West Side are banding together to oppose what they regard as a threat to reduce their neigh borhood to a racially segre gated slum.

title: BALLO, WITH A 68, PACES QUALIFIERS
ROGERS GETS LIST OF 468 REFORMS
description: WASHINGTON, July 20 (AP) Reformers in the State De partment, concerned by what they consider to be its declining role in foreign affairs, have offered 468 recommendations to strengthen the department.

title: PANTHER BOMB TRIAL WILL START SEPT. 8
description: The trial of 13 Black Pan thers for an alleged bomb con spiracy will begin Sept. 8, State Supreme Court Justice John M. Murtagh said in court yesterday.

title: Peter L. A. Folliss, Financier Of PanAm Building, Dies at 57
description: Peter L. A. Folliss, an Amer ican and British financier, died Sunday after a heart attack at the Deepdale Golf Course in Queens. He was 57 years old and lived at 830 Park Avenue.

title: Body of Girl, 16, Seized in Holdup, Found in Michigan
description: LANSING, Mich., July 20 (UPI)  Police Chief Derold Husby announced tonight that the body of Laurie Murninghan, 16 years old, who was kid napped during a holdup 11 days ago, had been found in a re mote area 22 miles south of here.

title: Riders Scarce as East River Hydrofoil Run Starts
description: Commuter hydrofoil serv ice from the Upper East Side to Wall Street got off to soggy, bumpy, and not too suc cessful start yesterday.

title: Trumpeter Still Seen Third Despite Delay for Repairs
description: LERWICK, Shetland Isles, Scotland, July 20 (UPI) De spite losing 16 hours because of repair work yesterday, the American yacht Trumpeter may still be in third place in the round Britain yacht race, offi cials said today.

title: Queens Bus Driver Dies
description: A Queens bus driver died of an apparent heart attack yes terday after his bus had struck five parked cars before coming to a stop at 65th Road and Queens Boulevard in Forest Hills. Four passengers were treated for slight injuries at St. John's Queens Hospital. The driver of the Green Bus Lines, Inc., vehicle was identified as (Eugene Gallavan, 44 years old, of 8306 Vietor Avenue. Elm hurst.

title: In Memoriam
description: LAGREETheresa. Passed away July 17, 1970. Dearest friend, always greatly loved and respected. May her soul rest In peace. Selma, Leonard, Jane and Cathy Goldstein.

title: Samsonite Is Leaving Wells, Rich for J.W.T.
description: Wells, Rich, Greene has lost the Samsonite Corpora tion account to J. Walter Thompson. It leaves officially on Nov. 1 and, according to the Denver company, the bill ings are $2.5million.

title: What Goals? ...
description: For a nation that is urgently in need of a clear and forceful redefinition of goals and priorities, the report of President Nixon's National Goals Research Staff comes as a disappointing evasion of responsibility.

title: 7 Grandchildren Share In $100,000 Lottery
description: A Brooklyn couple and their seven grandchildren were among the winners of $100,000 yesterday in the June state lottery drawing.

title: 2,900 More Americans Withdrawn From Vietnam
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, July 20 (UPI)A total of 2,900 American servicemen were withdrawn from South Viet nam last week, the United States command said today.

title: Wooden Elephant Finds A New Home in Jersey
description: MARGATE, N. J., July 20  Lucy, this Jersey resort town's 89yearold, 90ton, woodandtin elephant, was moved today to new quarters in town amid murmurs of approval and rumblings of discontent.

title: MOVIELAB PURCHASE OF BERKEY OPPOSED
description: The Justice Department filed a suit in Federal Court here yesterday seeking to enjoin Movielab, Inc., from acquiring Berkey Photo, Inc. The compa nies reached a purchase agree ment in June, 1969. The Justice Department, contending that the arrangement violates Fed eral antitrust laws, asked for divestiture by Movielab of Ber key Film Processing and a five year ban on Movielab's acquisi tion of any other professional film laboratory.

title: ...What Priorities?
description: President Nixon's deepening quarrel with Congress over Federal spending is at least in part a result of the President's own failure to respond forthrightly to the rising public demand to reorder national priorities.

title: Stepin Fetchit Says He Was Defamed on TV Series About Blacks
description: INDIANAPOLIS, July 20 (AP) Stepin Fetchit, the former, film actor and comedian, filed suit today for $3million dam ages, charging he had been de famed on a segment of the Co lumbia Broadcasting System's television series Of Black Americans.

title: Lose a Thurmond, Gain a Young
description: If one were to take at face value Senator Strom Thurmond's outburst against the Administration's un reasonable policies on desegregation, one would have to conclude that President Nixon had already traded in his Southern strategy for what Mr. Thurmond calls a Northeast philosophy. Given the implications of those two concepts, we wish we could make that inter pretation, but the facts, hopeful as they are, call for a degree of cautioneven taking into account the President's initial reaction at his press conference yesterday.

title: 2 Concert Series Added
description: Two new concert series will be added next season by the Chamber Music Society of Lin coln Center, bringing the total of subscription events to 24, compared with last season's 16.. The series, each consisting of six programs, will be at 5 P.M. on Sundays and at 7 P.M. on Tuesdays, in Alice Tully Hall. Concerts will also be given at 8:30 P.M. on Fridays and at 9 P.M. on Saturdays, as in the society's inaugural season last year.

title: YOUTH SURRENDERS IN CHICAGO KILLINGS
description: CHICAGO, July 20 (UPI)A fourth suspect in the killings of two Chicago policemen sur rendered today, two days after a murder warrant had been issued.

title: Rockefeller Appoints Wagner To Head Study on Home Rule
description: Governor Rockefeller set up a new commission yesterday headed by former Mayor Robert F. Wagner, to draft the most uptodate homerule powers for the localities of the state.

title: JOHN WEILBURG, LED PUBLICITY CONCERN
description: ELLSWORTH, Me., July 20 John Weilburg, an early organ izer for the American News paper Guild and president of the John Weilburg public rela tions agency in New York, died of cancer here Thursday at Maine Coast Memorial Hospital. He was 59 years old and lived at 29 Overlook Road in Haver straw, N. Y.

title: NET FUND SALES CLIMBED IN JUNE
description: The nation's mutual funds scored a sharp  and some what unexpected  increase in net sales of new shares last month, but instead of buying, stocks with this money they used it to help raise their cash reserves relative to total as sets to another record.

title: Cape Cod Tops Atlantic Collegians, 63
description: Lou Anemone, an Atlantic Collegiate Baseball League all star from the Staten Island Pilots had the kind of afternoon at Yankee Stadium yesterday that would make Pete Rose of the Cincinnati Reds only half satisfied.

title: McCoy Rejected As School Official By Board in Capital
description: WASHINGTON, July 20  Rhody A. McCoy, former ad ministrator of Brooklyn's Ocean Hill  Brownsville experimental school district, has been dropped from consideration as the Dis trict of Columbia's new school superintendent after two mem bers of the district's school board charged that he had been a divisive force in New York schools.

title: Noel Coward's Hay Fever Will Return
description: Leonard Sillman, who usu ally discovers talent to peo ple revues (he has produced 13 New Faces since 1933), is planning a Broadway re vival of a comedy in the fall with tried and proven artists.

title: GIANTS WIN, 74, ON 4 RUNS IN 6TH
description: SAN FRANCISCO, July 20 The New York Mets lost their third straight series tonight, and their seventh game in the last nine, when the San Fran cisco Giants defeated them, 74.

title: Landlords Ratify Apartment Terms
description: Apartment house landlords voted unhappily last night to accept terms for ending the 5dayold strike of elevator op erators, maintenance workers and other building help. The men are to return to work to day.

title: Big Board ShortInterest Rise Is Below Prior Month's Advance
Article 2  No Title
News Summary and Index
description: TUESDAY, JULY 21, 1970

title: Housing Bill With Subsidy For Interest Goes to Nixon
description: WASHINGTON, July 20 (UPI) The House completed Con gressional approval today on bill to generate 1.3 million new housing units, including a sub sidy plan for middleincome home buyers. It went to the White House for President Nixon's signature.

title: CITY SEEKS DELAY IN HOUSING ACTION
description: WASHINGTON, July 20  Two New York City housing officials asked a Senate sub committee today to defer ac tion on the Nixon Administra tor's housing program.

title: Food Chain Seeks Involvement in Chicago
description: CHICAGO, July 18  A new chart is posted these days over the detergent sec tion in most of the 220 su permarkets operated by Jew el Food Stores in Chicago and its suburbs.

title: In Regular School, They Were Hopeless; Now There's Hope
description: Sometimes Pedro ran round and round the room, screaming and disrupting the class. At other times he was abnormally quiet. Either way, he didn't learn any thing.

title: StarLedger Appointment
description: NEWARK, July 20 (UPI)The Newark StarLedger, New Jer sey's largestcirculation morn ing paper, announced today the selection of Andrew E. Morgan as associate publisher, effective Aug. 1. Mr. Morgan, an advertising executive at Vogue magazine, replaces George P. Slockbower, who is retiring as associate publisher. Both Vogue and The StarLedger are New house publications. Mr. Morgan, wlio is 45 years old, formerly worked for The Fort Worth Press, The Cleveland Press, The New York WorldTelegram & Sun and The New York Herald Tribune.

title: George Washington Gets a Belated Audit
description: George Washington's ex pense account for the Revo lutionary War, which was accepted by the Treasury and settled with hardly a glance in 1783, has at last come under exacting scrutiny.

title: Mrs. Kennedy in Ethiopia
description: ADDIS ABABA, Ethiopia, July 20 (Reuters)Mrs. Joseph P. Kennedy arrived here today for a fiveday visit as guest of Em peror Haile Selassie. Mrs. Ken nedy, who will be 80 years old on Wednesday, will attend the inauguration Thursday of the $2.4million Kennedy Memorial Library, dedicated to her son, President John F. Kennedy, at the Haile Selassie University here.

title: NIXON SUPPORTS THIEU IN OPPOSING FORCED COALITION
description: WASHINGTON, July 20  President Nixon today firmly endorsed the opposition of President Nguyen Van Thieu of South Vietnam to an im posed coalition government, emphasizing that an election open to all was the best ap proach to a political settlement in Vietnam.

title: LAWYER BIDS JURY CREDIT ADDONIZIO
description: TRENTON, July 20  The lawyer defending Hugh J. Ad donizio, former Mayor of New ark who is on trial here charged with extortion con spiracy, told the jury today that it must decide whose word should be believed, Mr. Addonizio's or that of the pros ecution's key witness, who, he said, lied.

title: U.S. FIVE CAPTURES WHEELCHAIR GAME
description: STOKE MANDEVILLE, Eng land, July 20 (AP)The United States wheelchair basketball team defeated the Nether lands, 6423, today in its first game of the 1970 Wheelchair Olympics.

title: RATES FALL AGAIN ON TAXEXEMPTS
description: Interest rates on taxexempt local government bonds again moved downward yesterday, snaking off the hesitancy this sector of the credit markets exhibited last week.

title: Soviet Union Continues to Debate Old Issue of Guns vs. Butter
description: Kremlin disagreements over the old gunsvsbutter issue appear to have played an im portant role in forcing the post ponement of the next congress of the Soviet Communist party to March, 1971.

title: Margaret Moore Prospective Bride
description: HOUSTON, July 20Miss Margaret Moore, a teacher at the University of Hartford, plans to be married late next month in New York to Clyde William Henry Jr., manager of sales for the Esco Corpo ration in San Francisco.

title: National Opera Institute Formed To Stimulate Medium's Growth
description: WASHINGTON, July 20The National Opera Institute, with a twoyear budget of nearly $1million, was formally estab lished today by some of the country's leading promoters of the arts.

title: Little Stir in Saigon
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, July 20  The two rockets that crashed into the center of Saigon early this morning made headlines round the world but barely made themselves felt in the minds of the people of this weary city.

title: HOUSE APPROVES TV FOR HEARINGS
description: WASHINGTON, July 20 The House timidly moved into the electronic age today, insert ing into a Congressional reform bill a provision to allow tele vising, broadcasting and photo graphing of committee hear ings.

title: Aguirre to End Output Of Puerto Rican Sugar
description: SAN JUAN, P. R., July 20 (UPI)The Aguirre Corpora tion has notified the Puerto Rican Government it will cease to produce sugar in the Commonwealth. The com pany said 1970 apparently will be another year of severe economic squeeze for the Puerto Rican sugar industry.

title: ALLSTAR CONTEST SEEN IN JEOPARDY
description: The owners of the National Football League's 26 teams must accept or reject today the proposal of the Players As sociation to submit their cur rent contract dispute to Fed eral mediation. If mediation is agreed upon, the College All Star game scheduled for Chi cago on July 31 seems certain to be canceled.

title: PETERSON DEALS ANGELS 61 LOSS
description: The New York Yankees, who saw both their starting pitchers routed by the California Angels in a doubleheader loss on Sun day, got their finest pitching performance of the season last night as Fritz Peterson set down the Angels on three hits and won, 61.

title: Whittier College to Produce Oral History of Nixon
description: President Nixon has taken the first formal step toward assembling a comprehensive historical record of his politi cal career that will eventually be placed in the Richard M. Nixon Presidential Library.

title: Dow and Grace Dip
description: Lower earnings despite slightly higher Sales in the sec ond quarter and first half of the year were reported yes terday by E. I. du Pont de Nemours & Co., Inc.

title: A Correction
description: Because of a transmission er ror, a Peking dispatch of The Globe and Mail, Toronto, that appeared in The New York Times of July 10 misquoted Prince Norodom Sihanouk, the deposed Chief of State of Cam bodia. The article should have stated that Prince. Sihanouk said a majority of the members of his government in exile felt the job of liberating Cam bodia could still be done by Cambodian resistance forces aided by fighters from North Vietnam, rather than by Cam bodian resistance fighters from North Vietnam, as it appeared.

title: INSURER IS ACCUSED OF MISINFORMATION
description: A leading Alabama life in surer was accused yesterday of misinforming stockholders of the terms of a proposed take over move.

title: Seeker of Change Within System
description: Someone, Whitney Moore Young Jr. has told black audi ences, has to work within the system to try and change it.

title: Fashion Scene Shifts to Paris, and Two Designers Uphold France's Reputation
description: PARIS, July 20Even the taxi drivers and the concierge ask you how do you like the showings. Fashion, like wine, is a source of national pride here. So far, there's nothing to be ashamed of. Philippe Venet and Louis Fraud out did themselves. Capt. Edward Molynewc stumbled, but then he's British.

title: Chief Hosea Kutako, 100, Led South African Tribe
description: WINDHOEK, South West Africa, July 20 (UPI)  Chief Hosea M. Kutako, leader of the 40,000man Herero tribe, died yesterday at his home 180 miles east of here after a brief illness. He was said to be 100 years old.

title: A Saigon Captain Sees War Devouring His Life
description: SOMEWHERE IN CAM BODIAA 32yearold cap tain in the South Vietnamese Army sat outdoors, staring down at his American boots, not up at the moon, while he wondered aloud how much he would mind the loss of an eye, an arm or a leg.

title: Vikings' Reilly Retires
description: BLOOMINGTON, Minn., July 20 (AP)The Minnesota Vik ings announced today the re tirement of Mike Reilly, a Na tional Football League player for six years

title: ABANDONED LINER SINKS IN ATLANTIC
description: SANTA CRUZ DE TENERIFE, Canary Islands, July 20 (UPI) The firedamaged cruise ship Fulvia rolled over and sank in the Atlantic Ocean today, 36 hours after an engine room fire forced the 273 crewmem bers and 448 passengers to abandon ship yesterday.

title: In The Nation: Thank You, General Thurmond
description: That fighting general from South Carolina, Strom Thur mond, who held the right wing in the great Nixon victory at the Battle of Miami Beach in 1968, has done the nation a service at last.
