The facility in Russell, Ky., is already building 2,000 sim ilar cars that were author ized by C. & O. directors last December. Completion of the last of that group is sched uled for Aug. 27. Work on the 1,600 car order will start at that time with completion scheduled for midJanuary of 1971.

title: Movie Mailbag
description: TO THE EDITOR:

title: Vegetables to Sow Now
description: VEGETABLE crops planted in midsum mer will be ready for a bountiful harvest time in September.

title: Channel Ferry Disabled
description: CHERBOURG, France, July 25 (AP)An explosion in the engine room disabled the Eng lish Channel ferry Free Enter prise tonight. Two tugs towed the ferry back to port. Two engineers were the only ones aboard injured by the explo sion.

title: Department Tightens Control Over Use of Arms
description: LOS ANOELES, July 25The killing of Jerry Lee Arnie and of two other unarmed men by the police here in a fortnight has focused renewed attention on police procedures  especially use of firearmsin Los Angeles.

title: N.E.T. Hits More High C's
description: FROM three presenta tions in its first season to eight in its second is the big jump that National Educational Televi sion Opera is making this year. The fledgling company, organized last year by Peter Hermann Adler, its music and artistic director, was so well received in terms of viewer response that it was able to plan a monthly schedule of programs, begin ning in October.

title: J. J. Tremba Weds Mary Susan Carroll
description: STAMFORD, Conn., July 25 Miss Mary Susan Carroll was married here this morn ing to 2d Lieut. Thomas J. Tremba, U. S. A.. The Rev. John J. Filip performed the ceremony and celebrated the nuptial mass in St. Leo's Roman Catholic Church.

title: The First Baseman
description: The question was strictly rhetorical and was offered mainly as a mild pleasantry by a kibitzer from Boston just before the AllStar Game not long ago. It was tossed in the direction of Carl Yastrzemski and a shrug of the shoulders served as the answer. It was:

title: Point of View
description: If the tenants living in an apartment house in poverty area are persons who are very alive and striv ing and are people who care for their building, should not this human quality be considered in a request for a loan to rehabilitate this building?

title: New Zealand Health Stamps
description: NEW ZEALAND has supported its national health and youth pro grams through issuance of special postage stamps since 1929the semipostal stamps discussed in the ad joined column. The first stamps each pic tured a nurse and bore the slogan Help Stamp Out Tuberculosis, 1929. Subsequent yearly issues have been inscribed Help Promote Health or the single word Health.

title: U.S. Oil Industry Regrets It Was Right
description: If an industry could have a facial expression, the United States oil industry would be wearing a bitter sweet smile.

title: Ocean Spirit Is First to Finish in RoundBritain Sail
description: PLYMOUTH, England, July 25 (UPI)The British yacht Ocean Spirit won the overall prize, by finishing first in the roundBrit ain yacht race today.

title: S. J. Curry Dies
description: ALBANY, Ga., July 25 (UPI)  S. J. Curry, a contractor whose company built the Oak Ridge, Tenn., atomic bomb plant, died today of injuries suffered in an automobile acci dent on Friday. He was 58 years old.

title: Shortage of Competitive Cars Plagues CanAm Challenge Cup
description: For all the glamour and beauty of its racing, the re grettable fact is that the Cana dianAmerican Challenge Ctip still has problems with the chronic shortage of competi tive cars and  something newerwith a few of its racing venues. Today's Klondike 200 at Edmonton, in north western Canada, is a ease in point. With Jim Hall's Chaparral 2J: still in the shops at Midland, Tex., there isn't much of a field to challenge the bright Orange. M8D's of the McLaren raee team.

title: Pollution Is Cut By G.M. Diesels
description: ORANGE, N. J.Pollution causatives are at the mini mum possible level in a fleet of 230, General Motors Cor poration Astro95 diesel trac tors on which CooperJarrett, Inc., has begun taking deliv ery, according to William D. Baker, president of the motor carrier.

title: Who Is the Films' Greatest Lover? Henri Langlois!
description: IN a new, featurelength documentary that Roberto Guerra and Ella Hirshon are making on the life and work of Henri Langlois, the creator and, for 34 years, the awesome director of the Cin mathque Francaise in Paris, Simone Signoret recalls the early Langlois as a tall, thin, angry young man. During the Nazi occupation, she remembers, he would turn up at the Caf Flor, looking like a very peculiar Scarlet Pimpernel, and go from one table of friends to another, whispering the time and location for the screening of the film for that evening.

title: VERMONT'S ECONOMY IS AIDED BY SKIERS
description: MONTPELIER, Vt., July 25 (AP)An estimated 350,000 skiers pumped approximately $46.4million into Vermont's economy during the 196970 ski season, according to a re port issued here by the state Development Department.

title: LONG HAIR BARRED BY ASIAN NATIONS
description: HONG KONG, July 25Trav elers to the Orient are advised to include one more item on their checklist of things to do before leavng home. Along with picking up visas, buying travel er's checks and getting their shots, they should also remem ber to have a haircut.

title: Calendar of Motor Sports Events
description: TodaySports Car Club of America, New England Region driver school track training, noon to 4 P.M., at Thompson, Conn.

title: New Moroccan Constitution Approved in Referendum
description: RABAT, Morocco, July 25 (AP)King Hassan II's refer endum on a new constitution, which would give Morocco a singlechamber parliament with limted powers, won 98.35 per cent of the vote, official results chowad today.

title: EXBIAFRANS LIVE BY MOONLINGHTING
description: ENUGU, Nigeria, July 25 (Reuters)Moonlighting or run ning some sort of small busi ness has become a way of life for nearly everyone, including civil servants, in the former secessionist state of Biafra. Most have been forced to be come traders to make ends meet.

title: The President Goes to the People
description: The following is a list of the principal trips President Nixon has made around the country since taking office, ex clusive of those to Key Biscayne and San Clemente (although some of the stops were made en route to and from those vacation retreats).

title: The Merchant's View:
description: As retailers plod through the hot summer, it would appear that they are trying to formulate policies that will make it possible to live with a difficult merchandising situation.

title: Bonn Minister Says That if U.S. Ends Draft, So Would Germany, and NATO Would Falter
description: BONN, July 12The aban donment by the United States of the Selective Service System would make continued con scription impossible in West Germany, Defense Minister Hel mut Schmidt has said.

title: Boca Raton Loses. 75. In English Polo Tourney
description: COWDRAY PARK, England, July 25 (AP)The Jersey Lilies of Cowdray Park defeated Boca Raton, the United States team that won the Gold Cup English polo championship, 7 to 5, to day in the quarterfinals of the Challenge Cup.

title: Klecatsky Rows to 2 Titles
description: ST. CATHARINES, Ontario, July 25The Union Boat Club of Boston won the senior four with coxswain event today in the 88th annual Royal Canadian Henley Regatta on the old Wel land Canal course. Union edged the Vesper Boat Club of Phila delphia by a foot.

title: The oddball with the knuckleball
description: Irreverent Jim Bouton! Betrayer of secrets! Clubhouse lawyer! Doesn't care whom he converts into enemies. Sly practical joker. Weirdo who throws baseball's most weirdo pitch the knuckleball. A knuckleball pitcher, even if he has the person ality of Soupy Sales, is apt to be unpopular.

title: Union Governs Assignments
description: For instance, preelection mayoral task forces on sanita tion have found that one of the roadblocks to changing sched ules in lowdensity, single family areas was that union agreements governing the as signment of the men to choice districts like those make it hard to shift them around to other ones.

title: Helen Jennings, $37, First at Liberty Bell; Process Shot Is 11th
description: PHILADELPHIA, July 25 After coming within a nose of winning the Susquehanna Handicap as a long shot last year, Raritan Stable's Helen Jennings won the $58,950 first renewal of the mile and a six teenth race for fillies and mares today at Liberty Bell Race Track.

title: Methadone for Drug Addicts Is Gaining in Popularity
description: BOSTON, July 24  The methadone maintenance treatment for heroin addiction developed amid much medi cal and political controversy in New York Cityappears to be gaining a strong foothold in dozens of cities throughout the country.

title: Anthony Barber Is Named Chancellor of Exchequer
description: LONDON, July 25Prime Minister Heath today ap pointed Anthony Barber to be Chancellor of the Exchequer, one of the most powerful posts in the British Government. Mr. Barber has served as Brit ain's chief negotiator with the Common Market. Mr. Heath announced the appointment from his official residence at 10 Downing Street.

title: Nixon Prepares for Budget and Defense Sessions
description: SAN CLEMENTE, July 25 President Nixon will engage next week in an intensive series of meetings with key officials on the economy, the fiscal 1972 budget, and the organization of the Defense Department.

title: Spotlight:
description: There may be a silver, per haps gold, lining on the dark clouds that now envelop the color television industry and the stocks of its leading com panies.

title: Mahoney to Captain Manhattan Five
description: Brian Mahoney, Manhattan College backcourtman for the last two seasons, will be cap tain of the team next season.

title: Uses of the Land
description: How this nation's land is used is presently deter Mined, according to Senator Henry M. Jackson, by some 60,000 separate jurisdictions, each with some measure of zoning authority. The results have been an overall planlessness, a running conflict of gener ally legitimate interests, and a staggering waste of resources which only the world's richest country would have tolerated  and only its most prodigal people could have. The Senator from Washington has accord ingly introduced a National Land Use Policy Bill intended to make at least a start in applying to land use the kind of systems analysis so dear to Americans in business and so abhorrent in government.

title: SEGIII'S 3HITTER DOWNS PETERSON
description: OAKLAND, July 25Diego Segui's Cuban forkball has put in three separate hitches with the nomadic Kansas City Oakland Athletics, and today he displayed an excellent reason why the club has brought him back from Washington and Seattle.

title: Home Sees Some Gains in Mideast and Indochina
description: LONDON, July 23 (AP)Sir Alec DouglasHome, the British Foreign Secretary, says that both the Egyptians and Israelis are starting to think of nego tiations as their best course. He feels that the North Atlantic Treaty Organization must take account of new Soviet influence south of Europe and must pos sibly consider protection of trade routes around southern Africa.

title: Lincoln Downs Race Goes To Be Back by 4 Lengths
description: LINCOLN, R. I., July 25 (AP) Be Back romped to a 4 length victory today in the $5,000 Little Rhody Handicap at Lincoln Downs.

title: Scene Is Set for $250,000 Westchester Golf Classic Starting Thursday
description: Main ProgramThursday through Sunday. 18 holes daily. Sudden death follows end of Sunday play in event of tie for first place. Starting field of approximately 150. Low 70 scorers and ties and those within 10 strokes of leader after second round continue for third and fourth rounds. Purse $250,000. First prize, $50,000.

title: Failing Companies
description: The nation is facing a problem that it has not con fronted to a comparable degree since the Great Depre sion: what should the Federal Government do about private enterprises that are failing?

title: N. Y. U. ATHLETES GET HALL OF FAME
description: New York University will establish a Sports Hall of Fame next fall, with the first induc tions set for the annual N.Y.U. Varsity Club awards dinner on Nov. 5.

title: Escapade Ensign Victor
description: SEA CLIFF, L.I., July 25 Gene Rogers and Joseph Schej bal's Escapade captured Ensign Class honors today in the Hempstead Harbor competition conducted by the Sea Cliff Yacht Club.

title: Blue Ridge Parkway Aide Sets Road Extension Goal
description: WAYNESVILLE, N. C., July 25Granville B. Liles, super intendent of Blue Ridge Park way, says he hopes that con struction on the Georgia exten sion of the parkway can get under way In the next fiscal year.

title: Late Listings for Today's TV
description: The following information about today's television programs was not available in time to appear in Section 2.

title: In the Sports Editor's Mailbox
description: The Benefits of Tennis

title: ASTROS WIN, 84, END PIRATE STRING
description: PITTSBURGH, July 25Denis Menke and Bob Watson drove in three runs each today and Jimmy Wynn produced two as the Houston Astros trounced the Pittsburgh Pirates, 84.

title: And Now in Israel A Fluttering of Doves
description: TEL AVIV.

title: Niekro's TwoHitterand Aaron's Homer Help Braves Triumph Over Cubs, 90
description: CHICAGO, July 25 (AP) Hank Aaron's 26th homer of the season and the 580th of his career backed Phil Niekro's twohitter today and helped the Atlanta Braves to a 90 victory over the Chicago Cubs.

title: Mideast 1: Nasser's Yes Opens Peace Door A Crack
description: CAIROGarnal Abdel Nasser is a bird who has twice arisen from the ashes of defeat, his plumage glossier than ever. These last days he has shown what he can do with a firmer platform, like a tightrope.

title: TEENAGERS PLAN FIGHT ON DRUGS
description: Teenagers working In the city's Youth Service Agency announced last week that more than 35,000 of their contempo raries here had signed pledgds to fight drug use as a fashion able thing for young people.

title: Foreign Affairs: Junking China's Junks
description: Approximately twentyfive years ago the Soviet Union decided to become a major maritime nation. At the time, some months before the end of World War II, Maj. Gen. Haida (assigned to maritime affairs) wrote: Our fatherland has right to be one of the greatest naval powers in the world.

title: DONATING TO YALE AT RECORD LEVEL
description: The total was $61,382 more tan Yale received last year and, according to records here, s more than any other univer sity or college annual fund in the country has ever collected.

title: BEANIE URGES NIXON TO PAY CITY FOR U.N.
description: The Federal Government should pay New York City for the expense of police protection for, the United Nations missions and foreign consulates and for the tax losses the city suffers in being host to these taxex empt facilities, Controller Abra ham D. Beame has suggested to President Nixon.

title: Contributing To Black Rage
description: THE broadcasting indus try contributes to black rage, not only because its radio stations and television channels lay out the goodies of an affluent society from which the grow ing black underclass is in creasingly alienated, but be cause it presents a daily re minder of the unwillingness of white America to deal with black Americans as ma ture, serious, complex human beings.

title: Howard W. Blauvelt Marries Mary E. Cassitv in Greenwich
description: GREENWICH, Conn., July 25Miss Mary Evelyn Cas sity, daughter of Mrs. Ed mond. Cassity of Kaw City, Okla., and the, late Mr. Cas sity was married here this noon to Howard W. Blau velt, president of the Conoco Chemicals Division of the Continental Oil Company.

title: Letters
description: EGGHEADS BY THE BUNCH

title: 2 Men Seized in Robbery Of Queens Korvette Store
description: Two men were captured and the police were searching for a third last night in the robbery of $60,000 from, a vault in the E. J. Korvette Store at 61st Avenue and Douglaston Avenue in Little Neck. Queens.

title: Best Seller List
description: This analysis is based on reports obtained from more than 125 book stores in 64 communities of the United States. The figures in the right hand column do not necessarily represent consecutive appearances.

title: Westmoreland Gets Award
description: THOMASTON, Me., July 251 (AP)Gen. William C. West moreland, chief of staff of the Army, received today an award for patriotism, the Gen. Henry Knox Award, in observance of the 220th anniversary of Knox's birth. Knox was the first Secre tary of War for the United States.

title: Ruby, Connecticut Amateur, Takes New England Golf
description: MANCHESTER, Me., July 25 (AP)John Ruby of Mills River, Conn., beat John Brown ing of Weston, Mass., 2 and 1, today and won the New Eng land amateur golf champion ship played in 90degree weather.

title: Wintergreens of the Sheltered Woodlands
description: IN midsummer, the sun scarcely touches the forest floor. The woods are darker. Bright splashes of color from spring's early flowers have gone and subtle shades abound. These are small berries of Canada mayflower and false Solomon's seal, those of red and white baneberry, cucumber root and Clintonia, the tight cluster of Jackin thepulpit, and the single, larger berries ?? trilliums.

title: P. A. Orsoni Weds Susan W. Osborne
description: CRAWFORD, N. J., July 25  Miss Sutan Wallace Os borne and Pierre Antoine Orsoni were married here this afternoon in the Memo rial Chapel of the First Presbyterial Church by the Rev. Dr. Robert G. Longaker.

title: A. E. L. MADURO
description: A.E.L. Maduro, who retired two years ago as president of the Selma Mercantile CorPora tion, an exporting and import ing concern here, died Friday in Smith's Parish, Bermuda, while on la visit. He was 77 years old and lived at 36 Byron Lane, Larchrnont, N.Y.

title: Parochial School Desegregation Asked by Catholics in Louisiana
description: NEW ORLEANS, July 25 A group of black Roman Cath olics has asked a Federal court to order the Catholic school system of Opelousas, La., to desegregate.

title: Ceylon Is Planning To Take a Census Of Wild Elephants
description: COLOMBO, Ceylon, July 25 A novel method of taking census of the wild elephant population in Ceylon is to be attempted by the Government's Wildlife Department soon.

title: 1,851 in Waukesha Show
description: The Waukesha Kennel Club fixture in Waukesha, Wis., to day has drawn 1,851 dogs, Making it the largest show in the state. Among the breeds with big entries are German shepherds, 112; English springer spanielS, 67, Afghans, 59; Irish setters 54 and St. Bernards, 49. There are 201 dogs in the obedience classes, with 68 in Novice A.

title: Backyard Gardeners Fight High Food Costs
description: THERE now are more vegetable gar dens in American backyards than ever before  50,000,000 of them according to some estimates. Tight money and high food costs are the chief reasons cited.

title: METS BEAT DODGERS, 64; A'S BLANK YANKS AGAIN, 10; DEWAN TAKES BROOKLYN STAKES; FORWARD GAL WINS
description: Dewan came along boldly in the stretch to win the $107,400 Brooklyn Handicap at Aqueduct yesterday. With Laf fit Pincay riding him, the William Haggin Perry representative scored by a head over F. Carl Vander voort's Pleasure Seeker, with Hydrologist of the Meadow Stable next.

title: NOTHING LIKE A RODGERSAND A KAYE
description: The time, July 27, 1920. The place, the old Central Theater on Broadway. The occa sion, opening night of Poor Little Ritz Girl with music by Sigmund Romberg and an unknown 18yearoldRichard Rodgers. Below, Grant Simpson, Lulu McConneil and Aileen Poe emote in a scene from that show. Above, Mr. Rodgers, 50 years and some 1,200 songs later, with Danny Kaye, who will star as Noah in the composers new musical, Two by Two, based on Clifford Odetss The Flowering Peach. For the enduring Rodgers Two by Two, due Oct. 29, will be his 38th Broadway musical; for comedian Kaye, his first appearance in one since Lets Face It back in 1941.

title: Japan to Launch Satellite
description: TOKYO, July 25 (UPI)Japan plans to launch into orbit on Aug. 19 a 136pound observa tion satellite, the Institute of Aeronautical Science reports.

title: E. R. Beecher Jr. And Lee Barney Engaged to Wed
description: MANHASSET, L. I., July 25 Mr. and Mrs. William Had wen Barney of Manhasset and Nantucket, Mass., have an nounced the engagement of their daughter, Miss Marie Louise (Lee) Barney, who ex pects to be graduated next month from Dickinson Col lege in Carlisle, Pa., to E. Ronald Beecher Jr., who re ceived his degree from Dick inson in May. He is the son of Mr. and Mrs. Evan R. Beecher of Middletown, N. J.

title: The Hordes
description: They hum, they buzz, they flit and flutter and creep and crawl, and the warmer the day the more active they are. Insects, the vast and varied world of insect life, revel in summer.

title: Economic Indicators
description: WEEKLY COMPARISONS

title: VOUCHER SYSTEM IN SCHOOLS BACKED
description: The Union of Orthodox Jew ish Congregations of America voiced strong support last week for a federally sponsored plan to set up an experimen tal education voucher system in one or two localities in the fall of 1971.

title: Frederick Weeman Weds Alice Hunter
description: ELMIRA, N. Y., July 25 Miss Alice Crist Hunter and Frederick Gerald Weeman were married here this after noon in the Park Congrega tional Church.

title: 2 Black Leaders in Mobile, Ala., Face Charges in Shootout Death
description: MOBILE, Ala., July 24The two leading black militants of Mobile were arraigned today on charges of first degree mur der. They face trial Sent. 22.

title: International Women's Soccer to Debut Next Sunday
description: The first international women's soccer game will be played here next Sunday at Randalls Island.

title: Behind Historic Scottish Pageant Lurk Dreams of Independence
description: ARBROATH, ScotlandFrom the royal chamber of a great red sandstone abbey, high above this windswept eastcoast fishing port in 1320, King Robert the Bruce and his nobles sent to Pope John XXII at Avignon a passionate proclama tion of Scotland's independence. It was framed in magnificently ringing Latin prose by Robert's Chancellor, Bernard de Linton the Abbot of Arbroath.

title: China Vows to Join Any War Of North Korea Against U.S.
description: TOKYO, Sunday, July 26 (AP)The Chinese Communist Army will join North Korea in any future war ?against United States and Japanese reaction aries, Peking's Hsinhua press agency said today.

title: Monmouth Results
Luf II OverAll Winner in Knickerbocker Race
description: PORT WASHINGTON, L. I., July 25Yale Grayson's Luf II from the New Haven Yacht Club won overall honors today in the Knickerbocker Yacht Club's ninth annual day race for cruising yachts on Long Is land Sound.

title: Final Standing
description: EDINBURGH, Scotland, July 25 (UPI)Final table of medal winners at Commonwealth Games.

title: Cards' Rookies Get Day Off
description: LAKE FOREST, III., July 25 (UPI)The St. Louis Football Cardinal rookies performed so well during a 30minute scrim mage today that Coach Charlie Winner gave them the day off tomorrow. There were very few mistakes and some very good hitting and running, he said. Most of the boys looked quite good considering that we've only been in camp a few days.

title: Cola Giants Speed Tests of Plastic Bottles
description: Striving for better and cheaper packaging, the na tion's two leading cola pro ducers are accelerating their market tests of plastic bottles for carbonated beverages.

title: CURFEW CONTINUED IN NEW BRUNSWICK
description: NEW BRUNSWICK, N. J., July 25A tight curfew on this city was continued tonight on the orders of Mayor Patricia Q. Sheehan, who said today that last night's restricted curfew was a success and had un doubtedly averted a serious crisis.

title: Pruitt Registers SecondRound Knockout Over Ryu
description: TOKYO, July 25 (UPI) Adolph Pruitt, a brawling 28 yearold from Los Angeles, bat tered the Japanese welterweight champion, Sorimachi Ryu, to thb canvas three times in the second round today and scored a knockout victory in a non title bout.

title: MISS HELDMAN OUT OF NATIONAL OPEN
description: LEICESTER, England, July 25 (UPI)Julie Heldman, the No. 2 American seeded star from New York, said today she had quit tennis indefinitely and would Miss the $160,000 United States Open championships in New York Sept. 2 to 13. This was her second retirement in three years.

title: T?? Driving School Alumnal
description: POCATELLO, Idaho, July 25 (AP)Teresa Jones, 15 years old, was among the first in her driver education class to get her licenseand certainly the first to get a traffic ticket. As she pulled away from the sheriff's office, she waved to friends, and promptly got into a collision. She was cited for inattention to driving.

title: Rosewall Beats Nastase, Richey Tops Kodes in Western Tennis
description: CINCINNATI, July 25 (AP) Ken Rosewall, sharp at the net, took only 45 minutes to elimi nate Ilie Nastase of Romania in semifinals of the $25,000 West ern tennis championship today.

title: Italy Seeking Tourism Gain
description: Plans for an expansion of Italy's tourist business, al ready earning a record of $1.7billion a year, have been announced by Giuseppe Lupis, the Italian Minister of Tourism and Entertainment.

title: What to do today before tomorrow gets you
description: Over a century ago Matthew Arnold asked what coal, iron and railroads had to do with sweetness and light, while in 1969 a college student named Molly told a man over 30 that technology and all those conveniences are a lot of . After all these years whether one pre fers the idiom of Victoria or Jerry Rubin the message is the same; we still have trouble with the machinery. And since the machinery is getting bigger all the time the troubles are getting larger.

title: Mr. Lindsay's Dilemma
description: The misery of being Mayor of New York is so established a political assumptionand with it the Mayor's desire to escape upwardthat it is a surprise to find John Lindsay reasonably happy and healthy. He tells visitors that he enjoys the job, with all the crises, and that he looks at politics in terms of holding this city together for the remaining three years of his term.

title: Rise in Post Office Burglaries Is Attributed to Outlaw Bands
description: WASHINGTON, July 26A handful of small outlaw bands specializing in post office bur glaries has caused growing losses to the Post Office De partment in recent years, ac cording to a highranking postal official.

title: For Children, OldFashioned Broomstick Pleats
description: At first glance, it might seem as though Bonwit Teller plans to turn children into lit tle witches. But the broom sticks that come with the children's clothes by Fischel, available this fall on the store's ninth floor, are for pleating, not flying. The red calico skirts, which come in midi or mini lengths and have suspenders that go over a white blouse edged in Mexican lace, have old  fashioned broom stick pleatsand what could be handier for pleating than a special broom to wrap the skirt around. For girls who like to dress identically with their dolls, there is also a doll in a matching midilength outfit.

title: ISRAEL REPORTED NEAR AGREEMENT ON U.S, PROPOSAL
description: JERUSALEM, July 26Israel was reported to have moved today toward accepting a Unit ed States formula for a limited ceasefire and the opening of peace talks with the Arab states, but acceptance was said Ito be conditioned on receiving military and political assur ances from Washington.

title: Senator Backs Crime Fight
description: ST. LOUIS, July 26 (UPI) Senator Stuart Symington, Dem ocrat of Missouri, called today for more Federal aid to cities and states to combat crime. It is essential that crime be re duced and public safety in creased, he told a meeting of the 12th Ward Progressive Dem ocratic Organization.

title: Egyptian Naval Leader Dies
description: CAIRO, July 26  Suleiman Ezzat, the commander of the Egyptian navy during the 1967 ArabIsraeli war, died yester day after a short illness. He was 60 years old. He was one of several Egyptian military commanders who resigned in a leadership shakeup following the conflict.

title: Julie Robinson Is Future Bride Of F. P. Kistler
description: VINEYARD HAVEN, Mass., July 26Miss Julie Ann Rob inson and Fredric P. Kistler plan to be married on Aug. 22. A garden ceremony is planned at the summer home here of the future bride's parents, Mr, and Mrs. Benja min M. Robinson. The Robin sons have homes also in New York and Barbados, W. I. Mr. Kistler's parents, Mr. and Mrs. George W. Kistler, live in Allentown. Pa.

title: Books of The Times
description: Although the United States is Incom parably the greatest consumer of Scotch whisky, it is an allegiance that, like the English language, may divide rather than unite us with our British kinsman. Neither David Daiches, the distinguished English scholar, not Dr. McDowell, a physician and professior emeritus at the University of London, would impose his own tastes on us. Nevertheless, they do take a rather. dim view of the American practice of chilling their Scotch (and our taste buds) by the addition of ice cubes to the glass or muddying the flavor of the beverage by the addition of Angostura bitters, fruit juices, soda water or other foreign bodies. The chances, are, in fact, that only a small handful of Americans drink what the authors would consider the genuine brew. None of these charges is made explicitly, but no other conclusion can, alas, be drawn.

title: Office Worker Circles Australia in Speedboat
description: SYDNEY, Australia, July 26 A young Danish office worker from Sydney received a hero's welcome here today after completing an often perilous voyage around Aus tralia alone in an open 12foot speedboat.

title: Mr. Nixon on Spending
description: As both a politician and a football fan, President Nixon knows that an aggressive of fense is the best defense. He has taken the offensive against critics of his economic strategy who believe that with high prices, high unemployment, and no economic growth, this Ad ministration has managed simultaneously to combine sev eral of the worst effects of inflation and deflation.

title: VIOLENCE RECURS IN EAST VILLAGE
description: Policemen called to stop the looting of a drugstore in the East Village last night were forced to fire eight shots into the air to disperse a threaten ing crowd of Puerto Ricans, the police said.

title: DR. FRANCESCO MIRAGLIA
description: PORT CHESTER, N. Y., July 26  Dr. Francesco Miraglia, an ophthalmologist with offices here and in New York, died yesterday in United Hospital. He was 87 years old and lived at 319 Glen Avenue. His New] York office was at 317 East 116 Street.

title: Miss Power Wed in Italy
description: BRINDISI, Italy, July 26 (Reu ters)Romina Power, the 18 yearold daughter of Linda Christian, the actress, and the late Tyrone Power, was married to Al Bano, 27, the Italian singer, in the Church of St. Catherine, near here today. Miss Christian attended the cere mony. The bride and bridegroom have often appeared on TV, radio and in the movies to gether.

title: Miss O'Shea Engaged To John R. Donohue
description: Announcement has been made by Mr, and Mrs. John F. O'Shea of Brooklyn of the engagement of their daugh ter, Miss Kathleen Mary O'Shea, to John Roger Dono hue, son of J. Paul Donohue of Westfield, N. J., and the late Mrs. Evelyn Hooper Donohue. An August wedding is planned.

title: Angels Top Senators In 11th
description: ANAHEIM, Calif., July 26 (UPI)Jarvis Tatum blooped a double to right field to score Billy Cowan from first base with two out in the 11th in ning today and gave the Cali fornia Angels an 1110 victory over the Washington Senators. President Nixon was among the spectators.

title: Nixon the Lawyer Talks About G.O.P. on TV Tape
description: A New York lawyer, Richard M. Nixon, was seen on WORTV last night in a videotaped inter view about the future of the Republican party.

title: KIRTLAND TRIUMPHS IN COW BAY SAILING
description: PORT WASHINGTON, L. I., July 26Bob Kirtland's Early Bird continued to dominate Raven Class ranks as a fleet of 91 yachts sailed today in the Knickerbocker Yacht Club on Cow Bay area, Yacht Racing Association of Long Island Sound competition.

title: No Shortcut
description: President Nixon now has before him the omnibus District of Columbia crime bill. By reorganizing and expanding the courts, reforming the coroner's office and rationalizing many procedures, this measure should achieve a substantial improvement in the ad ministration of justice in the nation's capital.

title: Letters to the Editor of The Times
description: Cosmetic Catchwords

title: ORANGEMEN PARADE, DEFYING ULSTER BAN
description: BELFAST, Northern Ireland, July 26 (AP)Protestant Or angemen marched in County Tyrone today in defiance of the Ulster Government's ban on parades.

title: For Julius Monk, Back to the Piano
description: Two days after Julius Withers Monk left the Cin cinnati Conservatory of Music in 1935 where, on the side, he had played the or an at Peebles' Paramount on weekends and, during the week, tooted a steam calliope on a sidewheeler, the Island Queen, he reached New York and began playing piano in the bar at No. One Fifth Avenue.

title: Virgin Islands Democrats Name Governor Candidate
description: CHRISTIANSTED, St. Croix, July 26 (AP)Senator Alexan der Farrelly scored a lopsided victory last night in gaining the Democratic nomination in a drive to become the first elected Governor of the Virein Islands.

title: International Loans Listed for Week
description: WASHINGTON, July 26The following is a list of loans and other aid extended last week by United States and other international lending agencies here:

title: Nixon, in Letter, Hails Bishop Freed by China
description: HONG KONG, July 26 (AP)President Nixon has written to the Most Rev. James Edward Walsh, the 79yearold Roman Catholic missionary released earlier this Month after 12 years in a Chinese Communist prison.

title: Rejection by Syria
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, July 26 Syria today rejected the United States proposal, but informed sources here said that they be lieved this had been done for propaganda purposes to main tain Syria's stand of opposition to a peaceful settlement with Israel.

title: Saigon Army Desertions Up Nearly 50% in Spring
description: SAIGON. South Vietnam, July 26Desertions from the South Vietnamese Army in creased drastically in the last few months, averaging nearly 50 per cent higher than the rate last year, according to in formed South Vietnamese sources.

title: Article 1  No Title
Dance: Farewell Party for Ashton
description: LONDON, July 26If Brit ain's Royal Ballet has ever had a finest houror a finest three hours, to be accurate then that hour struck at the Royal Opera House, Covent Garden, Friday night. There was magic in the air and gen ius on the stage. Over the years I must have seen some 7,000 performances of ballet; if I had to choose only one, this would be it. It started out modestly enough. Sir Frederick Ashtor is retiring from the director. ship of the Royal Ballet, and the company decided it would be nice to give a performance in his honor. Called simply Tribute to Sir Frederick Ash ton, C.H., C.B.E.  titles that make him sound more like a successful general than a great choreographer  the program was devised and staged by Ashton's two lieu tenants, John Hart and Michael Somes.

title: Holland America Begins Credit Plan for Cruises
description: The current economic downturn, adversely affect ing advance bookings for four long cruises this fall and winter, has prompted the Holland America Line to in stitute a sail now, pay later plan.

title: ROSEWALL BEATS RICHEY FOR TITLE
description: CINCINNATI, July 26 (UPI) Ken Rosewall fought back from 25 in the last set to de feat Cliff Richey, 79, 97, 86, for the men's singles title in the $25,000 Western tennis championships today.

title: Judith Gubner, G. E. Whitwell Marry on L.I.
description: PORT WASHINGTON, L. I., July 26Miss Judith Lenore Gubner and Gordon Edward Whitwell were married here this afternoon in the Luther an Church of Our Savior by the Rev. Dr. Thomas Spitz.

title: Israel Says Planes Raided Full Length of Suez Canal
description: TEL AVIV, July 26 (AP) Israeli planes attacked Egyptian fortifications and antiaircraft batteries along the 103mile length of the Suez Canal to day, the military command an nounced.

title: Kim Agnew Ends Indian Visit
description: SANTA FE, N. M., July 26 (UPI)Vice President Agnew's 14yearold daughter, Kim, flew hack to Washington today after a fourday goodwill mis sion to the Taos Pueblo In dians.

title: Advertising: Pfizer Plans Media Operation
description: Chas. Pfizer & Co., accord ing to reliable sources, is about to embark on its own media planning and buying operation for the Coty and Leeming/Paequin divisions. Last year those two spent about $7.5million in meas ured media while the entire corporation spent some $26.6million.

title: A Festival Town As You May Like It
description: STRATFORD, Ontario, July 26There is an As You Like It motel, a Romeo Street, and a Portia Boule vard, but mostly Stratford is a small, serene, unShake spearean city, surrounded by cows, barns and pastures, and seemingly undisturbed by the fact that for 18 years it has been the site of the famous Stratford Festival.

title: WEST GERMAN AIDE ARRIVES IN SOVIET FOR TREATY TALKS
description: MOSCOW, July 26Foreign Minister Walter Scheel of West Germany arrived today for formal negotiations with the Soviet Union that both sides hope will lead to a treaty opening the way to a signifi cant improvement in Bonn's relations with Eastern Europe.

title: Japan's Defense Force Tested Legally
description: TOKYO, July 26The Consti tutionality of Japan's 250,000 man SelfDefense Force is being tested in a trial that opened last week in Niigata.

title: Schools and Libraries to Get $243,250 Refund on Books
description: Attorney General Louis J. Lefkowitz announced yesterday than school districts and 14 library districts in New York State would receive refunds totaling $243,250 as a result of action by his office charging hook publishers and whole salers with violating antitrust, laws.

title: WAR COUNT TAKES 6TH HUNTER TITLE
description: WHEATLEY HILLS, L. I., July 26War Count, owned by the StaStill Farm of Syosset, L. I., maintained his unbeaten record on Long Island today by winning the AmateurOwner Hunter championship at the Meadowbrook Hounds Horse Show. The event was held on the estate of Mr. and Mrs. Charles V. Hickox.

title: Tennis Final to Kerdasha
description: RIDGEWOOD, N. J., July 26 Ron Kerdasha of Hillsdale re tained his New Jersey State tennis title for men 35 years and over today by beating Jack Schofield of Paramus, 63, 63, in the final.

title: OSTHEIMER GAINS SOLING SAIL TITLE
description: BRIDGEPORT, Conn., July 26 James A. Ostheimer of Pequot Y.C. won the Soling Class cham pionship today when the Long Island Sound Yacht Racing As sociation's eastern Connecticut, area regatta ended with one race off Black Rock Y.C. First in both of yesterday's races, Ostheimer placed fourth with Grimmet in today's ninemilel race in a 5toSknot south, southwest breeze and gained 27 points.

title: Kidnapped Guatemalan Freed After Ransom Is Paid
description: GUATEMALA, July 26 Owen Smith, a prominent cat tle and coffee producer who was kidnapped and held for 17 days by leftist guerrillas, is resting at the home of relatives after a ransom of $150,000 was paid for his release, friends said today.

title: Poseidon Firing Delayed
description: CAPE KENNEDY, Fla., July 26 (AP)Inaugural undersea launching of the Navy's multi explosive Poseidon missile was delayed today. Officials said the shot from the nuclearpowered submarine James Madison may be a month away because addi tional surface testing is needed before the Poseidon can be shot from beneath the sea.

title: 3 CEPEDA CLOUTS DEFEAT CUBS, 83
description: CHICAGO, July 26 (AP) Orlando Cepeda cracked three successive home runs, including a grand slam, and drove in seven runs today to power the Atlanta Braves to an 83 vic tory over the Chicago Cubs in the first game of a double header.

title: Orioles Trounce Twins, 111, as Powell Belts Grand Slam and Bats In 6 Runs
description: BLOOMINGTON, Minn., July 26 (AP)Boog Powell drove in six runs with a single and a grandslam homer today and Dave McNally notched his 13th, victory with a fivehitter as the Baltimore Orioles crushed the Minnesota Twins, 111.

title: Jordan Accepts Plan
description: AMMAN, Jordan, July 26 The Jordanian Government ap proved tonight the United States proposal for settlement of the conflict between Israel and the Arab countries.

title: MARGIN COLLATERAL CONTINUES TO DROP
description: The collateral in margin ac counts held by member firms of the New York Stock Ex change continued to decline, falling 6.4 per cent in June to $11billion, the lowest level since the exchange began keep ing records of such statistics on a comparable basis five years ago.

title: A. Listing of New Books
description: GENERAL

title: BONDSMAN SEIZES SHOOTING SUSPECT
description: A 32yearold bail bondsman was commended yesterday by a judge for capturing the al leged gunman in a fatal street corner shooting that he wit nessed in Brooklyn Saturday night.

title: CASTRO DESCRIBES ECONOMIC FAILURE
description: MIAMI, July 26Premier Fi del Castro tonight drew a bleak picture of the Cuban economy, with conditions in many sectors bordering on chaos.

title: Dancers Help Preacher Present David Story as AgeGap Lesson
description: An ancient Biblical story about the generation gap was translated into contemporary, speech and modern dance yes terday in a Brooklyn church.

title: Calif. Wins in Rugby, 1916
description: BRISBANE, Australia, July 26 (Reuters)The University of California rugby team beat Queensland University, 1916, today, despite the use of out side players by the Australian team.

title: Miss Ann Hoxton Prospective Bride
description: ALEXANDRIA, Va., July 26Mr. and Mrs. Archibald R. Hoxton Jr. have an nounced the engagement of their daughter, Miss Ann Hoxton of Boulder, Colo., to Michael F. Taylor, a student at Colorado Mountain Col lege in Glenwood Springs, Colo.

title: Methodists Keep Sabbath Holy in Dry Jersey Resort
description: OCEAN GROVE, N. J.  When the clock strikes mid night every Saturday, the five entrances to this small coastal community are securely barred and its yearround residents and summer visitors prepare for a day of quiet and contemplation.

title: Births
description: TOMCHINMichael and Laurie (nee Schnur macher) happily announce the birth of Marc Louis' sister, Allyson Jill July 26, 1970.

title: Unit Pricing Test: Buyers Appreciate Chance to Cut Food Costs
description: BURLINGTON, Iowa, July 26 You know, I found out some of the canned goods real ly are different in price, when you see the price broken down this way, said Mrs. Robert Hale. I'd always bought Armour's Golden canned hams for example. But then I saw the unit price and now I've switched to Dubuque, because I know they're cheaper.

title: SALT and Safeguard...
description: The Administration's claim that success in the Stra tegic Arms Limitation Talks (SALT) with Russia re quires Congressional authorization of an expanded Safeguard program is the least credible of the many unconvincing arguments made for this antiballistic missile (ABM) system in the past year.

title: JOSEPH GROSBERG
description: MIAMI BEACH, July 26 (UPI)  Joseph E. Grosberg, the founder of Central Markets, a supermarket chain in Eastern New York, died today at Mount Sinai Hospital here at the age of 86.

title: Montana Fish and Game Director Arouses Governor's Ire With Strict Stand on the State's Ecology
description: HELENA, Mont. July 26 The man in charge of protecting fish and wildlife in this sparsely populated state is under fire from the Governor and his own commission members for his continued insistence that en vironmental safeguards be in eluded in any proposed develop ment for Montana.

title: ACT ONE IS VICTOR IN CLEVELAND SHOW
description: CLEVELAND, July 26 (AP) Act One won a jump off against Idle Dice and Dutch Brandy to win the $6,000 top prize in the $15,000 American Gold Cup at the Chagrin ValleyProfessional Horsemen's Association show today.

title: City to Install ComputerRun Traffic Lights Uptown
description: New traffic signal equipment worth $6.5million will be in stalled in the next, year at all intersections in Manhattan be tween 69th and 125th Streets from river to river, Mayor Lindsay's office announced yes terday.

title: Burns Sees Supply Of Money Growing Fast, About Right
description: WASHINGTON, July 26Ar thur F. Burns, chairman of the Federal Reserve Board, said to day that the nation's supply of money has been growing faster than normal and that the rate would pick up even more dur ing this month.

title: PADRES TRIUMPH OVER PHILS, 162
Miss Mary Burnham Wed to Robert Gold
description: NORTHFIELD, Vt., July 26 Miss Mary Burnham was married here today to Robert E. Gold, son of Herman Gold of New York and the late Mrs. Gold. The Rev. David Pearson, minister of the Northfield United Church, performed the ceremony at the home of the bride's par ents, Prof. and Mrs. George H. Burnham. Her father is professor of physics and di rector of the Radiation Facili ties Laboratory at Norwich University here.

title: ARTHUR L. RIEDER
description: Arthur L. Rieder, vice presi dent of the Guaranteed Title and Mortgage Company, a division of American Title In surance Company, and a direc tor of the Tremont Savings and Loan Association, died yester day of a heart attack at his home. He was 61 years old and lived at 9728 57th Ave nue, Forest Hills, Queens.

title: State Sets Up Plan Of Drug Education For Schoolchildren
description: ALBANY, July 26 (AP)The State Education Department an nounced a $1.3million program today that is designed to save schoolage children from the horror of drug use.

title: Katherine Eunson, 67, Wife And Collaborator of Writer
description: BEVERLY HILLS, Calif.,. July 26 (AP)Katherine Albert Eun son, wife and collaborator of Dale Eunson, Hollywood novel ist and screenwriter, died today of a heart condition at St. John's Hospital in nearby Santa Monica. She was 67 years old.

title: Transit Authority Fills Post
description: The appointment of John T. O'Neill as chief engineer of the Transit Authority has been an nounced by Dr: William J. Ronan, chairman of the Metro politan Transportation Author ity. Formerly the city's Buildings Commissioner, he will head the Transit Authority's $1.4billion construction program.

title: Davies Captures Manila Grand Prix
description: MANILA, July 26 (UPI) Allan Davies of Britain took the lead going into the 21st lap and won the 84mile first Manila Grand Prix auto race today.

title: Ohio Students Practice Russian and Sightsee in Soviet
description: SOCHI, U.S.S.R.His rifle slung over a shoulder, the So viet militiaman stepped on the beach and faced the youths.

title: Salzburg Festival Opens
description: SALZBURG, Austria, July 26 (AP)  President Franz Jonas opened the 50th annual Salz burg Festival today. The 111 performances in 36 days of mu sic and drama will include Beethoven's Fidelio to mark the 200th anniversary of the composer's birth, and operas by Mozart, Salzburg's native son.

title: Crocker's Sunfish Victor In Regatta at Shinnecock
description: SHINNECOCK, L.I., July 26 Doug Crocker of the Long Island Yacht Club. West Baby lon, took the championship to day in the Shinnecock Yacht Club's annual Sunfish class in vitation regatta.

title: 11 City School Areas Ask Court to Clarify Race Balance Issue
description: CHARLOTTE, N. C., July 26 A resolution asking the Su preme Court to clarify as soon as possible legal questions surrounding conflicting racial balance and busing decisions by Federal district judges was approved by officials from 11 urban school districts meeting here this weekend.

title: Personal Finance
description: Everybody talks about fringe benefits for the working man but hardly anybody ever mentions fringe benefits for executives. One of the newer concepts in benefits for top level executives and middle management those earning $30,000 a year and upis fi nancial counseling.

title: RED SOX TROUNCE BREWERS BY 125
description: MILWAUKEE, July 26 (UPI) The Boston Red Sox hit four homers, including a pair of two run shots by Tony Conigliaro, and capitalized on three errors to rout the Milwaukee Brewers, 125. today.

title: TOKYO SMARTING FROM 4DAY SMOG
description: TOKYO, July 26This city suffered its fourth consecutive day of smog today as automo biles clogged highways leading out of the city.

title: Blacks at U. of Mississippi Striving To Change Status Quo as Lawyers
description: OXFORD, Miss.We go to school games, said Harold Hall, a 31yearold black law student at the University of Mississippi, but we find we always root for the visiting team.

title: South Africans Heartened by Report of Naval Exercise With British
description: JOHANNESBURG, South Af rica, July 26While much of black Africa was upset by Britain's decision to resume arms sales to South Africa, whites here were further heart ened last week by reports that Britain would participate with South African forces in joint antisubmarine exercises west of the Cape of Good Hope next month.

title: News Summary and Index
description: MONDAY, JULY 27, 1970

title: Humphrey May Seek Top Senate Post
description: WASHINGTON, July 26 The impression is growing here that former Vice Presi dent. Hubert H. Humphrey's hid for a Minnesota seat in the Senate is aimed not at positioning him for another Presidential race but at put ting him in line for the Sen ate majority leader's lob Mr. Humphrey, who was the Senate Democratic whip before Lyndon Johnson picked him as a running mate in 1964, has said sev eral times during his cam paign in Minnesota that he does not believe he will get another chance at the White House.

title: U. S. TV SATELLITE FOR INDIA DELAYED
description: NEW DELHI, July 26  A highly publicized firstofits kind project to beam education al television directly to villagers in India from an orbiting United States satellite has been post poned for a year because of budget cuts in Washington.

title: Lon Nol's Prospects Rise
description: PNOMPENH, Cambodia, July 26Four months after the ouster of Prince Norodom Sihanouk, friends of the new Government are most en couraged by what has not happened  the Government has not collapsed.

title: ... and the Future
description: With ABM systems deployed on both sides, even a low level, there would be a continuous race for quali tative improvement and, every few years, replacement of the system with a new generation of antimissiles, radars and computers. Far more dangerous, absence of limits on MIRV would permit a rapid multiplication of separately targeted nuclear delivery vehicles in the strategic offensive missile forces of both sides fivefold increase is now under way in the American forces, from 1,700 to about 8,000 nuclear delivery vehicles.

title: Dietz Wins as N. Y. A. C. Sweeps Canadian Henley Senior Singles
description: ST. CATHARINES, Ontario, July 26Jim Dietz of the New York, A. C. won Ms fourth straight championship singles crown at the 88th Royal Canadian Henley Regatta to day. Dietz defeated Roger Jackson of the ancouver Boat Club, Canada's gold medalist at Tokyo in 1964, by 10 lengths.

title: Salazar Rallies Slightly
description: LISBON, Monday, July 27 (AP)Antonio de Oliveira Sala zar, the 81yearold exPremier of Portugal, who is critically ill with a kidney infection, rallied slightly overnight, doc tors reported in a medical bul letin today. The bulletin said he had partly reestablished the balance of his clinical situa tion, which remained, however, unstable. Privately, however, his condition is described as hopeless and the family has been advised to expect the worst.

title: A BagMaking Project for Youths May Make a Profit, Too
description: Three teenage boys sat in a cramped, oneroom loft on lower Broadway the other day, handstitching big, flop py pieces of leather together.

title: Denunciation by Iraq
description: BEIRUT, July 26 (AP)In a broadcast monitored here to day, the Baghdad radio, after voicing Iraq's rejection of the peace plan, called on all mem bers of the Arab League to turn it down.

title: Leader of Britain's Dockers
description: LONDON, July 26Shortly before 7:30 each morning, Jack Jones leaves his three room apartment in London and starts the fourmile walk to Transport House near the houses of Parliament.

title: John of White Sox Wins 4th Straight, Beating Tigers, 40
description: DETROIT, July 26 (AP) Tommy John won his fourth straight game, scattering seven hits, as the Chicago White Sox blanked the Detroit Tigers, 40, today.

title: Mets Lose to Dodgers, 53
New Orleans Gets Plan to Increase Minority Hiring
description: NEW ORLEANS, July 26 Representatives of the construc tion industry, the unions, the city and a coalition of local chapters of the National Asso ciation for the Advancement of Colored People and the Urban League have agreed to a five year proposal for obtaining a 20per cent minoritygroup membership in all New Orleans construction trades craft unions.

title: Major Bills in Congress
Sensations to Begin Run At Theater Four Oct. 14
description: Sensations, described as a musical experience based on Romeo and Juliet, written and composed by Paul Zakr zewski and Wally Harper and presented by John Bohab and Charles Celian, has been, booked to open at Theater Four, 424 West 55th Street, on Oct. 14. The theater's current tenant is The Boys in the Band.

title: Connecticut Indians Feel Forgotten
description: TRUMBULL, Conn., July 26 Almost forgotten and, for the most part, dejected and unhappy, 13 Pequot Indians ranging in age from the 50's to the 80's are whiling away their days on four little res ervations in Connecticut.

title: Prayer Opens Dusenberry Agency
description: Phil Dusenbery has opened his own agency with a prayer.

title: Party Supports Nasser
description: CAIRO, July 26  President Nasser's acceptance of the United States initiative won endorsement tonight from the congress of the Arab Socialist Union, the country's sole politi cal organization.

title: How Much for a Marsh?
description: Private greed has momentarily triumphed over public good on Bald Head Island. Lying at the mouth of the Cape Fear River on the coast of North Carolina, Bald Head is one of the few undeveloped sea islands remaining along the Atlantic shore. It consists of 9,000 acres of salt marsh and 3,000 acres of high ground. Its ideal use is clearly as a marine research center and an undefiled habitat for the fish and birds that now abound there.

title: CAR MAKERS PLACE FALL STEEL BIDS
description: PITTSBURGH, July 26Steel mills are getting the first September orders from auto mobile companies.

title: W. E. MARCUS DIES; LED JEWELRY FIRM
description: BRIDGEPORT, Conn., July 26 William Elder Marcus, former president of Marcus & Co., the jewelers, died today at his home at 3030 Park Avenue here. He was 86 years old.

title: Airlines Differ on Atlantic Fares As Key to Increasing Revenues
description: Differing airline approaches to a common goal of more pas sengers and higher revenues over the North Atlantic have been made public by the Inter national Air Transportation As sociation.

title: Children's Shelter Hit by 3 Fires; Many Inmates Flee Into Street
description: Three fires within two hours broke out last night at Callagy Hall, the city's children's shel ter in the East Village.

title: APRIL'S FOOL POSTS VICTORY AS HUNTER
description: NORTH SALEM, N. Y., July 26April's Fool swept to vic tory in all four classes today to win the green working hunter championship at the Hill Horse Show.

title: Spurs Play Scoreless Tie With Varzim of Portugal
description: KANSAS CITY, July 26 (AP) The Kansas City Spurs were held to a scoreless tie tonight by Varzim of Portugal, but still retained first place in the northern division of the North American Soccer League.

title: Rural Odds and Ends, As History, Sell High
description: RUTAN, Pa., July 26 William G. Moore leaned against an old gravity gaso line pump, shielding his eyes against the burning sun, and with a slow shaking of his head indicated he had had enough.

title: Nixon Sees Baseball Game
description: SAN CLEMENTE, Calif., July 26 (AP)President Nixon spent the morning at his villa over looking the Pacific, aides said, with only a telephone call or two from members of his staff to break in. In the afternoon, he flew by helicopter 35 miles to Anaheim to watch the Wash ington SenatorsCalifornia An gels baseball game.

title: Bridge:
description: Two famous New York ex perts, Alvin Roth and Tobias Stone, won a convincing vic tory in an important pair tournament played last week in Deauville, France.

title: The Proceedings In the U.N. Today
Sultan of Muscat and Oman Is Overthrown by Son
description: AMMAN, Jordan, July 26 Qabus bin Said, 28yearold son of the ruler of Muscat and Oman, has overthrown his father, Sultan Said bin Taimur, in a palace coup, according to reports received here from the city of Salala.

title: Feeney Is Elected to Board Of Baseball's Hall of Fame
description: COOPERSTOWN, N.Y., July 26 (AP)Charles S. Feeney, president of the National eague, was elected today to the board of directors of the National Baseball Hall of Fame and Museum.

title: MRS. HORACE G. REED
description: HOUSTON, July 26Mrs. Florence Reed, widow of Hor ace Gardner Reed, a lawyer and former consultant to the State Department, died here yesterday at the age of 85.

title: Paper Raises Sunday Price
description: LOS ANGELES, July 26 (UPI) The Los Angeles Times an nounced today that the news stand price of its Sunday edi tion would be increased from 35 cents to 50 cents beginning Aug. 2.

title: CRUISING HONORS GO TO EQUATION
HOWARD E. PUSCH
description: SCARSDALE, N. Y., July 26  Howard E. Pusch, executive vice president and a director of the Tappan Zee National Bank, Nyack, died Friday at his home after a brief illness. He was 59 years old and lived here at 14 Fernway.

title: Miss Graham In 3 Aspects At Festival
description: NEW LONDON, July 26 Dramatic incidenes, mythic saga and lyrical abstraction are the three major creative areas Martha Graham has explored during her incredi bly productive choreographic career. On its first program Saturday evening at Con necticut College's American Dance Festival, her company presented significant works chosen from each strain.

title: The White House Before the Kennedys and After. . . Now What?
description: WASHINGTONWhen Mrs. Aristotle S. Onassis was Mrs. John F. Kennedy, she cre ated an optical illusion that the White House contained a great collection of American antiques, the White House Curator, Clement Conger, said the other day. Everyone has the mistaken impression that everything has been done. But nothing is further from the truth.

title: U.S. STAFF IN SAIGON WARNED OF VIOLENCE
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, July 26 (AP)  The United Stales Embassy has warned its staff against traveling alone in Saigon because of what it called recent acts of violence against Americans by students or other antiGovernment demonstra tors.

title: HARLEM ADDICTS TURN TO HOSPITAL
description: Groups of heroin addicts left the streets of Harlem yesterday to seek help in an unused ward of Harlem Hospital that had been taken over by a commu nity group Saturday evening.

title: OTTINGER CAUTIONS ON MERCURY IN FISH
description: Mercury contamination far exceeding the Food and Drug Administration's safety limit has been found in bass taken from the St. Lawrence River and Lake Ontario, according to a report released yesterday by Representative Richard L. Ot tinger, the Westchester Democrat who is running for the Senate.

title: Stennis Would Back 2d Cambodia Action
description: WASHINGTON, July 26  Senator John. C. Stennis, chair man of the Senate Armed Serv ices, declared today that he would favor another thrust into Cambodia by United States troops if the Administration found it necessary to clean out enemy sanctuaries there again.

title: HENRY BLOCH DIES; LAWYER SINCE 1904
description: SCARSDALE, N. Y., July 26 Henry Bloch, a lawyer spe cializing in realestate develop ment, died today in Lawrence Hospital in Bronxviile. He was 87 years old and lived at 40 Park Road here.

title: COHEN AND ARMY SING IN FOREST HILLS
description: Leonard Cohen, the Canadian novelist, poet and singer, brought his special despair to the Forest Hills Music Festival Saturday.

title: Miss Suzanne Stern Is Married
description: The marriage of Miss Su zanne Stern to Jeffrey B. Nachman took place here yes terday afternoon at the home of the bride's mother, Mrs. Stanley S. Goldfarb. The Rev. Dr. Nathan A. Perilman per formed the ceremony.

title: Kelly's 2Horse Trailer Solves Problem of Switching Tracks
Palmer and Nicklaus Win National Team Golf by 3 Shots
description: LIGONIER, Pa., July 26 Jack Nicklaus and Arnold Pal Ther, an old and established golfing partnership, won again today.

title: Sports Today
description: BASEBALL

title: Jersey Girl Dies in Maine
description: SCARBOROUGH, Me., July 26 (AP)A 19yearold New Jersey girl, Eileen Biscaha of Hasbrouck Heights, died today of injuries sustained May 11 when she was thrown from a motorcycle that struck the side of a bridge overpass here, the state police reported.

title: Tories in an Uneasy Mood as Recess Begins
description: LONDON, July 26The mem bers of Parliament locked their desks, shook hands, and stepped outdoors into a driving London (rainstorm. After four weeks of the new Conservative Govern ment, Laborites and Tories be gan a threemonth working holiday on Friday.

title: RED PLAN TO DIVIDE CAMBODIA REPORTED
description: PNOMPENH, Cambodia, July 26 (AP)In letters home from Peking, Prince Norodom Siha nouk is reported to have pro vided friends and family with what he thinks is the Commu nist masterplan for Cambodia.

title: CURFEW CALLED OFF BY NEW BRUNSWICK
description: NEW BRUNSWICK, N. J., July 26  A sunsettodawn curfew that has been in effect in this city since Friday was ordered lifted this afternoon by Mayor, Patricia Q. Sheehan following a meeting of the City Commission.

title: Government to Press 48 Balky School Districts on Desegregation
description: WASHINGTON, July 26  Federal teams will go to Austin, Tex., Tuesday for a final round of desegregation negotiations with 48 recalcitrant school dis tricts.

title: Records Set on Berlin Cinders and in Vienna Pool
description: BERLIN, July 26 (UPI) Karin Baizer of East Germa ny broke the women's world 100meter hurdles record to day with a time of 12.7 sec ends, the East German press agency ADN said.

title: Merged Firm Adopts Name
description: The name of the firm result ing from the recent merger of the New York Stock Exchange firms of Moore & Schley, Inc., and Dreyfus & Co. will he Moore & Schley, Cameron & Co., effective Aug. 1. The name of Dreyfus has been dropped, the firm said yesterday.

title: The Chief Awards
description: Junior Working Hunter ChampionshipCham pion, Sandy Loveioy's Coffee Break, 8 points; reserve, Lorraine Worthington's Lady: Mist, 7.

title: POLICE IN HOUSTON WOUND 2 NEGROES
description: HOUSTON, July 26 (AP) Two Negroes were wounded by the police in an exchange of gunfire in a black area of Hous ton tonight following a rally of black militants.

title: Rain and Winds Reduce AirPollution Levels Throughout City
description: Intermittent rain and im proved wind conditions cut air pollution levels in the city yes terday and eliminated the im mediate threat of an unhealth ful situation.

title: Bethpage Four Turns Back Brookville in Polo, 7 to 6
description: BETHPAGE, L. I., July 26 John Whitemore's goal late in the final chukker gave Bethpage a 76 triumph over Brookville at Bethpage State Park today.

title: Saigon Force Enters Cambodia In a New SearchDestroy Drive
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, July 26A force of 2,500 South Vietnamese soldiers entered Cambodia today in an operation that initially met only light to moderate opposition.

title: F. C. C. DISCOUNTS FEAR OF CABLE TV
description: WASHINGTON, July 26The Federal Communications Com mission's first general forecast of cable television's growth suggests that the broadcasting industry's fear of destructive competition has been focused on the wrong areas and has been greatly exaggerated.

title: The Consumer Is Now Courted in Budapest
description: BUDAPESTIt's called Cor win, after a Hungarian king of the Renaissance, but it could almost be Korvette or Klein's the way the summer shoppers are thronging to its bargain counters.

title: SOVIET, ON NAVY DAY, HAILS NUCLEAR SUBS
description: MOSCOW, July 26 (UPI) The Soviet Union celebrated Navy Day today with announce ments that its ships and nu clearmissile submarines are ready for war or peace through out the world.

title: Van Karajan Conducts in Films Of Cavalleria and Pagliacci
description: Given the popularity of that perennial operatic dou blebill, Mascagni's Caval leria Rusticana and Leon cavallo's Pagliacci, it is scarcely surprising that Phil harmonc Hall was nearly filled on Saturday night for the showing of films of Her bert von Karajan's produc tions of these works for La Scala of Milan. Mr. Karajan served as stage director and conductor of both works.

title: Bob Alter, Vice President Of Embroidery Works, 56
description: Bob Alter, executive vice president of Huber Embroidery Works, Inc., Fairview, N. J., died yesterday in New York Hospital after a brief illness. He was 56 years old and lived at 440 West 34th Street.

title: More Calves This Year
description: WASHINGTON, July 26 (UPI) The 1970 calf supply will rise 2 per cent, to 45,955,000 head, from last year, the Agriculture Department estimated this weekend.

title: BIG CAPITAL NEED IN HOUSING LOOMS
description: WASHINGTON, July 26 The emergency housing bill signed by President Nixon last week contains a potential for enormous demands on the cap ital markets, but there will be little impact this year, officials said this weekend.

title: Chess:
description: One of the most artistic finales during the 1970 Metropolitan Chess League matches was played by 85 yearold Dr. Edward Lasker of the Marshall Chess Club. He essayed the currently popular Benoni Defense against Dr. Ariel Mengarini.

title: Sports of The Times
description: It's played in grade schools and high schools, among college fraternities and in neighborhood lots and parks. Lawyers play it. So do industrial employes, showbusiness personalities and politicians. Fat, aging men play it at picnics. Women play it, too.

title: Scheel's Mission Historic
description: BONN, July 26Before de parting from the Bonn airport, Foreign Minister Scheel de scribed his mission as one of historic significance.

title: Turner Wins Moscow Dash
description: MOSCOW, July 26 (AP) Willie Turner of Oregon State won the 100meter dash in 10.2 seconds today at an informal track meet between United States and Soviet athletes.

title: Interstate Highway Costs May Be Twice Estimate
description: WASHINGTON, July 26 (AP) Congress is poised to push the estimated cost of the na tion's web of interstate super highways past $75billional most double the original 1956 price tag.

title: Board of Education Seeks Wider Role for Local Units
description: The president of the Board of Education said yesterday that it would seek a number of amendments to the school decentralization law this year to give greater powers to the city's 31 new community school boards.

title: Blood, Sweat and Tears Greeted At Garden After European Trip
description: Blood, Sweat and Tears made a somewhat triumphant return to New York Saturday night following its tour of Eastern Europe under the auspices of the State Department.

title: MachineTool Orders Advanced A Moderate 11.4% Last Month
description: New orders for machine tools, considered an important indicator of future business ac tivity, increased by 11.4 per cent in June from the May to tal, but this moderate advance left the order books of the tool builders at extremely depressed levels.

title: No Improvement Is Found In Nation's Payments Gap
description: The deficit in the United Slates international balance of payments ranged between $1billion and $1.5billion dur ing the second quarter of 1970, the Morgan Guaranty Trust Company said yesterday.

title: Colombia Considers Importation of Cats To Meet Rat Threat
description: BOGOTA, Colombia, July 26  A critical shortage of cats is threatening the lives of many Colombians as well as large sectors of the agricultural eco nomy. The situation has reach ed a point where the Govern ment is planning to import cats from whatever source it can, while studying ways of in creasing its domestic cat popu lation.

title: Al Unser Takes Indianapolis 150Miler
description: INDIANAPOLIS, July 26 (UPI) Al Unser of Albuquer que, N. M., sped his way through driving rain for the last 40 miles today and took the 150mile United States Auto Club championship race at Indi anapolis Raceway.

title: Taiwan Issues Trade Ban
description: TAIPEI, Taiwan, July 26 (Reuters)The Chinese Nation alist Government today an nounced a ban on dealings with Japanese companies that trade with Communist China. The move followed a similar ban by Peking on dealings with Jap anese concerns that trade with Taiwan.

title: Miss Alice Hamilton Betrothed To James P. Hyatt, an Investor
description: Mr. and Mrs. Frederick Johnson Hamilton of New York and Lloyd Harbor, Huntington, L. I., have an nounced the engagement of their daughter, Miss Alice Pinckney Hamilton, to James Prescott Hyatt of New York.

title: Wake Takes Final Contest And Thistle Class Sail Title
description: SAYVILLE, L. I., July 26 Lewis Wake in White Elephant captured the final race of the series today and won the Thistle Class Atlantic Coast sailing championship.

title: PLAYERS, OWNERS CONTINUE TALKS
description: PHILADELPHIA, July 26 (AP) Negotiations between. Nation al Football League club the and representatives of the Play ers Association shifted to a new level today, with both sides splitting up into subcommittee work sessions.

title: BEAR SLAUGHTER IN ALASKA DENIED
description: FAIRBANKS, Alaska, July 26 Gov. Keith H. Miller has de nied a report that oil work ers in the treeless wastes of the North Slope of Alaska are endangering the grizzly bear population by slaughter of the animals.

title: Belgian Beats Clarke in Run; Evans Posts Dash Double
description: LOUVAIN, Belgium, July 26, (Reuters)Ron Clarke of Aus tralia was second to Emile Put temans of Belgium in an invita tion ace at 6,000 meters to night.

title: Colts' Rookies Win, 140
description: BALTIMORE, July 26 (AP) Jeff Beaver, former North Caro lina quarterback, threw two thirdperiod touchdown passes today to lead the Baltimore Colts rookies to a 140 victory over the Washington Redskins rookies.

title: In Memoriam
description: BARREAU, BENJAMIN

title: HOUSING PLAN SET FOR JERSEY CITY
description: JERSEY CITY, July 26An application of radical concepts in multifamily housing construc tion is expected to get under way in this congested needy urban center late this fall, ac cording to the Federal Depart ment of Housing and Urban Development.

title: MOROCCO TO GET NEW PARLIAMENT
description: RABAT, Morocco, July 26 Moroccans will elect a Parlia ment next month that will end five years of absolute rule by King Hassan II.

title: 200 in West Chester, Pa.; Clash Again With Police
description: WEST CHESTER, Pa., July 26 (AP)About 200 Puerto Ricans pelted state and local police men with bottles and rocks to night for the second straight night. The trouble stemmed from a false report yesterday that a Puerto Rican had been killed in a fist fight with a bartender.

title: WYNN DRIVE TOPS LEADERS IN TENTH
description: PITTSBURGH, July 26 (AP) Jimmy Wynn's tworun homer in the 10th inning lift ed the Houston Astros to a 64 victory over the Pittsburgh Pirates in a raindelayed game today. The Pirates are leading the Eastern Division race.

title: Paul M. Hollister Is Dead at 79; Led Macy Fight on Price Fixing
description: Paul Merrick Hollister, an ad vertising executive and author, died Saturday in Ruidoso. N. M., after a long illness. He was 79 years old and lived in Lincoln, IN. M.

title: Festival Ruling Due Today
description: A court decision on the fate of the Powder Ridge Festival at Middlefield, Conn., is ex pected today at Superior Court in Middletown. Lawyers for the rural town have asked an in junction against the festival, scheduled for July 31 through Aug. 2, at the Powder Ridge ski area. Richard Zeisler, represent ing Middleton Arts Interna tional, Inc., denied charges that the festival would constitute a public nuisance.

title: Briton to Confer on Southeast Asia Defense Role
description: LONDON, July 26Britain's future military commitment in Southeast Asia will be de termined by the series of talks with her Commonwealth allies that Lord Carrington, Secretary of Defense, will begin tomor row in Singapore.

title: Week's Votes in Congress
description: WASHINGTON, July 26 Following are the votes of delegations from New York, New Jersey and Connecticut on the major rollcalls in Congress during the week ended yester day.

title: INDIANS VANQUISH ROYALS BY 65, 30
description: CLEVELAND, July 26 (AP) Roy Foster slammed a decisive threerun homer in the first game and Steve Hargan hurled a fivehit shutout in the second yesterday as the Cleveland In dians scored 65 and 30 vic tories over the Kansas City Royals.

title: METHADONE GRANTS BY STATE $433,000
description: ALBANY, July 26The State Narcotic Addiction Control Commission has approved a total of $433,000 in grants to finance methadone maintenance programs in New York City. The grants were announced to day by Governor Rockefeller.

title: Accountants Insist on New Merger Rules
description: The Accounting Principles, Board, the senior rulemaking, body of the public accounting profession, expects to promul gate the final version of its highly controversial rules on corporate merger accounting this Wednesday, a spokesman for the board said over the weekend.

title: WALLACE BACKERS FILE IN WISCONSIN
description: MIWAUKEE, July 26Wis consin followers of George C. Wallace have united with scattering of others in right wing organizations to give the state the most extensive list of thirdparty candidates since the old Progressive party three decades ago.

title: Protesters Rally at St. John's To Back West Side Squatters
description: About 100 demonstrators participated in, a rally on the steps of the Cathedral Church of St. John: the Divine yester day to support 200 squatters who had moved into two nearly vacant buildings across the street.

title: Lightning Kills Bronx Man
description: Gilbert Martinez, 31 years old, of 343 East 141st Street, the Bronx, was killed by light ning yesterday afternoon while playing ball with his two sons in Wolfe's Pond Park on Staten Island. The police said the bolt also hit a nearby tree, splitting the trunk and gouging a foot wide hole. Mr. Martinez was pronounced dead at Richmond Memorial Hospital.

title: TAX DEPRECIATION A TOPIC OF STUDY
description: WASHINGTON, July 24A Treasury Department study of various possible methods of liberalizing depreciation allow ances concludes that half a doz en different ones have some merit.

title: Ashe Turns Back Mulligan In Sweden. 64. 75, 63
description: BAASTAD, Sweden, July 26 (UPI)Arthur Ashe of Rich mond beat Martin Mulligan of Italy. 64, 75, 63, and won the Champion Cup tennis tour nament today.

title: TREASURY TO GIVE FINANCING PLANS
description: The Treasury is expected to announce Wednesday how it plans to refinance $6.45billion of Government debt coming due Aug. 15. The prospects for paying off the maturing bonds and notes and selling new se curities without any particular difficulty are much brighter now than they were in May.

title: Bruder Sets Course Mark In Bay Shore 6.4Mile Swim
description: BAY SHORE, L. I., July 26 Tom Brixler of West Islip, L. I., set a course record today in capturing the 17th renewal of the Cross Bay swim from Fire Island to Bay Shore.

title: Bridge Kills Three Filipinos
description: MANILA, July 26 (AP)A wooden bridge collapsed on a river procession today, killing three persons and injuring 30 in Taguig, Rizal province. Ac cording to the police, many of those injured were viewing the waterborne procession, the highlight of the town's fiesta, when the accident occurred.

title: SHETLAND WINS TOP SHOW AWARD
description: BETHANY, Conn., July 26  A red sable ad white Shetland sheepdog, Ch. Pixie Dell Epi cure, owned by Mr. and Mrs. A. R. Miller of Scarsdale, N. Y., won his first bestinshow award today at the 54th Elm City Kennel Club event at the Bethany Kennels and Stables grounds today. A field of 1,107 was entered.

title: Vincent Eliminates Oldham In National 35er Tennis
description: MANHASSET, L.I., July 26 Tony Vincent of New York, seeded second, reached the quar terfinals of the United States men's 35 years and over clay court tennis championships to day by beating Archie Oldham of Upper Nyack, N.Y., 63, 63, at the Shelter Rock Tennis Club.

title: Hulme and Gethin Drive McLarens to 1,2 Finish in Klondike 200 Auto Race
description: EDMONTON, Alberta, July 26 (AP )Denis Hulme of New Zealand and Pete Gethin of England drove their McLaren 8DDs to a one, two finish in the Klondike 200 CanadianAmeri can Challenge Cup auto race to day.

title: SCHWARTZ VICTOR IN SOUND SAILING
description: GREENWICH, Conn., July 26 Herbert F. Schwartz at the tiller of his Ensign sloop, Wen den, triumphed by 3 minutes and 300 yards on Long Island Sound today in the Greenwich Cove Racing Association cham pionship regatta.

title: State May Limit Utilities On New Gas Customers
description: The State Public Service Commission said yesterday that it was considering restricting gas companies throughout the state on the number of new customers they may add.

title: Three Explosions Damage An Army Base in Wisconsin
description: SPARTA, Wis., July 26 (AP) Three explosions shook the Camp McCoy Army base early today after a caller had told au thorities that a bomb had been planted on the post. Electric power was knocked out for 90 minutes.

title: Con Ed Power Import
description: Arrangements for bringing in 1.3 million to 1.7 million kilo watts of electricity starting to day were announced yesterday by the Consolidated Edison Company of New York to offset its loss of two major generators for the rest of the summer.

title: Union Leaders to Ask Men To Ignore Pickets at Mines
description: ECCLES, W. Va., July 26 (UPI)  Leaders of the United Mine Workers union in south ern West Virginia agreed to day to ask thousands of strik ing coal miners to ignore pick et lines and end a twoweek walkout.

title: 43 Count 'em 43 Homers Are Walloped in a Day
description: CINCINNATI, July 26 (AP) Johnny Bench blasted three home runs and drove in seven runs today as the Cincinnati Reds sent the St. Louis Cardi nals reeling to their eighth straight loss, 125.

title: Samuels Rejects Offtrack Estimate
